englishTitle: THE EARLY SOUTH-ENGLISHLegendary: ORLives of Saints.: I.MS. LAUD, 108, IN THE BODLEIAN LIBRARY.

0.0: 10 Sancta crux This legend, which is counted as 10th in the MS. 1s preceded by (1) a poem on the Life and Passion of Christ (wanting the beginning and end), ed. by me under the title of 'Leben Iesu, ein Fragment,' Münster, Regensberg, 1873, and (2) by a poem on the Infancy of Christ, ed. in 'Altengl. Legenden,' Paderborn, 1875, pp. 1-61. Eight pieces, therefore, are lost before the legend of the Holy Rood.
0.1: ÞE holie rode i-founde was : ase ich eov nouþe may telle. Costantyn þe Aumperour : muche heþene folk gan a-quelle, For huy ore louerd iesu crist : to strongue deþe brou&yogh;te, And alle þe heþene men þat nei&yogh; him were : sone he dude to nou&yogh;te. Eleyne, þat was is moder : to Ierusalem he sende to sechen after þe holie rode : and heo gladliche forth i-wende. Þo heo cam þudere, heo liet crie : ase heo hire red hadde i-nome, Þat alle þe giwes of þe cite : bifore hire scholden come. Þo þe giwes i-somoned were : huy hadden grete fere; gret conseil huy nomen þare-of : &yogh;wat þe enchesoun were. Þo seide on, þat hiet Iudas : "Ich wene þat ich wot &YOGH;wat þis somunce a-mounti schal : &yogh;if þat ich ou telle mot. Ich wene þat þe quene enqueri wole : ase heo hadde i-þou&yogh;t, Aftur þe rode þat Iesu crist : to deþe was on i-brou&yogh;t. Þat non of eov ne beo so wod : þat þare-of a-knowe beo! In conseil ich eov telle wole : þat mi fader tolde me. Þo mi fade r symeon : in is deþe vuele lay, In conseile he was to me a-knowe : þo he þene dez on him i-sai&yogh;: " 'Iudas,' he seide, 'leoue sone : &yogh;if hit bi-tidez so Þat men enquerieth aftur þe rode : þat Iesus was on ido, Loke þat þov beo a-knowe þare-of : are men þe aquelle! Þat Zachee, mi fader, tolde : in conseile ich þe telle; A luyte bifore is deþe he seide me : þat he was atþe dede to burie þe rode op-on Caluarie hulle : ase huy nomen heom to rede. Leoue fader, ich seide þo : &yogh;wat eilede eov, alas, &YOGH;wy wolde &yogh;e him to deþe do : &yogh;wane he so guod was? he seide þat þoru&yogh; him it nas nou&yogh;t : ake for þat he with-sede Mine felawes of heore lawe : huy duden him to deþe, And sethþe in sepulchre leiden him : and he a-ros to liue Fram deþe þene þridde day : Mid is woundene fiue, Þene fourteoþe dai þare-Afterward : to heouene he wende an hei&yogh; In þe londe of Galilee : þat muche folk it i-sei&yogh;; Twelf Monþe it was þare-afterward : and half &yogh;er and more Þat Steuene, þat [was] mi broþur : prechede of is lore, Þe Giwes him ladden with-oute þe toun : and þreowen him with stones And þare-with brou&yogh;ten him to deþe : and debruysden alle is bones; Þene Morewe aftur Midewinter day : to deþe huy him brou&yogh;te, And nouþe he is in þe blisse of heuene : and þat he wel deore a|bou&yogh;te.' " ¶ Þo Iudas hadde þis tale i-told : þe giwes seiden, ase huy stode: "Neuer er ne heorde we telle : þus muche of þe rode." Þo þe tyme icome was, : bi-fore þe quyene huy come. "Cheoseth," seide þe Quiene a-non : "on of þis tweie domes; Lijf and deth eov is bi-fore : cheosez &yogh;weþur &yogh;e wolle: bote &yogh;e me bringue þe holie rode : echone brenne &yogh;e schulle." gret fuyr heo liet makie : ri&yogh;t bi-fore hore ei&yogh;en. Þe giwes bi-gonne to crien loude : þo huy þat fuyr i-sei&yogh;en, And seiden : "&yogh;if any man þare-of wot : þanne wot Iudas, For Zachee, is fader fader : of swyþe gret power was Þulke tyme þat Iesus : was op-on þe rode i-do." Þo liet þe Quiene nime Iudas : and alle þe oþere he = heo liet go, And bad him beo a-knowe a-non. : he nolde for no þretningue. Þe Quiene him liet wel faste binde : and in strongue prisone bringue. With-oute mete and drinke : þare seue dawes he lay; For strong hounguer he criede loude : þene seuenþe day And seide : "bringueth me out of þis wo : and ich eov [wole] om. lede Þare ich wene þat þe rode beo : ase mi fader me seide." Þo he out of prisone cam : with muche folk he wende to þe place þare þe rode was : ase is fader him kende. Þo he to þe place cam : a-doun he sat a-kneo: "Louerd," he MS. heo seide, "&yogh;if it is soth : þat þou man and god beo And þat þou of Marie were i-bore : siend us þine grace, Som tokningue, þat we finde mowe · þe rode in þis place." A-non so Iudas þis bone hadde : to ore louerd i-bede, Þe hul bi-gan to quakien : and out of one stude A smoke þare cam and wende an hei&yogh; : and muche place fulde— Swottore þing nas neuere non : þane þat smoke MS. smake smulde. þo Iudas þis i-sei&yogh; : loude he gan to crie : "Iesus is on Almi&yogh;ti god : i-bore he was of þe maydene Marie! he is wod þat ani oþur bi-leuez : ase ich habbe mani a day. Taken ichulle cristin-dom : ich for-sake here þe giwene lay." he liet him cristni hasteliche : and þo he icristned was, He liet him nenne Quiriac : þat erore hiet Iudas. Þo nomen huy spade and schouele : and ner þe place wende And bi-gonne forto deluen deope : þare ase þe smoke out kende. So þat huy founden roden þreo : þo huy hadden i-dolue longue: Þe rode þat god was on ido : and þat þe tweie þeoues weren on an|honge bi-side ore louerd, him for-to schiende. : þo nusten huy of þe þreo Þo holie croyz þat huy sou&yogh;ten : &yogh;wich it mi&yogh;te beo. Naþeles huy nomen alle þreo : and toward toune heom bere To Dame Heleyne, þe guode Quene : with wel glade chere. bi þe weye ase huy comen : men gonne a-&yogh;ein heom bringue A ded &yogh;ong man ope one bere : toward bure&yogh;ingue. Quiriac nam þat o rode : and efft-sone þat oþur, And leide op-on þat dede man : ake he ne a-ros for noþur. Þe þridde huy leide op-on him : and he a-ros wel bliue And þonkede &yogh;eorne godes sone : þat fram deþe him brou&yogh;te to liue. Þo cam þe deouel &yogh;eollinde forth : loude he gan to grede: "Alas, nouþe [is] mi power idon : eueref[t] more," he sede; "Iesus, Iesus, &yogh;wat, þenxt þou : al folk to þe lede? Þou hauest here men to warde i-&yogh;iue : þing þat ich mest drede, Þoru&yogh; &yogh;wan ich was furst ouer-come : ake nouþe ich am al at grounde. Alas þulke soruwe : þat heo euere was i-founde! For i-ne habbe power non so gret : on eorþe a-mong manne, &YOGH;if man fourmeth enes þe croyz : a-non þat i-ne mot þanne. Þare-fore ich wot þat euerech man : wole nou þe soþe i-se Þat þe croiz me hauez ouer-come : and al bi-leue me. Allas, alas þe time, i sei&yogh;e : al ich worþe nouþe for-sake! Iudas, Iudas, &yogh;wat was þe : hou hauest þou on i-take? Þoru&yogh; A Iudas, þat was &yogh;wilene : Iesus to deþe ich brou&yogh;te, And nov þoru&yogh; Iudas ouer-come ich am : and i-brou&yogh;t to nou&yogh;te. Strencþe ne worth me neuereft non : bote ani man wolle with wille Serui me to paye is flesch : is soule for-to spille; Nouþe mi strencþe is me bi-nome : fondi ich mot with ginne And with traisun, &yogh;if ich mai : ani man to me i-winne. I-ne may here no leng bi-leue : for þis me þinchez longue; For þe creoiz þat me is so nei&yogh; : in pine ich am ful strongue."
0.2: IVdas seide: "go heonne anon : and ne cum MS. ne cum he cum here non-more! I-founde is, þei it late beo : þat schal ouer-come al þi lore. He þat haueth here þis dede man : fram deþe i-brou&yogh;t to liue, Pulte þe and þi pouwer al : into helle grounde bliue." Muche was þe Ioye of þe croyz : þat men maden þo þere; With gret song and with processioun : to þe Quiene huy hire bere. Þo nam Iudas cristindom : and þo he ibaptized was, he liet him cleopien Quiriac : þat erore hiet Iudas. Þe Quiene of seluer and of gold : one riche schrine heo wrou&yogh;te, And deorewurthe &yogh;imstones : and þe Rode þare-inne MS. innne heo brou&yogh;te. Op-on þe hulle of caluarie : þare huy þe rode founde, A noble churche heo dude a-rere : I-hered beo þulke stounde! Þo wilnede þe Quene muche : After þe nayles þreo &YOGH;ware-with ore louerd was : inailed to þe treo. Quiriac, þat hiet er Iudas : wende to þe place Þare ase þe croiz i-founde was : and bad ore louerdes grace, Þat he, &yogh;if is wille were : þe þre Nailes him sende. Þe Nailes with li&yogh;tingue gret : op of þe eorþe wenden. Quiriac þonkede Ihesu crist : and with gret Ioye heom nam, And bi-tok heom heleyne, þe guode Quene : þo he to hire cam. Þus was þe holie Rode i-founde : þe þridde day of May, Þat we holdez in holi churche : þe holie rode-day. Quiriac, þat þe rode fond : sethþe bischop was— he is nouþe in heouene seint Quiriac : þat erore hiet Iudas. bi-seche we þe holie croiz : þat brou&yogh;te þane Deuel to grounde, And seint Quiriac and seinte heleyne : þoru&yogh; &yogh;wam heo was i-founde, Þat huy bi-sechen him for us : þat on þe Rode schedde is blod, Þat we moten to þe Ioye come : of heuene þat is so guod.
0.3: ÞOrou&yogh; a treo we weren fur-lore : and furst i-brou&yogh;t to grounde, And þoru&yogh; a treo to liue i-brou&yogh;t : i-hered beo þulke stounde! Al it MS. A lit cam of one more : þat us to deþe brou&yogh;te, And þat us brou&yogh;te to liue a-&yogh;en : þoru Iesus þat us bou&yogh;te. Of þe Appel-treo þat ore furste fader : þane Appel of nam, In þe manere þat ich ov telle wole : þe swete rode cam. Þo Adam, ore furste fader : þe sunne hadde i-do, I-driue he was out of parays : and eue, is wijf, also. Aftur milce &yogh;eorne he cride : þei it to late were. For one bi-heste þat he of ore louerd hadde : þo þe Aungel him drof out þere: Þat, &yogh;wane þe time were fol-fuld : ore louerd him wolde bi-þenche And with Oyle of milce smeorien him : and is sunnes a-quenche; gret hope hadde Adam to his bi-heste : þere-after euere-mo, Ase he in þe ualeye of Ebron : leouede with teone and wo. Twei sones he hadde : þat hei&yogh;ten Caym and Abel; For onde þe on a-slou&yogh; þat oþur : ase &yogh;e i-wuten it wel. Þo Caym hadde is broþer a-slawe : i-flemd he was þare-fore. And þo Adam i-sai&yogh; þat he hadde : beie is sones for-lore, he weop and made deol i-nou&yogh; : "louerd," he seide, "þin ore! Nei&yogh; womman ich habbe to muche i-beo : i-nelle nei&yogh; hire come non|more. Þreo harmes ich habbe for hire i -haued : mi-sulf furst for-lore, And nouþe mine sones, a weilawei! : and of alle womman MS. wommen is more." Þo nolde Adam come nei&yogh; is wijf : to hundrede &yogh;er and more, For wo þat he hadde for hire i-haued : euere he liuede in sore. Of ore louerd he hadde tockningue sethþe : þat he scholde to is wiue wiende; Þo ne dorste he nou&yogh;t þare-a&yogh;ein beo. : a child he hadde atþenende, Seth: he liet it cleopie : and sethþe he hadde mo. Al is lijf þe selie man : leouede in teone and wo. Þo he was of Nin houndret &yogh;er : and to and þritti old, Þe strencþe him failede in is limes : is bodi bi-cam al cold; he ne mi&yogh;te nou&yogh;t a-boute þe eorþe swinke : ne þe weodes up drawe; Of is lijf he was a-nuyd : and wolde beo ded wel fawe. he sat and carede of is lijf : he cleopede is sone Seth: "leoue sone," he seide, "ich am weri of leoued : and wilni muche mi dez. Þo ich was out of parays idriue : ore louerd bi-hiet me þere, With eoyle of milce to smeorie me : &yogh;wane it time were. So longue ich habbe þare abede : þat i-ne may libbe more; to parays þov most þare-aftur go : and bidde him milce and ore. Þe Aungel þov schalt þare finde : þat drof me fram þe &yogh;ate; Seie, ich abide þulke bi-heste : and me þinchez it comez to late, And seie, elde me hath ouer-come : þat I-ne may libbe longue, bide him þat ich dei&yogh;e mote : and þe eoyle of milce a-fongue." "I-ne can nanne wei," quath is sone : "þuder-ward, ase ich wene." "Leoue sone," Adam seide : "þe wei is wel i-sene. &YOGH;wane þou comest to þe heued of þis valeie : a grene wei þov schalt wiende, Þat gez euene ri&yogh;t puyr est : and to parays gez þat on ende; Þare-forth comen þi moder an ich : þo ich parays for-liet: Euerech stape þat we stepen : for-barnde onder ore fet; Ne mi&yogh;te þare neuere-eft gras on growe : and al þe wei elles is grene; For þe foule sunnes þat we duden : ore stapen beoth euere i-sene. Þare þov mi&yogh;t with-oute faille : to parays euene gon." Seth nam is fader blessingue : and wende him forth a-non. Þe stapen he fond for-welewede : ase is fader him sede. Þo he to þe &yogh;ate cam, : he ne dorste gon in for drede. An Aungel cam sone to MS. te? [þe] &yogh;ate : and axede &yogh;wat he sou&yogh;te. he seide þat one tiþingue to him : fram is fader he brou&yogh;te: Þat he wes old and weri of leoued : and þat he was of-longued sore After þe bi-heste þat him was bi-hote : for he ne mi&yogh;te libbe non-more. ¶ "&YOGH;e," seide þe Aungel, "is he so? : he ne schal þarof nou&yogh;t doute. pult in þin heued here atþe &yogh;ate : and stond þi-sulf with-oute!" So gret deli&yogh;t he hadde and Ioye : of þe foulene murie song; A grene he i-sai&yogh; of grete swotnesse : and faire flovres þare among, Ech manere fruyt þare he i-sai&yogh; : þat smulde al-so wel swote: him þou&yogh;te of eche manere vuel : Aman mi&yogh;te habbe is bote; him þou&yogh;te, &yogh;if he moste þere : bi-holden In anie stounde, he mi&yogh;te euere in Ioye libbe : and is limes beon hole and sounde. A-midde þe place, þat was so fair : he sai&yogh; a swiþe fair welle, Fram &yogh;wam alle þe wateres on eorþe comiez : ase þe boc us dez telle. Ouer þe welle þare stod a treo : with bowes brode and lere, Ake þare nas opon noþur lief ne rinde : bote ase it for-oldet were; An Addre it hadde bi-clupt a-boute : al naked with-oute skinne— Þat was þat treo and þe Naddre : þat made Adam don furst orig. þe sunne. he bi-heold In þare-ate eft-sone : þat treo him þou&yogh;te he sei&yogh; Faire i-leued and i-woxe : op to þe heouene an hei&yogh;, On ouewarde he i-sai&yogh; a luyte &yogh;ong child : in smale cloþes i-wounde, Þe More of þe treo, ase him þou&yogh;te : tilde into helle grounde; Abeles soule is broþer al-so : him þou&yogh;te he [þer] i-sei&yogh;. Þo drof þe Aungel him fram þe &yogh;ate : þat he ne moste mor come so nei&yogh;. "Þat child," quath þe Aungel, "þat þou i-sei&yogh;e : an hei&yogh; opon þe treo, Godes sone MS. sone sone it was, þat on eorþe : for þine fader sunnes wole beo And bringue with him þe eoyle of milce : &yogh;wane þe tyme ifuld is, to smeorie þare-with and bringe of pine : þine fader and alle his." Þo wende þe Aungel to þulke treo : Ane Appel þare-of he nam And bi-tok Seth þreo curneles þar-of : þo he to him cam, And bad him legge þulke kurneles : onder is fader toungue &YOGH;wane he were ded, and burien him : and lokie &yogh;wat þarof sprongue. ¶ Seth wende hamward ase he cam : þe wei was wel i-sene, For he isei&yogh; þe stapen þat weren i-brende : and þat oþur wei was al grene. Þo he was i-comen hom a&yogh;en : his fader he fond ded. he dude þe curneles onder is toungue : ase þe Aungel him hadde i-sed, And sethþe he burede him in þe valeie of Ebron : ase it was ri&yogh;t to don, And of-swonk is owene mete : þo he nuste non oþur won. In A fewe &yogh;er þare-Aftur-ward : þe curneles bi-gunne springe, Þreo smale &yogh;erdene þare woxen of : faire þoru&yogh; alle þingue. Þo huy weren i-woxe in lengþe : of one Elne, ich wene, In þulke stat huy stoden longue þare : and euere-more grene, A-non for-to Moyses þe profete : &yogh;eode þare in londe, to lede þat folk of Israel. : and þo he fond þe &yogh;erdene stonde, "lo here," he seide, "gret bi-tokningue : of þe holie trinite, Of fader and sone and holie gost : bi þeose &yogh;eorde þreo." he tok hem op with gret honour : and in faire cloþe heom wond— A suote smul þare cam of heom : þat smelde in-to Al þat lond. to confermi þe bet is lawe : he bar heom forth on is hond; Ech sick man þat heom A-nourede : is hele a-non he fond. to techen is folk þe ri&yogh;te lawe : þe &yogh;eordene with him he ber, And for-to hele sike men : to and fourti &yogh;er. Sethþe þo he dei&yogh;e scholde : þe &yogh;eordene he sette er Onder þe hulle of Tabor : and deide him-suluen þer. Þare stoden þis &yogh;eordene grene : more þane a þousend &yogh;er, Forto seint Daui þe kyng cam : þat was of so gret power. So þat he was þoru&yogh; þe holie gost : i-hote forto hi&yogh;e To þe hulle of Tabor : in þe londe of Arabie, And þat he þulke &yogh;eordene þreo : fette and with him nome. Nie dawes he was þuder-ward : are he þudere come. With gret honur he nam heom op : þo he þe &yogh;eordene MS. &yogh;eordere fond— Þe swotnesse þat þarof cam : fulde al þat lond. With grete melodie of is harpe : seint Daui þe &yogh;eordene nam And ladde heom to Ierusalem : þene Nynþe day hom he cam. In a priue stude he heom sette : ase it was in þe eueningue, For-to a-morewe, þat he i-sei&yogh;e : &yogh;wodere he mi&yogh;te heom bet bringue.
0.4: A-Morewe, þo he cam þer-to : to one huy weren alle i-come, and weren i-morede suyþe faste : þat huy ne mi&yogh;ten beo op i-nome. Þat huy weren so alle to one i-woxe : &yogh;wat bi-toknede þis bote þe fader and sone and þe holie gost : þat al o god it is? Seint Daui a-boute þis holie &yogh;eorde : a strong wal he liet a-rere, And nam guode &yogh;eme hov longue it woxe : fram &yogh;ere to &yogh;ere: With a bei&yogh; of seoluer he bond : eche &yogh;eres schute þere, Þat he mi&yogh;te atþe laste i-wite : hou old þat treo were. So þat with-Inne þritti &yogh;er : þis treo wax wel on hei&yogh;; hit ne wax þo none more : and r. ase he wust wel bi þe seluerne bei&yogh;; Ake euere-more MS. mon þare-Aftur-ward : fair and grene it stod. Seint Daui it honourede muche : for he wuste þat it was guod. Þo MS. þat seint Daui hadde i-wrou&yogh;t : þe sunne of lecherie And man-slau&yogh;t, þo for is owene wijf : he MS. þat het slen vrie, And ore louerd nam þar-of wreche : swiþe sori he bi-cam, Onder þat treo is penaunce he dude : þat he þare-fore nam. Þo makede he þere þene sauter : is sunnes for-to bete; Þe sonere is sunnes him weren for-&yogh;iue : for þe holie treo so swete. Þo bi-gan he al-so for is sunnes : þe holie temple a-rere Swiþe noble in Ierusalem : ake he deide in þe fourteoþe &yogh;ere. Salomon, his sone : þat after him was king þere, Aftur him bulde þe temple forth : al-þat heo &yogh;are were. to and þritti &yogh;er he was þare-a-boute : and is fader fourtene al-so; So þat it was sixe and fourti &yogh;er : are þat weor[c] was al i-do. þo þat weork was almest &yogh;are : heom failede a long treo. þat holie treo was fairest þo : þat huy mi&yogh;ten ou&yogh;were i-seo: ¶ Þe kyng Salomon it liet felle and hewe : ase quoynte-liche ase men mi&yogh;te, And liet it meten and makien more : bi a fote þane þe ri&yogh;te. Þo it was i-brou&yogh;t to þe ri&yogh;te stude : and scholde beon ilaced þere, Þo was it bi a fote to schort : ase euene ase huy it meten er. Þe Carpenters it lieten a-don : in strongue wrathþe and grete; to no þing þat huy mi&yogh;ten it don : it nolde beon i-mete. Ane brugge ouer ane olde diche : huy maden þarof ate laste, For wrathþe þat huy ne mi&yogh;ten in þe temple : to none oþure weorke it caste. Þare-ouer eode mani man : þe &yogh;wile it þare lay— Nusten nou&yogh;t alle hov holi it was : þat defouleden it al dai. Þe Quiene of Saba cam þare forth : and a-non so þat heo it sei&yogh;, A-kneo heo sat and honourede MS. honoureden it : and nolde nou&yogh;t come þare-nei&yogh;. MS. nou&yogh;t bi anoþer wei heo wende forth. : to Saloman heo cam, For heo him hadde wel wide i-sou&yogh;t : to leorni of him wisdom. Þoru&yogh; grace þat ore louerd hire &yogh;af : to Salomon he = heo seide: Þat treo ne scholde nou&yogh;t ligge þere : and he dude bi hire rede. &yogh;eot heo seide, þare schal r. scholde a man : deie on þulke treo Þoru&yogh; &yogh;wam al þe lawe of giwes : destruyd scholde beo. Salomon it liet nimen sone : and onder eorþe it caste Swiþe feor fram alle men : and burede hit wel faste. So longue so it þare-aftur were : a faire welle þare sprong And a fair &yogh;water with grete fischsches : boþe deope and long. Manie sike men þat þare come : and wuschschen heore fiet þaron Oþur heore hondene oþur baþeden Al : helþe huy hadden a-non. Þat watur huy loueden swiþe muche : and wolden þare-inne wade; Ake huy nusten nou&yogh;t of þat treo : þat al þe vertue made. Sethþe þare-after longue it was : þat ore louerd on eorþe cam. Anon so þat folk bi-spac is deth : and heore red þare-of nam, Þat treo bi-gan to fleote : ase ore louerdes wille it was. Þe giwes comen and founden þat treo : fleotinde þare bi cas : huy nomen it op, for it þou&yogh;te fil and foul : and þare hadde i-lei&yogh;e longue, And maden þarof þe holie rode : ore louerd þaron to hongue, For þat treo for-olded was : and huy heolden ore louerd luþur al-so— &YOGH;eot heom þou&yogh;te þat treo to fair : þat he were þare-on i-do. Þe croiz aftur ore louerdes deth : deope under eorþe huy caste, Þare ase huy him to deþe duden : and bureden it wel faste, And þe tweie croiz al-so þare-bi : þat þe þeoues on i-hanguede were. Þare huy lei&yogh;en faste i-hudde : more þane to hondret &yogh;eres. For þo titus and vaspasian : Ierusalem nome r. hadde i-nome And hadden alle þe giwes destruyd : þat neuere-eft huy þare ne come, And al þat lond was i-brou&yogh;t : in þe Aumperoures hond of Rome And with is men i-fuld and al i-set : to nimen þer-to gome, Sethþe þare cam An Aumperour : þat hiet Adrian, heþene he was and swiþe luþur : and werrede ech cristine man; For he wuste &yogh;ware þe rode lai : þat god was on i-do, And þat cristine men þe stude honoureden : &yogh;wane huy mi&yogh;ten come þerto, he liet ane temple of Maumates : in þulke stude a-rere, Þat men ne mi&yogh;ten nou&yogh;t i-finde to louten heom to : bote maumates alle it were. Þei cristine men þudere &yogh;eoden : huy ne dorsten oþur for doute; And muche a&yogh;ein heore heorte it was : to ani maumete a-loute: So þat huy lieten al þulke stude : and wenden a-wei for fere, Þat with-inne ane fewe &yogh;eres þere-aftur : no cristine man ne cam þere. Þo þulke stude was al for-lete : and þare-after wel mani a dai, Þat cristine man ne paynim : nusten &yogh;ware þe rode lai, Sethþe þare cam an MS. am Aumperour : þat hiet costantin; In weorre and bataylle he was so muche : þat þare-of nas no fin. Þo come is fon and wonne : muche del of is londe. he &yogh;arkede al day al is Ost : a-&yogh;ein heom for-to stonde.
0.5: ASe he toward þe bataille wende : he bi-heold op and = an hei&yogh;: Him þou&yogh;te þat a fair Croiz : op in heouene he sei&yogh;; Lettres he i-sei&yogh; þare-on i-write : he bi-gan heom to rede : "With þis signe þou schalt maister beo" : þulke lettres seden. Þe Aumperour þis Onder-stod : þei he heþene were. Ane croiz he liet makien sone : þat is men bi-fore him bere In stude of his baner : in-to þe bataylle a-non: And þoru&yogh; vertue of þe holie croiz : he ouer-cam alle is fon, he i-wan þe maistrie and al is lond : in a luyte stounde þere. [Muche he thouthe þer-afterward wat þilke signe were.] This verse is added by a later hand on the margin. Þe wiseste men of al is lond : he liet bi-fore him bringue And Axede heom of þe croyz : &yogh;wat were þe tokningue. huy seiden him þat at Ierusalem : god was i-don on rode And þe giwes hudden þe croiz þere : ase huy onder-stode. "&YOGH;wane ich habbe þare-þoru&yogh;," quath þe Aumperour : "mine fon i-brou&yogh;t to grounde, Of heorte ne worþe ich neuere bliþe : are þe holie croyz beo i-founde." Þo þe Aumperour þe holie rode : and þe faire miracles i-sei&yogh;, he liet him baptizen of þe pope : seint Siluestre, þat was þo him ful nei&yogh;.
0.6: SEint Quiriac, þat Bischop was : prechede godes lawe. Þe luþere Aumperour Iulian : brou&yogh;te him of dawe, For þe holie rode þat he fond : and for he men þere-to drou&yogh; to bi-lieuen on Iesu crist— : for he heold it al wou&yogh;. Þo þe Aumperour hadde seint Quiriac : bi-foren him i-brou&yogh;t, he bad him bi-lieue on heore Maumates : and þo he nolde nou&yogh;t, his ri&yogh;t hond he liet of-smite : And seide, "ich do þe þis, For þou hast þare-with i-write : a-&yogh;ein ore lawe, i-wis." "Þou luþere hound," þis oþur seide : "wel hast þou i-don bi me, Of mine guode þou were wel onder-stonde : ich au&yogh;te wel blesci þe: For þou me hast MS. me hast me þat lime bi-nome : þat me hath ofte to sunne idrawe, And ofte ich habbe þare-with i-writen : a-&yogh;ein Iesu cristes lawe, Þe &yogh;wyle ich was a luþer giv&yogh; : and on god ne bi-liefde nou&yogh;t." Þo þis Aumperour þat i-sai&yogh; : þat he nolde tuyrne is þou&yogh;t, he made him drinke lead i-weld : and in is mouth helde it þere. Euere sat þis guode man : ri&yogh;t ase him no-þing nere. Op one gredire he leide him sethþe : ouer a gret fuyr and strong, To rosti ase men doth fersch flesch : þat were grece a-mong. Þat fuyr was i-maud of col and grece : and salt was eke þer-to, And is al. of is flesch þat was for-brend : þe woundene huy selten al-so. Þo he ne mi&yogh;te þare-with tuyrne is þou&yogh;t : and to deþe [him] bringue, he þou&yogh;te &yogh;if he mi&yogh;te him tuyrne : with anie oþur þingue. "Quiriac," he seide, "þench on þi-sulf : and do aftur mi lore: &YOGH;if þou nelt ore godes honouri : bote þou wolle more, Sei&yogh;e þat þou ne art cristine nou&yogh;t : and ichulle debonere beo; Þat murie lijf þou schalt þar-after lede : sone þou schalt i-seo." Þo þe guode man nolde aftur him do : a Caudron he liet fulle With eoyle, he liet it seoþe faste : and þane guode man þare-inne pulle, And seth þare-inne þane guode man : forto þat he weri was. Þe guode man herede ore louerd euere : and neuere þe worse him nas. Þo þe Aumperour þat isai&yogh; : þat he ne mi&yogh;te him so ouer-come, With a swerd he smot him þoru&yogh; þe heorte : þo he was of baþe i|nome. his soule wende to þe Ioye of heouene : After is tormentingue. Nou crist for þe loue of seint Quiriac : to þulke Ioye us bringue AmeN.—
0.7: ÞE holie Rode was i-founde : ase &yogh;e wutez, in May: He was an-hauset in septembre [ 14 Sept.] sethþe : on þe holie rode-dai&yogh;. Aftur heruest he comez i-lome : and oþur-&yogh;wyle þare-Inne. god us graunti for his moder loue : þe Ioye of heouene i-wynne. Mani a &yogh;er þare was bi-tweone. : ri&yogh;t is þat we telle Of eyþur feste aftur oþur : noþur ouer-huppe i-nelle. A kyng þare was in .perce. þo : Cosdroe was is name; Cristine men þat he mi&yogh;te i-finde : Alle he brou&yogh;te to schame. With his luþere power he i-wan al-so: þe londes al a-boute. And þo he cam to Ierusalem : of þe sepulchre he hadde doute Þat ore louerd was on i-leid : and a-non þat he þe sepulchre i-sei&yogh;, Of al is power, þat was so luþer : &yogh;eot ne dorste he come þare-nei&yogh;. Ake ane partie of þe swete croiz : þat seinte [Helene] supplied on the margin. þudere brou&yogh;te he tok with him and wende him hom : and þudere non-more ne þou&yogh;te. Of þat treo he was wel prout : þei he him-sulf luyþur were. A suyþe hei&yogh; tour of gold and seluer : he liet him sone a-rere; Of &yogh;ymmes and of deorewurþe stones : þare-a-boue he liet do Foourme of sonne and of mone : and of steorrene al-so, Schininde ase þei it heom-seolue weren : and tuyrne a-boute faste; Ase a þondringue he made swyþe ofte : þat muche folk ofte a-gaste; Þoru&yogh; smale holes bi quoyntyse : þat watur al-so þere Ofte he made to grounde falle : ri&yogh;t ase it rein were. Ase feor forth ase ani man couþe : he al. om. made al. makie with quoyntise, Þe fourme ase þei it an heouene were : he made on alle wise. On-ouewarde þe tour a-midde al þis : ane sege he liet a-rere, to sitten him-seolf þar-inne ase a god : in heouene ase þei it were In his ri&yogh;t half one sege he made : his o sone he sette þere In stude ase þei it were godes sone : þat non defaute it nere, In his leoft half he made an oþur : and a fair koc he liet fette And in stude of þe holie gost : on his leoft half bi him sette, And he him-seolf sat MS. þat þare-a-midde : þe fader ase þei it were, Sone and holi gost on eiþur side—: welle, gret pruyte was þere! Eraclius þe Aumperour : þat cristine man was, at rome, Of þis Added on the margin. misfarinde pruyde : he heorde telle i-lome: With his host he wende in-to is lond : and weorrede on him wel faste. In his heouene ase a god he sat : ase þei him no-þing ne a-gaste; So þat his eldeste sone : he hiet wienden atþe laste Wit his Ost a-&yogh;ein þe Aumperour : and out of his lond him caste— For he ne deignede nou&yogh;t him-seolf for him : of his heouene ene a|li&yogh;te, Non more þane hit were a god : with eorþeliche manne to fi&yogh;te. his sone a-&yogh;ein þe Aumperour : with is ost he wende. And þo huy toward þe bataille comen : eiþur to oþur sende Þat huy bi-twene heom-seoluen tweine : þe bataille scholden do And al heore Ost stonden and bi-holde : and non ne come hem to; &YOGH;weþur of heom a-boue were : habbe scholde þe mi&yogh;te Of þe oþeres men and al is lond : aftur is wille it di&yogh;te. Þo þis foreward was i-mad : to-gadere huy smiten to grounde And fou&yogh;ten ase hit heore ri&yogh;te was : and maden heom wel bitere woundes. Atþe laste þe Aumperour : þane oþerne ouer-cam, And al his folk, ase foreward was : into his power al. baundoun heom nam. he liet heom cristni euer-ech-one : and siwi him to is wille. Þe luþere king sat euere at hom : in his heouene wel stille Ase a god, and nuste nou&yogh;t : þat he was bi-neþe i-brou&yogh;t; So vuele he was of his men bi-loued : þat huy nolden him telle nou&yogh;t. Þis Aumperour wende him forth : in-to his heouene an hei&yogh; And fond him sitten þare ase a god : his sone him sat ful nei&yogh;. "Ille hail beo þou, false god : in þine false heouene i-founde, With þi sone and þi holie gost! : &yogh;e beoth nei&yogh; a-swounde. bi him þat þou countrefetest : þat for us þolede wounde, bote þou wolle on him bi-lieue : þou schalt here in a stounde Of mine hondene þolie deth : and þi pruyte i-brou&yogh;t to grounde, For al þine heouene i-nelle bi-leue : for marke ne for pounde."
0.8: "Nay certes," þis oþur seide : "þou ne schalt me so nou&yogh;t lere Þat ich to anie manne a-bouwie schulle : bote he herre þane ich were." Þe Aumperour drou&yogh; out is swerd : and smot of is heued ri&yogh;t þere. his &yogh;ongue sone þat sat bi him : þat was in his teoþe &yogh;ere, he liet cristny and maken him king : of al is fader lond. his men he &yogh;af MS. &yogh;at al þat seoluer : þat he þere fond. Mid þat gold and þe riche þingues : þat he fond al-so þere Þe churchene þat þe schrewes destruyden er : þare-with he liet a-rere, And made þare a lond wel bi-lieued : and guod in godes lawe; Alle þat nolden tuyrne to god : he brou&yogh;te sone of dawe. Þe holie croiz þat he fond þere : þat ore louerd was on i-do, A-doun he as nam with gret honour : and with him as ladde also To þe boru&yogh; of Ierusalem. : and þo he cam þare-bi-side, Opon þe hulle of Oliuete : one stounde he gan a-bide. Swyþe muche folk him cam a-boute : with gret honur with-alle And þonkeden god of þis cas : þat heom was þare bi-falle, Þat þe swete holie croiz : to heom a-&yogh;ein moste come þat þe luyþere kyng Cosdroe : heom hadde þare bi-nome. A-doun of þe hulle wende þe Aumperour : with fair processioun Ri&yogh;t þane wei þat ore louerd &yogh;eode : toward is passioun. Þo he cam ri&yogh;t to þe boru&yogh; : and wolde In atþe &yogh;ate, A fair miracle ore louerd sende : þat huy ne mi&yogh;ten In þar ate; For þe stones þat þare weren a-boue : a-doun a-non huy a-li&yogh;ten And stoden empne forth ri&yogh;t bi þe oþer walle : þat no man In ne mi&yogh;te. Sori was þo þe Aumperour : and al is folk al-so, And a-dradden þat he nou&yogh;t wuyrþe nere : swuch a dede for-to do. On god huy criden and wepen sore : þat he scholde heom grace siende, &YOGH;if þat it is wille were : into þe boru&yogh; for-to wiende. þo stod þare An Aungel ouer þe &yogh;ete : A croiz he heold on honde: "Sire Aumperour," he seide, "þulke time : þat ore louerd was here a-lonnde, Þo he com in atþusse &yogh;ate : to beo to deþe ido, Opon a seli Asse he rod : in feble cloþes al-so; he ne cam with none nobleye : so as þou dest nov, With riche cloþes and oþur pruyde : þei he were as hei&yogh; as þov." Mid þis word he wende a-&yogh;en. : þis Aumperour a-non A-li&yogh;te a-doun and his cloþes : he caste of euer-ech-on A-non to is schurte and to is briech : sore weopinde with-alle. Þe stones arisen op a-&yogh;en : þat weren er a-doun i-falle, And ech lai in his ri&yogh;te stude : ase heo hadden er ido: þat &yogh;at was opene ase hit was er : þe wei was clene al-so. Þe Aumperour nam þe swete rode : and al a-fote in bar; Þat folk him siwede with gret pres : muche Ioye and blisse was þar. Þare cam a-non so swote smul : ase hit fram heouene were; Muche was þe suotnesse and þe Ioye : þat in þe contreie was þere. Þe Aumperour bar þe swete croiz : in-to þe temple an hei&yogh;, He bi-gan to singue þat newe song : bi-fore alle þat þare were nei&yogh;: "Þis r. þu croiz is om. is bri&yogh;tore to þis world : þane alle þe steorrene beo. Þou art for-to honori of alle men : and þou art a suyþe louelich treo, holiore þou art þane al þat is : for þou one wuyrþe were Þat þou þat tresor of al þe world : al one opon þe þou om. þou bere. Þov swete treo þat bere on þe : þe swete nayles al-so And þe swete burþene of godes sone : þat on þe was i-do, Saue nouþe al þis compaygnie : þat hidere i-gadered is And here to-day to-gadere i-brou&yogh;t : in þine here&yogh;yngue i-wis!" Þe Aumperour song þo þis song : þat wel is &yogh;vyt vnder-stonde— For &yogh;uyt men it singueth in holie churche : &yogh;wane huy berez þe croiz on honde. Al folk onourede al-so þe croiz : so feor forth so huy mi&yogh;ten it do, With offringues and with song : and with oþur melodies al-so. Þoru vertue of þe swete rode : a-non-ri&yogh;t in þe place Mani miracle þare feol a-day : þoru ore louerdes grace. A ded man a-ros fram deth to liue : and ten men þat meseles were, And four men of strongue palasie : heore hele huy hadden ri&yogh;t þere, And fiftene men þat blinde weren : and manie oþere al-so I-held weren þoru&yogh; is swete grace : þat on þe rode was i-do. Þis was þe holie rode-day : þat in Septembre is: Þare-fore men honouriez in holi churche : þulke dai, i-wis. Mani miracle of þe swete rode : þe man þat heom telle couþe, Þare hath sethþe i-beo and al-so bi-fore : some we wollez telle nouþe.
0.9: IN þe lond of costantyne þe noble : A gyw some-time þare was In one churche him-seolf al one : ase it feol bi cas; he stod and bi-heol[d] þe rode : ore louerd forto schiende, And r. a = he? þou&yogh;te to don þe rode schame : are eni man come þare-hende. In þe þrote with a swerd : he smot þe suete rode; Þat blod sprong on him anon-ri&yogh;t al a-brod : þat he was al a-blode. Þo was þe schrewe a-ferd of cristine men : þat ani come atþe laste: Þe rode he bar a-non-ri&yogh;t a-wei : and in a deop put hire caste, And at-orn him-seolf for drede. : a cristine man sone he mette, Þat bi-heold him hou he was bi-bled : and on him faste he sette. "Schrewe," he seide, "&yogh;ware hauest þou ibeo? : &yogh;wam hast þou i|brou&yogh;t of dawe? Þou schalt a-bide here with me : and beo an-hongue oþur to-drawe." "Certes," seide þes oþur, "i-ne habbe i-do : no man bote guod." "Þou lixt," seide þe cristine man : "and þat man mai i-seo bi þis blod." "Louerd, merci," seide þe giv&yogh; : "to soþe nouþe ich i-seo Þat cristinemannes god is muche and guod : betere al. herre ne may non beo. doth mid me &yogh;wat &yogh;e wollez : of-serued ich habbe i-wis: For a rode ich smot a swiþe deop wounde : and heo bledde on me þis. And ich eov bidde cristine-dom : are ich beo to deþe i-do." Cristine men þat þis i-heorden : ful sone huy &yogh;eoden him to, Of þat þe giv heom tolde : huy maden heom ful bold: huy wenden forth and founden þe Rode : ase [he] heom hadde i-told. huy wuschen hire clene and setten hire up : ase heo was er bi-fore ido. &YOGH;uyt is þe wounde in þe þrote i-sene : and euere heo wole so. Þe giv þat hire hadde so i-smite : i-cristned he was sone, And guod lijf ladde, as it bi-feol : cristine man to done.
0.10: A Cristine man þare was &yogh;wile : in þe londe of Sicie, A rode he hadde in is hous : þer-on ofte to crie. hit bifeol at is terme-day : þat he wende to an oþur inne. A giv cam sethþe and wonede þer : and nust nou&yogh;t þe rode þare-inne. Þo þe rode was þare i-founde : alle þe giwes as nome And ladden as forth to heore Synagogue : ase huy ladden ore louerd to dome; And also ase huy ore louerd beoten : þe rode huy beoten faste, And spatten on hure and boffatteden al-so : and ofte a-doun hire casten; At þe ri&yogh;t side huy smiten a spere : ful deope in atþe laste: Þat blod sprong out with gret strem. : þo weren þe schrewes a-gaste. For huy nolden bi-blede heore synagogue : a gret fat and a muche huy fette, to hente þane strem of blode : vnder þe rode huy it sette; So þat heo bledde þat fat bretful : of blod, are hit stunte. þo ne dorsten huy more schame do : þe rode ase huy munte. Ake huy þou&yogh;ten to proui with þat blod : &yogh;weþer ore louerd were soth and guod r. soth god : Euerech sik giv þat huy kneowen : huy smeoreden with þat blod: And heore hele huy hadden a-non. : þe schrewene onder-stode þat heore lawe nas ri&yogh;t nou&yogh;t : þat ne bi-liefden nou&yogh;t on þe rode: to þe bischop huy wenden a-non : and lieten heom cristni alle, And tolden al heore luyþere dede : ant hou it þare-of was bi-falle. Þe bischop wuste þis holie blod : ase relikes riche and guode. gret miracle þare cam alday : of þulke swete blode; So þat it was in-to manie studes : I-fet, wide and side, Þat it is nouþe for relikes i-holde : in mani a lond wel wide. In mani stude men seggez it is : of ore louerdes owene blode; Ake in eche stude it may wel beo : among oþere relikes guode.
0.11: A Giv þare cam to Rome &yogh;wilene : þat ne mi&yogh;te herebeorewe non i-winne: In an old hous MS. hous hous he lay him a-doun : feor fram euerech Inne. For he was in so wilde stude : of þe deuel he dradde him sore. he þou&yogh;te hou cristine men heom wusten : fram þe deoueles lore: With þe croiz he blessede him al-a-boute : an-auntre &yogh;wat him bi-tidde, Þei he þare-on ne bi-liefde nou&yogh;t : and lay doun him-seolf a-midde. A gret deouel þere cam In at mid-ni&yogh;t : ase þei it a maister were, And oþur deuelene with him i-nowe : ane chaiere with him huy bere, Þare-oppon huy setten þis grete maister : and he heom eschte a-non Ech after oþur of heore dedes : and &yogh;ware-a-boute huy hadden i-gon. Þo euerech hadde i-&yogh;olde a-countes : of schreu-hede huy hadden ido, Þe maister lokede him bi-side : þane giv he i-sai&yogh; al-so. "&YOGH;wat is," he seide, "þilke maister : þat ich in þulke huyrne iseo? ho made him so hardi and so wod : at oure a-counte to beo? goth forth a-non and fetteth him hider! : we schullen maken him with us telle." So sore werth þe giv a-drad : þat he werth nei&yogh; out of is felle. Þo þe deuelene comen toward him : huy ne mi&yogh;ten come him nei&yogh;, Ake ech of heom a-drad was sore : þo he þat creoiz i-sei&yogh;. "&YOGH;wat nou?" quath þis bolde maister : "&yogh;wy ne habbe &yogh;e him i|brou&yogh;t?" "Sire, merci," þis oþere seiden : "we ne mowen come nei&yogh; him nou&yogh;t: he is in a veteles þat ampti is : ake with-oute i-armed faste." Þo flouwen þe deuelene for þe croiz : þat sore huy weren a-gaste. Þe giv bi-liefde in godes sone : þat on þe rode was i-do, And liet him cristni al-so sone : so he mi&yogh;te come þer-to.
0.12: A Nonne þare was of on Abbeie : þat in a day hire &yogh;eode plei&yogh;e. A fair herbe, þat men cleopez letuse : heo i-sai&yogh; stonde bi þe wei&yogh;e: In hire mouth heo pulte þarof a lef : and ne blessede it nou&yogh;t er: heo iwerth a-non out of hire witte : and feol a-doun ri&yogh;t þer. Þat folk made gret deol for hire : and ech man þat hire i-sai&yogh;. An holi man þat þarof heorde : þuder-ward wende adai. A-non so he cam toward hire : þe deuel gradde for fere And seide, "a weilawei! &yogh;wat dude ich here : bote op one herbe sat þere And heo me nam and swaluz r. swal&yogh; me in : and bot me al-so wel sore? Þou mi&yogh;t &yogh;wite me &yogh;wat þou wolt : ake i-ne habbe gult non more." "Þou schalt," quath þis holi man : "an oþer.In. habbe to-&yogh;ere. For heo for-&yogh;at to blessi hure : ful redi þou were þere." Þoru&yogh; signe of þe holie croiz : þene deuel he drof out þere; &YOGH;eollinde and fol sori he wende a-wei : with ful grislich bere. Þare-fore ich rede ech man beo i-war : þat wilnez wel to do, blessi is mete are he it ete : þat he ne beo i-serued so. Nouþe, god, for þe rode loue : þat þou were on ido, bringue us to þe hei&yogh;e Ioye : þat þou us bou&yogh;test to. Amen.

1.0: 11. S. Dunstan. This legend, and S. Cristofer, I have edited before in 'Lemcke, Jahrbuch für rom, und engl. phil., 1875.'
1.1: SEint Dunston was of enguelonde : i-come of guode more. Miracle ore louerd dude for him : þe &yogh;uyt he was un-bore. For þo he was in his moder wombe : In a candel-masse day, Þat folk was muche at churche : ase hit to þe tyme lay: As huy stoden alle with heore li&yogh;t : ri&yogh;t also men stondeth &yogh;uyt nou, heore li&yogh;t queincte ouer-al : þat no mon nuste hou; here þat li&yogh;t barnde swiþe wel : and here it was al oute. Þat folk stod al in gret wonder : and weren in grete doute, And bispeken ech to oþur : in &yogh;wuche manere it were Þat it queinte so sodeinliche : al þat li&yogh;t þat huy bere. Also huy stoden and þarof speken : in gret wonder ech-on, Seint Dunstones moder taper : a-fuyre werth a-non Þat heo huld in hire hond— : heo nuste &yogh;wannes it cam. Þat folk stod and þat bihuld : and gret wonder þar-of it nam; No man nuste fro whannes it cam : bote þoru ore louerdes grace. Þarof huy tenden alle heore li&yogh;t : þat weren in þe place. &YOGH;wat was þat, þat ore louerd crist : fram heouene þat li&yogh;t sende And þat folk þat þare stode aboute : heore taperes þarof tende, Bote þat of þulke holi child : þat was in hire wombe þere Al enguelond scholde beo ili&yogh;t : bet þane hit euer er were?— Þo þis child was i-bore : his freond nomen þer-to hede, huy leten hit do to Glastingburi : to norischci and to fede, And to techen him his bileue al-so : his pater noster and crede. Þat child wax and wel i-þev&yogh; : ase it moste nede. To þe world he nam luyte &yogh;eme : for to alle godnesse he drou&yogh;; Ech man þat heorde of him speke : hadde of him ioye i-nov&yogh;. Þo he couþe mannes wit : to his vncle he gan go, Þe Erchebischop of caunterburi : Aldelm þat was þo. With him he maude ioye i-nov&yogh; : and euere þe leng þe more, Þo he i-sei of his guodnesse : and of his wise lore. For gret deinte þat he hadde of him : he dude him sone bringue To þe prince of Engelond : Aþelston þe kyngue. Þe king him maude ioye i-nou&yogh; : and grauntede al his bone, Of &yogh;wat þing þat he wolde him bidde : &yogh;if it were to done. Seint Dunston him bad ane place : þare he was forth i-brou&yogh;t, In þe toun of Glastingburi : þat he ne wernde him nou&yogh;t. Þe king grauntede him is bone a-non : and after him al-so Edmund, is broþer, þo he was king : and in his power ido. To Glastingburi he wende sone : þe guode man seint Dunston, Þo boþe þe kingues &yogh;eue him leue : Eadmund and Athelston. ¶ A fair Abbeye he let þare a-rere : ase men i-seoth þare &yogh;uyt stonde, Of blake Monekes, þat was a-rerd : þe furste of Enguelonde— For ech Abbeie of Enguelonde : þat of blake Monekes is Of þe hous of Gastingburi : furst sprong and cam, iwis. Him-sulf he nam þe Abite þere : and Monek formest bi-cam; Sone he was Abbot of þe hous : and gret couent to him nam. he makede þare godes seruise : studefast and stable i-nov&yogh;; Þat couent þat þare-inne was : to alle guodnesse drou&yogh;. Þis holi Abbod seint Dunston : hadde gret power With þe king Eadmund, þo he was king : he was is conseiller. After þe king Eadmundes deþe : a guode &yogh;wyle it was a-gon Þat Edwyne, is sone, was king i-maud : ake nou&yogh;t ri&yogh;t sone after a-non. ¶ Þis Edwyne hadde ful vuel red : and þare-aftur he drov&yogh;. With seint Dunston he was wroth : and with wel gret wov&yogh; Of his Abbeye he drof him out : and dude him schame i-nov&yogh;; Þe more schame þat he him dude : þe more þe guode man lov&yogh;. he let driue him out of Enguelonde : and let crien him fleme. Þis guode man wende out wel glad : ne tok he none &yogh;eme. To þe Abbeie of seint Amaunt : bi-&yogh;eonde se he drou&yogh;, And soriornede þare longue : and ladde guod lijf inov&yogh;. ¶ þo þe king Edwyne was ded : Edgar, þat was is broþer. After him was king I-maud : for he was ner þane ani oþur. Swyþe guod man he bi-cam : and louede wel holi churche, And ech man þat him to guode radde : aftur him he gan wurche. ¶ Men tolden him of seint Dunston : þat is broþer drof out of londe With vnri&yogh;tht for is guodnesse : and he bi-gan him vnderstonde: After him he sende a-non : þat he come a-&yogh;en sone And with him bi-leue is conseiler : of þat he hadde to done. Seint Dunston cam hom a-&yogh;en : and faire was vnder-fongue, And hadde his Abbeye al in pays : fram &yogh;wuche he hadde i-beo longue. Swyþe wel he was with þe king : and al his conseiller; Men speken muche of his guodnesse : wel wide feor and ner. ¶ Hit bi-fel þat þe Bischop : of wyrecestre was ded: Þe kyng and þe Erchebischop Eode : þar-of nomen heore red And þene holie Abbod seint Dunston : Bischop huy maden þere, For he scholde beo herre in godes lawe : þei it a-&yogh;ein is wille were. Some men axeden at þe Erchebischope : of Caunterburi sire Ode &YOGH;ware-fore þat he him Bischop maude : and &yogh;wy his graces weren so guode. "For he schal," seide þis guode Man : "aftur me here bee Erchebischop of Caunterburi : and þat Men schullen i-see." "&YOGH;wat wostþou?" þis oþere seiden : "þou spext folliche, i-wis, Þou nost non more þane þi fot : op-on god al it is." "Mine leue frend," seide þis holie Man : "&yogh;e ne dorre me blamie nou&yogh;t, For ich wot wel &yogh;wat ore louerd crist : in mi Mouth hath i-brou&yogh;t. And ho-so with-seith ou&yogh;t of þulke þinge : þat ich eov habbe i-sed, Þe soþe he mai seo, &yogh;if he liueth : after þat ich am ded." ¶ Bischop he was of londone : seint Dunston, sethþe al-so, Of londone and of wyrecestre : and heold boþe to. hit bi-fel þat þe Erchebischop : of Caunterburi was ded: Þe pope and þe king Edgar : þar-of nomen heore red And mauden þane guode man seint Dunstan : Erchebischop þere. Guode men þat him i-knewen : wel glade þar-of were. Þe cristindom of Enguelonde : to guod stat he drov&yogh; And þe ri&yogh;tes of holi churche : he heold up faste i-nov&yogh;. he fourmede þoru&yogh; al enguelond : þat ech person scholde cheose To witien him chaste fram lecherie : oþur his churche leose. Seint Athelwold was þulke tyme : Bischop of winchestre, And Oswold, þe guode man : Bischop of wurecestre: Þeos twei Bischopes with seint Dunston : weren al at one rede, And Edgar þe guode king : to done þat guode dede. Þeos þreo Bischopes wenden a-boute : þoru&yogh; al Enguelonde And euerech luþer person casten out : heom ne mi&yogh;hte non atstonde; heore churchene and heore oþer guod : clanliche heom bi-nome And bi-setten as on guode men : þoru&yogh; þe popes graunt of rome. Ey&yogh;hte an fourti Abbeies : of Monekes and of nonnes Of þat tresur huy a-rerden in Enguelonde : þat of persones was so i-wonne. [Here a leaf is torn out in the MS., with the rest of this and the beginning of the following legend; only the first words of vv. 131-151 are preserved on a fragment of the leaf. MS. Vernon, which has the same text, continues:] [ffor so hit was bet biset : þen hit were al. was er on schrewe— ffor whonne gode Maystres beoþ : sum goodnesse heo wolleþ schewe. Gode weoren þe þreo Bisschopes : þat þulke tyme weren þo— Þe betere hit is in Engelonde : for hem euere-mo. ¶ Vr lord &yogh;af seint Dunston : on eorþe so feir grace Þat on a tyme, as he was : in a priue place, his ffader and his Modur ek : in þe Ioye of heuene an-heih, Aftur þat heo weoren dede : wel aperteliche he hem seih. Gret loue vr lord him kudde : whon he him schewede þere So muche of his priuyte : þe while he alyue were! ¶ As he lay a noþur time : in his reste a niht, he sayh þe Ioye of heuene : and þe place þer-inne wel briht; Aungels he herde syngen also : a Murie song þer-Inne, Þat me syngeþ in holy Chirche : whon me þe Masse bi-ginne: Kyrie leyson xpe leyson : was þat Murie song— Þe holi Mon þat þis i-herde : hit ne þhouhte him no-þing long. Wel ouhte he to heuene come : at his ende-day Þat, while he was alyue : so muche of heuene he say! ¶ harpe he louede swiþe wel : for of harpe he couþe i-nouh. A day he sat in his solas : and a lay þer-on he drouh. Þe harpe he heng vp bi þe wouh : þo hit was tyme to ete; Þo hit was redi þer-to ibrouht : he sat doun to his mete. Of heuene he gon þenche sone : of ioye þat was þere, Of þe Ioyful blisse þat þer was : among halewen þat þer were.] he These beginnings of the next verses are extant in L. on a fragment of the fol. sat [as þei&yogh; he weore i-nome : so muche þer-on he þouhte.] his h[arpe, þat heng so bi þe wouh : of whom he luyte Rouhte,] heo gan [to kuiþe his holy þouht : ded treo þei&yogh; hit were,] Also it o[vr lordus wille was— : hire herden alle þat weoren þere.] Al bi hire-[self heo gon harpen : a Murie Antempne iwis] Þat men s[ingeþ &yogh;ut in holy churche : þat on Englisch is þis]: "halewene s[oulen glade beoþ : þat in heuene beoþ i-do,] Þat siweden [vr lordes wey : and for him schedden also] heore blod for [his swete loue. : þerfore heo schulen wone] And kyngues Vern. knyhtes be [wiþ-outen ende : wiþ crist Godus sone."] Þe al. þis Antenene þa[t murie is : as þis folk iherden alle,] Þe harpe song a[l bi hire-self : as heo heng bi þe walle.] Faire grace ore l[ord him schewede þer : whon þat dede treo] Scholde so singue [of þulke Ioye : þat he scholde Inne beo!] Louerd, i-hered beo [þi grace : & þi mi&yogh;te also] Þat woldest her MS. for [alyue for him : such miracle do.] Vv. 143-4, om. in Vern., are added from MS. Harl. ¶ þo þis holie man [hedde i-lyued : on eorþe mony a day] And his ende-dai [was neih i-come : as he him-self say&yogh;,] An holi þoresdai [he wex sek : as hit fel in þe &yogh;ere.] he liet him clep[e of his frendes : þat specials to hym were,] his men þat h[im serueden ek : he lette hem clepe also,] [And for-&yogh;af hem heore trespas : þat heo him hedden misdo, And a-soylede hem of heore sunnes : as he in Godus bendes lay. And so he lay in þulke tyme : and eke þene ffriday. he lette clepe þe saturday : þe ffreres bi-foren him alle And bad hem alle haue god day : and seide what him r. hem scholde bi-falle; he let him don al his Rihtes : and vr lordus flesch he nom, And wende out of þis world : and to heuene wel sone com. Now, swete lord seint Dunston : þat vre Erchebisschop were, Bring vs to þe Ioye of heuene : as Angles þi soule bere. Amen.

2.1: SEint Augustin, þat cristendom : brouhte in-to Engelonde, Riht is among oþere i-wis : þat we him vndurstonde. Seint Gregori þe holy Mon : pope was of Rome, Engelond he louede muche : þeih he þer neuer ne come. Me tolde þat þe lond was good : and þat hit heþene was. Wel sori was seint Gregori : þat hit cristene nas. him-self he wolde habben i-went : in-to Engelonde, Ac he ne moste for þe Cardinals. : ac he sende his sonde: Wiþ ffourti goode men : seint Austyn he nom And sende hym in-to Engelonde : to preche cristendom, Þat vchone Monkes weore : seint Austin and eke þe oþere. fforþ heo wenden euerichone : þat were alle as breþere— Aftur þat God was i-boren : ffyue hundred &yogh;er hit was Þat seint Austin wende in-to Engelonde : to do þis goode cas. he dredde him sore for he ne couþe : þe speche of Engelonde: he nom men wiþ him þat couþen : þe speche vndurstonde. ¶ heo duden hem forþ in þe séé. : þo heo þider comen, Toward þe heþene of Engelonde : þe rihte wey heo nomen. In an Ile bi þe Est : Riht atte on ende Þis Goode Men gonnen aryue : as God wol[d]e hem grace sende. Þer heo nomen furst heore In : and nomen hem sone to Rede hou heo mihten best on taken : to don þis holy dede. ¶ To þe kyng Aþelbert, þat was þo : kyng of Engelonde, Bi a qweynte Messager : feire heo senden heore sonde: Þat heo weoren Messagers : and from an hei&yogh; mon heo come To don to him a Message : from þe Court of Rome, Þat scholde to him world wiþouten ende : and to alle in his londe To gret prou ben and to gret Richesse : &yogh;if he hit wolde vndurstonde. ¶ Þo þe kyng þis word herde : he stod a while in þouht. "Goode tiþinges," he seide, "mot hit beo : þat heo me habbeþ i-brouht. vndurfongeþ hem feire inouh : and honoureþ hem also, And fyndeþ hem plente inouh : of þat heo habbeþ nede to, fforte ich habbe wiþ hem i-speke : and heore Message seo; God leue, as heo me bi-hoteþ : þat hit mote to my prou beo." his heste was ful wel i-holde : and me vndurfeng hem feire i-nouh. Þe kyng toward þulke Ile : sone þeraftur he him drouh.] [Here L. continues, ] Þo he to þe .yle. cam : to seint Austyn he sende, Þat he to him with his felawes : to don is erende, i-wende. ¶ Seint Austyn him greiþede wel : and his felawes echon, For-to fi&yogh;hte a-&yogh;ein þe Deuel : and to batayle gon: huy mauden þe signe of þe croiz— : oþure Armes ne hadden huy non For-to done þis bataille : and to ouer-come heore fon. Ane Croyz of seluer with þe fourme : of god huy leten a-rere And in stude of Banere : bi-fore heom huy bere, And &yogh;eoden forth wel baldeliche : ase hardie kny&yogh;tes and guode, huy siweden alle heore swete Baner : þe fourme of þe rode; Þe letanie huy gonne singue : for prov of þe londe, Þat ore swete louerd heom sende grace : heore prechingue to vnder|stonde. ¶ Þane kyng huy gretten swyþe faire : þo huy to him come, And seiden him þe erende : þat huy brou&yogh;ten fram þe court of Rome, And precheden him of cristindom : and of ore louerdes lawe, Þat r. to goddere hele him and alle his : &yogh;if huy wolden þare-to drawe; huy bi-heten him þe Ioye of heouene : þat so riche was and is, Þat he scholde after þis lijf : tuyrne into þulke blis And be þere with-outen ende : with god þat us bou&yogh;te. Þe king stod, þo he heorde þis : ase þei he were in þou&yogh;te. ¶ "Swyþe fair þing," he seide, "it is : þat þov bi-hotest me; Mi&yogh;hte ich beo siker þat hit sothþ were : ich wolde don after þe. Ake ich ne concenti nou&yogh;t þer-to— : for it is &yogh;eot so neowe, Are ich habbe more vnder&yogh;ite : &yogh;weþur þis Message beo trewe. Ake for &yogh;e þus i-trauailede beoth : fram so ferre londe, And for ore guode, ase &yogh;e seggeth : and &yogh;e dothþ me onderstonde, Ich eov nelle greui nou&yogh;t : ake wel faire bi eov do And onder-fonguen eov and finden also : þat &yogh;e habbez neode to; And ich graunti also þat alle þulke : þat wollez to eov torne, Guode leue ich [&yogh;iue ech] om. man : for i-nelle no man weorne." ¶ Seint Austin and alle his : A swyþe fair woniingue In þe toun of Douere he heom &yogh;af : to makie inne heore prechingue. Seint Austin and is felawes also : bi-gonne to prechie faste, So þat some þat guode weren : to heom heore heorte caste And turnden heom to cristindom : and euere þe leng þe mo; So þat þut folk a-boute heom cam : ase þicke ase huy mi&yogh;ten go. heore dede sprong so wide sone : þat to þe king it cam Þe faire miracles þat huy duden : as huy precheden cristindom. ¶ He wende and heorde eft heore prechingue : and sei&yogh; þat hit was guod; "To longue," he seide, "ich habbe a-bide : ar ich þis vnder-stod." he turnde him to cristindom : and liet him baptisen anon And biliefde on ihesu crist : and is Men ech-on. Erchebischop of Caunterburi : þe furste þat euere cam, Seint Austin huy maden þo : to holde up cristindom. ¶ Seint Austin brou&yogh;te cristindom : þus into Enguelonde— Wel au&yogh;te we his [dai] Anouri : &yogh;if we weren wel vnderstonde. ¶ His day is toward þe ende of May : for in þat day he wende Out of þis lijf to ihesu crist : þat after him þo sende. Bidde we &yogh;eorne seint Austin : þat cristindom so brou&yogh;te, Þat we moten to þulke Ioye come : to &yogh;wan ore louerd us bou&yogh;te.

3.1: SEint Barnabe þe Apostle : þat guod was and hiende, I-Martred he was for godes loue : in strongue deþe atþenende. After þat ore swete louerd : to heouene gan i-wende, Þe Apostles precheden cristindom : ase he heom gan wit siende: ¶ Seint Barnabe i-sai&yogh; þo : þat his bi-leue nas nou&yogh;t: he turnde sone to þe Apostles : and to ore louerd al is þou&yogh;t. Of lond he hadde ane grete feld : and he it solde wel faste, to þe Apostles he wende anon : and to heore fet þe panes caste And for-sok al þis world r. worldes guod : and heore felawe bi-cam, And I-martred he was with heom : for loue of cristindam. Sethþe þo seint powel : to þe Apostles wende, Þe Apostles ne lefden it nou&yogh;t : þat ore louerd him to heom sende, Ake wenden þat he a gylur were : so þat hit was longue— For he hadde so luþur man i-be— : are huy dorsten him vnder|fongue. ¶ Seint Barnabe i-knev him ferst : so þat he formest brou&yogh;te Þe apostles in cuthrade with him : and in ri&yogh;te þou&yogh;te, And tolde heom hov ore swete louerd : bi weye to him cam And smot him and bi-nam him is si&yogh;t : and brou&yogh;te him to cristindom. ¶ Sethþe þo fram Ierusalem : þe Apostles gonne wende, For-to prechi godes lawe : þat so guod is and hende, And to þe londe of Cypre : seint Barnabe huy gonne þo sende: This v. om. in other MSS. Ase he wende forth in is wei : in one stude he fond A felau&yogh;schipe of quoynte Men : þe wiseste of al þe lond. he spac with heom so quoynteliche : ase he bi heom cam, Þat þar nas non of heom alle : þat ne wondrede of his wisdam. "Sire sire," seide on of heom : þat was of grete fame, "Tel us of &yogh;wannes þou art : and &yogh;wat is þi name, And fram &yogh;wannes þou art hidere i-come : and for &yogh;wuche þingue; Þou comest here into ore lond : ich wot for sume tiþingue." ¶ Seint Barnabe þis holie Man : fondede in eche pointe to answerien heom wel quoynteliche : for huy weren heom-self so quoynte. "Sire," he seide, "þov axest wel : and ich ou wulle telle: Barnabe ich am i-cleoped : þe deueles fo of helle, Iesu cristes man ich am : þat me gan hidere siende, Fram Ierusalem ich am i-come : and þus a-boute wiende For-to prechi is holie name : þat brou&yogh;te us out of biende. Bi-leueth on him and &yogh;e worþeth in Ioye : euere with-oute ende." he prechede so þis grete men : þat huy turnden heore þou&yogh;t And weren þare to cristindom : þoru&yogh; seint Barnabe i-brou&yogh;t And bi-liefden on Iesu crist : and heore heorte ope him caste, And prechede also of ihesu crist : and turnde þut folk wel faste. Seint Barnabe wende him forth : and to þe londe of cipre he com, to tuyrne men to ihesu crist : and to prechi cristindom. He cam and fond a foul dede : þat schendful was to do: Men vrne nakede al a-boute : and wummen al-so. Seint Barnabe was þar-of a-schamed : for it was a schenful dede Þat þe schrewene neren a-schamede nou&yogh;t : to schewi heore wrechhede. To þe temple he wende a-non : ope &yogh;wan huy a-vouweden heore schame, And a-mansede þat sori temple : in ore louerdes name. A-non with þis mansingue : al þat on half dachste a-do v nn Þoru&yogh; grete wreche of þis temple : with gret noyse and soun. Þo þe schrewes i-sei&yogh;en þe wreche : þat so schamelese were, huy bi-lefden þulke schendfole dede : huy ne dorsten non-oþur for fere. þis holie man wende him forth : ferrore in þe lond : MS. londe Tymon, þat was an holi man : in a stude he fond, Þat in a strong acces was of a feuere : and al atþe deþe nei&yogh;. Seint Barnabe of-þou&yogh;te it sore : þo he him i-sei&yogh;. Þe godspelles of seint Mathev : with him euere he ber In a bok; ase god it wolde : with him he hadde as þer : Þis bok he leide ope þis man : ase he so sijk þer lay : he bi-cam anon hol and sound : ase al þat folk i-say, MS. i isay And wende forth with him a-boute : hol and glad i-nov&yogh;, And prechede &yogh;eorne of ihesu crist : and folk fram sunne drov&yogh;. Of ore swete louerd of heouene : seint Barnabe hadde swich grace Þat, &yogh;if he founde ani sijk man : ase he wende in ani place, And he leide ope him þis bok : þat so holi and guod was Of þe godspelles of seint Mathev : so strong siknesse non nas Þat he þoru&yogh; ore louerdes grace : ne helde þar-of a-non; Þare-þoru&yogh; he maude mani men : to Iesu criste gon. Þoru&yogh; vertue of þis holie Man : and of þis holie bok al-so Muche fair mi&yogh;thte ore louerd hath : in his seriaunz ido. Þis holie man seint Barnabe : &yogh;et forþere he wende And prechede þe giwes faste : hore lijf for-to amende. Manie he tornede to cristindom : and þene holi gost on heom tende, Þoru&yogh; miracles þat he dude : and þoru&yogh; grace þat god him sende. ¶ Bareu was a luþur giv : þat euere weorrede faste Seint powel and seint Barnabe : and cudde it at þe laste : For þo he fond seint Barnabe : þat folk to ore louerd so w i ende, To þe luþere Iustise of þe lond : þe tiþingue he gan siende. Þis holi man was sone i-nome : and to dome i-brou&yogh;t. huy tormenteden him harde and stronge : forto torni is þou&yogh;t Alle manere turmenz huy him duden : þat huy mi&yogh;thten on bi-þenche : huy ne mi&yogh;thten him nou&yogh;t &yogh;eot enes make : fram god is þou&yogh;t blenche. ¶ Ase huy weren with al heore mi&yogh;te : a-boute him al. om. faste and longue For-to defouli þis holie man : with tormenz harde and strongue, ¶ Þe Aumperores o cosin : þat of gret power was, In-to toune cam þulke time : ase it feol bi cas. Þe giwes weren so sore a-drad : laste he hem bi-nome Þoru&yogh; strencþe seint Barnabe : and ladde him to rome : A-ni&yogh;ht huy nomen þis holie man : ase he was to-raunsed so, And teiden ane rop a-boute is necke : and knutten him faste þerto And drowen him out of heore synagoge : with seoruwe and pine i-nov&yogh;, And sethþe al-so bi þe sweore : out atþe &yogh;ate men him drov&yogh; And mauden a-boute him swiþe gret fuyr : and barnden him al-to nou&yogh;te. his soule wende to þe Ioye of heouene : þat he wel deore a-bou&yogh;te. ¶ Þo nomen þe luþere men heore red : &yogh;wanne huy mi&yogh;ten atþe laste, his bones þat weren bi-left vn-barnd : a-midde þe .se. to caste. Ake cristine Men þat weren bi-side : stelen to bi ni&yogh;te And bureden as wel stilleliche : with ase gret honour ase huy mi&yogh;te. Nov bidde we &yogh;eorne ihesu crist : king of alle kinge, For loue of seint Barnabe : þat he us to heouene bringue.

4.1: SEint Iohan was þe beste bern : þe holie baptist, Þat euere of womman was i-bore : with-oute ihesu crist. Ake of al þat he on vrþe was : we ne findez nou&yogh;t i-write Þat he ani Miracle dude : þat man mi&yogh;hte vnder-&yogh;ite. Mani men þinchez þerof wonder : so guod man ase he was; For manie miracles sum oþur dude : þat fulliche so holi man nas. Ake al it was for þe luþere giwes : þoru&yogh; ore louerdes wille so : For &yogh;if he hadde here on eorþe : ani miracle i-do, Þo giwes wolden habbe i-went : þat he ore louerd were, For he bi-gan ferst cristindom : and þat folk þer-to lere. Þare-fore ore louerd dude miracles : and ne liet him do non, For þe giwes scholden i-wite : &yogh;wuch he were ech-on. ¶ Seint Iohan for ore louerdes loue : was sethþe i-brou&yogh;t of dawe, For-to holden up cristindom : and þe ri&yogh;hte lawe. Heroudes, þat was þo king : in a time to rome Wende to þe Aumperour : ase is wone was for-to done. So þat bi þe weie he wende : bi sire phelipe, his broþur; And maude gret feste, ase ri&yogh;t was : heore eiþur with oþur. So þat heroudes spac : mid is broþer wiue : Þe r. þat he hire wolde to wiue habbe : þe &yogh;wuyle he were a-liue, And þat he wolde framward rome : þare-forth a-&yogh;ein wende And nimen hire and leden hire forth with him : and holde hire is liues ende. At on a-cord huy weren sone : to don þis sorie dede— Ase twei schrewene a-cordiet sone : to ane luþere rede. ¶ Þis kyng heroudes wende forth : in is wei toward rome And þou&yogh;te to take is broþer wijf : &yogh;wane he a-&yogh;einward come. His owene wijf it vnder-&yogh;at : ase sum freond hire word sende : to hire fader, þat [was] king : of Damasche, sone heo i-wende, to beon þare forto heo wuste : hou þis dede wolde an-ende. Þe king heroudes bi is broþer : A-&yogh;einward gan eft i-wende : And, also it was er bi-speke : þis wijf with him he nam And heold hire with strencþe ase is owene : in spous-bruche and horedam, And tiemde bi hire deolfolliche : in sunne and with gret wou&yogh;. his broþer and is wiues fader : weren with him wroþe i-nou&yogh; And duden him harm bi al heore mi&yogh;hte : and boþe weren is fon; Ake he heold him faste in his folie : and bi-lefde euere in on. ¶ So þat seint Iohan þe Baptist : to him a day com And calangede him of is sunne MS. sunnne : to ligge so in horedom, And seide, it was a-&yogh;ein heore lawe : and a-&yogh;ein cristindom. Heroudes þare-fore in wrathþe : seint Iohan wel faste nam And, for-to paye þe luþere hore : in strong prisun him caste— Þare-inne he lay al a &yogh;er : i-warded strangue and faste; And sethþe he liet smite of is heued : as &yogh;e i-hereth ofte telle, Also man redez in is daye in heruest : bi-foren eov in þe godspelle. ¶ In þe Castel of Arabie : is heued was of i-smite; Þe luþere quene it bi-nam hire dou&yogh;ter : and liet it faste wite. his desciples wenden stilleliche : þoru&yogh; ore louerdes grace And bureden þis holie bodi : in a wel fair place: Bi-twe[ne] Abel and Elysee : þat prophetes &yogh;wilene were, Stille was is holie bodi : wel longue i-bured þere. ¶ Þis false quene þat heued wuste : þat men ne founden it nou&yogh;t, laste it were in ani time : to þis bodie i-brou&yogh;t And a rise fram deþe to liue : and bi-come at þe laste A prophete ase he was er— : þere-fore heo wuste it faste. A day ase heo bi-heold þat heued : inwardliche in þe face, heo feol a-doun ded a-non : as it was ore louerdes grace. Þulke wreche to hire cam : þat deth hire a-doun caste— Me þinchez heo ne ou&yogh;te nou&yogh;t bi-li&yogh;he : hire schreuhede atþe laste; Ne þat luþere best, hire dou&yogh;ter, noþer. : for ase heo &yogh;eode a dai And pleide upon .yse. in hire game : ase mani a man it r. i- sai, Þat .ys. to-brak vnder hire : and heo a-dronk a-non And in þe deueles name (!) : boþe flechs and bon. Þis hadde moder and eke Dou&yogh;ter : to heore Mede atþen ende, And also schal ech luþur man : &yogh;wanne vre louerd it wole him siende. ¶ Þat heued was sethþe wel priueliche : to Ierusalem i-brou&yogh;t And i-bured stilleliche : þat Men ne founden it nou&yogh;t. Of þis holi bodi, þare it lay : manie Miracles come, Grete and faire, ny&yogh;ht and day : ase þat folk i-sai&yogh; i-lome. A luþer Aumperour þere was þo : þe luþere Iulian, Þa[t] reneyede ore louerdes lawe : and was swyþe vuel Man. Þo Men tolden him of þis Miracles : In grete wrathþe and onde he liet nimen þis holie bones : and to-sprede into al þe londe And casten heom a-boute ech fram oþur : þat no man þare-nei&yogh; ne come Ne ne founden r. founde heom to fette is bote : ase men duden er i-lome. Ake &yogh;ut for al is felonie : ne bi-lefde ore louerd nou&yogh;t Þat manie sike men þat comen þare-nei&yogh; : to hele weren i-brou&yogh;t. ¶ Þo was þis luþere Iulian : wroþere þane he was er. Ase is bones weren er to-[s]prad : his men he sende þer And liet heom fette a&yogh;ein wel clene : and with-oute þe toun a-non he liet heom sette on strongue fuyre : and fur-berne echon, And þut doust þar-of wel wide : he liet blowe mid þe winde, For men ne scholden of him on vrþe : neuereft more i-finde. ¶ Ake his o finguer with &yogh;wan he tei&yogh;hte : þo he MS. orig. ore louerd þo he him (so the other MSS.) ore louerd i|sai&yogh; Cominde toward baptisingue— : ase attwelfte day— Toward þe watere of Iordan : and loude gradde and cride and sede "lo here godes lomb, þat bi-nimeth : þe worldes mis-dede:" For-soþe no fuyr ne mi&yogh;te come : on þat fingur one; Ake elles was al to douste i-barnd : bodi and bones ech-one. No fuyr ne mi&yogh;hte þat finguer brenne : for none cunnes þingue, For þe holie dede þat he þare-with : tei&yogh;hte to þe hei&yogh;e MS. holie, on the margin hei&yogh;e kingue, Ake he bi-lefde hol, and &yogh;uyt is : and þere nis non more bi-leued On vrþe of him bote þilke fingur : and his holie heued; For al is bodi was for-barnd : bote vnneþe þulke two. his day, ase falleth in heruest : þis dede was i-do ¶ Þat is bodi was þus i-barnd. : and also þulke day Þer-aftur longue men founden is heued : vnder vrþe ase it lay. Of þulke two þingues men holdeth is feste : þanne, þat &yogh;e it wite; For men ne mowen nou&yogh;t on ore leuedi day : þo is heued was of i-smite. A manere martyrdom it was : is bones so to-drawe: Þare-fore men mouwe þanne holde : is feste bi ri&yogh;te lawe. ¶ His holie heued, þat þus was : at Ierusalem i-hud, Þoru&yogh; fair miracle of seint Iohan : formest was i-kud. For to tweie Monekus at Ierusalem : him-sulf he cam bi ni&yogh;hte And schewede heom &yogh;ware is heued lay : ase it were in a si&yogh;hte. huy wenden forth and sou&yogh;ten it orig. is sone : and in þulke here i-wounde Þat he werede in wildernesse : atþe laste huy it founden; And þane fyngur huy founden al-so : þat was of him bi-leued. With gret honour huy beren forth : þat fingur and þis h[e]ued. ¶ For fair relike huy weren i-wust. : and &yogh;ut atþe laste Eft-sone huy weren &yogh;uyt i-hud : and in a put i-caste: And leyen þare longue i-hudde : ase fewe þar-of þou&yogh;te, Ake weren on vrþe al for-&yogh;ite : ase no-man of heom ne rou&yogh;te. Bote seint Iohan it nolde nou&yogh;t : þat huy lei&yogh;en to longue þere: To þe Abbod Marcel MS. Maroel he cam a ny&yogh;ht : in metyngue ase it were, And bad him nime is heued up : and seide &yogh;ware it lay. Þis guode man a-ros up sone : and ne a-bod nou&yogh;t forto day, Ake he openede is celle dore : and bi-heold a-boute. Ane steorre he fond bi-fore þe dore : houinde þare-with-oute, Þe clereste steorre þat mi&yogh;hte beo— : him wondrede þar-of i-nov&yogh;. he þonkede god with guode wille : and toward þe steorre he drov&yogh;, And putte forth is hond and wolde hire take. : ake he ne mi&yogh;hte hire nou&yogh;t a-reche, Ake þe steorre gan softe to glide forth : also it were þene wey to teche. ¶ þis Abbod hire siwede euere forth : and þe steorre bi-fore wel softe— Þe Abbot Anourede his ledare : fale siþes and ofte. Forth wende þe steorre, forto huy comen : ouer þat ilke place Þare his holie heue[d] lay : þoru&yogh; ore louerdes grace; Þo heo cam ouer þulke place : heo houede þare ane stounde, For-to Marcel þis holie Monek : hadde þis heued i-founde. ¶ To þe guode bischop Iulian : Marcel tolde þis cas. Þoru&yogh; heom boþe þat holie heued : I-nomen up of þe vrþe was. his heued &yogh;ut, and is finguer al-so : boþe huy beoth hole and sounde. A-seint Iohanes day in heruest 29 Aug. : þus huy weren i-founde. Þare-fore &yogh;uit þoru&yogh; heste of Rome : so wijd so is cristindom Men holdez þane dai in ho[nu]raunce MS. hor|aunce : of is holi martyrdom. ¶ For in ore leuedie daye in leynte : as he was to deþe i-brou&yogh;t, For þe oþur festene þat þare beoth : of him men ne redez nou&yogh;t. Nouþe seint Iohan þat in þe flym Iordan : baptisede godes sone, Lieue us þoru&yogh; ore cristindom : to þe Ioye of heouene come.

5.1: SEint Iemes þe holi Apostle : guod is to habbe in mone, Seint Iohanes broþur þe Ewangelist : and ore louerdes aunte sone; his Moder was ore leuedi soster : Marie cleophe— Of guode kunne he was i-come : non betere ne mi&yogh;hte be; he au&yogh;hte wel him-self beo guod : ase &yogh;e mowe alle i-se. In þe londe of Samarie he prechede : and al-so in Ivde; Þoru&yogh; is prechingue mani on : he turnde to cristindom. To hermogenes þe luþere prince : þe tiþingue sone com. ¶ Þilke prince was wichche strong : and enchauntour also, Þoru&yogh; þe deuel he wolde al day : gret Miracle do. Ane desciple he hadde of is Art : philet was is name: him he sende to seint Ieme : to fondi to don him schame, &YOGH;if þat he mi&yogh;hte with is Art : seint Ieme ouer-come. To-gadere huy comen forto playdi : ase þe day was i-nome. Godes desciple and þe feondes : bi-gonne to playdi faste; Ac seint Ieme, þat was godes desciple : a-boue was atþe laste: Blinde men he &yogh;af heore sij&yogh;ht : and maude hole in þe place Meseles and þe crokede al-so : al þoru&yogh; ore louerdes grace. ¶ Þo philet i-sai&yogh; him þus ouer-come : to is maister he wende sone, Hermogenes, and tolde him fore : ase is ri&yogh;hte was to done: "Sire," he seide, "ne hope þov nou&yogh;t : to come seint Ieme with|Inne; For nau&yogh;t it is, for þov ne schalt nou&yogh;t : ouer-come him with al þi ginne. Þare-fore do ase ichulle þe rede : and go we to him, we twei&yogh;e, And crie him merci and bicome we : his desciples beye. For siker þou beo, ichulle it do : þei þou nelle nou&yogh;t also." So wroth was þe prince þat he nuste : &yogh;wat for wrathþe do; Þoru&yogh; strencþe of þe deueles Art : he made philet a-non Þat he ne mi&yogh;hte non more þane a stok : a fot of þat stude gon. ¶ "Nov," he seide, "we schullen i-seo : &yogh;wat Iemes þe mai don here, &YOGH;weþer he þe mai a-&yogh;ein me vndo : and a-&yogh;ein mine godes pouwere." he liet him ligge þare ase astok : and forth a-wei fram him wende. Philet nam ane man a-non : and seint Ieme word sende hou faste þoru þe deueles mi&yogh;hte : he lai þer i-bounde, And bad him helpe his desciple : and bringue þene deuel to grounde. ¶ Seint Ieme him sende a luyte cloth : þat he with him ber, Þat he touchede him þare-with : and seide þeos two vers of þe sauter: "Ore louerd vn-bind þat beoth i-bounde : and &yogh;if þe blinde is si&yogh;hte, Ore louerd ri&yogh;tht heom þat buth vn-ri&yogh;ht : for þou louest al. oure louerd loueþ alle ri&yogh;hte." ¶ Þo philet hadde þis i-do : ase seint Ieme word him sende, On-bounde he was of þe deueles bendes : and &yogh;wodere he wolde he wende. he þrettnede faste hermogenes. : to seint Ieme sone he cam And godes desciple was and is : and aveng cristindom. Þo hermogenes i-herde þis : þat he was so vn-bounde And þat seint Ieme hadde i-brou&yogh;t : al is dede to grounde, ¶ Manie deuelene he conIurede : þat huy to him wende. "Wel &yogh;e wutez," he seide, "&yogh;wi it is : þat ich after eov sende: Ore alre fo, Iemes, hath : mine desciple me bi-nome. Bote &yogh;e beon strengore þane ich am : i-wis we beoth ouer-come. Ich hote eov þat &yogh;e wenden a-non : and doth a god prei&yogh;e, Nimeth and bringuet heom to me : faste i-bounde bei&yogh;e. Certes, bote &yogh;e it mouwen do : ase &yogh;e wel i-seoth, Ouwer power nis nou&yogh;t wurth an hawe : for ouer-come we beoth." ¶ "We schulle sone," þe deuelene seiden : "with heom on vrþe Vern. a noþur plei&yogh;e, Faste i-bounde al to þine wille : we schulle heom bringue bey&yogh;e. huy comen fleo oppe in þe loft : ouer þe apostle seint Ieme. And a-non so huy weren ouer him i-come : huy guonne to grenne and reme, al. feme Belewi and wel foule crie : "Iemes, Iemes, þin ore! We brennez here are it ore tyme be : and beth i-tormented ful sore." "Ho tormentede al. tormenteþ eov," quath seint Ieme : "and &yogh;wat wolde &yogh;e nouþe here?" "Bote we buth i-come," þe feondes seiden : "to nime þe and þi fere; Hermogenes us made hidere wiende : þoru&yogh; is conIuringue, Þat we eov scholden faste i-bounde : bei&yogh;e to him bringue. Bote a-non so we comen here ouer þe : Aungles to us come With brenninde raketei&yogh;ene : and faste vs bounde and nome; here huy us beteth and tormentieth : with brenninde fuyre. A wey, wei, Iemes, &yogh;wat schulle we do? : we ne mowen nou&yogh;t þis duyre. A, Iemes, Iemes, leoue louerd : of us wrechches haue reuþe, And neuereft we nelleth nei&yogh; þe come : pli&yogh;hte we wolleth ore treouþe." ¶ "&YOGH;e wrechche foles," quath seint Ieme : "I not &yogh;wat &yogh;e wolden here. Of þat &yogh;e þou&yogh;ten me a-nuye : drawe &yogh;e schullen a-rere. Al on-bounde ich &yogh;yue eov leue : a-&yogh;ein forto fleo, And bringuth him þat hidere eov sende : faste i-bounde to me— Þat &yogh;e ne don him non oþur harm!— : for icholde with him speke." "Wel is us nouþe," þe schrewen seide : "we worþet wel a-wreke." ¶ To hermogenes huy comen sone : and to grounde him caste, huy drowen him and is hondene bounden : bi-hinden him wel faste. Þus al. þef huy seiden, "þou sendest us : þare we gret wo i-fielde, In gret torment and brenningue : and nouþe we wollez þe &yogh;elde." huy harleden forth þusne wrechche : and to seint Ieme heo him brou&yogh;te, And seiden, "lo sire, &yogh;ware he is her : þat to swuche torment us wrou&yogh;te. &YOGH;if us ferst leue þat we moten : ore tormens a-wreke And þe muchele vnri&yogh;ht þat he us hath ido : are þou with him speke!" ¶ "Nay, certes," quath þis holie man : "&yogh;e ne schullen nou&yogh;t so, For ore louerd us hiet þat we scholden : guod for vuele do. &YOGH;wy ne come [&yogh;e] nou&yogh;t nei&yogh; philet : þat stant here bi me?" "Wel þou wost," þis oþure seiden : "þat we ne moten for þe." "No. goth þanne," quath seint Ieme : "to eower kuynde stude, And ne cometh neuer-eft nei&yogh; no guod man : þei a fol eov habbe i|bede." ¶ Euere stod hermogenes : and criede milce and ore, he quakede for drede and for pine : And wep swiþe sore. ¶ "Philete, philete," quath seint Ieme : "þes hath þe schame ido, Þov schalt don him guod a-&yogh;ein vuel : for mi louerd het me so. he bond þe þo þov were vn-bounde : and a&yogh;ein þulke luþere dede The last half-lines are transposed in the MS. Þov schalt vn-binde him þat is bounde : for so mi louerd sede." The last half-lines are transposed in the MS. Philet vn-bond þane wrechche : and dude him vuel for guod. Þe wrechche ne dorste nou&yogh;woder gon for fere : ake quakyinde þare he stod. "Go &yogh;ware þov wolt," quath seint Ieme : "for mi louerd nele it nou&yogh;t Þat euere ani man a-&yogh;ein is wille : to him beo i-brou&yogh;t." ¶ "A, merci," quath hermogenes : "þis deuelen me beteh r. beten so sore Þat I-ne dar anne fot fram þe go : laste huy me nimen more; huy me wullez a-sle, &yogh;if huy me a-fongueth eft : and þare-fore ich bidde þe Þat þov me take sum þing þat ich mouwe : for heom bere with me." Seint Ieme him tok is staf on honde : "go nov forth," he seide, "Þere nis no deuel þat dorre nouþe : nei&yogh; þe come, for drede." Hermogenes wende him forth. : his bokes alle he nam Þat he hadde of his enchauntemenz : to þe Apostle a-&yogh;ein he cam And bad þat he as for-brenne scholde. : þe Apostle sone heom nam And caste heom in þe deope .se : faste i-bounde echon. ¶ Hermogenes criede him merci : and wilnede cristindom; So þat he i-cristned was : and swiþe holi man bi-cam.— Abiatar, þat þo was : Iustise, luþur i-nov&yogh;, For þis dede he was wroth : toward seint Ieme, with gret wou&yogh;. he nam him faste and swor is othþ : þat he it scholde a-bugge deore; to þe kyingue heroudes he liet him lede : a rop a-boute is swere. Heroudes &yogh;af his dom a-non : his þrote to smite a-two, And Iosie þe quellare he was bi-take : þulke dede for-to do. Ane Rop he dude a-boute is necke : and ladde him toward is dome. Ane Man he helde of þe palasie : are heo þudere come. Þo Iosie þis isai&yogh; : merci anon he criede; Seint Ieme þe holie Apostle : he bad wel sone a-bide And cristni him in þe place : a-non-ri&yogh;tes þere. A-seinte marie day in leinte : bi-haueded boþe heo were. Ake holie curche halt of ore leuedi : feste þat ilke day; Bi-fore lamasse seueni&yogh;ht : we holdeth is day þer-fore, MS. bi-fore For þulke daye is bodi was : in-to schrine i-bore. ¶ A-non so seint Ieme þe holie man : bi-haueded was þere, his desciples him wolden lede a-wei : ac huy ne dorsten for fere. heore tyme huy a-wayteden wel : &yogh;wanne none Men þare nei&yogh; nere, And þat bodi wel stilleliche : out of þe countreye bere. In a schip huy leiden it in þe se : and forth þare-withþ huy wende, And none &yogh;eme ne nomen &yogh;woderward fare : bote ase god he[m] kende. Þat schip wende forth bi him-seolf : and hit cam on a day Into þe lond of Galeis : þare ase þe quene lay, Þat luþur [was] and schrewe inov&yogh;. : seint Iemes Men a-non Op of þe schipe nomen þat holie bodi : and leiden it opon a ston.
