Þe ston bi-gan to wexe a-brod : and holu&yogh; bi-cam a-midde, Ase euene i-maud to þe holie bodi : as ani man wolde bidde— ¶ Ne scholde no man so euene a þrov&yogh; : in lengþe and i[n] brede To al. make to him ase þat ston bi-cam : ase ech man þat it i-sai&yogh; seide. his desciples, ase it was ri&yogh;ht : to þe Quene erest wende : "Dame," huy seiden, "we habbeth i-brou&yogh;t : þat ore louerd þe hider sende, Seint Iemes bodi his Apostle : of &yogh;wam þov nome ofte þi red To laten him nime þe &yogh;wyle he was quik : ase mani men it habbeth i-seid. Ore louerd him hath hidere i-sent : ase he him-seolf bed. orig. bad Loke &yogh;ware þov him legge wolt : for i-come he is to þe ded." ¶ "Ey, traytours," quath þe luþere Quen : "&yogh;weþer &yogh;e beon of his? &YOGH;wane i-ne mi&yogh;hte of him beo a-wreke : of eov ichulle, i-wis." Þis guode Men he nam ech-one : and to þe king of spaygne heom sende, Þat he heom brou&yogh;te to strong dethþe : oþur don heom heore lawe wende. Echone þe king nam a-non : and in strongue prisone heom brou&yogh;te. Ac ore louerd ne for-&yogh;at heom nou&yogh;t : ake wel sone on heom þou&yogh;te : For an Aungel fram heouene cam : and þat prisoun brak wel sone. Þo þe kyng was þar-of i-war : he nuste &yogh;wat was to done. ¶ Kny&yogh;htes he liet siende i-nowe : aftur heom wel wide; Þat febleliche a-gonne in heore neodes : for schame heom gan bi-tide. For ase huy wolden ouer ane hei&yogh;e brugge : after þis guode men gon, Vnder heom þe brugge brak : and huy a-drounken ech-on. ¶ Þo þe tyþingue to þe kingue cam : sori he was i-nov&yogh;; Of is luþere [þou&yogh;t] om. þat he þou&yogh;te : for drede he him with-drov&yogh;. Mildeliche he to heom he sende : þat huy a-&yogh;ein comen him to, And þat he heom wolde a-mendi faire : of al þat he hadde heom mis-do. A&yogh;ein huy wenden to þe kyng : and he faire a-&yogh;ein heom cam, &YOGH;ware-þoru&yogh; he and al is Men : a-fenguen cristinedom. ¶ Þe king sende þe Quene word : þat heo scholde heore wille al do. Ful sori was þe Quene þo : and sore a-nuyd al-so; Ake heo ne dorste nou&yogh;t beo a&yogh;ein is heste : nere hire no so [wo]. Wilde bollokes heo wuste fale : ope ane hei&yogh;e hulle go : "Gothþ," heo seide, "ope þulke hulle : finde &yogh;e mowen þere Oxene and Bolen strongue inov&yogh; : forte leden with ouwer bere; Tei&yogh;eth heom to þulke wayne : and þat bodi leggez þar-inne, And ledeth it &yogh;ware eouwere wille beo— : godes leue &yogh;e habbe and minne." ¶ For þe Bollokes wilde were : þe luþere Quene so seide, For huy ne scholden heom temie nou&yogh;t : eni-þing for-to lede. his desciples wenden forth : to þulke hulle hei&yogh;e : A fuyr Drake þar-opon : a-&yogh;ein heom cominde huy sei&yogh;e. Swiþe ferliche he blaste fuyr : and a-sayllede heom faste— Mani a man he hadde a-slawe : and al þe contreie of him a-gaste. ¶ Þis desciples mauden þe signe sone : of þe Creoyz heom bi-fore : Anon hadde þis luþere worm : is pouwer al ilore, Þat hit ne mi&yogh;hte ane fot forþere passe. : þis desciples forth wende And to-pouneden it al to deþe : and ech lime fram oþur rende. Þe Bollokes and þe &yogh;oungue steores : þat weren er so wilde, Anon so huy touward heom superscribed. come : huy woxen tame and milde. Þe beste huy chosen þat huy wolden : and to þe wayne heom ladde; And huy drowen þat bodi so mildeliche : þat ech man þarof wonder hadde. ¶ Þis desciples nomen seint Iemes bodi : and opon þe wayne it leide, Þe bestes it drowen forth wel mildeliche : with-oute eche fole breide. huy comen and driue þane wayn : þare as þe Quene was. hire wondrede muche and dradde sore : þo heo isei&yogh; þat cas. ¶ Heo for-sok hire false bi-leue : and tok hire to cristindom, For þe wonder þat heo isei&yogh; : and guod womman bicom. Al hure paleys þat heo was inne : and al heore oþure bone, For-to honouri þat holie bodi : heo grauntede heom wel sone. A-midde þe paleys þis holi bodi : huy bureden with grete pruyte— Þare he hath euereft to þis dai i-beo : and so he is &yogh;uyte. ¶ Heo liet arere ane noble churche : and gret tresor he &yogh;af þar-to, And gret lond, þat &yogh;uyt þare-to lijth : and grete rentes al-so : &YOGH;ware-þoru&yogh; of religioun : a gret hous nouþe þare is Of Chanones, þat Men &yogh;eot i-seoth and sechethþ : at seint Iemes of Galys. A gret pilegrimage it is i-holde : ouer-al, ase &yogh;e i-seothþ, To sechen þat ilke holie stude : þare seint Iemes bones beothþ. Mani miracle is pilegrimes seggeth : þat þare hath ofte i-come. Þei we ne mouwen nou&yogh;t alle telle : þenche we moten on some.— ¶ Þritti Men at one tyme : pilegrimes bi-come, To seint Iemes þe holie stude : alle þene wei huy nome. Ase huy wenden bi þe wei&yogh;e : so gret loue huy hadden and trewe, And so guod heorte ech to oþur hadde : þat a foreward huy mauden newe Þat non ne scholde failli oþur : in perile ne in neode, Ake wed-breþerne huy bi-comen echon : ase huy þat wei eode. heore treuþes huy pli&yogh;hten alle bote on : ake he nolde his nou&yogh;t pli&yogh;te, Ake þat foreward he bi-het to holde : treuweliche ope al is mi&yogh;hte. ¶ So þat it bi-feol bi þe weie : þat on i-vuelede a day And vnder þe hulle of seint Mi&yogh;hel : longue sijk he lay. his felawes þat hadde him treouþe i-pli&yogh;ht : fiftene dawes þere Abiden him; so þat heom þou&yogh;te longue : for sore a-nuyde huy were, And seiden, "we ne mouwen no leng a-bide : late we him ligge ligge on the margin. stille; Do we moten ore pilegrimage : god do bi him is wille." huy nomen heore leue and lieten him ligge : and wenden forth ech-on, Bote þilke þat nolde is treuþe pli&yogh;hte— : he nolde nou&yogh;t fram him gon. ¶ "Certes," he seide, "god do is wille : and lieue eov wel to wende, I nelle anne fot fram him gon : are ich wute of him sum ende." Mid him he bi-lefde al one : for-to þat he ded were. Betere is trewe dede þane fals word : as it was isene þere. Þis trewe Man þat was with þe bodi : ful sore a-drad he was, For he was so feor fram toune : and no man nei&yogh;h him nas; For he was with þe dede al one : and it was nei&yogh;h ni&yogh;hte, he nuste &yogh;wat with þat bodi to do : bote seint Ieme him helpe mi&yogh;hte: his help he bad with guode heorte. : and in þe eueningue ri&yogh;ht Seint Ieme cam to him ride : in wel fair a-tyr of kni&yogh;ht. ¶ "Cum here," he seide, "forth with me : ne haue þou of no-þing drede, Bi-fore me cast þat bodi her : and ich it wolle hennes lede, And lupe þou up bi-hynde me." : and þo þis was al ido, Þis holie Man ladde þene dede forth : and þene quike al-so, Fyftene Iorneies grete are day— : in þulke luytele &yogh;wile,— To þe mount of Ioie : þat is bi-sides seint Iemes a mile. Þo huy comen to þulke Mount : seint Ieme gan a-bide, "Go," he seide to þe quike manne : "to mine churche here-bi-side And sei&yogh;e mine Canones þat þarinne beoth : þat ich heom word bi þe sende, Mine pilegrim þat me was leof : þat in treowenesse mine wei wende, Þat huy him burien a-mong heom þere : with fair seruise and li&yogh;hte— For ded he schal þudere come : &yogh;wane he a-liue ne mi&yogh;hte. And seie heom þat þine felawes were : þat heore wei is al i-lore, For heore treouþe þat huy breke : heore felawe, þat is nov bi-fore. And þine &yogh;wyle ichulle þe &yogh;elde : þat þou hast þus treowe i-beo." Mid þusse worde he wende forth : þat he ne mi&yogh;hte him none-more i-se. ¶ A-boute þat bodi for þis Miracle : folk cam þicke reke. Here man mai sum-del i-seo : &yogh;wuch [it is] treouþe to breke, And &yogh;wuch it is þane holie wey : to seint Iemes forto go. Þis Miracle is so Murie : ich mot &yogh;eot telle of mo.— ¶ Hit was a guod man and is sone : þat toward seint Iemes wende; To þe cite of Tolouse : a-&yogh;ein eue huy hem kende. Al ni&yogh;ht huy bi-lefden þere : at ane luþere mannes Inne. he þou&yogh;te with &yogh;wuche tricherie : he mi&yogh;hte panewes winne. ¶ Nou was þe lawe in þulke stude : as þe schrewe wel onder-stod: Þat ho-so an-hengue anine r. anne man : he scholde habbe al is guod. Þe schrewe heom made fair semblaunt : ase is manere was to done, Þat huy were for-dronke beie : and a-slepe lei&yogh;en sone. A coppe of seluer stilleliche : þis luþere Man gan bringue And dude in heore schrippe softeliche : a-mong heore oþur þingue. ¶ Þis guode Man a-wok and is sone : so sone so it dai was, And nomen heore leue and wenden forth : and nusten nou&yogh;t of þat cas. Þo huy come with-oute toune a luyte : þis luþere man aftur cam, hotinde out, with grete siwte : and þis trewe men beie he nam And seide huy hadden is coppe i-stole : and in heore scrippe i-bounde. Þat folk þis i-liefde a-non : þo huy þe coppe founde. ¶ Þis pilegrimes, þei huy treowe weren : to dome weren i-brou&yogh;t. Eche manere þeofþe huy fur-soken : ake þat folk ne liefde heom nou&yogh;t, For huy weren i-nome hond habbinde : þe court lokede a-non Þat huy heore dom with heom beren : and hanguy scholde þat on. ¶ "Alas, alas," þe fader seide : "&yogh;weþur i schulle novþe hongue And are ich habbe seint Ieme i-sou&yogh;t : þis file dethþ a-fongue?" "Nai certes," quath is sone : "þat nolde ich graunti þe, For to beo louerd of al þe world : þat þov deidest bi-fore me. hanguy ichulle for us boþe : þene deth i-nelle nou&yogh;t for-sake, And al-so wis ase we gultlese beoth : mine soule ich god bi-take." "A, mi leoue sone," quath þe fader : "so ne schal it nou&yogh;t beo; Scholdest þou dei&yogh;e and ich libbe : i-nelle neuere þane day i-seo. Swuch a child touward as þou art : i-loked it were wroþe, Þat þov scholdest hanguy and ich libbe! : ichulle hangy for us boþe." "A, fader, fader," quath þe sone : "be stille, ich bidde þe, For I nelle neuere þane day a-bide : þat þou schulle hongue bi-fore me; ¶ Ake go þane wey for us boþe : and ichulle hangy for us beye, And bide seint Ieme þat he me graunti : sum part of þine weye." Bi-twene þe fader and þe sone : þe striuingue laste longue— Þat ech man hadde deol þerof— : &yogh;weþur scholde þene dethþ a-fongue. So þat it ful atþenende : þei it were with wrongue, Þat þe sone for heom bei&yogh;e : gulteles was an-hongue. ¶ Alas, alas, þe deolfole cas : to heore so muche falshede! Wel &yogh;eorne boþe fader and sone : seint Ieme help huy bede. Welle louerd, þe deol of þe fader— : grettore neuere non nas, Þo he isai&yogh; is sone an-hongue : and for he gulteles was! he bi-tey&yogh;te is soule Iesu crist : þo þare nas non oþur won, And is wei with sorewe i-nov : to seint Iemes he gan gon. Also wel for is sone ase for him : seint Ieme he bad faste; And wende, þo he hadde al ido : hamward at þe laste. Are he come þare is sone was : him þou&yogh;te swyþe longue, &YOGH;if he mi&yogh;hte finde oþur i-seo : ani lime of him hongue— For þe lawe was þere þat euerech man : þat an-hangued were hanguy scholde þe &yogh;wyle i-laste al. he laste : and for-to ech lime fram oþur to-tere. ¶ Þis &yogh;oungue Man sixe and þritti dawes : heng up-on þe galu-treo Are is fader a-&yogh;ein to him come : þat i-roted he au&yogh;te to beo. he cam and fond him &yogh;uyt : and ner him he gan teo, he weop and criede and wrong is hondene : þat deol it was to seo. ¶ "Leoue fader," þe sone seide : "ne weop þou nou&yogh;t to bliue, For ich nam to bi-weope nou&yogh;t : &yogh;eot ich am a-liue. Me nas neuere on eorþe so wel : ase me hath sethþe i-beo; Ich am ase þei ich were in heouene : þei ich hanguy here on þis treo. For seint Ieme me halt up : and Ioye i-nov&yogh; me dieth make. Me of-þuncheth þat þou so sone come : laste þov me a-doun take." Louerd, þe Ioye þat þe fader : hadde þulke stounde, Þo he aftur al is sor : his sone a-liue founde! ¶ To toune he orn with Ioye i-nou&yogh; : and cleopede folk wel faste. Muche folk him siwede and al þe soþe : i-sei&yogh;en atþe laste. Withþ gret Ioye huy nomen him a-doun : and to þe toune him brou&yogh;ten. Þene traitur þat him maude an-hongue : wel sone out huy sou&yogh;ten And an-henguen him wel hei&yogh;e a-non : and nou&yogh;t bote he wuyrþe were. Þus seint Ieme þe holie man : is pilegrim halp þere.— ¶ In þe Cite of leouns : a &yogh;oung man þare was al-so Þat ofte wende to seint Iemes : and gret loue hadde þar-to. At one tyme ase he þudere wolde : he dude er ane folie Þat manie Men to helle bringueth : þe sunne of lecherie; Toward seint Iemes he wende forthþ : are he i-schriue were. Þe deuel was wel &yogh;eorne a-boute : &yogh;if he mi&yogh;hte him mis-lere. ¶ A-&yogh;ein him he cam in þe wei : swiþe milde and softe, Ri&yogh;ht ase it seint Ieme were : ase þe schrewe gyleth men wel ofte. "&YOGH;wost þou euere," he seide, "ho ich am?" : þe &yogh;oungue man seide nay. "Icham þilke," he seide, "þat þov hast : I-serued wel mani a day, Seint Ieme to-ward &yogh;wam þou art. : I ne may make no mone Of þe þat þov wel ne dest : of eche þingue bote of one : Þat þou dust MS. de&dotb; u st; dust=dudest lecherie : are þou wendest to me; Among alle men, &yogh;if þat nere : mest ich preisie þe." ¶ "Seint Ieme, merci," quath þis man : "ich crie þe milce and ore, For&yogh;if me þulke luþere sunne : i-nelle don as neuereft more." "Ov, beau frere," quath þe schrewe : "strong is þe mis-dede. Þov ne mi&yogh;ht me neuere paye wel : bote þov do ase ich rede : Þe menbre þov most keruen of : &yogh;ware-withþ þou i-sunegut hast; Þe sunne ichulle for-&yogh;iue þe þanne : &yogh;wanne he is fram þe i-cast; Ak next me þou scholdest in Ioye beo : in þe blisse of heouene a-boue, &YOGH;if þou woldest beon a martyr : and þi-seolf martri for mi loue." ¶ "A, louerd seint Ieme," quath þis man : "þov haue merci of me, Ichulle, mine sunnes to bete, mi-sulf martri : and forto pay&yogh;e þe." Þis wrechche Man carf of is membres : and a-wei fram him caste. And sethþe þoru&yogh; þe false þeues rede : him-self he a-slov&yogh; atþe laste. Ful redi was þe schrewe þer : þe soule he nam a-non And wel glad þare-with in his manere : to-ward helle he gan gon. Ne fur-&yogh;at nou&yogh;t seint Ieme is pilegrim : for þat cas þat him gan bi|tide : A-&yogh;ein þe deuel he cam a-doun : and bad þane schrewe a-bide, And seide, "þou berst more þane þin owe. : þat i schal kuyþe þe. &YOGH;wi hast þou mine pilegrim bi-traid? : gret schame þou dest me." "&YOGH;e, al for nau&yogh;t," quath þe schrewe : "þou art hidere i-come : In his sunne him-sulf he a-slou&yogh; : and þare-with ich him habbe i|nome. Ne may no man in dedlich sunne : in-to heuene wende. Ase wel þou mi&yogh;ht gon hom a-&yogh;ein : he is min with-outen enden." ¶ "Bel amy," quath seint Ieme : "þou bi-traidest him with fals|hede And with tricherie þou to him come. : lat him gon, ich rede!" "Ich habbe leue," quath þe schrewe : "to bi-gyli and bi-traye al-so Mid eche quointise þat ich mai. : &yogh;wi wolde he aftur me do?" Þis strif i-laste bi-twene hem longue. : ake þo seint Ieme ne mi&yogh;hte habbe þe soule ne with-inne him come : with no resun ne ri&yogh;hte, "Þou schalt," he seide, "come with me : to an herre Iustise, Þat þe schal cuyþe þi tricherie : of &yogh;wam þe schal a-grise." Bi-fore ore leuedi swete and milde : þane schrewe he gan lede; he &yogh;al and quakede deolfulliche : þo he i-sei&yogh; hire, for drede. ¶ "Þov luþere þing," ore leuedi seide : "&yogh;wi fondeste in alle wise To bi-nime us and bi-trai&yogh;e men : þat beth in ovre seruise? Þou ne schalt neuere þe soule brouke : for þine tricherie." "leoue leuedi," quath þe schrewe : "merci ich þe crie. Vnder-stond þat ich habbe leue : to bi-gylie men inou&yogh;, And þat ich fond him in dedlich sunne : and þare-inne him-sulf he slov; And no man neuere in swuch cas : to heuene come ne mi&yogh;hte. Ase he is min mid alle lawe : hold me, ich bidde, to ri&yogh;hte!" ¶ "Þov luþere best," ore leuedi seide : "to muche ower pouwer is. Alas þat men nellez beon i-war : are huy don a-mis! Ase þou mid þine tricherie : his lijf him bi-nome, Al-so ichulle him &yogh;iuen a-&yogh;ein : is lijf with ri&yogh;hte dome. So þat þe ne tit of him no part : for guod man he wo[l] &yogh;eot be." Ore leuedi made þe soule a-non : to þe bodi a&yogh;en fleo; Fram deþe to liue he a-ros : þoru&yogh; ore leuedi ore, And guod lijf ladde euere aftur-ward : and þe deuel doutede þe more. ¶ His menbres, þat he carf of : euer-eft he dude misse, Bote a luytel wise &yogh;ware-þoru&yogh; he mi&yogh;hte : &yogh;wane he wolde, pisse. Manie Men for þulke miracle : seint Ieme louieth þe more. Nou bidde we &yogh;eorne euerech-one : seint Ieme milse and ore, Þat he for þat holie stude : þat he hath in galiz, helpe us and alle is pilegrimes : and bringue us to heouene blis.

6.1: SEint Oswold þe holie king : of þe on ende of enguelonde King was, ase þulke tyme bi-feol : in northþ-homber-londe. Cristine man he was guod i-nov&yogh; : and with al is pouwer he heold up þe lawe of cristindom : and tei&yogh;te as feor and ner— For he was king are cristindom : puyrliche stable were. Al is men þar-to he brou&yogh;te : so wijsliche he gan heom lere. To þe princes he sende of scoth-lond : and bad þat huy him sende Ane wise clerk, is men to wissi : heore lijf forto amende. huy senden him ane holie man : þat icleoped was aydan, Þat wende and prechede al is lond : and tornede mani a man ¶ Þoru&yogh; is prechingue and seint Oswold : þat to alle guodnesse hem drov&yogh;, Cristindom into al þat lond : stable was i-nou&yogh;. Seint Oswold maude þesne holie man : Bischop in is londe, And made him al is conseiler : and herede godes sonde; he ne dude noþing with-outen him : ake with him he heold him faste, And to-gadere al heore lijf huy weren : and in heouene atþe laste. ¶ A day ase he sat and eat is mete : seint oswold þe holie man, And þis holie man bi him : þe Bischop guode aydan, Þat o seriaunt MS. seriannt seide þat þare withoute : manie pouere men were And beden sum guod for godes loue : and guod was þat men him r. hem bere. Þe king nam inov&yogh; of is mete : þat bi-fore him stod, And sende þar-of wel largeliche : heom þat beden him guod. Ane Dischs of seluer he nam also : þat bi-fore him was i-do, And to-brak it al to smale peces : and sende heom al-so. Þe Bischop sat and bi-heold : ase þei he were in þou&yogh;te, Bi þe hond þe king he nam : and a swete word out brou&yogh;te: "Ne for-rotie neuere þis hond : ake i-blessed be heo," he sede, "And euere hol and sound bi-leue : þat dude so guod a dede!" ¶ His bone was fole wel i-heord. : for it bi-feol atþe laste Þat heþene men come in-to is lond : and weorreden on him wel faste. he stod a-&yogh;ein with al is mi&yogh;hte. : so bi-feol þat huy come And i-metten heom with heore host : and þe batayle nome. At þe tounne of Maserfeld : huy smiten to-gadere faste, And seint Oswold þe holie Man : a-slawe was atþe laste ¶ And I-martred of þis luþere men : for ore louerdes loue. Al huy to-heowen is bodi : þo huy weren a-boue; Ake huy ne mi&yogh;hten for no þing : makie none wonde In noþer of is holie hond : ake smiten as of hole and sounde. And so huy beoth &yogh;eot, of ase fair heu&yogh; : ase huy euerer were, And i-holde for fair relike : ase men mowe i-seo þere. ¶ He was of ei&yogh;te and þritti &yogh;er : þo he i-martred was, [a. 642] And Nye &yogh;er he hadde king ibeo— : bote luytel &yogh;wile it nas. Nov seint Oswold þe swete Martyr : ore erinde to gode beode, Þat he us for-&yogh;iue ore sunnes : and us helpe at alle ore neode And ore soule for is swete loue : in-to blisse lede.

7.1: SEint Edward þe &yogh;ungue : was kyng of Enguelonde. Wel &yogh;oung he i-martred was : þoru&yogh; tricherie and onde. Þo is Moder þe guode Quene : ase god wolde, was ded, his fader nam an oþur wijf : þat luþur was and qued; Þat sent Edward louede luyte : and euere radde luþur red. Bi hure he hadde ane oþur sone : þat i-hote was Atheldred. ¶ Þe Quene louede hire owene [sone] om. : ase ech man deth is blod; Ake seint Edward heo louede luyte— : for stepmoder is selde guod. heo wilnede more þane ani-þing : þat seint Edward ded were, Þat hire owene sone aftur þe king : þe heritage bere. Þo þe king wende out of þis world : seint Edward, and r. as? is sone, Aftur him was king j-mad : ase lawe was and wone. ¶ Þe guodnesse of þis &yogh;oungue king : ne may no man telle. he was meoke and milde inou&yogh; : and fair of flechs and felle, De-bonere for-to speke with : ant with pouere men mest, Chaste, and wis of conseil : and pruyte he louede lest; Wylde Men ne louede he nou&yogh;t : þat rechelese weren of þou&yogh;te, And wise Men to him he drou&yogh; : and aftur heom he wrou&yogh;te. Aftur þe Erchebischope of Caunterburij : seint Dunston þat was þo, Ech dede þat he wolde do : þe meste del scholde go. Glad was þe holie man of him : and al þat lond also, Of swuch a king þat heore louerd was : þat alle þing wolde wel do. Guod pais þare was in Enguelonde : and loue and muruþe i-nov&yogh;, Richesse and al oþur guod : elles it were &yogh;wov&yogh;— For &yogh;wanne þat heued hathþ godes grace : and loueth alle guode, Wonder it were bote alle his : þe betere heom onder-stode. ¶ To þe guodnesse of þis holie Man : þe deuel hadde envie, And is stepmoder þe luþere Quene : þat ful was of tricherie; For heo þou&yogh;te Ni&yogh;ht and day : &yogh;if heo mi&yogh;hte in ani manere Þat seint Edward were a-slawe : and hire sone kyng were— For he was eldest aftur him : and þe kingues sone al-so. Þis luþere wumman narewe hire bi-þou&yogh;te : hou þis mi&yogh;hte beo do. To some þat weren hire conseilers : hire luþere þou&yogh;t he = heo seide, þat huy holpen with some Gyle : to don þat luþere dede; Þis luþere MS. þuþere Men also forthþ with hire : weren in grete þou&yogh;te With &yogh;wuche gyle huy mi&yogh;hten do : þat huy to ende [it] brou&yogh;te. ¶ So þat heo hadde to hire conseil : I-nowe atþenende. For fellere þing nis non ase wumman : &yogh;ware heo wole to vuele wende. Nadde þis &yogh;ungue king i-beo : in is kynedom vnneþe Bote þreo &yogh;er and Ey&yogh;hte dawes : þat he nas i-brou&yogh;t to deþe. For a day he wente on hontethþ : with is kni&yogh;htes bi cas In a fayr wode in deorsete : þat bi-side waraygne was. Fair wode þare was þulke tyme : ake nouþe heo is al a-doune, Bote þornes and þunne boskes : þat stondeth bi-sides þe toune. ¶ Ase þis &yogh;oungue king wende on hontethþ : a gret wille him cam to For-te seo is &yogh;oungue MS. &yogh;onngue broþur : and in eche manere he wolde it do. For he was þere a luyte bi-side : ase is stepmoder was In a toun þat men clepeden Corf : þat bote þreo Mile þanne it nas. A strong castel þare is nouþe : ake þe &yogh;uyt nas non þere. Þis holie man þou&yogh;te longue : are he at is broþur were; Ane fewe men with him he nam : and þuderward he gan ride. his Men pleiden and Arnden bi þe weie : and spradden a-boute ful wide, So þat with heom r. him ne bi-lefde non : al one he was sone; Ake naþeles forth he wende is wei : ase he þou&yogh;te to done. Þe court he bi-heold a-fer : þare ase is broþer was: Þudere he wende wel mildeliche : ake no man with him nas— he ne þou&yogh;te to no man bote guod : ne no man he nadde mis-do. To-war[d] is deþe forthþ he wende : and mildeliche al-so. Þo is stepmoder þe luþere Quiene : al one i-sei&yogh; him come, heo þou&yogh;te to don hire wille of him : ase heo hadde hire red i-nome. Þe luþere Men heo cleopede sone : þat weren at hire rede, And bi-speken bi &yogh;wuche feolonie : to don þis luþere dede. ¶ þo þis holie Man was nei&yogh; i-come : þe Quiene a-&yogh;ein him eode With fair Meyne and gret honour : and gret loue gan him beode— þe feste þat heo with him made : no tongue telle ne may— And swor þat he scholde a-li&yogh;te : and with hire bi-leue alday. "Nai certes, dame," seide þis king : "so ne may it nou&yogh;t beo. Ake lat me speke with mi broþur : for me longueth him to seo. For er þane ich him habbe i-sei&yogh;e : Ine worþe nou&yogh;t bliþe, i-wis, Min heorte is so muche opon him : and no wonder it nis." ¶ "A, sire," quath þe luþere Quiene : "&yogh;wane it ne mot oþur beo, Furst ichulle to þe drinke : and þu schalt him sethþe i-seo." I-redi was þe Botiler : and brou&yogh;te him drinke a-non. Among þe oþere þat þare weren : o schrewe þare cam gon And wel-comede him with fair semblaunt : and made him Ioye i-nov&yogh; And custe him Iudases cos : and sone him þere a-slov&yogh; : For ase he stoupede and custe him : redi he was i-nov&yogh;, Þoru&yogh; is wombe he smot a knijf : and is gottes al-to-drov&yogh; Þis holie Man sat upri&yogh;ht : and bi-heold is deþes wounde. he ne rod bote wel luyte wei : are he feol to grounde And liet þere is swete lijf— : is soule to heouene wende. Alas, luytel vuel þou&yogh;te he : þo þe schrewe is wombe rende! Ake he was luþur ase Iudas : þat so feolliche him custe And with tricherie is wombe rende : are he it euere wuste! Þo þis holie Man i-martred was : huy þat him brou&yogh;ten þer-to Bi-þou&yogh;ten hou huy mi&yogh;hten best : with þis holie bodie do : In-to a dierne stude huy wenden : and þar-inne is bodi huy caste Wel filliche and stilleliche : and bureden it þare wel faste. ¶ þo þis holie Man i-martred was : þe Quiene hadde hire wille; For li&yogh;htliche Men holdeth euere with þe quike : and þe dede is sone stille. Men nomen þo þat child Aþeldred : þat was þe Quiene sone, And aftur is broþur mauden him king : as ri&yogh;ht was and wone. ¶ Þe hei&yogh;e men alle of þe lond : with him heolden echon Ase with heore prince and heore louerd : and þene dede for-&yogh;ete a-non. Ake among lowe Men and simple : deol þere was i-nou&yogh;, huy corseden alle with-oute god : þat heore louerd a-slou&yogh;. "Alas," huy seiden, "&yogh;wat schulle we nouþe? : ho schal for us beo? ho schal us nouþe fram weorre wite MS. us wite ? : &yogh;wodere schulle we nouþe fleo? ho schal nou pais in londe holde? : ore ioye is al i-do! Of weorre and wo we mouwen beo sikere : al wrechhede comethþ us to." ¶ Grete wille hadden þe guode Men : of þe contreie bi-side In sum fair place þat bodi legge : and sou&yogh;ten it wel wide; huy ortreuweden wel þat it were : in sum foul stude i-do, huy sou&yogh;ten it ofte wide a-boute : and ne couþen nou&yogh;t come þer-to. On a time ase þis guode men : of wareygne þare bi-side In þe contreye wenden and sou&yogh;ten : þis holie bodi ful wide, huy stoden and bi-heolden MS. bi-heoldem heom bi-side : þo isei&yogh;en huy gret li&yogh;ht And cler with-alle a-boute one place : ase apiler stonde upri&yogh;ht. ¶ Huy þou&yogh;ten þat þere was godes grace. : þudere huy wenden and sou&yogh;te, And founden þere þis holie bodi : and up of þe eorþe it brou&yogh;ten. Þare was wop and sor i-nov : þo huy sei&yogh;en is grisli wounde! Ake &yogh;eot was heore heorte glad : and Ioyful, þo huy him founde. With wel fair procession : þis bodi forth huy bere In-to þe toun of warayne : and faire it bureden þere; In a churche-&yogh;erd of ore leuedi : bi este þe churche a luyte, Þare huy bureden þat swete bodi : with gret honur and pruyte. A chapele þare is arerd : ase þat holie bodi lai In þe toun of warygne : þat stant &yogh;eot to þis dai. Þe put þare he was feorst i-founde : a welle þare gan springue, Fair and cler, þat &yogh;eot i-last : and is ofte gret botningue, Þat Men cleopieth &yogh;eot to þis day : "seint Edwardes welle;" þare Mani Miracle hath i-beo : ase þe contreie dethþ telle. ¶ Þat holie bodi lay guode &yogh;wyle : þare it was i-do, In þe toune of waraygne : and Mani man cam þar-to. Þe tiþingue hov he i-martred was : sone sprong wel wide, And þe Miracles þat for him comen : a-boute in eche side. An hei&yogh; Eorl þare was a-londe þo : þat i-hoten was Alfez, Þat seint Edward louede muche : þe &yogh;wyle he liuede her : Þo he heorde of þe Miracles telle : þat ore louerd for him wrou&yogh;te, Glad and bliþe he was i-nou&yogh; : ase ech Man wel ou&yogh;te; him þou&yogh;te it was wel vuele i-do : þat he lai so lowe þere, Þat he nere i-bured in herre stude : ase he wel wuyrþe were; Gret deol he hadde in is herte : þat he was a-morþred so, And swuch a creature ase he was : in so lowe stude i-do. In deorsete he wende wide a-boute : to þe hei&yogh;e men alle þere, To Bischopes and to Abbodes al-so : þat in Enguelonde were, And bad heom of þulke holie bodi : þat huy it þannes bere To herre stude ase it was wuyrþe : and þat huy þare-a-&yogh;ein nere. his Messagers he sende a-boute : for þis þing wel wide, And to þe Abbesse of wiltone : þat i-hote was wilfride, And to Eadithþe þe holie wumman : þat Nonne al-so was þar, orig. þer Þat was seint Edwardes suster : and þe kingus dou&yogh;ter Edgar. So þat Bischopus and Abbodes : and hei&yogh;e Men mani on To-gadere comen in a time : ase huy bi-speken echon. ¶ To þis holi bodi huy wenden. : and þo huy þer-to come, hol and sound huy founden it ligge : þo huy þat bodi up nome, Al-so hol it was with-oute weomme : ase it euer er a-liue was— Þare nas nou&yogh;t on þat it i-sei&yogh; : þat glad and Ioyful þere-fore nas. Ake Eadithþe, is holie suster : to þat bodi orn a-non And bi-clupte þat bodi and custe it faste : bi-fore heom euerechon; For gladnesse heo lov&yogh; and weop : teres wel mani on, Þo heo sai&yogh; hire broþur so a-slawe : and so sovnd of flechs and bon— ho-so nadde neuere deol i-sei&yogh;e : of hire he mi&yogh;hte þere. Þis hei&yogh;e men with gret honur : þat holie bodi forth bere, With gret song and procession. : muche folk þuder-ward drov&yogh;. Ore louerd dude þare for is loue : fair Miracle i-nov&yogh;. ¶ For tweie crupeles þat in heore limes : al fur-crokede were, Mid gret hope leien in þe wey : and a-biden þe bere : hore limes bi-gunne to rechchen a-ri&yogh;ht : and hole bi-comen a-non; Þare was Ioye and blisse i-nou&yogh; : a-mong þis men ech-on. ¶ His stepmoder, þat him þare-to brou&yogh;te : herof herde telle : hire of-þou&yogh;te, þo he swuch man was : þat he = heo him let so quelle. Ope hire palefrey heo werth a day : aftur þat bodi to wiende, To bidde for-&yogh;iuenesse of hire misdede : &yogh;if god hire wolde siende. ¶ Ase heo wolde þuder-ward wiende : and with hire mani on, huy ne mi&yogh;hten make hire palefrey : þat it ane fote wolde gon; huy schouen it faste forthþe-ward and drowen : and neuere þe betere it nas. Þe Quiene þou&yogh;te on hire misdede : þat al þare-fore it was : heo a-li&yogh;hte of hire palefrey : and wolde a-fote gon To-ward þat holie cors. : ake heo nadde power non; A-&yogh;ein-ward heo mi&yogh;hte wel gon : ake forthþe-ward for no-þing. Heo bi-lefte, þo it was non oþur : in gret deol and mournyng. Of hire misdedes heo repentede hire sore : ase manie Men habbeth i-sed, And cam to guod mendement : are þat heo were ded. ¶ Þis Men ladden þis holie bodi : with gret honur and pruyte To þe Abbeye of Schaftesburi : þare ase he lijth &yogh;uyte A-mong blake Nonnene þat þare beoth : and al-so þare weren þo, Þat fram þe toun of waraygne : is twenti Mile and mo; In þe northha[l]f of þe hei&yogh;e Autere : in þe walle bi-side huy leiden þis holie bodi : þat manie men sechez wide. In-to þulke Abbeie of Schafteburij : seint Edward huy ladde, For þe kyng Alfred, is graunt-sire : þat hous a-rerd hadde And made þar-inne is dou&yogh;ter Nonne : þat was i-hote al&yogh;yue— For hire loue he hadde þat hous arerd : and muche guod þudere in i-&yogh;iue : An hondret hidenene r. hidene of guod lond : with hire he &yogh;af þer Þat hous, al-so freo in eche point : ase he him-sulf it heold er. In þis Abbeie seint edward : lai on and twenti &yogh;er, So þat huy i-seien tokningue ofte : þat he nolde nonmore beo þer. For &yogh;wane men comen ofte to is toumbe : ase li&yogh;thliche up huy as bere And heuen as up and doun ase huy wolden : ase þei it li&yogh;ht treov were. ¶ Seint Edward cam al-so ani&yogh;ht : ase in a visioun To an holi man þat þere was nei&yogh; : in an oþur religion; "Go," he seide, "to Schafteburi : to þe Abbesse of þe house, Dame Aldred þat clene Maide : þat is godes spouse, And seie hire þat i-nelle nonmore : ligge þare ich nou do; Þat ich beo i-brou&yogh;t in an oþur stude : and þat heo segge mi broþer so." ¶ Þis guode Man a-morewe a-ros : and ne fur-&yogh;at nou&yogh;t þis cas : To þe Abbesse he wende of Schafteburi : and tolde al hou it was. Þis guode womman was glad i-nou&yogh;! : to þe kyngue heo wende sone And of is broþur tolde him al : and &yogh;wat þer-of were to done. Welle, þe kyng was one glad : þo he i-heorde telle So swete tiþingue of is broþur : þei is moder him liete a-quelle! ¶ He wolde habbe i-went to schafteburi : In shrine him to bringue, Ac he was so bi-set mid weorre : þat he ne mi&yogh;hte for no þingue : For is fon ornen so faste him up-on : þat he ne mi&yogh;hte þannes wiende. To heie Men a-boute in þe londe : wel sone he gan siende, And to wilfin þe guode bischop : þat was bischop þo, Þat huy scholden with gret honour : to schafteburie go And his broþur in schrine bringue : ase ri&yogh;th was forto done. ¶ Þe Bischop with þis oþur Men : to schafteburi comen sone. With swiþe fair procession : to is toumbe huy wende. A swiþe fair Miracle a-mong heom alle : ore louerd for him þere sende : For a-non so huy openeden þat lid : of is swete toumbe þere, Þare cam a-doun þoru&yogh; al þe churche : ase þei it a mist were, A-mong al þe prece þat þere was : þat huy i-seien alle with ei&yogh;e, Fleu&yogh; al. flen a-mon[g] heom al-so a myst— : so swote þing neuere huy er ne sei&yogh;e. ¶ So swote was þe smul and guod : þat alle þat þere were For muruþe þou&yogh;ten þat huy stoden : in parays and nou&yogh;t þere. Þis holi bodi up huy nomen : with gret honour and pruyte, And leiden it in a wel fair schrine : þare ase it lijth &yogh;uyte. In þis manere he was i-schrined : in þe on an twentiþe &yogh;ere Þat þe hei&yogh;e men him brou&yogh;ten fro waram : and bureden him furst þere; A þousend &yogh;er it was and on : after þulke stounde Þat ore louerd was on eorþe i-bore : and a-li&yogh;hte for us to grounde. ¶ His broþur, þe king Aþeldred : guod man was i-nou&yogh;; Edward was is sone i-hote : þat to alle guodnesse drou&yogh;, Þat king was sethþe aftur him : and hei&yogh; halewe in heouene is, I-cleoped seint Edward aftur is vncle : at West-Munstre he lijth, i-wis. ¶ Op-on Mi&yogh;hel-masse fourtene-ny&yogh;ht : his day fallez in þe &yogh;ere, And a-midde þe Monþe of luyde 18 March : seint Edwardes dai þere. = þe ere Nov god for þe loue of heom boþe : þet swete kingues were, To þe Ioye of heouene þat huy beoth inne : with heom us bringue þere.

8.0: 18 Franceys. This life is based on the Vita s. Fr. by S. Bonaventura, in Act. SS. Boll. Oct. 4, p. 742 ff.
8.1: SEint Fraunceys, þe frere Menour : þat guod man was i-nov&yogh;, Marchaunt he was in his &yogh;onghede : and to eche treuwenesse drov&yogh;. his Marchaundise he maude a al. al day : in þe cite of Asise; And in almesdede he spendede an om. an on pouere Men : muchedel is Marchaundise; For no loue of catel : he it nolde bi-leue, &YOGH;wane ani pouere man him bede : bote he him som-&yogh;wat &yogh;eue. ¶ Ase he cam a day bi þe wei : he gan mieten bi cas Ane kni&yogh;t þat hadde Riche i-beo : and MS. and and swiþe a-pouered was; vuele he was i-cloþed al-so : and bad him sum guod. Seint Fraunceys hadde reuþe of him : and one &yogh;wyle he with-stod, ¶ he strepte of is cloþes of is rug : and &yogh;af þis pouere kny&yogh;t. And þer-aftur ase he lay a-slepe : in is bedde a-ny&yogh;t, A swiþe noble paleys : him þou&yogh;te þat he i-sei&yogh;; he Axede was þat paleys were : þat so riche was and hei&yogh;; Men seiden him þat it was his : and is kni&yogh;tes al-so. Þo þis holie Man a-wok : sum-&yogh;wat he þou&yogh;te do. In þat paleys him þou&yogh;te he sai&yogh; al-so : kny&yogh;htes Armes þere, And with afair creoiz þoru&yogh;-out : I-markede alle huy were. ¶ Þou&yogh;te he, "ore louerd it wole : þat ich mi-seolf kny&yogh;t beo, And swyþe feble ich am þare-to : bote ich me bet bi-seo." An Eorl þare was in poile = Apoile : þat was corteys and hende : he þou&yogh;te kny&yogh;t beo i-maud of him : þuder-ward he gan wende. Ase he wende towar[d] þis Eorl : for-to beo i-maud kni&yogh;t, Ore swete louerd in Auision : to him cam a ni&yogh;th; "Sei&yogh;e me," he seide, "of þe louerd : and of þe hyne al-so, And of þe riche man and of þe pouere : &yogh;wuch may þe mest guod do?" "Bote þe louerd," quath þis oþur : "and he þat is riche." "Þou haddest almest i-chose," ore louerd seide : "þat ful oni-liche : For truste of þe hyne : þene louerd þou for-soke; Þov nome vuele þin Avision : þou most þe bet bi-loke. ¶ Þe Armure and þe paleis : þat þou so noble i-sei&yogh;e, Elles-&yogh;ware þov schalt finde : Ake þou ne comest nou&yogh;t &yogh;uit so hei&yogh;e; Kny&yogh;tes þov schalt habbe onder þe : þulke Armes for-to lede. Þare-fore wend þe hom a-&yogh;ein : and bi-þench bet þi dede!" ¶ Þis holi man, þo he a-wok : a-&yogh;ein wende to Asise, And þou&yogh;te al on Ihesu crist : and bi-lefde is Marchaundise, And bad ore louerd ny&yogh;ht and dai : þat he scholde him rede And some tokningue senden him : hov he scholde is lijf lede. ¶ A day, ase þis holie man : with-oute Asise him drou&yogh;, he mette a lodlich Mesel : þat revlich was i-nou&yogh; And bad him sum guod for godes loue. : seint Fraunceys a-li&yogh;hte And bi-clupte and custe þane sike man : ase faire ase he mi&yogh;hte, And of is seluer him tok : and bad him habbe guod day. Þo nuste he &yogh;ware he was bi-come : ne in none stude him ne say. ¶ Þo þou&yogh;te wel ho it was : and aftur þulke dede he wep and cride on ihesu crist : þat he scholde him sum-&yogh;wat rede; And ofte he wolde bi costome : to Meseles fare And sechen heom at heore owene hous : bote he founde hem elles|&yogh;ware, And cusse heore hondene and heore fet : and heore Mouth al-s[o] And &yogh;yue heom guod wel largeliche— : bi costome he wolde it do. a later hand adds als ¶ Bi a churche of seint Damian : a day he cam gon, Þat ope þe poynte was to falle a-doun. : In he wende a-non And kneolede a-doun bi-fore þe croiz : ase he dude wel ofte. Þo spac a voiz þare-inne : wel Mildeliche and softe And seide, "Fraunceys, go þe forth : and a-rer up min hous an hei&yogh;, Þat, þou sixt, fallez to grounde : and al destruyd is nei&yogh;." ¶ Seint Fraunceys, for þe churche was : a-done-ward al i-brou&yogh;t, Wende þat ore louer[d] þare-bi seide— : ake þar-of nas it nou&yogh;t: he wende and solde is cloþes a-non : and muche of is oþur þingue, And þe panes þat he nam þare-with : to þis church gan bringue. Þe pr[e]ost of þe churche he fond þere : þe panes he wolde him take, To arere up þe pouere churche. : and he heom gan for-sake; he ne dorste nou&yogh;t for is fader : ne for is oþur freond, he seide, So muche tresor nime of him : bote it were bi heore rede. ¶ Seint Fraunceys nam þat tresor : þo þe oþur it for-sok, And in a fenestre leide it þere : and in ore louerdes warde it tok. Þo þe tyþingue cam to is fader : þat he hadde i-sold is guod, Toward him he wende anon : and for wrath was nei&yogh; wod. Seint Frau[n]ceys was i-war of him : and ne bi-lefte nou&yogh;t bi-hinde, he wende and hudde him in a Dich : þat he ne mi&yogh;hte him nou&yogh;t finde. In þis Diche wel longue he lay : in hunguer and wrech-hede, And euere cride on Ihesu crist : þat he scholde him betere rede. ¶ So longue he was þare in meseise : þat he for-ferde nei&yogh;, Þat vnneþe him couþe i-knowe : ani man þat him sei&yogh;. Atþe laste in meseise i-nov&yogh; : he wende to Asise. Þat folk, þo huy seien him com[e] : heom gan ful sore a-grise And seiden "here cometh a wod Man" : huy harleden him wel faste And smiten and pulten here and þere : and dunge on him caste. Seint Fraunceis wende euere forth : ase þei him no-þing nere. ¶ his fader cam al-so bi cas : and i-mette him þere: he ladde him hom to is hous : and beot him sore i-nov&yogh;, And bad him bringue hom þat catel : þat he er a-wei drov&yogh;. Þo he ne mi&yogh;hte habbe non oþur word : he bond him swiþe strongue; So þat þis guode man : in prisone lay ful longue. Atþe laste, þe &yogh;wyle is fader : out of toune gan i-wende, his Moder hadde reovþe of him : and brou&yogh;te him out of bende. Þo he was out of bendes i-brou&yogh;t : he ne bi-lefte no leng þer, he wende to þe Dich a&yogh;ein : fro &yogh;wannes he cam er. ¶ Þo þis housebonde cam hom : and ne founde him nou&yogh;t þere, Swiþe sore he beot is wijf : and axede &yogh;ware he were. To þe churche of seint Damian : þe housebonde wende þo, And fond þat tresor al-hol þere : ase he it hadde i-do. And sethþe he wende to þe Dich : and founde is sone þere. he axede at him for &yogh;wat þingue : þat tresor a-wei he bere; And þo he i-sei&yogh; al þen ende : þat he luyte þar-of rou&yogh;te, he ladde Fraunceys forth with him : ant bi-fore þe Bischop him brou&yogh;te, And bad, &yogh;if he alles wolde : þe worldes guod bi-leue, Þat he bi-fore þe Bischope þer : þat tresor up &yogh;eue. ¶ Seint Fraunceis with þulke worde : glad and Ioyful stod: Þare and bi-fore god he &yogh;af up : al his eorþelich guod, And streopte of is cloþes : a-non to is bare liche And bi-fore þe Bischope tok is fader : and bad him beo guod and riche; he seide, "ich þe habbe fader i-cleoped : euere to þis day, And nouþe it is so feor i-come : þat non more i-ne may; Segge ich mot mi .pater-noster : heonne-forthþe-ward i-wis And to mi fader holde me : þat in heuene is." Nakede he wende fram is fader : bi-fore heom þare echon; Worldes guod aftur þulke tyme : ne bod he neuereft non. ¶ A seli vplondischse Man : þat nakede sai&yogh; him go, Gret deol in is heorte hadde : for is chele and for is wo: he &yogh;af him ane olde Mantel : his bones þare-with to hele; Seint Fraunceis it vnder-feng : to witien him fram chele, his licame he heolede þare-with : and in myseise i-nov&yogh; A-&yogh;en þare he was i-bore : to Asise he him drov&yogh;. ¶ Ase he hadde er i-beo so riche : and so wel was i-knowe, A beggare he cam a[n]d bad is mete : þere-aftur in a þrowe, Fram dore to dore he bad is mete : and wonede him þar-to; Some weren wroþe for is dedes : and no guod nolden him do. Of þe ordre of frere Menours : he ne made no-þing &yogh;uyte; he bi-gan in pouerte i-nov&yogh; : and with luyte pruyte. ¶ Men of þe contreie weren : a-boute for-to a-mende Seint Damianes churche : þat al a-done-ward wende, Þare ase seint Fraunceys hadde i-beo : and tresor bi-left þere. Þo he ne mi&yogh;hte non oþur do : þe churche for-to a-rere, he wende þudere and sore swonk : and bar morter þar-to, And sethþe he eode and bad is mete : &yogh;wane he hadde al i-do. ¶ Ane churche sethþe of seint peter : men arerden elles-&yogh;[w]are: Þis holie man in is miseise : wel sone he was þare And Morter and ston drou&yogh; þer-to : and sore swonk al-so, And sethþe eode and bad is mete : þo he hadde al i-do. &YOGH;wane he heorde of ani churche : þat ou&yogh;wer was for-ta-rere, he wende þudere, and longue him þou&yogh;te : are he were þere. ¶ To seinte Marie in desert : ate laste he wende wel stille And criede on ore louerd ni&yogh;ht and day : þat he dude bi him is wille And þat he &yogh;eue him is grace þere : in &yogh;wat manere he best mi&yogh;hte his churche þat a-doneward was : best a-rere up and di&yogh;hte. So þat god him &yogh;af þe grace : þat he þare bi-gan Þe ordre of frere Menours : to saui mani a man. ¶ In þe bi-guynningue of þis ordre : ase ore louerd &yogh;ef þat cas, Ane masse he i-heorde a day : þat of þe Apostles was; As man rat &yogh;uyt a-mong us : in þe godspelle it seide þo Þat ore louerd hiet is desciples : þo huy scholden a-boute go, Þat huy ne beren with heom gol[d] ne seluer : &yogh;wane huy wenden ouer lond, Ne baggue, ne tweie curtles noþur : ne schon, goinde with ouer lond Ashm. ne staf in hor hond — ¶ In þis manere ore louerd hiet : his Apostles gon. Þo seint Fraunceis i-heorde þis : he dude of is schon, And poruei&yogh;ede þat frere Menours : barefot scholden gon, With-oute bagge, with-oute staf : with-oute ani þing to spene— Bote ech frere Menour do al-so : he ne halt nou&yogh;t is ordre, ich wene. In stude of is gurdel al-so : with rope he him bond— In þis manere frere Menours : scholden go ouer lond. ¶ Seint Fraunceis bi-þou&yogh;te þus : to don þis holie dede And made þe ordre of frere Menours : al ase þe godspel sede. ¶ Bernard, þat was a guod scholer : formest to him cam And þe ordre of frere menours : of him formest he nam. he axede at him hov he scholde best : þe world clanliche for-sake. To seint Nicholas churche huy wenden : ane masse-bok huy gonne take. Þe bok was i-closed faste to : seint Fraunceis hine gan vndo, Al on-mundliche he on-dude þe bok : and þe furste þat he cam to Þat was a godspel þat seith : "&yogh;if þou wolt parfijt beo, Sul al þi guod and &yogh;if pouere men : and sethþe siwe me!" ¶ Al vn-Mundlingue he cam eft-sone : to a godspel þat seide : Þat man ne scholde seluer ne gold : bi þe weie lede. Þe þridde tyme al on-Mundlingue : þe masse-bok he wende : Þo cam he opon þis godspel : ase ore louerd him grace sende : "ho-so wole come after me : him-sulf he schal for-sake And is owene rode bere : and þene wei after me so take." ¶ "Þov i-fuxt here," quath seint Fraunceis : "hou ore louerd in a stounde Sent us grace ope &yogh;wuche þingue : we schullen þis ordre founde : Opon þeos þreo god-spelles, þov fuxt : þat we habbeth furst i-founde We schullen foundi al ore ordre : and opon þis strongue grounde." Opon þis MS. þis þis þreo godspelles he maude maudre is ordre : and is riule Ryvle on the margin. for|sothþ— And þe frere Menor brekez is ordre : þat þare-a&yogh;ein ou&yogh;t dothþ. ¶ Fre Gyles was þo þe ferste— : þat guod scoler hadde i-beo, Þat aftur frere Bernard þe ordre nam : and sethþe oþur þreo. So þat vnder heom alle sixe freres : to-gadere weren i-brou&yogh;t. And þei þis ordre were i-maud : i-confermed nas heo nou&yogh;t. ¶ Seint Fraunceys þe holie Man : þo god þe tyme sende, To confermi is ordre a-ri&yogh;ht : toward Rome he wende. Ake swiþe sore he was of-drad : laste þe pope were Contrarious a-&yogh;ein is Ordre : þat heo i-confermed nere. Ake forth he wende to fondi : he nolde nou&yogh;t beo bi-hynde; And euere he bad Ihesu crist : þat he moste som grace finde. ¶ Þo þou&yogh;te him in a wision : þat [he] i-sai&yogh; a gret treo, So hei&yogh; þat he was a-drad : toward þe coppe i-seo; And netheles on aunture he him dude : and nam þar-of a bov&yogh; Aboue in þe hexte stude : and toward him it drov&yogh; : hit bei&yogh; al a-doun to him : aftur is wille i-nov&yogh;, For al þat him dradde furst : þat it was hei&yogh; and tov&yogh;. ¶ Þo þis holie man a-wok : on þis sweuene he þou&yogh;te longue And þare-þoru&yogh; he hopede of þe pope : sum grace for-to afongue; For þe treo þat was so hei&yogh; : lij&yogh;thtliche to grounde drov&yogh;, Also he hopede þene hei&yogh;e pope : to is wille bringue i-nov&yogh;. To þe pope Innocent : þo he to Rome cam, he bad graunti is Religion : to amendi cristindam, A[n]t þat he scholde is ordre preouen : and is Revle al-so Þoru&yogh; þe godspel of godes word : and þer-aftur do. ¶ Þo þe pope is Revle isei&yogh; : þat heo was clene and guod, And ope þe godspelle i-founded al : ase he wel onder-stod, In is herte he grauntede it : ake nou&yogh;t with is Mouth a-non, For he moste is cardinales : conseili þare-uppe ech-on. ¶ So þat a-Mong þis Cardinales : counseil þere was i-nome. Some heolden þare-a&yogh;ein : and also þare-with some. Þo was þer a Cardinal : þat Bischop was al-so, Maister Iohan of seint poul : þat faste heold þer-to And seide, "&yogh;if we destourbieth him : a&yogh;ein þe godspelle we beothþ, &YOGH;wane he spechut al vpe godes word : ase we wel i-seothþ." ¶ In Avisioun to þe pope : a-ni&yogh;ht also it cam Þat he grauntede him is Reule : to saui cristindom. So þat þe pope grauntede him : al is Reule to do, And confermede þoru&yogh; al þe court : and bi-hiet him more þer-to. Þo wende forthþ þis holie Man : and is freres withþ him nam And prechede a-boute þe godspelles : to amendi cristindom. ¶ Þo þe contrei&yogh;e i-sei&yogh; heom ferst : gret speche was þere, Some seiden þat Aunte-crist : oþur is desciples it were; So þat in wel manie studes : luyte guod men heom sende And huy weren ofte ofhungrede sore : ase huy a-boute wende. So þat huy comen into a stude : and ofhungrede weren sore, Þat some of þe freres hadden i-þou&yogh;t : in þe ordre to beo non-more. Þo cam þere a wel fair man : and brou&yogh;te heom mete i-nov&yogh;— Sone huy nusten &yogh;ware he bi-cam : ne &yogh;woder-ward he drov&yogh;. Þis freres i-sei&yogh;en fule þo : þat an Aungel it was : Þe studefastore in heore ordre : huy weren for þis cas And bi-hieten god þat huy nolden neuere : for miseise ne for wo In þe ordre bi heore mi&yogh;hte : pouerte fur-go. ¶ Bi-side þe toun of Asise : feor fram eche strete huy wenden alle to one stude : þat was al fur-lete. Miseyse huy hadden þare i-nov&yogh; : and ofte wepen sore, For defaute of heore sustinaunce : and for defaute of bokes more. For huy ne hadde bokes none : &yogh;ware-on huy mi&yogh;hten loke, In þe croiz huy bi-heolden al day : in-stude of heore boke, And beden god MS. guod , &yogh;if it were is wille : þat he scholde heom sum guod teche, For huy nadden non oþur bok : ne nusten &yogh;ware-with any a-reche. ¶ To seinte Marie in desert : þannes huy gunne i-wiende, Ase huy bi-gunnen furst þe ordre : to bringue as þare to ende. Seint Fraunceis wende bi þe londe : and prechede a-boute þere. Men wenden, þo huy sei&yogh;en him furst : þat of an oþur worlde he were; For he capede euere upward : toward heouene an hei&yogh;, Þat men wondreden and speken þar-of : euer-ech þat him i-sei&yogh;. Manie heolden him a truant : of þe deueles lore And harleden him here and þer : and ofte beten him sore. Þis holie man ne tok none &yogh;eme : ake criede ore louerdes ore, And &yogh;ware men duden him mest schame : þudere he drov&yogh; þe more. ¶ Idel ne kepte he neuere beo : he ne louede no þin[g] so luyte Ne hatede so muche ase he dude Aise : and idelnesse and pruyte. "Frere Asse" he cleopede is owene flesch— : for &yogh;e wuten wel þat an Asse, Nabbe heo neuere so luyte mete : is trauail nis no þe lasse, For heo is i-harled here and þere : and to file weorke i-do, I-priked and i-scourget eke : and sackes heo berez al-so; Of &yogh;eomere þingue heo is i-fed : &yogh;wane heo alles comez þar-to, And selde heo is i-coureyd wel : with-ovte nail an scho. ¶ He seruede so is owene flesch : and cleopede it "frere Asse": Mete he &yogh;af him luyte i-nov : and to cloþingue wel lasse; he prikede also and scourgede ek : and þoru&yogh;-out þe contrei&yogh;e harlede it and deope wod : bare-fot in deope weye. &YOGH;wane he i-sai&yogh; ani idel Man : þat louede glotonie And ne trauailede nou&yogh;t for is mete : he cleopede him "frere flie": For þe flie ne doth non oþur guod : bote fleoth feor and neor And a-waytez &yogh;wane men goth to mete : oþur to heore soper; A-non so þe Disch is i-set a-doun : heo wole beo ope þe brerde— Of trauail ne wo ne kep[t]hþ heo nou&yogh;t : bote þat heo wel ferde; ¶ &YOGH;wane a Man hath al dai i-swounke : þei he it hadde i-swore, he ne schal to is Disch come so sone : þat þe flie nele beo bi-fore. ¶ Also farez manie idele Men : þat non oþer guod nelleth do, Bote &yogh;wanne oþur Men beth to-ward þe mete : &yogh;are huy beth þar-to; Atþe Dische huy wollez al-so sone beo : ase huy þat habbez i-swounke, And þanne is al heore weork i-do : habben huy i-&yogh;ete and i-dronke; Þanne gothþ huy ligge slepe : oþur gothþ to some folie. Þare-fore seint Fraunceys cleopede : swuche men "frere flie". ¶ Of noþing nas þis holie man : so glad ase of edwij&yogh;t: For &yogh;wane ani Man opbraid is pouerte : he was in gret deli&yogh;t; &YOGH;wane Men cleopeden him hoxtare : oþur cheorl oþur cheorles sone— For port-Men beoth ofte boistouse : and hoxtares bi wone— "leue broþer," he seide : "certes, þov seist sothþ, I-blessed beo þou for þat word : and alle þat so dothþ! Preses r. Perses (Ash. Peres) sone Bernard : it bi-comethþ bi ri&yogh;the lawe To heore telle of is ri&yogh;hte : ich auch&yogh;te beo glad and fawe." And &yogh;wane men preiseden ou&yogh;t of is cuynde : he nadde þare-of no deli&yogh;t. Þare-fore ho-so wolde him paye : segge him sum edwi&yogh;t; And bi-fore al folk a-brod : in is prechingue he seide his Miseise and is defaute : ofte and is wrechhede.— ¶ In poyle seint Fraunceis &yogh;eode : some time ouer lond, So þat a porsful of panes : bi þe weie he fond; he ne tok non more &yogh;eme þare-to : þane to so muche fen. his felawe bad him nimen heom up : and dele pouere men. "I nelle nou&yogh;t," seide seint Fraunceis : "of oþur mannes dele." "Me þunchez," seide is felawe þo : "þat þov nart nou&yogh;t fele, Þat þou ne louest nou&yogh;t pouere men : &yogh;wane þou nelt heom don no guod." Þis holie man i-heorde þis : and one &yogh;wile in þou&yogh;te stod; ¶ "Þou schalt," he seide, "sone i-seo : &yogh;[w]at þis panes beoth ech-on." he wende and nam up þat pors : and openede him a-non: Þo crep þare out a naddre : þe fouleste þat mi&yogh;hte gon, And þe pors al amti was : and peni bi-lefte non; And þat was þe Deuel of helle : þat in þe fourme of panes lay, For-to bi-traye þis holie man : &yogh;wane he þe panes i-sai&yogh;. ¶ Þis holie Man seint Fraunceis : among ech manere best Muche he louede &yogh;oungue lambre : and a-nourede heom euere mest, For ore louerd euenede him-sulf to a lomb : þoru&yogh; seint Iohan þe Baptist, And for it is with-oute felonie : and milde ase ihesu crist; And ofte &yogh;wane men wolden heom quelle : fram deþe he heom brou&yogh;te With biddingue and with is faire word : and fale siþes heom bou&yogh;te. ¶ In þe Abbeye of seint verecunde : a &yogh;oung lomb he founde, A souwe a-strangli it a-non : and fret it in a stounde. Seint Fraunceis stod and bi-heold : "A-mong alle bestes," he seide, "A-corsed þou beo, luþere souwe : þat dudest þis luþere dede; Þat þi lijf beo schort and strong : and þi dethþ beo strong al-so, And þat no þing ne ete of þi flesch : &yogh;wane þou ert of liue i-do!" Þo bi-gan þe souwe a-non : ase he þis word seide, To beo ful of schabbe and of buyles : and of oþur wrechhede, Þat heo orn out al of quiture : and ase þat folk i-sai&yogh;, In wrechhede and in sorewe inov : heo deide þane þridde day, And fur-rotede and stonk foule i-nov&yogh;. : no best þat it i-sei&yogh;, Rauon ne pie no oþur foul : nolde enes come þare-nei&yogh;. ¶ For seint Fraunceis louede lambre orig. lombre : ase al þat folk i-sai&yogh;, On of is freond for godes loue : a lomb him &yogh;ef a day&yogh;. Þis lomb wolde old and &yogh;oung : al dai nei&yogh; him beo And maken with him Ioye i-nou&yogh; : &yogh;wanne it him mi&yogh;hte i-seo. Seint Fraunceis hiet þis schep a day : &yogh;wanne it heorde freres singue, To churche gon at eche tide : and ne lete for none þingue. Þat schep aftur þulke time : selde wolde a-bide, &YOGH;wane hit i-heorde freres in þe queor : þat hit nas at eche tide; Blete it wolde a-&yogh;enes heom : for it ne couþe nou&yogh;t elles do; And &yogh;wane it sai&yogh; þe freres sitten a-kneo : kneuli it wolde al-so, And &yogh;wane ani preost sacrede : kneoli it wolde þar-to And wel inwardliche bi-holde þudere : ase it sai&yogh; oþur freres do. Wel au&yogh;te we onouri þe sacringue : &yogh;wane a swuch best wolde! A wonder bede-man it was : to come to godes A later hand adds: seruice so bolde! ¶ Ase seint Fraunceis þis holie man : ouer lond ofte him drou&yogh;, Wilde foules, smale and grete : honoureden him i-nov&yogh;. For ase he wende in atyme : to prechie ouer lond, An hep of foules grete i-nov&yogh; : In a stude he fond; huy songuen and maden noyse i-nov : euerech in is wise; Þe &yogh;uyt þe holie man a-mong heom cam : huy nolden nou&yogh;t enes arise. ¶ "Beu frere," quath þis holie Man : "ore sustren þat beoth here honourieth god þat heom made : ech in his manere; Ri&yogh;ht is þat we don also : are we fram heom gon." huy gonne to segge heore tidene : among þis foules ech-on. Þo maden þis foules so gret noise : þat huy ne mi&yogh;hten noþing i-here. "Sostrene," quath þis holie Man : "chaungiez eouwer manere, Beothþ nouþe stille and latehþ me segge : mine tidene with mi frere, And sethþe &yogh;e mouwen aftur us : euer-ech with is fere." ¶ Þis foules a-non-ri&yogh;ht to is heste : stille weren al-so And seten and heorden heore tidene : for-to huy hadden al ido. "Nou sustren," quath þis holie man : "we habbuthþ i-seid ore tide, Bi-guynnez ouwer &yogh;wane &yogh;e wollez : &yogh;e ne þoruen no leng abide." Þis foules bi-gonne singue anon : þe leste and eke þe meste— Swiþe gret pouwer he hadde of god : þat foules weren at is heste! ¶ Þis holie man wende him forth : to prechi ouer lond: A gret hep eft-sone of foules : in on oþur stude he fond. he wende forthþ a-mong heom. : þis foules bi-gonne echon Louten to him wel mildeliche : and honouri him a-non. Þis holie Man at-stod ane &yogh;wile : and þou&yogh;te heom sum guod teche, And ri&yogh;ht ase it weren men of witte : þis foules he gan to preche: ¶ "Leoue sostrene," he seide, "for godes loue : honouriethþ ore creatur, For a-mong alle liues : &yogh;e au&yogh;ten him don honour: For he &yogh;ifht eov nobleie i-nou&yogh; : wynguene for-to fleo, And feþerene to beren eov up-on hei&yogh; : wide for-to seo, And mete &yogh;ware &yogh;e wollez a-li&yogh;hte : with-oute eche-manere suynche, he &yogh;ifth eov also muche pruyte and ayse : ase &yogh;e mouwen onne þenche; Delue ne diki ne þorue &yogh;e naþur : ase manie Men moten do, And &yogh;eot &yogh;e mouwen habbe mete i-nov&yogh; : &yogh;wane oþere nabbeth nou&yogh;t so." ¶ Þis foules heorkeneden him wel stille : þe &yogh;wile is prechingue i-laste, And fram wodes and fram oþur studes : þuder-word drowen faste. Þo þis holie man hadde i-do : he wende forth a-non And bi-tei&yogh;te heom ihesu crist : and blessede heom ech-on; he pleide with heom murie i-nou&yogh; : ase he among heom gan gon, These vv. are out of order. And strokede heom with is longue fleue. : þere nolde a-rise nou&yogh;t on, Are he wolde bidden heom wende forth : &yogh;ware huy hadden to done. Þis foules, þo huy heorden þis : huy flouwen forth wel sone. ¶ Seint Fraunceis a-mong al oþur þingue : ri&yogh;ht at is heorte grounde Ofte he þou&yogh;te deope i-nov&yogh; : of ore louerdes wounden; So studefast-liche in is þou&yogh;t : non oþur þing he ne nam. hit bi-feol at þe holie rode-tid : þat a-&yogh;ein Mi&yogh;hel-Masse cam, Opon þe hul of Auuerne : ase it was ore louerdes wille, Al one in is oresones : þere he lai wel stille, he þou&yogh;te on ore louerdes woundene : so deope þat it nas non ende: An Aungel he i-sai&yogh; an hei&yogh; : ri&yogh;ht fram heouene wiende, ¶ Six wingene him þou&yogh;te he hadde : þat schinden bri&yogh;hte and wide, Þe tweie stoden up a-bouen is heued : and þe tweien bi is side, And þoru&yogh;-out ouer is wombe a-creoyz : tweien þere weren al-so, Ase men seothþ ofte in churche depeint : ho-so lokethþ þare-to; Þe Armes weren a-long i-sprad : ase huy weren on þe rode, And þe fet i-streitht a-long : al vrninde a-blode, Þoru&yogh; þe ri&yogh;ht side he was i-smite : and þoru&yogh; fet and honde: hit was in fourme of an Aungel : ore louerd, ich onder-stonde. ¶ So gret Ioye hadde þis holie Man : of þis noble si&yogh;hte Þat him þou&yogh;te he was in an oþur world : and þonkede godes mi&yogh;hte; he nuste &yogh;wat for Ioye do : þe &yogh;wyle he þis fourme i-sei&yogh;h. At þe laste he fleu&yogh; a-&yogh;ein : in-to heouene an hei&yogh;h. Seint Fraunceis was in Ioye i-nou&yogh; : for he hadde þat noble si&yogh;th, And nameliche of ore louerdes wounden : þat he wilnede dai&yogh; and ny&yogh;ht. Þo bi-heold he is owene hondene : and is fiet al-so: Þo weren huy þoru&yogh;-out i-smite : and þe nailes þar-on i-do, And is ri&yogh;ht side i-wounded al-so— : ake wel sore neren huy nou&yogh;t; So þat he hadde þe woundene him-sulf : þat so muche weren in is þou&yogh;t. ¶ Þe nailes weren blake i-nou&yogh; : þe hauedene rounde and grete, Þe poyntes weren euelongue : ase huy weren a-&yogh;ei[n]ward-i-bete; Aboute þe nailes þat flesch stod up : ase it were al-to-swolle And ase it al a-boute were : for Anguyse to-bolle. In þis manere we mouwen beo sikere : þat ore louerdes woundene were— For bote ase a schewingue and Ansaumple : in seint Fraunceyse huy nere. So þat þis holie man hadde : ore louerdes woundene fiue; And bi-lefden on him aftur-ward : þe &yogh;wile he was a-liue. At þe holie rode-tid in Septembre : he gan furst þis þing i-seo; Ac ope þe hulle he hadde er : nei&yogh; a monþe i-beo, And fourtene ni&yogh;t þare-aftur-ward : he bi-lefte &yogh;uyt þere; So þat euene vnder al : fourti dawes þere were. ¶ Ase Moyses opon synay : was bi olde dawe Fourti dai&yogh;es in priuete : to seon þe olde lawe, Also was þis holie Man : fourti dawes ri&yogh;ht Opon þe hulle of Auuerne : to seo þat holie si&yogh;ht. So þat Aboute Mi&yogh;helmasse : furst he wende to grounde; Ac he hudde is fet and hondene faste : þat Men ne i-sei&yogh;en þe wounde. With þe woundene he liuede two &yogh;er : and prechede a-boute wide, And þe woundene ornen ofte a-blode : and nameliche of is side, And bi-bledde is cuyrtel ofte : and is briech al-so; he carede muche hou he mi&yogh;hte : stilleliche it a-wei do.— ¶ Sethþe þare cam in þe londe : a swyþe strong qualm of orue, Þat schep and reoþeren and oþur bestes : aldai lei&yogh;en a-storue. A guod Man þat hadde muchel orf : bad ore louerd wel faste Þat he ne bi-nome him nou&yogh;t al is guod : ake þat som him moste i-laste. Slepinde in ametingue : to him seide þoru&yogh; om. þoru&yogh;? godes sonde Þat he scholde nime of þat watur : þat seint Fraunceis wusch inne is honde Oþur is fet and þere-with : a-mong þe bestes sprenge, And, &yogh;if him þou&yogh;te þare were to luyte : with oþur watur it Mienge. ¶ Þis guode Man þare-afturward : a-waitede is point ofte And stal of þis watur stilleliche : in huydeles wel softe, And spreinde a-mong is owene orf : and a-mong oþure mani on: And oueral þare it was i-spreind : huy weren hole ech-on.— ¶ Seint Fraunceis was frere Menour : in þe ordre twenti &yogh;er, And two &yogh;er and al-mest þreo wyke : ore louerdes woundene he ber, So þat he drou&yogh; to-ward þe deþe : and feblischede ful swiþe faste. On him nas nou&yogh;t bote fel and bon : bi-leued atþe laste. In torment he was strong i-nov&yogh; : and &yogh;wane he was in worst stounde, his lene bones he wolde drawe : a-&yogh;ein þe harde grounde, For-to make þe more is pine : and þe eorþe he custe al-so And þonkede god of alle guode : þat he him hadde i-do. he lay sijk and deide sone : seint Fraunceis þe holie man In ore leuedi churche : þare he furst þe ordre bi-gan. ¶ Þo he was þe deþe nei&yogh; : naked he liet him do, And to þe harde vrþe al bar : al nakede he lay so, And het heom þat a-boute him were : þat aftur þulke stounde huy leten him ligge longue also : nakede on þe grounde, Þat eorþe mi&yogh;hte on eorþe dei&yogh;e : for þat were is ri&yogh;hte. he bi-gan to prechi is breþren : ope is feble mi&yogh;hte. ¶ Atþe laste, þo he þene dethþ i-sai&yogh; : and i-felde hine ful strongue, "Voce mea" he bi-gan : one saume of euesongue, And seide forthþ þe saume al out : and heold up is hondene hei&yogh;e, And with þe laste word of þe saume : he bi-gan to dei&yogh;e. he deide tweolf hundred &yogh;er : and sixe and twenti ri&yogh;ht Aftur ore louerdes burtime : on a satur-day at ni&yogh;ht. Þe sonendai he was i-bured— : he ne ferde nou&yogh;t ase þis riche Þat for bobaunt of þe world : liggethþ longue a-liche. ¶ Þo þis holie man was ded— : þei it were bi ni&yogh;hte, A gret hep of lauerkene : opon þe churche a-li&yogh;hte And murie sounguen al þe longue ni&yogh;ht : a-boute þe bodie þere, Þo þe soule to heouene wende : a&yogh;ein kuynde þei it were— For þe lauerke is a foul : þat muche louez li&yogh;ht And herethþ þane dai with hire song : and restez hire a-ni&yogh;ht. A&yogh;ein kuynde huy sounguen þere : ase þei huy hadden in muynde hou muche he was anoured er : of foules a-&yogh;ein hore kuynde. ¶ Frere Austyn, þat was ministre : under him i-do, Þo þis holie man was ded : atþe deþe he lai al-so In þe londe of labour [Terra di Lavoro] : þat feor was þare-bi-side. Wel longue he lai speche-les : þene dethþ forto a-bide, And ri&yogh;ht ase seint Fraunceis deide : feor in an oþur londe, Þis frere Austin spac wel mildeliche : and heold up is two honden : "Abijd, broþur," he seide, "ane &yogh;wyle : ich come with þe a-non." his freres axeden him &yogh;wat it were— : for heom wondrede ech-on. ¶ "Bote frere Fraunceis," he seide, "ore fader : i-brou&yogh;t hath is lif to ende And is nouþe toward heouene : and with him i-chulle wende." With þis word he gan dei&yogh;e : and is soule al in pes To þe Ioye of heouene wende : with is maister seint Fraunceis, And þare huy [beoth] boþe : in Ioye with-outen ende. Nou god for þe loue of seint Fraunceis : late us alle þudere wende. AmeN.

9.1: SEint Albon þe holie Man : was here of Enguelonde, I-martred he was for godes loue : þoru&yogh; Iesu cristes sonde. Formest he was heþene man : and of heþene men he cam, And sethþe, ase ore louerd it wolde : he tornede to cristindom. ¶ Þe luþere prince þat was þo : dioclician, And an oþur þat was al so : þat hei&yogh;te Maximian, Cristine men þat huy mi&yogh;hten i-wite : huy brou&yogh;ten alle to grounde; In eche londe huy lieten heom seche : &yogh;ware huy mi&yogh;hten beon i|founde, And to strongue deþe heom duden : swiþe manie and fale; huy ne spareden none þat huy mi&yogh;hten finde : noþur grete ne smale. ¶ A luþur Iustise þat with heom was : to enguelonde he cam, To Martri alle cristine men : and destruyen cristindom. A clerk, a guod cristine man þat was : heorde it telle wide Of tormens þat huy duden oþur men : he ne dorste no long a-bide, Ake he fleu&yogh; elles-&yogh;wodere : þat he i-Martred nere; To seint Albones house he cam : and bad is In þere. ¶ Seint Albon, þe &yogh;wile he with him was : a-waitede and i-sai&yogh; hov he was in is oresones : boþe ni&yogh;ht and dai&yogh;: he þou&yogh;te þat he was a fol : þat he was heþene so longue, he gan to leue on Ihesu crist : and cristinedom ta-fongue. ¶ Þe Iustise þane clerk liet seche : so þat it was i-kud hou at seint Albones house : with him he was i-hud. Kni&yogh;htes he sende to fechchen him : &yogh;if he i-founde were. To seint Albon huy comen : and echsten after him þere. [This v. is written on the margin; v. 25-6 are spurious.] huy comen and founden seint Albon : and axeden him a-non &YOGH;weþur ani swuch þere were. : "for gode," quath þis holie man, "For gode," seide þis guode Man : "I nelle it nou&yogh;t for-sake, A swuch Man ich am mi-seolf : I nelle eou non oþur take." ¶ "A, þeof," seiden þis luþere men : "artþou i-come þar-to, &YOGH;wane þou wolt for þat strongue þef : to deþe beo i-do?" Þis holie man huy bounden faste : and to þe Iustise him brou&yogh;te, And tolden him þat he pulte him forth : for þat oþur þef þat huy sou&yogh;ten. ¶ "Bel ami," quath þe Iustise : "seie &yogh;wat is þi name And of &yogh;wat kunne þou art i-come : þat ore godes dost schuch r. swuch schame." "To þis Axingue," quath seint Albon : "ichulle answerie sone. Of &yogh;wat kunne ich am i-come : luyte þou hast to-done; Alban is mi name, i-wis : and ich honori al-so God þat schop alle þing : and euere-more wolle do." ¶ "A, traitur," quath þe Iustise : "artþou i-come þar-to, I schal don tormenti þi bodi : fram heued to þin ho. hastþou i-hud þane þef at-hom : þat doth us so muche schame, And pulst forthþ þi-self, þo r. þou cheitif : to deþe in his name: Anoure ore godes, ich rede, a-non : and heom sacrefise, Oþur ichulle þe tormenti so : þat men schullen of þe agrise." "For nou&yogh;t þou spext," quath Albon : "þar-aboute þou spillest þi brethþ, I-nelle neuere þene deuel honoure : for drede of þe dethþ." ¶ Þo was þe Iustise swyþe wroth : þane holie man he nam, Nakede, and al. he liet him faste binde : and &yogh;af him sone is dom: With schourges he made is tormentours : leggen on him i-nowe. On him huy leiden þat huy werie weren : and al is bodi to-drowe. Þe harde scourgene in is tendre flechs : deope gonne wade; Þe more þat huy tormenteden him : þe gladdore he him made; [53-4 added in L.] he þonkede god þat he moste : þare for is loue To þe stat of cristindom : þoru&yogh; is torment come. ¶ þo þe luþere Iustise i-sai&yogh; : þat it was al for nou&yogh;t, Þat he ne mi&yogh;hte fram Iesu crist : for no-þing torne is þou&yogh;t, he hiet him lede with-oute toun : and is heued smite of sone. I-redie weren þe tormentours : for-to do is bone, huy harleden him wel filliche : þat schame it was to se, For-to huy comen to þulke stude : þare he scholde i-martred be. huy comen to an vrninde brok : þere huy mosten ouer wade: [63-4 added in L.] Þe tormentores woden ouer al a-brod : and no strencþe þar-of ne maden. ¶ Ake ore louerd for seint Albones loue : dude miracle þere, A-non so þe schrewe tormentores : ouer i-wade were: For þo þis holie Man to watere cam : þat watur him with-drou&yogh; And ouer þe broke made ane wei : druy&yogh;e and clene i-nou&yogh;, þat he wende ouer al-so druy&yogh;e : ase it a-londe were; And euere þat watur bi-hinden him : smot to-gadere þere And cam al a-&yogh;ein ase it was er : þo he cam to londe. Louerd, muche is þi mi&yogh;hte : ho-so him wole onder-stonde! ¶ þe maister of þe tormentores : to &yogh;wam he was bi-take, Þo he i-sai&yogh; þe faire miracle : þene deuel he gan fur-sake, [73-4 spurious.] And seide he wolde to Ihesu crist : al is heorte wende, For þe Miracle þat he þare i-sai&yogh; : þat so fair was and hende; his sweord þat he on honde bar : wel feor fram him he caste And to seint Albones fet he feol a-doun : and criede him merci faste, Þat he moste for him dei&yogh;e : oþur, bote it oþur were, Þat he moste in þe place : þene dethþ a-fongue þere. ¶ Opon an hul huy wenden an hei&yogh; : ase huy weren a-signet to Þis holie Man seint Albon : to þe deþe do. Seint Albon wilnede aftur watur : þare ope þe hulle on hei&yogh;; he bi-heold þat þare ne mi&yogh;hte : no watur come þare nei&yogh;: Ore louerd he bad with guode heorte : þat he sende is grace Þat som water moste to him come : in þat ilke place. [85-6 added in L.] Ore louerd heorde is bone : þare anon-ri&yogh;hte bi-fore alle þe tormentores : in heore alre si&yogh;hte: ¶ For þo he hadde i-seid is oresun : and ore louerd i-bede, Þare sprong out of þat hei&yogh;e [hul] : a fair welle in þulke stude, Of al-so guod water ase ani mi&yogh;hte beo— : þat &yogh;uyt lastethþ, ich wene. Euere was þo and al-so nouþe : ore louerdes mi&yogh;hte i-sene. Þis guode kni&yogh;ht þat bi-liefde on god : for þat he sei&yogh; er, Wel more he criede þo on him : for þulke miracle þer, And wilnede &yogh;eorne þat he moste : for him dei&yogh;e þere. So þat in ore louerdes name : Imartrede boþe huy were. ¶ Ake þe tormentour þat smot of : seint Albones heued, Luyte he þorte þar-of &yogh;elpe : him were betere habbe bi-leued: For þo he smot of is heued : ri&yogh;ht in þulke stounde his owene ey&yogh;ene out of is heued : þare ri&yogh;ht fullen to grounde. Louerd, muche is þi mi&yogh;hte : ho-so him wole onder-stonde, Ase men mouwe bi is wiþer-wine : godes mi&yogh;hte fonde. g. m. f. on the mar|gin; puyrliche onder-stonde ex|punged. Seint Albon i-martred was : here in Enguelonde Bi-side ane toune þat widincestre : men cleopeden, ich onder-stonde. Þare is nouþe a churche a-rerd : and a gret Abbeye al-so, Þat men cleopieth seint Albones : ase he was to deþe i-do. Bidde we &yogh;eorne Ihesu crist : and seint Albon wel faste Þat we moten to þe Ioye come : þat euere schal i-laste.

10.1: SEint Wolston, bischop of wyrecestre : was here of engelonde, Swiþe holi man he was al is lif : ase ich me vnder-stonde. Þe &yogh;wile he was a &yogh;ong child : clene lif he ladde i-nov&yogh;; &YOGH;wane oþur children ornen to plei&yogh;e : toward churche he drou&yogh;. Seint Edward was kyng þo : þat nouþe in heouene is; And þe bischop of wyricestre : bri&yogh;ttey hei&yogh;te, i-wis. Of þis bischop Bri&yogh;tei : seint wolston is ordre nam, Ech aftur oþur, ase it fel : so þat he preost bi-cam. Þe bischop vnder-feng him sethþe : and Monek him makede i-wis In þe priorie of wiricestre : þat noble hous and gret is. Swyþe wel is ordre he heold : in þat priorie And al is wille was for-to pay&yogh;e : god and seinte Marie. In none bedde he nolde come : ake, &yogh;wane oþere &yogh;eoden þar-to, bi-fore on auter he wolde go : his oresones for-to do; &YOGH;wane þe dede slep him ouer-eode : þat he ne mi&yogh;te no leng gon, his heued he wolde legge a-doun : opon þe harde ston, Ope one grece bifore þe Auter : oþur is bok þare-vnder do, And liggen ane stounde in dweole Miengyngue— : al is slep scholde beon so. he nolde þreo dawes in þe wyke : no-þing eten with-alle, Ne no word speken bote his beden : for nou&yogh;t þat mi&yogh;te bi-falle; þe oþur dawes wel luytel he spak : and wel luytel he eat al-so, bote it were a luyte potage— : holde he wolde him þer-to. So longue he leouede at wirecestre : in þat holie lijf wel stille, Þat he was imaked prior of þat hous : muche a-&yogh;ein is wille. his Couent he wuste swyþe wel : and to alle guodnesse hem drou&yogh;; Of god and alle guode men : loue he hadde i-nou&yogh;. Þe prior[ie] MS. prior of wyricestre : seint oswold bi-gan er, Þat was bi-fore seint Wolston : nei&yogh; ane hondred &yogh;er; And þat he hadde er bi-gonne : þe oþur fulfulde, i-wis, So þat þoru&yogh; heore beire dede : strong weork and hei&yogh; þare is. Ase þis holie Man seint wolston : in a tyme liet a-rere A bel-hous of swiþe strong weork : bellen to hanguy þere, And Machouns a-boue and bi-nethe : þare a-boute were, Bi laddren cloumben up and doun : and þat weork bi-twene al bere, A man þare clemb up bi one laddre : an þo he was up on hei&yogh; Fram eorþe mo þane fourti fet : ase al þat folk i-sei&yogh;, Dounward he ful, ase he mis-stap— : Men weren sore a-gaste. Seint wolston stod and bi-heold : hou he was a-dounward faste: he made þe signe of þe croyz : ase he feol to-ward þe grounde: harmles he feol and hol man i-nov&yogh; : his limes weren hole and sounde, And a-ros up and dude is weork : ase him no-þing nere. Louerd, muche is þi mi&yogh;te : and þat þou cuddest wel þere, Þat [he] so harde fram so hei&yogh;e feol : and of eche harme was sker; Þou art a louerd þat wonderes dest : ase seith þe sauter. ¶ Hit bi-feol so þat bri&yogh;tey : þe Bischop of wyricestre, was ded: A clerk was bischop after him : þat Men cleopeden aldred, Þat seint wolston louede wel : and he louede him al-so— For ech guod man wole louien oþur : it were elles vuele i-do. Sethþe it bi-fel þat þe Erchebischop : of Euerwicke was ded: Erchebischop huy maden þar : þene bischop aldred, And þe bischopriche of wiricestre : vacaunt was and lere : Seint wolston was sone i-chose : and bischop i-maked þere. Bischop him made þe holie man : seint Edward þe king, And a-feng him in his dignete : and tok him is staf and ring. his bischopriche he wuste wel : and also is priorie, And a-forcede him to serui wel : god and seint Marie. Four &yogh;er he hadde bischop i-beo : and nou&yogh;t fulliche fiue þo seint Edward þe holie kyng : wende out of þis liue. Gret reuþe it was to al engelond : so weilawei þe stounde! For straunge men þere comen sethþe : and brou&yogh;ten enguelond to grounde. ¶ Harold was þo ri&yogh;htest eyr : for non oþur þere nas; Þe croune he bar of Enguelonde : &yogh;wuche &yogh;wile so it was. For willame Bastard, þat was þo : Eorl in Noremaundie, Þou&yogh;te to winne Enguelond : þoru&yogh; strencþe and tricherie: om. he let him greiþi folk i-nou&yogh; : and gret poer with [him] 1 nam And with gret strencþe in-to þe se he him dude : and to Enguelonde he cam. he liet ordeinie is fierd wel : and is banere up arer[d]e, And destruyde and nam al þat he fond : and þat folk sore a-ferde. ¶ Harold heorde herof telle : þe king of Enguelonde: he liet greiþie faste is ost : a-&yogh;ein him for-to stonde. Þe baronie of Enguelonde : redi was wel sone Þe king to helpe and heom-sulue : ase ri&yogh;ht was for-to done. Þe weorre was þo in Enguelonde : deolful and strong i-nov&yogh;, And eyþur of oþeres Men : al-to grounde a-slou&yogh;. ¶ No strencþe ne hadden þis straunge men : þat were i-come so newe, A&yogh;einest heom of enguelonde : þe &yogh;wyle huy wolden beo trewe. Ake alas þe muchele tricherie : þat þo was, and &yogh;eot is, þat brou&yogh;te þo Enguelond : al-to grounde i-wis! For þe englische barones bi-comen some : on-treowe and false also To bi-trai&yogh;e heom-seolf and heore kyng : þat so muche heom truste to. ¶ Þis Noremauns and þis Englische men : ane dai of bataile huy nome, Þare ase þe Abbeie of þe bataille is : ate daye to-gadere huy come, To grounde huy smiten and slowen al-so. : ake alas þulke stounde, Þat Enguelond was þoru&yogh; tresoun : þare i-brou&yogh;t to grounde! For þulke þat þe king truste to : failleden him wel faste; So þat he was bi-neoþe i-brou&yogh;t : and ouer-come atþe laste And to grounde i-brou&yogh;t, and alle his : and al Enguelond also, In-to vnecouþe mannes honde : þat no ri&yogh;ht ne hadden þar-to; And neuer-eft [it] ne cam a-&yogh;ein : to ri&yogh;hte Eyres none— Vnkuynde Eyres &yogh;eot huy beothþ : ore kingues echone, And nei&yogh;h-&yogh;wat alle þis hei&yogh;e Men : and of þe lo&yogh;we al-so. For willam liet [him] crouni king : þo þe bataile was al i-do, And bi-sette al enguelond : with men of oþere londe— Neuereft to is cuynde heritage : ne cam it, ich onder-stonde. ¶ Þis willam bastard, þat was king : sethþe him onder-stod Þat he mid vnri&yogh;hte hadde i-sched : mani ane mannes blod: And þare as þe bataille was : ane Abbei&yogh;e he liet a-rere, Þat "þe Abbeie of þe bataille" is i-cleoped : þat wel noble stand &yogh;eot þere; for heore soulene he as liet a-rere : þat he with vnri&yogh;hte þare a-slou&yogh;; Ake euere he heold forth þe kynedom : of enguelonde with wou&yogh;. ¶ Ake sone so he was king i-mad : and al enguelond bi-sette, Ase he wolde, with straunge men : and no man ne mi&yogh;hte him lette, Þis holie Bischop seint wolston : wel ofte him withseide Þat he with on-ri&yogh;hte hadde i-do : a swuch luþer dede, And spac a-&yogh;ein him baldeliche : and ne sparede for no drede— For he was þo þe cuyndeste englische man : þat was of enie manhede, And for alle oþure weren deseritede nei&yogh;h. : þe king was with heom r. him wrothþ Þat he was so luyte a-drad of him : and swor a-non is othþ To pulte him out of is bischopriche. : he liet [him] somoune al-so To westmunstre, to answerien him : of þat he him hadde mis-do. ¶ Nou nas nou&yogh;t seint wulston : wel gret clerk in lore— For þo he scholde to scole gon : to churche he &yogh;eode wel more. To westmunstre he cam to is day : ase he was i-somoned er. Þe king was in grete wrathþe : wel prest to kepe him þer, And þe bischop of Caunterburi : lanfranc was is name, And þe bischop gondolf of Roucestre : alle to don him schame. Seint wolston bi-fore heom cam : þat a-&yogh;ein him weren so strongue Ase a þeof bi-fore Iustise : his dom to vnder-fongue. ¶ Þe king and þe Erchebischop al-so : speken to him wordes grete, Þat he scholde, ase he wuyrþe was : is bischop-riche lete; For-to holden swuch dignete : to luyte he couþe of lore, And huy him hadden to longue i-þoled : And þo nolden huy nonmore, And grete foles huy weren þat swuch a fol : formest brou&yogh;te in swch mi&yogh;hte, And &yogh;if he was folliche onder-fongue : huy wolden don him out with ri&yogh;hte. ¶ Seint wolston stod wel mildeliche : and herknede al þat huy sede— Nadde he noman bote god : to his answere him rede. "Sires," he seide, "ri&yogh;ht it is : þat ich eoure heste do, For, sire king, þou art mi souerein : and þe r. þu erchebischop al-so. Þe Croce ich habbe &yogh;are i-bore : þat &yogh;e i-seothþ here, lo, A-knowe ich am and wel ich wot : þat i-nam nou&yogh;t wuyrþe þer-to; &YOGH;wane &yogh;e wollez þat ich as bi-leue : ase man þat vnwurþe is, Wel fain i-chulle eouwer heste do : ase mine souereines, i-wis.
