Vn-bou&yogh;hsome to holie churche : i-wis i-nelle be nou&yogh;t: To &yogh;elden hire up ase &yogh;e me hotez : ich habbe as here i-brou&yogh;t. ¶ Ake, for &yogh;e ne token as me nou&yogh;t : I nelle eou take non, Ake him þat as me bi-tok : bi-fore eov euerech-on: Þe guode Man þat as me bi-tok : &yogh;eonde he lijthþ wel stille, Ich as wulle him taken up : and þanne ich do eoure wille." ¶ To seint Edwardes toumbe he wende : þat was of Marbre-ston, A r. and? nam up is croiz wel mildeliche : and smot þe point þar-on. Þe staf wende into þe marbreston : ase it were in nesche sonde, And þo heo was inne deope i-nou&yogh; : þe guode Man hine liet stonde. "Nou," he seide, "ich him habbe bi-take : him þat as tok me And bi-fore eov here : i-&yogh;ollden op þe dignete. Takez as nouþe &yogh;wam &yogh;e wollez : som þat bet beo in lore, And habbez guod dai nouþe euerech-one—; &yogh;e ne mouwen esche me non-more." ¶ Þis holie Man wende forth : a-mon[g] heom alle wel softe. Þat folk stod ase it were i-nome : and bi-heolden þe croce wel ofte, hou heo stod in þe Marbre-ston : so deope and so faste; Of þe Miracle heom wondrede alle : and some weren sore a-gaste, Some wenden þar-to sone : þe croce up for-to drawe: Þare nas non so strong of heom : þat mi&yogh;hte hire enes wawe. huy porueiden er sire Gondolf : bischop of roucestre, Þat he scholde aftur seint wolston : beon Bischop of wirecestre: ¶ Þe Erchebischop aros him up : to saisi þe croiz a-non, Þe Bischop of Roucestre wel baldeliche : þudere-ward gan gon, Þe croiz he nam and faste he drou&yogh; : in þe Marbre-ston: he ne mi&yogh;hte hire nou&yogh;t enes wawien. : þat folk wondrede ech-on, And þare-a-boute wel þicke ornen : þat wonder for-to seo. Þo þe king and þe Erchebischop i-sei&yogh;en : þat non oþur it ne mi&yogh;hte beo, heom of-þou&yogh;te heore dede : and after seint wolstan sende, And þat huy wolden in faire manere : heore trespas a-mende. ¶ Þe Messagers i-redie weren : and aftur him sone wenden. &YOGH;eot þis holie Man for al þe gult : is heorte to heom bende, And seide, "ich mot nede do : mine souereines wille;" To court he wende a-&yogh;ein to heom : wel mildeliche and stille. Þo he was to court i-come : huy a-risen a-&yogh;ein him þere, Þe king and þe Erchebischop al-so : and oþere þat þare were; With gret honur huy cleopeden him forthþ : and for-&yogh;iuenesse him bede, And boden a-mendi a-&yogh;ein him : al heore grete misdede, And beden him nime a-&yogh;ein is croce : and don bi heore rede, For he was bet wuyrþe þare-to : þane ani oþur, huy seide. ¶ "Nai certes, sires," quath seint wolston : "þat nere me nou&yogh;t to do: Ich wot wel þat &yogh;e seiden soth : þat i-nam nou&yogh;t wuyrþe þare-to; Ake nimeth &yogh;wam eower wille be : an oþur þat conne more." Þe kyng and þe Erchebischop also : beden him milce and ore And seiden þat þere nas non oþur : þat so wuyrþe were þare-to. Longue it was are þis holie man : wolde heore wille do do added later. ; Ake, for-to obeien is souereins : he wende forth atþe laste And nam þe croce wel mildeliche : þare he stikede hire er so faste. ¶ Also li&yogh;htliche ase ani-þing : þe croce he gan up drawe Þat so mani men fondeden er : and ne mi&yogh;hten hire enes wawe. Þicke orn þat folk a-bouten him : and no wonder it nas! Þe miracle was sone wide i-kud : þat so apert was. Men anoureden þis holie Man : al-so muche ase huy mi&yogh;hte. his power þat him was er bi-nome : he tok a&yogh;ein with ri&yogh;hte; A-&yogh;ein to is bischopriche : with gret honour he him drou&yogh;; his Couent vnder-feng him faire : with grete noblei&yogh;e i-nou&yogh;. ¶ Þis holie Man ladde al is lif : swyþe faire and clene. Sijknesses þare weren wel fewe : þat man wolde him offe mene, Þat he ne brou&yogh;te to hele a-non : þoru&yogh; ore louerdes grace; Sike men wel þicke comen : to him in eche place, Deue and doumbe and blinde al-so : he helde þoru&yogh; godes grace &YOGH;wane huy comen to him : ou&yogh;were in ani place. So longue he leouede on eorþe here : þat he was of grete elde. His bodi bi-gan to heuegy swiþe : grete feblesse he fielde. ¶ A slou&yogh; feuere him cam on : þat ne nam him nou&yogh;t ful strongue, Ac heo made is bodi to melte a-wei— : þat laste swiþe longue. Seue ni&yogh;ht bi-fore þat he deide : his breþren he liet fette alle And liet him alle is ri&yogh;htes do : and seide &yogh;wat heom scholde bi-falle. Out of þis world to heouene he wende : þare he schal ay bi-leue, In þe Monþe of Ieneuer [19 Jan.] : a-seint Fabianes eue, ¶ A þousend &yogh;er and nie hundret : and foure þare-bi-fore It was þat ore swete louerd : on vrþe was i-bore, In þe teoþe &yogh;ere also : of þe kinedom Of willam þe rede king : þat aftur willam bastard cam These two v. are written in one line. he hadde, are he heonne i-wende : foure and þritti &yogh;er And four Monþes and four dawes : i-beo in worlde r. wolde? the other MSS. bishop Four-score &yogh;er he was old : and seuene al-so nei&yogh;h Are he wende out of þis lijf : to þe Ioye of heuene an hei&yogh;. ¶ Þo þis holie man was ded : þe Monekes comen sone In þe priorie of wirecestre : and duden þat was to done: Wuschen þat bodi, ase it was ri&yogh;ht : and to churche it bere; Þe Monekes alle with gret honour : þat is breþerne were, Þe seruise a-bouten him huy duden : ase it was wel ri&yogh;ht, And to seggen heore sauteres al-so : þare-bi huy woken a-ni&yogh;ht. ¶ Þo it was wel with-inne ni&yogh;ht : ase huy seiden in heore boke, heom luste slepe swiþe wel : þat vnneþes huy mi&yogh;hten loke, And some ne mi&yogh;hten nou&yogh;t fur-bere : ake lei&yogh;en and slepen faste, Some ase it were in dweolkningue : heore ei&yogh;ene to-gadere huy caste. Þat holie bodi, þat lai þare ded : a-mong heom in þe bere, A-ros up wel mildeliche : ase þei it a-liue were, And a-wei&yogh;hte heom euer-ech-on : and bi-gan atþon ende And al along þe rewe : þoru&yogh; þe queor he gan i-wiende; And euere ase he a-wei&yogh;hte heom : sumdel he superscr. gan heom chide Þat huy nolden with heore slep : heore ri&yogh;hte tyme a-bide. ¶ So muche [was] is holi heorte : þe ordre for-to wite Þat he nolde, þei he were ded : his breþerne fur-&yogh;ite! Þis Miracle was sone i-kud : ase ri&yogh;ht was þat it were. At wirecestre he was i-bured : and &yogh;uyt he liht þere. Þare Man may for is holie bodi : mani fair Miracle i-seo. Nou god graunti þat we mote with him : in þe Ioye of heouene beo.

11.1: SEint Matheu þe Ewangelist : apostel he was and is, al. i-wis Ewangelist and eke a-postle : for-soþe he was and is: Ewangelist, for he godspelles made : þat men doth ofte rede, Apostel, for ore louerd here on vrþe : seint Matheu with him gan lede. For ase ore louerd eode ouer lond : seint Matheu he sai&yogh; bi cas his mester don of walkingue : for a follare al. tollare he was, Fals and trichor of is werk : and liuede bi falshede. Ore louerd him hiet bi-leue is weork : "cum siwe me," he seide. And he bi-lefde þo is weork : and wiz ore louerd eode, And is false mester liet : for he nadde þer-to non neode. ¶ Fair forebisne ore louerd &yogh;af : alle sunfole men þo, &YOGH;wane he ane so sunfole Man : het with him go! Seint Matheu is sunnes bette : and tok to cristindom, And siwede ore louerd swiþe faste : and is Apostel bi-com.— Sethþe þo ore louerd was into : heouene i-wend, Þe Apostles weren þo wel wide in londe : for-to prechie, i-send. In-to þe londe of Ethiope : seint Matheu sone &yogh;ede, to prechie men to cristinedom : ase it was wel gret neode. ¶ He founde tweie luþere men : and strongue wichchene þere, Zaroen and Arphaxat : þat þe deueles limes were, Þat, ase huy wolden, in grete siknesse : manie men hadden i-do And manie men þoru&yogh; þe feonde : i-helde huy hadden al-so. Alle þat þe luþere men : in siknesse brou&yogh;te, Seint Matheu heom helde a-non : and wel clene heom out sou&yogh;te. Sorie weren þis luþere Men : huy nusten &yogh;wat was to done: Tweie dragones, þat feondes weren : to heom huy cleopeden sone, Þat casten brumston and fuyr : and [slowe] om. &yogh;end al þe londe Mannes r. men and bestes þere-with wel þicke— : heom ne mi&yogh;hte no þing at|stonde. ¶ Þis luþere men nomen þe dragones to heom : for huy scholden to|drawe Þane Apostel seint Matheu : and bringue him of lijf-dawe. Þo seint Matheu þis i-heorde : baldeliche he gan gon, Þe signe he made of þe croiz : and to heom wende a-non. A-non so þe dragones him i-sei&yogh;en : to is fet huy fullen a-doun, huy ne mi&yogh;hten heom wawien hider ne þuder : ane fot for al þe toun. "lo, &yogh;e wrechches," quath þe apostle : to þe luþere men tweie, "&YOGH;ware is nouþe al eouwere mi&yogh;hte? : ouer-come &yogh;e beothþ beine. ¶ &YOGH;if i-nadde nouþe mine louerdes grace : for eou &yogh;eorne bi-sou&yogh;t, On eov-sulf it scholde nouþe bi-falle : ase &yogh;e hadden bi me i-þou&yogh;t. Þis twei luþere dragones : þat &yogh;e habbuth hidere i-brou&yogh;t, A-rereth heom &yogh;if &yogh;e mowen : oþur eower art nis nou&yogh;t." ¶ Euere stoden þis wrechche men : ri&yogh;ht ase huy weren i-nome, huy weren of seint Matheu a-ferde sore : and heolden heom ouer-come. Seint Matheu þis tweie dragones : þoru&yogh; Iesu cristes lore Out of þe londe heom drof a-non : þat huy ne comen þere non-more. he wende a-boute and prechede : and þe tweie schrewene liet go— Ouer-comene wrechches ase hui weren : nas heom neuer er so wo. ¶ Hit bi-feol þat þe kingues sone : of þe londe was ded. Sone þis twei&yogh;e deoueles limes : to-gadere nomen hore red And wenden þudere, &yogh;if huy mi&yogh;hten : þoru&yogh; heore art him orig. heom a-rere; And huy maden heore enchauntement : ase þe deuel heom gan lere. Ake þat child lai euere ded— : for heore mi&yogh;hte nas ri&yogh;th nou&yogh;t. Þoru&yogh; þe kingue huy weren i-nome : and in strongue prisone i-brou&yogh;t. ¶ Þe king sende aftur seint Matheu : ase men of him tolde, &YOGH;if he mi&yogh;hte is sone arere— : for he was so wis i-holde. Þo seint Matheu þudere cam : to ore louerd he MS. heo dude is bone And a-rerde þat child : fram deþe to liue wel sone; Þat child a-ros and herede god : i-bore of mayde marie. A-non so þe king þis i-sei&yogh; : wel loude he gan to crie : "For-soþe," he seide, "ich i-seo : þat Matheu a god is; Þei he beo here in mannes fourme : he is a god, i-wis! ¶ Anoure we him ase it is ri&yogh;ht : with seluer and with golde." huy offreden to him tresor i-nou&yogh; : more þane he a-fongue wolde. "Nai certes," quath þis holie man : "god nam ich nou&yogh;t, Ake godes seriaunt þat here on eorþe : to deþe was i-brou&yogh;t. ho-so wole on him bi-lieue : to heouene he schal i-wiende, And ho-so nele nou&yogh;t, he worth i-wis : in pine withþ-outen ende." So þat þe king and alle his : i-cristnede of him were. With þe tresor þat men him brou&yogh;te : a fair churche he liet a-rere. ¶ In þritti dawes heo was arerd— : so gret hel[p] þare was to; Þare þe king and is heore beden bede : and alþe contrei&yogh;e al-so. Aftur þe tuei&yogh;e MS. trei&yogh;e enchauntours : seint Matheu liet sende, Zaroes and Arphaxat : and made heom þannes wiende. Into þe londe of perce : huy wenden with schame i-nov; Þere þat folk mis-bi-leued : wel þicke a-boute heom drov. ¶ Sethþe seint symon and seint Iude : to perce þene wei nome And þulke two enchauntours : to grounde huy ouer-come, Þare huy neuereft cristine Men : non a-nuy ne wrou&yogh;te, Ase Man mai in heore liue i-seo : ho-so þare-after sou&yogh;te.— Seint Matheu in Ethiope : þe kingues dou&yogh;ter nam, Þat of hire-seolf was a clene þing : and &yogh;af hire cristinedom, A r. and? made hire a-uouwe chastete : and clene lif to lede. þat maide was wel a-paid euere-aftur-ward : of þat ilke dede. ¶ A king of an oþur londe : is loue on hire he caste And wolde ire habbe to his spouse : and wowede hire wel faste. Þo þis maide nolde is wille do : to seint Matheu he &yogh;eode Þat he scholde in his half beo : and bed him grete mede. ¶ "Cum," quath seint Matheu, "þilke dai : and ich hire wolle rede Þat heo heolde hire spoushod : and þare-inne hire lijf lede." Þe king was glad and wende wel : Þat he bi him it seide, Þat he wolde hire to him rede— : ake he nolde nou&yogh;t don so to quede. Þe king cam aday, and muche folk : with him he gan bringue, And þis maide cam al-so : to hure seint Matheus prechingue. Seint Matheu stod and prechede : þat folk al a-brod : Mest he preisede of alle þingue : in is sarmun spoushod, And þat þere nas no lijf so guod : þare it was trewe and clene. Þe kyng was glad and hopede wel : þat he it dude bi him mene, For þat Maide scholde : to him i-wedded beo; Seint Matheu he louede muche : and hopede is wille i-seo. ¶ So þat sethþe seint Matheu : is prechingue forþere drou&yogh; And seide, "&yogh;if þe king hadde a wif : þat he louede i-nou&yogh;, And a fol come in spousbruche : and lei&yogh;e bi is wiue, Þe king wolde beo wroth i-nou&yogh; : and bringue him of liue, For he him hadde is wijf bi-nome : and imad hire don amis. Of þe hei&yogh;e king of heouene : also it fareth, i-wis : &YOGH;if he hathþ a guod spouse : þat ledeth clene lijf, A nd þare come forthþ a fol : and bi-nime him is wijf, To strongue deþe he wolde him bringue : and to þe pine of helle al-so. Þare-fore ech man beo i-war : þat he swuch þing ne do." ¶ Þo þe kin[g] i-heorde þis : sone he onder-stod Þat it was ri&yogh;ht bi him i-seid. : for wrathþe he was nei&yogh;h wod, And swor þat he nolde bliþe beo : are he were MS. he were a were awreke. For[th] MS. for he wende and bi-gan a-non : seint Matheus dethþ bi-speke. Þis guode man nas no-þing aferd : he prechede euere faste And confortede þat clene maide : þat ire heorte opon him al caste. ¶ Þis Maide feol doun to is fet : and on him &yogh;eorne gradde; Euere þis guode man hire bi-sou&yogh;te : þat heo clene lijf ladde. Sethþe he wende and greiþede him : is masse forto singue. luþere Men i-redie weren : i-sende þoru&yogh; þe kingue. Ri&yogh;ht ase he stod at is Masse : on of heom forthþ wende And smot him þoru-out with a swerd : and alle his gottes to-rende : For he smot him In atþe Rugge : and atþe wombe out. Þo þe guode Man a-slawe was : þe schrewe was wel prout. ¶ Þat folk þat cristine was : wel þicke it cam a-non Þe kingues paleis for-to brenne : and to a-quelle is men ech-on. Ake seint Matheus desciples : for-boden heom ech-one Þat huy ne duden no such þing : ake lieten god wurþe al-one. huy wenden and nomen þis holie bodi : and swiþe faire on eorþe it brou&yogh;te.— Þe king &yogh;uyt bi al is mi&yogh;te : after þat maide &yogh;eorne sou&yogh;te. Ake þo he ne mi&yogh;hte in none manere : to is wille hire i-winne, he wende forth and sette a-fuyre : þat hous þat heo was inne. Ake seint Matheu ne for-&yogh;at nou&yogh;t þat Maide : þei he ded were : orig. were ded Fram heouene he a-li&yogh;hte a-doun to hire : and is help ire cudde þere added : For þat fuyr he drof a-&yogh;ein : to þe kingues paleis a-non And fur-brende it al-to nou&yogh;t : and is Men echon; ¶ Vnneþe he him-sulf and is sone : a-scapeden with heore liue. he mi&yogh;hte segge, to wroþerhele : he wilne[de] aftur wiue. For suyþe sone þare-aftur-ward : Musel he bi-cam; And þo he ne mi&yogh;hte nou&yogh;t beo hol : gret deol to him hee nam, With is swerd him-sulf he a-slou&yogh; : and is bodi al-to-rende— Nou god it wot and seint Matheu : &yogh;wodere is soule wende. Þat folk wende forth a-non : and made ane newe king wel bliue, Þe clene maidenes broþur i-wis : þat he wilnede so muche to wiue, Þat seint Matheu þe apostel hadde : i-cristned with is honde; &YOGH;ware-þoru cristinedom : cam sethþe into al þe londe. Nou Iesu crist us &yogh;iue is grace : þulke Ioy&yogh;e i-winne For þe loue of seint Matheu : þat he woneth inne.

12.1: SEint leger a bischop was : and holi man i-nou&yogh;; Mani a man þoru&yogh; is prechingue : to godes lawe he drou&yogh;. A luþur Iustise þare was nei&yogh;h : Ebrom r. Ebroin was is name : Men tolden him, ase he wende a-boute : of seint legeres fame. he liet him wel sone nime : and bi-fore him bringue, And fondede for-to tuyrne is þou&yogh;t : fram þe heuene kingue. þo he ne mi&yogh;hte þat don nou&yogh;t : he was wroth inou&yogh;; Ane luþere man he cleopede sone : þat boþe is ei&yogh;ene ou&yogh;t drou&yogh;. ¶ Þo is ei&yogh;ene in grete pine : weren i-holede out boþe, he gan þe more prechi of god. : þare-fore huy weren wroþe. A wei þer was of scharpe stones : and opward stoden echon : Þare-oppe þis holie man : barefot huy maden gon, huy driuen him barefot and a-blend : ope þis scharpe stones þere. Þis guode man eode wel baldeliche : ase þei him no-þing nere, And euere he prechede on Iesu crist— : he ne bi-lefte for no fere. ¶ For is longue prechingue þe luþere men : wroþest with him were : huy coruen of is tongue a-non : ri&yogh;ht bi is þrote a-boue. Þare schewede ore swete louerd : fair Miracle for is loue : For þo is tongue was of i-corue : &yogh;eot he prechede faste And al-so wel as he dude er. : þo weren þe schrewes a-gaste. huy bi-speken to don him more schame : ake huy weren sumdel in doute. huy [sto]den unreadable. and bi-heolden is heued : and þo MS. þe? i-sei&yogh;en huy þare|a-boute A ro[un]d croune and swiþe cler— : bri&yogh;htore ne mi&yogh;hte non beo, Þat vnneþe huy mi&yogh;hten is holie heued : for þe leome i-seo. ¶ Þis luþere Iustise het a-non : þat men smiten of is heued, Four tormentores he was bi-take : þat it nere nou&yogh;t bi-leued. huy ladden him with-oute toun : for-[to] don þat dede. Ase huy comen a-midde þe wei : þis holie man to heom seide : "&YOGH;wat neode is it for-to trauailli : ferrore me to lede? Dothþ anon þat &yogh;e scholden do : here ri&yogh;ht, ich eou rede." Þe þreo quellares of þis word : anon weren in grete drede : To is fet huy feollen a-kneo : and for-&yogh;iuenesse him bede. Þare-fore was þe feorþe wroth : forth he hupte sone And smot of þe guode mannes heued : ase he hadde heste to done. ¶ Sone þare-aftur cam a fuir : ase it of helle were, And al quik fur-barnde him : and þe deuelene a-wei him bere. Seint leger was wel faire i-bured. : is soule to heouene wende, And for þat bodi, ase it on eorþe lai : fair miracle ore louerd sende. ¶ Þe luþere Iustise þat him liet a-quelle : þere-of heorde telle, two &yogh;er aftur þulke tyme : þat he him liet a-quelle : To is toumbe ane kni&yogh;ht he sende : þe soþe for-to fonde. Þo þe kni&yogh;ht to þe toumbe cam : þare-bi he gan stonde, "In schendnesse," he seide, "mote he dei&yogh;e : and in strongue deþe al-so ho-so bi-lieuethþ þat dede men : ani miracle mouwen do!" Wel filliche also þe toumbe he smot. : and a-non-ri&yogh;ht with þe dede Oppon him feol is owene bone : ase he bad and seide : For deuelene a-strangleden him a-non— : for al redie þare huy were, And is soule, ase it was ri&yogh;ht : a-deuele wei huy bere. ¶ Þe Iustise sone þare-aftur-ward : to deþe was i-do And a-slawe in grete schendnesse : and a-deuele wei wende also. Þus was þe bischop seint leger : a-wreke of is fon, And he him-sulf to þe Ioie of heouene : after is deþe gan gon. Nou god for þe loue of seint leger : is swete grace us siende, Þat we aftur þusse liue : moten to þe Ioye of heouene wiende.

13.1: SEinte Fey, þat holie Maide : of swiþe hei&yogh;e men heo com. Swiþe &yogh;ong in hire childhod : heo turnede to cristindom, And holi lijf i-nou heo ladde— : þat word sprong wel wide Of hire guodnesse and of hire holi lijf : a-boute in eche side. ¶ A luþer Aumperour þare was þo : þat hiet Dioclician, And is felawe þat was al-so : þe schrewe Maximian; A luþur Iustise huy hadden with heom : is name was dacian : To deþe huy brou&yogh;ten &yogh;ware huy founden : ani cristine Man. ¶ Þe Iustise Dacian : wende in-tal = in-to al þe lond And a-slou&yogh; alle þe cristine men : þat he ou&yogh;were fond. So þat he heorde telle : ase he wende bi þe wey, Of þis holie maide and clene : and i-cristned, seinte Fey. ¶ To þe toune þare heo was inne : ase a wod man he wende, And burstinde in grete wrathþe : is bedeles a-boute he sende, To crie a-boute in eche strete : &yogh;if men mi&yogh;hte ani finde Cristine man oþur womman : þat huy heom scholden faste binde And bi-fore him bringue haste-liche— : þat huy ne sparede non!— And bote huy wolden heore [þou&yogh;t] tuyrne : anoþur it scholde gon. ¶ Þo þe banne was þus i-cried : þare was Ioye I-nou&yogh; Among þe paeyns euerechone : þat Man cristine men so a-slou&yogh;; Ake seoruwe and sor and deol i-nou&yogh; : among cristine men þare was, Þo huy sei&yogh;en heore deth i-come : and non oþur bote þare nas. ¶ Seinte Fey was furst i-sou&yogh;t : for men wusten of hire wel wide. Ioyful heo was and glad i-nou&yogh; : þo men þe banne criede; Ake forth heo wende wel baldeliche : nolde heo nou&yogh;t longue a-bide, Ake profrede hire to þe tormentores : ase men sou&yogh;ten hire wide. With hardie heorte heo wende forth. : þe tormentores hire nome And harleden hire wel filliche : forth toward hire dome. ¶ Þe Iustise for wrathþe wende r. vemde þo : heo bi-fore him come. heo made þe signe of þe croiz : and blessede hire i-lome; heo bad ore louerd wel mildeliche : þat he ire &yogh;eue þere Studefaste bi-leue and strencþe of heorte : þat heo ouer-come nere, And in hire tormenz treowe heorte : and þat he ire &yogh;eue is grace To his onour answerie wel : þe Iustise in þat place. ¶ Þe Iustise bi-heold þat Maide : with ful sori chere, he grennede and femde touward hire : ri&yogh;ht ase he wod were : "Dameisele," he seide, "&yogh;wat art þou? : &yogh;wat þencstþou for-to do? Tel me on &yogh;wam þou bi-lieuest : and &yogh;wat is þi name, al-so." "Sire," seide þis holie Maide : "Fey ich hote nouþe, And cristine womman ich habbe i-beo : sethþe ich ani guod couþe. Mi name nelle ich nou&yogh;t for-sake : no mi cristindom noþur; Þou mi&yogh;ht þretne al þat þou wolt : of me ne worth þe non oþur." ¶ Þo bi-gan þis Dacian : fair semblaunt to make, "Maide," he seide, "ich rede þe : þat þou an oþur red take. Þench þat þou art fair and noble : and þat þe bet bi-come A noble lauedi to beon and hei&yogh;h : þane beo i-brou&yogh;t here to dome. For &yogh;if þou wolt don aftur me : in grete Ioie þou worst i-brou&yogh;t And in grete nobleie, ase þe bi-cometh— : þare-fore torne þi þou&yogh;t." ¶ "Certes, sire," þis maide seide : "þou spext embe nou&yogh;t, For i-nelle neuere him for-sake : þat so deore me hathþ a-bou&yogh;t; For ich habbe to him mi vou i-maked : þat i-nelle neuere breke. Þare r. þare-fore do elles &yogh;wat þou wolt : bote þat þou þarof ne speke; For I-nelle nou&yogh;t honouri þine false godes. : for in þe sautere it is i-write Þat alle swuche Deouele beoth : and þat may ech Man i-wite." ¶ Þo fierde þe Iustise ase he were wod : and made wel sori bere, And was neih&yogh; wod for þis Maide seide : þat is godes deuelene were. he liet fette a bed of bras : brod and hei&yogh;h also, And dude strepe þis Maide naked : and in þis harde bedde ire do. ¶ Þis Maide, þo heo naked was : with glad semblaunt in wende; huy strei&yogh;hten hire a-long and a-croiz : and gret fuyr þare-onder tende, And casten on grece riue i-nou&yogh; : þat drof up so gret lei&yogh;e Þat þis maide þou&yogh;te al a-fuyre : ase huy þat stoden þare i-sei&yogh;e. Þe tormentores stoden þare-bi-side : with kene oules and strongue And tur[n]den þat Maide side and oþur : ouer þe fuyre wel longue, Þat heo þoru&yogh; strencþe of þe grece : ofte al a-fuyre stod. Euere lai þat holie Maide : ase hire nere nou&yogh;t bote guod, hire heu heo nolde chaungi enes : ne tuyrne hire þou&yogh;t; Alle men þat þe wonder i-seien : þe enchesun nusten nou&yogh;t. ¶ Cristine men manie : þo huy herden telle Þat þe Iustise was þudere i-come : with tormenz heom to quelle, huy ornen out of toune hem for-to huyde : ech in is side, for doute, And lei&yogh;en in puttes and in olde diches : &yogh;eon t al þe contreie a|boute. An holi man þare hudde him so : þat men cleopeden capras, Þat in þe north-side of þe toun : in one olde roche he was. ¶ He lai and darede out of is hole : ase he dorste for doute, And i-sai&yogh; al þe torment of seinte Fey : ase he [biheold aboute, om. (so Ash.) ] hou men rosteden hire with fuyr and grece : and to-drowen hire al-so— For it was a luyte þare-bi-side : þat þis dede was i-do. Ase þis fuyr bi-gan to brenne : þis holie man i-sei&yogh;, A coluere þare cam, so &yogh;wijt so milk : fram heouene fleo on hei&yogh;, ¶ A croune of guold heo bar a-doun : þat schinde swiþe bri&yogh;hte, Bri&yogh;htore þane þe sonne leom. : oppe þe maidenes heued Ash. maide heo ali&yogh;hte And sette þe croune on hire heued : with þe winguen heo bleu faste A&yogh;ein þat fuyr, ase him þou&yogh;te : þat it ne mi&yogh;hte nou&yogh;t i-laste— Fram-ward þat Maide heo bleu it euere : þat it ne cam hire no-þing nei&yogh;h, And heo lai þare in alle Ioye : ase þis holie man i-sei&yogh;h. Þare-fore oþure þat weren hire nei&yogh;h : nusten nou&yogh;t hou it was, Þat þou&yogh;te þat heo was al a-fuyre : and neuere þe worse hire nas. ¶ Þis holie man seint capras : þat i-sei&yogh;h al þis, to him-seolf he seide, "ich a-bide : nou sone to longue, i-wis;" he sturte out of þis deope Roche : and þudere or[n] wel faste; to þis tormentingue sone he cam : no-þing him ne agaste. Loude he gradde with folle Mouth : "Ich am cristine Man, I-nelle for-sake Ihesu crist : for drede of Dacian. To longue ich habbe heonne i-beo— : þat me for-þuncheth sore. here is Ioye and blisse i-nou&yogh;h : þat schal bringue us to more." ¶ Tweie breþren þare comen þo al-so : seint Felician And seint prime : þat seide also to þis Dacian. Wod-wrothþ was Dacian þo : he dude heom nime ech-on, Seinte Fey and alle þe oþere : and smiten of heore heuedes a-non. Þe tormentores i-redie weren : and gonne þat maide take And hire felawes forth with hire : þat nolden ore louerd for-sake, And ladden heom forth to heore ende-day : and heore heuedes smiten of sone In gret wrathþe ech aftur oþur : and duden heore maistres bone. ¶ To þe Ioye of heouene a-non huy wenden : and þare bi-leue with|outen ende; Aungles þare weren to bere heom forthþ : þat ore louerd þudere gan siende. Þe luþere men leten þe bodies ligge : þo huy weren i-brou&yogh;t of dawe, In a foul stude al on-bured : þare bestes heom scholden to-drawe. Ake cristine men þat þare weren nei&yogh;h : þerto stelen bi ni&yogh;hte And bureden heom in a derne stude : ase nobleliche ase huy mi&yogh;hten. Nou seinte Fey and hire felawes : ore erinde beode so, Þat we moten to þe Ioye come : þare huy beoth inne i-do.

14.1: Ondleuene þousend of virgines : for ore louerd i-martrede were; Telle i-chulle of heore martyrdom : and ho heom þar-to gan lere. A kyng þare was in Brutayne : sire Maur was is name; Ane dou&yogh;ter he hadde þat hiet Ourse : þat was of noble fame; Cristine heo was and al hire kun : swiþe hende and quoynte, So fair womman Men nusten non : no so guod in euerech pointe. ¶ Of hire fair-hede and of hire guodnesse : men tolden in eche side, Þat þe word cam into Enguelond : and elles-&yogh;woder wel wide. A kyng þare was þo in Enguelonde : and Man of gret poer; Gret nobleie he heorde telle : of þis maide feor and ner: his wille was gret þat is sone : þis Maide in spoushod hadde. Ake Men þe &yogh;uyt in Enguelond : cristinedom non nadden. ¶ Þe king of enguelond, þat was þo : to þe kyng of Brutayne gan siende For is dou&yogh;ter to is sone : þat was is heyr so hende; And seide, &yogh;if þat he þare-a&yogh;en were : þat þe dede nere i-do, him and alle his he wolde destruy&yogh;e : and al his lond al-so. Þo þis Messagers comen to þis kyng : and heore erinde hadden i-seid, Sori and dreori was þis king : he ne couþe þare-of no red: For þe king of Enguelond : was heþene, and alle his, And for he wuste wel þat is dou&yogh;hter nolde : i-wedded beo, i-wis, And also, for þe kyng of Enguelond : was of so gret mi&yogh;hte Þat he no strencþe ne mi&yogh;hte habbe : a&yogh;ein him for-to fi&yogh;hte. And naþeles Triwes of is answere : a&yogh;ein þe messagers he nam. Deol and sor and luyte gladnesse : in is heorte þare cam! ¶ He ne tolde no-þing is dou&yogh;ter fore : of þis reuful cas; &YOGH;eorne he bad god ni&yogh;ht and day : for he redles was, And criede on him swiþe reufulliche : þat he him scholde rede. A ni&yogh;ht an Aungel to is dou&yogh;ter cam : and þeos wordes to hire sede: "Ne beo þou nou&yogh;ht a-&yogh;ein þis sonde : Ake, þine fader forto paye, Graunte i-wedded for-to beo : and bide þat he it delai&yogh;e Ane þreo &yogh;er, þat þou mouwe þe &yogh;wile : þi Maiden-hod anoure; And þat huy þe purchace clene maidenes : with þe to habbe in þi boure: ¶ And þat þe king of Enguelonde and is sone : and þi fader beon alle at one rede Þe for-to cheose ten clene Maidenes : with-oute eche wicke dede; &YOGH;wane &yogh;e Endleue to-gadere beothþ : þat huy eou finden &yogh;eot þer-to Euer-ech of eov a þousend maidenes : to serui eou al-so, Þat &yogh;wane &yogh;e alle to-gadere beoth : þat ech mouwe in is side honouri hire Maiden-hod and þin : þat it beo couth wel wide, So þat Men ne mouwen Maide non : alosed finde finde overlined a&yogh;ein þe; And þat he wolle cristine bi-come : þi louerd þat schal beo. In þis foreward graunte him : aftur þe þridde &yogh;ere I-spoused to beon in godes lawe— : And ne haue þerof no fere!" Þo þat maide i-heorde þis : glad heo was of is lore, Þat heo wuste &yogh;ware-with heo mi&yogh;hte : bringue hire fader of is sore. ¶ Sone heo wende to hire fader : and bad þat he ire telle scholde &YOGH;wy þat he so mourninde &yogh;eode. : he seide þat he nolde. "Ich wot wel þi þou&yogh;t," þat maide seide : "þei þou it holde stille. Of þi sonde ne haue no doute : ichulle don al þi wille." Þo bi-gan heo tellen him in &yogh;wuche manere— : ase þe Aungel hire hadde i-seid— heo wolde habbe þene hei&yogh;e Man : &yogh;if þat it were is red. ¶ Welle, glad was þe kyng : þo þat he iheorde þis! Þe Messagers he &yogh;af Answere : sone with gret blis. Þo huy [it] brou&yogh;ten þe kingues sone : þe tiþingue wel him payde. Sone he liet Baptizen him : for loue of þat Maide; And þoru&yogh; is fader and þoru&yogh; him : and þoru&yogh; þe oþur kingue Endleue þousend of clene maidenes : to þis maide huy guonne bringue. heo was glad of þe compaygnie : þat so fair to hire cam! Sone heo bigan in priueite : telle heom of cristinedom; Þat for hire loue and for hire prechingue : alle cristine huy were. Louerd, &yogh;wuch a compaygnie : of clene maidenes was þere! ¶ So gret Ioye þe king of is dou&yogh;ter hadde : and of ire faire ferrade, Þat he liet heom makien a quoynte schip : of al. of gret lengþe and of brede, Þat huy scholden in þe se : plei&yogh;e, &yogh;wane huy wolde, Þat ech man a-londe and in watere : heore mayden-hod pre[i]sie scholde. huy sounguen ofte a-watere and eke a-lond : and treches huy gonne lede And oþur-manere faire pleies : and al was of clene dedes. Mete and drinke stilleliche : to þe schip huy lieten bringue To þreo &yogh;eres sustinaunce : with-oute leue of þe kingue. ¶ A dai huy wenten into þe se : and pleiden heom up and doun— For Ioye þere stoden, to bi-holden heom : Men of mani a toun. Ase huy weren in mest Ioye of plei : ore louerd ane wynd sende, Þat drof heom feor into þe se : þat men nusten &yogh;wodere huy wende. Welle, glade were þis maydenes þo! : þe wind heom drof wel bliue, To al. ate þe cite of coloyne : formest huy gonne ariue. ¶ To Damoysele ourse, þe kyngues dou&yogh;hter : an Aungel cam þere And bad hire lede wel hire compaygnye : for-to huy i-martrede were; And seide þat huy scholden forþere fare : and alle a-&yogh;ein wende, And in þulke toune for ore louerdes loue : imartrede beon atþenende. Glad was þat Mayde for þis word! : forthþ huy wenden a-non. Atþe cite of Basilie : huy a-riueden ech-on. ¶ Fram þulke Cite euerechone : a-fote huy wenden to Rome. Gret Ioye made þe pope with heom : þo huy þudere come— For manie of heom weren nei&yogh;h him sibbe : and for he was of bru|tayne; Cyriac is name was. : huy weren of him wel fayne. An Aungel cam to þe pope a ni&yogh;ht : and seide þat he scholde With þis Maydenes i-martred beo : for ore louerd it so wolde. After þat tyme þis holie man : honourede heom þe more, And prechede heom ofte of clannesse : and of ore louerdes lore. Tweolf monþe and endleue wokes : alle þis Maydenes were At Rome with þis holie pope : þat heom dude wel lere. ¶ Ake þe pope seint Ciriac : is conseil cleopie gan, His clerkes and is Cardinales : and Mani on oþer Man: Bi-fore heom al is dignete : he tok up atþen ende, And seide he wolde in-to an oþur lond : with þis maydenes wende. ¶ Þis Cardinales weren þare-a-&yogh;ein : and seiden þat he gan reue With fole wummen for-to go : and is dignete bi-leue. Naþeles he wende forth with heom : al a-&yogh;ein heore rede; Þe Cardinales and is clerkes : gret schame þare-fore him seide. Tweie luþere princes þare weren : Maximin and Affrican, Þou&yogh;ten þat þis Maydenes wolden : tuyrne mani a man: To heore Mey, þe prince of Coloyne : huy senden for-þen-one Þat he, &yogh;wane huy þudere comen : A-slowe heom euerech-one. ¶ Þat child þat scholde þis Mayde wedde : ase heo hadde i-seid, Kyng was i-maud of Enguelonde : þo is fader was ded; Þat ladde swiþe chaste lijf : and longuede swiþe sore With þat clene Maide to speke and beo : þoru&yogh; strencþe of godes lore. An Aungel cam to him and bad : þat he on alle wise his Moder and is &yogh;ungueste soster : anon-ri&yogh;ht liete Baptize And he with heom to Coloygne : wiende with al his mayne A-&yogh;ein is trewe spouse, þat was : Mayde Ourse of brutayne; Þat heo r. he him to hire leide faste : in wille and eke in dede, And endede heore lijf in godes seruise : ase heo heom wolde rede. ¶ þis &yogh;ongue with gret ioye dude : þat þe Aungel him gan lere: his moder and is soster he nam : þo huy i-baptizede were, And þe Bischop Clement al-so : þat i-baptized heom hadde, Toward coloyne forth with him : a-&yogh;en þis Maydenes he ladde. Swiþe glad was þis &yogh;ongue king : þo he to is lefMan cam! And also glad was þat Maide : þo heo sai&yogh;h him in cristinedom! Mest Ioye heo made with is &yogh;ongue soster : þat hiet Florentyne, Þat heo, clene Mayde, scholde : soffrie deþes pine. ¶ Ourse of Brutayne þene &yogh;oungue king : in grete Ioye of loue gan lere Þat he him heolde faste to hire : and ne bi-lefde for no fere, Þat huy mi&yogh;hten in trewe loue : to-gadere i-martred beo And wonye in heuene with Ihesu crist : þat bou&yogh;te heom on þe treo. Alþis grauntede þis &yogh;oungue king : and is lefmane nou&yogh;t ne wernde; his furste þou&yogh;t into treowe loue : and into clannesse he turnde. ¶ Þe heþene prince i-redi was : þo huy to Coloyne come With manie luþere heþene Men : and al þis compaygnie huy nome, And huweden and crieden on heom a-schame : and to grounde heom a-slowe, And ase so fale wolues a-mong lambren : heore flechs huy to-drowe. Þo huy comen to þis clene þing : Maide Ourse of Brutayne, Þat huy founden so fair a creature : of hire huy weren wel fayne. Þe prince hire nam and hire bi-hiet : to laten hire gon a-liue And, for heo was so fair and noble : habbe hire to wiue. ¶ Þis Maide seide þat heo nolde to hire spouse : him ne non oþur take. Þe prince nei&yogh;h for wrathþe wod : þo he was so fur-sake, he liet hire to deþe scheote : with Aruwene atþenende And þus heo and al hire compaygnie : to þe Ioye of heuene gan wiende; And þe &yogh;ongue king of Enguelonde : and is Moder also, And is &yogh;ongue soster Florentine : to deþe weren i-do, And þe pope Ciriac : and Bischopes mani on Þat for trewe hope of Martyrdom : with heom weren i-gon. Ore louerd hadde swiþe al. Ou louerd þe gret Ioye : of þat swete ferrede, þat swuch martyrdom for is al. þi loue : a-fenguen with-oute drede. In þe to hondrede &yogh;ere al. om. : and ei&yogh;te and þrittiþe &yogh;ere After ore louerdes buyrtyme : þis maidenes i-martrede were. ¶ Þis endleue þousend of clene maydenes : and al þis compaygnie I-burede weren in Coloyne : in one Nonnerie.— An Abbot þere was bi-side : þat heorde of þis cas, And ofte of þis clene Maydenes : þat gret Miracle þere was: he bad þe Abbesse of Coloyne : þat heo him graunti scholde A bodi of þis clene Maydenes : and he wolde it don in golde. Þo þis bodi was him i-take : twelf Monþe he liet it beo With-oute seluer oþur gold : in one cheste of treo. ¶ Þo þe twelf monþes weren a-go : ase þe Monekes weren ech-one A ny&yogh;t at Matines, þis MS. þis þis holie bodi : a-ros hire up allone, heo beu&yogh; hire to þe hei&yogh;e weued : and wende mildeliche A-mong al þe Couent forthþ : and out wel stilledliche. r. stilleliche Þe Monekus, þo huy þis i-sei&yogh;en : of-dradde and sorien r. sorie were: huy eoden to þe cheste þare heo [was] inne i-leid : and ne founden ire nou&yogh;t þere. ¶ "Þis," quath þe Abbod, "is ore wreche : for we hire i-do nadde In a schrine of gold, ase we bi-heten : þo we ire hidere ladden." To þe Abbesse of Coloyne : þe Abbod wende a-non And tolde þis cas al-hou it was : of þat Maide i-gon. huy wenden forthþ to þulke stude : þare heo was i-leid inne er, And heuen up þe þrouwes lid : and founden hire ligge þer Faire and euene ase heo dude er— : so luyte lime þere nas Þat ne lai ase heo was furst i-leid. : a fair Miracle þere was! Þe Abbesse was þo swyþe glad : and þe Nonnes euerechon, And þonkede god of þat faire Miracle : and hei&yogh;e sounguen a-non. ¶ Þe Abbot bad þat he moste habbe : þis holie bodi eft-sone, And seide he wolde honouri it faire : ase he au&yogh;te for-to done. Ake þe Abbesse nolde graunti it nou&yogh;t : ne þat couent noþur Þat eft it scholde habbe a-wei : þei he hadde i-beo heore broþur; For buy i-sei&yogh;en þat it was godes wille : þat it bi-lefde þere. Þis Abbod wende him hom a-&yogh;ein : with wel dreorie chere. Nou God us graunti, &yogh;if is wille is : þat we moten i-winne Þe hei&yogh;e Ioye of heouene : þare alle þis Maydenes beoth inne, Ne þat we neuere þarof ne missen : for none MS. nome sorie sunne.

15.1: SEinte Katerine of noble kunne: cam, bi olde dawe; Hire fader was king, hire Moder Quyene : boþe of þe olde lawe, Þe king . Coste. hire fader het. : gret clerk þis Mayde was; Þare nas non of þe seue .Ars : þat heo maister of nas. Maxentius het þe Aumperour : In eche londe he let crie Þat ech kynerich under him : come to Alisaundrie, Euerech Man for is stat : to don to heore godes sacrefise; ho-so i t lete, men scholde of him don : swyþe stronge Iustise. Þo ech lond was þudere i-come : to don heore lawe, Seinte katerine wel harde-liche : to-ward heom gan drawe; bi-halues heo stod and bi-heold : heore wrechche gydi-hede, heo sai&yogh; Anouri þe Maumates : and manie cristine Men for drede. Þo hadde heo gret deol in hire heorte : and blesse[de] hire a-non And forth anon to þe Aumperour : baldeliche heo gan gon. "Sire," heo seide, "riche Aumperour þou art : swiþe noble and hende, Þov scholdest þi wisdom and þi wit : to some guode wende. Þat i segge for þe folie : þat ich i-seo eov do— So muche feorrene folk : þov hast i-cleopet þar-to. Grete Ioie in ouwer heorte : þis temple &yogh;e makiez i-fo Þat is ymaud of lym and ston : and of ouwer Maumates also; &YOGH;wy ne bi-holde &yogh;e þe hei&yogh;e temple— : for þer-of wondri ov mai— Of þe heie heuene þat geth a-boute : a-bouen eov ni&yogh;t and dai, Of sonne and Mone and steorrene al-so : fram þe este to þe weste Þat trauaillieth and neuere werie ne beoth : ne neuere ne habbeth reste? bi-þench þe wel and turne þi wit : to some wisdome, ich rede, And &yogh;wane þin owene In-wit it seith : þat nou&yogh;were nis swuch dede, Al-mi&yogh;ti god þou him hold : þat swuch wonder can make; bi-fore alle oþere Anoure him : and þine Maumates for-sake." With oþere resones of clergie : þat mayde proffrede also Þat heore godes nau&yogh;tes ne were : þat heo Anoureden heom to. ¶ Þe Aumperour stod and ne couþe þar-to : Answerie In none wise; Gret wonder him þou&yogh;te of hire fair-hede : and of hire Quoyntise; "Mayde," he seide, "a-bijd here-with : for-to aftur ore sacrefise And we schullen more with þe speke : ich oþur mi Iustise." Þo þe sacrefise was i-don : þe Aumperour sat In is trone, And al is folk a-bouten him. : men brouten þat Maide sone. "Maide," seide þe Aumperur : "þou þinchest gent and freo; Of &yogh;wat kunrade art þou i-come? : gret wonder us þinchez of þe." ¶ "Sire Aumperur," þis Maide seide : "I-ne wilni bote luyte to tellen þe of mine kunne : for it were signe of pruyte; For In is boke þe wise Man : Catun seith al-so: Þat Man ne schal him-sulue preisi : ne blamie no-þe-mo, For so doth foles þat wilniez muche : of &yogh;elpingue and of sunne. Naþeles ichulle, ake for no pruyte : tellen eov of mine kunne: Ich am þe kingus dou&yogh;ter coste : þat þou wost &yogh;wuch is. hidere ich cam to speke mid eov : of þat &yogh;e bi-leuez a-mis; Mid vn-ri&yogh;te heo beozþ i-cleped godes : þat o fot ne mouwen go MS. gon Ne no man helpe in none neode : ne heom-sulue no-þe-mo." ¶ "Maide," seide MS. seide seide þis Amperur : "&yogh;if þat þis sothþ were, Al þis world were fals and guydi : &yogh;if þou one heom MS. heom heom scholdest [lere]; And we schulle betere i-leue alle men : and more it wole beo note, Þane ani fol womman ase þou art— : for ouwer bolt is sone i-schote." "Sire," seide þis Maide þo : "þei þou luyte telle of me, Also guod mai beo mi reson : ase þat comez of þe. For, sire Aumperur, þou MS. ich þou art : ase ech man is al-so Þat hote mai and hys men moten : nede hys hestes do, Of bodi and of soule þou art y-maud : ase þi-sulf mi&yogh;t i-seo; Mid ri&yogh;te þi soule Maister is : and þi bodi is hyne schal beo. &YOGH;if þi bodi maister is : and þi soule superscribed later. is hyne, A&yogh;en kuynde it is : and þou worst sikur : þare-fore of helle pine." Þoru&yogh; hire clergie þat holi Maide : resones made so quoynte Þat þe Aumperour ne non of his : ne couþe hire ansuerie in none pointe. "Maide," he seide, "þou schalt a-bide : In warde here mid me And oþere ichulle bi tyme finde : þat schullen Answerie þe." Þis Aumperour sende anon : wide a-boute is sonde Þat þe gretteste maistres of clergie : to him comen In eche londe, grete Mede of him to habbe : to don a luytel Maystrie, And for-to susteinen op heore lawe : þoru strencþe of clergie. So þat þare comen fifti Maistres : þe gretteste þat man fond Also wide ase men mi&yogh;ten seche : ou&yogh;were In ani lond. Þe Aumperour heom seide a-non : &yogh;ware-fore he after heom sende: For-to desputi a-&yogh;ein a &yogh;ong womman : þat al heore lawe schende. "Nou is þis," þat .o. Maister seide : "gret schame, ich onder-stonde, An Aumperur to sende a-boute : so wide in eche londe After þe gretteste Maistres, for-to despuyti : a-&yogh;en a fol wenche, &YOGH;wane on of heore knaue mi&yogh;ten sone : hire resones alle a-quenche!" "Nai," seide þis Aumperour : "heo is wisore þane &yogh;e wene; &YOGH;if &yogh;e mouwen ou&yogh;t a&yogh;en hire don : sone it worth i-sene. For ich habbe leouere þat &yogh;e hire ouer-come : with resones In some wise, Þane we with strencþe hire maden : to don þe sacrefise." "Lat bringue hire superscribed. forth," seide þat on : "and heo schal segge a-non Þat heo ne spac neuere wit wisore men : are heo fram us gon." ¶ An Aungel to þis maide cam : and bad hire of no-þing drede, And seide heo scholde heom alle þoru hire reson : to cristinedom lede, And heo alle scholden þoru hire reson : a-fonge martyrdam. Þo þat Maide i-herde þis : gret Ioie to hire heo nam, baldeliche heo eode forth : þo men aftur hire come. "Sire," he = heo seide to þe Aumperur : "&yogh;ifst þou a wis dom Þat þus fale maistres of clergie : bringest and sest a-benche, And me-self to desputy a-&yogh;eines heom : þat nam bote a fol wenche? And &yogh;if þat heo me ouer-comez : þou bi-hast heom gret mede, And makest me mid strencþe with heom speke : and ne bi-hast me bote luyte! Þat þinchez me with on-ri&yogh;te it is : &yogh;wane ich am one a-&yogh;ein heom alle. ¶ Nov ichulle, for god is min help : a-fonge þat me wole falle." "Seie, dame conIoun, &yogh;wat artþou?" : þis o legistre seide, "Þenchestþou speke a-&yogh;ein ore clergie? : turne þi þou&yogh;t, ich rede! Þov seist þat god al-mi&yogh;ti : dethz on eorþe þolede here: I-chulle proui þat he ne mi&yogh;te a-liue beo : nouþe In none manere. For, ho-so deiez, he ne may : neuerefft to liue come, &YOGH;wane þe vertue of al is bodi : þoru deþe him is bi-nome; And þi god al-mi&yogh;ti is ded : þou ne mi&yogh;t libbe nou&yogh;t, &YOGH;if he þat scholde &yogh;iue þe lijf : is to deþe i-brou&yogh;t." ¶ "Nai," seide þis holi mayde : "þou faillest of þin art, An-oþur þou most segge, &yogh;if þou þencst : of þine maistrie to habbe part. God hadde euere and euere he schal : mid him is god-hede, And for loue of us In ore flesche : he nam him man-hede: Of twei þingus he was þo imaked : eiþur moste þo is kuynde a-fonge. For þe kunde of man-hede us to bugge : he þolede deth wel stronge; Ake for-to bi-leue ded, a-&yogh;en kuynde it was : ase of is god-hede, Þare-fore he aros fram deþe to liue : þo he hadde i-don al is dede. For þe stronge deþe þat þoru&yogh; Adam : we weren to i-brou&yogh;t, Þoru&yogh; is godhede, i-meynd In ore kuynde : nede moste beon i-bou&yogh;t. &YOGH;if þou with-seist þis reson : an oþur i-chulle þe make Þat grete clerkes seiden In heore lawe : þat man ne may nou&yogh;t for-sake. ¶ Platon, þe grete philosophe : þat was heþene of ouwer lawe, he seide þat god wolde deie : and him-selue to liue a&yogh;en drawe. Lokiez In is boke, omit in is boke hov it mi&yogh;te beo soth : nouþe In ouwere r. oþer manere, bote þe muchele god of heuene : bi-come a luyte Man here. Also Balaam, ouwer prophete : þat heþene was al-so, In is bok he seide—&yogh;e wuten wel &yogh;ware : &yogh;if &yogh;e wollez loki þer-to— Þat þare scholde of Iacobes kuynde : a steorre a-rise wel bri&yogh;t Þat scholde kinges and princes : al bi-nimen heom heore mi&yogh;t. Þat was þat ore louerd wolde : of Iacobes kuynde beon i-bore & added. ouer-comen alle þat euere weren : sethþe oþer bi-fore. And &yogh;uyt þre kinges of ouwer lawe : on þulke steorre þou&yogh;ten, For þe steorre þo god was i-bore : and þare-fore lok him brou&yogh;ten." Þo þeos Maistres heorden þis mayde speke : of so grete clergie, heo ne couþen answerie hire of neuere a word : and &yogh;euen hire þe maistrie. ¶ Þo seide þe Aumperur In grete wrathþe : "nis non of eov þat can— A-mong so manie grete Maistres— : answerie a fol womman?" "Certes, sire," þis Maistres seiden : "so gret clerk nov nis Þat scholde to hire reson &yogh;iue answere : for heo seith so al. soþ i-wis, We seggeth, þe holie gost is with hire : and In hire mouþe, Þat we ne conne hire answerie nou&yogh;t : ne we ne dorren þei we couþe. Þare-fore, bote we betere of oure lawe : þane we &yogh;eot i-seon, Alle we seggez with one mouþe : cristine we wollez beon." "Ey, trichours," seide þe Aumperur : "is it icome þer-to? Certes, &yogh;e schullen euerech-one : beo to stronge deþe i-do." he het þat Men scholden a-midde toun : fur-berne heom echone. And huy afenge þe deth for godes loue : with-oute anie mone, And muche reuþe heo maden to katerine : I-baptizede þat heo nere. Þat Maide heom confortede wel : and cristine lawes gan heom lere, And seide þat heore stronge martyrdom : þat heo þoleden þere, In stude of cristine-dom scholde beon : &yogh;if heo stude-faste were. ¶ Þis Maistres weren wel glade þo : gladliche forth heo eode And nomen þane deth for godes loue : þat men heom wolde beode; Heo maden þe signe of þe croiz : þo men in þat fuyre hem caste. And þo heo hadden longe i-barnd : and dede weren atþe laste And þat fuyr was al a-queynt : al-hole heo leien þere, &YOGH;wittore and wel fairore [of] om. heu&yogh; : þane heo euere er were; Þare nas so luyte wem on heom : þat þe leste of heore here Oþur of heore cloþus a-peirede weren— : heo leien with faire chere. Þis Aumperur let fette a-non : þat Maide katerine: "haue reuþe of þi-sulf," he seide : "and schild þe fram pine! haue reuþe of þi noble bodi : þat is so fair and hende! For þou schalt beon in grete nobleye : &yogh;if þou wolt þi þou&yogh;t wende: In mi paleis ich schal þe make : hext after þe quene; After þi fourme ichulle þe make : An ymage, bri&yogh;t and schene, Ouer-guld and quoynte i-nov : and sette as a-midde þe cite, Þat ech man hire honouri schal : for honour of þe Ase men schullen to one god do. : þou ne schalt mid al þi lore So muche nobleie bi-þenche þe : þat I nelle don þe more." ¶ "Sire Aumperur," þis Maide seide : "let þi fole þou&yogh;t, For þov nast non more &yogh;wile to spille : þane speken embe nou&yogh;t. god almi&yogh;ties spouse ich am : and al þi blaundisinge Ne alle þine tormenz ne schullen min heorte : enes fram him bringe." Þe Aumperur hire let strep[e] naked : and to a piler faste hire bounden, With stronge schourges men beoten hire sore : and maden hire harde wounden. Þo heo ne mi&yogh;ten þare-with-al : turnen hire þou&yogh;t, In depe prisone and swiþe deorke : sone heo was i-brou&yogh;t; Þat no man hire mete ne &yogh;af ne drunch : þei heo scholde for hungur deie, For heo scholde to heore lawe hire þou&yogh;[t] tuyrne : and beon i-brou&yogh;t out of teie. In þat prison þat Maide lai : twelf dawes and twelf ni&yogh;t, Þat heo noþer .et. ne dronk : ne i-sai&yogh; non eorþelich li&yogh;t; A &yogh;wit coluere þare cam fram heuene : to hire euer-ech dai And brou&yogh;te hire fram heuene mete : In-to prisone ase heo lai. A day ase þe Aumperur was : out of þe toune i-fare, Þe Aumperesse þou&yogh;te on katerine : and hadde of hire gret care: Of hire bede wel priueliche : heo a-ros at mid-Ni&yogh;t, And nam with hire sire porfirie : þat was hire priue kny&yogh;t. Þo heo to þe prisone come : heo i-sei&yogh;en þare gret li&yogh;t; gret wounder heom þou&yogh;te &yogh;war-of were : þe deorke stude so bri&yogh;t. Þo heo i-sei&yogh;en al. sei&yogh;en heo seinte katerine : was In þe prisone grounde And an Aungel of heuene with hire stonde : and smerede hire wounde: ¶ Þe Aumperesse cride a-non : "Katerine," heo seide, "þin ore! Mine ri&yogh;te bi-leue þov tech me : I nelle beo fol non more." Þe kni&yogh;t al-so, sire porfirie : loude cride al-so, Þat muche folk þat þare-a-boute was : sone cam þer-to; Sire porfirie ful a-doun to hire fet : and merci he gan crie. With grete Ioye þis Maide prechede heom : of god and seinte marie; So þat Aumperesse and porfirie : þoru&yogh; þis Maide þere, And twei hondred of oþur folk : I-baptizede weren. ¶ Ore louerd him-sulf cam sethþe a-doun : to seinte katerine : "Lo," he seide, "here ich am : for &yogh;wam þou hast þis pine. In þine tormenz beo studefast : Ichulle beo mid þe; Þi sege is in heue[ne] i-maud : þare þov schalt wonien mid me." An oþur dai þe Aumperour : after þis Maide sende; Þat heo were ded, oþur al fur-fare : swiþe wel he wende. Þis Maide was bi-fore him y-brou&yogh;t : swiþe fat and round. "&YOGH;wat," he seide, "hou geth þis? : heo is hol and sound? &YOGH;ware beoth þis traitores," he seide : "þat hire In prisone wuste? Stilleliche heo hire habbeth i-fed : þat no man it nuste. bi þe treuþe þat i schal to Mahon : heo ne schullen so non-more!" he let nime alle þe gayholers : and tormenti heom ful sore. ¶ "Sire Aumperur," þis Maide seide : "is þis a guod Ivggement, gulte-lese Men for mine gulte : to bringe in swuche torment? he þat hath me i-fed : him ne drat of þe ri&yogh;t nou&yogh;t: For an Aungel it was of heuene : þat mete me hath i-brou&yogh;t. Do me &yogh;wat torment þat þov wolt : and lat heom quite gon: For-soþe, þat al. of þat þou on heom seist : gult heo ne habbez non." "Ey., hendie Maide Katerine" : seide þis Aumperour, "Þench op-on þi noble stat : of alle Maidenes þov art flour; Torne þi þou&yogh;t and þou schalt beon : þe Aumperesse per; heo ne schal no-þing bi-fore þe habbe : bote þat heo me mot beo ner." "guode man," seide þis holie mayde : "þov spext embe nou&yogh;t: For al þi pouwer þou ne schalt : fram ihesu crist wende mi þou&yogh;t. Al þat torment þat þou mi&yogh;t þenche : And of alle [day longe, d. l. wr. by a later hand on an erasure. ] Þov mi&yogh;t don me &yogh;if þou wolt : redi ich am to fonge; For ich ne wilni no-þing so muche : ase mi flechs and mi blod, i-wis, to &yogh;iue for mi louerdes loue : þat for me he &yogh;af his." Þo was þe Aumperur so wroth : þat he was nei&yogh; i-swowe. Four &yogh;weles of Iren he let fullen : with rasores, kene I-nowe, And with ginne heom makede tuyrne a-boute : þe tweien on þat on half opward, Þe oþur tweine euene heom a-&yogh;ein : In þat oþur half a-done-ward, Þat, ho-so bi-twene were : In none half ne mi&yogh;te him wende Þat þe rasores nolden al is flechs : to-drawen and to-rende. Sone so þis Maide was i-don þar-on : hire bodi for-to schende, Ore swete louerd fram heuene : an Aungel to hire gan sende: Þis Aungel with a drawe swerd : þe &yogh;weoles al-to-hev, Þat þe peces a-boute flowen : ase corn &yogh;wane man it sev, And smot al. smite of þis luþere men : wel harde to þe grounde; Four þousend þ[er]e weren a-slawe : In a lutel stounde. Þo nuste þe Aumperur &yogh;wat he mi&yogh;te don : for deol ne for sore. Þe Aumperesse nolde hele hire stat : lengore þo nam-more: ¶ "Sire," heo seide, "hou gez þis? : for godes loue, þin ore! Ich i-seo þat þis mayde is guod : and of holi lore, Ower Maumates ichulle for-sake : Inelle on hem bi-leue more." Þo gan þe Aumperur for wrathþe : loude &yogh;eolle and rore. he ne mi&yogh;te fram Ihesu crist : hire þou&yogh;t no-þing wende: he het men þat r. þat men scholden hire lede : to þe tounes ende And hire bresten fram hire bodi : with Irene crokes rende And þare-after smiten of hire heued : þe more forto r. hire to schende. Wit guode heorte þe Aumperesse : þane deth gan a-fonge; Þe quellares heo bad hi&yogh;en faste : and ne a-biden nou&yogh;t to longe. Heo nomen þe kene crokes of Ire : þat hire flechs depe gnowe, And, also man draweth with combes wolle : hire tetes heo to-drowe Fram hire bodi mossel mele : and sethþe smiten of hire heued. Þat bodi, for houndes it scholden ete : vn-bured it was bi-leued. Ake porfirie it burede a-ni&yogh;t : þat holi bodi and guod. Þo þe Aumperur þat bodi miste : he was wroth and wod; he tormentede þare-fore manie Men : þat ne mi&yogh;ten heom nou&yogh;t skere. Þo eode porfirie forth : and seide, "sire, lo me here, Ich burede þat holie bodi : þat was cristus make; And to Ihesu crist ich habbe al-so : al min heorte i-take; For no pouwer þat þou mi&yogh;t don : I-nelle him for-sake." Þo gan þe Aumperur for deol and sor : alle is lymes to schake. ¶ "Mahun," he seide, "hou schal þis beo? : &yogh;wat schal ich nou do, Nov Ich habbe mi wif for-lore : and mi kni&yogh;t porfirie al-so? And porfirie al min heorte was! : &yogh;wy neltþou me rede?" Þo wenden þis oþure kny&yogh;tes forth : and loude heo gonne grede, "We nellez þane deth for godes loue : no leng bi-leue for drede." Þo gan þe Aumperur to-drawe is her : and sore siche and grone, "Mahun," he seide, "&yogh;wat schal ich do? : hov schal ich bi-leue allone? &YOGH;wi neltþou raþer fette me : and bringe me of þusse liue, Þane soffri alle mine men to leose : after mine leoue wiue? Þei þou nelle, mahun, helpe me : I-ne for-sake þe nou&yogh;t, Þis foles þat habbez þe for-sake : to deþe heo schulle beo brou&yogh;t." He let nime porfire þene guode kny&yogh;t : and is felawes echone And smiten of heore heuedes with-oute toun : ase Mahones fon. Þo let he fette katerine : "Dameysele," he seide, Þei þov me bi-nome mi wijf : mid þine fole rede, I-chulle, &yogh;if þou wul torni þi þou&yogh;t : fur-&yogh;iue þine misdede And with gret nobleie ase min Aumperesse : ouer-al with me þe lede." ¶ "Certes, sire," þis Maide seide : "þis wordes beoth alle for nau&yogh;t: Þov ne schalt me neuere bringue fram him : þat hath min heorte i-cau&yogh;t. Do þat þov wolt, and haue i-don : and bring þi wille to ende, For þou ne schalt neuere for no-þing : min herte fram Ihesu wende." "&YOGH;ware beo &yogh;e, mine quellares?" : þe Aumperur þo seide, "Faste &yogh;e schulle þe wychche binde : and with-oute toune lede, And smitez r. smite of hire heued a-non : an don þe guode dede, Þat heo ne bringe us neuereft : In soruwe ne In drede." Þo þis Maide was i-brou&yogh;t : to slene with-oute þe toun, hire preiere heo maude to god : a-knes heo sat a-doun: "Louerd," heo seide, "graunte þou me : þat ech man þat hath in om. in mone In ani neode oþur in ani anuy : of mine passione, graunte þat he mote to is wille : help a-fonge sone." Þo cam ore louerd him-self to hire : and grauntede hire bone. ¶ "Cum forth," he seide, "mi suete leman : mi leue spouse al-so: heuene-&yogh;at a-&yogh;ein þe I-opened is : þare þou schalt comen to." A quellare hire heued of smot. : þat folk þat a-boute heom stode, &YOGH;wijt Milk heo i-sei&yogh;en eorne out of þe wounde : and nou&yogh;t o drope of blode. Aungles comen and nomen þat bodi : a-mong alle þe manne And to þe hul of synay it beren : tuenti Iorneies þanne, And bureden it þare In one faire place : wit grete nobleye and riche; Þare þoru&yogh; Ihesu cristes grace : hire bones restez &yogh;uyte. Þare-of &yogh;eot to þis day : þare eornez eoille wel riue, &YOGH;ware-with manie sike Men : beoz to hele i-brou&yogh;t and to liue; Wide In londe it is i-lad : þat ho-so it habbe mote, Noble relike it is al-so : sike Men to don bote. Þre hundred &yogh;er and twenti : after þat god was i-bore, I-Martred was þis holie Maide : of &yogh;wam we tolden bi-fore. Ihesu crist, for þe suete loue : of seinte Katerine graunti us þe Ioye of heuene : and schilde us fram helle pine. Amen amen, segge we alle : for is holie tyme.

16.1: SEinte lucie, þat holie Mayde : In Cezile was i-bore; &YOGH;ong heo bi-gan to serui god : and bi-lefde sunne and hore; Dame Evtice hire Moder het : þat hire to wommane brou&yogh;te— Of hire childe wel glad heo was : ase heo suyþe wel ou&yogh;te. So bi-feol þat on Dame Eutice cam a siknesse : swiþe greuous and long— Four &yogh;er he = heo hadde gret pine— : þe menison of blode wel strong. On leches heo hadde i-spendet MS. i spendedet : Muche del of hire guod, Ake þare nas non þat hire hele mi&yogh;te : þat heo ne bledde euere blod. So þat wide In þe londe Men tolden : of seinte Agace, Of Miracles þat comen at hire schrine : þoru ore louerdes grace In þe cite of Cathenes : þere þis holi womman lay; Folk wende þudere wel wide : boþe Ni&yogh;t and day bi manie scor to-gadere : of eche londe a-boute. Þo seinte lucie þis i-sai&yogh; : al dai so gret route, "Moder," heo seide, "þou hauest an vuel : ful greuous with-alle And we hereth of miracles al day : þat of seinte Agace doth falle: go we þudere forth mid oþure : to þe holie seint Agace, And þare þou schalt to hele come : þoru&yogh; ore louerdes grace." ¶ Nov was lucie stilleliche : I-torned to cristine-dom, Ake hire Moder heþene was : and al þat heo of com; Lucie to ane heþene manne : was i-weddet In hire &yogh;ong-hede, Ake Naþeles clene Mayde heo was : with-oute eche fol dede. Hire Moder heo nam stilleliche : and with oþere Men heo wende To seinte Agace Toumbe : hire Moder for-to amende. vv. 25-6 are tr. in the other MS. And i-heorde þe Masse a dai : mid oþure þat þere were, Þo heo weren þudere i-come— : so longue al. a stounde heo lefden þere. So þat þe godspel was þat day : ase lucie onder-stod, Of a womman þat &yogh;wylene hadde : þe menison of blod And cam ant touchede þe lappe : of ore louerdes cloþes ene Ase he eode In grete prece : and was hol a-non and clene. "Leoue Moder," seide lucie : "&yogh;if þov bi-leuest on holi churche And þe wordes of þis godspel : and þer-after wolt wurche, Þoru&yogh; touchingue of seinte Agace toumbe : þou&yogh; schalt beo hol a-non, Ase þeo womman &yogh;wylene was : þat aftur ore louerd gan gon." Þo þat folk was al i-went : seinte lucie cam To seinte Agace holie toumbe : and ire Moder with hire nam; Þare heo leien In heore beden : heo nolden þannes gon. ¶ So þat lucie, þat clene Maide : werth a-slepe a-non. Seinte Agace, þat holie Maide : to hire fram heuene a-li&yogh;te, With gret felau&yogh;-schipe of Aungles— : hire croune schon wel bri&yogh;te; "Lucie," heo seide, "leoue soster : &yogh;wy trauaillestþou so And &yogh;wy biddestþou me so &yogh;eorne þat þing : þat þou mi&yogh;t þi-self do For þine bi-leue, þat is so guod : helpez þi Moder, i-wis: And nov þoru þe and þine guod-nesse : þi Moder i-held is. And also ase þis cite is : i-wuyrþet muche þoru&yogh; me, Also schal þi contreie : Anoured beon for þe; For þi clene Maiden-hod : and for þi holie lif, i-wis, Þi woneingue is wel &yogh;are i-maket : with us in heuene-blis." Þo þis holie Maide a-wok : heo bi-gan to quakien sore; ¶ "Moder," heo seide, "þov art hol : ne þarfþe drede non-more. For þe loue of þat holie Maide : þat þe hath to hele i-brou&yogh;t, Ne fonde þov neuere to bringue me : of mi clene þou&yogh;t And ne soffre þou nou&yogh;t mine spouse in folie : mi Maiden-hod a-spille, Ne lat me nou&yogh;t leose þat longue lif : for a luytel fol wille! Ake al þat þou i-grauntet hast : for-to &yogh;iue him with me, Lat me it &yogh;iue þe pouere men : Moder, ich bidde þe." Þe Moder, þo heo hol was : guod womman bi-cam, And þe dou&yogh;ter bi hire Moder wille : þat guod to hire heo nam; heo hit delte a-mong pouere Men : þe &yogh;wyle þare i-laste ou&yogh;t. to him þat hire spouse was : þe teoþingue was i-brou&yogh;t: he wende to seinte lucies norice : and axede hire wel stille &YOGH;wat lucie were on bi-come : heore guod for-to a-spille, ¶ And &yogh;wi heo dude it so a-wei : and &yogh;wodere heo dude it bere. Þis norice wel quoyntelich : &yogh;af him a-non answere: "heo hath ifounde forto sulle : swyþe derewurþe þing, i-wis, Þat is suych a þousent more wurth : þanne al þat þing þat is; Þe beste chaffare it is i-bou&yogh;t : þat euere Man to drou&yogh;; Woldestþou gon þare-Inne In part : riche man þou were i-nou&yogh;"— Þat was þe chaffare þe blisse of heuene : þat heo hadde i-bou&yogh;t. gret wonder he hadde of þulke Answere : and stod in gret þou&yogh;t. So þat he onder-&yogh;at sone : þat heo cristine was. In grete wrathþe he tolde fore : þe Iustice, þat het pakas. MS. þakas Lucie was sone i-fet : and bi-fore þe Iustice i-brou&yogh;t. "Maide," seide þe Iustice : "&yogh;wat hast þou i-þou&yogh;t? ¶ Let þi folie," he seide : "Ich rede, on alle wiffe, And to ore godes, ase ri&yogh;t is : do þine sacrefise!" "Ich habbe," quat h þis holie Maide : "al þis þre &yogh;er i-do Mine sacrefise to Iesu crist : and &yogh;uyt i-chulle al-so: Al þat ich hadde ich habbe ispended : and bi-take In is lore; And þer-to ichulle mi bodi take : &yogh;wane me nis bi-leued nomore. Spene corr. to spend by a later hand. i-chulle nou al mi bodi : fram þe fot to þe heued And euerech lime In is seruise : nov me nis more bi-leued; Ich &yogh;elde him op al mi bodi : sire Iustise, here bi-fore þe, to spene corr. to spend by a later hand. ech lime In is seruise— : do &yogh;wat þou wolt bi me!" ¶ "Nov ich wot," quath þe Iustise : "&yogh;ware-to þou tornest þi mod: For In hore-dom and In lecherie : þou hast i-spend al þi guod, Þar-on þou wolt þi bodi al spene corr. to spend by a later hand. : and þar-of þou dest preche; &YOGH;wane þov nast non more to spene corr. to spend by a later hand. : for-soþe þou worst a wrechche: For þov spext ase an hore strong : &yogh;wane þou wolt for-sake Þi louerd þat þou art to i-weddet corr. to i-wedded. : and to lechours þe take." "I-wedded ich was to Ihesu crist" : þis holie maide him tolde "Þo ich was i-baptized : and þulke weddingue ichulle holde. Ake to hore-dome þov woldest me bringue : &yogh;wane þov me woldest make Mine spousede louerd Ihesu crist : for ani oþur man for-sake." "Þou schalt for-sake him," quath þe Iustise : "haddestþou it i-swore: For to þe commune bordel þov schalt beo : i-lad oþur i-bore, The following part of this legend is written as prose, in two columns on each page on f. 60b. And þare schal mani a moder-child : go to þi foule licame And ligge bi þe, alle þat wollez : in hore-dom and in schame." ¶ "Ne mai no wumman," quath þis maide : "of hire maiden-hod beo ido For no dede þat men deth þe bodie : bote ire herte beo a later hand adds consente. þerto. For þe more þat mi bodi a-&yogh;ein mi wille : here defouled is, Þe clenore MS. clenore is mi mayden-hod : and þe more mi mede, i-wis." ¶ Þe Iustise let wide a-boute : into al þe contreie crie : Þat alle þat wolden : bi a swuch fair wumman don anie folie, Comen to hire, alle þat wolden : for alle heo scholde heom take, a later hand adds consente. For in bordel heo scholde beo i-do : þare heo ne scholde non fur-sake. he hiet is men nimen hire faste : and to þe bordel hire lede anon Alle þat mi&yogh;hten nei&yogh;h hire come : faste huy hire drowen ech-on, huy schoue and drowe al þat huy mi&yogh;hte : ake huy ne mi&yogh;hten hire anne fote i-winne Ne o fote uchchen of þe stude : þare as heo stod inne. Þo nomen huy ropes strongue i-nou&yogh; : ant to fet and hondene teide, And alle þat mi&yogh;hten þere nei&yogh;h come : faste huy drowen and breide; A þousend men with al heore main : on hire gonne drawe : Ac euere heo lai stille a-&yogh;ein : huy ne mi&yogh;hten hire enes wawe. ¶ "&YOGH;wat, hou goth þis?" quath þe iustise : "&yogh;wat resun mai þis beo Þat a þousend ne mouwen nou&yogh;t þis womman : of þe stude enes teo?" ¶ "Sire iustise," þat Maide seide : "þou hontest a-boute nou&yogh;t: For, þei þou haddest &yogh;eot to heom : ten þousend mo i-brou&yogh;t, &YOGH;uit it scholde bi-foren eov alle : bi folfuld bi me her Þat holie vers þat seint Dauid : seithþ in þe sauter: [Ps. 90] Þat a þousend men scholden in mi side falle : and to grounde beon i-brou&yogh;t, And ten þousend in mi ri&yogh;ht side : and nei&yogh;h me ne comen nou&yogh;t. Þare-fore it is al for nou&yogh;t : þat þou hontest here-a-boute; God is strengore þane þou be : and þare-fore i-nabbe no doute." ¶ "Þou art strong wichche," quath þe iustise : "and þar-of Man schal þe bringue, Mine clerkes and mine enchauntours : bi-nime schullen þi wich|chingue." His clerkes he let bringue forth : and his enchauntours echone: And huy maden heore coniurisones : a-boute þis Maide alone. And þo huy hadden al ido þat huy couþen : þat folk gan eft-sones drawe: Ake euere heo lai i-liche stille : huy ne mi&yogh;hten hire enes wawe. ¶ Þe Iustise, þo he þis i-sei&yogh; : for wrathþe he was nei&yogh;h wod. "Certes," he seide, "hire wichchingue : ne schal do hire no guod." Strongue temene he liet fette : of Oxene mani on And bringue þere þis Maide was : and to hire tei&yogh;en ech-on; He liet heom prikie and harli faste : and huy guonne drawe and pluchche: And euere lai þis Maide stille : huy ne mi&yogh;hten hire enes wawe. ¶ "Certes," he seide, "ore fare nis nou&yogh;t : oþur-&yogh;wat we moten do, With oþer þing we schullen hire to nau&yogh;te bringue : &yogh;wane we ne mouwen so. Makieth ope þe hore, þare heo lijthþ : &yogh;wane we ne mouwen hire winne heonne, Also strong fuyr ase &yogh;e conne : þat heo al-to douste brenne!" A strong fuir and gret i-nou&yogh; : þis tormentores wrou&yogh;te Aboute þis holie clene maide : to brenne hire al-to nou&yogh;te. Þo þis fuyr was wel strongue i-maud : heo sat a-midde ful stille; Þat fuyr ne mi&yogh;hte don hire non harm : þat were wurth a fille. Þo nomen huy pich and brumston : and welden it wel faste And ope hire nakede tendre bodi : al-fuyri it casten. ¶ Euere sat þis Maide stille : it ne greuede hire no-þing, Ake euere heo prechede with glade heorte : of Ihesu, heuene king. ¶ Þo nuste þis luþere iustise : &yogh;wat he mi&yogh;hte don more. &YOGH;wane he ne mi&yogh;hte þis clene þing : ouer-come mid al is lore, A scharp swerd and a kene : þoru&yogh; hire þrote he liet do, To bi-nimen hire speche : and hire lijf also. Þo heo was þoru&yogh; þe þrote i-smite : þe betere heo spac i-nou&yogh;, And prechede euere of Ihesu crist : and wel smere lou&yogh;: ¶ "&YOGH;e þat beoth cristine : glade and bliþe &yogh;e beo, Of no-þing ne habbe &yogh;e drede : for gret ioy ich i-seo! Ane Ioyeful þyþingue ich eou telle : þat sothþ is and nou&yogh;t les: Þat ri&yogh;ht nouþe is holi churche : i-brou&yogh;t in guod pes: For hire tweie wiþerwines : þat habbez i-beo so &yogh;are, Ri&yogh;ht nouþe beoth to nau&yogh;t i-brou&yogh;t : &yogh;e þorue habbe of heom no kare. For þe luþere dioclician : þat so muche harm hath i-do, he is i-pult out of his kynedom : he ne cometh non-more þar-to; And also Maximian : þat so luþur hath i-beo, Ri&yogh;th nouþe he deide in luþur deth : &yogh;e schulle him non-more i-seo; So þat þe luþere wiþer-wines : þat a-&yogh;ein holie churche were, Out of heore mi&yogh;hte beoth i-brou&yogh;t : ne habbe &yogh;e none fere. ¶ Þus glade tyþingue ich eov bringue : þei huy feor heonne beo— I-hered beo god, þat ich moste : þis dai a-liue i-seo! I-chulle bi-teche ou ihesu crist : for fram eov ich mot wende. Bringuth me ore louerdes flechs and is blod : for þat schal beo mi corr. to my ende." ¶ Þe preostes wenden forth anon : and folk þat þere stod, And fetten to þis holie maide : godes fl[e]chs and is blod. Þo heo it hadde under-fongue : and hire ri&yogh;htes al-so, And þe oresones weren alle i-seid : þat bi-fullen þer-to, Mid þe laste [word] om. heo &yogh;af þene gost : ase huy amen seide. Aungles þare weren redie I-nowe : hire soule to heuene lede. Þere heo is with ihesu crist : in Ioye with-outen ende. Nou god for seinte lucie loue : þudere us late i-wiende! Amen.

17.0: 27 ¶ Ici poez oyer coment seint Thomas de Kaunterbures nasqui. e de quev manere gent de pere e de Mere.
17.1: WOlle &yogh;e nouþe i-heore þis englische tale : þat is here i-write Of seint Thomas of Caunterburi : al-hou he was bi-&yogh;ite? Of londone is fader was : A bordeys r. borgeys hende and fre, Gilbert Bekat was is name : þe bok tellez me. Ake is Moder was of heþenesse. : nov sone &yogh;e mouwen i-heore Al-hou heo cam into engelonde : are heo i-cristned were. Gilebert him bi-þou&yogh;te : þe Croiz for-to fo In-to þe holie lond : his penaunce þe bet to do. So þat, þo he þudere cam : he was sone i-nome, Ase A sclaue forth i-lad : and i-don In prisone, And faste was i-gwiued : he and manie mo, And i-wust wel sikerliche : þat he ne scholde a-wei go. In þe Amirales prisone orig. prisones : heo hadden i-beo so longue, To &yogh;eres and an half : In bendes swiþe strongue, So þat god &yogh;af þe Amiral : boþe heorte and wille Þe more to louien Gilebert : for he was meoke and stille. Eche daie &yogh;wane þe Amiral : to is mete wolde go, he bad, Gilebert to is mete : scholde come also— gret auantage, for-soþe, it was : þat he mi&yogh;te so gon; Ake euere he hadde ane peire feteres : faste him up-on. And ofte-siþes þe Amiral : dude for Gilebardes loue Auantage to is felawes : þat with him weren In prisone. hit bi-feol þat Amiral : Ane faire dou&yogh;ter hadde— Childrene of is owene : none mo for-soþe he nadde. priueliche heo dude for Gilebert : Auantages manie and fele. And ofte-siþe heo wolde speke with him : &yogh;wane heo mi&yogh;te to bi|stele— For heo ne dorste bi-fore hire fader : laste he it onder-&yogh;ete Þat it were for gyle : þat heo with him speke. &YOGH;eot it bi-feol In a dai : þat heo sai&yogh; þo heo mi&yogh;te: to Gillebert heo eode priueliche : and echste him &yogh;wat he hi&yogh;te And of &yogh;wat bi-leue he were : and of &yogh;wyche londe, And &yogh;if he wolde for is louerdes loue : þene deth a-fonge. Gilbert hire Ansuerede þo : In swiþe fair manere: "Of engelonde ich am, and cristine Man : þei ich beo nouþe here; Mi name is Gilbert beket : of Londene þe cite; gladliche icholde þane deth a-fongue : for is loue þat MS. þad. bou&yogh;te me, And for-to saui mi cristine-dom : and mine trewe bi-leue al-so." Þis womman to Gilbert wel sone : þeos wordes heo seide to: "Cristine-dom ichulle onder-fonge : for þe loue of þe, And þou a-non aftur-ward : treweliche weddi me." Gilbert was ful sore a-drad : of þis wommane sawe, Laste heo wolde bi-Meldi him : &yogh;ware-þoru&yogh; he were a-slawe. To &yogh;eres and an half he was sclaue : and þat him þou&yogh;te longe: So þat he and is felawes : gonne heom onder-stonde Þat heo wolden þet prison breke : and A-weiward gon; Sore heo weren alle a-ferd : for traison of þat womman. Þat prison heo breken : ri&yogh;t þulke daie at eue; Forth heo wenden alle a-wei : þare nolde non bi-leue. In þe morewe-tide heo weren i-sou&yogh;t : bote þer nas non i-founde. Ak þo bi-þou&yogh;te þat Maiden hire : In wel luyte stounde hov heo mi&yogh;te best on take : and &yogh;wat heo mi&yogh;te do; So þat heo porueide hire : and fort a-wei gan go. Al-bi ny&yogh;te heo wende a-wei : men nusten &yogh;ware heo bi-cam. Ne heo ne couþe nanne wei : bote god was hire lodes-man. Þoru&yogh; godes grace heo was i-lad : with men þat onder-stoden hire langage, So þat heo cam to þe se : and redi fond hire passage. Þane wei heo Axede In hire langage : In-to engelonde; So þat heo cam with pilegrimes : ase ich me onder-stonde, Ouer þe se sauf and wel : þoru&yogh; grace þat heo hadde Of Iesu crist, and socur of men : þat hire ouer ladden. heo ne couþe no-þing conteini hire : ne speken no-þe-mo; Ake euere heo axede In hire langage : to londone for-to go. Mid pilegrimes and þoru grace of god : to londone heo cam. And þo heo was þudere i-come : þare ne knev heo no man, Ne heo ne couþe speke ne hire bi-seo : bote ase a best þat a-strayed were. Þare-fore on hire gapede alday : swyþe muche fol[c] þere, boþe Men and wommen : and children suyþe fale— for hire continaunce was wonderful : and hire speche no Man ne couþe þare. In Manie stretes heo hadde i-wandret— : þat Man may wel i-wite, So þat bi-fore gilbertes house : þe Noyse was onder-&yogh;ite. For þe knaue þat hadde with him : In heþenesse i-beo, to þe dore he orn swyþe : þe dune for-to i-seo. he i-sai&yogh; þat it was þe Amirales dou&yogh;ter : þat al þe wondringue was on: hasteliche he tornede In a-&yogh;en : to is louerd a-non, And seide, þe Amirales dou&yogh;ter was : In þe strete þare-oute, And suyþe gret prece of gurles and Men : comen hire al-a-boute; he seide, "al þe gredinge is for hire : þat &yogh;e doth nouþe i-heore." "Louerd," seide gilbert, "&yogh;weþur heo beo : al-one with-outen fere?" he het is knaue loki sothþeliche : &yogh;if þat heo it were; And bad hire leden to ane guode wyues house : and a-stunte with hire þere, And þat heo hire scholde finde i-nou&yogh; : of al þat heo hadde neode, ri&yogh;t ase heo wolde is owene bodi : and he hire þar-of bede. Al-so tyme ase þis knaue : to þis Mayde cam, For Ioye heo ful a-doun i-swowe : opon þe harde ston. Þo hire stat was a-&yogh;ein i-come : þe knaue hire op nam, And heo wel gladliche with him eode : to þulke guode womman. An d heo hire onder-feng swiþe faire : for gilberdes loue; heo makede hire wel an-Ayse : and was hire swyþe wel-come. Gilbert him bi-þou&yogh;te : a-non so he hadde i-ete, To þe bischop for-to gon : with him forto speke, Þare he was at seint poules : of him to habbe red a-non Al-&yogh;wat him were of þat Maide : is beste forto don. Þane bischop of londone : for-soþe he fond þere, And fyue oþur bischopes : with him þare were; So þat he fond þare six bischopes : þe beste of Engelonde. And þo Gilbert i-sai&yogh; heom alle : bi-fore heom he eode stonde; he bi-gan to telle is tale : þoru&yogh; is owene Mouth, And are he hadde al i-told : heo was swyþe selcouth. he tolde hou he In þe Amirales prisone : in heþenesse hadde i-be And hov þe Amirales dou&yogh;ter to him seide : þat was so fair and fre, Al-hov þat heo wolde cristine bi-come : for enchaison of him &YOGH;if he wolde weddi hire : and for-saken al hire kun; And hou he and is felawes : bi-twene hem alle bi-speke For drede of hire wordes : þat prison for-to breke, &YOGH;If þat heo mi&yogh;ten grace habbe : a-wei for-to gon, laste heo weren alle for hire : to stronge deþe i-don; And al-hou heo was to londone i-come : and fram so fer i-gon, gret wonder þar-of he hadde : for language ne couþe heo non. Þo þis bischopes hadden i-heord : þat gilbert heom hadde i-told, Þe bischop of wynchestre it wel onder-stod : for he was wis and bold: Þat hit was al þoru&yogh; godes grace : þat heo was so fer i-come, Out of hire owene londe so fer : þat heo þoru miseise ne hadde i-be nome; MS. nonome. For heo ne couþe language non : with men for-to speke, With &yogh;wan heo mi&yogh;te i-winnen hire : herboruwe and drinke and mete. he seide, "with-oute faille : &yogh;if god hathþ i-porueid so þat heo for gilberdes loue : cristinedom wole onder-fo, And gilberd hire wolde weddi : sum blede of hire schal come Þat schal holie churche holde to ri&yogh;te : and serui godes sone. For we it mowen wel i-wite : and we wollen us onder-stonde: Þat heo is in-to þis londe i-come : it is godes sonde. for þat þing þat god helpe wole : ne schal nou&yogh;t beo for-fare." Alle þeos oþure bischopes : a-cordeden to þis tale, And seiden þat gilberd scholde weddi hire : and holden hire to wiue, &YOGH;if heo wolde i-cristned be : and tuyrne to clene liue. So þat a-non-ri&yogh;t þene moruwe : i-porueid it was al-&yogh;are At seint poules churche, þat heo scholde : Icristned beo ri&yogh;t þare. Þo þe baptisterie was al-redi : to hire baptizingue, Þe bischopes beden þat Men scholden : þe womman bi-fore heom bringe. Þo heo cam bi-fore þe bischopes : heo axeden hire wel sone &YOGH;if heo wolde i-cristned beo : ase lawe was for-to done. heo answerede In hire langage : wel sone heom a-&yogh;en: &YOGH;if gilbert wolde hire weddi : i-cristned heo wolde ben And bote he hire weddi wolde : heo nolde cristinedom a-fongue, heo seide heo wolde raþer tuyrne a&yogh;en : In-to hire owene londe. Gilberd couþe hire language. : þare he stod wel stille: to þe bischopus he seide : he wolde don heore wille. So þat heo i-cristned was : ase god hire &yogh;af þe grace, Of alle þe six bischopes : and i-spouse in þe place. hire heþene name ne j nou&yogh;t telle : for-soþe &yogh;wat heo hiet, Þe name þat heo of cristindom hadde : i-wute &yogh;e schullen &yogh;et: heo was i-nemd Alisaundre : as ich me onder-stonde; Seint Thomas was on hire bi-&yogh;ite : pris-martyr of engelonde. Þo Gilbert orig. Gilberd hire hadde i-weddet : wel glad of him heo was. Þe furste Nij&yogh;t þat he knovlei&yogh;te hire : he bi-&yogh;at seint thomas. Fram þe tyme þat he was bi-&yogh;ite : for-to þat he was i-bore he ne lai non more bi hire : þane he dude bi-fore. Anon-ri&yogh;tes a-morewe : so gret wille him nam to þe holi londe for-to gon : þat he cam erore fram, Þat him þoute dei&yogh;e he scholde : bote he wende a-&yogh;enward sone. Ake he bi-þou&yogh;te him of is wiues stat : &yogh;wat were of hire to done, laste heo wolde mourny swyþe : &yogh;wane he were a-gon, And gret deol to hire nime— : for langage ne couþe heo non Þat ani Man couþe onder-stonde : þat heo speke to, bote gilbert oþur [his] knaue. : þare-fore him [was] ful wo. So þat gilbert was in grete þou&yogh;te : and bi-gan to sike sore, laste is wif gret harm habbe scholde : &yogh;wane he i-wend weore. Þare-fore gilbert mournede muche : and si&yogh;te stille and softe, laste is wif fur-fare scholde : he bi-þou&yogh;te him ofte. for þe mourningue þat he makede : is wif it onder-stod, And for he si&yogh;te i-lomeliche : þat i-chaunged was is mod. his wif him axede swiþe &yogh;eorne : and a-raysonede him wel tou&yogh;te, &YOGH;if him mis-likede ani-þing : þat grefde him in þou&yogh;te. So streitliche heo fraynede him : þat he ne mi&yogh;te no leng for-sake: he tolde hire hov gret wille he hadde : þene wei a-&yogh;ein to take, For-to trauaili is bodi more : ase euerech man wel ou&yogh;te, Al for-to honouri Iesu crist : þat him so deore a-bou&yogh;te. Þo heo sai&yogh; gilbertus wille : þat it was so guod, heo nolde no-þing a-&yogh;en him beo : for-to chaungi is mod, Ake heo &yogh;af him conseil þane wei to gon : þat he hadde In þou&yogh;te, And forto queme Iesu crist : þat him deore bou&yogh;te. Þare was i-sene þat heo was treowe : and of studefast mod! heo nolde letten hire louerd nou&yogh;t to done : þat him þou&yogh;te god, Ake euere heo bad him þane wei gon : þat he hadde In þou&yogh;t For-to serui is creatour— : þare-a-&yogh;ein he o nolde beo nou&yogh;t, And &yogh;eorne he = heo bad for enchaison of hire : he ne scholde it nou&yogh;t bi-leue.
