Saue MS. sone heo bi-sou&yogh;te gilbert : þat he one bone hire &yogh;eue: Þat heo moste is knaue with hire habbe : þat hire langage couþe, And for he scholde hire solas beo : and speke to hire with mouþe. heo truste so muche to Iesu crist : þat to cristinedom ire hadde i-brou&yogh;t, Þat heo ne scholde nou&yogh;t fur-fare— : so treowe was hire þou&yogh;t. Gilebard lefde is knaue wit hire : his name was Richard Mone. he greiþede him wel haste-liche : and wende is wei wel sone. To þe holie londe he wende : In penaunce ase he dude er, And þare he bi-lefde þo : fulle furthþe-half &yogh;er. Þo he hadde þre &yogh;er þare i-be : and an half &yogh;er more, Into is owene londe : a-longued he was sore. &YOGH;if þat he was þare ou&yogh;t i-knowe : I-ne can ou tellen non ende; bote, ase þe bok us tellez : hamward he gan þo wende. And þo he to londene MS. londe ne cam : Ichot wel, þare he founde his wif and thomas, is &yogh;onge sone : boþe hole and sounde. Welle, muche was þe Ioie : þat he makede with is sone, And also he dude with is wif : þo he was hom I-come; And is wif gret Ioie made : with hire housebonde, For he was hire swiþe wel-come : In-to engelonde. Þat child heo setten to lore : are it were seue &yogh;er eld; Ich wot, it leornede swiþe wel : and wax swiþe quointe and beld. Þo þat he was wel i-woxe : of bodi and of clergise, Þat þe bischop of londone : wilnede is seruise, he nolde serui þe bischope nout : ake he bi-lefde at-hom, And preide is fader wel &yogh;erne : þat he moste to schole gon. Of is fader and of is moder : &yogh;e habbez i-heord telle, Acke of seint thomas him-selue : þat beste cometh nou to spelle.
17.2: ¶ Hic Isci Comence la vie seint Thomas Erceeueske de Kaunterbury. ENgelond, wel glad þov beo : for þou mi&yogh;t wel eþe, And al-so holi churche : for one Mannes deþe, Þe erchebischop seint Thomas : þat al. þat ou wel deore bou&yogh;te With is blod and with is brayn : þat þe scharpe swerd sou&yogh;te! Seint Thomas, þis holi Man : to Alle guodnesse he drov&yogh;. At londone he was i-bore : of guode Men i-nou&yogh;, For of londone is fader was : a wel guod emne Man. Þis child was &yogh;ong to schole i-set : And swiþe wel he bi-gan. His Moder him wolde al day rede : and wel ofte on him crie Chaste lijf and clene for-to lede : and for-sake lecherie, And louien bi-fore al oþur þing : god and seinte Marie, And serui hem and holi churche : and bi-leuen alle folie. Þis child, þei it were &yogh;ong : swiþe wel þis under-stod— For seli child is sone i-lered : þare he þenchez to beon guod. Þo þis child was bet in elde : and of to and twenti &yogh;er, his moder wende out of þis liue : þat so muchel him louede her. Þis child wolde lengore gon to scole : ake is fader him nolde finde— For þat child þat is modur for-leost : is help is muche bi-hinde. Þis child þoru&yogh; is fader heste : ase man þat oþur red not, Seruede A borgeys of þe toun : and his a-countes wrot. So longe þat he cam to court : and was in guod offiz With þe erchebischop of Kaunterburi : sire tebaud, guod and wis. He seruede him so hendeliche : þat In a luytel stounde he makede him his conseiller : so studefast he him founde; his ercedekne he makede him sethþe : and dude al bi is rede. Swyþe wel bi-gan þis Ercedekne : holi churche bi-lede, And stifliche heold op hire ri&yogh;te— : þat alle Men i-seie, An þar-of nolde he þolien no wrong : þei he scholde þare-fore deie. Wel ofte he wende to rome : for holi churche al-so— Swuche prelatus al-to fewe : beoth nouþe In office i-do! ¶ So þat henri king of Engelonde : after sire steuene þe blays— Duyk of Normandie— : y-maked was al In pays. Þis king henri þe &yogh;ongue : þo he to londe cam, louede muche wel to do : and guode Men to him nam, And fondede to habben guod conseil : and wis bi al is mi&yogh;te, For-to holden riche and pouere : euerech man to ri&yogh;te. Of þe Ercedekne Thomas : Men tolden him sone i-nou&yogh;, hov he was stable Man and wis : and to alle guodnesse drou&yogh;: Þoru&yogh; þe Erchebischopes graunt : he makede him chaunceler— For euere Man mot him a-bouwie : þat hauez mest pouwer. Þo þis holi Man was i-torned : fram þe office of holi churche To a gret office of þe world : þare-after he moste wurche: Al-to nobleie of þe worlde : his continaunce he brou&yogh;te— Of swuche porture neuere Man i-holde nas— : þei oþur were is þou&yogh;te. With more nobleie he rod i-nou&yogh; : þane he was i-wonet to do: his loreins weren al of seluer : stirapes and spores al-so; pley he siwede of hauekus : and of houndes I-nou&yogh;; And ase men þou&yogh;ten, In euereche point : to alle pruyte he drou&yogh;. bote In is heorte it was an-oþur : hov-so he him bere; And euere he was chaste þoru&yogh; alle þing : hov-so it euere were. Ake euere he was for holi churche : and for pouere Men al-so, A-&yogh;en þe proute courteoures : þat a-&yogh;en heom wolden ou&yogh;t do. Both verses were orig. transposed in the MS. ¶ To holden op holi churche ri&yogh;te : so muche wo he gan drie A-&yogh;en þe luþere courteours : þat a-nuyden him of is liue, Also he tolde þe Erchebischope : wepinde swiþe sore, And oþere ofte In priueite : þat loueden him þe more: he wilnede mest of alle þinge : and on ore louerd he gan crie, Þat he moste with honour : bi-leue þulke baillie And ech oþur seruise of court : with þe kingus gode wille, For he ne mi&yogh;te nou&yogh;t is court paie : bote he wolde is soulle spille. Ake þe king him fond so stable : and so guod conseiller, Þat he nolde make for no-þing : non oþur chaunceler; he ne truste to no man so muche : ne þare nas non so hei&yogh; Þat he tolde is priueite so muche : ne þat him were so nei&yogh;. So muche he caste is heorte on him : þat In his warde he let do his eldeste sone sire henri— : he was is .Eyr. al-so— Þat he were is wardein : and al is ordeinour, Aftur is wille to wissi him : to þe kingus honur. Þe king wende In-to Normandie : for-to soiorni þere, And lefde is sone with seint Thomas : þat he is wardein were. ¶ boþe þe fader and þe sone : mest heore heorte heo caste Ope seint thomas þe holi Man : þe &yogh;wile it wolde i-laste; Þare nas Man In engelond : þat hadde so gret power Of þe reaume ase seint thomas : boþe fer and ner. Hit bi-fel þat sire Tebaut : ase god þe grace sende, Þe Erchebischop of Kaunterburi : out of þis liue wende. Þat word was sone wide couth : a-mong þeuwe and freo, Þat seint Thomas after him : scholde Erchebischop beo. Þe king al-so In Noremandie : þo men tolden him þat cas, A-non bar is heorte him mest : to don þare seint thomas; Þat couent of Caunterburi : desirede him also. So ase ech Man it wolde : i-brou&yogh;t he al. it was þar-to. At West-munstre he was i-chose : to þat heie pouwer, Þe fifte &yogh;er þat he was i-mad : þe kingus Chaunceler; he was of elde þulke tyme : of foure and fourti &yogh;er— his owene deth he onder-feng : and is Martyr-dom þer. For þe king was In Normandie : Ipresented he was to henri, is sone, In Engelonde : þo non oþur kyng þere nas. Ake þei it were a-&yogh;en is wille : he nolde it nou&yogh;t for-sake. ¶ Þo MS. þo he Axede In &yogh;wuche Manere : þo Axede he in &yogh;wuche m. Axede he in &yogh;wuche manere : þe croiz he scholde take. Men seiden him þat he scholde a-fongue : holi churche so freo Þat he MS. heo ne scholde onder noman : bote onder þe pope beo, Ne no-þing þenche bote holden op wel : holi churche lawe. "In þis manere," quath seint thomas : "ich hire a-fongue fawe." Þis was ri&yogh;t at wit-sonentid : þat þis dede cam to ende. Þis guode Man to Caunterburi : a-non bi-gan to wende. Al þe contreie, to don him honour : a-&yogh;en him cam and drov; Þare was for him In Caunterburi : Ioie and blisse I-nov. Þat dai of þe Trinite : bischop i-sacret he was And onder-feng þis dignete : þe guode Man seint thomas. Sire henri, þe kingus sone : was at his sacringue, And sixtene bischopus al-so : þis dede to ende bringue. Þo þis dede was i-don : heo gonne sende sone Aftur is palliun to rome : ase ri&yogh;t was for-to done. Alisaundre, þat was pope þo : he was at Mount-pellers: Þudere wenden þis wise men : þat weren is Messagers. ¶ Þe Abbod Adam of Euesham : heore cheuenteyn huy nome, to þe pope Alisaundre : to Mount-pellers heo come. heore erinde heo hadden sone of him : for [he] hem no-þing ne wernde, And heo nomen heore leue of him : and hamward a-&yogh;ein heo turnden. And þis pallion wel sone was : to seint thomas i-brou&yogh;t: Þis holi Man it a-fonge : with wel milde þou&yogh;t. ¶ Þo he was in is dignete : al clanliche i-do, he chaungede euerech-del is lif : and is maneres al-so. Þe here he dude on next is liche : is flesches maister to beo, Schuyrte and brech streit i-nov : a-non doun to is kneo— For him þou&yogh;te þat he wel mi&yogh;te : of oþure habbe þe maistrie, &YOGH;if he hadde of is owene flesche : al-ovt þe seignorie; &YOGH;if is soule Maister were : and is flesch is hyne, him þou&yogh;te he mi&yogh;te is dignete : bringue to guode fine. Sethþe on-ouewarde þe here : þe Abite of Monek he nam, And a-boue al þan clerkene Robe : ase to is stat bi-cam; So þat he was clerk with-oute : and with-Inne Monek al-so, Þoru&yogh; þe Abite þat he hadde on him : priueliche i-do. In penaunce and In fastingue : he was ni&yogh;t and dai, And In is oresones, bote som &yogh;wile : þat he slepe lai; And &yogh;wane he scholde eten is mete : for þat he moste nede, Euere he preide ore swete louerd : þat he moste wel spede; And euere &yogh;wane he Masse song : he wep and si&yogh;te sore; he hastede euere þare-with faste : ne mi&yogh;te no man more. ¶ Swiþe faire he fedde him at is bord : with grete nobleie and pruyte And of þe beste him-sulf he et : ake ofte bote luyte. Of is ordres he was ful streit : and he was in grete fere For-to ordeinen ani Man : bote he þe betere were. Idul nolde he neuere beo : ake euere doinde he was; In eche manere of betere liue : neuere no bischop nas. Sire henri, þe kingus sone : þat with him was er i-brou&yogh;t, bi-lefde euere In is warde : fram him nolde he nou&yogh;t. Þe loue þat was hem bi-twene : nas neuere more i-seie, Ne of no Man þis child nadde : neuere more loue ei&yogh;e. al. ne ei&yogh;e
17.3: Reditus regis. HIt bi-fel þat þe king : ovt of Noremandie cam In-to Enguelonde, þe stat to loke : and al-so is kynedom. Seint Thomas nam with him : sire hanri, is sone, And wel faire with honour : wende to south-hamptone. Þare was Ioie and blisse i-nou&yogh; : þo heo to-gadere come; heo custen and heo clupten faste : and hereden god i-lome. Þe king bi-lefde In Engelonde : to wardi is kynedom. Seint thomas to is priueitez : euere-more he nam And heold him euere ase he dude er : is hexte conseiller; bi is wille he nolde habbe i-haued : non oþur chaunceler. Euere &yogh;wane he ani-þing dude : þat were a-&yogh;en þe ri&yogh;te, Seint thomas it with-seide : euere with al is mi&yogh;te.— Hit bi-fel þat þe bischop of wirecestre : sone þere-after ded was, And þe bischop of hereforde al-so : ase ore louerd &yogh;af þat cas. Þe bischopriches fullen boþe : In-to þe kingus hond, For-to onder-fonge al þe prov þare-of : ase lawe was in þe lond. ¶ Þe king heom nolde nou&yogh;t &yogh;iue sone : bote heold heom swiþe longe In his hond, þat he mi&yogh;te þar-of : þe more prov a-fonge. Hit ne likede nou&yogh;t seint Thomas : þat holi churche so Scholde for a luytel coueitise : In þe kingus warde beon i-do; he þou&yogh;te þat it was swiþe muche : a-&yogh;en ore louerdes wille, And þat þe king mi&yogh;te In swuche manere : holi churche a-spille. he bad þe kinge In faire manere : þat he ne scholde it nou&yogh;t bi-leue Þat þulke tweie bischoperiches : some guode Men he &yogh;eue. Þe king him grauntede mildeliche : and nas nou&yogh;t a-&yogh;en is bone, Ake Þeos bischopriches boþe he &yogh;af : twei guode Men wel sone. ¶ Seint thomas þou&yogh;te wel : þat he ne mi&yogh;te nou&yogh;t paie þe kingue ne his conseil : bote he wolde holi churche bi-traie; In gret care and in soruwe he was : hov he mi&yogh;te best do, For he ne mi&yogh;te nou&yogh;t paien Ihesu crist : and þene kingue also. Seint Thomas halewede þat ilke &yogh;er : þe churche of Redinge, Þat i-founded was and a-rerd : þoru&yogh; henri þe oþur kingue, Þat &yogh;eot lith þare wel faire i-bured— : willames sone bastard. In þulke &yogh;ere seint thomas : schrinede seint edward At westmunstre, þare he lijth : þat bi-fore king willame was; bote king harald heom was bi-tueone : for-to is power no leng nas. Þe loue was euere gret i-nou&yogh; : bi-tweone seint thomas And þe kinge, for-to þe feond : destourbede hit, allas! luyte an luyte þat contek sprong : for pouere Mannes ri&yogh;te: paie ore louerd and þe kinge : þis holi man ne mi&yogh;te. Þe furste tyme þat seint thomas : ovtliche him with-seide, hit was for þe king a-&yogh;en pouere Men : dude onri&yogh;tful dede. ¶ Þe king nam fro &yogh;er to &yogh;ere : þoru&yogh; Engelond wel wide After is wille ane summe of panes : i-deld bi-eche side, And sethþe þoru an-queste : he let þoru&yogh; þe contreies an-quere hov muche ech Man scholde pai&yogh;e : and hov muche is ri&yogh;te were. So longue he nam taillage : þat he axede atþe laste Eche &yogh;ere ane certeyne rente : þoru&yogh; al engelond wel faste. &YOGH;wat for ei&yogh;e, &yogh;wat for loue : no man him ne with-seide; bote euere þou&yogh;te seint thomas : þat hit was an onri&yogh;tful dede. he þou&yogh;te al on god and on is soule : and bi-lefde al his manhede, And wende forth wel baldeliche : to þe king with-outen drede: "Sire," he seide, "&yogh;if it is þi wille : þou art riche and hende, And king of gret pouwer i-nov— : ore louerd þe more sende. A taillage þov taxt fram &yogh;er to &yogh;er : þoru&yogh;-out al þi londe, And axest it for a certeine rente : with onri&yogh;te, ich onder-stonde; For ri&yogh;te rente þov dest it take : at a certein daie in þe &yogh;ere, A certeyn summe a-signed : And so ne dude no king ere. &YOGH;ware-þoru&yogh; þat þat certein rente, me þinchez : þov ne mi&yogh;t it nou&yogh;t make: A taillage it is, and sumdel : with vnri&yogh;te i-take." ¶ "Thomas, thomas," quad þe king : "þou art mi chaunceler, Þou au&yogh;test more to holden op : þane to with-seggen mi power." ¶ "Sire," quath þis holi Man : "ich habbe i-beo with þe, And þou hast, ore louerd fur-&yogh;elde þe : gret guod i-don me: An oþur baillie ich habbe a-fongue : þei it were a-&yogh;en mi wille, And I ne mai nou&yogh;t loki boþe wel : bote ich scholde min owene a-spille; For ich am to luyte wuyrth : þat on for-to loke: Þanne dude he gret folie : þat boþe me bi-toke. Þare-fore ich þe &yogh;elde up here : al-out þe chauncelerie, And take me al to holi churche : to god and to seinte Marie." Þo was þe king wel of I-nou&yogh; : wroþere þane he was er; Ake naþeles is heorte bar : euere to Thomas þer. Þat þridde þing &yogh;eot mest of alle : and sonest in wrathþe hem brou&yogh;te: A preost, þat al. þer was a luþer Man : þat luyte of god rou&yogh;te; Þat of Manslau&yogh;t was bi-cleoped : and þare-fore i-nome also And In þe bischopes prisone of Salesburi : þare-fore he was i-do. Þe Mannes frend þat was a-slawe : siweden ope him so faste, So þat þe preost to Iuggement : Ibrou&yogh;t was atþe laste. Men acuseden him faste of þe dede. : he ne answerede nou&yogh;t þer-to, Acke heold him faste to holi churche : and ope none oþere he nolde him do. ¶ I-loked him was to puyrgi him : þoru&yogh; clergie, &yogh;if he mi&yogh;te, And dai him was þar-to i-set : þoru&yogh; holi churche ri&yogh;te. Þo þe dai was i-come : he ne mi&yogh;te him puyrgi nou&yogh;t: he was sone i-lad a-&yogh;en : and into prisone i-brou&yogh;t. Þo was þe bischop in grete care : &yogh;wat þer-of were to done; For-to habbe þe wisore red : to seint thomas he sende sone. And he him sente word a-&yogh;en : þat he scholde þene preost take And on-ordeini him of euerech ordre : and ase a lewede Man him make, And sethþe don him in strongue warde : þat he neuer-eft þar-of ne wende, In penaunce and in pine i-nou&yogh; : his sunnes for-to a-mende. Þe bischop of Salesburi : dude seint thomas heste; So þat þe preost was i-brou&yogh;t : In tormenz bi þe meste. Þe tiþinge her-of sone : to þe kinge cam, Þat a luþer þef, a manquellare : hadde a so li&yogh;t dom. him þou&yogh;te þat it nas nou&yogh;t ri&yogh;t : ne þat it ne mi&yogh;te nou&yogh;t beo so. And phelipe de boys, a Chanoyne : him hadde al-so mis-do: Þare-fore was ech oþur clerk : þe more him a-&yogh;en wille; him þou&yogh;te þat swuch lawe scholde : þe pais of þe londe a-spille. To westmunstre he let somony : alle þe bischopes of engelonde, And oþure, þe gretteste clerkes al-so : and þe hexte, ich onder-stonde. Ait Rex. ¶ "Beav seignours," þe king seide : "I not &yogh;wat &yogh;e habbeth i-þou&yogh;t; &YOGH;if &yogh;e goth forth with ower wille : ore pais ne worth ri&yogh;t nou&yogh;t. &YOGH;if a clerk hath ane Man a-slawe : oþur strong þeffþe i-do, And he mouwe þanne desordeined beo : and to liue comen so, heo wollez þanne mis-don al day : and beon þare-oppe wel bolde, And so schal þe pays of þe londe : wel vuele beon i-holde. Luyte heom wolde rechche : to leosen heore ordre so, &YOGH;wane heo for heore ordre ne spariez nou&yogh;t : þefþe for-to do! And euere þe herre heore ordre is : me þinchez bi puyr lawe, þe strengore scholde heore dom beo : &yogh;wane heo wolden to þefþe drawe." Ait Thomas. ¶ "Sire, sire," quad seint Thomas : "&yogh;if it is þi wille, Lothz vs were any-þing to don : þi pays for-to a-spille. Þe clerkus þat beot h I-ordeynede : þov wost wel heo berez a signe Þat heo beoth lymes of holi churche : þat so noble is and digne; &YOGH;if heo weren with þulke signe : to vile deþe i-do, A-viled were al-holi churche : and foule i-schend al-so. And &yogh;if heo beoth formest onordeined : and for þulke sulue dede Sethþe þoru&yogh; dom to deþe i-brou&yogh;t : it nere nou&yogh;t wel to rede: For it nas neuere lawe ne ri&yogh;t : double dom to take For o trespas, ase &yogh;e wel wuteth : and sunne it were to make; And vnwuyrþere þane a lewed Man : holi churche were so: A lewed Man for o trespas : bote o Iuggement nis i-do. Þare-fore þine grace we biddeth þe : &yogh;if it is þi wille, Þat þov ne a-rere none newe lawe : holi churche to spille, For we biddez ni&yogh;t ant day : ase ri&yogh;t is for-to do, Þat god holde þe þine ri&yogh;te : and þine reavme al-so." Rex. ¶ "beav sire," quath þe king þo : "þov seist wel i-nov&yogh;. Ich hadde lothz bi mi concience : don holi churche wov&yogh;; For lawes þere beoth and costomes : þat habbethz euere beon i-holde Of bischopus þoru&yogh; al Engelond : ase ovre Aunceteres us tolde, And bi þe kingus daye henries : þat ovre graunt-sire was I-confermede weren and i-holde : And no man þare-a&yogh;en nas. Woltþu þulke lawes holde? : do me to witene sone!" "We schullen do," seint Thomas seide : "al þat is to done— Thomas. Alle þe lawes and þe costomes : we schullen holde bi ore mi&yogh;te Þat beothz to holde and habbeth i-beo : sire,—sauue oure ri&yogh;te." Rex. "Sauue ouwer ri&yogh;te?" quath þe king : "bev sire, &yogh;wi seistþou so? bi þulke worde Ine scholde no-þing : a&yogh;en þine wille do Þat þov noldest segge þat it were : a-&yogh;en holi churche ri&yogh;te, And so þou mi&yogh;test bringe al þat lond : In contek and In fi&yogh;te. &YOGH;e moten holde þe lawes : for-soþe ich onder-stonde, Þat word me þinchez venimous : to þe pays of þe londe." Thomas. "Sire," quath þis holi man : "ne meue &yogh;e ov ri&yogh;t nou&yogh;t! Wel þov wost þat ech of us : are we weren here-to i-brou&yogh;t, Trewenesse we þe sworen ase ri&yogh;t was : and eorþelich honour al-so, Sauue ore ordre and ore ri&yogh;te— : bote þat was out i-do. hou scholde we, sire, nouþe oþur do? : &yogh;e ne Au&yogh;ten it us nou&yogh;t beode. For godes loue hold us to ri&yogh;te : for nouþe we habbez neode." Rex. ¶ "Ich i-seo nouþe, thomas," quath þe king : "&yogh;ware-to þou wult drawe; Þov art I-come to late : to bi-nimen us ovre lawe. Þov woldest makien me more wrechche : þane euere ani kyng was: Þare-to þov art i-come to late : þou cast aumbes as." þe king [aros] in wrathþe a-non : and let heom sitte ech-one; In-to is chaumbre he wende : and ne grette heom neuer one. Fram londone he wende sone : In wrathþe ase þei it were, he ne seide no man of is þou&yogh;t : ake bi-lefde heom alle þere. Þe bischopus þou&yogh;ten þo ech-one : þat he was wroth i-nou&yogh;, Þare weren fewe bote seint thomas : þat toward him ne drou&yogh;. ¶ On seint Thomas heo criden faste : is þou&yogh;t forte wende, Oþuer he wolde al þat lond : for þulke one worde schende. kni&yogh;tes and oþure ofte comen : þat with þe kinge were And beden seint Thomas ententifliche : þat he þat word for-bere, And þat it were him gret folie : þe kinge In wrathþe bringe, And also destourbi al þat lond : for so luytel þingue. Seint thomas stod longe in þou&yogh;te. : "leoue breþren," he seide, "A-&yogh;en þe kyngus honur I-ne schal : neuere don no dede, Ake euerech word ichulle bi-leue : þat a-&yogh;en is honur is." Þo weren þis oþure glade i-nou&yogh; : þo heo i-heorden þis, And radden him wende to þe kinge : is wrathþe for-to stille. "Lef me were," quath seint Thomas : "with ri&yogh;te to don is wille." He wende to þe kinge to Oxenford : and with him þare he fond grete Eorles and barones also : þe hexte of al þe lond. Þe king welcomede seint Thomas : ake he ne made him nou&yogh;t fair chere; bischopes and Eorles he let cleopien : alle þat þere were. Rex. ¶ "Bev sire," he seide, "ich am king : with ri&yogh;te of þis londe; Customes here weren bi-fore : I-vsed, ich onder-stonde, And so muche wrechche nam ich nou&yogh;t : þat ich nelle þe lawes holde Þat ovre Auncestres heolden &yogh;wyle : ase ore conseil us tolde. Þare-fore ichulle þat þulke lawes : i-confermede beoth ech-on Of mine eorles and mine barones al-so : heo ne with-seggez non. Þare-fore ich hote ov euerechone : þat &yogh;e beon þat ilke dai At mi maner at Clarindone : with-outen ani de-lai, For-to confermi þis lawes. : ope peyne þat i schal ou sette, Ich hote þat &yogh;e beon þare ech-one— : þat non oþur ne lette." So departede þe court þo : and euerech to is In drou&yogh;; And euere was seint thomas : In care and soruwe i-nou&yogh;. Clarendon. ¶ þis bischopes and þe baronie : alle comen to þe dai&yogh;e to clarindone In wilte-schire : þe kingue for-to paye. Þo heo comen to þe parlement : þe king axede heom a-non &YOGH;weþur heo wolden holde þe lawes : ase heore Auncestres heolden ech-on. Thomas. ¶ "Sire, sire," quath seint thomas : "&yogh;if it þi wille is, Ech man mot speke for him-selue : and ich for me, i-wis. For mi stat and for holi churche : Ich answerie þar-to Þat alle þe olde guode lawes : And þat &yogh;eot beoth al-so graunti ichulle for holi churche : for-to habben þin ore, Sauue ore ri&yogh;tes and ore ordre. : þou ne mi&yogh;t axi nonmore." ¶ Þe king was wod-wroth for þat word : þat him gan þo mislike, Seint Thomas wep In is heorte : and sore bi-gan to sike. Al-to blodi was þat word i-seid : and deore it was a-bou&yogh;t: Þare-fore was seint Thomas : to stronge deþe i-brou&yogh;t. Þe bischop of Salesburi : and of Northwiche al-so Wepinde knevleden to seint thomas : þat he scholde anoþur do And habbe revþe of al-holi churche : and of heom echone, "Þat we ne beon alle to grounde i-brou&yogh;t : for þulke worde one." hei&yogh;e Men þat with þe kingue weren : mani on al-s[o] wende And knevleden to seint Thomas : þat word for-to a-mende. ¶ "Louerdyngues," quath seint Thomas : "ich am &yogh;et a &yogh;ong man And luyte &yogh;wule habbe bischop i-beo : and þar-on luytel ich can: Þare-fore of ower olde lawes : transcrit &yogh;e me take, And þare-oppe ichchulle conseillen me : &yogh;wuche beon to for-sake." þe king him let a traunscrit take : of þis customes echon. Seint Thomas grauntede some of heom : and with-seide mani on. Prima lex. ¶ Þe lawes þat ichulle nouþe telle : he grauntede wel fawe: '&YOGH;if a bonde-man hath ane sone : þat to clergie beo i-drawe, He MS. Ne schal nou&yogh;t with-oute is louerdes leue : no&yogh;were i-crouned beo, For þev-Man ne mai nou&yogh;t beon i-maket : a-&yogh;en is louerdes wille freo.' Alia lex. ¶ An oþur lawe he grauntede al-so : þat &yogh;e mowen nouþe i-seo: '&YOGH;if ani man of holi churche : halt ani-þing of lay-fe, person, preost, oþur &yogh;wat-so he beo : he schal don þere-fore Þe seruise þat to þe kinge bi-fallez : þat is ri&yogh;te nere for-lore; And In plaidingue stonde in eche place : and In iuggement al-so, bote &yogh;ware ani Man schal beon bi-leomed : oþur to deþe i-do.' Tertia lex. ¶ He grauntede also, '&yogh;if ani Man : þe kingues traytur were And ani man is chateus : to holi churche bere, Þat holi churche ne scholde nou&yogh;t : þe chateus with strencþe lette, Ake þe king hem scholde wel baldeliche : ase is howene fette. For al þat þe kingus feloun hath : þe kingus catel it is, And ech man in holi churche : is owene take i-wis.' Seint Thomas grauntede bluþeliche : þeos and oþure mo, Ake þeos oþere he with-seide— : þat dude him muche wo: I a contradicta. ¶ '&YOGH;if bi-twene tweie lewede men : were ani striuingue, Oþur bi-tuene a lewed man and a clerk : for holi churche þingue, Ase for Avouweson of churche : &yogh;weþur scholde þe churche &yogh;iue, Þe king wolde þat In his court : þat plai scholde beon i-driue, ¶ for ase muche ase a lewed Man : þe o partye, was clanliche onder þe kingue : and onder no bischop nas.' ija. ¶ An oþur lawe was 'þat no bischop : ne clerk noþe-mo Scholde out of engelonde : with-oute þe kingus leue go, And þanne heo scholden swerien heore oth : opon þe boke, i-wis, Þat heo ne scholden purchaci non vuel : þe kingue ne none of his.' iij a . ¶ Þe þridde was, '&yogh;if ani man : In mansingue were i-brou&yogh;t And sethþe come to amendement : and a-&yogh;en ri&yogh;te nere nou&yogh;t, Þat he ne scholde nou&yogh;t swerie op-on þe boke : ake borewes finde he scholde to stonde to al þat holi churche : with ri&yogh;te him lokie wolde.' iiij a . ¶ Þe ferþe was 'þat no man : þat of þe kinge heolde ou&yogh;t In chief oþur In seruise : in mansingue nere i-brou&yogh;t, bote þe wardeins of holi churche : brou&yogh;te al. þat br. him þer-to, Þat al. þe kyng s. seiden, oþur is baillifs : &yogh;wat he hadde mis-do, And lokede formest &yogh;weþer heo wolden : to amendement it bringe, And bote huy wolden, bi heore leue : þanne don þe mansingue.' v a . ¶ Þe fifte was 'þat no bischopriche : ne non Abbeie also, al. þat bischopriches: & abbayes also Þat were voyde with-oute prelat : In þe kingus hond were I-do And þe king scholde al þat lond : ase is owene take, For-to atþe laste þat him luste : ani prelat make; And þanne scholde þilke prelat : of is chapele i-chose beo, Of is clerkus &yogh;wuch þat he wolde : þat benefiz to bi-seo; And þanne &yogh;wane he were i-chose : In is chapele þere homage he scholde don to him : are he j-confermed were.' vj a . ¶ Þe sixte was, '&yogh;if ani plait : to chapitle were i-drawe And ani man made ani apel : &yogh;if men duden him a-&yogh;en lawe, Þat to þe bischop fram þe Ercedekne : his apel [he] om. scholde make, And fram þe bischop to þe Erchebischop : and sethþe non herre take; bote þe Erchebischopes court : to ri&yogh;te him wolle r. wolde bringe, Þat he scholde fram þulke court : bi-cleopien to þe kinge, And fram þe kinge non herre'— : so þat atþenende Þe playdingue fram holi churche : to þe kingue scholde i-wende, And þe king a-mendi scholde : þe Erchebischopes dede And beon chief of holi churche— : ake seint thomas it with-seide. vij a . ¶ Þe seueþe was 'þat playdingue : þat of dette were, for-to &yogh;elde þoru&yogh; treuþe i-pli&yogh;t : and nou&yogh;t i-holde nere Al-þei it þoru&yogh; treuþe were : þe playdinge scholde beon i-brou&yogh;t bi-fore þe kinge and is baillifs : and to holi churche nou&yogh;t.' viij a . ¶ Þe ei&yogh;teþe was 'þat In þe londe : citation non nere Þoru&yogh; bulle of þe pope of rome : Ake clanliche bi-leued were.' ix a . ¶ Þe Ninþe was 'þat peteres panes : þat men gaderiez mani on, Þe pope nere nou&yogh;t on i-send : ake þe kingue euerech-on.' x a . ¶ Þe teoþe was, '&yogh;if ani clerk : ase felun were i-take And for kingus felon j-proued were : and he ne mi&yogh;te nou&yogh;t for-sake, Þat men scholden furst desordeini him : and sethþe þoru&yogh; ri&yogh;te lawe And þoru&yogh; ri&yogh;t Iuggement of þe londe : bringe him of lijf-dawe.' Þeos customes, and manie oþere : þe king pulte forth a-non, And het þoru&yogh;-out al þis lond : þat Men heom heolden echon. Þene feorþe dai bi-fore candelemasse : þo þis was ido, Þe king het seint thomas a-non : and þe oþere bischopus al-so On þis chartre heore seles sette : þat non aftur-tale nere, Þat þulke costomes weren i-holde : þoru&yogh; al þe londe þere. "Sire, sire," quath seint thomas : "for godes loue þin ore, to conseili us betere &yogh;if us furst : are we speken her-of more!" So þat respit was þar-of I-nome : and ech wende In his side. ¶ Seint thomas nam þat transcrit : and nolde no lengore a-bide, to winchestre he wende þanne : with soruwe and care i-nov&yogh; hov he mi&yogh;te holi churche schilde : fram þis muchele wov&yogh;. &yogh;wane oþur Men weren faste a-slepe : he wep and si&yogh;te sore, "And Iesus al. & bad god helpe holi churche" : and cride him milce and ore. he i-sai þat þer nas bote o wei : oþur he moste stif beo, Oþur holi churche was al bi-neþe : þat with ri&yogh;te was so freo. Sori and careful he was I-nov : þat he tok on so, For-to entri into Answere : þare he ne ou&yogh;te nou&yogh;t to do, Þat he a-feng þat transcrit : and respit hadde i-bede: For him þou&yogh;te þat al-holi churche : In þat he misdude; For holi churche ne scholde : In none stude stonde to dome Ne Ansuerie kinge ne prince noþur : bote þe pope of rome. ¶ Þe deol þat thomas makede : no tounge telle ne may. "Louerd," he seide, "alas, alas : þat ich euere i-sai&yogh; þis day, Þat ich þe warde of holi churche : so folliche scholde take, And so freo ase heo was er : þus þeu sethþe hire make! heo þat was er so hei&yogh; and freo : bi mine Auncestres daye, Þat ich hire scholde bi-neoþe bringe : Allas! and so bi-traie, for þis Martyrs þat &yogh;wylene weren : for hire to stronge deþe i-do, heo is nouþe þev þoru&yogh; me i-maked! : Allas, &yogh;wi dude ich so? luytel wuyrth ich am of holi churche : wardein for-to beo, And al-so vnwurthþeliche þar-to i-nome— : þat ech man may i-seo: For ich nam nou&yogh;t, ase ri&yogh;t was : fram none ordre i-nome, Ake fram hei&yogh;e kingus court to holi churche : and þat wolde vuele bi-come. Of houndes ich was wardeyn : and of hauekes with þe king, And nov am wardein of soulene i-maked : and þat ne Ioyneth no-þing; Ich þat for-sok min owene : þe &yogh;wyle ich was chaunceler, So manie soulene habbe to loke : allas! &yogh;wat schal ich her? Ich drede þat god habbe me fur-sake : hov tok ich on, alas!" Þe deol þat þis holi man makede : with-outen ende it was: he wep and si&yogh;te ny&yogh;t and dai : and heold him al for-lore. &YOGH;if he mi&yogh;te a-soilled beo : to þe pope he wolde þer-fore, And wende toward Caunterburi. : sone þe kinge men tolde Þat þe Erchebischop nolde nou&yogh;t : þe newe statuz holde. Þe king het his baillifs sone : and sende a-boute is sonde, Þat heo scholden greui seint thomas : ouer-al on is londes. ¶ Þis baillifs weren preste i-nov&yogh; : and ope is maneres wel faste, Nomen is bodene and greueden him— : heo wenden þare-with him a-gaste. Seint thomas let heom al i-worþe : and op-on ore louerd is heorte caste, And wende him wel priueliche : bi ny&yogh;te atþe laste to þe se, toward rome : þat none of is men it nuste, bote twey Men þat he tok with him : þat is priuete mest wusten. Sethþe þo is men him misten : and nusten &yogh;ware he bi-cam, And seien þat heo with-oute louerd weren : euer-ech is red nam for-to don euerech is beste : ech wende In is side, Ase men þat weren louerdlese— : heo nusten &yogh;wat a-bide. Þis holi Man wende him forth : and dude him In schipe sone, And wende forþeward in þe se : ase he þou&yogh;te for-to done. ¶ Þe wind cam ase ore louerd it wolde : and drof him a-&yogh;en to londe. Sethþe he wende eft in-to þe se : þe passage for-to fonde: Þe wind cam and drof him a-&yogh;ein. : and ofte al. eft In he wende, And euere he was a-&yogh;en i-driue : ase ore louerd þe grace him sende. Þo i-sai&yogh; þis holi man wel : þat it nas nou&yogh;t godes wille Þat he þe &yogh;eot of londe wende : he turnde a&yogh;en wel stille. On of is seriaunz sat a ni&yogh;t : þe &yogh;wile þat men woke, In his chaumbre at caunterburi MS. caum|terburl : þe chaumbre for-to loke; In þe Eueninge he bad is knaue : to steken þe dore faste. Þis knaue eode toward þe dore : is ei&yogh;ene a-boute he caste: Þo i-sai&yogh; he þis holi man : In one huyrne stonde. he orn and tolde his maister fore : and þonkede godes sonde. Þe seriaunt ne lefde þat nou&yogh;t : naþeles op he a-ros And fond seint Thomas In þe huyrne : and sum-del him a-gros. Þare was sone Ioye i-nov&yogh;! : þat folk sone to him drov&yogh; And welcomeden him and maden him guod semblaunt : with Ioye and blisse i-nou&yogh;. ¶ Heo setten bord and spradden cloth : and bi-gonne to soupe faste. Seint thomas tolde hem þo : wel Mildeliche atþe laste &YOGH;wodere he þou&yogh;te to habbe i-went : and &yogh;wuch cas god him sende, And hou it nas nou&yogh;t godes wille : þat he þe &yogh;wyt forth wende. Þe tiþinge to þe kinge cam : þat þe guode Man sein thomas, A&yogh;en þe status of clarindone : of londe i-went he was— For þat o statuit was þat no bischop : ne scholde bi none ende With-oute leue of þe kinge : oute of londe wende. Ake þe king sende is men sone : to saisi al is lond And al-so al is bischopriche : ase is traitores, In-to is hond. Þis baillifs comen to caunterburi : ase heo i-hote were. ¶ Þo heo wenden to habben al heore wille : heo founden seint thomas þere: No-þing ne mi&yogh;ten heo saisi þo : heore wei heo hadden for-lore; Also huy comen heo wenden a-&yogh;en : and tolde þe kinge fore.— &YOGH;uyt seint thomas him bi-þou&yogh;te : þat he wolde fondi more &YOGH;if he mi&yogh;te of þe kinge habbe : betere grace and ore: he &yogh;arknede him wel mildeliche : and to him þane wei he nam, At is manere at wodestoke : to þe kinge he cam. Ase is erþeliche louerd : he grette him, faire i-nov&yogh;. Þe king bi-heold him ful hokerliche : and a-scorn som-del lou&yogh;. "thomas," he seide, "hou is þis? : beo we so grete fon Þat we ne mowen in one londe wonie? : thomas, hov schal þis gon?" "Sire, sire," quath seint thomas : "god ne late hit neuere so beo, Ake god us sende, and holi churche : betere grace to þe, And sende þe wille to louien hire bet : And Iesus for is mi&yogh;te Ne late me neuere a-&yogh;ein þi wille : don þing with on-ri&yogh;te." ¶ Þe Erchebischop of Euerwyke : fondede for-to bringe A-cord and loue bi is pouwer : bi-twene thomas and þe king. Þe king swor a-non is othþ : þat non oþur a-cord he nolde bote þat þe status of clarindone : ech bischop holde scholde; And nameliche þeos bi-fore alle oþure : '&yogh;if a clerk hath mis-do And he þe kingus felun i-preoued were : and for þeofþe also, Þat Men him MS. him him scholden desordeini : and sethþe a-non þoru&yogh; lawe to þe kingus baillifs deliueri him : to an-hangi oþur to-drawe.' Seint thomas i-sai&yogh; wel þo : þat þare nas wei bote on: Oþur he moste stif with-stonde : oþur is ri&yogh;tes for-gon. ¶ he þou&yogh;te þat he nolde neuere : holi churche bi-traye, Ne þat heo ne scholde beo in suyche seruage : neuere bi is daye; Raþur he wolde, ase oþere weren : to Martyrdom beon i-do, Þane holi churche were so bi-neoþe— : I-redi he was þar-to. Neuere ne mi&yogh;ten þe king ne he : no-þing a-cordi þer, Ake departeden al with wrathþe : ase heo hadden i-don ofte er. Þe king makede him wroth i-nov&yogh; : þat so ofte in barate was For o man þat him with-seide : and non oþur a-&yogh;ein him nas: In grete wrathþe he swor is oth : þat he wolde of him beon a-wreke, And þat þe holi Man scholde : anoþur with him speke. he let somony seint thomas : þat þe nexte þoresdaie he were At Norehamptoune bi-fore seint lucus dai : to &yogh;iuen him Answere; And alle þe bischopus of þe lond : And þe baronie al-so, he het beon þare at þulke daie : is hestes for-to do. Alle seint thomas londes : in-to is hond his men nome, Ase it were for-to destreynen MS. destruyen him : þat he to his court come. ¶ Ore louerd helpe nouþe seint thomas : for oþur frend nath he non, A-mong so manie tyraunz for-to come : þat weren alle is fon! bodi and soule he bi-tok : Iesu, godus sone, And to is daie ase he Isomoned was : wende to Norehamptone. In þe castel sat þe motinge : of þis tyraunz ech-on. Þis holi man a-godes name : a-mong MS. a mond heom wende a-non. ¶ "Sire king," he seide, "god þe loke : and saui þi dignite! Somounz ich hadde at þis daie : here to Ansuerien þe. Ake non Erchebischop of caunturburi : nas neuere i-somoned so, Ne so destreyned of no king. : I not &yogh;wat þov me þencst to do, I not &yogh;wat is þe newe statuit : þat þou þencst forth to drawe, bote hit beo on of clarindone : þat þou woldest bringe to lawe. On me nastþu power non : swych destresse for-to do: Heued of holi churche ich am i-maked : þei ich onwuyrth beo þer-to. And also ich am þi gostlich fader : þei MS. þei þou of me luytel þov lete: It nas neuere ri&yogh;t ordre þat þe sone : is fader scholde bete, Ne þat desciple beote is maister. : al þis were a-&yogh;en lawe. Al þis, ho-so ri&yogh;t bi-halt : þov bi-ginnest forth to drawe. And þis bischopes al-so guod : þat wardeins beoth mid me to holde op þe honur of holi churche : and þe þi dignite, heo beoth nouþe a-boute hire forto schende : and bringe In-to vilte. gret reuþe it is þat Man schal so : hire bringe bi-neþe for me; &YOGH;if þov wolt ou&yogh;t to me : þov wost wel i-ne may nou&yogh;t fi&yogh;te, Ich am &yogh;are deth for-to a-fonge : for holi churche ri&yogh;te." Rex. ¶ "I-nelle no man," quad þe king : "for holi churche quelle. beau sire, þov spext ase a fol : a-noþur þov schalt me telle. Acke com to-morewe bi speche-tyme— : þat þov þinne dai ne breke!— And Ansuere me of oþur þinge : þat ichulle to þe speke." Þus departede þe court þo. : a-morewe, þene friday, Seint thomas wende þudere a-&yogh;en : þo he þe time i-sai. Þe king [sat] an hei in is sce : and a-coupede him wel faste. "Þov were," he seide, "mi chaunceler— : ake al-to longe it laste, Ich þe lende þo fif hondred pound : and þov ne &yogh;olde me nou&yogh;t on: Sete me þar-of ane schorte day : for þov schalt heom &yogh;elde ech-on." Thomas. ¶ "Sire, sire," quath seint thomas : "god sende us bet þin ore! I-ne wende neuere of þulke panes : i-heore a-countes more. For ich hadde þulke tyme : betere grace to ov&yogh; Þane ich habbe nouþe : and þat me þingchez wou&yogh;; guode grace ich hadde to þe : þou me louedest i-nou&yogh; þo, Þulke panes þo þov me &yogh;eue : and woldest &yogh;et wel mo. Sire, þar-of ich am suyþe wel a-knowe : þat ich heom a-feng of þe: Of þine &yogh;ifte with guode heorte : for-soþe þov &yogh;eue hem me, And so hei&yogh; man ase þov art : it mi&yogh;te wel beo stille to Axi þing þat þov &yogh;eue er : with þine so guode wille." Þe king him axede &yogh;if ani man : þulke &yogh;ifte i-sai&yogh;, And &yogh;weþur he mi&yogh;te prouen þe &yogh;ifte. : Seint thomas seide nay&yogh;. Rex. ¶ "Nov, louerdingus," quath þe king : "alle &yogh;e i-heorez þis, Þat of þat tresor þat he is a-knowe : þat ich him tok i-wis, Þe &yogh;ifte ne mai he proui nou&yogh;t : Ase alle &yogh;e mowen i-seo. Iugement ich axi of þis court : hou it þare-of schal beo." Þe court him lokede : ase he was : a-knowe of þat þing, And ne mi&yogh;te nou&yogh;t þe &yogh;ifte preoui : to &yogh;elden ech ferþing. Þe king him het þe panewes &yogh;elde : oþur sikernesse him make, Oþur is Marschales scholden swiþe anon : is bodi to prisone take. Þis holi man of is bischopriche : hadde wel luytel guod, Ake al helples a-mong is fon : with-oute conseille he stod. Þe Marchales i-redie weren : to prisone him lede a-non; heo heten him don heom sikernesse : oþur he scholde with hem gon. Þis holi man nuste non oþur red : bote soffri al heore wou&yogh;. ¶ Some guode men þat þare weren : hadden of him reuþe i-nou&yogh;: Fif kni&yogh;tes nomen hem to rede : and wenden to þe kingue And token an hond for seint thomas : of alle þulke þinge, euerech of an hondret pound : for þis seli man to paie. Þo was þis guode Man quit I-nov : ase at þulke daie. ¶ A-Moruwe, þene saturdai : to court eft-sone he wende, For-to heore þe kingus wille : &yogh;if is heorte wolde ou&yogh;t a-mende. Þe kyng sat a-doun In is sce : thomas bi-fore him stod. "bel ami, þou hast," quad þe king : "i-stole me muchel guod. Mi chaunceler þov were, al-to longe : and haddest In þin hond Abbeies and bischopriches : and muche del of þat lond, And þov ne &yogh;olde me þar-of none a-countes. : þat rewez me wel sore; Þar-of þritti þousent pound : þov me schalt, and wel more. Þare-fore make þe &yogh;are i-nov : þine a-countes to &yogh;elde, Sikur þov beo þov schalt it do : &yogh;if ich þe may a-welde." Alle þat heorden þeos demaunde : In grete wonder stoden þere, And to al. ech to o. oþur seide þo : þat heo ne heorden þer-of neuer er, And þat seint thomas was al bi-neþe : and ope þe pointe he was to beon i-cast In prisone : for non oþur wei þare nas. Seint thomas stod In þou&yogh;te longue : and with ri&yogh;te þe kinge bed Þat he moste is conseil nime : of þat he hadde to him i-seid. Þe bischopes he nam to is conseil : þe king ne wernde him nou&yogh;t. In one Chaumbre, faste i-loke : alle heo weren i-brou&yogh;t, Þat he ne scholden a-scapien : are heo hore answere seide. "Nov, louerdinges," quad þis guode man : "her-of &yogh;e moten me rede. For, al-so god me bringe of care : Ine habbe þar-of gult non, Ake me for-to schende he axeth þis : with on-ri&yogh;te ech-on. For ich was with him er wel i-nov : and þat bringeth me nouþe in teone: Þare ne tok ich no witnesse : of þat us was bi-tweone." Consilium. episcopus Wincestrie. ¶ Þe bischop henri of winchestre : furst bi-gan him rede. "S[i]re," he seide, "þus me þinchez : þov mi&yogh;t don of þis dede. For-soþe me þinchez with gret wrong : þe calangez þe king; Þo þov wendest of his seruise : he ne Axede þe no-þing, And þo þov þe bischopriche a-fenge : so clene and so freo Þat þov of none oþur þinge : ne scholdest i-charget beo; And he quath þe quit al clanliche : of ech oþur wike þer, An ne axede þe no-þing : of þat þov haddest i-don er. &YOGH;ware-þoru me þinchez of none þinge : þou ne schal t ansuerien nou&yogh;t bote to god and holi churche— : of alle oþere þov art i-brou&yogh;t." episcopus london'. ¶ Þe bischop gilbard of londone : seide þo his a-vis: "Sire," he seide, "&yogh;if þov þe bi-þenchest : ase a guod Man schal and wis, &YOGH;wat power þe king þe hath bi-take : and to &yogh;wuche guode i-br[o]u&yogh;t, Al is wille þov most soffri : and a-&yogh;en him ne beo þov nou&yogh;t! In muche wo þov bringst us alle : and holi churche also, And þin owene bodi In perile : bote þov is wille do. &YOGH;if þov þis wel onder-stode : me þinchez for-soþe, i-wis, Þov woldest fondi him to paye : and elles þov dudest a-mis." episcopus Wincestrie. ¶ Þo seide þe bischop of wynchestre : "sire gilbert, beo stille! We sospendiez swuch conseil : for it nis nou&yogh;t wurth a fille. &YOGH;if þe Erchebischop scholde beo : al to þe kynges wille, Þe honour of holi churche he lore : and is soule he mi&yogh;te so spille." episcopus Cicestrie. ¶ Þe bischop hyllarie of Chichestre : bi-gan to speke þo: "Sire," he seide, "mi conseil is : hou-so it euere go, Forto fondi In faire manere : to paie þe kingues wille With faire bi-heste, for-to eft-sone : þat it were sumdel stille; Þanne we mi&yogh;ten, &yogh;wane we weren : of þusse destresse i-brou&yogh;t, Þe betere a-cheui In ore conseille— : for nouþe ne do we ri&yogh;t nou&yogh;t." episcopus lincoln'. ¶ Þe bischop Robert of lincolne : radde wel þare-to. "Sire Erchebischop," he seide : "for-soþe þov most it do; Oþur þov schalt leose þine bischopriche : and per-Auenture þi lif; Þanne bi-&yogh;ete þov wel luyte : me þinchez, of þis strif." episcopus Exon'. ¶ Þe bischop bartholmev of Eccetre : bi-gan to segge is þou&yogh;t: "In al þe soruwe of þe world : and care we beoth i-brou&yogh;t. betere it were þat on heued : In peril him brou&yogh;te, Þane al-holie churche were bi-neþe : and i-do to nou&yogh;te." episcopus Wigorn'. ¶ Þe bischop Roger of wyrecestre : longe in þou&yogh;te stod; "I-nelle ov segge on ne oþur : for i-not &yogh;wat is guod. &YOGH;if ich radde him for-ta-bouwien : al-to þe kingus wille, Min owene Mouth him-sulf demez : al-holi churche to spille; And &yogh;if ich rede a&yogh;en him to beo : In þis place sum is Þat wolde telle þe kinge fore : and maken him mi fo, i-wis—" bi þe bischope of londone : þat ilke word he sede; for he was euere a-&yogh;ein seint thomas : with wordes and with dedes. "Þare-fore," he seide, "on ne oþur : I-nelle segge i-wis. guod conseil god us &yogh;iue— : for muche neod it is." Þare nas non þat couþe is conseil : with menske bringe to ende, Ne þat wuste hov heo mi&yogh;ten best : ovt of þe chaumbre wende. Thomas. ¶ Atþe laste ope seint thomas : þis conseil moste al gon. Tweie eorles of þe kingus hous : he let cleopie a-non, "Louerdingus," he seide, "we habbez i-speke : faste of þusse þinge, And al-so fer forth ase we mowen : we wollez paye þe kinge. Ake for we nabbeth nou&yogh;t i-redi here : ore conseil al-clene, For-to þe nexte daie we biddez furst : þat &yogh;e it graunti nouþe ene." So þat heom was respit i-graunted : and ech wende in is wei&yogh;e. Manie of seint thomas men : bi-lefden him for ei&yogh;e; And kni&yogh;tes þat with him weren : alle fram him heo drowe. Seint thomas nam pouere men : bi þe weie i-nowe, And ladde hem to is Inne : and to þe mete heom sette; he seruede heom is owene bodi : And i-nov&yogh; mete and drinke heom fette. "Þis beoth," he seide, "godes kni&yogh;tes : þis oþur men me habbeth for|sake. Þeos kni&yogh;tes ich loue more : to heom ichulle me take." Þene sonenday þare nas no court i-holde : for it was an hei&yogh;-day. And þe Monenday sore syk : þe bischop thomas lay, In þe syknesse of maldeflanke : þat to him ofte cam And for þe care þat he was Inne : wel þe worse him nam. Men seiden þat he makede him sik : for he ne dorste to court wende. Þe king in grete wrathþe i-nov&yogh; : after him gan sende. "Wel &yogh;e i-seoth," quath seint thomas : "þat I-ne may come nou&yogh;t, For-soþe to-moruwe ichulle : hov-so ich beo þudere i-brou&yogh;t. Þei ich schulle beo þudere i-bore : In baruwe oþur In bere, Þudere ichulle, þoru&yogh; godes grace— : crist me helpe þere." A-morewe, þane tywesday : ore louerd him gan a-rere, Þe furste dai after seint lucus dai : ase it fallez In þe &yogh;ere. Þat dai he au&yogh;te onder-stonde : and mani an oþur al-so: For bi custome alle is grete a-nuy : bi twyesdai cam him to. Alle þe bischopes þane tywesday : erliche to him wende, And seiden, "sire, þov art in feble point— : god it þe a-mende. We habbez ore red þarof i-nome : and mid one mouþe ech-on to queme þe kinge we redez þe : hov-so it euere gon; Oþur he þe wole bere on hond : þat þov art is traitur, And fur-swore &yogh;wore al. &yogh;wane þu swore him to don : eorþelich honovr, And ne dost him non ake tricherie— : he þe wole bere on honde, And bi-nime þe þi stat : and perantur bringue þe out of londe." ¶ "Mine leoue breþren," quad seint thomas : "&yogh;e i-seoz wel echon Þat al þe world grat on me one : and alle [beoz] mine fon; And þat [is] &yogh;uyt mest reuþe of alle : þat &yogh;e þat mine breþren beoz, And me, þei ich sunful beo : ouwer fader In torment i-seoz, &YOGH;e beoz mine meste fon of alle : and also &yogh;e bez al-&yogh;are In seculer court to demen me : and þat nolde nou&yogh;t wel fare. For &yogh;e habbez þis a-mong ov to-day : bi-speke swyþe i-lome. Nov god helpe al-holi churche : and take þar-to gome! Ake In obedience ich ov hote : þat &yogh;e þare-nei&yogh; ne beon &YOGH;if ich am i-brou&yogh;t to Iuggement : ake þat &yogh;e raþur fleon. And &yogh;if ani man hond on ov al. me set : ich ov hote al-so Þat &yogh;e þe sentence of holi churche : for swuche violence &yogh;e om. &yogh;e do; And holdez vp holi churche ri&yogh;te : þat ov is bi-take— Man ne schal for none drede of deþe : hire ri&yogh;tes for-sake." Þe bischopes weren þo wroþe i-nou&yogh; : ant wenden to court ech-one. Nou god helpe þis holi man : for he was þare al one! bote þe bischop of wynchestre : þere ne lefde with him nou&yogh;t on, And Iocelin, þe bischop of Salesburi : þat ne weren alle fram him i-gon. ¶ Þis holi man truste muche to god : and greiþed him a-non, And song ane Masse of seinte steuene : are he come a-mong is fon. he song þulke masse i-lome : for al-so heo bi-ginnez, Þe furste offiz is propre inov : to þe stat þat he was Inne— Þe bi-ginninge of þulke masse : In englischs so is þis: "For &yogh;wane þe princes habbez i-sete : and a&yogh;en heom men spekez, al. a&yogh;en me speke i-wis, And luþere men pursiweden me : louerd, min help þov beo!" Ps. 119. Manie seiden þat þis i-heorden : "novþe we mouwen wel i-seo Þat he singuth þis Masse for þen-ones : for þe kinge and for alle his, And þat he halt heom alle luþere : þat a&yogh;en him spekez, i-wis." Þis word cam to court wel sone— : &yogh;ware-þoru&yogh; heo weren ech-on In þe more wrathþe a-&yogh;ein him : and wel þe more is fon. ¶ Þo seint thomas hadde is masse i-songue : his chesible he gan of weue; Alle is oþur uestimenz : on him he let bi-leue— Oþur Armure nadde he non : for holi churche to fi&yogh;te; A-boue he caste is cope : þat bi-feol to is ri&yogh;te. he tok godes flechs and is blod : with him swiþe stilleliche, Ane Creoyz he nam in is hond : and wende forth baldeliche. Þe uestimenz was is Armure : ase bi-feol to swuche ane kni&yogh;te; Þe fourme of þe creoiz was is baner : for holi churche to fi&yogh;te. Forth wende þis guode kni&yogh;t : a-mong alle is fon— Swete Iesus beo is help : oþur frend nadde he non. Þe creoiz in is hond he bar forth : and a-rerde op is baner. Þe bischop Robert of hereford : bi-gan to gon him ner, "Sire," he seide, "ich crie þin ore : þi chapeleyn ich mote beo, bi-fore þe lat me bere þe croiz : for it ne fallez nou&yogh;t to þe." "Þe &yogh;wyle ich hire bere," quad seint thomas : "and þe fourme i-seo, Ich ne drede me of no man : þe hardiore ich may beo." Þanne seide þe bischop of londone : þat euere was is fo: "I-ne rede nou&yogh;t þat þou bi-fore þe kingue : In swyche manere go; For wrathi he wole him a-non : and a-wreken him In þe place." ¶ "Ich bi-take me," quath seint thomas : "al to godus grace." "Þov hast euere al þi lif," þis oþur seide : "a muche fol i-beo, And þi folie nelt neuere bi-leue : ase men mai nouþe i-seo." Curia. Þis holi Man wiz is creoiz : In-to þis court gan gon. Rex. And þo þe king i-sai&yogh; him so come : he wrathþede him a-non. ¶ "Louerdinges," he seide, "here &yogh;e i-seoz : hov þis man me schent! In &yogh;wuche manere is he In-to þis court : among us hidere i-went! Ase þei we ne lefden nou&yogh;t on cristindom : ne In godes name. Ne mot ich nedes awreke me? : ne doth he me gret schame?" Þo seide al þe court a-non : "sire, wel &yogh;e mouwen i-seo Þat [he] is prou&yogh;t and conteckor : and euere hath i-beo; In despijt of þe and alle þine : þis dede he hath i-do. For &yogh;if þou wolt, þou mi&yogh;t beon i-war : eft-sone to take on so, to bringe men In so gret povwer : swiche ase he is, to beon þe hexte of þine londe : ase þou madest him, i-wis. Þare-fore we ne bi-menez þe nou&yogh;t : þou noldest beo i-war bi-fore. We seggez bi him echone : þat he is puyrliche for-swore: And ase bi a swuch Man þou do bi him : and ase bi þine fon! For he þe swor eorthþelich honur : and nele don þe non." Þe budeles and þe oþur schrewes : grenneden on him faste, And euere a-biden þe kinges heste : In prisone him to caste. ¶ Þe king let crie a-non a-boute : &yogh;if ani so wod were Þat stode In conseile wit seint thomas : oþur felau&yogh;schipe him bere, Ase þe kingus traitour : Men scholden him nime a-non, And laten him al one stonde : and fondi &yogh;wodere he wolde gon (!). Þe bischop of Eccestre to seint thomas : he feol a-doun a-kne, "For godes loue þin ore! : for soruwes þat þov mi&yogh;t i-se, haue reuþe of þe and of us : oþur þou wolt us alle schende; Alle we worþez i-brou&yogh;t to nou&yogh;te : bote þov þi þou&yogh;t wende." "Sire bischop," quad seint thomas : "ase wel þou mi&yogh;t be stille. go henne fram me &yogh;if þov wolt : and lat ech man don is wille." Þe bischopes wenden to-gadere ech-one : and heore conseil nome. And þo heo hadden heore fourme i-set : to þe kinge a-&yogh;en heo come. ¶ "Sire," heo seiden, "&yogh;e beoth a-nuyd : and þat us for-þinchez sore; For-&yogh;if us þat &yogh;e on us berez : we nellez þe mis-don non-more. Wel we wutez þat þis wrechche : þat scholde ore chief beo, he is fals and for-sworen : and [þat] om. mai ech man wel i-seo: For he suor to holde þe eorþelich honur : and hath i-broke is oth; And þat man mai wel proui on him : &yogh;if &yogh;e nellez nou&yogh;t beo wroth. Fur-&yogh;if us þine wrathþe, we biddez þe : ant to rome we wollez wende to bi-nimen him is Erchebischopriche : and ase a wrechche him schende: Puyrliche for-suore we schullen him preoui : sire king, bi eovwer rede." Þe king bi-het heom gret honur : to don þat ilke dede. to seint thomas, þare he was : heo wenden alle a-non. Þe bischop hyllarie of Chichestre : tolde for heom ech-on. "Sire," he seide, "ore gostliche fader : þov were here-bi-fore, For fader we fur-saketh [þe] : þov art fals and for-swore. For þou suore þe kynge eorþelich honour : and nelt don him non. Þare-fore to þe court of rome : we bi-cleopiez þe echon, to ansuerien us bi-fore þe pope : of þat þov hast ido a-mis." "Louerdingus," quath þis holie man : "ich i-heore wel al þis." ¶ Nov suete Ihesu beo is freond : &yogh;wane alle oþure were is fon! Þe king him let cleopien faste : þat he come forth a-non. Þe Eorl Robert of lecestre : and oþur men mani on Comen after him and heten him sone : bi-fore þe kingue gon. "Louerdingues," quath seint thomas : "&yogh;e wuyten wel ech-on hou wel ich was with þe king : þei ich habbe nouþe manie fon: Erchebischop he made me— : for-soþe a-&yogh;ein mi wille, For euere ich dradde for oncunninge : mi soule forto spille. ¶ Þo axede ich bifore al þat folk : In &yogh;wuche manere he me toke Þe Maistrie of holi churche : to wardi and to loke. holi churche me was bi-take : In eche manere so freo, Þat ich were quit of alle oþure courtes— : and &yogh;eot with ri&yogh;te it scholde so beo. And &yogh;wane holi churche is so freo : I-nelle ansuerien þe kingue Ne non oþur in his court : of none eorþeliche þinge. For gold ne passez nou&yogh;t so muche : In bounte led, i-wis, Al-so dignete of þe preost : herre þane þe kingus is. And is gostliche fader ich am : &yogh;if he wolde nime &yogh;eme, And it nere no lawe þat þe sone : þe fader scholde deme. Þare-fore i segge at o word : þat I-nelle me no-þing take to Iuggement of kingus court : ake clanliche it wolle for-sake, And take me to holi churche : and to none erþeliche dome: And Ich bi-cleopie ov here ech-one : to þe court of rome. Al þe stat of holi churche : and al mi dignite ¶ Þoru&yogh; Ihesu crist it beo i-wardet : &yogh;wan it ne mai oþur beo. And ou bischopus ich bi-cleopie : to þe court of rome also, for &yogh;e Anourieth more ane erþeliche king : þane &yogh;e god al-mi&yogh;ti do. And so þoru&yogh; þe ri&yogh;te of holi churche : fram þis court ich wende, to bringe þeos cause of holi churche : bi-fore þe pope to ende." Þis holi Man wel mildeliche : out of þis court gan gon. Þe king, and þat mid him was : wrathþeden heom a-non; heo criden on þis holi man : and beleweden ech-on Wit Also MS. A h so grete noyse : ase anie Men mi&yogh;ten don; heo ne mi&yogh;ten makie non more cri : þei al þe toun were a-fuyre, Ase al. þane heo duden opon þis holi man : þat wide men it mi&yogh;ten i-huyre. Þis guode man eode softe forth : ase him no-þing ne rou&yogh;te— for &yogh;uyt more men schenden Ihesu crist : þo men him to deþe brou&yogh;te. he werth opon is palefrai : and to is Inne he wende also. Vnneþe he mi&yogh;te with is hondene : þeos þre þingus do: blessi þat folk and bere þe croiz : and is bridel wisse. Þat simple folk orn a-bouten him : with Ioye i-nov&yogh; and blisse; for heo wenden þat he hadde i-beo : atþe court faste i-nome, heo þonkeden muche Ihesu crist : þat he moste a-mong heom come. ¶ to is In, at seint Andreues : heo siweden him faste i-nov&yogh;; Seint thomas alle þe pouere men : with him to þe mete he drov&yogh;, And seide, "comiez here forth with me : for mine freond &yogh;e beoth; Ine habbe none freond bote eov : ase alle men nouþe i-seoth." he let heom Alle fede wel : a gret hous-ful nei&yogh;; Þe guode man wel þe gladdore was : þat he heom alle i-sei&yogh;. Ase þis holi man sat at is mete : þei he grete wille þer-to nadde, Þis word þat ore louerd het : is redare bi-fore him radde: "&YOGH;if Men ov pursiwiet In one toune : In-to anoþur toun &yogh;e fleo." Þis holi man þou&yogh;te þat bi him-self : þat word mi&yogh;te wel soth beo And þat it godes wille was : In-to An oþur londe gon, As þe holi godspel seith : a man for-to fleo is fon. Þis holi man was þo wel þe hardiore : of londe for-to wende, &YOGH;wane he mi&yogh;te a-schapie wel : and god wolde þe time sende. ¶ Þo it was to-war[d] eue : twei seriaunz þare come, Sore weopinde, and warneden him : þat he sum red him nome, For þe kyngus Men hadden i-swore : þoru&yogh; heste of þe kinge, &YOGH;ware-so heo him mi&yogh;ten finde : to stronge deþe him bringe. Seint thomas þou&yogh;te an-oþur. : he let maken is bed a&yogh;en ni&yogh;t Op Inþe heie churche : bi-twene twei weuedes ri&yogh;t. Þo alle oþur men weren a-slepe : and no man nas him nei&yogh;, he aros up and bi-heold : on þe ymage an hei&yogh;; bi-fore þe auter he feol don a-kne : and on ore louerd bi-gan to crie, And formest he seide þe seuen salmes : and sethþe þe letanie; Al wepind ech haluwe he bad : is help for-to beo; bi-fore ech ymage he op aros : and eft he sat a-doun a-kne. Þo he hadde iseid is beden : stilleliche he gan gon, A luyte bi-fore þe cockes crowe : out of þe churche a-non, And wende him out-ward of engelonde : þat no man with him nas bote a frere of Semplingham : þat wel priue to him was. Þis guode Man flev al Engelond : for holi churche ri&yogh;te; Of al is wo ne &yogh;af he nou&yogh;t : &yogh;if he it a-mendi mi&yogh;te. ¶ Þe tiþingue cam of þis cas : to þe kingue ful sone. Þe hei&yogh;e men nomen heore red : &yogh;wat were þar-of to done. Þe king and al is baronie : and þe bischopes echon, Þat au&yogh;ten with seint thomas habbe i-be : and weren mest is fon, to þis conseil euer-ech-one : heo concenteden at þen ende: Þat þe king scholde of is hexte Men : to þe court of rome sende A-&yogh;en him &yogh;wane [he] þudere come : and þe pope don onder-stonde Þat he was fals and for-swore : and destourbour of þe londe. For-to don þis grete neode : þe wiseste Men heo nome, And þat is þing were al in pais : for-to heo a&yogh;en come. Þe Erchebischop of Euerwike : and þe bischop of Eccestre to rome MS. rome rome heo wenden for þis neodes : and þe bischop of Cicestre And þe bischop of londone : and of winchestre al-so, And also eorles and barouns : and manie clerkes þer-to, to beren witnesse of þe fals-hede : &yogh;wane heo to court come. Noble &yogh;iftes and oþur Iueles : with hem al-so heo nome— Þare-with man mai ofte at court : þe ri&yogh;te bringe to wou&yogh;. Nou&yogh; crist helpe þis holi man : for he is &yogh;uyt pouere i-nou&yogh;! he nadde none &yogh;iftes forto &yogh;iue : to holden up is ri&yogh;te; Fram Norehamptone bar he eode : for holi churche to fi&yogh;te. ¶ Fram seint Andreues þis holi man : of Norehamptone he wende With a frere of Semplingham : are god þane dai heom sende. Fiue and twenti mile he wende : to þe toune of graham Are he stunte in anie stude : with þe frere of Sempringham— Al North-ward he drou&yogh; him furst : a-wei al fram þe se, Þat þe kinges Men ne scholden him finde : to nimen ne for-to sle. Sethþe he wende fram graham : fiue and tuenti Mile al-so to þe toun added later. of lincolne : are he wolde reste i-fo. Þene moruwe ope seint lucus day— : tiwes-dai it was þo, he departede fram þe kingus court : with much seoruwe and wo MS. we ; his wei þane wodnes-ni&yogh;t : out of þe toune he nam; Sone morewe þene þores-dai : to lincolne he cam: At one follares house : his In he nam ri&yogh;t þare. þare corr. to þere And bi ni&yogh;te euere he eode is wei : þat he a-waited ne ware. At lincolne he dude him into watere : are god þane dai sende, And þane fridai fourti mile : al bi watere he wende, to þe Ermitage of Sempling-ham : þat a-midde þe watere is; And þare he bi-lefde al hardiliche : þre dawes, i-wis. And sethþe he wende to seint botulf : þat was heonnes ouer ten mile: Þare he dude him eft In-to watere : and cam in a luytel &yogh;wile to þe hous of hauer-holt : þat of Simpling-ham is— Þe frere him ladde bi þulke house : þe sikerore to beon, i-wis. Fram þannes he wende to eistreþe r. estreye : his o maner with ri&yogh;te, Þe Erchebischopes of kaunterburi : &yogh;if he hadde ani mi&yogh;te; Þare he was nei&yogh; þe se i-nov&yogh; : he a-bod wel þere And a-waitede is point to passi ouer : &yogh;wane hit best tyme were. ¶ Seue-ni&yogh;t he bi-lefde þare : for-to alle soulene dai; In A Chaumbre ri&yogh;t bi þe churche : dai&yogh; and ni&yogh;t he lai, Þat no man no scholde him onder-&yogh;ite : ne i-war of him beo; Þoru&yogh; þe churche he made an hol : þe sacringe for-to seo And for-to heren þare is masse— : and Men þat to churche come Nusten nou&yogh;t þat he was so nei&yogh; : ne þer-of heo ne token none gome. An alle soulene dai, þene tywesdai&yogh; : are god þene dai sende, he bi-tok god al holi churche : and In-to þe se he wende. heo roweden forth al þane dai : and a-&yogh;en þe eueninge bi-sides ane hauene heo a-riueden : þat men cleopez graueninge, In Flaundres, ase god it wolde. : bote hors ne hadde he non: Þis holi man al a-fote : forth is wei gan gon. Þat no man ne scholde him knowe : þe Abite of frere he nam And al-so a frere forth he eode : þo he to Flaundres cam. blac was is cope a-boue : is Cuyrtel &yogh;wijt blaunket; Opon is rugge is cope he bar : &yogh;if he mi&yogh;te go þe bet. Þe reyn was gret and suyþe st[r]ong : and þe wei ful deop: Swiþe weri was þe holi man : onneþe he bar up is fet. he was so trauailled In þe weie : and in þe se bi-fore, Þat he sat a-doun and ne mi&yogh;te no fer : bote he were i-bore. Þo wende forth a man, þat with him eode : and huyrde him a mere, For an Englichs peni, with an haltre : þis holi man to bere. Þe holi Man is cloþes tok : and op-on þe Mere heom caste, And werth op a-boue alle is cloþes : and rod him forth wel faste. ¶ Allas þat suych a noble man : vuele was it is ri&yogh;te So febleliche ouer lond to wende— : wel muche is godes mi&yogh;te; Vuele was it is ri&yogh;te to gon a-fote : oþur ope swuch a best to ride— holi churche he a-bou&yogh;te deore : þat men tellez of wel wide! With one haltre ope þe mere : forth rod þis holi man As þei it were a frere, and let him cleopie : frere cristian; For he nolde nou&yogh;t lie : þat cristian he was, And he was a-drad to beon i-knowe : &yogh;if man cleopede him thomas. At one gode mannes house : his In a-ni&yogh;t he nam; At þe bordes ende he sat : Ase vuele it him bi-cam, And al with-Inne seten is men : as þei he lowest were. his oste nam wel gode &yogh;eme : hov heo heom alle bere. he tok kepe of þe holi man : þat sat atþe bordes ende, hou milde he was a-mong alle : and mest corteis and hende, And hou hendeliche he delde is mete : heom þat bi-fore him stode, And hov luytel he .et. him-selue : with wel simple mode; his limes al-so he bi-heold : hou faire heo weren and freo, Þe hondene faire and longe fingres : fairore ne mi&yogh;ten none beo; his face was brod and long al-so : his fore-heued large i-nov&yogh;: And euere mest bi-fore alle oþere : is heorte to him drou&yogh;. ¶ Of þe Erchebischope of Caunterburi : he gan him vnderstonde, Þat it was couth ouer-al aboute : þat he was i-wend out of londe: his heorte him bar þat it was he. : In gret studie he was i-brou&yogh;t; he rounede in is wiues ere : and tolde hire al is þou&yogh;t. his wijf after þulke tyme : þat soþe al-so þou&yogh;te: heo bi-gan to serui þis holi man : and deinteþes to him brou&yogh;te, Applene. & peoren. and notes also : and fondede in alle manere A-mong alle þis oþur men : to gladien wel þene frere; heo bi-lefde to serui alle þe oþere : and opon him was al hire þou&yogh;t. Seint thomas it vnder-&yogh;at : and þare-with ne paide him nou&yogh;t. So þat he bi-heold a-boute : a-non after soper, Wel mildeliche he bad is oste : for-to comen him ner And to sitte bi him a-doun : for solaz, one stounde. "A, sire, merci," quad þis oste : "Ichulle sitte on þe grounde, And sat him a-doun at is fet. : seint thomas him bad arise. "Certes, sire," quad þis oste : "I-nelle In none wise. ¶ Nolde god þat ich bi þe sete! : mi louerd, i-hered þou beo, Þat In mine house þov scholdest come : and þat ich þane dai mi&yogh;te i-seo." "Luyte deinte," quat seint thomas : "of a swuch pouere man, Of swuch a frere ase ich am : i-cleoped frere cristian." "Sire, þin ore," quat h þis oste : "wel ich onderstonde, Þov art Erchebischop of Caunterburi : i-wend out of engelonde." "&YOGH;wy seistþov so?" quad seint thomas : "þov hauest selde i-sei&yogh;e Þene Erchebischop of caunterburi : wende in swuche manere bi weie!" "Sire," quad þe oste, "þov it art : al-so me seith mi þou&yogh;t, And ich bidde þe for þe loue of god : ne with-sak it a-&yogh;ein me nou&yogh;t." Þis holi man him bi-þou&yogh;te : þat oþur he moste lie Oþur beo bi-knowe þat he MS. heo it was : so heo gonnen on heom al. so þe oþer gan on him crie. Ate laste he was a-knowe : ake with him a-morewe he nam his oste, þat he ne scholde him wrei&yogh;e : forto he aftur r. a fer weie cam. to [þe] Abbeie of seint Bertin : þis holi man i-wende, And þare he bi-lefde : forto ore louerd oþur grace him sende.— Þe bischopus of engelonde : and þe barones al-so, toward þe court of rome he o wenden : heore erinde forto do. to þe kinge of Fraunce heo comen : and lettres with heom bere fram þe king of engelond : þat þus muche an Englisch were : "to is louerd þoru&yogh; godes grace : sire lowis þe kinge, henri king of engelonde : sende loue and gretinge. ¶ Thomas, þat Erchebischop was : of caunterburi bi-fore, Out of mine londe he is i-wend : ase mi traitore and for-suore. Þare-fore ase min erþeliche louerd : ich bidde þe bi mine sonde, Þat þov ne suffri nou&yogh;t þat he beo : Irecetted In þine londe." Þo þis king þis bone i-heorde : ane &yogh;wile in þou&yogh;te he stod. "Certes," he seide, "ase me þinchez : þis bone nis no-þing god. So strong þeof nis non in engelonde : &yogh;if he in Fraunce come, Þat he ne mi&yogh;te In Fraunce duelle : ase heo doth i-lome; And wel raþur scholde a suych hei&yogh; man : ne come he no so sone. Ake noþur ich ne þe king of engelonde : with ore bischopes nabbez to done; For mine bischopes with holi churche : heore wille ich late heom do, And fairore were þe kinge anouri him : and late him i-worþe also." ¶ Ne mi&yogh;ten þis hei&yogh;e men of him : non oþur word a fonge; So þat he o wenden forth heore wei : þo heo hadden a-bide longe. Maister herebard of Boseham : and oþure sethþe i-wende to þe kinge lowis of Fraunce : ase seint thomas him sende, And tolden þe kinge of al þe wo : þat seint thomas hadde with wou&yogh;. Þe king weop, þo he i-heorde þis : and made deol inou&yogh;, And tolde heom hov þe kingus men : at him weren bi-fore, And &yogh;wuch ansuere he heom &yogh;af : þat heore [wei] om. was for-lore. Þis gode men with ioie inov : heore leue of him heo nome, And þannes heo wenden sone i-nou&yogh; : to þe court of rome. Þare neren heo nou&yogh;t faire onder-fonge : for þe bischopes comen bi-fore And desclaundreden seint thomas : þat he was fals and for-suore. Ake naþeles þe grace heo hadden : þat to þe pope heo mi&yogh;ten go. him-sulue heo tolden in priuete : al seint thomases wo: Of þe status of clarindone : hou heo furst forth come, And hou he was i-brou&yogh;t at norehamptone : bi-fore þe kinge to dome, And hov he wende out of engelonde : In muchele miseise and wo, And al-hov he chaungede is name : þe sikerloker forto go. papa. ¶ Þe pope bi-gan to siche sore : and al. om. with ful dreori þou&yogh;t, Þe teres fullen out of is ei&yogh;ene : he ne mi&yogh;te with-holden heom nou&yogh;t, he þonkede god þat swuch a prelat : under him moste beo, So studefast to holi churche : and þat he mi&yogh;te þane dai i-seo.— A-morewe comen þis bischopes : and þe eorles also, To procuri seint thomas al þat vuel : þat heo mi&yogh;ten do; bi-fore þe pope, ase [he] sat : ful nobleliche heo come, And bi-fore þe cardinales : and al þe court of rome. episcopus london'. ¶ Þe bischop of londone : þat euere luþur was, bi-gan formest to telle is tale : a-&yogh;ein seint thomas. he stod up bi-fore al þe court : "beu pere," a-non he seide, "To þe we comieth to make ore mone : of strong lif þat we ledez. Ower ri&yogh;te it is up to holde : alle þat guode beoth, And foles to bringuen of heore folie : &yogh;wane &yogh;e heom i-seoth. A destaunce þare is i-sproungue : li&yogh;tliche in Engelonde, Þat destourbez al þat lond : with onri&yogh;te, ich onder-stonde. Þis holi man wende forth : In care and deol bi wei&yogh;e, Forto he cam to senouns : twelf mile fram pounteneie. ad Senon'. ¶ Þare he bi-lefde In soiourninge : alþe &yogh;wile þat he wolde, And þe king him fond to spene i-nov&yogh; : of seluer and of golde. Þis guode Man bi-lefde þere : In pais and reste i-nov&yogh;; An euere he carede for holi churche : þat þe king dude hire wou&yogh;. he sende to þe kinge of Engelonde : þat he scholde late beo stille And ne weorri non more op-on holi churche : &yogh;if it were is wille. Sone þas al. seþþe þe king of Engelonde : ase is wille him nam, Ouer se wende, ase god it wolde : and in-to Fraunce he cam. ¶ Þe king of Fraunce was a-boute : &yogh;if god wolde him grace sende, A-cordi him and seint thomas : &yogh;if he mi&yogh;te it bringe to ende. So þat heo weren to-gadere i-brou&yogh;t : at one dai&yogh;e I-set. Seint thomas cam bi-fore þe king : and ase is louerd him gret, And to is fet fel a-kne : he wep and cride is ore, "haue reuþe of holi churche : and ne weorre þov hire non-more, And þine wille i-chulle do : ase ich seide er, bi mine mi&yogh;te, Saue mine louerdes honur : and holi churche ri&yogh;te." ¶ Þe king makede him wroth i-nov&yogh; for þat word : ase he hadde ofte i-beo. "Novþe &yogh;e movwen," he seide, "ech-one : his falshede i-seo, For man al. i-ne ne mi&yogh;te don ope is al. þis worde : noþing a&yogh;en is wille Þat he ne wolde segge þat icholde : al-holi churche spille And þat it al. ic were a&yogh;en godes lawe— : and In swyche manere he mi&yogh;te Þat lond destourbi and me bi-nime : mi fraunchise and mi ri&yogh;te. And gode bischopes þare habbez i-beo : bi-fore him ase [&yogh;e] wyten, i-wis; Ake, þat &yogh;e i-seon alle mine treowenesse : and þat al þe wronge is his : And al. as þe wiseste and þe beste bischopes : þat bi-fore him were, A-&yogh;en þe meste fole kinge þat bi-fore me was : faire heo heom bere: Do he al-so a&yogh;en me nouþe : and ich me pai&yogh;e wel i-nov&yogh;; And &yogh;if he is a&yogh;en þis fourme : me þinchez he hauez wou&yogh;: Oþur him þinchez þat neuere bischop : so wis ase he non nas, Oþur he me halt þe meste wrechche king : þat euere i-bore was." rex francie. ¶ Þo seide þe king of Fraunce : and alle þat heorden þis: "Certes, þov bedest him loue i-nov&yogh; : al þat wrong is his." thomas. ¶ Seint thomas stod and bi-þou&yogh;te him : and gan to siche sore, "Þei ichabbe i-haued a-nuy : to come me is wel more. "&YOGH;if þe bischopus," he seide, "bi-fore me : hadden i-do heore mi&yogh;te, hit ne hadde i-beo non r. nou? neod þare-fore : to contecki ne to fi&yogh;te, For are þis it were stable i-nov&yogh; : þoru&yogh; gode mannes si&yogh;te. Nouþe god for is grace : sende holi churche hire ri&yogh;te! For þat þe bischopus bifore me weren to nesche : ase ich nouþe i-finde, Þe studefastore i mot beo : oþur it worth al bi-hinde. Ich wot wel þat heo habbeth here-bi-fore : þe customes in engelonde .I.-vsed heom al-to muche : holi churche to schonde; And þei heo habben i-beon suffred longe : and to custome i-drawe, Þare ne may no man for-soþe segge : þat heo beoth ri&yogh;t ne lawe. For ore louerd louez ri&yogh;t and sothnesse : and none vuele costomes, i-wis, And þat he schewez wel bi o word : þat In þe godspel is: For ore louerd euenez him-self : to sothnesse þere, Ake he ne eueneth him in none stude : to costome þat a&yogh;ein þe ri&yogh;te were. Þare-[fore] me þinchez ri&yogh;t it is : þat we to sothþnesse drawe, And destourbi þe vuele costomes : þat beth a-&yogh;ein þe lawe; Þare-fore i-nelle none costomes : soffri bi mine mi&yogh;te Þat a&yogh;ein sothnesse beoth : and a-&yogh;en holi churche ri&yogh;te." here man mai i-se þat vuele lawes : no guod Man nele a-fonge, Ake destourbi heom mid al is mi&yogh;te : þei heo habben i-beo i-holde longe; For he þat sosteinez vuele lawes : ase wel he haueth sunne, bote he heom a-legge &yogh;if he may : ase he þat heom deth bi-gynne.— Þo þe king of Fraunce i-heorde : and oþure þat þare were, Þat seint thomas ne dude þe kinges wille : no-þing apayd heo nere. rex francie. ¶ "Sire bischop," quath þe king of Fraunce : "Ich i-seo wel novþe þi wrong: Þe king þe beot loue i-nov : þet strif is nov on þe i-long. Wolt r. wost þov nouþe is lawes him bi-nime : þat neuere him nere bi-nome, Þe kingus heo[m] habbeth alle i-holde : þat bi-fore him habbeth i-come, gret Maister þov woldest a-londe beo : to muche were þi power. to muche ich habbe honouret þe : In mine londe her; bote þov suffri him is ri&yogh;te lawes : Ichulle bi-come þi fo, And &yogh;if we beoth þine fon boþe : I-not &yogh;wodere þov mi&yogh;t go." ¶ Seint thomas heold him euere In on. : þe kingues heom makeden wroþe, And departede fram him MS. heom so : In grete wrathþe boþe; huy þretneden and maden noyse i-nov : seint thomas heold him stille, Raþur he wolde deth a-fonge : þane þolie heore luþere wille. Nov help crist seint thomas : for neode he hath þere-to! Nov boþe þe kingus beoth is fon : &yogh;ware may he nov go? I-flemd he was out of Engelonde : and out of Fraunce also. Alle is men maden deol i-nov : heo nusten &yogh;wat forto do, And nameliche is cunnes-Men : þat for him i-flemd were. "Louerd," heo seiden, "allas, allas : þat we lifles nere! For i-driue we beoth out of Engelonde : and nei&yogh; of Fraunce al-so; Louerd, &yogh;wat scholde more sorewe : þane us is i-come nouþe to?" ¶ Seint thomas made him glad i-nov : and confortede is men a-non; "beth stille," he seide, "&yogh;e makiez deol : neodeles nouþe ech-on;" And seide "&yogh;e mouwen of-swinke ouwer mete : ase guode men doth mani on; For beo &yogh;e fram me, huy wollez beo ouwer freond : þat nouþe beot ower fon. &YOGH;e ne habbez hate of no man : bote for me, with wou&yogh;, And beo &yogh;e fram me i-wend : men wollez louien ov i-nou&yogh;." "A, sire, merci," þis oþure seiden : "we wuten wel al þis, For us-sulf nis us nou&yogh;t : bote for þe, i-wis; We schullen wel nouþe ore mete i-winne : ake we nuten &yogh;wat þov schalt do, bote þov schulle for honger dei&yogh;e. : louerd, &yogh;weþer þov schulle so?" "Ich mai bidde mine mete," quath seint thomas : "for i-nam nou&yogh;t to guod þer-to; Ore louerd it &yogh;elde heom alle þat ani guod : for his loue me habbez r. wollez i-do. bi-twene borgoyne and prouence : ase men doth me onder-stonde, gvode men beoth and al-mes-fole : þoru&yogh; kuynde of þe londe: &YOGH;if I-ne mot In Fraunce beo : þudere ichulle i-wende And bidde mine mete for godes loue : &yogh;if he me wole it sende. &YOGH;eot sum MS. sun guod man me may i-seo : and it beo godes wille, And habbe revþe of me and beon min help : þat miseise me ne spille." His men for him and for hem MS. him sulf : makeden deol i-nov&yogh;; Þe guode man among al is wo : confortede heom and lou&yogh;. Allas þe deol þat þare was : þat swuch an hei&yogh; man bi-tidde, Þat þe Erchebischop of Caunterburi : is mete scholde bidde! Deore a-bou&yogh;te he holi churche : and holi churche ri&yogh;te! Wel au&yogh;te ech man here-after drede : a-&yogh;en holi churche to fi&yogh;te.— Ase ech man at oþur is leue nam : a-boute for-to wende, And þe holi man In his side : &yogh;wodere god him wolde sende, Þare ase god wolde to bidde is mete : fort god him sende betere won, god sende is grace a-mong heom alle : þat sorie weren ech-on. ¶ Þe kingus Messager of Fraunce : to seint thomas cam gon, And seide þat is louerd him bad : come to him a-non. ¶ Fort h wende þis holi man : ake he nuste for &yogh;wuche þinge; he tok him al-to godes wille : and cam bi-fore þe kinge. ¶ A-non so þe king him sai&yogh; come : a-&yogh;en him he gan gon And ful a-doun to is fote a-kne : and cride him merci a-non; "blind," he seide, "ich habbe i-be : and þat novþe ich onder-stonde. Al mi lond to þine wille : ich take þe an honde; Þe &yogh;wule ich am in Fraunce king : ichulle finde þe i-nov&yogh;, For ich onder-stonde þe soþe nouþe : þat þe king hath al þe wou&yogh;." ¶ Þe king sende þis holi man a-&yogh;en : to Senouns, i-wis, And fond him þere spense i-nou&yogh; : him and alle his. More he dude is mi&yogh;te &yogh;eot : and bi-tuene he sende is sonde For-to bringue a-cord bi-twene him : and þe kinge of enguelonde. At Momartre In Fraunce : þis dai was i-nome, Þudere weren þis kingues boþe : and seint thomas i-come. Þe king of Fraunce dude is mi&yogh;te : þat heo weren to a-cord i-brou&yogh;t; Ake þo heo hadden to-gadere i-speke : al it was undo for nou&yogh;t: For þe king swor euere grete oþus : þat a-cord he nolde non bote þe status of Clarindone : i-holde weren euerech-on; And seint thomas swor þat bi is dai&yogh;e : he nolde þarof holde non, Raþur he wolde deth a-fonge : bote þare were oþur i-won. So þat heo departeden with wrathþe : þo heo nolden non oþur do. Seint thomas bi-gan to siche sore : and Inliche wep al-so, "Louerd," he seide, "help me nouþe : for þine swete fif wounde, Oþur holi churche is ope þe pointe : to beon i-brou&yogh;t to grounde." Maister bernard of bosham : þat MS. þaf is .o. clerk was, In priueite bi-twene heom to : seide to seint thomas: "Sire," he seide, "þe mount-martre : þis hul i-cleoped is Þare ase &yogh;e MS. ase &yogh;e ase &yogh;e habbez pais bi-speke : of holi churche i-wis: And ase þe name seith of þis hulle : ase ich douti in mi þou&yogh;t, Þoru&yogh; þi martyrdom holi churche : worth formest to pais i-brou&yogh;t." ¶ Sore sichinde seint thomas seide : "god wolde þat it were so And þoru&yogh; mine deþe holi churche : Into ri&yogh;t pais were i-do, And þat ich hadde with mine blode : and with mine liue i-bou&yogh;t Þat heo were in ri&yogh;te lawe : and Into guod pais i-brou&yogh;t!"— A-&yogh;ein Midsomer it bi-ful : þat þe king him gan onderstonde And In wrathþe of seint thomas : wende In-to engelonde, For-to saisi sire henri is sone : mid al is kinedom And for-to crouny him—longe him þou&yogh;te : are he þare-to com. And is conseil seide þat it was : mest of alle þinge Holi churche and seint thomas : In vnri&yogh;te for-to bringe; For þe Erchebischopes ri&yogh;te it were : þat of Caunterburie is To crouny þene kyng of Engelonde : and non oþur bischop, i-wis. Þe king in preIudice of him : and to bi-nimen him is ri&yogh;te, Let oþur bischopes crouni is sone : and [cud]de a luyte mi&yogh;te. ¶ Four bischopus him crouneden : a-&yogh;en ri&yogh;te and a-&yogh;ein þe wone: Þe Erchebischop of Euerwyke : and þe bischop of londone And þe bischop of salesburi : and of roucestre al-so; In seint peteres churche at west-Munstre : þeos dede was ido. Þe fader seruede þe sone : at þe mete a-dai, And with [þe] reaume saisede him : ase al þat folk i-sai.
