Þe tyþingus of þusse þingue : to seint thomas huy come: Of þulke on-ri&yogh;te he sende sone : to þe court of rome. Þe pope him sende lettres a&yogh;en : and bulle þat he scholde A-mansi þe king and is conseil : &yogh;wuch tyme þat he wolde, And suspendi þe bischopes : þat swuch on-ri&yogh;t duden þere, And entre-diten al engelond : for-to it a-mendet were. ¶ Seint thomas heold þe lettres to him : for-to god him grace sende Þat he mi&yogh;te him-sulf þe neodes al. dede do : &yogh;wane he to engelond wende.— &YOGH;uyt cam king henri þe olde : eft-sone into Fraunce. Þe king of Fraunce was euere a-nuyd : of þulke desturbaunce And wende a-boute to makien a-cord : and bi-tweone he sende faste; So þat heo weren, ase god it wolde : a-cordut at-þe laste. A-seinte Marie dai Maudeleyne : Idon was þis dede, In ane Mede þat men cleopiez &yogh;uyte : "þe traitores mede"— Al-so ferde þulke a-cord : ase þe Mede i-cleoped was, For þer-aftur a luyte stounde : no-þing i-sene it nas. Muche heo speken In priueite : and in grete loue heo wenden a-two, And seint thomas wende þat þe king : al is wille wolde do. Maister herebard of boseham : to þe kinge he sone wende For þe foreward þat heo hadde bi-speke : ase seint thomas him sende, And bad him hote &yogh;elde a-&yogh;en : ase forth ase he mi&yogh;te Þat is baillifs in is bischopriche : nomen with onri&yogh;te. "&YOGH;e," quath þe king, "wolde he so? : &yogh;eot he schal a-bide, Ichulle i-wite hov he wole him bere : formest In oþur side; par-auntur so faire he may : bere him a-&yogh;en me, Þat ichulle &yogh;elden him ech feorþing. : þare-fore cheose he." ¶ Maister herebard wende a-&yogh;ein : ant tolde seint thomas fore. "&YOGH;e," þou&yogh;te seint thomas : "þis pais is al-for-lore." Sethþe seint thomas him-sulue : to þe kinge he wende, to speken more of þe a-cord : &yogh;if he it mi&yogh;te a-mende. Þe king him welcomede al li&yogh;tliche : ase he ne heolde nou&yogh;t þer-to, And wende him forth to heren is masse : and seint thomas al-so. he was i-woned to habbe is masse : ase it ful to þe dai&yogh;, MS. dai&yogh;e And þo he let singen him þe soule-masse : þat no-þing þare-to ne lai&yogh;, For he nolde nou&yogh;t atþe pe i s : cussen seint thomas. Þe holi Man þou&yogh;te wel : &yogh;wat þe Anchaisoun was. Wel narewe þe king him gan bi-þenche : to derne is luþere þou&yogh;t, Ake to him þat wot ech derne þing : þing om. þing it nas [to] hele nou&yogh;t. Þo þe Masse was i-do : In conseil longue heo stode; Wel ofte þe king him opbraid : þat he dude him er of guode, And &yogh;wuch a lov&yogh; man he cam to him : and In &yogh;wuche pouwer he him brou&yogh;te, And þat he au&yogh;te vuele a-&yogh;ein him beo : &yogh;if he him wel bi-þou&yogh;te. So þat heo weren to-gadere longe : and þo heo hadden al i-do, Þei it luytel &yogh;wile i-laste : with loue heo departeden ato.— ¶ Seint thomas bi-gan to sike sore : þo he gan him onder-stonde reprimacio thome. Þat he hadde longe i-beo : oute of engelonde; Þei it were a-&yogh;ein is wille : it þou&yogh;te him luþer dede Þat is bischopriche so longe was : with-oute conseille and rede: to þe king of Fraunce he wende furst : and to oþere guode and hende And faire he tok is leue at heom : to engelond for-to wende; he þonkede heom of alle honur : þat heo him hadden i-do; With fair conduyt and gret loue : fram heom he wende so. Fram Fraunce he wende with gret honour : toward engelonde; At one hauene he gan a-bide : þat Men cleopiez &yogh;wit-sonde. [near Calais] Þe lettres þat he hadde of rome : to Engelond he sende, to don þe sentence al a-brod : bi-fore him ase he wende. Þe Erchebischop of Euerwyke : In sentence he let do And þene bischop of salesburi : and of londone al-so; for heo hadden i-crouned þene &yogh;onge king : a-&yogh;en þe dignete With onri&yogh;te In is bischopriche : he a-mansede hem alle þre. ¶ Þo þe tiþinge to heom cam : heo maden heom wroþe i-nov&yogh;, And þretneden þis holi man : þei it were with wou&yogh;. Seint thomas eode toward þe schipe : In-to engelonde for-to wende: A man þare cam fram engelonde : a&yogh;en heom, r. him guod and hende. "A, sire," he seide, "for godesloue : ne passe nou&yogh;t þe se, For þare beoth kni&yogh;tes in Engelonde : Iporueide þe for-to sle; At eche hauene Men a-waytiez : to kepe þe, mani on; &YOGH;if þou comest a-mong heom ov&yogh;t : þov worst a-slawe a-non." "Certes," quath þis holi Man : "Inelle no leng a-bide, to Engelonde Ichulle me drawe : tide &yogh;wat bi-tide; Þei ich beo drawe lime mele : I-nelle bi-leue non-more, to longe ich habbe þaunes i-beo : þat rewez me wel sore. Þe soulene þat ich habbe þare for-to loke : six &yogh;er and more, i-wis, With-oute wardein habbez i-beo : allas! to longe it is. A-slawe ich worþe, wel ich wot : þare, are come ou&yogh;t longe, Ichulle for holi churche ri&yogh;te : gladliche þene deth a-fonge. Ake biddez for me Ihesu crist : i bidde eov par charite! bi-fore alle oþere nameliche : o þing biddeth for me: Þat god for is holi grace : to Caunterburi me sende, Þat ich mote a-liue oþur ded : In-to mine owene churche [wende]; &YOGH;if i-ne mai þudere a-liue come : are ich i-martred beo, Þat mi bodi mote &yogh;wan ich am ded— : god it graunti me." his leue he nam wel deolfolliche : and to schipe he wende so; he þonkede heom al honour : þat Men him hadden i-do, And bi-tei&yogh;te al Fraunce Ihesu crist : and blessede it wel faste; Þat folk wep and makede sorewe gret : heore deol longe i-laste.— ¶ At douere were kni&yogh;tes &yogh;are : þat heorden of him telle, Sone ase he come op þere : al aredi him to quelle: Sire Reinaud of wareygne : and sire Randolf þe brok; And also Gerueis þe schyrreue : gret folk with him tok, to kepe þis holi Man at douere : ase he come op of þe se, And bote he wolde heore wille do : al-&yogh;are him for-to sle. to þe hauene of sandwiche : þat schip wel euene drou&yogh;— Þe oþere a-biden him alle at douere : with þretninge and bost i-nou&yogh;. In þe schipes seile an hei&yogh; : þis holi man let do Ane Croiz, þat Man fer isai&yogh; : Iseuwed faste þer-to: Þat was signe of is baner : oþur ne kepte he non. Men stoden at sandwich and bi-heolden : þe Croiz wel manion, And seiden, "we i-seoth nouþe hider-ward come : oure bischop thomas;" Þe &yogh;uyt he was fer in þe se : heo wusten &yogh;wat he was. Þat cri was sone wide couth : þat folk orn faste i-nov&yogh;, And are he were to londe i-come : muche folk a-&yogh;ein him drou&yogh;. heo criden and þonkeden Ihesu crist : þat heo mosten him a-liue i-seo, And welcomeden him with Ioye i-nov&yogh; : non more ne mi&yogh;te beo. Þene þridde day of þe Aduent : bi-fore cristemasse it was Þat he to Engelonde cam : þe guode man seint thomas; Þe seuenþe &yogh;er þat he wende furst : out of engelonde— Six &yogh;er and a Monthþe he was fleme : ase ich me onder-stonde. Þis was endleue hondret &yogh;er : and sixti &yogh;er and tene After þat ore swete louerd : In is moder a-li&yogh;te, ich wene.— Accusatio militum. ¶ Þat word to þe kni&yogh;tes cam : to douere of þis cas, hov seint thomas þe holi man : at sandwych a-riued was: to sandwich heo wenden faste. : seint thomas heo founden a-non; With MS. withith luþer semblaunt and fals heorte : heo welcomeden him ech-on, And seiden, "hou hauestþov þene wei : to engelonde i-nome, Þat destourbest al þat lond : sone so þov art i-come, And al-so al-holi churche : ase we alle i-seoth, Þat þov a-mansest þus þeos bischopes : þat þine felawes beoth! Þov au&yogh;test mid alle lawe : loue and pais a-rere, And þare nas neuere a-londe pais : sethþe þov bischop were! &YOGH;if þov wenest wel for-to do : with-drau&yogh; þine dede sone; Oþur Man schal bi þe do : ase with swuch a man is to done." Responsio thome. ¶ "Mine leue freond," quath seint thomas : "sothþ it is i-nov&yogh; þe mansinge þat ich let do : it was with ri&yogh;te and nou&yogh;t with wou&yogh;, And bi mine louerdes leue þe king : þat ech man in ri&yogh;te were, Þat so gret trespas ne wende forth : þat it a-mendet nere, And were eft-sone after-ward : with on-ri&yogh;te and a-&yogh;ein lawe In desertison of mine churche : to costome i MS. it -drawe." Þo þe kni&yogh;tes heorden þat þe king : consentede þer-to, heo bi-leueden al heore grete mod : and heore þretningue al-so, And in faire Manere beden him : ondon is Mansingue, to norisi loue with is felawes : and bi-twene him and þe kinge. So þat respit bi-tuene heom : of þis Ansuere heo nome, For-to seint thomas a-moruwe : to Caunterburie come. Aduentus Cantuar. ¶ Seint thomas a-moruwe : to Caunterburi him drou&yogh;. Al þe contreie a-&yogh;ein him cam : with Ioye and blisse i-nou&yogh;. Ech preost somonede is paroche : clanliche in euerech ende to beon alle &yogh;are a-&yogh;ein him : with procession for-to wende: So þat with processiones : manie and faire i-nov&yogh;, With croyz and with taperes : þe contreie a-&yogh;ein him drou&yogh;. Þare was Ioie and blisse i-nou&yogh; : more ne mi&yogh;te non beo; heo þonkeden &yogh;eorne Ihesu crist : þat a-liue him mosten i-seo. Of bellene and of tabours : so gret was þe soun, Of eche manere gleo and of song : þo he cam into toun, Þat man ne mi&yogh;te i-heore non oþur þing : bote þe noise þat was so gret; Non more ioie ne mi&yogh;te beo : þane þare was In euereche stret. ¶ Ase ore louerd a-palme-sonenday : honovred was i-nov&yogh; Þo he rod into Ierusalem : and toward is deþe drov&yogh;, Al-so was þis holi man : ase men mi&yogh;ten i-seo þere; For ore louerd wolde þat is deth : semblable to his were. Are seint thomas þe holi man : to is churche come, Þe Monekus with procession : a-&yogh;ein him þene wei heo nome. Of is palefrai he li&yogh;te a-don : and custe þe Monekes ech-on; to þe weuede wel mildeliche : heo ladden him a-non. Þo he hadde at churche i-do : al þat him was to done, With is men wel mildeliche : to is In he wende sone.— Milites retro veniunt. ¶ Seint thomas ne hadde i-beo : at is paleis nou&yogh;t longe, Þat þe kni&yogh;tes ne comen : heore answere forto afonge. heo beden him ase heo beden er : on-don is mansinge And a-soilli þe bischopes MS. bischepes : þat he let þare-Inne bringe. "bev freres," quath seint thomas : "þat ne mai i do nou&yogh;t, For heo beoth In mansinge : þoru&yogh; þe pope i-brou&yogh;t, And .I.-ne mai nou&yogh;t on-do is dede : &yogh;e wuten wel, in none place. Ake nou&yogh;t-for-þan ich truste wel : so muche In his grace, Þat ichulle a-soilli heom : In þusse fourme fawe: Þat heo don sikernesse for-to stonde : at holi churche lawe And to þe lokinge of holi churche— : ake in oþur fourme non." Þe kny&yogh;tes, þo heo herden þis : chidden faste ech-on, And þo heo nadden non oþur word : in wrathþe forth heo wende And tolden þe bischopes heore ansuere : þat heom þudere sende. Þe bischopes maden heom wroþe i-nou&yogh; : ant þretneden him wel faste. Ake naþeles þe tweyne of heom : with-drowen heom atþe laste: ¶ Þe bischop of salesburi : and of londone al-so; to holi churche heo wolden stonde : and to is lokinge al-so. ¶ Ake þe Erchebischop of Euerwik : a-non-ri&yogh;t heom with-sede: "Daþeheit habbe þat so atstonde : so folliche at ower rede, For-to don us in is grace : þat euere hath i-beon ore fo And hath i-don us mani a schame : and þanne he wolde wel mo! Þei he habbe ouer ov power : ouer me ne hauez he non, For erchebischop ich am, wel &yogh;e wutez : ase wel ase he is on. Ich habbe a luytel Coffre : þat stant hol and sount, Atþe leste þare beoth Inne &yogh;eot : Ei&yogh;te hundret pound: &YOGH;are ich am to spene þat : and &yogh;eot me þinchez to luyte, For-to a-wreken us wel of him : and for-to a-legge is pruyte. Wende we to þe kinge a-non : and telle him of is dede, Þat him ne tit neuere pais : bote he þarof him rede." hic ueniunt ad regem. ¶ Þeos þreo bischopus hasteliche : ouer se þene wei nome. A luyte bi-fore cristemasse : to þe kinge heo come, And founden him in Normandie. : a-doun heo fullen a-kne, heo beden him holden op his honour : stifliche hore help to beo, And tolden him hov þis holi Man : þo he to londe cam, Destourbede al-holi churche : and is kynedam And hov he hadde with gret pruyte : In mansinge i-do Al þat maden is sone king : and consenteden þare-to, And hov in despit of him : he dude swuch luþer dede, And þat he ne scholde neuere in pais beo : bote he nome an-oþur to rede. Rex iratus. ¶ Þe king, þo he heorde þis : for wrathþe he was nei&yogh; wod, he eode op and doun ase witles : and ofte in þou&yogh;te stod. "&YOGH;if he a-mansez alle þat maden : mine sone king," he seide, "Mid þe furste he a-mansez me : for it was min owene dede. Þe traitur a-spillez al þat lond : and bringez us in wrechhede, ho mi&yogh;te In swuch soruwe : longe eni lif lede?" Ofte he corsede alle þeo : þat he hadde forth i-brou&yogh;t, Of þe false preost and is fo : þat heo ne a-wreke him nou&yogh;t, Þat destourbede al þat lond : and brou&yogh;te in wrechhede; Ase he eode op and doun MS. don doun : ofte þat word he seide. ¶ Þe kni&yogh;tes þo [heo] heorden þis : stoden some stille, And bi-þou&yogh;ten heom wel priueliche : to paie þe kinges wille. Þe foure þat mest schrewes weren : bi-þou&yogh;ten hem of guyle: Sire reynaud le fiz ovrs : and sire huwe de moruile And sire willam traci : and sire Richard de bruiz— heore names for heore schrewehede : ne beoth nout for-&yogh;ite &yogh;uyt. huy nomen heom to rede stilleliche : to passi þe se, to paie þe kingus wille : seint thomas for-to sle. Stilleliche heo wenden forth : þat no man it nuste; heo weren nei&yogh;wat atþe se : are þe king it wuste. Þo þe king it onder-&yogh;at : After heom he sende Þat heo bi-lefde heore folie : and a&yogh;enward to him wende. Ake þis messager ne mi&yogh;te nou&yogh;t : ouer-take heom for none ginne, For are he cam to þe se : heo weren fer with-Inne. Þo made þe king deol i-nov : þat heo weren forth i-wend And þat is messager ne ouer-tok heom nou&yogh;t : þat he after heom hadde i-send.— Predicatio thome. ¶ Seint thomas at Caunterburi : a-midewynteres dai Stod and prechede al þat folk : þat mani a man i-sai. In is prechingue he bi-gan : to siche swiþe sore, And deol and sorewe made i-nov : ne mi&yogh;te no man more; Swiþe sore he gan to wepe : þe teres ornen a-doun. Þare was mani wepinde Ei&yogh;e : wel sone &yogh;eont al þe toun. "Mine leue freond," quath þis holi man : weopinde suyþe sore, "Ouwer preost ich habbe ane &yogh;wyle i-beo : ake i-ne mai no lengore more, This v. added on the bottom. For min ende-dai is nei&yogh; i-come : I-ne worþe here nou&yogh;t longe; Ich am redi for holi churche ri&yogh;te : deth for-to afonge. biddez for me for godes loue : and for holi churche al-so, Þat geth al-mest nouþe to grounde : bote god nime &yogh;eme þar-to. Deth ichulle wel fain take : &yogh;wan it is godus wille, For þe ri&yogh;te of holi churche : raþur þane heo spille." bok and candele he nam a-non : and a-mansede ri&yogh;t þere Alle þat werreden MS. wer&dotb; r n&dotb; e den holi churche : and a-&yogh;ein hire ri&yogh;tes were, And nameliche sire randolf þe brok : and sire robert de bruyz r. Brok also, Þat þe Erchebischope of Caunterburi : gret on-ri&yogh;t habbez i-do. For þe &yogh;wuyle þat he was out of londe : þe king henri bi-tok Þe bischopriche al for-to loke : sire Randolf þe brok, And he mad Robert de brok : is clerk þat was þo, Of al þis wardein onder him. : þat dude is londe wel wo; For he destruyde al þe bischopriche : and to him-sulf nam i-nov&yogh;, And dude him fair bold a-rere : of þat he nam with wou&yogh;. Þer-inne a-criste-masse dai : þo þe mansinge was i-do, he sat and .et. wel nobleliche : and manie with him al-so. Seint thomas (!) r. he (so the other MSS.) caste houndes of is bred : þat bi-fore him lai, And euerech hound it for-sok : ase al þat folk i-sai&yogh;. Þo handlede he oþur bred : and let menge hit at þe laste Wit oþur bred þat lai bi-side : and to þe houndes let it caste. Al þat he i-handlet hadde : þe houndes al for-lete, And chosen out þat oþur þare-a-mong : and wel clanliche it ete. Þe guodnesse al. mansinge was on him i-sene : a-non-ri&yogh;t þat ilke dai, &YOGH;wane þe houndes þat bred for-soken : þat bi-fore him lai. ¶ bi a fridai þulke &yogh;eres : was cristemasse-dai, Milites. Þare was gret miracle of god : þat al þat folk i-sai.— ¶ Þis four luþere kni&yogh;tes : of &yogh;wuche we gunne telle, to engelonde wel sone comen : seint thomas to quelle. to þe castel of salt-wode : a-seint Iohanes dai heo come, Six milene fram caunterburi : and þare heore In heo nome; And sire Randolf þe brok : to hem cam wel sone. heore conseil heo nomen þulke ni&yogh;t : þe luþere dede to done. Þene morewe, a-childre-masse dai : þo god þene dai sende, Sire Randulf þe brok wel stilleliche : to Caunterburi he wende, For-to enqueri of seint thomas : &yogh;ware heo mi&yogh;ten him finde, Þat he ne drowe him nou&yogh;t a-wei : ne hudde him no&yogh;were bi-hinde. Milites. ¶ Þis kni&yogh;tes þene Tywesdai : no lengore nolden bi-leue, Ake wenden heom to Caunterburi : wel are it were eue. A luyte bi-fore compelin : to seint thomas heo come; Þene ri&yogh;te wei ful baldeliche : In-to is chaumbre heo nome. heo comen and founden him stilleliche : In is chaumbre stonde With priue clerkes : and gret conseil hadden on honde. Sire Reynaud le fiz ours : grimliche forth i-wende, "Sire," he seide, "ore louerd þe king : in message us hidere sende, Fram him out of Normandie : Ane heste we habbez i-brou&yogh;t, Þat þov do is heste— : ne bi-lef þov it nou&yogh;t, And þat þou wende sone to is sone : þat &yogh;ong king i-maked is, For-to a-mendi a&yogh;einest him : þat þov hast is fader i-don a-mis, And swer þene othþ to beon him trewe : and of þe baronie al-so Þat þou halst of him in chef : do þat þo[u] au&yogh;test him for-to do. Þe clerkes þat þov bringest with þe : &yogh;if here-ate heo wollez at-stonde, Schullen suerie þe kinge trewe to beo : oþur heo schullen out of londe." Thomas. ¶ "Bev frere," quath seint thomas : "I-nelle þe no-þing lie, Þe kinge ichulle don ri&yogh;t and lawe : of þe baronie. Ake nolde it god þat holi churche : onder fote were so Þat ich oþur mine clerkus : scholden ani othþ þe kinge do. For þov wost wel alle þe lewede Men : þat beoth In his londe, Ne sweriez him nou&yogh;t þene oth : as ich me onder-stonde. Nov wolde &yogh;e holi churche : In grete seruage do, In more þane ani lewede man beo? : nai, it ne worth nou&yogh;t so." Miles. ¶ "Me þinchez wel," quath sire Reynaud : "þat þov nelt do no-þing Of þe heste þat we bringez : fram ore louerd þe king! Al-so in is half we hotez þe : þat þov a-soili al-so his bischopes þat þov hast : In mansinge i-do." thomas. ¶ "bev frere," quathþ MS. quathy seint thomas : "it nis mi dede nou&yogh;t, Ake þoru&yogh; þe popes owene mouthþ : in sentence heo beoth i-brou&yogh;t: ¶ And þou wost wel it ne fallez nou&yogh;t to me : þe popus dede on-do." Miles. "Þei þe pope it hete do," quat sire Reynaud : "þoru&yogh; þe it is i-do." ¶ "&yogh;if þe pope hath," quath thomas : "In sentence i-brou&yogh;t thomas. heom þat habbez me mis-don : he ne mis-paiez me nou&yogh;t." Miles. ¶ "In eche manere þov schewest wel" : sire Reinaud seide þo, "For-to a-nuye ore louerd þe king : and þat þov art is fo. &YOGH;ware-þoru&yogh; we i-seoth wel : þat þov wilnest to don him wo, And woldest beo king in is stude— : ake þou ne worst neuere so— And &yogh;if þou mi&yogh;test, bi-nime him is crovne— : ake so ne schal it nou&yogh;t go." both lines transposed in other MSS. ¶ "Certes, bev frere," quath seint thomas : "I-ne þenche no-þing þer-to, Ake raþur ichulle him þer-to helpe : so muche so ich mai, And for him and for his honour : ich bidde ni&yogh;t and dai. For þare nis nouþe man on eorþe : þat ich louie, i-wis, So muche ase him, sauue is fader : þat &yogh;eot mi louerd is. A-seinte Marie dai Maugdeleyne : for-soþe i segge þe, Þo þe a-cord was formest i-maked : bi-twene mi louerd and me, he seide me þat ich lete a-mansi : alle þat hadden mis-do Mine churche þat is his owene Moder— : and ich habbe idon so." ¶ "A-voy, sire preost," quath þis oþur : "to muche þov spext nei&yogh;, Þov desclaundrest þin owene louerd : þov ne art noþer guod ne slei&yogh;! Miles. Seistþov þat mi louerd þe king : In mansinge let do Alle þat maden is sone king? : ne consentede he þer-to? Nas it al is owene dede : and bi none oþur mannes lore? A-voy, sire preost, bi-þench þe bet : ne seie þov so namore." ¶ "Certes, sire," quath seint thomas : "þou wost wel it was so, thomas. For þou were þare þi-self þo : and manie oþere þer-to, bischopus and Erchebischopus ek : and oþere grete and hei&yogh;e, &YOGH;e fif hundred men and mo : al-so þov wel i-sei&yogh;e." Miles. ¶ "beo stille," quath þis luþere kni&yogh;t : "hold þinne mouthþ, ich rede, Þov mis-seist mi louerd þe king : daþeit alle þat it seide! ho mi&yogh;te soffri swuch sclaundre : bote he nome þar-of wreche? bi þe fei þat schal to god : man schal þe an-oþur teche!" his felawes euerechone : heore Armes a-brod caste And ferden ase Men þat weren wode : and þretneden him wel faste. to þe Monekus heo wenden a-non : "comieth here forth," he seide, "&YOGH;e holdeth here þe kingus fo : witiez him wel, ich rede; Þat &yogh;e to þe kingus wille : is bodi &yogh;e om. &yogh;e habben al-&yogh;are, Oþur he schal ouwer londes aboute : and ower maneres maken wel bare!" thomas. ¶ "Sire Reynaud," quath seint thomas : "wenstþou þat ichulle fleo? Nai par deu, nou&yogh;t a fote : for þe king ne for þe." Miles. ¶ "bi god, sire bischop," quath þis oþur : "bi þat þou wost þen ende, Þi fleoinge schal beo luyte wurth : þou ne schalt nou&yogh;t wel fer wende." Þis kni&yogh;tes in grete wrathþe þo : wenden heom forth ech-on, And leten heom army swyþe wel : and comen a-&yogh;en a-non, W[i]th suerdes and with axes : and with oþere armes mo; Robert de brok, þe luþere clerk : he was with heom þo. Into þe cloistre of Caunterburi : with grete noyse heo comen weue, Þe Monekus songen Euesong : for it was wel-nei&yogh; eue. Some for þe grete noyse : fullen a-doun for fere, And some bi-gonne to fleon a-boute : ase men þat witlese were. Seint thomas nam ane Croyz : ake oþure armes non, And þare-with wel baldeliche : he eode a-&yogh;ein is fon. Þis Monekus ornen MS. ornem to him some : "sire, merci," heo seiden, "For godes loue a-bid &yogh;ut here : ore louerd þe mai &yogh;uyt rede; Soffre þat we helpen þe : oþur þat we with þe dei&yogh;e." Some wolden makien þe doren : þo heo þat folk i-sei&yogh;e. "bi-leuez," quath þe holie Man : "&yogh;e ne doth nou&yogh;t as þe wise, Singuth forth ower auesong : and doth ore louerd is seruise. Man ne schal of holi churche : castel maken non. latez foles ane stounde a-wede : and in heore folie gon!" Þe kni&yogh;tes comen reken In : heore folie for-to do, And seiden, "&yogh;ware is nouþe þis traitour : and þis false bischop also?" thomas. ¶ Seint thomas bar þe Croiz on honde : and answerede is fon : "Ich am here, godus preost : ake traitour nam ich non. Sechez him þat wole ov fleo : oþur þat drede ovwer þretninge : Non rediore ne beoth ower swerdes : me to deþe bringue Þat min heorte prestore nis : þene deþ for-to take; For þe ri&yogh;tes of holi churche : I-nelle nou&yogh;t det for-sake." Þare wende forth on of heom : and is huyre of him drou&yogh;, And is mantel a-non after-ward : with gret uilte i-nou&yogh;. Sire Reynaud le fiz ours : pursiwede him anon. ¶ "Sire Reynaud," quat seint thomas þo : "hov schal þis nouþe gon? Ofte ich habbe þe guod i-do : and manie oþure mo." "Þov schalt sone," quath þis oþur : "i-wite hou it go. Traitour, þou art ded a-non : non oþur nelle ich do." "For-soþe," quath þis holi man : "wel prest ich am þer-to, For þe ri&yogh;tes of holi churche : dei&yogh;e ichulle wel fawe, &YOGH;if heo mi&yogh;te þere-after-ward : in pais beo and in lawe. Ak ich ov bidde &yogh;if &yogh;e sechez me : in ovre louerdes name, Þat &yogh;e ne comen nei&yogh; non oþur man : harm ne do ne schame; For non oþur gulti nis : of þat &yogh;e witez me, heo buth alle gultlese bote ich one : þar-of sikere &yogh;e beo; And al-so ase heo gultlese beoth : harmles latez heom wende." Þe guode man sat a-doun a-kneo : þo he sai al þe ende; Forto a-fonge þene stronge deth : is heued he buyde a-doun, And softe, ase some i-herden : he seide þis oresoun : Oratio thome. ¶ "Ore louerd and seinte Marie : and seint Denis al-so And alle þe avouwes of þis churche : In &yogh;was ore ich am i-do, Ich bi-take mine soule here : and holi churche ri&yogh;te." &YOGH;eot he bad for holi churche : þo he nadde non oþur mi&yogh;te! Sire Reynaud le fiz ovrs : mest schrewe of ech-on, For-to smite þis holi man : is swerd he drou&yogh; a-non. ¶ Ake Edward grim, þat was is clerk : in g[ra]unte-brugge i-bore, his louerd to helpe &yogh;if he mi&yogh;te : his Arm he pulte bi-fore. he woundede is Arm swyþe sore : þat blod orn faste a-doun. W[i]th þulke dunte he smot al-so : seint thomas ope þe croun, Þat blod orn bi MS. bi corr. to to is face a-doun : In is ri&yogh;t half of þe wounde. Lovde gradde þis luþere kni&yogh;t : "smitez alle to grounde!" Edward grim and MS. and and alle is men : þat þo a-boute him were, At-ornen a-boute ech in is side : ope þe weuedes for fere. Ase it bi ore louerd ferde : þo þe giwes him nome : his desciples flovwen anon : men nusten &yogh;ware heo bi-come; For in þe godspel it is i-writen : þat ore louerd him-self seide "&YOGH;wane a man smit þene schepherde : þe schep wollez to-sprede"; And ore louered bad for is desciples : þat men ne scholden hem MS. him non harm do. Þaron þou&yogh;te seint thomas : he bad for is men al-so. An oþur kni&yogh;t smot seint thomas : in þulke sulue wounde, And made him bouwie is face a-doun : and loke toward þe grounde. Þe þridde in þulke sulue stude : þare-after him smot a-non, And makede him loute a-doun : is face to þe ston. In þulke stude þe feorþe smot : þare þe oþere hadden er i-do, Þat þe point of is swerd brak : In þe Marbre ato.— ¶ &YOGH;eot þat ilke point at Caunterburi : þe Monekus doth wite, For honour of þe holi man : þat þare-with was i-smite.— With þulke stroke he smot al of : þe scholle and þe croune, Þat þut brain ful on þe pauement : al a-brod þare doune. þat &yogh;wite brayn MS. braym was i-meind : with þe rede blod þere, Þat colur was wel fair to seo : þei ich al. hit reulich were. Al round it orn a-boute is heued : ase it were a dyademe, And al-round þare-a-bouten it lay : &yogh;ware-of men token grete &yogh;eme. For &yogh;wane men peyntiez an Anletnesse al. halewe : &yogh;e ne seoth it nou&yogh;t bi-leued Þat þere nis depeint a Roundel : al-a-boute þe heued: Þat rondel men cleopiez þe diademe. : for manie i-seien þat cas, al. as me se&yogh; þer a fair cas bi þe diademe of is brayne : þat he holi was. Þo þis holi man i-martret was : þis kni&yogh;tes graden ech-on, "Þis traitour is to deþe i-brou&yogh;t : wende we henne a-non. Siwieth us &yogh;e kingus men alle : and alle þat with him beoth! Of þis traytur &yogh;e beoth a-wreke : ase &yogh;e nouþe i-seoth. he þou&yogh;te beo herre þane þe king : and bi-nimen him is croune And bringe to nou&yogh;t al engelond : ake nouþe he lijth þare doune." Ase þe giwes bi ore louerd seiden : þo heo wolden him to deþe do, Þat he made him kin[g] and non nas : and godes sone al-so. Þo þis luþere kni&yogh;tes weren : fram þis holi man igon, Robert de brok him bi-þou&yogh;te : and turnede him a-&yogh;en a-non And þoru&yogh; þe scolle smot is swerd : deope with-Inne is heued, Þo þe scolle al amti was : and no brayn Inne bi-leued. Ase þe giwes leten smite ore louerd : to þe heorte grounde After þe deþe with a spere : and maden þe fifte wounde. ¶ Þis luþere men alle in one stude : smiten seint thomas, In þe scolle ri&yogh;t euene a-brod : þare is croune was. he nas nou&yogh;t þe man þat he wolde : is heued enes with-drawe Ne fondi for-to fleo heore strokes : ne enes a-weiward wawe, Ne nou&yogh;t enes groni ne makien cri : bote mildeliche and softe Euere he heold is heued forth : al-þei heo smiten him ofte.— Þis luþere kni&yogh;tes wenden a-non : to is tresorie, breken is doren and is coffres : and duden gret robberie; heo nomen is cloþes and is hors : and is tresor al-so. Chartres and oþur priue writes : þat in is coffres weren i-do, heo it bi-token sire Randolf de brok : þat he þare-with wende to þe kinge in-to Noremandie : and segge þat heo him sende And þat he dude þare-with &yogh;wat he wolde : and &yogh;if þare ani were A&yogh;en is wille oþur is fraunchise : þat he MS. heo sone to-tere. A-mong is tresor heo founden al-so : tweie wel stronge heren : Wel filliche heo casten heom a-wei : ase þei heo nou&yogh;t wurth nere. Ake naþeles heo bi-þou&yogh;ten heom þo : and weren somdel in fere, And seiden bi-twene heom stilleliche : "guod man we wenez he were." Sire willam traci tolde sethþe : of þis guode man seint thomas Þe bischope of Eccetre in is schrifte : ase he of him i-schriue was: Þat þo þe guode man was a-slawe : and heo ovtward were, So sore heom a-gros þat heo weren : nei&yogh; witlese for fere; For heom þou&yogh;te euere ase heo eoden outward : ne wenden heo no so bliue, Þat þe eorþe openede onder heom : for-to swolewen hem a-liue.— ¶ Þo þis guod man i-martred was : and þe kni&yogh;tes weren out i-gon, In-to al þe toun of Caunterburi : couth it was anon. Þat folc cride deolfulliche : and to churche heo drowe And onovreden þat holi bodi : and custen it ofte i-nowe. Þe Monekus comen sone þer-to : and þis holi bodi toke And leiden faire In one bere : and bi-fore þe Autere it bi-woke. Þat face was &yogh;wy&yogh;t and cler i-nou&yogh; : and no blod nas þar-inne, bote fram þe ri&yogh;t half of is frount : toward þe left chinne A smal rewe þere was of blode : þat ouer is nose drou&yogh;; More blod þar nas in al is face : ase folk i-sai&yogh; i-nou&yogh;. Þe woundene bledden al þe ni&yogh;t : and men henten þare-of, i-wis— And In þe churche of Caunterburi : of þulke blode &yogh;eot is. Ake he nas neuere of þe worse hewe : for al þat he bledde þere, bote in guode heowe and cler inov : ri&yogh;t ase he liues were, And somdel ley&yogh;inde with þe mouþe— : he lai ase þei he slepe. Muche folk was a-boute him : þat blod for-to kepe, And forto gaderi of þe blode : þat i-sched was on þe grounde, And of þat eorþe þat was bi-bled : and glade weren &yogh;wan heo it founden— ¶ For þat nolde heom noman werne— : þicke a-wei men it drou&yogh;; And ho-so mi&yogh;te enes þat bodi cusse : he was glad i-nou&yogh;. A-morewe þe luþere kni&yogh;tes : Armeden heom eft-sone And with-oute toun nome heore red : &yogh;wat heom was to done; heo bi-radden for-to nime þat holi bodi : and with wilde hors to-drawe And sethþe hangen it on a waritreo— : heo seiden þat it was lawe, For he nas nou&yogh;t wuyrþe to beon i-bured : In churche ne In churche|&yogh;erd. Þe Monekus þou&yogh;ten þis swiþe wel : and weren ful sore a-ferd: heo bureden þat holi bodi : hasteliche þere-bi-side With luyte solempnete i-nov&yogh; : for heo ne dorsten no leng a-bide: Þis holi bodi was i-bured : In þe munstre of ihesu crist, bi-fore seint Austines weuede : and seint Iohanes þe baptist. heo ne dorsten nou&yogh;t so longue : for-to þat bodi i-wasche were, Al ongreiþet to leggen it In : [heo] hei&yogh;eden bliue for fere. Ase heo strepten of is cloþes : al a-boue heo founde Clerkene cloþes ase him to bi-feol : and oþere bi þe grounde: Monekene Abite with-Inne : ase heo founden þere, boþe Covele and stamin : he founden next is here. So þat he was Monek with-Inne : and seculer with-oute— Nuste no man is priueite : of þa[t] him was a-boute. And next is flesche þe here was : with knottes mani on, Þat deope in is flesche seten : some ri&yogh;t to þe bon; Þar-of he hadde schurte and brech : luytel aise he mi&yogh;te i-fele, So þat he was þare-inne i-bounde : fram þe scholdre to þe hele; With luytel aise he mi&yogh;te sitte : and ful on-aisi-liche ride, And on-aisiliche ligge also : opon eþur side. This v. on the margin. Ful of wormes was is flesch : to al oþur wo, In none creature, ich onderstonde : neuere ne weren i-seie mo; For in euereche stude of is flesche : so þicke heo weren i-sete, Þat þe grete ne mi&yogh;ten for þe smale : comen to heore mete; Faste heo schouen and cropen al-so : ase ametene formice overwr . al a-boute, Ake þe smale cleoueden faste to : þe grete bi-lefden with-oute. ¶ he deide endleue houndret &yogh;er : and seuenti and on After þat ore swete louerd : of is moder nam flesch and bon. Of þreo and fifti &yogh;eres elde : him-sulf he was þo— Mani a fair dai he hadde i-leoued : in care and in wo.— Þe king was in normandie : and her-of nuste nou&yogh;t: he made deol and sorewe i-nou&yogh; : þo þe tiþinge him was i-brou&yogh;t. In þe Castel of Argenteyn : he soiornede þo; With-oute þe &yogh;ates ne cam he nou&yogh;t : fourti dai&yogh;es ne mo, Ake euere he heold him in priuete : In wepinge and oþur wo; For none neode þat Man mi&yogh;te habbe : with-oute he nolde go; Ne rou&yogh;te he no-þing of þe world : wel luyte he eat al-so; Þe sorewe and þe deol þat he made : ne mi&yogh;te neuere beo i-do. he sende a-non to Caunterburi : for þis deolful dede And bad þe Monekus pitousliche : þat heo for him bede; And sende heom þat it nas : no-þing bi is rede, Ake þat þe kni&yogh;tes wenden forth : and no-þing him fore ne seide, And þat he sende after heom : for-to comen a-&yogh;e, ¶ And are þe messeger were to heom i-come : huy weren fer in þe se. to þe pope al-so god : þe king sende sone And bad is conseil pitousliche : &yogh;wat him were to done, he bad him for þe loue of god : In swyche anguise him rede, Þat he were i-schriue and a-soilled : of so luþer a dede. Þe pope hadde ful gret pite : þat he swuch word him sende, ¶ And gret Ioye for he hadde wille : is lif for-to amende. twei cardinales he sende him : wise men boþe to, to schriuen him of þulke sunne : and a-soilli him al-so, And þe bischopus for-to a-soilli al-so : þat weren in mansinge. Welle, þat þe Cardinales : welcome weren þe kinge! Þe king bad heom deolfulliche : to schriuen him of þe dede, And bi-het heom studefastliche : to stonden al-to heore rede. he swor on þe halidom : þat þoru&yogh; him nas it nou&yogh;t, Ne bi is wille, ne bi his heste : þat he was to deþe i-brou&yogh;t; And &yogh;et he seide þat for is fader deþe : so sori man he nas, Ne for is moderes no-þe-mo : Ase he for is deþe was; And he seide he wolde with guode heorte : alle þe penaunces a-fonge Þat heo wolden on him legge : ne weren heo no so stronge: For he was enchaison of is deþe : and of is anuy al-so: Þe kni&yogh;tes, for-to paien him : brou&yogh;ten him þer-to. ¶ Þo þe Cardinales i-sei&yogh;en þis : þat he to repentaunce drou&yogh;. heo a-soileden him and setten on him : stronge penaunce i-nou&yogh;, In priuete ase ri&yogh;t was : þat no man þar-of nuste, And þis al-so þat ichulle novþe telle : þat alle Men of wusten. his priue penaunces some weren : fastinge for-to make, vv. 2261-2 om. in the other MSS. And In fale tymes linne cloth and schurte of selk : for is sunnes for-sake. In-to þe holie londe he scholde finde : to hundret kny&yogh;tes, to fi&yogh;te Al ane &yogh;er with þe templers : for holi churche ri&yogh;te; ¶ And þat he scholde þe status of Clarindone : al clanliche with|drawe, Þoru &yogh;wuche statuz þis holi man : i-brou&yogh;t was of lijf-dawe; And þat he clanliche &yogh;olde a-&yogh;ein : al þat bi-nome was Þe bischopriche of Caunterburi : for wrathe of seint thomas; And þat he scholde is vuele wille : also clanliche for-&yogh;iue Alle þat he hadde out of londe : for wrathe of him i-driue. Þe king grauntede al heore wille : weopinde swiþe sore, And seide þat it was to luyte : and bad on him legge more, And &yogh;eot, "al to ouwer wille here : mi bodi ich bi-take, &YOGH;iueth me penaunces i-nowe : I-nelle neuer on for-sake." he wende out atþe Churche dore : a-soiled forto beo, And seide þat he nas nou&yogh;t wurthe : þat men scholde him with-inne i-seo; And with-oute churche pitousliche : he sat a-doun a-kne. Ake þe Cardinales nolden nou&yogh;t : is bodi al on-wreo, And somdel a-boue is cloþes : heo a-soileden him ri&yogh;t þere; For deol heo weopen pitousliche : and manie þat þare were. his sone al-so made one bi-heste : with wel dreorie chere: Þe faderes penaunce to folfulle : &yogh;if he of power nere Oþur &yogh;if he felle in-to feble stat : þat he ne mi&yogh;te it nou&yogh;t ful-ende, Opon him-self þe charge he nam : and dude ase guod and hende. Þus was þe holi man : i-brou&yogh;t to martyrdom; Mani was þe fair miracle : þat for him sone com. Both verses are written in one line. — Jerusalem. ¶ For In Ierusalemes londe men wusten : of is martyrdom With-Inne þe furste fourtene-Ni&yogh;t : þat he þe det nam. For a Monek in þulke londe : In is deþe vuele lai, And is Abbod cam to him : bi-fore is ende-dai Both verses are written in one line. And conIurede him MS. him þat him þat he scholde : after is deþe þere to him comen and tellen him fore : in &yogh;wuch stat he were. So þat þis Monek deide sone : ase ore louerd &yogh;af þat cas. to is Abbod sethþe he cam : ase he I-conioured was, And seide þat he i-saued was : In þe Ioie of heuene an hei&yogh;; he tolde him muche of þe Ioye : þat he þare i-sei&yogh;. he tolde him þat þulke tyme : þat he to heuene cam Þe Erchebischop of Caunterburi : þolede martyrdom, And þat is soule þulke tyme : to heuene wende a-non; "Fair was þat processioun : þat a-&yogh;en him cam gon Of Aungles and of patriarks : and of apostles al-so, Of Martirs and of confessours : and of virgines þer-to. heo nome alle þeos holi soule : And bi-fore ore louerd sone brou&yogh;ten hire with Ioye and blisse : ase he sat in is throne. his croune was al of i-smite : and blodi was is heued, And is brayn was al i-sched : þare nas nou&yogh;t bi-leued. ¶ 'Thomas, thomas,' quath ore louerd : 'þus it fallez to þe To þine louerdus court to come : In swuche manere to me! For þi seruise ich þe &yogh;yue : ase muchel Ioie and blis Ase ich &yogh;af seint peter : þat min Apostel is.' he sette ane Croune op-on is heued : of golde cler and guod, Swyþe wel bi-cam þat bri&yogh;te gold : op-on þe rede blod. More Ioie ne mi&yogh;te non beo : þane In heuene for him was, For þe Erchebischope of caunterburi : is name was seint thomas. Þe Tywesdai after Cristemasse : þe furste þat þere cam, Þis holi man in Engelonde : þolede martyrdom; And &yogh;wan þov i-heorst of is deþe telle : of Men of Engelonde, Þov i-leue me of þis tale : and þe soþe onder-stonde." Þe Abbod sone a-morewe : ne fur-&yogh;at nou&yogh;t seint thomas, Ake þe patria[r]cke of Ierusalem : he tolde al hov it was. So þat forþere in þe &yogh;ere : it was wel onder-stonde, Þo pilegrimes þudere comen : out of Engelonde, In &yogh;wat manere he was a-slawe : and &yogh;wuch tyme he was ded: Þe pilegrimes tolden al þe soþe : ase þe Monek hadde er i-seid. Þus was i-kud In Ierusalem : þe deth of seint thomas With-Inne þe furste fourtene ny&yogh;t : þat he i-martred was.— Guerra regum. ¶ þe fifte &yogh;er, ich onder-stonde : after is martyr-dom bi-twene kyng henri and is sone : gret contek þare bi-com. Þe sone bi-cam prout a-non : for is kynedom, And of is fader tolde luyte : and werre ope him nam. Þe meste del was with is sone : of al Engelonde, And þe kyng of Fraunce al-so : and þe king of scotlonde. So þat þis seli oldeman : In sorewe was I-nov&yogh;. Al he it wuste þe luþere dede : þat man seint thomas a-slou&yogh;. he wende him out of Normundie : to-ward Engelonde, Are he come to Caunterbiri : he nolde nou&yogh;were at-stonde; And þo he cam fer w[i]th-oute þe toun : he gan to li&yogh;te a-doun, Al a-fote and bare-fot : he wende into þe toun. In is Curtel one and on-gurd : ase al þat folk i-sai&yogh;, Ri&yogh;t so he wende to þe stude : þere seint thomas lai. At is toumbe he feol a-doun a-kneo : wepinde wel sore, he heold op is hondene deolfolliche : and cride him milce and ore. ¶ Wepinde in is oresones : al fastinde he lai At þis holi mannes toumbe : a ny&yogh;t and al a dai; Of euerech Monek of þe hous : he tok is discipline With a smart &yogh;eorde, and &yogh;eot him þou&yogh;te : þere was to luyte pine. he bad heom alle deolfulliche : bidden for him one, And swor he wolde legge a-doun : þe luþere lawene ech-one. ¶ So þat he let singe ane masse : are he þannes wende, In þe honour of seint thomas : þat he is grace him sende. Þe &yogh;wyle men þe masse songe : ase ore louerd &yogh;af þat cas, Þe kyng of Scotlond was i-nome : þat mest is fo was; And manie oþere also with him : þat weren is stron[ge] fon; So þat heo þat weren vn-nome : to him nadden power non. his folk dude þe bataille : þe &yogh;wyle þe masse i-laste MS. staste ; Þar-to heo hadden luyte help : and weren wel sore agaste, Ake ore louerd for seint thomas loue : his grace wel sone him caste, So þat heore fon weren some m MS. sone i-nome : and some flouwen wel faste. So þat þis seli olde king : þat al bi-neþe er was, Al a-boue was sone i-brou&yogh;t : þoru&yogh; bone of seint thomas; And is sone was al bi-neþe : and so he bi-&yogh;at wel luyte For-to weorri a&yogh;ein is fader : for is sori pruyte. bi him men mowen nime ensaumple : to beon to hastiue: to &yogh;iuen heore sones op heore lond : þe &yogh;wyle heo hem-sulue beoth a-liue. Þe kingus sone þare-after-ward : prouede vuele i-nov&yogh;, And wel longe bi-fore þe fadere : toward þe deþe he drou&yogh; And fur-pinede in þe menisone : þat is lif him þou&yogh;te long; he deide sethþe deol-folliche : in gret pine and strong. his broþer also, sire Geffrei : þat Erl of brutayne was, Deide al-so in þe menison : In þulke sulue cas. So þat after is fader deþe : þare ne lefde eir non bote heore &yogh;ongue broþer king Richard : and sethþe þe king Iohan— Ake sire Geffreies child : with ri&yogh;te lawe of londe Þe heritage scholde habbe i-bore : ase ich me onder-stonde.— Mors Militum. ¶ Þeos luþere kni&yogh;tes alle foure : þat slowen seint thomas Deiden in stronge deþe i-nou&yogh; : ase wel ri&yogh;t it MS. it it was. heo weren echone repentaunt : ne mi&yogh;ten none men more, euere heo criden on seint thomas : to &yogh;iuen heom milce and ore. Sone after-ward þat he was a-slawe : al heore guod huy lete And wenden to þe holi lond : heore sunnes for-to bete. Ake sire Willame traci ne wende nou&yogh;t : forth with þe oþere þreo, he hopede here In Engelonde : Inou&yogh; repentaunt to beo. These two verses are tr. in the MS. Þare-after-ward he bi-cam : in grete meseise and strong: his flesch bi-gan to breken out : and rotede an fovle stonk, So longue þat he stonk so foule : þat deul it was to se, Þat onneþe ani man mi&yogh;te : for stunche nei&yogh; him beo. his flesch rotede on him al-so : and al dai ful awei, Þat is bones weren al bare— : þo ne likede him no plei! Wit is hondene he to-drou&yogh; al-so : his flesch atþe laste, pece and oþur al a-brod : a-wei fram him he caste; hondene and Armes he to-drov&yogh; : mest of ech-on, Þat þere nas no flesch bi-leued : bote senue and bare bon. Manie men it þou&yogh;ten wel : þat bi is wille it were, Al for-to biete MS. bi e te is sunnes here : þat is soule in helle nere. Wrechchedore gost ne mi&yogh;te non beo : þane þis prisun was; And euere he cride deolfulliche : "merci, seint thomas." Atþe laste he let is lijf : In wel stronge pine, And &yogh;if ore louerdes wille was : he cam to guode fine. Þis kni&yogh;tes aftur heore luþere dedene al. dede : deiden sone ech-on, So þat with-Inne þe þridde &yogh;ere : a-liue ne lefde þer non. For þe sauter seith þat swuche men : þat of tricherie beoth, Ne schullen nou&yogh;t halue heore dawes libbe : ase &yogh;e alda[i] i-seoth; Þei heo beon swyþe repentaunt : ase þis kni&yogh;tes weren, ich wene, &YOGH;uyt ne libbeth heo nou&yogh;t half heore lif : ant þat was bi heom i-sene.— ¶ Seint thomas þis holi man : onder eorþe he lay, Are þat he I-schrined were : wel mani a long day; he lai þere nine al. inne and fourti &yogh;er : and half a &yogh;er þer-to And a-boute ane Ei&yogh;te dawes : are he were of eorþe i-do. god wolde a-bide ane guode tyme : to don so noble þing: Þat þare weren boþe guode : Erchebischop and king. For þe king Iohan þat longue was : euere of luþere rede, luyte þou&yogh;te bi is daie : to don so guode dede. ¶ Ake þe king henri, is &yogh;onge sone : nolde nou&yogh;t longe a-fine, After þat he was king i-mad : are seint thomas were in schrine. he nas nou&yogh;t þrettene &yogh;eres old : þo he dude þis noble þing, And it was in þe feorþe &yogh;ere : þat he was i-mad &yogh;ong king. Þe guode Erchebischop steuene : radde faste þer-to: So þat bi hore boþe redes : þis dede was i-do. Þe pope honorie, þat was þo : hidere he gan sende Ane legat fram Rome, þat het pandulf : to bringe þis dede to ende. Þe pope &yogh;af alle pardon : þat þudere wolden gon, Þat men nusten in Engelonde : suuych pardon non. Þare-fore, for-to honouri þis holi man : þere cam folk i-nov&yogh;; Of bischopes and of Abbodes : mani on þudere drou&yogh;, Of priores and of persones : and manie oþur clerkes al-so; Of Eorles and of barones : and manie kni&yogh;tes heom to; Of seriaunz and of squiers : and oþere house-bondes i-nowe; And þe simple men of þe londe : so þicke þudere drowe Þat al þe contreie þare-a-boute : þe tounes wide and longe MS. londe Vnneþe mi&yogh;ten al þat folk : þat þudere cam a-fonge. ¶ So þat þis hei&yogh;e men : þat scholden þis dede do Weren in care hov heo mi&yogh;ten : for prece comen þer-to; So þat Erchebischop steuene : of &yogh;wam ich er ov seide, And þe bischop Richard of Salesburi : þar-of heom nomen to rede, And prior water of þe house : and þe couent al-so, Wenden heom in priuete : þis dede for-to do. bi ni&yogh;te, þo men weren a-slepe : and luyte þar-on þou&yogh;te, heo nomes r. nomen op þe holi bones : and in one cheste brou&yogh;te, And setten heom in a priue stude : for-to þe time was i-come þat MS. hit was i-crid into al þat lond : þat heo scholden beo up i-nome. It was in þe monþe of Iulie : euene þene seuenthe dai, bi a tiwesdai it was þo : ase al þat folk i-sai&yogh;. Þo þe dai was i-come : to þe munstre heo wenden a-non, Kyng henri þat &yogh;onge child : an þe hei&yogh;e men ech-on; A-boute onderne of þe daie : to þis holi bones heo come. PAndulf wende furst þer-to : þat legat was of rome, And þe Erchebischop of Caunterburi : and þe Erchebischop of reins al-so, Þat for þulke þinge cam : fram bi-&yogh;eonde se þer-to, And sire hubert de boru&yogh; : þat þo was hei&yogh; Iustise. Þeos foure grete louerdes : þat noble men weren and wise, On heore scholdres huy nomen up : þis holi bodi a-non; ¶ Bischopus and Abbodes al-so : it beren ful mani on. to þe hei&yogh;e weuede of þe trinite : þe holie bones heo bere, And leiden þe Cheste al þare-with : In a noble schrine þere. Þis king henri was so &yogh;ong : þat he ne dorste nou&yogh;t With þe oþere bere þat holi bodi : laste men him hurten ou&yogh;t. It was bi a tiwesdai : þat heo þe bones op nome; Alle is chaunces þat he hadde : bi tiwesdawes him come. In a tiwesdai he was i-bore : and of is moder wombe he cam; And also ase men bringuth ane þeof : for-to a-fonge is dom, bi-fore þe kynge at Norehaumptone : op-on a tiwes-dai&yogh; Wit gret schame he was i-brou&yogh;t : ase al þat folk i-sai&yogh;— Filloker þane ani þef : folk him þare schende; bi tiwesday he was i-flemd al-so : and out of londe he wende; And bi a tiwesdai&yogh; at pounteneie : ore louerd to him com And seide to him þat swete word : of is martyrdom— ¶ "Thomas," seide ore swete louerd : "&yogh;eot schal of þine blode Al mi churche honoured beo—" : þis wordes weren wel guode; bi a tiwesdai also gud : to engelonde he cam, After þat he was i-flemd : to a-fonge is martirdom; bi a tiwesdai at Caunterburi : to deþe he was i-do; And sethþe bi a tiwes-dai : Ischrined he was al-so. Þeos seuen Auntres bi tiwesday : him comen atþe leste: Þare-fore we i-seoth manie men : makien one bi-heste to bi-leue flesch þene tiwesdai : oþur to o mel faste, For-to heo comen to Caunterburi : oþur þe &yogh;wyle heore lif i-lastez. Nov Iesu crist for þulke loue : þat seint thomas on þou&yogh;te, &YOGH;yue us part of þulke Ioie : þat he so deore a-bou&yogh;te.

18.1: AL þis bok is i-maked of holi dawes : and of holie mannes liues Þat soffreden for ore louerdes loue : pinene manie and riue, Þat ne spareden for none ei&yogh;e : godes weorkes to wurche; Of &yogh;was liues &yogh;wane heore feste fallez : men redez in holi churche. Þei ich of alle ne mouwe nou&yogh;t telle : ichulle telle of some, Ase euerech feste after oþur : In þe &yogh;ere doth come.— Þe furste feste þat in þe &yogh;ere comez : we cleopiez &yogh;eres-dai, Ase ore louerd was circumciset : In þe giwene lay, For to fulfullen heore lawe : and for cristinedom non nas Are longe þare-afturward : þat he I-cristned was. ¶ He was Nyne and twenti &yogh;er : and þrettene dawes old Are he i-baptized were : ase þe bok us hath i-told: Al-so it fel a twelfte-dai : seint Iohan þe baptist Baptizede in þe flum Iordan : ore louerd Ihesu crist. In þat dai a twelf-monþe : ore louerd was at one feste, Þare he turnde water to win : þoru&yogh; is moder heste. We holdez al-so þat dai feste : of þe þridde þinge: Ase þe þre kingues to ore louerd : presaunt dude bringe; to him heo comen ase is moder : a-child-bedde lay, After þat he i-bore was : þane þretteþe day, Ase it fallez a-twelfte-dai— : longe heo erore him sou&yogh;ten, gold. and. mirre. and An-sens : In presaunt heo him brou&yogh;ten.— Seint Fabian þrettene &yogh;er : pope was MS. was was In rome; he turnede mani men þat luþere weren : in-to cristine-dome. Decius, þat prince was : of heþenesse þo, he let him martri þere-fore : and oþere with him mo.
18.2: Vita sancti Sebastiani. Telle ichulle of þe holi man : seint Sebastian. he seruede ane heþe amperour : þat het dyoclician; hext maister he was onder him : to don al is wille. Cristine Man he was bi-come : bote þar-of he heold him stille, for no doute of Martyrdom : ake for þat he wolde longe Serui god almi&yogh;ti, are he wolde : deth onder-fonge. Alle þe men þat cristine weren : þat þe Aumperor ou&yogh;wer founde Sone he let to deþe bringe : with fuyre oþur mid wounde. &YOGH;wane ani man for cristindom : to deþe scholde beon brou&yogh;t, Seint Sebastian heom confortede : þat heo ne dradden heom nou&yogh;t Deth a-fonge for godes loues : Ake þat heo studefaste were; Mani he heold in þe ri&yogh;te bi-leue : þat flechchi wolden for fere. ¶ Marcus and Marcellian : breþren weren tweie, Þe Aumperour for cristinedom : I-nome hadde heom bei&yogh;e: he let heom binde to-gadere faste : boþe to o piler, And to þe Eorþe naylli heore fet : þat heo ne mi&yogh;ten fer ne ner. So heo stoden al ane day and a ni&yogh;t : þat non ne mi&yogh;ten fram oþer; Eiþur of heom ofte to oþere seide : "here is ioye, leue broþer!"— guod it is and murie : breþren to wonie i-fere! Euere heo precheden cristindom : mid wel glade chere. Þe Aumperor let nimen ane spere : ase heo stoden to-gadere i-bounde, Þoru&yogh; heore heortene he let heom smite : þat heo deiden in a luyte stounde. Sebastian was þo i-wreid : þat he heom &yogh;af þane red to holden op faste heore cristindom : þei heo scholden beo ded. Þe Aumperor let him cleopie : "Sebastian," he sede, "to þe al mi truste was : mi lond to wissi and rede, Of alle þing þat min is : Ich &yogh;af þe mest power, to holden op min honour : and to saui it fer and ner: Ich habbe to þe suspecion : Ake for-soþe i-ne segge it nou&yogh;t, Þat þov a-&yogh;en me and a-&yogh;en min honour : Itorned hast þi þou&yogh;[t]." Sebastian seide, "sire Aumperour : A&yogh;en þe neuere I nas, Ake mid þe and al þine þinge : to þin honour ich was, And ofte ich habbe ni&yogh;t and dai&yogh; : godes sone bi-sou&yogh;t, Al-so wisliche ase he with is heorte blode : deore us hauez i-bou&yogh;t, Þat he þe &yogh;yue power gret : and wille and eke þou&yogh;t to leten þine false godes— : for heo ne helpeth þe nou&yogh;t." ¶ Wod-wroth was þis Aumperor. : "Sebastian," he seide, "habbe ich þus i-holde þe? : turne þi þou&yogh;t, ich rede! bote þov honouri ore godus : to swuche pine i schal þe take Þat, are þov beo to deþe i-brou&yogh;t : ech lime þe schal ake." "Sire," seide Sebastian : "þine þretningue ne drede i nou&yogh;t, More me greuez þat þou nelt : habbe reuþe in þi þou&yogh;t And honouri him þat made þe man : ant þine maumates bi-leue, Þat ne mouwe helpe nou&yogh;t : for heo beoth doumbe and deue." Þe Aumperour in grete wrathþe was : þesne holi man he let take, And dude him leden into þe feld : and binde him to a stake, he let archers to him scheote : ase it were to one marke; With quareles and with Arewene : heo maden him woundes starke. Mani on wende þoru&yogh;-out him : in a luytel &yogh;wyle heo stikeden al-so þicke on him : so yrichon deth of piles. Þo heom þou&yogh;te þat he was ded : hom heo gonne i-wende; On-bured heo bi-lefden him þare : his bodi for-to schenden. A cristine womman, þat hei&yogh;te Yreine : wende þudere bi ni&yogh;te Forto burien þat holi bodi : &yogh;if heo it finde mi&yogh;te. heo cam and fond him hol and sound : he nadde nou&yogh;t one wounde; With gret Ioye heo ladde him to hire hous : and glad was þat heo him founde. ¶ Þene feorþe dai Sebastian : wende to þe Aumperour. "Sire," he seide, "ichulle þe telle : þat fallez to þin honour: &YOGH;e mis-bi-leuez, and men doth eov : a-mis to onderstonde Þat cristine men scholden harm do : to þe and to al þine londe. For i-sosteyned and i-saued : it is þoru&yogh; heore bone More þane þoru&yogh; ouwer Maumates : þat ne beoth nou&yogh;t wurhþ a spone. For we biddez ny&yogh;t and day : god, þat me hidere sende, Þat he eov &yogh;iue long lijf : &yogh;if &yogh;e eov wollez a-mende." "hou is þis?" quath þe Aumperour : "&yogh;weþur þov a-liue beo? Nartþou nou&yogh;t Sebastian : þat ich a-felde let sle?" "&YOGH;e," he seide, þis holi man : "a-liue ich am nouþe her, hol and sound, with-oute wounde : to schewen þe godus pouwer, And to schewen þat &yogh;e onri&yogh;t doth : cristine Men to sle, For heore bi-leue is ri&yogh;tful and guod : and ouwere nis wuyrth a stre. Þare-fore on þine soule þench! : ne bi-lef þou nou&yogh;t on a stone, Ake on him þat us deore a-bou&yogh;te : þat is godes sone al one." ¶ "Ov&yogh;," seide þe Aumperovr þo : "&yogh;ware is ovre mi&yogh;te? Schal þis þeof þoru&yogh; is wichchinge : a-&yogh;en us with wordes fi&yogh;te?" he let nimen sebastian : and hom to is paleis lede. For no miracle þat he dude : to wide scholde sprede, Laste Men torneden to cristindom : In-to a priue stude he him ladde, With staues he let him to deþe beten. : and þo heo a-slawe him hadde, In one Chaumbre foreine : a-midde þe fuylthþ-hede he let him honge with a rop— : and þat was a vil dede— Þat bodi forto schende : for he hadde drede Þat cristine Men him wolden stele : and is bodi a-wei lede. bi ni&yogh;te cam þis holi Man : to a womman, þat het lucine, And tolde hire hou he ymartred was : and in &yogh;wuche pine, An hou filliche is bodi heng : and þat heo ase sone ase heo mi&yogh;te his bodi fette, and burien it : a-mong cristine men bi ni&yogh;te. Þis guode womman at Midni&yogh;t : dude ase he hadde i-bede: Fette þat bodi and burede hit : In a wel fair stude. Þus seint sebastian þe holi man : is lif brou&yogh;te to ende, And fram þe pine of is liue : to þe blisse of heuene he gan iwende.

19.1: SEint Anneis, þat holi Maide : wel &yogh;ong heo bi-gan to serui god al-mi&yogh;ti : to beon cristine womman. heo nas bote of þrettene &yogh;er : þo heo was to deþe i-brou&yogh;t For þe loue of Ihesu crist : þat deore us hath i-bou&yogh;t. In rome, þare he wonede : so fair creature nas non Ase was þis maide forthward : of felle noþer of bon. Ase þis Maide-child cam a dai : goinde fram schole, Þe constables sone hire i-sai&yogh; : and heold hire for fole; he gan to louien hire in folie : and for hire was in mourninge, And carede hov he mi&yogh;te best : to ende his fole þou&yogh;t bringe. For stille mourninge þat he hadde : he i-werth swuyþe lene. Þar-of wondrede muche is frend : and &yogh;erne him duden bi-men[e]. heo axeden him a dai in priuete : hov he dude fare. he gan to telle fram on to oþur : &yogh;ware-of was is care, And hou he wolde him-self a-sle : bote he þat maide hadde. Þe consta[b]le non oþur ne sai&yogh; : is sone forth he ladde; heo comen to Anneyse, þat Maide hende : and nomen hire bi þe honde. Þe fader seide : "lo here mi sone : þat wurth riche heyr of londe: ¶ A fair grace þe is i-come : he hath is heorte to þe i-take; Riche womman þou worst i-nou&yogh; : he schal habbe þe to make; hext þov worst of al þi kun : of londe and oþur þinges, gold and seluer þe worth i-nou&yogh; : broches and eke ringus." Þat maide seide : "go fram me : þov luþe[r] deþes fode! Woldestþov defouli mi bodi? : þov ne bringest me neuere in þat mode. Ich habbe me one spouse i-nome : þou ne wost nou&yogh;wer swuch non, bri&yogh;tore þane þe sonne oþur ani li&yogh;t : þat euere on eorþe schon. Of &yogh;was kuynde wondri may ech þing : for is moder is clene mayde, his fader of womman neuere ne wuste : so þe prophetus us saide; Al þene world he made of nou&yogh;t : and &yogh;af us ovre fode; Wel deore with is swete blod : he bou&yogh;te us on þe rode. Ane marke he hathz on me i-do : þat I-ne scholde non oþur take, Deorewurþe þing he hath me bi-hote : I-nelle him neuere fur-sake." ¶ Þe Constable het Symproni. : "hov geth þis," he seide, "&YOGH;weþur þov bi-leue on þe false gode? : torne þi þou&yogh;t, ich rede And nim þis child to þi spouse : and þenk on þine owene guod, Oþur ischal do þe so tormenti : þat þov schalt nei&yogh; beo wod." "beo stille," seide þis maide þo : "be stille, þou deueles lime, Þov ne schalt to-dai for no þretning : mi guode þou&yogh;[t] me bi-nime. Ich am redi for is loue : þat deore me hath i-bou&yogh;t tormenz a-fonge, and þe deth al-so : for Ine drede me ri&yogh;t nou&yogh;t." þe Constable let somony al þe cite : and brou&yogh;te þis mayde heom bi-fore; hire for-to schiende, he dude hire strepe : so naked so he o was i-bore, Þat ech man scholde i-seon hire derne limes : þe more hire to schende. "Onwreste man," þis mayde seide : "schame þe worth atþenende. ¶ Ne schameth þe no-þing in þi þou&yogh;t : bi womman þus to do, &YOGH;wan þou of womman art i-come : and ech man is al-so?" Þat al. þat maide was not ags. hnot for hire &yogh;ong-hede : are hire smok were of i-nome, Þare was MS. was was on hire swete heued : so muche fair her i-come, Þat hudde al hire swete bodi : þat it tilde bi-neothe hire kne MS. kneo ; Þo ne mi&yogh;ten men for here : of hire bodi nou&yogh;t i-se. An hous þat seruede of bordel : þare was bi-side: Þare-Inne þe constable hire let do : and sethþe het crie wide Þat alle þat wolden folie don : þudere scholden wende And finde þare a fol womman : of bodie fair and hende. Þo þat Maide was þare-Inne i-do. : so ful was þat hous of li&yogh;te Þat no man for brij&yogh;t-hede : þat Mayde i-seo ne mi&yogh;te. Þat Maide sat a-doun a-kneo : and seide hire oresun þere: "Louerd," heo seide, "&yogh;ong ich am : a-mong mine fon i-brou&yogh;t here, Euerech fondeth to don me schame : þat he[r]-a-boute wendez: Louerd, ne &yogh;if neuere no luþer man power : mi bodi for-to schende!" Þis Maide sat euere in hire beden : to ore louerd heo gan crie: hire ne mi&yogh;te no man for li&yogh;te i-seo : þat come þere-In for folie, Ake euere &yogh;wane heo comen In : to don heore fole þou&yogh;t, heo heorden hire crie on ore louerd so &yogh;erne : and hire ne sei&yogh;en nou&yogh;t. Vv. 63, 64 are tr. in the MS. ¶ Þo bi-gan ech after oþur : ase euer-ech with-Inne cam, For Miracle þat heo sei&yogh;en þere : tuyrne to cristindom, And bi-gonne forth with hire : to ore louerd &yogh;eorne crie— Þo was þat an hous of beden : þat raþer was of folie. Ase þat maide sat and bad hire beden : an Aungel þare cam gon, A Roket he brou&yogh;te on is hond to hire : &yogh;wittore nas neuere non. Þat [maide] om. dude on þis Roket. : al naket heo was er, Naþeles heo ne mi&yogh;ten nou&yogh;t hire bodi seo : for li&yogh;te ne for her; Þo heo hadde ido þis Roket on : non-more i-hud heo nas; Fairore lijf nas neuere i-seie : þane þis &yogh;onge maide þo was. Þe constables sone cam for-to don with hire : ase he hadde er i-seid: And are he mi&yogh;te þat Maiden handli : he fel a-doun stan-ded. his felawes þat with him comen : with-oute heo weren wel stille, And hopeden, for he so longe was : þat he dude is wille. ¶ Naþeles, þo he to longe was : is o felawe gan in gon, And fond þat child ligge ded : so cold ase a ston. he leop him out in-to þe strete : loude he gan to grede: "Comiez hidere, men, and sleth þis wichche : for heo hath i-do a luþer dede: Þe Constables sone heo hath a-slawe : here &yogh;e mouwen i-seo. Comiez nouþe bliue and nimeth hire : þat heo a-wei ne fleo!" Þat folk cam reke a-boute þis hous : and founden þat it was ded. Alle þe baillifs þudere comen : to nimen þar-of red. Some seiden þat heo wichche was : some þat heo was guod, And alle for þe childes deþe : wroþe weren in heore mod; heo stoden and Iuggeden hire a-mong heom alle : þat quelle heo wolden hire sone. Þat maide sat a-doun on hire knes : and made to god hire bone: "louerd," he seide, "&yogh;if þi wille beo : &yogh;if me &yogh;if me al. om. þine mi&yogh;te and þine grace: Þov kuythþ þine mi&yogh;te þ. m. al. om. and send þis child : lijf here In þis place, Þat þis folk þat here is luyþur : þine mi&yogh;te mouwen i-seo; Ne lat none mo men deth a-fonge : for enchesun of me." ¶ A-doun þar cam an Aungel : "mayde Anneis," he seide, "Ore louerd hath i-heord þine bone : þat þou to him bede." heo blessede þat child, and hit aros : fram deþe to liue, And þonkede god, and orn him out : at þe dore wel bliue; he cam out a-mong al þat fo[l]k : loude he gan to crie: "On god þat om. þat is In heuene : þat was i-bore of þe Maidene Marie, Þat is fader and sone and holi gost : louerd of alle þinge, Þat wille hadde þoru&yogh; is mi&yogh;te : fram deþe to-day me bringe. Fur-sakez eovwer false godes : for heo nabbeth mi&yogh;te non Forto meoui heom enes of þe stude : non more þene a ston." Þe childes fader and mani oþure : swiþe glade bi-come, Þo heo i-sei&yogh;en þe Miracle : and cristindom hem nome. Wod-wroþe weren þe luþere men : heo gonne bi-twene heom telle In &yogh;wuche martyrdome heo mi&yogh;ten : þis holi maide a-quelle. heo leten makien a gret fuyr : þare a-midde þe place, For-to brenne seint e Anneis. : and þar MS. þat ore louerd cudde is grace. ¶ For þo þat Mayde was þudere i-brou&yogh;t : In þe fuyr men hire þrev&yogh;: Þat fuyr clef a-middes a-to : and þe luyþere men it wel i-knev&yogh;, For þo it smot in eiþur side : and barnde heom al-clene. Þat Maide nas i-wemned nou&yogh;t : for it ne touchede hire nou&yogh;t ene; bote heo sat hire a-doun a-kne : and in eiþur half was þe lei&yogh;e. "Louerd," he o seide, "&yogh;if þi wille it beo : þat ich here schulle dei&yogh;e, I-redi ich am for-to a-fonge þat fuyr : þat is me In eyþur side, &YOGH;if ich schal here I-martred beo : oþur lengore a-bide." Þo heo hadde þis word i-seid : þat fuyr a-queinte a-non, Non more hete nas in þe place : þane in þe colde ston. &YOGH;eot þulke þat bi-lefden a-liue : on god þat ne om. þat bi-lefden nou&yogh;t, And Iuggeden hov heo mi&yogh;ten don : þat heo were to deþe i-brou&yogh;[t]: heo leten nime a kene suerd : and þoru&yogh; hire þrote it smite; Þat rede blod orn a-doun : on hire limes so &yogh;wite. Fairore ne mi&yogh;te no-þing [be] : þane was þat ilke blod On hire limes þat weren so &yogh;wite : þo hit þaron stod. Þus þis Mayde seinte Annes : brou&yogh;te hire lijf to fine, And wende to þe Ioye of heuene : after hire muchele pine.

20.1: SEint Vincent In spayne : to a cristine bischop cam, Þat men cleopeden valentin : and cristindom of him nam. Þe king al. iustice of þe londe— : Dacian was is name— For þe bischop cristine was : he þou&yogh;te to don him schame: he let him nime and binde : and don him in grete pine. Þe bischop cride &yogh;erne on god : he nolde oþur fine. With heom þat him tormenteden : he spac with milde speche. Seint Vincent was þare-fore wrath : and seide: "ich mot þe teche; &YOGH;wy spext þov so mildeliche : ase þei þov a-drad were? Wenstþou þat heo þine Maistres beon? : &yogh;war-of hauest þov fere? Spec hardiliche, and conforte wel : oþure þat cristine beoth, Þat heo mowe to þe deþe hardie beon : ase heo þe i-seoth!" "hov is þis?" seide þe king : "&yogh;weþur þes þef wene fi&yogh;te And with-segge us al a-brod? : Ich him schal euene di&yogh;te. Lateth þene bischop a-wei gon : for is milde speche, Nimez vincent and bindez a-non : we schullen him oþur tech[e]. With scourges and with staues : faste &yogh;e him bete, Þat he ne mouw i-w i elde neuere a lime : are þat &yogh;e him lete!" "&YOGH;e," seide vincent, "þov pai&yogh;est me wel : þi word ne þinchez me nou&yogh;t ille, I-ne fond neuere Man þat so wel : a-cordede to mi wille: ¶ Nov ich hopie to habbe game : for erore me þou&yogh;te longe; hit schal me tuyrne to Ioye and gleo : and þe to MS. to þe pines stronge." Þe tormentores nomen þane holie Man : and to a piler him bounde, With staues and scourges heo leiden on him al. him on : and maden him mani a wounde. Þo heo &yogh;euen him sorest duntes : lei&yogh;en he gan wel smere; Þe tormentores seten a-doun and cleopeden help : þo heo werie were, And seiden : "we beoth nouþe ouer-come : ore Armes aketh sore; he[l]pez us and betez þesne MS. þesne þesne þeof : for we ne mowen non MS. nou more." Þo was þe king wroth with heom : he let heom a-nou take, Some he let tormenti sore : þat ech bon heom gan Ake, And some he let to deþe bringue : and some in oþur turment. Euere he let ferschi and nevny r. nevuy? : tormentores to seint Vincent. &YOGH;wane heo weren werie of bete : þe holi man bi-gan to speke: "Louerd, i-wuyrþed beo þi name : nouþe ich am swiþe wel a-wreke: Þe more þat heo betez me : þe betere me is, i-wis; to heom i[t] torneþ to pine and sor : and me to Ioie and blis." ¶ "Ne mowe we nov&yogh;t," seide þe king : "with no-þing þar-to it bringe Þat þov nelt nemme þine false god : for no luþur betinge?" "Þov luþere Man," seide Vincent : "&yogh;eot þou most tormenti more, I-ne habbe nou&yogh;t &yogh;eot tormenz i-nouwe : þar-after me longez sore." Þo he was i-scourget so : þat men mi&yogh;ten i-seo ech bon And euerech Ioynt and senue : þe king gan ner him gon, "Vincent," he seide, "haue of þi-self : revþe and merci, Ne lat þov non-more þi fa[i]re bodi : þus defouli! bi-lief on ovre godes and torne anon : þi þou&yogh;t and þi mod And i-schal þe &yogh;iue ope al mi lond : pouwer gret and guod." "beo stille," seide seint vincent : "al Atter is þi lore, beo stille a-non, þou deueles tonge : þou makest me drede sore: hit me greueth þat þov feinest þe : more þane al þe pine And alle þe tormens þat þov me dest : þov and alle þine; Þat þov bi-leuest þine tormenz so sone : and art bi-neoþe i-brou&yogh;t. &YOGH;eot þou most more Ioye : bringen in mi þou&yogh;t." "Þov schalt &yogh;eot," seide þe king : mo tormenz a-fonge." he let him lede with-oute þe toun : and on a gibet him honge. Vincent for Ioie bi-gan to eorne : þo he i-heorde þis dom, Þare nas non þat him mi&yogh;te ouer-take : are he to þe gibat com. Þo þat he an-hengut was : gret Ioye he made and blisse, Euere he prechede ase he heng : godes wordes to wisse; Þe lengore þat he þare heng : þe more Ioie he made. Þo gradden þe tormentores : "we ne schullen neuere ouer-come þis tade." ¶ Atþe laste he nomen him a-doun : and ladden bi-fore þe kinge, And seiden þat heo ne mi&yogh;ten him : for noþing to deþe bringe. "Alas," seide þe king þo : "is ore mi&yogh;te us bi-nome? &YOGH;ware-of seruieth ovre godes : þat þes þeof us schal ouer-come? Ledez him with-oute þe toun : a gret fuyr &yogh;e þare make; And þat he beo a-midde i-brou&yogh;t : and i-bounde to one stake; For-brenne he schal euerech lime : ne schal he þus him wer[e]: And &yogh;wane he is to douste I-barnd : we beoth i-brou&yogh;t of care." Þe tormentores nomen seint Vincent : and duden þe kingus heste. Þe holi man wende in-to þe fuyr : ase gladliche ase to one feste. Þo heo wenden þat seint vincent : to douste i-brend were, heo ornen hom and tolden þe kinge fore : gladdore neuere heo nere. heo ne mi&yogh;ten so sone hom come : þat seint vincent nas er At home and stod bi-fore þe kinge— : mani sori man was þer! ¶ Þe tormentores tolden þe kingue : hov he i-barnd was. "Alas! alas!" þe king seide : "neuerer i-schend i-nas! Schal þeos þef us ouer-come? : Mahun, nou þin ore! Þei he grete tormenz habbe i-haued : &yogh;eot ich can bi-þenche more." he let nime platus of Ire : sum-del þunne and brode, And let heom legge amidde þe place : wel nei&yogh; ane cartes lode; gret fuyr he let þar-on make : and þo heo glowinde were, Þat wode-fuyr heo duden al a-wei : þane guode man þudere heo bere And on þe berninde plates him casten : and some þarof heo toke And leiden an-ouewarde is holi bodi : mid one Irene croke. Al he was þar-on ihud— : þe &yogh;ut nadde he none fere! Þat grece of him orn a-brod : ase þei it frijnge were. Þe swyþere þat he barnde : þe gladdore he him made; he lou&yogh; smere, &yogh;wane þe plates : In is flesch gonne wade; Atþe bi-ginningue he was glad : and gladdore atþenende. "Alas! alas," þe king seide þo : "þes þef us wole schende! Þis torment ne helpez us nou&yogh;t : an-oþur we moten bi-þenche." he let maken a swyþe gret fuyr : þat no-þing ne mi&yogh;te a-quenche: ¶ Seint Vincent huy lei[den] a-mide-warde : and sethþe salt heo nome And Mid ladeles on is wondene it casten : in al. & in þe fuyr i-lome, So þat þe salt scholde is woundene frete : with þe brenninde fuyre; Þe spranglinge of þe blode i-selt : wide men mi&yogh;ten i-huyre. "&YOGH;e," seide þis guode man : "þis is a swete feste! Mani Ioye ichabbe i-haued : ake þis is on þe meste." &YOGH;wane is blod spreinde In þe rof an hei&yogh; : he gan to lei&yogh;en smere. Þanne was þe king and alle is men : In swyþe grete fere, And seiden : "þes þef us wole ouer-come. : Mahun, &yogh;ware is þi mi&yogh;te? Schal þes þef with is wichchinge : a&yogh;en þi power fi&yogh;te?" "&YOGH;eot Ich þenche," seide þe king : "of one pine stronge; beo þes þef þar-on i-do : he ne schal nou&yogh;t libbe longe." heo setten him in a swyþe deork put : þat in þe gayhole was, So ful of sweordes pointes i-pi&yogh;te : ase Mede is ful of gras: Þare-oppe þanne holi man : heo casten, faste i-bounde, Þat þe pointes of þe swerdes scholden : &yogh;iuen him deþes woundes. Faste heo loken alle þe dore : and leten him longe þere beo Ope þe swerdes pointes in deorkhede : he ne mi&yogh;te noþing i-seo. Þare cam an Aungel with a taper : brenninde in is hond, Of his pine he bar him op— : and þare was godes sonde! ¶ Þe Aungel was þar with him : ase longe ase he þare was, Mid a brenninde taper, and Ioie gret : þat neuere more nas. Þo it was longe þare-afturward : þis men comen þerbi-side, And wende þat he were ded : ane stounde heo gonne a-bide: Þo i-heorden heo þis holi man : loude and murie singe And herede god in heuene. : heo tolden þat þe kinge. Þo was þe þing nei&yogh; i-swowe : and seide, sichinde wel sore: "Alas, we beoth nouþe ouer-come : I-ne can MS. cam þenche non more; Ovre godes ne helpez us nou&yogh;t : þat alle þing habbeth to wolde. I-nelle neuere-eft a-&yogh;ein him fi&yogh;te : creaunt ichulle me holde. ¶ &YOGH;wane no pine ne mai him sle : oþur þing ichulle fonde: "goth," he seide, "and maketh a bed : þat softeste in anie londe, Of quoiltene and of materasz : of cheisel and of palle, And þanne leggez him þar-on : swiþe softe with-alle." Þo þat bed was i-maket : to þe gayhole heo wende, And founden þare þat lij&yogh;t of heuene : þat ore louerd þudere sende. Wel softe heo nomen þis holi man : and custen is sore wounden, to Relikes heo gadereden stilleliche : þat heo of is blode founden; heo leiden him in þat nesche bed. : and þo he was þaron, his preiere he dude to ore louerd crist : and deide þo a-non. Þo þe king isai&yogh; þis þat he deide : so mildeliche in is bedde, "tormenz," he seide, "we him habbeth i-do : vuele þarof us spedde: Ded we wolleth him ouer-come : &yogh;wane we ne mi&yogh;ten a-liue. Into þe wilde felde : þat bodi &yogh;e beren wel bliue, Wilde bestes and foules : to-drawe heo schullen it sone." Þis men brou&yogh;ten þat bodi þare : and duden þe kingus bone. Þare cam fleo a Rauon : and a-doun þare-bi he a-li&yogh;te, Kene and suyþe dredful : i-redi he was to fi&yogh;te; &yogh;if þare come ani foul to : þat þis bodi i-sei&yogh;e, Þe Rauon smot to grounde : ne mosten þare come non nei&yogh;e, ¶ Ake Euere he drof heom a-wei : þudere &yogh;wane heo come; Ne mi&yogh;te þare come none so kene : þat o mossel þarof nome. A wolf cam also þuder-ward : is mete for-to fette, And wolde of þat bodi nime. : þe Rauon a-&yogh;ein him sette, he flev and smot with bile and fot : þat þe wolf atþen ende blodi was and ouercome : a&yogh;en hamward he gan wende. Þe Rauon wuste þis bodi longe : Iwemmed nou&yogh;t it nas. Þo þe king it onder-&yogh;at : þat þe bodi i-hol was, hom he let it fette a&yogh;en : and seide, "&yogh;wat may beo ovre red, þat we ne mouwen him ouer-come : noþer quik ne ded? &YOGH;if we ne mouwen quik ne ded : ouer-come him a-londe For no MS. ne quoyntise þat we mouwen do : a-watere we wollez fonde." he let it lede fer into þe se : and bonde þarto mani a ston, And casten it out of a schip. : it bi-gan to sinke a-non. þo þe Mariners i-seien þis : glade heo weren and bliþe; For-to telle þe kinge fore : heo hi&yogh;eden hom wel bliue. heo ne mi&yogh;ten so sone to londe come : þat heo ne founden a-londe Þis holi Man wel faire ligge : a-bouen þe se-sonde. Sore a-gremed and a-schamed : hom huy gonne wende; Þe kinge heo tolden al heore cas : fram þe furste to þe ende. "Alas, alas," þe king seide : "þe schame and þe schonde! We ne mowe him neuere ouer-come : quik ne ded, a-watere ne a-londe. ¶ Do we him out of ovre þou&yogh;t : we ne mouwen us neuere a-wreke; Ich drede þat he mi bane worþe : I-here ich more of him speke." A-ni&yogh;t In slepe seint Vincent cam : to A womman þare-bi-side And tolde hire &yogh;ware is bodi lai : and bad hire nou&yogh;t to longe a-bide Ake þat heo it scholde burie sone : for him longuede after reste. Þis guode womman it onderstod : þo heo a-wok, with þe beste: heo wende and sou&yogh;te þis holi bodi : and fond it swiþe sone; heo dude it burie with gret honour : ase ri&yogh;t was for-to done. Þus seint vincent þe holie man : in Spayne endede is lif And wende to þe blisse of heuene : after þis pines and strif. Men nusten neuere martyr non : þat hadde more torment Ne þat with som pine ouer-come nas : bote þe gode man seint vincent.

21.1: SEint powel was a luþer Man : are he i-couerted were. Alle þe cristine Men of þe lond : hadden of him gret fere, For he was muche and strong and feol. : &yogh;ware-so he eni founde, In chaumbre ne in bedde he ne sparede nou&yogh;t : þat he ne slov&yogh; heom alle to grounde. Þo he hadde a-boute Ierusalem : In eche stude i-sou&yogh;t And alle þe cristine men þat he fond : to stronge deþe i-brou&yogh;t, he cam to þe souereyns of þe lawe : and seide, "ich habbe i-mad al clene Al þis lond of cristine Men : [&yogh;e] om. ne dorre of heom more mene: Wende ichulle to Dam[a]sche : and clansi þat lond al-so; Alle þat ich a-liue finde mai : to deþe ichulle heom do, Oþur ichulle heom faste binde : and hidere to eov sende; Alle þat ich a-liue finde may : ichulle a-sle oþur schende." ¶ Saul was þo is ri&yogh;te name. : he gan forth i-wende, I-Armed, and mani a man with him : to bringe is þou&yogh;t to ende. Ase he cam a-midri&yogh;t þe wei : a li&yogh;t him cam a-boute, Þat he ne mi&yogh;te for li&yogh;te i-seon. : þo gan him sore a-doute; he stod ase þei he a-stoned were. : þo cam þare in a stounde A drem ase þei it a þondre were. : þare-with he ful to grounde And lai, þat he ne mi&yogh;te him wawie nou&yogh;t. : þo herde he a uoiz telle : "Saul, &yogh;wi werrestþov opon me : mine Men for-to quelle?" "ho art þov?" seide saul : "louerd, artþov þare?" A voiz seide, "&yogh;e, ich am þi god : þat þov hast i-weorred so &yogh;are. to wynci a&yogh;ein þe pricke : swiþe strong it is þe." "Louerd," seide Saul þo : "&yogh;wat woltþov do mid me?" "Þov schalt," seide ore louerd þo : "In-to þe toune wende; Þine ri&yogh;te bi-leue þe schal teche : a man, to &yogh;wam i-schal þe sende."— Þis was þene fourteoþe &yogh;er : aftur þulke stounde Þat Ihesu crist soffrede on þe rode : for us deþes wounde.— Þo Saul hadde longe i-leie : wel softe he op a-ros And stod op—he ne mi&yogh;te i-seo neuere a del : ful sore him a-gros. he let him lede to þe toun. : it was þane þridde dai Are he .et. oþur dronk : oþur ani si&yogh;t i-sai&yogh;. ¶ Ore louerd cam to a guod preost : is name was ananye, "go," he seide, "in-to þe toun : and to Iudases hous þov hi&yogh;e: Saul þov schalt þare finde : þat i-weorred me hauez longue; &YOGH;if him cristindom in mine name : and he it wole onder-fonge. sei&yogh;e þat god þe þudere sende : þat In þe weie a-&yogh;ein him cam Þo he wolde a&yogh;ein him weorri : and is power him bi bi overlined -nam." 'Louerd," seide Ananie : "ich habbe muche i-heord telle Þat Saul was a luþer man : and cristine men dude quelle." "Ne dred þe nou&yogh;t," ore louerd seide : "lomb he is bi-come, him þinchez longe are he habbe : cristinedom i-nome. to beo prechour of mi word : i-chose ich him habbe; he schal beo wis and studefast : nanne betere i-nabbe." Þo Ananie i-heorde þis : hardiliche forth he wende. he cam to Saule and seide him so : þat ore louerd him þudere sende Þat he scholde cristine beo. : saul was þo wel bliþe, And er þane he i-baptized was : ech &yogh;wyle him þou&yogh;te fiue. Þo he i-baptized was : powel was is name. Wel au&yogh;ten men herien þane god : þat of þe wilde makez þe tame! A-non so he I-baptized was : þare feol out of eiþer ei&yogh;e Fuylþe ase þei it were slym : þat alle þe men it sei&yogh;e. þo mi&yogh;te he swiþe wel i-seo. : he heold op is honde, ¶ A-knevwes he sat in his bedes : and þonkede godes sonde. tendre metes men greiþede him : and &yogh;af him þar-of wel ofte, &YOGH;if he mi&yogh;te is strencþe coueri : heo beddeden him wel softe. Þo seint powel i-couered was : and hadde strencþe of Manne, he purueide him of prechingue : and wende a-non ri&yogh;t þanne Into þe giwene synagogue : and prechede cristindom. Ech man wondrede þat him i-sai&yogh; : þo he prechour bi-cam, And seiden : "nis þis þilke man : þat weorrede alle þeo In þe londe of Ierusalem : þat he mi&yogh;te o&yogh;were cristine men I-seo?" Manie Men he tornede to cristinedom : and manie him þou&yogh;ten quelle And bi-speken hov heo mi&yogh;ten do : for he bi-gan a-&yogh;ein heom telle. he ne let for no drede : þat he ne prechede wel bliue. For euere þoru ore louerdes grace : he ascapede with þe liue. he sou&yogh;te &yogh;ware þe Apostles weren : to heom he cam wel sone, to prechi mid heom godes word : ase hore ri&yogh;te was to done. Þe apostles weren formest a-ferd of him : and leueden him wel vnneþe, For he so muche cristine folk : hadde i-brou&yogh;t to deþe; Ake þo heo wusten hou it was : to felawe [heo] him toke— For þare ne i-werth non so wis : holi churche to loke. Seint powel to cristinedom : cam In þusse manere. god us graunti for is loue : In heuene to ben is fere.

22.1: Seinte Bride of hei&yogh;e men : In scotlond heo cam, Of riche men and of gret power : In lawe of cristindom. Þis Maide bi-gan wel &yogh;ong : to beo of porture hende; Þare ne scholde vil dede ne word : neuere fram hire wende. heo bigan ore louerd crist to serui : in worde and in dede; &YOGH;wane hire &yogh;ongue felawes weren atþe plei&yogh; : hire oresones heo seide. ¶ hire moder louede hire swiþe wel : þat, þo heo was of elde, Al hire chese and al hire milk : heo bi-tok hire to welde, And al þet &yogh;wijt þat In þe court was : heo scholde ope hire helde, At a certeyn dai þarof : trewe a-countes &yogh;elde.
