Þat Maide let gaderi swiþe clene : þe Milk ant þe chese, botere and al þat þarof cam : nolde heo nowi&yogh;t leose : &YOGH;wane heo sei&yogh;e anie pouere Men : heo delde it heom wel clene— hire deierie was euere of chese and botere : bar and swiþe lene. &YOGH;wan hire dai&yogh; was nei&yogh; i-come : a-countes forto &yogh;elde, Of hire moder heo was a-ferd : glad heo was ful selde. &YOGH;eorne heo bad ore louerd crist : þat he scholde beo hire red, he nadde &yogh;warof a-countes &yogh;elde : ase hire moder hadde i-seid. Þo þe day was i-come : heo nuste &yogh;ware-with hire a-quite, For þare nas in þe deierie : nou&yogh;t adel of none &yogh;wite. Naþeles þe moder eode þudere : to loke hou it ferde : heo fond ech lome i-heped ful : al a-boue þe brerde, Of chese and of botere : and of oþur &yogh;wijte also. he ne may neuere is &yogh;wyle leose : þat for þe guode wole ou&yogh;t do. hit bi-feol þat þis Maydenes frend : nomen heom to rede Þat heo i-weddet scholde beo. : and heo anon-ri&yogh;t heom with-seide. to þe bischope heo wende a-non : and a-vouwede chastete, And seide heo nolde neuere man habbe : þe sikerore for-to beo. For Ioye þat þe bischop hadde of hire : he seide þa[t] he wolde ete, And alle is Men, a dai with hire : he bad hire maken heore mete. Þarof was þis Maide glad : and naþeles sore heo hire dradde, For bote bred and Ale and one kou : non more mete heo nadde. heo bi-gan to milken þis cov : and muche milk of hire heo nam MS. mam ; Þe lengore þat heo hire Milkede : þe more milk þare cam : Þis kov &yogh;af so muche Milk : þat þare-mide heo fedde Þene bischop and alle is Men þat dai : and muche þonk þarof hadde. ¶ hit bi-feol þare-after-ward : þat Maide a-feld wende, Forto loki to hire schep. : so gret rein ore louerd to eorþe sende Þat hire cloþes al wete weren. : and a-&yogh;en hom MS. heom heo gan gon. heo wolde hangi hire cloþus forto druye : and heo ne sai&yogh; nou&yogh;t &yogh;waron. Þe sonne schon In at one hole : and ope þe bem of þe sonne hire wete cloþes heo heng forto druy&yogh;e : þat þe stremes a-doun ronne. Museles comen to hire adai : of-hongrede and of-cale, heo beden hire mete and drinke for godes loue. : he nadde nou&yogh;t a spone-ful ale. A fat þare stod fol of baþe-water : heo &yogh;af it hire blessinge : Þe beste Ale a-liue it bi-cam : he &yogh;af it þe Museles drinke. A womman cam and bad hire salt : and heo ne hadde non : With hire blessingue heo turnede to salte : ane wel grete ston. Þre sike men beden hire guod : ase heo to hire come. A seluerne coppe heo [heom] &yogh;af : and gladliche heo hire nome; And bi-gunne for-to striui : hov heo hire dele mi&yogh;te. "Abidez," seide þis Maide : "and ichulle it euene di&yogh;te." Þis Coppe heo smot a&yogh;en a ston : þat heo to-brak aþre; Euerech heo &yogh;af iliche muche : ase euene ase it mi&yogh;te beo. Þeos miracles, and manie oþure : seinte Bride wrou&yogh;te; Þe blinde and þe doumbe : to guode hele heom brou&yogh;te. Þe furste dai of feuerer : hire lijf heo brou&yogh;te to ende. god us graunti alle forth with hire : te r. to þe blisse of heuene wende.

23.1: SEinte Agace, þat guode Maide : In cisile was i-bore; Wel &yogh;ong heo bi-gan cristine to beon : þat hire soule nere fur|lore. Of faire porture þis Mayde was : and stable in godes lore. Þe Duyk of þe londe it onder-&yogh;at : it him of-þou&yogh;te sore. he ne mi&yogh;te for revþe don hire in pine : Al for hire &yogh;onghede; And for heo so fair was : he hopede hire out of þulke bi-leue lede. An old quene þare was bi-side : strong hore and baudestrote; heo hadde Ni&yogh;e dou&yogh;tren li&yogh;t wummen. : þe Duyk bi-gan hire gret mede bi-hote, Þat heo scholde þat maide wite : and mis-techen hire and rede, And fondi &yogh;if heo mi&yogh;te hire bringe : in fol þou&yogh;t oþur in fol dede. Þis clene þing was to þis hore i-brou&yogh;t : þat hei&yogh;te Affrodose. heo, and hire dou&yogh;tren al-so : maden hire þe glose, And bi-hete hire quoynte þingus fale : of seluer and of golde, Richesse and oþur Ioye i-nou&yogh; : þat heo hire þou&yogh;t chaungi scholde; heo seiden : "hov mi&yogh;te a swuche creature : þus gent and þus freo, hende and milde and swete i-nov&yogh; : with-oute Iolifte [beo]? Þi &yogh;ongue blod nolde it þolie nou&yogh;t : scholde þi Ioie beon þe bi-nome; In þis lond nis prince so hei&yogh; : þat þov ne mi&yogh;test him wel bi-come." ¶ Þis Maide, þei heo were &yogh;ong : bi-gan to Answerie a-non, And seide, "beo stille, þou deueles bouk! : þe ne worth here non i-won. Þe hexte prince þat is ani : In loue ich habbe i-take, In mine &yogh;onghede and euere-more : to holde him for mi make. Swete and hende and milde he is : on him is al mi þou&yogh;t, Ich am so faste to him i-bounde : þar-of ne bringuest þou me nou&yogh;t." Þis luþere wummen weren ech-one : studefastliche Ni&yogh;t and dai&yogh; A-boute to bringue luþer þou&yogh;t : In-to þis swete &yogh;ounge may&yogh;; Þritti dawes heo was with heom : þat heo fondeden euere to bringue hire into þe deueles lore : Ake heo ne spedden neuere. Þis wychche wende to þe Duyk þo : þat het quincian, And seide, "sire, i-ne mai chaungi nou&yogh;t : þe þou&yogh;t of þis womman; Li&yogh;tloker man may þane hardeste ston : make nesche ase wolle Þane þat Maide þoru&yogh; any gin : of hire þou&yogh;t bringe schulle." Þe Duyk let a-non þis mayde fette : and Axede &yogh;wat heo were. "godes schulchone," heo seide, "ich am" : heo nadde none fere. he Axede of &yogh;wat kunne heo were. : heo seide, "of gent and freo." Þe Duyk seide, "hov mi&yogh;t þov gentil womman : and eke a schulchone beo?" "&YOGH;us," seide þat maide þo : "hit is more fraunchise to beon gode[s]schulchene oþer is þral : þane king oþur Iustise." "Anovre ovre godes!" seide þe Duyk : "ne spec of þi god non-more, Oþur ichulle þe swuch pine do : þat it schal þe rewe sore." "I-ne schal so sone," þat maide seide : "In pine beo i-brou&yogh;t Þat it nele a-swagi &yogh;if ich habbe : on ihesu crist mi þou&yogh;t; &YOGH;if þou bringest me in ani fuyre : and ich me bi-þenche On þe pine þat he þolede for me : a-non it wole a-quenche." Þe Duyk let nime þat maide a-non : and In-to þe gayhole lede; Þat maide was þo also glad : ase þei men hire to feste bede. In stronge prisone heo was i-do : þar-inne longe heo lay. Þe Duyk let þare-after-warde : at-fore him þat mayde bringe a day. ¶ "Agace," he seide, "bi-þench þe wel : bi-lef þi fole þou&yogh;t, Anovre ore MS. ore ore godes þat mowen þe helpe : are þou beo in pine i-brou&yogh;t." Þat maide seide, "þou spillest þi breth : and þou tellest embe nou&yogh;t. Ake ich rede þat þou Anouri him : þat deore us hath i-bou&yogh;t, And bi-lef þine false godes : þat power nabbez non, Þat beoth i-mad of an old stoc : oþur of þe harde ston." "Neltþou [nou]&yogh;t MS. Neltþou&yogh;t ," seide þe duyk : "þine folie &yogh;uyt bi-leue, In stronge pine þov schalt beo i-don : to-day are it beo eue." hokes and witthene he let nime : and faste to hire breoste binde, And let is tormentores with þe withþene : hire breostene of wynde. "Þov onwreste bouk," þis Maide seide : to þe duyk quincian, "Ne hastþov no schame in þine heorte : defouli þus ani man Þat lyme þat þov þi moder of soke : and þe hath forth i-brou&yogh;t? Do þov þin owene confusion : and ne dred þe ri&yogh;t nou&yogh;t." ¶ gret pine þolede þis clene [may] : are heo weren of i-drawe; So muche was hire þou&yogh;t on gode : þat it ne greuede hire nou&yogh;t an hawe. Þo heo weren of i-drawe : In-to prisone heo was eft i-do. Þe Duyk let witie þat prison faste : þat no man ne come hire to hire woundene to hele with ani-þing : oþur hire pines forto lisse. Ake ore louerd ne for-&yogh;at nou&yogh;t hire : þo ne þorte he misse. Ase heo in prisone al one was : an old man þare cam gon, boxes fulle of Oygneme[n]z : he brou&yogh;te mani on And seide þat he hire hele wolde. : "þov ne schalt," heo seide; "I-ne kepe no man bote god : þat me hele and rede." "Ich am," seide þe olde man : "In his name hidere i-wend, For ich am his apostle— : to þe he me hath i-send Þine woundene forto hele : þat þov hast for him stronge. In þe Ioye of heuene : þine mede þou schalt afonge." Þe woundes he gan smeorie : heo weren hole in one stounde. Þat Maide nuste &yogh;ware he MS. heo bi-cam : þo he hadde i-held hire wounde. Þe Duyk let þat maide bi-fore him bringe : þene feorþe day, he seide, "hastþov &yogh;eot i-chaunget þi þou&yogh;t?" : þat mayde seide "nay. Þi word," heo seide, "ne doth non oþur : &yogh;wane þov spext þus to me, bote fuylez swiþe foule þe eyr : þat it deth inne fleo. he is wod þat stok oþur ston : wole to helpe calle, And nou&yogh;t to god of heuene : þat hath i-heled mine wounden alle." "Darstþou &yogh;eot," seide þe Duyk : "of þine false gode more telle? Beo þov so wod to nemmen him more : in stronge deþe Man schal þe quelle." "Onwreste bouk," þat Maide seide : "I-nelle it lete nou&yogh;t, Þe &yogh;wyle þat ich libbe may : to nemen him with worde oþur with þou&yogh;t." Þe Duyk het men hire for-brenne : a gret fuyr he let make. Þo heo [hire] wolden þar-inne do : þe eorþe bi-gan to quake, ¶ Ase wide ase þe cite was : and felde a-doun þe dom-halle; Twei men þat hire Iuggeden to deþe : a-slawe weren with þe walle. Þat folk of þe cite was a-drad. : to þe duyke heo seiden: "Þis Mayde is guod, and we beth for hire : In grete perile and in drede. gret pine þov hast [hire] i-don : þou ne schal so non-more." Þo þe Duyk i-herde þis : a-drad he was wel sore; Þat Mayde he let to prisone lede : and he him-seolf a-scapede a-wey bi one posterne stilleliche : þat no man him ne sey&yogh;. Þo þat mayde into prisone cam : a-doun heo sat a-kneo, "Louerd," he seide, "fram mani pine : þou hast i-saued me, fram fuyr and fram woundes stronge : þou me hast i-brou&yogh;t, And fram mi child-hod þou me hast i-wust : þat ine mis-bi-lefde nou&yogh;t: Lat me, louerd, to reste wende : for here me þinchez long, Tyme it is to endi mi lijf : mine soule þov onder-fong." Mid þusse worde bi-fore al þat folk : heo bi-gan to dei&yogh;e. Þare was mani a sori man : and mani a wepinde ei&yogh;e. Þat folk þat hire louede : siwede hire wel faste, hire bodi heo nomen with gret honour : and bureden it atþe laste. Þo heo bureden þat holi bodi : a felawe-schipe þare cam go Of þe faireste children þat mi&yogh;ten beo : þre hondret and wel mo, &YOGH;onge þingus of on age : in &yogh;wite cloþus of palle; Ane table of Marbre In is hond : þe on bar at-fore heom alle: ¶ heo Ioyneden it to seinte Agace toumbe : þo heo comen þer-to, Wel sweteliche heo wenden a&yogh;en : þo heo hadden so i-do— Angles it weren þat þare a-li&yogh;ten : for seinte Agace to grounde. Clerkes bi-heolden þe table &yogh;eorne : þare-Inne i-write huy founde: "Þis Maide hadde holi þou&yogh;t : god heo dude honour, A-serued heo hath to alle þe contreie : deliueraunce of langour." For-soþe heo mi&yogh;ten þis laste word : þar-after onder-stonde: þulke time a twelf-Monþe : of an hul in þe londe Strong fuyr þare cam eornen out : ase water doth of welle, And barnde al þat þare was a-boute : quic þing it gan a-quelle; hit spradde wide into al þat lond : þat folk hadde grete fere, And barnde þe hard roche of ston : ase þei it Col were. heo ne dorsten bi-leue at no toun : ake ornen ase men þat were wode: At seinte Agace Toumbe : þare heo formest at-stode. Al-so it bi-feol in hire daye : ase sone ase heo weren þere, Þat fuyr queinte a-non in-to al þat lond : ase þei it neuere nere; And bi-fore it hadde six dawes i-last : and six Nij&yogh;t al-so, And orn ase þei it water were : for-barnde al þat him cam to. Þo schewede ore louerd þat it was soth : þat þe maide seinte Agas A-seruede deliueraunce to al þe Contree— : þare wel i-sene it was. Al-so w[i]sliche we schullen hire bidde : ase heo þe contreie &yogh;af bote, Þat we to þe Ioye þare heo is Inne : with hire come we mote.

24.1: SEinte scholace, þat holie mayde : heo was of clene liue, Leouere heo hadde to beon Nonne : þane beon i-widdet to wiue. Seint Beneit hire broþer was : and þe Ordre furst bi-fond Of Nonnes and of blake Monekus : þat is &yogh;uyt into al þat lond; Of blake Monekus at Duyn : An Abbeye he let a-rere, him-sulf þe Abite furst he nam : þe &yogh;ongore for-to lere. Seinte Scholace, his soster : blac Nonne he let hire make, And tei&yogh;te hire penaunce forto don : to faste and to wake. Þeos twei&yogh;e holie creatures : eche &yogh;ere hadden ane wone to comen to-gadere some Tyme : and tellen of godes sone; Ake heore noþer in oþeres Abbeye : bi-leue come ne mi&yogh;te Ne duelle for none þinge : oute of heore celle bi Ni&yogh;te. ¶ Þo þis guode holi mayde : i-brou&yogh;t was in grete Elde, hire longuede with hire broþer to speke : feble heo hire felde. Þo heo hadde to him i-sent : and to-gadere heo weren i-come, Al dai heo tolden of godes priuetez : seinte Marie sone, Of þe Ioye of heuene : hou holi men heore [lif] ladden; Þare-of al heore Ioye was : þat heo to-gadere hadden. Sorie weren þis holie þingus boþe : for it was sumdel nei&yogh; Eue. Seint Beneit to is soster seide : þat he ne mi&yogh;te no leng bi-leue. Seinte scholace sori was. : "broþur," heo seide, "þin ore, Þis holie wordus so murie beoth : &yogh;eot we moten telle more; &YOGH;wane we In godes seruise beoth : we ne doz nou&yogh;t ore ordre breke. Ich am so feble þat ich ne wene : neuer-eft more with þe speke; bi-leue we þis one Ni&yogh;t to-gadere : for his loue þat deore us bou&yogh;te, Ich wot þat he it wole us for-&yogh;iue : &yogh;wane we it doth in guode þou&yogh;te." "beo stille," seide seint beneit : "loke &yogh;wat þou dest telle, Wel þov wost þat ine mai beo : bi ni&yogh;te fram mine celle." Þo scholace i-sai&yogh; þat it ne heold : to bidde hire broþur more, hire heued he hangede a-doun : and bi-gan to wepe sore. "Louerd," heo seide, "þat þov art : ful of milce and ore, Lat me, louerd, &yogh;if þi wille it beo : i-heore more of þi lore; ¶ Ne lat nou&yogh;t mi broþur to-Ni&yogh;t : fram me, louerd, wende, Ake soffre us with tales of þe : bringe þis ni&yogh;t to ende." Ase þis Maide loke r. lokede opward : þo heo hadde i-don hire bone, Þat weder þat was so cler and fair : bi-gan to chaungie sone; hit bi-gan to þondri and hauli : lei&yogh;ten and eke rine, Þat feor with-Inne Ni&yogh;te it was : er þat weder wolde a-fine. ¶ Þo ne mi&yogh;te seint beneit : for þe wedere þannes i-wende. "Soster," he seide, "&yogh;wat hastþov i-don? : þou fondest me to schende; &YOGH;if it nere ore louerdes wille : wel ne dost þov nou&yogh;t, Þat i-schal mine ordre breke : so nadde ich neuere i-þou&yogh;t." "Leue broþer," þat maide seide : "ich bad þe swiþe &yogh;erne Þat þou þis ni&yogh;t bi-lefdest here : and euere þov dudest me werne: Ich bad mi louerd of heuene : and he me i-herde a-non. Cheos nouþe &yogh;waþer þov bi-leue wolt : oþur heonnes for-to gon, bi-lef me alone &yogh;if þov mi&yogh;t : for no þonk ne can ich þe, Ake ich þonki god of heuene : þat so sone i-heorde me." Þo heo ne mi&yogh;ten departi nou&yogh;t : to-gadere al ni&yogh;t heo woke, And tolden of godes suettnesse : and of is mi&yogh;te : In tale and eke in boke. Þe Ni&yogh;t heom þov[&yogh;te] suyþe schort : and sorie at þene ende heo weren þo heo þane dai&yogh; i-sei&yogh;en : &yogh;wane heo scholden a-to i-wende. heo ne dorsten no lengore to-gadere beo : ac wenden to heore celle, heo weren boþe swiþe sorie : þat heo ne mi&yogh;ten no leng to-gadere duelle. Þo þat Maide was hom i-come : sore sik heo lay&yogh;, And ase it godes wille was : heo deide þane þridde dai&yogh;. Seint Beneit in is celle eode : his soster soule he i-sei&yogh; In fourme of a &yogh;wi&yogh;t Coluere : fleon op into heuene an hei&yogh;; heouene openede a-&yogh;eines hire : þe Coluere gan in fleo. glad was þis holi man : þat he it mi&yogh;te i-seo! A-moruwe he and is couent : þudere wenden sone And bureden þat holi maide : ase it was ri&yogh;t to done. bidde we suete Ihesu crist : þat is so fair and hende, Þat we moten þudere comen : ase scholace dude i-wende.

25.0: 35 Purgatorium sancti Patrici abb[at]is. I have published this legend before in Altengl. Legenden , Paderborn, 1875, p. 177 ff, together with two other versious.
25.1: SEint paterik þoru godes grace : makede ane put in Irlonde, Þat seint patrike purgatorie is icleoped : &yogh;eot, ase ich onderstonde. Ore louerd him bi-tok ane staf : mid is owene honde, Þat he fond þulke purgatorie with : i-hered beo godes sonde! In Irlonde is &yogh;eot þilke staf i-wust : dereworþeliche i-nov&yogh;, For gret relike he is i-holde : and elles it were wou&yogh;. Seint paterik in þulke stude : þat his purgatorie is, Of religion bi-gan an hous : þat &yogh;eot stant, i-wis, Ant Chanoynes þare-inne he makede : ase &yogh;eot þare beoth al-so. Þane put he let faste closi a-boute : þat noman ne come þar-to. ¶ In þe churche-&yogh;erd is þat ilke putt : ri&yogh;t toward þe Est-side, ri&yogh;t est fram þe hei&yogh;e Au&yogh;ter : þat manie men &yogh;wylene sou&yogh;ten wide. he is bi-walled faste a-boute MS. abooute : and faste i-loke þe &yogh;ate, And þe prior haueth þe kei&yogh;e in warde : þat no man ne mot In þar-ate. Al bi seint paterikes dai&yogh;e : men wenden þudere i-lome, And sethþe also mani on : and fewe a&yogh;en þare come; Ake þulke þat þare comen a&yogh;en : of þat heo i-sei&yogh;en, heo tolde, Ase it is in þe house i-write : and in priue conseile i-holde.— ¶ Þe manere is of euerech man : þat for-soþe þudere i-went, Þat it beo to bete is sunnes : &yogh;if ore louerd him grace [sent]. to þe bischope of þe lond : furst he schal him schriue, And bidde him leue þene wey to go : in amendement of is liue. Ake þe bischop schal rede heom r. him þare-a-&yogh;ein : and manie resones schewe, And segge þat manie þudere wendeth : and a&yogh;ein þare comieth fewe. Ake &yogh;if he is stable in is þou&yogh;t : for al þat men him habbez i-bede, Þe bischop him wole is lettre make : to þe prior of þe stude. ¶ Þe prior him wole al-so rede i-nov&yogh; : for-to chaungi is þou&yogh;t; And, &yogh;wane he si&yogh;kz him studefast : þat he nele bi-leue it nou&yogh;t, In-to churche he wole him lede : and sette him a-doun a-kne; Fiftene dawes he schal þare : in is oresones beo. And &yogh;if heo ne mouwen for no-þing : maken chaungi is þou&yogh;t, With gret procession MS. precession of preostes : to þe putte he worth i-brou&yogh;t; With þe croiz and with þe haliwatur : heo schullen blessi him ech-on, him-sulf he schal him blessi al-so : and þanne into þe putte gon; And þat procession schal tuyrne a&yogh;en : ase ri&yogh;t is for-to done. A-moruwe In þulke tyme : heo schullen come þudere eft-sone, And, bote heo finden him þanne a&yogh;en i-come : with gret deol and sor heo schullen tuyrne a-&yogh;ein, and sikere beoth : þat he ne comez a&yogh;en non-more.— ¶ hit bi-fel bi þe kingus dai&yogh;e steuene : þat novþe late was, Of a kni&yogh;t, þat hei&yogh;te sire Ovwayn : a swiþe wonder cas. to þe bischop þis kni&yogh;t eode : and to schrifte to him he cam, In grete repentaunce of is sunnes : deol and sorewe to him he nam. Þe bischop bi-gan to chide faste : for þat he hadde mis-do, And seide þat he was manne worst : for-to sunegun so, And seide þat he ne mi&yogh;te so muche schame a-fonge : þat he nere wuyrþe more. Þe kni&yogh;t sat with careful heorte : he si&yogh;te and weop ful sore. ¶ "Sire," seide þe kni&yogh;t, "&yogh;wan ich habbe : manne worst i-do, to þe sunne þat grettest is : mest penaunce mot þar-to; And &yogh;if ich a-mong alle men : mest sunful am, alas, Þe gretteste penaunce ichulle take : þat euere bi-founde was: Ichulle me take to godes grace : and in is name i-wende Into seint paterikes purgatorie : and take þat god me wole sende." "Ov, beu frere," quath þe bischop : "be stille, &yogh;wi seistþo v so? Crist for-beode þat þov euere : swuch folie do! Onneþe comez þare ani a-&yogh;en : þat doth þare-In i-wende; Nolde god þat þov þe dede dudest : bodi and soule to schende! Ake wend into religion and bi-lef þare : to þine liues ende: Þine sunnes þou mi&yogh;t bete wel : &yogh;if god þe wole grace sende." "Certes, sire," quath þis kni&yogh;t : "ase wel þov mi&yogh;t beo stille, For þulke penaunce ichulle do : &yogh;if it is godes wille; For ase muche ase ich habbe of-serued : Ine mai nou&yogh;t habe of wo. Þere-fore sei&yogh;e &yogh;wat i schal : for þudere ichulle go." ¶ Þe bischop prechede him faste i-nov&yogh; : for-to chaungi is þou&yogh;t; Ake atþe laste, þo he isai&yogh; : þat it was al for nou&yogh;t, To þe prior of þe stude : his lettres made sone, Þat he scholde bi him do : ase bi swuch a man was to done. ¶ Þe prior prechede him faste i-nov&yogh; : and schewede him resones i-nowe, &YOGH;if he mi&yogh;te changi is þou&yogh;t : þat he him with-drowe; bote is prechinge was al for nou&yogh;t. : ase he sai&yogh; atþen ende Þat he nolde lete for no-þing : þene perilouse wei to wende, Þe prior nam him bi þe hond : and in-to churche him brou&yogh;te. Þare he ful akne adoun : and ore louerdes grace bi-sou&yogh;te; In fastingues and in oresones : fourtene ni&yogh;t he lai, Forte bidde ore louerdes grace. : and in þe fourteþe dai Þat Couent cam a-boute him : and oþere preostes al-so And clerkes, with procession : þe seruise for him to do. ¶ For him heo songun þe hei&yogh;e-masse : and to ore louerd criden faste, And ore louerdes flechs and is blod : heo &yogh;euen him atþe laste, And spreinden him with holi watur : and heore oresones heo seide. With Croiz and with procession : to þe put heo gonne him lede, And hei&yogh;liche songun þe letanie : and holi water with hem bere, And alle louerdes halewe beden : þat heo heore r. his help were. Þe prior on-lek þe puttes dore : bi-fore heom ech-on, And seide : "beu frere, lo here þe wei : þat þou wilnest for-to gon. Ake &yogh;if þou wolt bi ore rede do : þi þou&yogh;t þou schalt wende And in oþur manere þine sunnes bete : ase god þe grace wole sende; Fewe here comen euere a&yogh;en : þat wenden here-In bi-fore, Ake heo beoth for tormentingue and for wo : lif and soule for-lore." ¶ "Certes, sire," quath þis kni&yogh;t : "rede &yogh;wat þov me rede, In ore louerdes name þane wei ich take : to bete mine misdede. Ake for is loue þat us deore bou&yogh;te : biddez for me ech-on! Lif and soule god ich bi-take : and In his name ichulle In gon." he blessede him, and wende forth In : and bi-tok god is flesch and is bon; Þe prior spreinde him with holi water : and lek þe dore a-non. Þis guode kni&yogh;t wende him forth : wel baldeliche and faste, In one holewe weie onder eorþe : and to god is heorte caste; Swyþe deork it was, þat he ne say ri&yogh;t nou&yogh;t : ne no-þing him ne a-gaste. So longe þat him þou&yogh;te he i-sai&yogh; : wel feor li&yogh;t atþe laste. Þuderward he wende baldeliche : so þat he cam þere nei&yogh;: Þe faireste feld þat mi&yogh;te beo : atþe wei&yogh;es ende he isei&yogh;. Pulchra via. ¶ Þare-Inne he wende murie i-nov&yogh; : and a-midde þe felde he fond Þe faireste halle and þe nobleste : þat mi&yogh;te beo in ani lond. Ake þet weder nas nou&yogh;t cler : bote ase it were nei&yogh; eue. Forto bi-holde þat noble weork : ane stounde he gan bi-leue. Þe walles neren nou&yogh;t i-hole : ake al a-boute i-wis With pilers and with q v oynte Arches : ase þis Monekene cloistre is. In he wende a godes name : and sette him al one an hei&yogh;; he bi-heold a-boute in-to eche huyrne : and þat quoy[n]te weork he sei&yogh;. Ase he bi-heold al-so a-boute : þare come In at þe on ende Twelf men in &yogh;wite cloþes : swiþe faire and hende; Alle heore crounes weren newe schaue— : and suyþe faire heo him gretten, And alle heo seten faire a-doun : and þane [kni&yogh;t] bi heom heo setten. ¶ Þo seide on of heom, ase þei it þe prior were : wel mildeliche and stille: "bev frere, i-hered beo Ihesu crist : þat on þe brou&yogh;te swuche wille, And late þe þat þou&yogh; a-godes name hast bi-gonne : for is holi grace wel ende! leue broþur, &yogh;wane þou woldest þis wei : for þine sunnes wende, Oþur þov most beon studefast and hardi : and in none manere tuyrne þi þou&yogh;t, Oþur þov worst for-lore, lif and soule : and sone to þe deuel i-brou&yogh;t. For also-sone ase we beth heonne i-went : þe feondes luþere and wicke heo wollez come a-boute þe : In-to þis hous ful þicke, And don þe tormens and wo i-nov&yogh; : and bi-hote þe wel more; And heo wollez also bi-hote þe Ioye i-nov&yogh; : &yogh;if þov wolt leue heore lore; And &yogh;if heo mouwen þoru&yogh; ani bi-heste : oþur enie gile, þe ouer-come, For-soþe þov worst, lif and soule : a-deuele wei al clene i-nome. Ake &yogh;if þov art studefast of heorte : and on Ihesu crist wolt þenche, Ne for bi-heste MS. heste heste ne for wo : fram him þou nelle blenche, Þou worst quit of alle þine sunnes : þat þov hast euere i-wrou&yogh;t, And þov schalt i-seo alle þe Ioies : þat guode men beoth inne i-brou&yogh;t, And al-so þe pine þat luþere men : habbez for heore mis-dede. Ake in &yogh;wat wo þat þov euere art : euere þench on god, ich rede, ¶ And euere &yogh;wane heo tormentiez þe : cri Iesu milce and ore, And, &yogh;if þou art studefast in gode bi-leue : heo ne schullen defouli þe non-more. We bi-takez þe god of heuene : and ich rede þov do bi ovre lore." Þo nuste þe kni&yogh;t &yogh;ware heo bi-comen. : he sat and si&yogh;te sore, Elinge he bilefte alone : and cride on godes mi&yogh;te, And Armede him with holie beden : a&yogh;en þe deuelene to fi&yogh;te, On þe holi gost he cride faste : þat he ne scholde him faile; he lokede euere &yogh;wane heo comen : him for-to a-saille. Ase he sat a-godes name : þe bataille for-to a-bide, Þare cam a sori reuful cri : a-boute in eche side, Ase alþe world to-borste and to-breke : him þou&yogh;te it was al-so, Þat, þei alle þe bestes of þe worlde : to-gadere weren i-do, Ase al. & ase loude and ase grisliche ase heo mi&yogh;ten : &yogh;eollinde ech-one heo were. Ake al. om. heo ne mi&yogh;ten a-mong heom alle : make so grisliche bere, Þat al. þat &yogh;if is hope and is heorte on ihesu crist : euere-more heo were, r. nere Elles he hadde wod bi-come : and i-lore is wit for fere. ¶ Þo comen heo a-bouten him : þicke and grisliche þere, &YOGH;eonijnde and grenninde on him : with ful lodlich chere. "bel ami," quath þe on of heom : "þou hast a-ri&yogh;t i-do, We owez wel alle a-nouri þe : for al to fewe doth so. For alle oþere men wollez a-bide : þat heore lif heom beo bi-nome, And &yogh;eot it is a&yogh;en heore wille : þat heo schullen hidere come: And þov art i-come al bi þine liue : and bi þine guode wille al-so; Wel ou&yogh;te we þine mede &yogh;elde : and gre[t] þonk also þe do. &YOGH;wane þov hast boþe bodi and soule : i&yogh;yuen us bi þine liue, Saunt faille we ne beoth nou&yogh;t so onkuynde : þat we it nellez &yogh;elde þe bliue, For þe kundenesse þat þov to us come : al bi þine owene lore. Ake naþeles, &yogh;if þou wolt on eorþe : habbe Ioye more, Sikere us an hond þat þov wolt : In ore seruise bi-leue And we þe wollez a&yogh;en to eorþe bringe : al sauf, are hit beo eue, And þov schalt habbe þare Ioye i-nou&yogh; : in halle and eke in boure— For none men ne fareth so murie þare : ase þulke þat beoth ovre. hei&yogh; man and noble þov schalt beo : and alle men schullen honouri þe. &YOGH;wane þov art ded ant comest to us : þou schalt habbe ase guod ase we." Þis kni&yogh;t þou&yogh;te euere on Iesu crist : and nolde chaungi is wille, For þretninge ne for fair bi-heste : ake sat him euere stille. Þo he nolde graunti nou&yogh;t : to heom for-to wende, heo &yogh;ollen and grenneden on him foule : and strong fuyr bi-gonne for-to tiende; ¶ Þis kni&yogh;t heo bounden honden and fet : and a-midde þe fuyre him Prima pena. caste, With Irene Ovles and pikes : heo to-drowen him wel faste. Þis kni&yogh;t hadde gret pine : wel loude he cride a-non: "Ihesus, Ihesus, help me nouþe : and do a-wei mine fon!" A-non so [he] hadde þis word i-seid : þat fuyr a-queinte ech spronke, And þe deuelene ne mi&yogh;ten him non more to-drawe. : ore louerd he gan þonke, And þe hardiore he was i-nou&yogh; : þo he þis i-sei&yogh;, And þe lasse he was of heom a-drad : þat weren him so nei&yogh;. Wel grisliche heo &yogh;ollen, þe schrewes : þo heom faillede heore mi&yogh;t, And flouwen echone out of þe halle : and drowen with heom þis kni&yogh;t. A-&yogh;en þe grounde heo drowen him harde : boþe bi fet and honde, longe, him þou&yogh;te, and swiþe feor : al-a-boute in a waste londe. So blac and deork was al þat lond : þat no-þing he ne sei&yogh; bote þe feondes þat him to-drowen : þat so þicke weren him nei&yogh;. Ake swiþe softe wind þare was : þat he heorde onneþe, Ake so scharpe he bleu&yogh; and colde : þat brou&yogh;te him nei&yogh; to deþe; Ri&yogh;t colde he wende þoru&yogh; is heorte : and þoru&yogh; al is bodi also, Þat him were leouere þane al þe world : þat þe pine were ido. Þus colde heo drowen him, ase heom r. him þou&yogh;te : forth ri&yogh;t est, i-wis, Ase þe sonne a-rist in somer : &yogh;wane þe dai lengest is. Þo heo comen, ase heom r. prima Secunda 1 pena þou&yogh;te : ri&yogh;t to þe worldes ende, bi a brod valeie heo torneden heom : and southward gonne i-wende, toward þe stude þat þe sonne : In winter doth a-rise. Þis seli kni&yogh;t was i-drawe : and i-pined in fale wise. Þo þou&yogh;te him þat he i-heorde feor : bi-fore him ase it were, Swiþe deolful cri and wop : and swyþe revful bere; Euere þe neor þat heo comen : þe revlokur was þat cri. So longe [heo] drowen him, þat him þou&yogh;te : þat heo weren ri&yogh;t þer-bi. ¶ Þo comen heo into a wid feld : non more ne mi&yogh;te beo, So long and brod in eche side : þat he ne mi&yogh;te non ende i-seo. Of men and of wummen þis feld was : ful in eche side, Þe wombene to-ward þe grounde : i-spradde a-brod ful wide, hondene and fet al a-brod : to þe eorþe faste i-bounde With Irene nailles al fuyrie : i-smite þoru&yogh; heom to grounde. Þis wrechche gostes weren al. om. so i-pinede : with Irene and with fuyre. So deolful cri heo maden þare : þat gret deol it was to huyre; heo criden merci deolfulliche : Ake no merci men nolde heom do; For Anguische þe eorþe heo freten : and hore tongene gnowen al-so. Þe deoulene ornen opon hem : and treden heom to þe grounde, And with Ovles swiþe kene : maden heom mani a wounde.— Allas, &yogh;wy nellez men beon i-war : and heore sunnes here bete, Are heo comen to purgatorie : and with þe luþere gostes mete! For ase wel beth þe schrewes in purgatorie : and ouer-al, ase in helle, And schullen for-to þe dai&yogh;e of dome come : telle &yogh;wat men telle.— Þe feondes seiden, "ri&yogh;t ase [þis] men beoth i-pinede : þov schalt beo also, bote þov wolle þi þou&yogh;t wende : and after ovre rede do." ¶ And þo he nolde in none manere : to grounde harde heo him caste And tormenteden him ase þe oþere weren : and to þe eorþe naileden him faste. Ake he criede a-non to ihesu crist : þo him smert so sore: Þare nas non of þe schrewes þo : þat mi&yogh;ten serui him so more. Tertia pena. Þo þe schrewes i-sei&yogh;en þat heo ne mi&yogh;ten : heore wille habben þo, heo drowen him into an oþur felde : wel ful of more wo. Of Men and wummen it was ful : op-ri&yogh;t i-sprad to grounde, Fet and hondene a-to i-drawe : and to þe eorþe faste i-bounde, With glowinde biendes al of Ire : i-nailede heo weren þer-to; Al fuyrie naddrene ope heom seten : and foule crapoudes al-so. Some of þe naddrene bi-clupten heom : so faste al a-boute Þat heom þou&yogh;te heo scholden to-berste : so streite heo gurden heom with-oute; Some seten ope heom : and heore flesch al-to-gnowe And with kene tieth al fuyrie : wombe and breoste to-drowe, Some with hore scharpe tounges : þoru&yogh; þe heorte sore heom smite; Some heo gnowen, and some heo stounge : and some with scharpe tieth heom bite. Þe Crapoudes al-so, þat weren so foule : op-on heore breostene sete And stoungen heom þoru&yogh; heore heortene : with heore foule wrottes grete. Þe luþere gostes ornen al-so : a-boute heom i-nowe With hokes and with ou&yogh;les : a[nd] MS. a with gret eir heom to-drowe. Þe wrechche gostes, so for-pinede : in swuch torment weren al. om. i-brou&yogh;t, heo criden alle deolfulliche : ake hit ne halp heom nou&yogh;t. ¶ Þe feondes nomen þis seli kni&yogh;t : and wolden him pini al-so: Ake anon so he cride on Ihesu crist : ne mi&yogh;ten heo bringe him þer-to. &YOGH;eot þe feondes eft-sone him nomen : and to þe þridde feld him Quarta pena. brou&yogh;te. In stronge pine he sai&yogh; þare wrechche gostes : þat of heom-self luyte rou&yogh;te, Þat weren i-spradde on þe eorþe abrod : and i-smiten þoru&yogh;-out ech-one with nailes þicke al abrod : ase þare mi&yogh;ten stikie one, Þat man ne mi&yogh;te finde ane amtie place : on al heore bodie so luyte Þat man mi&yogh;te for þe þicke nailles : a fingres ende to heom puyte. ¶ A smart wind also to oþur wo : on heom bleu&yogh; wel faste, Þat heom þou&yogh;te heo weren i-barnd : þoru&yogh;-out with eche blaste. Þe feondes ornen faste a-boute : fram ech to oþur i-nowe And heore wrechche flesch with oþur wo : mid Ovles heom to-drowe. Þeos wrechche gostes, so fur-pinede : and in swuch torment i-brou&yogh;t, Revliche heo criden ase heo mi&yogh;ten : ake it ne halp heom ri&yogh;t nou&yogh;t; For heo weren so clene ouer-come : þat heo ne mi&yogh;ten onneþe Ani voiz out-bringe bote ase a man : þat were ope þe pointe of deþe: In heore þrote heo criden dimmeliche : for heore strencþe heom was bi-nome With muche pine, and no wonder it nas : þei heo weren ouer-come. Þe feondes nomen þis seli kni&yogh;t : and to grounde him caste, And seiden, bote he wolde turne is þou&yogh;t : heo wolden naili him þare wel faste. Ake he cride on Ihesu crist : and nemde is holi name: Þe schrewes ne hadden none mi&yogh;te þo : to don him more schame. Quinta pena. &YOGH;eot heo nomen and drowen him : into þe feorþe felde, Ful of brumston al brenninde : with stronge lei&yogh;e and spelde. ¶ Ech manere pine þat mi&yogh;te beo : In þulke felde he sei&yogh;: Some with chaines of Ire : al fuyrie, hengen on hei&yogh;, Some bi Armes, some bi fet : and bi þe necke mani on, heo weren an-hangede in stronge fuyre : of pich and eke brumston; Some hengen bi stronge crokus : I-pulte þoru&yogh; eiþur Ey&yogh;e, Þoru&yogh; þe þrote some also : and þoru&yogh; eiþur ere wel hei&yogh;e, And some þoru&yogh; heore derne limes : and some þoru&yogh; þe tete, Þat leuere heom were þane al þe world : heore lyf to habbe i-lete. Some op-on grediles of Ire : i-rostede weren also, Some ase gyes, þe spites of Ire : þoru&yogh;-out heom i-do; Some leyen opri&yogh;t a-&yogh;ein þe grounde : &yogh;eonijnde wel faste, Þe feondes welden led and bras : and in heore mouþes caste. he ne mi&yogh;te bi-þenche no manere pine : þat he ne sai&yogh; mo þer. him þou&yogh;te he sai&yogh; þare mani on : þat he knev on eorþe her. Þe feondes him casten a-midde þis pine : a-mong þis oþere ech-on: And he cride on Iesu crist : and was deliured a-non. Sexta pena. ¶ &YOGH;eot þis feondes þis selie kni&yogh;t : into an oþur place huy drowe. Þare-Inne he i-sai&yogh; a grislich &yogh;weol : with spokene longe i-nowe; Þat on ende hangede toward þe grounde : þat oþur op-on hei&yogh;, Ful it was of hokes and pikes : wel þicke, ase he i-sei&yogh;; Þis hokes and þis pikes weren : faste i-riuen al-so, With wrechche gostes al-a-boute : þat þaron weren i-do. Al brenninde was þis sorie &yogh;weol : and stinkinde of brumston; Þe wrechche gostes þat þar-on hengen : brenninde weren ech-on. Þis feondes wenden forth a-non : and heore hokes þaron caste In eiþur side, a[nd] MS. a tur[n]den a-boute : þis sori &yogh;weol so faste, Þat of þe gostus þat þaron hengen : no-þing heo ne sei&yogh;e— So faste heo torneden þat &yogh;weol a-boute— : bote þe brenninde lei&yogh;e; Ake deolfulliche heo criden and &yogh;ollen : euer-ech in is ende.— Alas, &yogh;wi nellez men beon i-war : are heo heonnes wende, &YOGH;wane he mi&yogh;ten here with a luytel pine : bete heore mis-dede And þare heo schullen so bitere a-bugge : alas, þe wrechhede!— Þis feondes nomen þis seli kni&yogh;t : and on þis &yogh;weol him caste And with þis oþere wrechche gostes : torneden him a-boute faste: Sone he cride on Ihesu crist : deliuered he was a-non; Þe feondes stoden and bi-heolden : with dreori mod ech-on. Septima pena. ¶ Eft heo nomen him bitterliche : and ferrore &yogh;uyt him ladde, And harleden him forth wel revfulliche : and loude &yogh;ollen and gradde. bi-fore him he sai&yogh; an hous stonde : long and brod i-nov&yogh;; stunch and hete þat þarof cam : him þou&yogh;te al-mest [him] a-slou&yogh;. he with-stod, and nolde, is þonkes : for stunche gon non ner; "Ferrore þov schalt," þe fendes seiden : "þou ne schalt nou&yogh;t a-bide her; A bath it is þat þov isijcst : and þar-inne þov schalt beo And baþi with oþere þat þare beoth : ne schalt þov nou&yogh;t so fleo." Þe gostes þat þare-inne weren : wel deolfulliche cride And &yogh;ollen loude, ase he i-heorde : a-boute in eche side. Þis kni&yogh;t with þis foule wi&yogh;tes : Into þe grete house cam. Of tormens þat he þare isai&yogh; : gret gome with-alle he nam. ful of puttes and of diches : þat hous with-inne it was; More seoruwe ne more stunch : neuere i-sei&yogh;e nas: heo weren folle of stronge tormens : boillinde euer-ech-on Of wallinde led, and i-fulde heo weren : of piche and brumston. Wrechche gostus þare-inne seten : þe torment tilde wel hei&yogh;e: Some a-boue þe heued : and some ri&yogh;t to þe Ey&yogh;e, Some to þe nose, and some to þe mouth : and some op to þe swere And some to heore breostene : and a-bou&yogh;ten heore sunnes ful deore, And some to heore nauele : and some neþerrore more, And some stoden op to heore knen : and criden and weopen sore, And some stoden In with boþe fet : and some with þat on; Deolfolliche heo weopen and criden : and &yogh;ollen euerechon. ¶ "Nov þov i-sixt," queþen þe feondes : "&yogh;woder-In þov schalt gon, bote þov wolle an-oþur speke : and to us tuyrne a-non." heo nomen and casten him In a putte. : on Iesus a-non he cride: Op he cam a-non a-&yogh;en : and no lengore he ne moste þare a-bide. [Octaua pena.] heo nomen him in grete wrathþe : and harleden him ferrere more, And brou&yogh;ten him opon a swyþe gret hul : ful of sorewe and sore. he stod and bi-heold a-boute : þo he cam þare-op an hei&yogh;; him wondrede of þe manie gostes : þat he þare i-sei&yogh;. Alle þe pinene al. þat alle þat he hadde er i-sei&yogh;e : þare-a&yogh;en nou&yogh;t nere: I-clui&yogh;te heo seten ope heore ton : and quakeden revliche for fere. In þe south-half of þe hul : a deop water þare was and lou&yogh;, Þat foule stonk, and caldore was : þane ani ys oþur snov&yogh;. A norþerne wind faste blev&yogh; : þat him þou&yogh;te is flesch to-rende; Euere þare seten gostes : and a-&yogh;ein þe winde heom wende, heo quakeden and chyuereden faste : in grete pine and stronge, Ase ho-so seith a-bidet þare heore time : heore deth for-to a-fonge. "lo," seide on of þe feondes : "þov nost nou&yogh;t &yogh;wat istis; bote þov torne þi þou&yogh;t sone : þou schalt i-wite, i-wis." Ne hadde he bote þis word i-seid : þat þare ne cam a wind blowe And drof alle þis wrechche gostes : into þe deope watur ful lowe; ¶ Þe Norþerne wynd drof heom a-doun : al mid one blaste, And alle þe gostes, and þene kni&yogh;t : a-midde þe watere hem caste. More pine ne mi&yogh;te non beo : of stronge chele ne of stunche Þane þis gostes þarinne hadden : þare ne mi&yogh;te non at-blenche. Þo þe kni&yogh;t þe stronge pine : of þis water i-felde, he gan to crie on Ihesu crist : þat faillede him ful selde: A-non-ri&yogh;t with-oute lette : op of þis watere man him al. he (man om.) drov&yogh;. Ake þis wrechche gostes lefden þere : with sorewe and wo i-nov&yogh;. For in þat water, þat was so cold : and so foule stonk also, Þis gostes swymden op and doun : in muche sorewe and wo; Þe feondes ornen opon þe watere : so men doth on þe londe, And &yogh;wane ani wolde coueri al. cleueri op : with fote oþur with honde, heo pulten him a-doun a-&yogh;en : þat þare ne a-scapede non; Þare was wo and sorewe i-nou&yogh; : a-mong heom euerechon. ¶ Þis feondes wenden forth a-non : and þe seli kni&yogh;t eft nome, And drowen him into a sori stude : þare neuer er heo ne come. heo comen and stoden ouer a put : wyd it was and deop i-nov&yogh;; A brenninde smoke, þat foule stonk : op of þe putte drov&yogh;, Þat onneþe þe kny&yogh;t mi&yogh;te stonde : for sori stunch þare-nei&yogh;. Wrechche gostes in þis put : in þat sori smoke he sei&yogh; Fleo op and doun al brenninde : ase speldene doth of fuyre, And in-to þe putte eft fullen a-doun : þo heo ne mi&yogh;ten no leng duyre. him þou&yogh;te he was al ouer-come : for þe stunche þat þar-op of drov&yogh;; Þare-bi him þou&yogh;te þat in þe grounde : was soruwe and deol i-nov&yogh;. "&YOGH;wy stanst þov so?" þe fendes seiden : "þinchþ þe þarof wonder, Of þis swete smoke þat here bloweth : and &yogh;wat put beo þare-onder? Puteum Inferni. ¶ In þis put is ovre woneingue : for þe put of helle it is; And, for þov us hast i-serued wel : here þov schalt wonie, i-wis, For alle þat us seruieth wel : hidere heo schullen wende; And, &yogh;if þov comest here-in with us : þov worst here with-outen ende. Þare-fore i rede torne þi þou&yogh;t : and do us here man-rede And we schullen þene wei ase we come MS. conne : al sauf a-&yogh;en þe lede; Þov schalt on eorþe al þi lijf habbe : richesse, and Ioye al-so, For we schullen on eorþe þe finde i-nov&yogh; : ase ri&yogh;t is þat we do." Þo þe kni&yogh;t for-sok heore bi-heste : ase he hadde er i-lome, heo smiten heom a-doun into þe putte : and þene kni&yogh;t with heom nome. Þe deoppore þat heo comen : þ[e] braddere þe put was; Ake al. þat al þe wo þat he isai&yogh; er : a-&yogh;ein þat nou&yogh;t it nas. Of stunch, of brenninge, and of oþur wo : þe kni&yogh;t was so ouer-come Þat is þov&yogh;t toward Iesu crist : nei&yogh; him was bi-nome; So muche pine nas neuere i-sei&yogh;e— : him þou&yogh;te ase þei he felde Þat he was nei&yogh; ope þe pointe : þene gost op to &yogh;elde. Ake ore louerd a-mong al is wo : grace him &yogh;af atþe laste Þat he þou&yogh;te on Ihesu crist : and to him cride [faste]. MS. atþe laste A smoke þare cam smite up a-non : mid one wel stronge blaste Þene kni&yogh;t an hei&yogh; a-boue þe putte : and manie oþere al. om. gostes, caste. Þe kni&yogh;t &yogh;wirlede op in þis blast : ase speldene doth, wel wide, Atþe laste he li&yogh;te a-doun : a-boue þe putte bi side. Þare he stod and bi-heold a-boute : ase man þat witles were, Þat for þe pine þat he hadde i-haued : he nuste hov he cam þere. Þo he hadde longe i-stonde al one : and bi-holde a-boute, Þare comen blaste op of þe putte : deuelene a gret rou&yogh;te And [stoden] bi him al a-boute : al newe as þei heo were; Ase him þou&yogh;te, he ne sai&yogh; hem : neuer er bote þo þere. heo bi-heolden him wel grisliche : and grenneden on him al-a-boute, And seiden, "&yogh;wi stanst þov here al one? : þov most come into ovre rovte." heo seiden, "tolden ore felawes þe : þat þis was þe put of helle? hit nis nou&yogh;t so, ake we wollez sone : for ri&yogh;te soþe þe telle. Nostþov nou&yogh;t þat it is ore ri&yogh;te : to li&yogh;en euere-mo, And þat we with lesingues bi-traieth men : bote it mowe oþur go? And so ore felawes louwen þe : þat þis was þe put of helle; Ake þov schalt come þudere with us : and þe soþe we wollez þe telle." ¶ Þis deouelene harleden þane kni&yogh;t forth : þat wo was him to-drawe, Þat him were leouere þane ani-þing : þat he hadde i-beo of lif-dawe. So þat heo comen to a swyþe gret watur : deop and brod i-nov&yogh;; A strong mist, þat foule stonk : op of þis watere drov&yogh; Of brumston and of oþur wo— : so strong stunch neuere he ne sei&yogh;, Þat mid al þe pine of þe world : onneþe he stod þere-nei&yogh;. A brugge þare was ouer þat watur : smallere ne mi&yogh;te non beo; Þe smoke was so þicke al-a-boute : þat onneþe he mi&yogh;te [it] i-seo. þo seiden þe sorie fendes : "we seggez þe i-wis Þat onder þis deope watere : þe put of helle so is. And þat þov schalt sone i-wite : for þov schalt sone a-non ouer þis watur, þat is so deop : opon þis brugge gon, And we schullen þe sende swuch a wynd : þat schal þe amidde caste, And ore felawes þat beoth bi-neothe : schullen þe nime wel faste And drawe þe doun forth with hem : Into helle grounde a-non. Cum novþe forth and þou&yogh; schalt : op-on þis brugge gon." heo nomen þis seli kni&yogh;t : and op-on þis brugge drowe, And maden him go þere, is on-þonkes : with wrechhedes i-nowe. Þreo þingus vuele i-nowe : on þis brugge were: Þat on was, for heo was so hei&yogh; : þat no gost ne al. vnneþe me mi&yogh;te for fere Þare-oppe gon and so deope a-doun : habbe so grisliche si&yogh;te; Þat oþur was, for heo was so narov&yogh; : þat onneþe ani-þing al. me mi&yogh;te Þare-oppe sette ani fot : þat he ne fulle a-doun a-non; Þe þridde, þat heo was so slider : þat man ne mi&yogh;te þare-oppe gon bote he slide and felle a-doun : so slei&yogh; man neuere nere. Þeos þreo þinges þesne selie kni&yogh;t : brou&yogh;ten in grete fere, For heo was narov&yogh;, and slider, and hei&yogh; : þat he ne scholde him so bi-telle, &YOGH;if þat he glufte al. glide in ani half : þat he ne fulle in-to helle. ¶ Þare-oppe he was with strencþe i-brou&yogh;t : and þare-oppe i-maket to gon. So gret drede, ase him þou&yogh;te : ne hadde he neuer er non. Ake sone he þou&yogh;te on ihesu crist : þat so ofte him sauede er, And cride on is holie name : þat he were is helpe þer. he eode forth we[l] baldeliche : and þe innore þat he cam Þe hardiore him þou&yogh;te he was : and þe betere heorte to him he nam, And þe braddore was is wei— : so longe forth he eode, Þat it was so brod þat þere mi&yogh;te : a carte gon for neode, And so longe, þat tuei cartes mi&yogh;te : meten heom wel i-nov&yogh;. Þe kni&yogh;t þo wel baldeliche : ase a maister forth him drou&yogh;. Þe feondes stoden bi-neþe þe brugge : and sei&yogh;en him so faste gon, And for al þe wo þat heo him duden : ne ouer-cam him nou&yogh;t on; heom þou&yogh;te, it was al for nou&yogh;t : after him to honten more: grisliche heo gonne forto &yogh;eolle : ant to crie and wepe suyþe sore, Þat for þe &yogh;eollinge þat heo maden : he hadde wel more fere Þane of al þe pine þat he hadde er : so lodlich was þe bere; ¶ heore Oules heo nomen and heore hokes : and toward him casten an hei&yogh;; Ake þare nas non þat him touchi mi&yogh;te : ne no-þing come him nei&yogh;. So þat al sauf with alle Ioye : ouer þis watere he him drov&yogh;, And þe feondes lefden bi-hinde : with grete soruwe ant sor i-nou&yogh;— In helle is heore kuynde heritage : and elles for-soþe it were wov&yogh;! heo leten him go &yogh;wodere he wolde : and ne fondeden him non more, And heolden heom cleneliche ouer-come : for al heore false lore. Þis kni&yogh;t wende him forth, sauf i-nou&yogh;— : þat he hadde erore deore a|bou&yogh;t, And þonkede &yogh;eorne Ihesu crist : þat þe feondes ne siweden him nou&yogh;t. Þat watur he passede sauf inov&yogh; : and forþere þene wey he nam. Þe contrie him þou&yogh;te murie i-nou&yogh; : þare-forth þat he cam; Þe forþere þat he wende : þe more murevþe he sei&yogh;. So [longe] þat he i-sai&yogh; ane wal : swiþe noble and hei&yogh;— So riche weork nas neuere i-sei&yogh;e : ase him [þou&yogh;te] þat þar-on was; And swyþe fair &yogh;at þaron he sai&yogh; : þat neuere swuch i-sei&yogh;e nas; Þat &yogh;at schon swyþe bri&yogh;te : ase þei it al gold were, Folle of derewurþe stones i-pi&yogh;te : none richere neuere nere. him þou&yogh;te, are he þudere cam : is wei ful longe laste. Þo he cam forþere a luytel wi&yogh;t : he stod and bi-heold it faste. Þat [&yogh;at] om. wende op a&yogh;en him : and a-non-ri&yogh;t with þe dede Þare cam smite out a swote smel : and wide a-boute gan sprede, Þat him þou&yogh;te, þei al þe world : swote spices were, So muche swotnesse ne mi&yogh;te &yogh;iuen : ase þat suote smul dude þere. In so gret Ioye him þou&yogh;te he was : þat þei he hadde beo i-brou&yogh;t In-to al þe soruwe þat he was er : it ne schulde him habbe i-greued nou&yogh;t. he bi-heold in at þis &yogh;ate : þo he cam þer-nei&yogh;: More clernesse nas neuere i-sei&yogh;e : him þou&yogh;te, þane he þere i-sei&yogh;. Ase he wolde þare-In wende : a&yogh;ein him þare cam gon A procession fair i-nov&yogh; : of noble men ech-on, with creoiz and with taperes : and with baneres clere; I-reuested faire muche folk was : and ech hadde is fere, Some were bischopus and Ercedeknes : and some Monekes and freres, And euerech, him þou&yogh;te, hadde þe Abite : þat heo wereden here. with þe meste Ioye þat mi&yogh;te beo : þis kni&yogh;t was onder-fonge, And i-lad In with Ioye i-nov&yogh; : mid solas and murie songe. Þo þis murie song was i-do : to him sone þare come Tweien ase it maistres weren : and bi þe honde him nome, And welcomeden him wel mildeliche : and þonkeden ore louerd faste, Þat him sende so guode bi-leue : so stableliche for-to laste. heo ladden him a-boute and scheweden him : þat lond fer and ner: So muche Ioie and clernesse : him þou&yogh;te he ne sai&yogh; neuer er. ¶ Ase þe sonne bi-nimez þe li&yogh;t : of Candle a-boute Midday, Also it bi-nam þe sonne hire leom : him þou&yogh;te, ase al. þe li&yogh;t þat he þare i-sai&yogh;. So long and brod þe place was : þat he ne mi&yogh;te non ende i-seo: A fair Medwe he sai&yogh; al. Al murie med with swete floures : swottere ne mi&yogh;te non beo, Treon al-so with noble fruyt : þat smulde swote Inov&yogh;; And þe al. So gret swotnesse of euer-ech stude : al a-boute op drou&yogh;, Þat þare with-oute mete and drunch : him þou&yogh;te, euere-mo he mi&yogh;te libbe with alle Ioie : &yogh;if he moste þare-Inne go. It was þere euere i-liche li&yogh;t : and euere it was dai. So muche folk in none place, him þou&yogh;te : neuer er he ne sai&yogh;. Ech Compaygnie to oþur drov&yogh; : and ech bi oþur stod, With murie song and Melodie : and gladnesse in heore mod, Þat ech of oþur þe more Ioye : to-gadere heo mi&yogh;ten a-fonge; Al-mi&yogh;ti god, þat heom schop : heo hereden In heore songe. And ase sum steorre þat &yogh;e i-seoth : bri&yogh;tore þane oþur is, Also was bi heom, for some weren : clerore þane some, i-wis; Ake þulke þat mest dosk was : him þou&yogh;te, was more cler And bri&yogh;tore schon, þane ani gold : þat he i-sai&yogh; euer er. ¶ Ech werede cloþes of þe en-taile : þat heo wereden on eorþe here: Monekes ase it to Monek bi-feol : and freres ase to frere; So þat heo hadden heore ri&yogh;te fourme : ake wel bri&yogh;tore was hore hev, Ant &yogh;wat men heo were on eorþe : bi heore cloþinge he knev. Some hadden þe croune of golde : an-ouewarde þe heued ido, And some beren in heore hond : &yogh;eordene of golde al-so. And alle heo þonkeden Ihesu crist : þat so studefast heorte him sende, Þe kni&yogh;t, for al þe pine þat he hadde : is heorte enes ne wende; Ech-one heom þou&yogh;te þat for him : In þe more Ioye heo were. he stod and bi-heold al þis Ioie : as þei no wit on him nere. Þe on, ase it heore maister were : is Mouth ondude wel softe And welcomede him wel mildeliche : and þonkede ore louerd ofte, Þat swuch porpos him hadde i-send : and studefast heorte al-so, Þat he ne chaungede nou&yogh;t is þou&yogh;t : for al þat him was i-do. "bev frere," he seide, "i-herd beo god : þat þe hauez hidere i-brou&yogh;t And a-mong alle þine stronge fon : studefast i-wust þi þou&yogh;t! Of þe pine of sunfule gostes : I-fondet þov hauest i-nou&yogh;, And þare-with þine sunnes i-bet : and elles it were wou&yogh;. ¶ Þov mi&yogh;t here sumdel i-seo : þat þov wilnest more, Of þe Ioye þat guode soulene habbez : þat comieth to milce and ore. Þis place þat we inne beoth : ich wene þov ne knowest nou&yogh;t: It is eorþelich parays : þat Adam was Inne i-brou&yogh;t And þat he was Inne ymad : and sethþe for is mis-dede he was i-cast out þar-of, and we also : on eorþe into alle wrechchehede; ¶ Al þe Ioye þat þov i-sixt her : he hadde to is wille, Ake he ne mi&yogh;te, þo he was out i-cast : þar-of i-seo wurth a fille. Of wrechhede we beoth i-kened : and of sunful blode i-come: And þat us is þoru&yogh; godes grace : ant þoru&yogh; ore cristinedom bi-nome. Ak þat we aftur ore cristindom : of sunne on eorþe wrou&yogh;te, On eorþe oþur in purgatorie : wel deore we it bou&yogh;te: For we alle þat þou here i-sixt : þare-forth hidere come And ore sunnes þare betten : and harde penaunce nome, Ne mi&yogh;te we elles here come. : ase guod bi þe it is: For &yogh;if þine sunnes nere for-&yogh;iue : þov ne come nou&yogh;t here, i-wis. And alle þat þov þare i-sei&yogh;e : to us þudere heo schullen wende, And al dai doth some, &yogh;wane heo habbez : heore penaunce i-brou&yogh;t to ende. Neuer on not hov longe he schal : þare bi-leue, i-wis; For ho-so ani freond on eorþe hath : mid him þe betere it is: Þoru&yogh; massene and þoru&yogh; oþur beden : and þoru&yogh; almes-dede Man mai hore pine muche a-legge : and þe sonore ovt þar-of heom lede. And &yogh;wane ani of heom hidere comez : a&yogh;en him we wendez ech-on, Ase we duden a-&yogh;ein þe, with Ioye : and ledez him In a-non. Ake non of us nis &yogh;uyt wuyrthþe : in-to heuene for-to wende, Ne neuere on not &yogh;wane ovre louerd : after ani of us wole sende; For ech man þat in-to heuene schal : þoru&yogh; purgatorie mot And sethþe into eorþeliche parays : ase we beoth novþe, wel ich wot. For þis is ovre kuynde heritage : i-wrou&yogh;t we weren þar-to, Al for-to ore furste fader it a-gulte : and for-to he hadde mis-do; here we scholden alle habbe i-beon i-bore : and i-leoued ore lif al-so, For ore louerd wold þat we weren : In þe more Ioye i-do. Þei men beon ovt heonnes i-cast : here-forth heo moten wende And om. and a&yogh;en, ar heo to heouene come : aftur heore liues ende. Ake al þe Ioye þat is here : nis no-þing, i-wis, A-&yogh;ein þe leste Ioye of heouene : wel muche þe meste is. Sum-þing þov schalt of heuene i-seo : In a place here-nei&yogh;." he ladde him op-on an hei&yogh; hul : and bad him bi-holde on hei&yogh;, And axede him of &yogh;wuch colur were : heuene op-ri&yogh;t þere. he seide, him þou&yogh;te ri&yogh;t ase gold : þat puyr wallinde were. "&YOGH;e," seide þis oþur, "þis is þe wei : þat geth ri&yogh;t to heuene blis, And þat is þe &yogh;at of parays : þat with-oute heuene &yogh;eond is. ¶ Ech day some of purgatorie : comez hidere us to, And some of us to heuene wendez : euer-eche daye also; So þat [we] wexez eche daie : and waniez, þov sixt lo; We nutez &yogh;wuch of us it schal beo next : bote as god wole habbe i-do. Ech dai þe &yogh;wuyle we here beoth : ore louerd us fedez ene with riche metes of heuene : þat swete is and clene; &yogh;wuche þulke metes beon : are þov heonnes wende with us þov schalt sone i-wite : &yogh;wane god it wole us sende." Ne hadde he bote o word i-seid : þat þare ne cam a-li&yogh;te A manere brez fram heouene a-doun : þat schon wel clere and bri&yogh;te, Þat ouer-spradde al þat lond : and a cler leome þare-with-oute, And al. om. opon euereches heued a-li&yogh;te a-doun : wel faire, with-outen doute, al. clerore þane aboute And op-on þis kni&yogh;tes heued al-so : an þoru&yogh; him smot a-non, And þoru&yogh; euerech lime and lith of him : þat swete li&yogh;t gan gon; Þa[t] so muche wille r. winne? and Ioye : him þou&yogh;te, neuere he nadde. he stod, ase þei he were i-nomen : for Ioye þat he þo hadde, &YOGH;weþur he were quik oþur ded : bote ase he in metingue were. louerd, murie is þe Ioye of heuene : ase he i-felde wel þere! Ake it ne laste heom bote luytele &yogh;wile : þat þe leome ne with|drov&yogh;; And naþeles, þei it luyte laste : þar-of heo weren fulle i-nov&yogh;. Þe kni&yogh;t stod and bi-heold a-boute : and is ri&yogh;te stat onder-stod. So fol he was of þat holi leome : þat so swete was and guod: him þou&yogh;te, þei he leouede euere-more : and neuereft more ne ete, Ne scholde him neuer-eft to mete luste : so guod was þe leome and swete. "Lo," seide þis oþur gost : þat schewede him al þis place, "Sum-del þov hast nouþe isei&yogh;e : of ore louerdes grace ¶ Of þe pine þat þe wrechche gostes : habbeth for heore mis|dede, And of þe Ioye þat guode gostes : in parays doth lede, And sum-del of þe grete Ioie : þat in þe ri&yogh;te heuene is. Eche dai&yogh;e we beoth i-fedde : ones with swuche Ioie and blis, And þanne beo we al dai fulle i-nov&yogh; : for-to ore louerd more us sende: In swuche Ioie heo beoth þat beoth in heouene : and worþez with|oute ende, And &yogh;uyt sum-del in more : it ne faillez heom neuere mo, And we ne beoth a day bote enes : for-to we þudere go; And &yogh;wan þat we þudere comieth : we schulle with-outen ende, And þou, &yogh;if þov a-seruest heuene forth : þudere for-to wende. Þov mi&yogh;t don ase þov wolt : &yogh;wane þov comest to eorþe, i-wis, And þudere anon a-&yogh;en þou most— : for-soþe, at þe time it is; And &yogh;if þov wolt guod lif lede : þine mede þov mi&yogh;t i-seo; And &yogh;wat pine heo habbez, þov hast i-seie : þat luþere wollez beo. A-&yogh;ein þou most wende a-non : go forth a-godes name! For sikerliche þov mi&yogh;t gon : þe feondes ne mowen don þe no schame; heo beoth a-dradde wel sore of þe : and a-schamede in eche side. A-godes name go forth þi wei : þov ne mi&yogh;t no leng here a-bide!" "A, sire, merci!" quath þis kni&yogh;t : "bi-tide &yogh;wat me bi-tide, A fote i-nelle fram eov go : for wrechche-hede MS. hedede goth so wide. ¶ Ake soffriez me bi-leue here with ov! : for, &yogh;if ich fram eov wende, A-drad ich am of þe feondene mi&yogh;te : laste heo with sunne me schende." "Do wei, beu frere," þis oþur seide : "ase wel þov mi&yogh;t beo stille, A-&yogh;en þov schalt to eorþe a-non : and al. om. þov mi&yogh;t don þare þine wille; And &yogh;if þov seruest wel ore louerd þere : siker þov mi&yogh;t beo to comen a-&yogh;ein hidere to us : and sethþe to heuene fteo. A-godes half wend a-&yogh;en a-non : for-soþe, þov schalt so." "Alas, alas!" quath þis kni&yogh;t : "&yogh;wat schal ich nouþe do? Al þe Ioye þat ich habbe nouþe isei&yogh;e : it worth me bi-nome, And to þe wrechhede of þe worlde : alas, schal ich novþe come!" Ovt ate &yogh;ate heo brou&yogh;ten him : wepinde, at þe laste, And beden him gon wel hardiliche : and herien ore louerd wel faste; A-non so he was with-oute i-gon : þat &yogh;at heo maden wel bliue. With dreori mod he wende a-&yogh;en : and was a-drad of is liue; Ase he cam er, with careful mod : þene wei a-&yogh;ein he nam. And, &yogh;wane ani deuel þat him pinede er : ou&yogh;were a-&yogh;en him cam, Ase wode schrewene heo flouwen faste : and ne dorsten a-bide him nou&yogh;t. So atþe laste þis kni&yogh;t was : to þe halle a-&yogh;ein i-brou&yogh;t Þare as þe holie compaygnie : þuder-ward to him wende; And sat him a-doun wel softe þere : for-to ore louerd him grace sende. Ase he sat and bi-heold a-boute : to him heo comen þere, Al þat faire compaygnie : þat a-&yogh;ein him cam er, And honoureden him wel faire : and conforteden him wel faste, And þonkeden Iesus, godes sone : þat his bi-leue so wel i-laste. ¶ "bev frere," heo seiden, "&yogh;wane þov hast : swuch penaunce i|driue, Siker beo þou þat þine sunnes : al clene þe beoth for-&yogh;iue. loke, &yogh;wane þov comest to eorþe a-&yogh;en : þat þov clene lif lede, So þat þov neuer-eft in pine ne come : for sunne ne for mis-dede! Þov most don þe heonnes a-non : for at hom in þine londe hit dawez clere and is nei&yogh; dai : ase ich me onder-stonde, And þe prior with procession : to þe &yogh;ate comez wel sone to loki &yogh;weþur þov beo i-come : ase ri&yogh;t is forto done, And, bote he þe finde þere : he wole maken þat &yogh;at a-non And wole beo siker þat þou ne comest non-more : and sori wole a-&yogh;en gon." This verse on the margin. Þene kni&yogh;t heo brou&yogh;ten out of þe halle : and blesseden him ech-on And bi-tei&yogh;ten god boþe lif and soule : fel and flesch and bon. Forth he wende wel dreoriliche : bote ase he nede moste it do. And ri&yogh;t ase he cam to þe &yogh;ate : þe prior cam al-so A-&yogh;ein him with procession : to loke hou it were. A-non so he hadde þe &yogh;ate on-loke : þene kni&yogh;t heo founden þere. Þare was Ioye and blisse i-nov&yogh; : þo huy to-gadere come! With song and oþur melodie : þane kny&yogh;t þare-out huy nome, Ant ladden him forth to churche a-non : ant þonkeden god wel faste. Þis kni&yogh;t bi-fore þe hei&yogh;e auctere : a-knes wel sone him caste, Ant stableliche in his oresones : fiftene dawes he lay, And þonkede ore louerd & on him cride : boþe ny&yogh;t and day. And sethþe on his bare flesch : þe holie croiz he nam And wende to þe holie lond : ant suyþe holi man bi-cam. he ne tolde neuere-eft nou&yogh;t of þe world : bote ase he were euere in þou&yogh;te, Ake wende euere forth wel stilleliche al. simpleliche : as he of no-þing ne rou&yogh;te. Ofte he tolde of alle þe men : þat in parays were; As him þou&yogh;te, grei&yogh;e Monekes : mest Ioye hadden þere, None-manere men in so gret Ioye : ne in so grete honour he ne sei&yogh;— hit nis no wonder sikerliche : for þe ordre is noble and hei&yogh;.— Novþe &yogh;e habbez alle i-heord : þoru&yogh; ore louerdes grace, hou seint paterik þulke purgatorie : founde in þat place, For-to warni men a-boute : heore sunnes here to bete. For þe loue of Iesu crist : and of is moder swete Alle ower sunnes betez here : as god ov wole grace sende, Þat &yogh;e mouwen with-oute pine : to parays hennes wende. god leue us ovre sunnes here so biete : for is holie wounde, Þat we ne þoruen in purgatorie : bi-leue bote luyte stounde.

26.0: 36 Vita sancti Brendani, Abbatis de Hybernia.
26.1: SEint brendan, þe holi man : was here of ovre londe. Monek he was of harde liue : as ich me under-stonde, Of fastingue and oþur penaunce i-nov : and Abbot he was þere Of a þousend Monekes : þat alle under him were. hit bi-feol in a day : as ore louerdes wille was, Þat beryn, al. barint an oþur Abbot : to him cam bi cas. Seint brendan him bi-sou&yogh;te anon : him don onder-stonde Ant tellen him &yogh;wat he hadde i-sei&yogh;e : a-boute in oþur londe. Þis guode man, þo he i-heorde þis : sichingues he made i-nowe Ant in grete þou&yogh;te bi-gan for-to weope : and fel a-doun i-suowe. bi-twene his armes seint brendan : þis holie man op nam & custe him faste, & cride on him : al for-to is wit him cam; "Fader," he seide, "par charite : oþur red þov most take; hidere þou come for ovre solas : and nou&yogh;t suych deol to make. tel us &yogh;wat þou hast i-sei&yogh;e : a-boute as þou hast i-wend In þe .se. of Occean : as ore louerd þe hath i-send." Nou is þe .se. [of] Occean : grettest and mest al-so: heo goth a-boute al þe world : and alle oþere cometh þer-to. So þat berin, þis olde man : ri&yogh;t of is heorte grounde Al weopinde he hem tolde : &yogh;wat he hadde i-founde. he seide, he al. ic hadde a wel guod sone : and Mernok was is name, "A Monek he was, as we beoth : and man of grete fame; his heorte him &yogh;af for-to wende : in-to a priue stude and stille, Þare he mi&yogh;te beo al one : to a-serui godes wille. So þat bi mine wille he wende : ase ich it telle ov, to an yle fer in þe se : þat delitable was i-nov, bi-side þe Montayne of stones : þat is couth wel wide. Þe Monek likede þare wel : and longue gan þare a-bide, And hadde þare under him : Monekes mani on. Þo ich heorde tellen þat : þuder-ward ich gan gon. So þat in auision : ore suete louerd him sende, Þat a-&yogh;en me, are ich to him come : þre Iorneies he wende. And in a schip we duden us sone : and Astward euere kenden In þe .se. of Occean : as ore louerd is grace us sende. toward þe est so fer we wenden : þat we comen ate laste In suyþe þuyster stude : and clouden us ouer-caste; Al ane tide of þe daye : we weren in deorkhede. Ate laste ore suete louerd : forþere us gan lede. So þat we i-sei&yogh;en a newe lond : þuder-ward ore schip drov; bri&yogh;ttore it þou&yogh;te þane þe sonne : Ioye þare was i-nov, Of treon and herbes, þikke j-nov&yogh; : bi-set in eche side, And of suete preciouse stones : þat bri&yogh;tte schynen and wide; Euerech herbe was ful of floures : and ech treo was ful of fruyt; bote it were in heuene : nas neuere more duyt. Þare-Inne with Ioye and blisse I-nov&yogh; : longue we duden i-wende; &YOGH;eot us þou&yogh;te luytel &yogh;wyle : ne mi&yogh;te we finde non ende So þat we comen to a watur : cler and bri&yogh;t I-nov&yogh;, þat euere fram-ward þe est : toward þe west it drov&yogh;. We stoden and bi-heolden a-boute : for we ne mi&yogh;ten ouer i-wende: Þare cam to us a &yogh;ong &yogh;omman : swiþe fair and hende, And welcomede us euerech-one : wel mildeliche and swete; he nemnede euerech is ri&yogh;tte name : and faire gan us grete, And seide þat we ou&yogh;ten al. &yogh;e a&yogh;te Ihesu crist : þonki suyþe wel with ri&yogh;te 'Þat schewez eov is priuete : and al-so of is mi&yogh;te. Þis is þat lond þat he wole : &yogh;uyt are þe worldes ende [his dernelinges an erþe &yogh;yue : &yogh; hyder he schal heo scholle, on the margin. wende. This verse added by a later hand in the text and on the mar|gin. ] Þis lond is half in þusse half : ase &yogh;e i-seoz wel wide, And bi-&yogh;eonde þe watere haluen-del : al bi þat oþur side— Þat watur ne mowe &yogh;e passi nou&yogh;t : þat oþur del to seo. For al. om. here &yogh;e habbez al a &yogh;er : meteles i-beo, Þat &yogh;e ne eten ne dronken : ne slepen nou&yogh;t with ey&yogh;e, Ne chele ne hete ne greuede ev nou&yogh;t : noþur lowe ne hei&yogh;e. Þis al. For þis is ore louerdes priue stude : and þoru&yogh; him it is þus li&yogh;t; Þare-fore it is [her] euere day : and neuere-more ni&yogh;t. &yogh;if Adam a-&yogh;ein godes heste : ne hadde no-þing mis-do, here-Inne he hadde &yogh;uyt i-beo : and is of-sprung al-so. &YOGH;e ne mowen no leng here bi-leue : a-&yogh;en &yogh;e moten fare; [ Here 2 fol. are torn out in the MS. I supply the gap from MS. Harl. 2277.] [Þe&yogh; hit ne þenche &yogh;ou bote a while : &yogh;e habbeþ ibeo her &yogh;are.' Þat so al. So þat he brou&yogh;te ous in oure schip : & faire his leue nom; & þo MS. þe we were hamward in þe see : we nuste whar he bi-com— A&yogh;e-ward he wende a&yogh;en oure wille : þat of-þo&yogh;te ous sore ynou&yogh;. A&yogh;en to þis oþer monekes : þis schip wel euene drou&yogh;. ¶ Þis monekes vrne a&yogh;en ous : þo hi ous mi&yogh;te iseo, & sori were & wroþe ynou&yogh; : þat we hadde so longe ibeo. we seide hem þat we hadde ibeo : in gret ioye & feste, Bifore þe &yogh;ates of parays : in þe lond of biheste, Þat oure suete louerd haþ bihote : hem þat he loueþ her, Þer is euere dai & neuere ni&yogh;t : & euere li&yogh;t suyþe cler. ¶ 'Certes,' quaþ þis monekes : 'þis we mowe iseo Bi þe suete smyl of &yogh;ou : þat &yogh;e habbeþ þer ibeo.' "— ¶ Þo seint Brendan ihurde þis : he þo&yogh;te & stod stille; [he þo&yogh;te fondi more her-of : &yogh;if it were godes wille.] This verse, om. in H., is taken from Ashm. he wende aboute his monekes : & tuelue out he nom, Þat he triste to mest of alle : whan eni neode him com. Þuse he nom in consail : & in priueite [hem] sede: ["I þenche do a priue þing : þer-of &yogh;e mote me rede, To seche þat lond of biheste : &yogh;if god wolde ous þuder lede.] These 2 v. om. in H. Siggeþ what &yogh;oure consail is : to do such a dede." "Leoue fader," quaþ þis oþere : "oure wille we habbeþ forsake, ¶ Oure freond & al oure oþer god : & clanliche to þe itake: & whan al oure dede is on þe : & þu wolt þat hit beo, we schulle bliþeliche wiþ þe wende : godes grace to seo." So þat hi faste fourti dawes : & gret penance dude also, & bede &yogh;urne oure louerdes grace : þulke veyage to do. hi leten hem di&yogh;te a gret schip : & aboue hit albi MS. abbi -caste wiþ bole-huden stronge ynou : ynailed þerto faste, & siþþe ipiched al abou[t]e : þat þe water [in] necome. hi wende to here breþeren : & wel faire here leue nome, And siþþe in oure louerdes name : to schipe wende anon; here breþeren þat bihynde were : sori were echon. & þo hi were in þe schip : after þer come go al. om. tuo & bede faste þat hi moste : þane wei mid hem go. "&YOGH;e mowe wel," quaþ seint brendan : "ac &yogh;oure on schal atta[n] ende Repenti er he come a&yogh;e : & al quic to helle wende." Þider al. vorþ him wende þis holi man : whoder oure louerd hem sende; & þis tuei monekes þat come last : also wiþ hem wende. ¶ In þe grete see of occian : forþ hi rewe faste, & triste alto oure louerdes grace : & noþing nere agaste. Þe see drof here schip after wil : þe wynd was gret ynou&yogh;; As þe wynd hem drof est forþ : wel euene þe schip him drou&yogh;, Euene a&yogh;e þat þe sonne ariseþ : a-midsomeres day— Nou nuste non of hem whar he was : ne no lond he nesay. Euene forþri&yogh;t fourti dayes : þe wynd hem drof faste: So þat hi se&yogh;e in þe norþside : a gret ylle r. yle atte laste, Of harde roche & gret ynou : in þe see wel he&yogh;e; Þreo dayes hi wende þer-aboute : er hi mi&yogh;te come þer-ne&yogh;e. ¶ A lute hauene hi MS. he fonde þo : alond hi wende þere; hi wende alond as maskede al. masid men : hi nuste whar hi were. Þer com go a wel fair hound : as hit were hem to here; At seint Brendanes fet he ful adoun : & makede him faire chere. ¶ "Beau freres," quaþ seint brendan : "&yogh;e neþore noþing drede: Ich wot þis is a messager : þe ri&yogh;te wei ous to lede." Þis hound ladde þis holi man : to an halle, fair ynou&yogh;, Gret & starc & suyþe noble : euene in he drou&yogh;. Þis monekes fonde in þis halle : bord & cloþ isprad, & bred & fisch þer-vppe ynou&yogh;— : þer nas non þat nas glad. hi sete adoun & ete faste— : for hem luste wel þerto. Beddes þer were, al &yogh;are ymaked : er here soper were ido: After here soper to bedde hi wende : to resten hem, as þe wise. Þo hi hadde alle islepe ynou&yogh; : sone hi gonne arise, & wende to here schip : as hi hadde er ibeo. In þe see wel longe hi were : er hi mi&yogh;te lond iseo. ¶ Þo hi se&yogh;e r. se&yogh;e hi as bi þoþer side : an ylle fair ynou&yogh;, Grene & [wiþ] wel fair lese. : þiderward here schip drou&yogh;. Þo hi come on þis faire lond : & bihulde aboute wide, Þe faireste scheep þat mi&yogh;te beo : hi se&yogh;e in eche side; A scheep was grettere þan an oxe : whittere ne mi&yogh;te non beo. Gret ioye hi hadde in here hurte : þat hi mi&yogh;te þis iseo. Þer com al. þo com þer go a wel fair man : & grette hem wiþ faire chere, & seide, "&yogh;e beoþ hider icome : þer &yogh;e neuere nere. ¶ Þis is icliped þe lond of scheep : for scheep wel faire her beoþ, Mochele & white & grete ynou&yogh; : as &yogh;e aldai iseoþ; Fairere hi beoþ þan &yogh;oure scheep : & grettere vnyliche, For murie weder is her ynou&yogh; : & lese suyþe riche. her nis neuere wynter non : for her nis non al. ne non hei ifounde, Ac hi eteþ þerbes nue : as hi springeþ of þe g[ro]unde. Ne me ne gadereþ no&yogh;t of here mulc : þat hi scholde þe worse beo; ¶ For þis þing, & meni oþer : þe bet hi mowe iþeo. To a stede &yogh;e schulle hunne wende : þurf oure louerdes grace, Þat is foweles parays : a wel ioyful place : Þer &yogh;e schulle þis ester beo : & þis wit-sonedai also. Wendeþ forþ a-godes name : þat þis veyage were ido!"
26.2: SEint Brendan & his breþeren : to schipe wende anon, & rue forþ faste in þe see : wiþ tempest meni on. So þat hi se&yogh;e in anoþer side : an ylle gret ynou&yogh;. here schip þurf godes grace : þiderwardes drou&yogh;. Þo hit cam almest þerto : vpe þe roche hit gan ride, Þat hit ne mi&yogh;te no&yogh;t to þe yle come : ac bileuede biside. Þis monekes wende al. wode vp to þis yle : ac seint brendan no&yogh;t. Þis monekes gonne makie here mete : of þat hi hadde ibro&yogh;t : hi makede fur & soden hem fisch : in a caudroun faste. Er þis fisch were isode [I-nou&yogh;] : somdel hi were agaste : For þo þis fur was þurf-hot : þe yle quakede anon & wiþ gret eir hupte al vp— : þis monekes dradde echon, [& þe wei toward hor schip : ech after oþer nom, God leuest hem þo&yogh;te he was : þat sonest þuder com.] om. in H. hi bihulde hou þe yle : in þe see wende faste & as a quic þing hupte vp & doun : & þat fur fram him caste; he suam more þan tuei myle : while þis fur ilaste. Þe monekes ise&yogh;e þe fur wel longe : & were sore agaste : hi cride &yogh;urne on seint brendan : what þe wonder were. "Beoþ stille," quaþ þis gode man : "for no&yogh;t &yogh;e nabbe al. habbeþ fere. &YOGH;e weneþ þat hit beo an yle : ac &yogh;e þencheþ amis : hit is a fisch of þis grete see : þe gretteste þat þer is. Iastoni he is icleped : & fondeþ ni&yogh;t & dai To pulte his tail in his mouþ : ac for gretnisse he nemai."— Forþ hi rue in þe see : euene west wel faste, Þreo dayes, er hi se&yogh;e lond : hi were somdel a-gaste. ¶ Þo se&yogh;en hi a wel fair lond : of floures þikke ynou&yogh;— wel glade hi were þo hi se&yogh;e : þat here schip þider drou&yogh;. In þis faire lond hi wende : lengere þan i c telle : So þat hi fonde in a place : a suyþe noble welle. Bi þe welle stod a treo : brod & round ynou&yogh;; Foweles white & faire ynou&yogh; : were in euerech al. so þicke were in ech bou&yogh;, Þat vneþe eni leef : hi mi&yogh;te þeron iseo— Þer was ioye & blisse ynou&yogh; : to lokie on suche o treo. ¶ Seint Brendan for ioye wep : & sat adoun akneo And bad oure louerd schowi him : what such a cas mi&yogh;te beo. Þo fle&yogh; þer vp alute fowel : þo he gan to fleo, al. & toward him gan te As a fiþele his wynges furde : þo he to him-ward gan teo. al. þo he gan to fleo Murie[re] Instrument neuere nas : þan MS. þat his wyngen were! he bihuld seint brendan : wiþ wel faire chere. "Ich hote [þe,]" seide seint brendan : "if þu ert messager, Þat þu sigge me what [þu] ert : & what &yogh;e doþ her." Þe&yogh; hit þo&yogh;te a&yogh;e cunde : þis fowel ansuerede anon : "We were," he seide "sum-tyme was : angles in heuene echon. As r. ac sone so sone as we were ymaked : oure maister was so prout, Lucefer, for his fairhede : þat he ful sone out, & mid him also meni on : as here dede was; ¶ & we fulle also a-doun : ac for no synne hit nas, for MS. Ac for noþing þat we assentede : to his foule vnri&yogh;t, Bote soulement forto schewe : oure louerdes suete al. suete louerdes mi&yogh;t. Ne we ne beoþ her in pyne non : ac in ioye ynou&yogh; we beoþ, And somdel oure suete louerdes : mi&yogh;te we seoþ. & bi þe vrþe we fleoþ : & bi þe lifte also, As gode angles, & liþere ek : ri&yogh;t is for-to do, Þe gode [for]-to do men god : þe liþer liþere makieþ. ¶ & sonedai, þat is dai of rest : such forme we takeþ : MS. makeþ Þe forme of suche white foweles : as þu mi&yogh;t iseo, [&] honureþ god þat ous makede : her on þis brode treo. Tuelf-monþ hit [is] ipassed nou : þat &yogh;e gonne out wende, & alle þis six &yogh;er &yogh;e schulle fare : er &yogh;e schulle al. om. bringe &yogh;oure wille to ende; For whan &yogh;e habbeþ iwend soue &yogh;er : oure louerd wole &yogh;ou sende A si&yogh;t þat &yogh;e habbeþ longe iso&yogh;t : anon after þe soue &yogh;eres ende. Eche &yogh;er &yogh;e schulle her mid ous : holde ester-feste, As &yogh;e nou doþ, forte &yogh;e come : to þe lond of biheste"— Nou was hit an ester-day : þat al þis was ido. ¶ þe fowel nom his leue of hem : & to his felawes wende þo. Þe foweles, þo hit eue al. time was : bigonne here euesong— Muriere song nemi&yogh;te beo : þe&yogh; god silf were among. Þe monekes wende to bedde & slepe : þo soper was ido; & þo hit was tyme of matyns : hi arise þerto. ¶ Þe foweles sunge ek here matyns : wel ri&yogh;t, þo hit was tyme, & of þe sauter seide þe al. om. uers : & siþþe also MS. alto prime, & vnderne siþþe, & middai : & afterwardes non, & eche tyde songen of þe dai : as cristene men scholde don. Þis monekes were in þe lond : ei&yogh;te wyke also, Forto alþe feste of ester : & of witsonedai were ido. ¶ Þo com atte trinite : þis gode man to hem þer Þat spac wiþ hem in þe lond of scheep : & ladde aboute er : he chargede here schip suyþe wel : mid mete & drinke ynou&yogh;, & nom his leue wel hendeliche : & a&yogh;eward drou&yogh;. ¶ Þo seint brendan was in his schip : & his breþeren also, Þis fowel, þat spac wiþ hem er : wel sone com hem to; he seide, "&yogh;e habbeþ her wiþ ous : þis he&yogh;e feste ibeo; Gret trauayl &yogh;ou is to come : er &yogh;e eftsone lond iseo. &YOGH;e schulleþ after soue monþes : iseo a wel fair yle. Þat abbey is icliped : þat is hunne meni a myle; &YOGH;e schulleþ beo mid holie men : þis myde-wynter þere. &YOGH;oure ester &yogh;e schulle holde þer : as &yogh;e dude to-&yogh;ere : Vpe þe grete fisches rugge : þer þi monekes were in-fere, & &yogh;oure ester [be] mid ous : ri&yogh;t as &yogh;e nou were." Seint brendan a-godes name : & his breþeren echon, In þe grete see of occian : forþ wende anon. Þe wynd hem harlede vp & doun : in peryls meni on. So weri hi were of here lyue : þat hi nuste whoder gon. Four monþes hi were al. wende in þe see : in þis grete turment,] [Here L. goes on again.] Þat huy ne ysei&yogh;en no-þing bote þe se : ant þe firmament. Þo huy ysei&yogh;en al. seie hi fer fram heom : ane yle ase þei it were; heo criden faste on Ihesu crist : þat huy mosten a-riuie þere. &YOGH;eot after þat seint Brendan : þis yle furst y-sei&yogh;, MS. sai&yogh; Fourti dawes heo wenden in þe se : er huy comen þere nei&yogh;, Þat heom þou&yogh;te heore lif was heom loz. : þe Monekes weren a-gaste, heo criden &yogh;eorne on Ihesu crist : and is help heo beden faste. A luytel hauene and swyþe streit : huy founden atþe laste, Þat vnneþes heore schip mi&yogh;te þerinne come : Aunker MS. Annker for-to caste Þis Monekes wenden a-lond þo : wel longue heom þou&yogh;te er. huy bi-heolden al-a-boute : murie heom þou&yogh;te þer. Þo ysei&yogh;en heo twey faire wellene : þat on was suyþe cler, And sumdel wori and þicke þat oþer was. : þe Monekes &yogh;eoden ner, to drinken of þat faire welle. : seint Brendan it i-sei&yogh;, And seide, "with-oute leue of oþur men : ne come &yogh;e nou&yogh;t þere nei&yogh;, Of olde men þat here-inne beoz : al þoru&yogh; godes wille al. for mid gode wille ; For om. heo wollez party þar-of mid us : and þare-fore beoz &yogh;eot stille." A fair old man and swiþe hor : a-&yogh;ein heom þere cam gon; he wel-comede heom faire i-nov&yogh; : and seint Brendan he custe a-non, And ladde heom forth with him : bi a wel fair wei A-boute in many a murie stude : and sethþe in-to on Abbey. Seint Brendan bi-heold a-boute : and axede &yogh;wat it were, And &yogh;wat-manere men weren þare-inne : and ho þare al. om. woneden þere. Stille was þis olde man : and ne &yogh;af him none Answere. Þo cam þere gon a fair couent : and ane croyz bi-fore heom bere, With taperes in eyþur side— : Monekes it weren ech-on, A nd yreuested faire and in queor-copes : a-&yogh;ein heom huy comen gon, With procession faire i-nou&yogh;. : þe Abbod bi-hinde com, And wel faire custe seint Brendan : and bi þe hond him nom. he ladde him and is monekus : in-to a noble halle, And setten al. sette heom a-doun alle on a rewe : and wuchs heore fet alle; Of þe worie welle heore fet he wuchs : þat huy er i-sei&yogh;e. In-to þe freytore he ladde heom þo : and sette heom wel hei&yogh;e, I-medlede with heore al. his owene couent. : and þo heo weren alle i-sete, Þare cam on and seruede : and brou&yogh;te heom alle mete : And ane wel faire &yogh;wite lof : he sette bi-twene to & to, &YOGH;wite moren, ase it of herbes were : bi-fore heom he sette al-so— Swettore mete ne mi&yogh;te non beo : huy ne knewen it nou&yogh;t on; Of þe clere welle þat huy er i-sei&yogh;en : þe Monekes dronke ech-on. "beoz nouþe glade," þe Abbot seide : "and drinkez nouþe i-nov&yogh; In charite of þulke welle : þat &yogh;e wolden er with wou&yogh;— Betere it is drinke in charite : &yogh;wan it is ov i-brou&yogh;t, Þane &yogh;e it þeofliche nomen : ase &yogh;e hadden i-þou&yogh;t. Þis bred þat we eteth of : we nuten of &yogh;wan it is : An straunge man eche daye it bringuth : In-to ovre celere, i-wis, We nutez nou&yogh;t bote ope godes grace : wanne it is ibrou&yogh;t— For ho-so trust to ihesu crist : him ne schal failly nou&yogh;t.
