We beoz foure-ant-twenti freres : and &yogh;wane we beoz i-sete, twelf &yogh;wite Miches al. suche loues men brynguth us : eche daye to ore mete; Ate feste of eche hali-daye; and &yogh;wan it sonen-day is, Foure-and-twenti loues us comieth : so þat euer e ch man hath his; Þat euerech frere of þat him leuez : witiez to is soper. I-doublet it worth nouþe for ov : ase &yogh;e i-seoth wel her : Al al. vor al ore couent nis nou&yogh;t here : ake muche al. muchedel it hath vn-ete. So þat ore louerd þoru&yogh; is grace : sent us alle mete. Fram seint paterikes Abbeye al. dai : & seint ailbi also : þat in yrlonde is al-so, Four-score &yogh;er we habbez i-beon here : þat no man ne cam us to; euere-eft ore louerd þoru&yogh; is grace : I-fed us hath ech-on. And þis weder is euere murie i-nou&yogh; : syknesse here nis non. And &yogh;wane we schullen ore seruise don : ore louerd sent us li&yogh;t; Ore taperes ne beoz no-þe lasse : þei huy brenne day and ny&yogh;t." heo a-risen op and wenden to churche : þo heo hadden y&yogh;ete : And twelf oþere freres heo i-metten : Inward to þe mete. "hov is þis?" quath seint Brendan : "&yogh;wy neren þeose nou&yogh;t with us?" "Leoue fader," quath þe Abbot : "nede it mot beo þus; Þer ne mouwen bote foure-and-twenti Monekes : in ore freitore beon ido, And &yogh;wane &yogh;e weren þare-inne with us : þeos ne mi&yogh;ten nou&yogh;t al-so. Þe &yogh;wile we singuth euesong : heo schullen sitte and ete, And heore euesong huy schullen syngue : &yogh;wane heo habbez i-&yogh;et[e]." Seint brendan bi-heold þat weued : him þou&yogh;te þat hit was al, weued and chaliz and Cruettes : þoru&yogh;-out cler cristal. Seue taperes weren in þe queor : for þare ne weren non mo, And foure-and-twenti segene : þat Monekes scholden to— For þare weren foure-and-twenti Monekes : and euerech hadde his; And þe Abbodes sege was : a-midde þe queor, i-wis. Seint Brendan axede þe Abbode : "do sei&yogh;e me, leue broþur, hov holde &yogh;e so silence : þat neuer on ne spekez with oþur?" "Ore louerd it wot," þe Abbot seide : "þat al. om. we habbez here i-beo Four score &yogh;er in swuche lyue : ase &yogh;e mowen here i-seo, And þare nas neuere a-mong us alle : yspeke in none wise Are þis tyme non oþur word : bote ore louerdes seruise; Ne we neren neuer-eft in feblesse : ne sike of us nou&yogh;t on." Seint brendan, þo he i-heorde þis : for Ioy&yogh;e he weop a-non. "Leoue fader," he seide : "mote we bi-leue here?" "Þov wost wel," þe Abbot seide : "&yogh;e ne mowen in none manere. Ne haueth ore louerd i-schewed ov wel : &yogh;wat &yogh;e schullen do? Come þov schalt to yrlonde i-wis : and þine twelf breþren al-so; And fram þe to þe yle of Ankres : þe þreotteoþe schal i-wende, Þe fourteoþe al quic to helle : and beon þare with-outen ende." Þo cam orig. com þare-In a fuyri Arewe : at a fenestre a-non, Ase þei heo fram heouene come : and þe taperes tende ech-on, And flev&yogh; out a-&yogh;ein ase heo cam In : bi þulke fenestre þere. Þe taperes barnden longue Inov : and no-þe lasse huy nere. "Louerd crist," quath seint brendan : "Ich wondri In mi þou&yogh;t hou&yogh; þis taperes bernez þus : and ne waniez nou&yogh;t." "Ne hastþou," quath þe Abbod : "In þe olde lawe i-founde hov Moyses say A þorn berne : fram þe toppe to þe grounde, Þe More þat þe þorn barnde : þe grenore þe leues were? Ne wenestþou nou&yogh;t þat ore louerd beo : ase mi&yogh;ti here as þere?"— Þeos Monekes weren to-gadere : for-to Midewynter was al i-do, For-to after twelfte-day : are huy departeden a-to. Anon to seint hyllaries day : seint Brendan forth i-wende With is Monekus in þe se : þoru&yogh; grace þat god heom sende. huy floten op and doun in soruwe I-nov&yogh; : þe se heom caste hei&yogh;e; Fram þulke tyme forto in leinte : no lond huy ne i-sei&yogh;e. So þat a-boute palme-sonenday : heo bi-heolden a-boute faste : heom þou&yogh;te heo i-sei&yogh;en swiþe fer : ase a cloude ate laste. Þis Monekes hadden wonder þar-of : &yogh;wat þe cloude were. "beoth stille," seide seint brendan : "&yogh;e habbez i-beon þere : Þare is ore procuratour : þat muche guod us hath i-do In [þe] foulene parays : and In þe lond of schep al-so." So þat heore schip ate laste : to þat yle drou&yogh;— A-schereþores-day huy comen þudere : in gret trauaile inou&yogh;. Þis procuratour heom cam a&yogh;ein : and welcomede heom a-non, Ant custe seint brendanes fet : and þe Monekes echon; And sette heom sethþe to þe soper : for þe day it wolde so, And sethþe he wuchs hore fet alle : þe maunde for-to do. huy heolden þare heore maunde— : and þare heo gounnen bi-leue A-gode friday al þe longue day : for-to an ester eue. An ester eue heore procuratour : bad heom heore schip take And heore resurrection : opon þe fisches rugge make, And aftur heore resurrection : he bad heom euene teo to þe foulene parays : ase heo hadden er i-beo. Þis holie men wenden forth : and ore louerdes grace nome, Þat al. so þat to þis grete fischse : þulke daye huy come, Þat houede ase it were a lond. : heore caudron heo founden þere Ase heo it bi-leften opon is rugge : in þat oþere &yogh;ere. Louerd crist, þat swch a best : scholde houi so stille And soffri men op-on him gon : and don al heore wille! Þis Monekes op-on þe fisches rugge : bi-leften al þe ny&yogh;t, And songuen matynes and euesong : and sethþe, þo it was li&yogh;t, Op-on is rugge huy sounguen : heore massene echon; MS. echone And euere MS. eueuere houede þis muche fichs : stille so eny ston. Þo heore resurrection was : with gret honour i-do And þis Monekus hadden i-songue : heore Massene al-so, A-boute onderne of þe daye : to þe schipe huy heom nome, And to þe foulene parays : þat ilke day huy come. Þo þis foules i-sei&yogh;en heom come : huy gonne singue ech-one A&yogh;enest heom with gret melodie : ase it were for þenone. Þe foul þat spac with [heom] er : a-&yogh;ein hem orig. him sone he drou&yogh;— þe drem of is winguene murie was— : he welcomede heom faire ynou&yogh;. "&YOGH;e Au&yogh;ten," he seide, "ore louerd crist : þonky mid þe beste, Þat porueiez ou þeos four studes : to habben on ouwer reste : With ouwer guode procratour : ouwer maunde for-to do, And sethþe ouwer resurrection : ope þe fisches rugge al-so, And sethþe with us þis ei&yogh;te wokes : a-non to witsonen-day, And fram Mide-winter to candele-masse : In þe yle of Abbey. MS. Aylbey In þe se [of] Occean : in gret peril &yogh;e schullen i-wende In trauail al þat oþur tyme : for-to þe seuen &yogh;eres ende : And sethþe þat lond of bi-heste : god wole þat &yogh;e i-seon, And fourti [dawes] sethþe þar-inne : In ioy&yogh;e &yogh;e schullen beon. And to þe contreye þat &yogh;e beoz of : sethþe &yogh;e schullen i-wende With-oute trauail al aisieliche : and þare ower lif ende." Þis holi men bi-lefden þare : for-to þe trinite : heore procratour to hem cam : and al. þat was euere in plente, he brou&yogh;te heom mete and drinke i-nou&yogh; : ase he hadde er i-do, And chargede heore schip þere-with : and let heom wenden so. Þis holie men wenden forth : ase god heom wolde sende— For godes grace was with heom : þe betere huy mi&yogh;ten wenden.— Al-so huy wenden In a tyme : In strong tempeste j-nou&yogh;, Pissis mala. A gret fisch huy sei&yogh;en and grislich : after þe schipe he drou&yogh;; brenninde fom out of is mouth : after heom he caste, Þat water was herre þane heore schip : bi-fore heom at eche blaste; he cam wolchi after ase an hous : a n d porsiwede heom so faste; So al. so faste he schef with is breostene : þe Monekes weren a-gaste, And criden &yogh;eorne on seint brendan : and on ore louerd al-so. After heore schip so swyþe he schef : þat he cam al-mest þer-to. And þo he heom hadde al-mest ouer-take : [&] huy ne tolden nou&yogh;t of hore liue, An oþur fisch out of þe west : þare cam swymme bliue, he gan i-mete þis luþere fisch : and smot to him faste, Þat he for-clef is foule bouk : in þre partyes atþe laste; Þat ilke al. & þane wey þat he cam er : wel euene a-&yogh;ein he drou&yogh;. Þis monekes þonkeden iesu crist : and weren [gladde] added later; al. ioyful ynou&yogh;.— Longue al. So longe wenden þis gode men : in þe se forth so, Þat huy weren of-hongred sore : and heore mete was al i-do. Auis paradisi. Þo cam þare fleo a luytel foul : and brou&yogh;te a gret bou&yogh; Fol of grapus swyþe rede : and euene to heom he drou&yogh;. A v. om.: þis grapes he tok s. brendan : þis gode man som|del lou&yogh;. Þare-bi heo liueden fourtene ni&yogh;t : and hadden mete i-nou&yogh;. Þo þis grapes weren i-don alle : of-hongrede huy weren sore : bi þone side huy i-sei&yogh;en an yle : and mete þar-inne more. Þe yle was ful of faire treon : and so ful was euerech bou&yogh; Of swuche grapes ase huy hadden er : þat on þe grounde it drou&yogh;. Seint brendan wende op of þis schip : þe grapes he nam faste And bar into þe schipe, to libbe þer-bi : þat fourti dawes it al. i-laste laste.— Sone þare cam a gryp fleoinde : after heom in þe se And a-saillede heom in heore schip : and fondede heom to sle. Þis Monekes criden deolfolliche : and tolden luyte of heore lyue. Þo isei&yogh;en huy come þat luytel foul : toward hem wel bliue Þat heom al. om. in foulene parays : so ofte heom hadde irad. Þo seint brendan i-sai&yogh; him MS. heom come : he nas nou&yogh;t a luytel glad. Þis luytel [foul] added later. smot to þis gryp : and nam is dunt so hei&yogh;e And at þe furste dunte : he smot out eyþur ey&yogh;en; Sone he a-slou&yogh; þis luþere best : þat he fel doun in-to þe se— Þing þat god wole habbe i-wust : ne schal it no wi&yogh;t orig. man, al. þing sle.— Þis holie Men wenden in þe se : a-boute here and þere : In on of þe four studes : þe hey&yogh;e festes huy were. In a seint peteres day : gret feste huy maden with heore tounge And swiþe murie of seint peter : In þe se huy sounge. In a stude of þe se : so cler þe se huy founde, A-boute heo i-sei&yogh;en in eche side : clerliche to þe grounde : heom þou&yogh;te þe ground was on eche half al. iheled was : with fisch al on hepe. Þis Monekes beden seint brendan : þat he softe speke, So þat he ne a-wei&yogh;te nou&yogh;t þe fisches : laste huy heore schip breke. Alle þe fisches lei&yogh;en stille : ase þei heo weren a-slepe. This v. follows after 448 in the other MSS. "beo &yogh;e a-ferde?" quath seint brendan : "&yogh;warof beo &yogh;e a-drad? Opon þe maisteres rugge of alle fisches : &yogh;e habbez i-beon wel glad And fuyr i-maked op-on is rugge : and doth fram &yogh;ere to &yogh;ere!" Þis holie Man þe luddere song : for þes ones al. þen one ase þei it were. Þe fisches sturten op with þis song : ase þei huy a-woken a-slepe, And comen a-boute þis monekes : alle to one hepe; So þicke huy floten bi eche side : no water man ne i-sei&yogh;, MS. sa&dotb; e i&yogh; And bi-setten þat schip al-a-boute : Ake no water al. ac hi ne cam þare nei&yogh;. So þicke huy weren a-boute þis schip : And euere syweden it so, Þe &yogh;wyle brendan is Masse song : for-to heo was al ido; And þo þe Masse was al MS. all ido : ech fisch wende in is ende— Muche &yogh;wounder man may i-seo : þat wide wole i-wende.— Þe wynd was boþe strong and stif : and drof heore schip so faste; Al-so feor ase heo mi&yogh;ten seue-ny&yogh;t wenden : þat clere water i-laste, þat heo isei&yogh;en in þe se : ase clerliche ase huy mi&yogh;ten a-londe— gret wonder hadden þis gode Men : and þonkeden godes sonde. Þo cam sone a souþerne wynd : and northþe-ward drof heom faste; Ri&yogh;t euene with heom he was : and ei&yogh;te dawes he laste. Þo i-sei&yogh;en huy feor in þe north : a lond deork i-nou&yogh;, Smoke stynkinde foule al. smokie as it smythes were : and þuder-ward heore schip drou&yogh;. Þo i-heorden heo gret blowynge : of manie beolies þere And gret betynge and noyse i-nou&yogh; : þondre ase þei it were. þo was brendan sori j-nou&yogh; : and blessede him wel faste. Þo cam þare out a luþer wy&yogh;t : ful Atelich ate laste, Þoru-out swart and brenninde— : ope heom is ei&yogh;ene he caste And tornede him anon a-&yogh;en— : þis Monekes weren a-gaste. Þat luþere wi&yogh;t &yogh;af a cri : þat Men mi&yogh;ten i-heore him wide. Þo come þare out swuch e schrewes mo : þicke on eche side, With tongen orig. tongene and with hameres : brenninde mani on; Op-on þe watere heo ornen faste al. To þe brimme h. o. of þe se : After þat schip ech-on. þo huy ne mi&yogh;ten þare-nei&yogh; come : huy gounnen to &yogh;eolle faste, heore hameres al brenninde : after þis men huy casten, Þat men ne mi&yogh;ten no-þing bote fuyr : noþer iseo ne huyre; MS. he&dotb; u o&dotb; y re Þe se was brenninde al-a-brod : ase þei heo were a-fuyre. euer-ech caste is owel op oþur : and some huy þrewen an hei&yogh;, huy þrewen alle a-boute þat schip : ake non ne cam þare-nei&yogh;. Ate laste heo torneden alle a&yogh;ein : þo huy ne spedden nou&yogh;t þere, And al þat lond þou&yogh;te of heom : a-fuyre ase þei it were, And al þe se þare a-boute : barnde and smokede faste— Strong was þe stunch and þe smoke : and longe, i-wis, it laste. Þo þe smoke al. monekes was sum-del feor : þat heo ne isei&yogh;en non more, &YOGH;eot heo i-heorden heore &yogh;eollinge : þe þeoues weopen sore. "hou þinchez ou," quath brendan : "was þis a murie pas? We nellez non-more come þare-nei&yogh;— : þat on ende of helle it was, And þe feondes hopeden suyþe wel : habbe i-haued a wel god cas; Ake i-hered beo swete ihesu crist : huy casten Aumbes as!"— Þe souþerne wind laste &yogh;uyt : and &yogh;uyt drof heom forth. So þat huy i-sei&yogh;en ane hul : wel feor in þe north, glowinde and brenninde smoke : gret stunch so was þere; Þe lei&yogh;e stod op an hei&yogh; : ase þei it a wal were; &YOGH;if þare was muche in þat oþur stude : þare was &yogh;eot wel more. On of þe monekes þo bi-gan : to weope and &yogh;eollen sore : For is tyme was þo i-come : he ne mi&yogh;te no leng bi-leue. he hupte out of þat schip : and amidde þe se he gan weue And orn faste op-on þe watere : to-ward þat ilke fuyre. he cride &yogh;eorne and &yogh;al deolfulliche : þat gret deol it was to huyre; "Alas," he seide, "mi wrechche lijf! : for nou i seo min ende. In ioye ich habbe with ou i-beo : ake i-ne may nou&yogh;t a&yogh;en wende. A-corsed beo þat me bar : and þe tyme þat ich was i-bore, And þe fader þat me bi-&yogh;at! : for ich am nouþe for-lore." Þe feondes comen him a-&yogh;ein : and nomen þat wrechche faste And defouleden him stronge Inou&yogh; : and a-midde þe fuyre him caste. Þo fond he soth þat seint brendan : seide, þo he out wende : him failede grace, hou-so it was : his sunnes for-to a-mende.— So faste barnde þe Montayne : þat no-þing huy ne i-sei&yogh;e, Þe &yogh;uyt heo weren feor þare-fram : no-þing bote ley&yogh;e. Þo tornede þe wynd in-to þe North : and drof heom south-ward faste, In þulke side stronge Inou&yogh; : þat seuen-Ni&yogh;t fulle he laste. So longe huy wenden euene south : þat huy i-sei&yogh;en at þen ende Judas. One harde roche In þe se : and þe se þare-ouer wende; Þare-ouer þe se caste i-lome : and ofte he was bar. Ant þo heo comen þe roche nei&yogh; : of a gost heo weren i-war : heo i-sei&yogh;e on-ouewarde þe roche sitte : &yogh;wane þe se with-drou&yogh;, A wrechche gost, naked and bar : in stronge meseise j-nou&yogh;; A-boue him was a cloth i-tild al. teid : with tweie tonguene faste, to is chin tilde þe neoþer ende— : þe wynd it wide caste, Þat euere &yogh;wane þat water him with-drou&yogh; : þat cloth, þat heng hei&yogh;e, beot him, al. om. ase þe wynd him blev&yogh; : þat wrechche gost al. om. in þen ei&yogh;e; Þe wawes of þe se beoten also : bi-fore and bi-hynde— A &yogh;eomerore gost þane he was : ne mi&yogh;te no man finde. Seint Brendan him bad a-godes name : telle &yogh;wat he were And &yogh;wat he hadde ore louerd mis-don : and &yogh;wi he sete þere. "Ich am," he seide, "a deolful gost : ich hote wrechche Iudas, Þat ore louerd for panewes solde : and on eorþe with him was. Þis nis nou&yogh;t mi ri&yogh;te stude : ake ore louerd doth me grace to habben mi parays : here in þis place, For no guodnesse þat ich dude : bote ore louerdes ore. I-ne habbe nou&yogh;t so muche pine : þat ich nere wurþe more. For in þe brennynde hulle : þat ech of eov i-sai&yogh;, Mi ri&yogh;te is to brennen Inne : boþe ny&yogh;t and day&yogh;; Þare ich was þis &yogh;eondere dai&yogh; : þo ower broþer þudere cam And was into pine i-lad : and þare hadde is dom. Þare-fore helle was so glad orig. gled : and makede so grete lei&yogh;e, For þat he was þudere i-come : and so nei&yogh; him al. þat &yogh;e so ver i-sei&yogh;e— So huy doz &yogh;wane ani soule : is formest þudere i-come. Þoru&yogh; godes hei&yogh;e milce : þare-fram ich am i-nome : For here ich am euer-ech sonenday : and fram saterday&yogh;es eue For-to euen-song tyme þane sonenday : here i schal bi-leue; Ant at Midewinter al-so : for-to twelfte-dai beo ido, Ant fram þe bi-guynninge of estur : þat &yogh;wit-sonenday come, al-so, Ant al-so at ore lauedi festes— : so ful of milce heo is; Ake alle oþure tymene : In helle ich am, i-wis, With pilatus. ant with heoroudus : and al-so with al. Anne and cayphas— A-corsed beo þe tyme : þat ich i-boren was! Ich bidde þe for þe loue of god : fonde on alle wise For-to bi-leuen al. þat ich bileue here al þis al. ni&yogh;t : þat þe sonne a-rise, And þat &yogh;e wyten me fram þe feondes : þat sone comieth aftur me." Seint Brendan seide, "þoru&yogh; godes grace : we schullen schilde þe. tel me nouþe &yogh;wat is þat cloth : þat so hei&yogh;e hanguth her orig. here ." "Þo ich was on eorþe : and godes panewes ber, Þis cloth ich &yogh;af a musel : and min owene it nas nou&yogh;t, For it was with ore louerdes panes : ant mine felawes i-bou&yogh;t. Ant for ich it &yogh;af for godes loue : nouþe it is me bi-fore— So luyte ne schal man for him do : þat schulle beo i-lore. For it was of oþur mannes : ase ich me under-stod, Þei it hangy bi-fore me : it doth me more harm þane guod : In mine ei&yogh;ene it bat sore : ant doth hem harm i-nou&yogh;."— Man mai i-seo &yogh;wuch it is : to &yogh;yuen oþur mannes þing with wou&yogh;; As wollez manie of þis riche men : with onri&yogh;te al day take Of pouere men here ant þer : and almesse þar-of make. Þat heo doth for godes loue : ne schal nou&yogh;t beo for-&yogh;ite, Ake to pine it heom turne schal : ant þat huy schullen i-wite!— "Þe tonguene al-so," quath Iudas : "þat &yogh;e so hei&yogh;e i-seoth, tweye preostes ich &yogh;af on eorþe : and þare-fore here heo beoth— For man schal clanliche ech þing finde : þat he doth for is loue. Þe ston þat ich op-on sitte : and makez me sitte a-boue, In one wei&yogh;e ich hyne fond : þare non neode nas no ston : In a fenni dich ich it caste : þat men mi&yogh;ten þare-ouer gon. Fewe goddedes ich haue i-don : of &yogh;wan ich nouþe may telle; Nis non so luyte þat man ne may fynde : in heuene oþur in helle." Þo it was .eue. þe sonenday : þe feondes comen blaste, For-to leden to helle þat sori gost— : huy weopen ant &yogh;ollen faste. "Wend heonne," heo seiden, "þou gode al. godes man : þou nast nou&yogh;t here to done; Lat us habbe ore felawe : ant to helle leden him sone : For we ne dorren ore mayster i-seo : are we him MS. him him habben i-brou&yogh;t. Þou wend fram him, for it is tyme : and ne lete us nou&yogh;t!" "Ich ne lette ov nou&yogh;t," quath seint brendan : "to don ouwer mester, Ake doth ore louerd iesu crist : þat is of more pouwer." "hou darst þou," þe feon[des] seide : "bi-fore him nemme is name? Ne bi-trayde he him and solde him al-so : to deþe with grete schame?" Seint Brendan seide, "in his name : ich hote ov, ase ich may, Þat &yogh;e ne derien him to-ny&yogh;t : are to-morewe þat hit beo day." Reuliche þe feondes &yogh;ollen þo : ant hamward gonne fleo. Iudas þonkede reufolliche : þat it was deol to seo. A-morewe, a-non so þat it was day : þe feondes comen blaste. Grysliche heo &yogh;ollen ant weopen : ant gonnen to chide faste. "A-wey," huy seiden, "gode man! : a-corsed beo þe stounde Þat þou come here us so nei&yogh; : and þat we þe here founde : Ore Maister us haueth i-pyned : bitterliche al þis ny&yogh;t Ant swyþe strongue, for we ne brou&yogh;ten : with us þis sorie wi&yogh;t. Ake we wollez þeos six dawes : doubli al is wo And so we wollez a-wreken us : for on him-sulf it schal go!" Þat wrechche gost quakede þo : þat reuþe it was to seo oþur telle. Þe fendes nomen þo þis gost : ant ladden in-to helle; Ant seint Brendan hem for-bed : In ore louerdes name Þat heo ne scholden for þat ny&yogh;t : don him þe more schame.— Seint Brendan and is Monekus : In þe se forth wende Þre dawes euene south : ase ore louerd hem grace al. om. sende. Þe feorþe dai heo i-sei&yogh;en ane yle : albi souþe an hei&yogh;. Seint Brendan si&yogh;te sore : þo he þat [yle] i-sei&yogh;. "Powel þe heremite : is in þe yle þat ich i-seo, here he haueth with-oute mete : fourti &yogh;er i-beo." Þo heo comen to þis yle : heo wenden in ech-on. Þis heremite, þat was so old man : a-&yogh;ein hem cam a-non. his her tilde doun to is fet : of berde and of heued, and helede is bodi al-a-boute— : ri&yogh;t nou&yogh;t þare nas bar bi-leued; None oþur cloþes nadde he on : is limes weren al hore. Brendan stod and bi-heold : and weop swiþe sore, A v. om.: Alas, he sede, ichabbe so &yogh;are: in stude of monek ibe, "And nouþe In liue of Aungele : ane man ich i-seo." "beo stille," quath þe hermite : "for god doth wel bi þe; For he schewez þe more þane ani oþur : of is priuete. For a Monek liuez muche : bi swunche of mannes al. is owe honde, Ant þou liuest bi godes grace : ant þoru&yogh; is owene sonde. In þe Abbeye of seint paterich : Monek ich was, i-wis And of is churche a wardein : þare is purgatorie is. A day þare cam a man to me : ich eschte him &yogh;wat he were. he seide, 'ich am þin Abbot : ne haue of me no fere.' 'Non oþur man þane seint paterik : min Abbot nis,' ich sede. 'Ich it am,' quath he a-&yogh;ein : 'ne haue of me no drede. to-morewe,' he seide, '&yogh;wane it is day : to þe se þou most i-wende : Al-&yogh;are þou schalt finde a schip : þat god þe wole sende; Ant do þe forth in þe se : in þine schipe wide : hit wole þe lede to þe stude : þare þou schalt a-bide.' Sone morewe ich oup a-ros : to don is holie bone : And þo ich cam to þe se : þat schip ich fond wel sone. Mid me ich bad r. let þat schip i-worþe : wel euene forth it wende. Þe seuenþe dai to þis yle : ore louerd me hydere sende. Þo ich was out of þat schip : þane wei a-non ich al. a&yogh;en it nam Ri&yogh;t euene þoru&yogh; godes grace : so þat ich al. ri&yogh;t as it hidere cam. Elinge ich &yogh;eode here al one : confort nad-ich non : So þat on is hindore fet : An .Otur. þare cam gon, Bi-twene is forþere fet he brou&yogh;te : a fuyr-Ire ant a ston, Þare-with to smite me fuyr : and fisch he brou&yogh;te sethþe guod won. Þis [otur] wende sone a-&yogh;ein. : ich makede me fuyr faste Ant seth me fisch a-godes name— : þre dayes it i-laste. So þat euere þene þridde day : þis .Otur. to me drou&yogh; And brou&yogh;te me mete, þat ich hadde : þre dawes þar-on i-nou&yogh;. Watur of þis harde stone : þoru&yogh; ore louerdes sonde Þare sprong out of eche daye al. ech sonedai : to drinke and wasche min honde. Þis welle bi-gan furst hire to schewen : þat þou mi&yogh;t i-seo, here al. þo ich hadde MS. habbe þritti winter : In swuche liue i-beo; both vv. are transp. in other MS. bi þis welle ich habbe I-leoued : fourti &yogh;er and on, And fifti &yogh;er ich was old : are ich gan hidere gon; So þat of an hondred &yogh;er : and twenti &yogh;er þare-to Ich am nouþe bi þis time— : ore louerd is wille bi me do. And mi deth ich a-bide here : &yogh;wane god it wole sende, &YOGH;wanne mi louerd wole þat ich come to him : and of þis world i-wende. Ake nim with þe of þis watur : þat þou hast neode to, And wiend þe forth in þe se : for þi wei nis nou&yogh;t al i-do. For þou schalt &yogh;eot in þe se : fourti dawes fare, And þanne þou schalt þine Ester holde : ase þou hast i-don are, And fram þanne þou schalt wiende forth : to þe londe of bi-heste And þare þou schalt fourti dawes : bi-leuen atþe leste, And to þin owene londe a&yogh;ein : þou schalt wiende so." Þis guode men with deol i-nou&yogh; : þus de-parteden a-two.— Þis holie men wenden hem forth : in tempeste al. in þe se wel faste, Fourti dawes euene south : þe &yogh;wile þat leinte i-laste. to heore guode procratour : an ester eue huy come. With heom he made ioie i-nou&yogh; : ase he dude er i-lome. he ladde heom to þis grete fisch. : þudere huy comen an eue; Þe Ester ni&yogh;t for-to a-moruwe : þare huy gounne bi-leue; Þare huy songuen heore matynes : and heore masse al-so. Þe fisch bi-gan to meouen him : þo þe masse was al i-do, And bar þis Monekes forth with him : And swam swiþe faste In þe se wel stuyrneliche— : þe monekes weren a-gaste. A wonder þing it was to seo : ho-so it hadde i-sei&yogh;e, A so gret best a-boute wiende : ase it were a gret contreie! Ri&yogh;t to foulene parais : þis monekes he ladde ech-on, And sette heom up hole and sounde : and wende a-&yogh;ein a-non. Þis monekes, þo huy þudere comen : wel glade and bliþe huy were. For-to aftur þe trinite : huy bi-lefden þere. For heore guode procuratour : þulke tyme brou&yogh;te heom mete and drink i-nou&yogh;, Ase he hadde er ido— : into heore schip he it drou&yogh;, And al-so he wende forth with heom : &yogh;wodere-so god heom sende. Ri&yogh;t euene towar d þe est : fourti dayes huy wende. Þo þe fourti dai&yogh;es weren a-gon : hit gan to hauli faste; A wel deork mijst þare com al-so : þat swiþe longue i-laste. "beoth glade," seide þis procuratour : "and makiez grete feste, For ichot wel þat &yogh;e beoth : in al. nei þe londe of bi-heste." Þo huy comen out of þis Mijst : and mi&yogh;ten a-boute i-seo, In al. vnder þe faireste lond huy weren : þat euere mi&yogh;te beo. So cler and so li&yogh;t it was : þat Ioye þare was I-nou&yogh;; Treon þare weren fulle of fruyt : wel þicke euer-ech bou&yogh;. Þicke it was i-set wit h treon : þe treon wel faire were, al. & þe treon þicke bere Þe Applene weren ripe inou&yogh; : ri&yogh;t ase it heruest were. Fourti dawes in þis londe : a-boute huy gounne i-wiende, In none half huy ne mi&yogh;ten finde : of þis lond non ende. hit was euere-more day : heom þou&yogh;te, and neuere-more ny&yogh;t, huy ne founden in none stude : neuere so muche li&yogh;t; Þe eyr was euere in o stat : naþur to hot ne to cold— &YOGH;wat [ioie] huy þere founden : ne may neuere beon i-told. So þat huy comen to a fair watur. : huy nolden nou&yogh;t ouer i-wiende. A v. om.: Ac ouer hi mi&yogh;te þe lond ise : vair wiþ-outen ende. Þo cam to heom a &yogh;onglich man : swiþe fair and hiende, Fairore ne mi&yogh;te neuere non beo : ase god him gan þare MS. þure siende. he wel-comede euerech bi is name : and custe heom ech-on, Faire he honourede seint Brendan : and on is hond him nam a-non. "Lo," he seide, "here þe lond : þat &yogh;e habbez i-sou&yogh;t so wide. For ore louerd nele nou&yogh;t : þat &yogh;e here-Inne longue þus a-bide, Ake &yogh;e schullen in þe se : is priuetez i-seo, These vv. are corrupt. Chargiez ower schip with of þis fruyt : for &yogh;e ne mouwen no leng here beo." to seint Brendan he seide And spak : þis &yogh;ounge man fair and hende : This v. al. om. "Þou most to þin owene lond : a-&yogh;einward a-non i-wiende : For þou schalt sone out of þis world : þi lijf is nei&yogh; atþende. Þis watur þat &yogh;e here i-seoth : delez þis world a-two; Þeos half ou þinchez fair i-nov&yogh; : and bi-&yogh;eonde half al-so. &YOGH;e ne mouwen nou&yogh;t comen a-&yogh;end MS. &yogh;ende half : for it is nis nou&yogh;t ri&yogh;t. Ake þis fruyt is euere i-liche ripe : and þis lond i-liche bri&yogh;t. And &yogh;wane ore louerd eche-manere men : to him haueth i-drawe And &yogh;wane alle-manere men knowez him : and vnder-stondez is lawe, Þat lond he wole þanne schewe : toward þe worldes ende heom þat beth to him i-core : are huy heonnes i-wiende." Seint Brendan a[n]d is Monekes : of þis fruy t token faste, And of preciouse stones al-so : and into hore schipe it caste; And faire and wel heore leue nomen : þo al þis was i-do, And with wop and sor and deol i-nov : departeden a-two; And wenden hamward in þe se : ase ore louerd heom sende. Wel sonere, ich wot, hom huy come : þane huy outward wende. heore breþren, þo huy comen hom : Ioyfule weren i-nou&yogh;. Seint Brendan, þe holie man : sone to deþe drou&yogh;— For neueref[t] aftur þulke tyme : of þe world he ne rou&yogh;te, Bote as a man of an oþur worlde : and ase he were in þou&yogh;te— And deide sone in yrlaunde : aftur þulke stounde. Mani fair miracle men habbez sethþe : for him þare i-founde; And a fair Abbeie þare is a-re[r]d : ase is bodi was i-do. God bringue us to þulke Ioye : þat is soule wende to. AmeN. 27.1: SEynt Nicholas þe holie Man : þat guod confessour was, Of hei&yogh;e men he was i-come : In þe cite of patras : For in patras he was i-bore— : nelle ich þar-of nou&yogh;t lye; his moder name was Ione : his faderes epiphanie. Þe furste day þat he was i-bore : þat child, þat was so guod, Ase it was in ane mele i-baþed : al one upri&yogh;t it stod. Ano[n] so he was i-bore : he MS. and gan to beo guod and clene; he nolde fridai ne wodnesday : souke nou&yogh;t bote ene. Þo he couþe gon ant speke : he ne pleide neuere mo, Ake &yogh;wane oþur children rageden orig. raieden faste : to churche he wolde go; he nolde speke non ydel word : ase swuche children doth; Lei&yogh;ingue and plei&yogh;es and ragingues : he bi-lefte al-so. Þo he was sethþe of grettore elde : to scole he was i-set; So wel he leornede : þat man nuste, no child leorni bet. Sethþe þo he more al. m. wit couþe : al his studie he tok to guodespelles ant to holi writes : and alle oþere bokes for-sok. So clene lijf he ladde &yogh;ong : þat deinte it was to wite; More godnesse ne mi&yogh;te beo : þane we findeth of him i-write. Þo is fader and is moder weren dede : þis holie child Nicholas luyte tolde of heore guode : þei he heore eyr was : to pouere Men he &yogh;af it clene : &yogh;ware he sai&yogh; neode; And heo þat nolden bidde him non : stilleliche he gan hem beode.— An hei&yogh; Man þare was bi-side : þat sethþe þoru&yogh; luþer cas his guod was al-clene a-wei i-go : and al pouere bi-come he was. he hadde þre dou&yogh;tren faire i-nou&yogh; : clene and guode al-so; In so gret Meseise heo weren i-brou&yogh;t : þat heo nusten &yogh;wat to do. Þo heo nusten &yogh;ware-bi libbe— : for heore guod heom was bi-nome— heore red huy nomen alle þreo : fole wommen to bi-come And raþer þanne heo in swuche houngur weren : to libbe bi hore| MS. heore dom. Þe olde man, heor alre fader : gret deol to him he nom. gret pite hadde in is heorte : þe guode seint Nicholas, Þo he i-heorde þe deolfole mone : þat a-mong heom alle was. Of is fader guode a ny&yogh;t : ane bei&yogh; al. weg of gold he nam, I-wounde in one cloute : and stilleliche to heore house he cam, to a derne wyndouwe softeliche : seint Nicholas gan gon And caste in þat gold priueliche : and wende a-&yogh;ein a-non. Þis housebonde a-ros a-Moruwe : ant þar-of nuste nou&yogh;t : he com and fond þane bei&yogh; of gold : þat seint Nicholas hadde i-brou&yogh;t. Þar-of he was glad i-nou&yogh; : þei he nuste ho it brou&yogh;te; he it nam and þonkede Iesu crist : þat on is meseise þou&yogh;te. Þare-with he conseilede swyþe wel : his eldeste dou&yogh;ter sone With fair bruydale and gret honour : ase ri&yogh;t was for-to done. Seint Nicholas i-sai&yogh; al þis : and naþeles &yogh;uyt he þou&yogh;te Þat þis selie Man neode hadde : þat he more guod to him brou&yogh;te. A ni&yogh;t he a-waitede swyþe wel : ase ore louerd it wolde, And at one fenestre caste In eft-sone : ane oþur bei&yogh; of golde. Þis housebonde a-morewe a-ros : þat gold he fond sone; he þonkede god with guode heorte : þat hadde i-heord is bone. And natheles him wondrede muche : ho is freond so wel were, And þou&yogh;te þat he a-waiti wolde : &yogh;if he more come þere. he conseilede is oþur dou&yogh;ter : swiþe wel with þis golde, With gret nobleie and fayr bruydale : ase ore louerd it wolde. &YOGH;eot þou&yogh;te þis guode Nicholas : þo þis was al i-do, Þat it were guod to conseili : þe þridde dou&yogh;ter al-so : A ni&yogh;t he wende wel stilledliche : to þat fenestre eft-sone And caste In ane bei&yogh; of gold : ase he was i-woned to done. Þis housebonde hadde i-waked longue : for-to wayti of þis cas : So þat, þo seint Nicholas cam : wakiende he was. Op he sturte and siwede him : and bi is cloþus heold him faste, he ne let nou&yogh;t go are þe guode man : i-kneu&yogh; him al. was iknowe at þe laste. &YOGH;eorne bad seint Nicholas : þat he to no man ne sede, Þe &yogh;wyle þat he a-liue were : of þis priue dede. With þis gold þe þridde dou&yogh;ter : wel i-conseilled was; And alle þreo weren riche al. gode wiues : þoru&yogh; seint Nicholas. In þis manere seint Nicholas : ase ich nouþe habbe i-sed, Delde al is heritage : þo is fader was ded. &YOGH;wane oþur Men eoden to habbe solas : he nadde þar-to no MS. ne wille : to churche he wolde and in one huyrne : is beden bidde wel stille.— ¶ Hit bi-feol þat þe bischop : of Mirre was ded, And folk cam to cheose ane oþur : and þar-of hy nomen heore red; So þat heo weren in hore beden : ny&yogh;t and dai wel faste Þat ore louerd heom sende ane guode man. : and he herde heom ate laste. For a ny&yogh;t þare cam a voiz : ase it were in metingue, to a bischop þat was maister þer : and tolde him þis tyþingue al. of þe cheosinge And seide, "goth to-morewe to churche to ch. on the margin. sone : ri&yogh;t are hit dai beo : Þe furste man þat &yogh;e þare mouwen : i-heore oþur i-seo And þat hote Nicholas : takez him wel sone And makez him bischop of Mirre! : god hath i-heord ower bone." þe bischop and þat oþur folk : a-risen are hit dai were, And comen to churche, and founden sone : Nicholas stonde þere : In one huyrne he stod ful stille. : heo axeden &yogh;wat he was And &yogh;wat were is ri&yogh;te name. : he seide hem "Nicholas." heo nomen and ladden him with gret honour : to þe churche of Mirree And sacreden him to bischop þere : and setten him in is se. Þo he was hei&yogh; man i-maked : þis guode Nicholas, More bou&yogh;sum and milde he bi-cam : þane euer er [he] was; luyte pruyte he hadde of is power : &yogh;wane men him wolden a-loute, And &yogh;if it nere for ei&yogh;e of god : leouere him were with-oute. So prest he was to alle men : þat on him beden & cride, And so muche for heom he dude : þat men speken þar-of wide.— Muche folk In a time : In-to þe se i-wende In a schip, to don heore neode : &yogh;if ore louerd þe grace heom sende. So þat þere cam a gret tempeste : þat heo wenden alle a-drenche. Alle guodnesse heo bi-hei&yogh;ten god : þat heo mi&yogh;ten on bi-þenche. So þat heo þou&yogh;ten, ase heore schip : toward þe grounde was, On þe guodnesse þat men tolden : of þe bischop Nicholas : "Leoue louerd Nicholas" : wel loude alle heo criden, "&YOGH;if it is MS. it soth þat we habbez : i-heord tellen of þe wide, In þis peril saue us nouþe : þat we ne beon a-dreint; Louerd Nicholas, help us nouþe : are ore schip beo a-seint!" Ase heo gradden, þare cam on eorne : on-owarde þe watere bi-side A bischop in abite swiþe fair. : wel loude on him huy cride. "Lo me here," quath þis holie man : "&yogh;e cleopeden me wel faste. Seggez &yogh;wat ouwer wille beo : and &yogh;warof &yogh;e beon a-gaste!" "Louerd," heo seiden, "Nicholas : &yogh;if it is þi wille, Saue us nouþe of þis tempeste : þat we he[re] MS. he ne a-spille" "Ne habbe &yogh;e," quath þis holie man : "her-of none drede!" Þat weder bi-cam þo stille inou&yogh; : þo he þeos wordes sede. heo bi-heolden þo after him— : heo nusten &yogh;ware he was; And þonkeden muche ore swete louerd : and þene bischop Nicholas. Þene wei stille and murie : toward þe londe huy nome; With-oute eche destourbingue : to londe wel glade heo come. Alle heo duden heom fort a-non : to þe bischope Nicholas, Ase to a man þat heo neuere ne sei&yogh;en : ne nusten &yogh;wuch he was. Ech of heom bi-heolden him faste : þat to þis guode man com : Alle heom þou&yogh;te þat it was he : þat þene deth heom bi-nam. "Louerd," heo seiden, "i-hered þou beo! : to þe we gradden bliue; On-ouewarde þe se þo þou come : and brou&yogh;test us to liue. I-hered beo þe tyme þat þou most : a-mong men on eorþe beo! For swuche grace ne hadde neuere eorþelich Man : ase man may on þe i-se." Þis guode Man, þo he i-heorde þis : þonkede and herede al-so Ore louerd, þat wolde for is loue : suych miracle do.— ¶ hit bi-feol In ane oþur tyme : of þe bischop Nicholas, Þat gret hongur al-a-boute : In is bischopriche was; So luþere fullen þe &yogh;eres alle : þat no corn nou&yogh;were nas. gret deol hadde þis guode bischop : of þat luþere cas. Fram feorrene contreies al. om. þare comen schipes : with muche corn þare|bi-side : Þis bischop wende a-&yogh;ein heom sone : and bad heom one stounde a|bide, "For þe loue of Iesu crist : leneth me," he sede, "Ane hondret quarters of þat corn : þat &yogh;e þare doth lede, to þis selie men þat beoth here : nei&yogh; for houngur dede; heo ne habbeth no corn to libbe bi : to sede ne to brede." "Certes, sire," þis schipmen seiden : "þat ne dorre we nou&yogh;t : For al þis corn þat þou i-sixt : þat we habbez here i-brou&yogh;t, With swyþe schars met with-alle : bitau&yogh;t it is us echone Þat we it leden þe Aumperour— : ne dorre we make no lone." "With-oute faille," quath þis gode man : "ne dredez ou ri&yogh;t nou&yogh;t, &YOGH;if &yogh;e me wollez þar-of lene : þat eov schulle faili ou&yogh;t; Þe folle &yogh;e schulle &yogh;elden þe Aumperoure : ase men token ou for-to lede, No-þing ne schal ou failli : ne þarf ov no-þing drede." Þe schipmen ope truste of is word : wel largeliche him mete And token þe bischope wel i-metene : Ane houndred quarteres &yogh;wete; And wenden forth to þe Aumperour : and is corn him ladde; And beden is stiwardes meten wel : &yogh;if heo þe folle hadden. huy meten, and founden al þe fulle : and wel more þare-to. For wonder heo axeden þe schipmen : &yogh;wi it woxe so. heo þonkeden a-non þane gode bischop : þat is neode to heom mende, And tolden fore þe Aumperoure : hou muche corn heo him lende, And hou he bi-het heom þat it ne scholde : þare-fore ne wanie nou&yogh;t, And hou heo hadden bi large met : wel more corn i-brou&yogh;t. Þis guode bischope heo hereden swiþe : and þonkeden muche also, Þat hadde þoru ore louerdes grace : swche miracle i-do. Al þe contreie hadde i-nou&yogh; : to mete and to sede, To &yogh;er and more, of þat corn : þat heo gonne þare lede.— ¶ In an oþur tyme þis guode bischop : bi a fair treo com : he fond þare men þat duden þing : a-&yogh;ein heore cristine-dom : heo stoden þare, ase heo ofte duden : and maden heore sacrefise to þe deuel onder þis treo : þat men superscribed. mi&yogh;ten þar-of a-grise. Seint Nicholas heom tornede echone : gode men for-to be, And dude heom for-sake þe feondes lore : and hewe a-doun þat treo. Þe deuel after þulke tyme : to him hadde gret onde : For-to a-batien is pouwer : in alle manere he gan fonde.— pilegrimes weren in þe se : to seint Nicholas for-to wende, For þe guodnesse þat huy of him herden : &yogh;if god heom wolde þe grace sende. In fourme of a fair womman : þe deuel cam heom to And seide, "louerdingues, wel is eou : þat &yogh;e mouwen ouwer wille do For-to seche þis holie man : þat so milsful is and hende! Leouere ich hadde þane ani-þing : mi&yogh;te ich with ou wende : For ich ne wilni no-þing so muche : ase þane holie man to seo. A luyte þing &yogh;e moten for me don : &yogh;wane it ne may oþur beo : Nimeth here þis guode oygnement : þat deorewurþe is with-alle, And &yogh;wane &yogh;e into is churche comiet : smeorieth in eche walle, For-to wurthschipien þane guode man : þat is of so gret pouste; And &yogh;wane ich ne mai to him come : doth þat In þe muynde of me!" Þis pilegrimes with glade heorte : þis oynement to heom nome, to smerien with þis holie churche : &yogh;wane heo þudere come. Ase he wenden forth in þe se : sone it dude bi-falle Þat þare cam to heom a schip : with faire men with-alle; A bischop þare was a-mong heom : swiþe fair man and hende. he grette heom faire and axede a-non : &yogh;wodere heo þou&yogh;ten wende. heo seiden þat heo wolden : &yogh;if it godes wille were, to þe churche of Mirree : for-to Anouri seint Nicholas þere. "&YOGH;wat was þe womman," þe bischop seide : "þat &yogh;wile er eou cam to, And &yogh;wat was it þat heo eou bi-tei&yogh;te? : &yogh;wat schulle &yogh;e þare-with do?" "Sire, it is an oynement" : þeos pilegrimes seden, "Þe guode womman &yogh;eorne us bad : to þe holie churche it lede And þare-with in muynde of hire : &yogh;wane it were þudere i-brou&yogh;t, Smeorie þe holie churche wowes— : þat we ne leten it nou&yogh;t!" "&YOGH;e, &yogh;e," quath þis holie man : "&yogh;e nuten nou&yogh;t &yogh;wat heo is. takez me þat oynement : and &yogh;e schullen i-seo, i-wis." Þis guode man nam þat oynement : and a-midde þe se it caste. Þat watur bi-gan to berne a-non : a-&yogh;ein is kuynde, wel faste; Fram stude to stude þat fuyr orn : and barnde þe se, i-wis. Þo seide þe guode man, "here &yogh;e iseoth : &yogh;wat ouwer oynement is. hadde &yogh;e ani-þing þarof : on þe churche-walles i-do, Al þe churche hadde for-barnd : and al þe toun al-so. hit was þe foule feond of helle : þat it ou tok with honde For-to brenne þulke churche : for he haueth þar-to onde." Forth wende þis bischop and alle his : anon-ri&yogh;t þoru&yogh; godes sonde. Þe pilegrimes roweden orig. rewe þene nexte wey : so þat huy comen to londe. to seint Nicholas heo wenden þo : þat heo so wide sou&yogh;te. A-non so heo i-sei&yogh;en þis guode man : heo stoden in grete þou&yogh;te; heom þou&yogh;te þat it þe bischop was : þat in þe se to heom cam, Þat sche w ude hem þat oynement : and þe feondes swykedam. "Louerd," heo seiden, "nov þin ore! : muche is þi pouwer : Þat we i-sei&yogh;en in þe se : are we comen her." heo hereden muche þene holie man : as it wel ri&yogh;t was. Þe guode man faste heom for-bed : þat heo ne tolden nou&yogh;t þis cas. Fairore Miracle on eorþe : ne mi&yogh;te we neuere i-wite Þane we of seint Nicholas : findeth ofte i-write!— In a tyme luþere men weorreden : þene Aumperour of rome And destruyden is londes faste : and bataille a-&yogh;ein him nome. Þe Aumperour nam þre grete louerdingues : and oþere wel mani on, For-to wenden, I-armede swyþe wel : to fi&yogh;ten a-&yogh;ein is fon. Þis þreo princes with heore men : in þe se forth i-wenden, to fi&yogh;ten a-&yogh;ein is wyþerwynes : ase þe Aumperour heom sende. So þat þe wynd heom drof : ase it were bi cas, to þe contreie of Mirree : þare þis bischop was. Þe bischop heorde of hem telle. : a&yogh;en heom he wende sone, And bad heom come and ete with him : and huy graunteden is bone. Þis [þe] om. guode man dude for heo ne scholden : none robberie do. he made hem suyþe wel an ayse : and fair semblaunt al-so; So þat þoru&yogh; þis holie bischop : heo and heore fon With-oute dunt oþur blod i-sched : a-corded orig. acordet weren a-non, Al-to þe Aumperores guode : ant to his honour al-so. Þeos þre maistres wenden hamward : þo þis dede was i-do. heo comen and tolden þe Aumperour : hov heo hadden on i-take. Þe Aumperour was wel a-payd : and gret feste gan heom make. heore luþere felawes comen sone : and þare-to hadden envie, And seiden heo hadden þe Aumperoure : i-don gret tricherie And with is fon imaked a fol pays : and with grete feolonie, to þe deseritisun of þe Aumperour : ope heom heo gunne lye. Þe Aumperour in grete wrathþe : let heom nime faste And binden þeos þre princes : and in strongue prisone caste. So faste weren þis luþere men : ope þis princes þreo Þat þe Aumperour swor is oth : A-slawe heo scholden beo. he let somony is kny&yogh;tes alle : þat heo a-morewe come For-to bringuen þeos þreo princes : to deþe þoru&yogh; heore al. his dome. A-non so þe tiþingue was i-brou&yogh;t : to þis princes al. prisons þreo, heo weopen and criden deolfulliche : þat reuþe it was to se, heo weopen and heore cloþes teren : and heore her al-so; And þou&yogh;ten on þe grete godnesse : þat seint Nicholas hadde i-do. vv. 241-2 al. om. "Louerd," heo seiden, "Nicholas : fro &yogh;wam wel glade we eode, And also wis ase we gultelese beoth : help us in ore neode, Ne lat us neuere þus gulte-lese : to deþe beon i-brou&yogh;t!" Þe holie bischop Nicholas : ne fur-&yogh;at heom nou&yogh;t : vv. 245-6 al. om. For a ny&yogh;t, ase þe Aumperour : ase a louerd lay and ase a sire, In-to is paleis, þat was so strong : and i-barred al with ire, to him ri&yogh;t bi-fore his bed : þis holi bischop com, orig. ca o m And seide, "sire Aumperour, &yogh;wat þencst þou : with þi false dom? &YOGH;wi hast þou þis gultelese men : In þi prisone i-brou&yogh;t And gulteles þenchest heom a-quelle? : ich rede, with-drau&yogh; þi þou&yogh;t! A-ris op sone, ich rede þe : and lat heom of prisone wende, Oþur ichulle mine louerd bidde : þat he þe weorre sende, al. schal þe schende Þat þare-inne þou worst al-to-boned : and i-brou&yogh;t of lijf-dawe, Þat foules schullen and wilde bestes : þi caroyne al-to-drawe." vv. 255-6 al. om "&YOGH;wat artov," quath þe Aumperour : "oþur of &yogh;wat pouste, Þat in þis tyme art i-come : in-to mi paleys to me And swuche bolde wordes spext? : wonder me þinchez of þe!" "Ich am," quath þis Nicholas : "bischop of mirree." ¶ Seint Nicholas wende al-so : to þe Aumperoures hei&yogh;e Iustise, Þare he lai bi-side in þe paleys : and made him sum-del a-grise : "Þov witlese wrechche," he seide : "&yogh;wat hauestou i-þou&yogh;t? Rastov þat þis gultelese men : to deþe beon i-brou&yogh;t? With-drau&yogh; þi red, ich þe rede, sone : oþur þou schalt al for-dwyne And for-leose al þi guod : and dey&yogh;e in strongue pine." "&YOGH;wat artou," þis oþur seide : "þat spext wordes þus grete And þe Aumperores hei&yogh;e Iustise : þus baldeliche darst þrete?" "Ich am," he seide, "Nicholas : bischop of Mirree. bote þou with-drawe þi red sone : þou schalt i-leue me." Þe Aumperour lai and quakede sore : and sende after is Iustise, Þat was al-so sore a-drad : and soruful in eche wise. Eyþur tolde oþur fore : hou he to heom seide And wel baldeliche þretnede heom. : &yogh;ware-fore heo weren in drede. For-to schilden heom fram is wrathþe : an-oþur heo mosten rede : Þis þre prisones heo leten up nime : and sone bi-fore heom lede. Swiþe sore heo weren a-dradde : for heo wenden a-non beo dede; To þe bischop Nicholas : reuliche heo gonne grede. "beaus amis," quath þe Aumperour : "&yogh;wat-manere men beo &yogh;e, Þat þus þoru&yogh; ouwer enchauntement : a-ni&yogh;t drechcheth al. derieþ me?" "A, sire, merci," þis oþure seide : "&yogh;wi wolle &yogh;e seggen so? Of anchauntement ne couþe we neuere : ope god we wollez us do. Ake gultelese men we buth : with onri&yogh;te hidere i-brou&yogh;t; Al-so wis god schilde us fram þe deth : ase we ne beth gultie nou&yogh;t." "I-knowe &yogh;e ani Man," quath þe Aumperour : "þat hote Nicholas?" Þare nas neuere on, for þis word : þat in gre[t] hope ne was! heore hondene heo heolden op on hei&yogh; : and wel loude gradden to þe bischope MS. bi bischope Nicholas : þat he reuþe of heom hadde. "Þoru&yogh; him," quath þe Aumperour : "&yogh;e beth to liue i-do, Ich ou &yogh;iue lijf and lime : and ouwer chateles al-so. goth nouþe hasteliche to him : and tellez him wel bliue hou þat for þe loue of him : ich let ov gon a-liue; biddeth þat he for-&yogh;iue me is wrathþe : and non harm for eu me do, Ake þat he bidde god for me : and for mi kynedom al-so." vv. 293-4 al. om. Þis prisones wenden with glade heorte : to þe bischope Nicholas, And þonkeden him, ase heo au&yogh;ten wel : of þis Ioyfule cas. Ich wene, þere nas neuere haluwe : seint Nicholases i-per, Þat so manie faire Miracles : bi is liue dude her; For to come into so strong paleis : and gon op-on þe se al-so, gret wonder was þat ani-bodi : swuch miracle mi&yogh;te do! Muche of þe kuynde of heuene : ore louerd here him sende, Aungles dede a-liue to do : are he hennes i-wende. vv. 297-302 al. om. — Þo ore louerdes wille was : þat he scholde hennes w i ende, he bad ore louerd þat he scholde : aungles to him sende. Þo he i-say þe Aungles to him come : he þonkede ore louerd faste. Þe þrittiþe saume of þe sauter : he bi-gan þus ate laste "In þe, louerd, ich habbe i-hoped : þat ich i-confundet ne beo, Þine holie ere bei&yogh; a-doun to me : hei&yogh;e and deliuere me." he deide ate sixte vers : þat on e[n]glichs to seggen is "Mine soule, louerd, ich bi-take þe : þou bou&yogh;test hire, i-wis." Þe soule out wende with þulke worde : and þe Aungeles forth hire bere; Alle þe felaweschipes of heuene : wel glade þere-with were. he deide þre houndret &yogh;er : and in þe þreo and fourtyþe &yogh;ere After þat god was i-bore : as þe bok us deth lere. In one toumbe of Marbre he was i-leid : swyþe faire with-alle. Out of þe harde Marbre-ston : þe oyle gan out walle; A welle of eoyle þare sprong out : ri&yogh;t at is heued a-non, And at is fet a welle of water : of þe harde Marbre-ston. vv. 317-8 al. om. Sike men þare gonnen sone : wel þicke þudere gon. Þar-of men beren wide a-boute : and &yogh;eot men doth al-so; gret botningue þar is &yogh;uyt : of men þat comieth þare-to— For þe welle of eoyle and of watur : ase manie men i-seoth, In þe harde ston lastez &yogh;eot : þare is holie bones beoth.— Many fair Miracle þare om. þare hath of him : sethþe he deide, i-come. Þei we ne mouwen nou&yogh;t tellen alle : we moten tellen of some. vv. 320-5 al. om. — ¶ To a gyv at one tyme : a cristine man &yogh;eode For-to borewi gold of him : to is muchele neode. he ne mi&yogh;te finden him nanne boru&yogh; : ne wed nadde he non : Þane gyv to seint Nicholas churche : he bad with him gon; Op-on seint Nicholases auter he swor : at one certeyne daye, So god him helpe and seint Nicholas : his gold him for-to paye. Þis giv for seint Nicholas loue : his oth nou&yogh;t ne for-sok, Ake seint Nicholas to borewe he nam : and þat gold him bi-tok. Þis luþere cristine man : þo it cam to is daye, Þat gold nolde he &yogh;elde nou&yogh;t : ake þou&yogh;te þane giv bi-traye. Þe giv cam and axede him : &yogh;wanne he it &yogh;elde wolde. "Þov false schrewe," þe oþur seide : "ich it þe habbe i-&yogh;olde." Þe giv seide nay, and he &yogh;us : bote al ne heold it nou&yogh;t. Þe giv let him somoni : þat he was to court i-brou&yogh;t. Ake þis false cristine man : þou&yogh;te op one feolle gynne : Ane staf he nam op-on is hond : —holu&yogh; he was with-inne— Þare-inne he dutte al þat gold : þat he scholde þe giwe &yogh;elde, And feolliche dutte hine and faste : þat men ne scholden him bi|melde. bi-fore þe bayllifs huy comen : þe giv and he boþe. he with-sok þe giwes dette : and was i-don to ane oþe. Þo he scholde is oth do : is false staf he bi-tok Þe giwe, and bad him &yogh;witie þe &yogh;wile : he leide is hond on þe bok; And seide, "al-so muche gold al-so ich borewede : of þe giv þat here is, So helpe me crist and seint Nicholas : ich tok him a-&yogh;ein, i-wis." Þis luþere man with is fals oth : swiþe wel i-leued was, And þe oþur, for he was a giv : no-þing i-leued he nas. "&YOGH;wane þou me hast bi-giled : with þi false cas, Ich bidde þine borou&yogh; þat he it me &yogh;elde : þe guode seint Nicholas." Þe giv with wel sorie chere : wende him forth a-non, And þe false man nam is staf : and hamward bi-gan to gon. Al-so he wende bi þe weie hamward : to slepe he hadde grete wille : Þare twei wei&yogh;es to-gadere comen : a-doun he lai wel stille. As þis false man lay and slep : a cart þare cam gon, And al-to-bruysde is false bones : þat he deide a-non. Þat o &yogh;weol to-brak þane false staf : ase mani a man i-sai&yogh; : [Here a fol. is wanting; MS. Harl continues :]
27.2: [Þat gold schadde out al-abrod : & amidde þe weye lay. ¶ þe gyw, þo he þis ise&yogh; : loude he gan to crie & þonkede seint Nicholas : þat schewede his tricherie. For þe miracle men him radde : cristene forto beo. "Certes, ynelle," quaþ þis oþer : "er i c more iseo; Ac if god & seint Nicholas : wolde þis liþer manes al. man is lyf sende, Cristene i c wolde þanne beo : & serui hem to mi lyues ende." ¶ Fram deþe to lyue þis false man : þurf seint Nicholas com. Anon so þe gyw þis ise&yogh; : he wilnede cristendom, & bileouede on ihesu crist : & god man euereft was. Þis me þin&yogh;þ a fair miracle : of seint Nicholas! her &yogh;e seoþ hou hit goþ bi men : þat wiþ gyle swerieþ, iwis; Þe&yogh; he þurf gyle swerie soþ : iwis forswore he is.— ¶ A god man þer was in a tyme : þat longe was mid his wyue, Þat no childe nemi&yogh;te habbe : þat euere cam to lyue. To seint Nicholas ofte hi bede : achild hem to sende, & bihete him, if hit so were : to him forto wende. ¶ Seint Nicholas ihurde here bone : —for god he is & mylde : hit biful þer-after sone : þat his wyf was mid chylde, & brou&yogh;te forþ afair sone. : glad þis gode man was! he let &yogh;arki a fair coupe : to seint Nicholas. So faire was þe coupe of golde : þo heo was &yogh;aru iwrou&yogh;t, & þis hosebonde heo was so leof : þat he nolde leue hire no&yogh;t, Ac athuld hire in his owe hous : him-silue þer-of to drinke; Anoþer to seint Nicholas : þe goldsmyth he let biswinke. ¶ Þo þe coupe was ymaked : to þe louerd seint Nicholas, he wiste hire wiþ gret drueri : ac þoþer fairere was. ¶ Þo his sone was wel i-woxe : & hadde stren&yogh;þe & mi&yogh;te, To þe pelgrimage of seint Nicholas : þis gode man him di&yogh;te, & nom wiþ him his leoue sone : & þe coupen beye, Þe furste, þat him was so leof : to serui him bi þe weye, Þoþer, to ofri seint Nicholas : whan hi þider come. hi greiþede hem a-godes name : & þe holi wei hi nome. ¶ So þat hi come in þe see : as hi þane wei wende. After water of þe see : þis gode man his sone sende : "Fech me," he seide, "of þe water : in myn owene coupe!" Þat child dude his fader heste : & to þe water gan stoupe. Þe coupe ful out of his hond : & anon to grounde sonk; Þe child ful in afterward : & in þe water adronk. Gret deol makede þis gode man : þo he se&yogh; þis cas, Þat he nadde bote þat o child : & he adronke was. "Awei," he seide, al. þat i c schal "þis dai abide! : leoue louerd, allas! wel i c wot, i c haue agult : þe louerd seint Nicholas, Þat i c bynom him þe furste coupe. : louerd, what schal i c do? Þerfore i c habbe ilore nou mi child : & þe coupe also. Seint Nicholas, for&yogh;if hit me : & ynelle no&yogh;t bileue, iwis, Þat ynelle siche þe : þe&yogh; me beo bifalle þis!" ¶ Þis gode man [him] wende forþ : in deol & sori þo&yogh;t; Er he to seint Nicholas com : he neturnde a&yogh;e no&yogh;t. Þo he to þe weued com : þat he hadde wide iso&yogh;t, Þe coupe he offrede þerto : þat he hadde þider ibro&yogh;t. þe coupe hipte anon a&yogh;e : he nolde astinte þere, Ac hipte into þe flor : wreche as þe&yogh; hit were. Þis gode man hire nom vp : & offrede hire eft þere. Eftsone heo hipte fram þe weued : forþere þan heo dude ere. ¶ Þo was þis gode man agrise : & þoþere aboute also. "Louerd," he seide, "seint Nicholas : i c haue þe moche misdo. Ich wolde offri þoþer coupe : ac ynemai þerto come : vnderfong þus, if hit beo þi wille : for þoþer me is bynome. vnderfong þoþer of mi sone : for þu wost wher he is; Let mi sone to þe offri þulke : & let me offri þis."— For no hope of his sones lyf : þe gode man þis nesede, Ac for he scholde his soule helpe : & þe whatlokere do what he bede.— ¶ Mid þis word þer com in : his sone, þat was adronke, & bar þe coupe on his hond : þat was mid him asonke; To þe weued he &yogh;eode & offrede : to seint Nicholas. wele, louerd, þe grete ioye : þat of þe miracle was! Gladliche þe fader & þe sone : here offring vp bere; & wende hom wiþ gret ioye : & leuede þe coupen þere, & herede moche seint Nicholas : as hi wel au&yogh;te, iwis.— Meni is þe faire miracle : þat of seint Nicholas is!— ¶ A gyw was while in a tyme : þat i-hurde meni o tale Of þe miracles of seint Nicholas : þat he dude so fale. So [þat], þe&yogh; he were a gyw : vpe him his hurte he caste, & honurede him ynou&yogh; : & biþo&yogh;te him atte laste : An ymage priueiliche he makede : of seint Nicholas & honurede hit in his hous : þo hit &yogh;are was. ¶ In a tyme hit biful : þat he hadde to done In þe contrai þer-aboute : to come a&yogh;e wel sone. he nuste wham his god bitake : forte he a&yogh;e come : Seint Nicholas ymage he bad : nyme þer-to gode gome. "Ich þe habbe," he seide, "iloued ynou&yogh; : do me som god þerfore : wite mi god forte i c come : þat hit ne beo forlore! For, bi seint Nicholas þat i c louie : if hit beo awei ibore whan i c come a&yogh;e, þu schalt : sore abigge þerfore." Þe gyw wende forþ his wei : & tok al his god to wite Þe ymage, forte he come a&yogh;e : as hit is iwrite. Siþþe hit biful þat liþere men : & þeoues þer come [Here L. goes on again.] And to al. om. -breken þe giwes hous : and is guod a-wei nome. Þo þe giv cam hom a-&yogh;ein : and miste al is gvod, orig. good gret deol he made and seoruwe i-nov&yogh; : and ferde ase he were wod. to þane ymage he wende a-non : ase he bi þe walle stod : "Seie," he seide, "&yogh;wat hauest þou i-do? : þou hauest i-set harm a-brod. Ich bi-tok þe to witene al mi guod : þat god lente me : hit is nouþe al i-bore a-wei : and þat ich wite þe, &YOGH;wan ich it bi-tok þe in warde : and þou were of pouste to witen it wel, &yogh;if þat þou woldest. : þare-fore þou haue maugre. vv. 456-7 al. om. For &yogh;wane ich truste so muche to þe : and þou noldest do mi bone, bi ri&yogh;te lawe, ase ich þe bi-het : þov schalt a-bugge sone, &YOGH;wane þou &yogh;olde mine godhede : so vuele atþe laste." harde scourgene he nam and stronge : and beot þis ymage wel faste, Þat grete peces borsten a-wei— : he ferde ase he were wod, And euere he bad þat seli treo : bringue a&yogh;en is guod. Seint Nicholas þare-afterward sone : to þe þeoues wende, Al for-woundet and to-drawe : ase þe giv him to-rende; "Lo," he seide, "hov ich am for ov : I-woundet and for-gnawe, blok and blodi, ase &yogh;e i-seoth : and al mi bodi to-drawe. bringez a-&yogh;en, ich red ov, sone : þat &yogh;e habbez a-wei orig. a-&yogh;en i-bore And istole of þe giwes guode : oþur &yogh;e schulle hangi þare-fore. vv. 466-9 al. om. For-soþe i segge, &yogh;e schullen hangen : bote &yogh;e it hom anon lede, &YOGH;e schullen some a-bugge with me : ouwer foule mis-dede." Þeos þeoues weren sore of-dradde : heo nomen heom to rede And ladden hom a-&yogh;ein þe giwes guod— : huy ne dorsten oþur for drede, orig. fere And weren a-knowe of al hore gult : and þe Miracle him sede hov seint Nicholas to heom cam : with is sidene blod-rede. Þe giv, and þe þeues al-so : to seint Nicholas bede Þat he for-&yogh;eue heom heore gult : and nolden more don to quede. Þe þeues bi-comen trewe men : and ne stelen neuereft more, And þe giv him let cristny sone : and tok him al-to godes lore, And euereft more euerechone : loueden seint Nicholas. Me þincheth, a-mong alle oþere : a fair Miracle þat was! vv. 480-1 al. om. — ¶ In anoþur time a guod man was : þat hadde a clerk to sone; Eche &yogh;ere he wolde for is loue : a-seint Nicholas dai bi wone Of manie clerkus gret feste holden : and wurthschipien al. om. seint Nicholas al-so, with offringue and seruise at churche : gret honur him do. Þe feond hadde þar-to onde. : a dai he MS. ase he cam þere A-seint Nicholas day to þe &yogh;ate : ase þei it a beggare were, And bad, for seint Nicholas loue : þat man sum guod him orig. heom &yogh;eoue. Anon so þat child wuste him þere : he nolde no leng bi-leue Ake bred he nam in is hond : þane schrewe forto beode. And þo þat child cam toward þe &yogh;ate : þe schrewe aweiward &yogh;eode; Þat child eode euere after-ward : to &yogh;iuen him of þe brede, Ake he &yogh;eode euere forth, ase it were : a-weiward þat child to lede : And þo he cam in-to a derne stude : he bi-turnde him ate laste, Ase it were to nime þat bred : and anon he nam wel faste Þat child bi is seli þrote MS. þ r ote : and a-stranglede him a-non; Þat child lai þare and deide sone : and þe schrewe a-wei gan gon. Þe guode man, þo he miste is child : he sou&yogh;te it wel wide; Ake þo he fond it ligge a-slawe : wel deolfulliche he cride. "Louerd," he seide, "seint Nicholas : ich bidde þe milce and ore! honoured ich þe habbe mani a dai : ant &yogh;eot ich hopie more, And for anchaisun of mi sone : þe more, and for is lore, Þat þou me sendest Ioie of him : and schildest me fram sore : &YOGH;wi &yogh;elstov mine &yogh;wyle þus? : louerd, &yogh;wi dest þou so? hov mi&yogh;tþou þus, seint Nicholas : for reuþe bi me do? &YOGH;if me gladnesse of mi child : þat ich mote him a-liue i-seo, And ich him bi-hote to þine seruise : and þat he schal guod man beo." Ase he was þus in is beden : þat child a-ros op allone, And herede god and seint Nicholas : a-mong heom euerechone, Þat him hadde lijf i-sent : for is fader bone þer; And he tolde al-hou þe deuel hadde : him a-strangled er, For al-so muche ase he honourede so : þane guode seint Nicholas. Þis, me þinchez, a-mong alle oþere : a fair Miracle it was! Louerd, [þat] for þe loue of seint Nicholas : mani Miracle hast i-do, Þou schild us fram þe pine of helle : and fram dedliche sunne also.

28.1: SEint Iulian þe confessour : was i-bore at rome; Muche folk þoru&yogh; is prechingue : cristine heo bi-come. Of noble kunne he was i-come : and renable he was i-nou&yogh;; After þe Apostles he cam sone : and muche folk to guode dro&yogh;. In-to a cite he was i-sent : þe prechour guod and trewe, Ase a-postel for-to prechi : þe &yogh;wile cristinedom was newe. Cristinedom was þo vnwurþe : in þulke cite þere : gret scorn heo hadden of alle þulke : þat icristnede were, And alle þat speken of cristinedom : heo defouleden heom i-nou&yogh;. In Aunter him dude þis holie man : and þuder-ward &yogh;uyt him drou&yogh;, And a-mong heom he cam wel mildeliche : and prechede faste a-non. Þat folk drof to busemare : þe meste del ech-on; Ake ore louerd sende him grace : and fair miracle for him wrou&yogh;te, And þat folk þoru&yogh; is prechingue : to cristinedom he brou&yogh;te. Ore louerd him &yogh;af so fair grace : þat with one worde he mi&yogh;te helen Meoseles and guidie Men : and þe blinde &yogh;iuen heore si&yogh;te; Þare nas no-manere vuel : nou&yogh;wer þare he cam gon, Þoru&yogh; þe vertue of þe croiz : þat he ne helde heom al. om. a-non. So þat he tornede to cristine-dom : al þat folk þare-a-boute; And siweden him al-so in-to al þat lond : of heom wel grete route. So þat heo comen in one stude : a-þurst heo weren wel sore; heo nusten &yogh;ware to drinke come : it greuede heom ful sore : al. þe more heo criden alle on seint Iulian : þat he sum drinke heom founde. Þis holie man nam op is staf : smot doun in-to þe grounde And pi&yogh;te þane poynt a luyte in þe eorþe. : þare cam walle out a-non Þet beste water þat mi&yogh;te beo : a-mong heom euerech-on, And fond heom alle drinke i-nou&yogh; : þare neuer er welle nas, Þoru&yogh; vertue of þis holie man— : fair miracle þare was! So mani fair Miracle ore louerd dude : for loue of seint Iulian, Þat muche del of þat folk : heolden him a god a[nd] no man. In godes seruise ate laste : his lijf he brou&yogh;te to ende And a luyte bi-fore candel-masse : to heouene he gan i-wende, In þe latere ende of Ieneuer : þis confessour so hende. Nou god for is swete loue : us þudere alle sende.— An oþur seint Iulian þare is : þat men biddeth wel faste After guod .In. in onecouth stude : &yogh;wane heo beoth sore a-gaste.
28.2: Vita sancti Iuliani boni hospitis. SEint Iulian þe guode herebeger : of noble kuynde com; stalewarde and strong man he was : and louede wel cristin|dom; he louede al-so game i-nou&yogh; : of hauekes and of houndes— A noblere bodi þane he was : nou&yogh;were nas non i-founde. Ase he hountede In a dai : In Iolifte j-nou&yogh;, A swyþe fair heort he i-sai&yogh; : and þare-after faste he drou&yogh;. he strencþede him to nime þat best : and siwede after faste. Þo þis heort hadde longe I-orne : he bi-turnde him ate laste, And spak with him, ase god it wolde : "Iulian, Iulian," he sede, "&YOGH;wi siweste me so faste?" he seide : "þou schalt don anoþur dede : boþe þi fader and þi moder : þou schalt &yogh;eot a-quelle. Ake ne beo þou no-þe wroþure with me : þei ich it þe telle." Þo þis guode man þis i-heorde : him bi-gan wondri, and drede, For þat wilde best so spack : and for wordes þat he sede; him wondrede, ase him mi&yogh;te wel : for it spak a-&yogh;ein kuynde, he was a-ferd for þat superscribed. he him bi-het : and ofte it hadde in muynde, Þat he scholde fader and moder sle. : And to fleo þat dede, he wende out of contreie stilledliche : ase god him wolde lede. Into feorrene contreie he wende. : so þat he cam bi cas to a gret prince of a lond : and in seruice wiz him was. So wel he paide is louerd in Armes : and in alle oþur dedes, Þat he made him maister of is ferd : al for-to gwie and lede; And sethþe he made him we d di wijf : riche and noble al-so, A lauedi of a gret contreie al. castel gret : and of grete moru&yogh;iue al-so. al. Þerto bi-twene him and is guode lauedie : loue þare was i-nov&yogh;; For to alle guodness bi heore mi&yogh;te : eyþur to oþur drou&yogh;. Ake is guode fader and is Moder : þat he bi-lefte him atom bi-hinde, Swyþe sorie weren for heore sone : þat heo ne mi&yogh;ten him nou&yogh;wer finde. heo wenden forth in atyme boþe : and sou&yogh;ten him wel wide, Fram o contreie to oþur faste : a-boute in eche side. So þat heo i-heorden of him tellen : þei it were longue. to is castel huy drowen heom a-non : and faire weren onder-fongue : heo ne founden nou&yogh;t him-seo[l]f athom : ake is wijf, heo was þere, Fair semblaunt heo made heom : þo heo wuste &yogh;wat heo were! heo honourede heom þe more : for hire louerd ne was nou&yogh;t þare, And leide heom in heore owene bed : and hire-seolf lay elles-&yogh;ware. A-morewe, are hit were dai : heo a-ros op wel softe And to churche &yogh;eode wel stilleliche : ase heo was i-woned ofte. Þo cam hire louerd hom : In þe moreweningue sone, And drou&yogh; him to chaumbre toward is bed : ase he was i-woned to done. Þo i-heorde he wel softe slepe : and swei&yogh;en þar-inne tweie, Ase Men and wommen nede moten : þat beoth werie of weie. he &yogh;eode ner and i-sai&yogh; þare ligge : Man and womman al-so. "&YOGH;e," þou&yogh;te he, "þis is mi wijf : and sum gering is i-comen hire to; I seo wel nouþe þat þe hore : is i-wonet here-to. huy ne schullen neuereft ete mete : ne more schame me do." he slou&yogh; is fader and is moder : mid is swerde þere And wende bi heom þat is wijf : and hire horeling it were. Wel softe he &yogh;eode out a&yogh;ein : þo þis dede was i-do, And &yogh;eode him toward churche : And tuynde þe dore to. Ase he toward churche was : his wijf hamward he mette. "Louerd, merci," he þou&yogh;te, "hou is þis?" : with gret wonder he ire grette; "Dame," he seide, "hou goth þis? : &yogh;wat dost þou nouþe here? ho liggez in ore bedde athom : Man and womman i-fere?" "A, sire," quath þis guode leuedi : "wel glad mi&yogh;t þou beo, I-hered beo ore louerdes grace : þat þov most þis day i-seo : Þi fader and þi moder it is : þat wide þe habbez i-sou&yogh;t, I-hered beo ore louerdes sonde : þat hidere heom hath i-brou&yogh;t! Leoue sire, hi&yogh;e þe hom : þou schal t heom faire a-fonge And make with heom Ioie i-nou&yogh; : me þinchez er wel longe." "Nai, certes," quath þis Iulian þo : "&yogh;if þat it is so, Al mi blisse of þusse liue : and mi Ioye is al i-do. Alas þat ich habbe þus longe i-leoued : þat i-ne hadde er i-beo ded! habbe ich a-slawe fader an Moder! : louerd, &yogh;wat mai beo mi-red? Al-to soth me seide þat wilde best : alas þulke stounde; Þei ich habbe i-folewed al. i-flowe his bi-heste : þe soþe ich habbe i-founde. haue nouþe, dame, wel guod day : for i-nelle habbe no reste Er ich habbe mine penaunce ido— : god leue me don mi beste." "A, sire, merci," seide is wijf : "&yogh;ware-fore seistþou so! Sikerliche þou schalt athom bi-leue : and þine penaunce do." "beo stille, dame," Iulian seide : "þou spext al embe nou&yogh;t, certes, I-nelle neuere a-stunte : are ich me habbe of londe i-brou&yogh;t. Ake haue guod dai, mi treowe spouse : and god þe leue wel do; led clene lijf; and bide for me : for I-ne wene neuere come þe to." "Alas," seide þis guode wijf : "sire, &yogh;wi seistþou so! &YOGH;if god wole, þe &yogh;wyle we a-liue beoth : ne schulle we departi atwo; bote þou wolle bi-þenche þe bet : And at hom bi-leue here, Certes, &yogh;wodere þou euere i-wenst : i-chulle beo þi fere And parti with þe of þi wo : ase ich dude er of þi blis— For ho-so deth þat on, he schal þat oþur : þou wost wel þat ri&yogh;t it is."
28.3: ÞIs guode Man and is trewe wijf : wel stille forth heo i-wende And leten lond and leode : and al þat god heom sende. So þat heo wenden feor and longue : þat atþe laste heo come to a deop watur and perilous : þare Men a-dreinten i-lome. Þis guode Men [a-stynte MS. adreinten expunged , a stynte by a later hand . ] þer : and leten heom sone a-rere A luytel hous—bote hit was guod i-nou&yogh;— : bi-side þe watere þere. Alle Men þat þare-forth comen : And with-oute he[r]borewe were, he fond heom hereborewe, guod i-nou&yogh; : þat with-oute none nere, bed and cloþes guode i-nowe : and wel aysiliche heom di&yogh;te; heore fet he wuchs and baþede heom : and duden al. dude al þat heo mi&yogh;te— For is fader soule and for is moder : he dude al þis dede; he bad alle þat to him come : þat for heore soulene huy bede. he porueide him of a schip : and ouer þe watere ladde euer[e]ch tyme, dai&yogh; and ny&yogh;t : alle þat to him gradde— Þare-with he swonk sore i-nou&yogh; : of noman ne tok he nou&yogh;t. &YOGH;wane he hadde ani miseise man : ouer þe watere i-brou&yogh;t, he ne let him nou&yogh;t fram him gon : are huy r. he a-mendede were : he ladde heom in-to is house a-non : and aisede heom swiþe wel þere. Al heo duden r. he dude for-to bete þe sunne : of þat cas þat him bi-tidde, For is fader soule and is Moder : and bad Men for heom bidde.— Þare-fore Men &yogh;eot to þis day : þat ouer lond doth i-wende, heo biddeth to seint Iulian faste : þat he guod .In. heom sende; And seint Iulianes pater-noster : ofte heo seggez al-so For is fader soule and is Moder : þat he bringue heom þar-to.— Þo þis holie Man seint Iulian : In þis trauail hadde MS. hadden i-beo longe And mani Miseise Man in is hous : wel loueliche vnder fonge, A day, ase he hadde i-beo : in trauaile strong i-nou&yogh;, Ase ladde þis men ouer : and into is Inne heom drou&yogh;, And a-&yogh;ein middel ny&yogh;t to is bed : &yogh;eode atþen ende, For-to habbe sum reste þere : &yogh;if ore louerd it wolde him sende : Atþe mid-ny&yogh;t, ase he bi-gan : sum-del reste a-fongue, A &yogh;eond half þe watere þare cam on : in grete forste and strongue : "A-ris, Iulian, a-non," he gradde : "hider-ward þou most go And bringue me ouer þis watere sone : oþur ich dei&yogh;e for wo." Þis guode man heorde sone þis : and þei he weri were, he wende to þis seli man : and ladde him ouer þere. him þou&yogh;te þat he was onneþe a-liue : for he was al ouer-come, Mid chele and mid oþur wo : is limes him weren bi-nome; A lodlich musel he þou&yogh;te al-so : and þe fouleste þat mi&yogh;te beo— A Miseisiore man þane he þou&yogh;te : no man ne mi&yogh;te iseo. Seint Iuliane ladde þis seli man : In-to is house bi ni&yogh;te And fondede to maken him an-Ayse : bi al is trewe mi&yogh;te : gret fuyr he dude him makien and guod : þat he were of chele i-brou&yogh;t, And leide [him] þare-bi wel softe— : ake al it was for nou&yogh;t. Ake þo he ne mi&yogh;te with fuyre him hete : ne with none oþur ginne, his owene bed he let faire spreden : and brou&yogh;te him þare-Inne; cloþes i-nowe opon him he spradde : and helede MS. holede (corr.?) him wel faste. &YOGH;eot he þou&yogh;te ful sore of cale : for al þat he on him caste. Swyþe sori was þis guode man : and sore him a-gaste, Þo he him dude al þat he mi&yogh;te : and þe chele so longe i-laste. he stod and bi-heold þis selie man : a Musel ase he wende : Sone so ore louerd it wolde : is hev&yogh; bi-gan a-mende, Atþe laste he werth so fair a man : ase euere any mi&yogh;te beo, And so cler he bi-cam sone : þat vnneþes men mi&yogh;ten him seo. "Iulian," he seide, "god it þe &yogh;elde : þat þou me hast i-do! In ore louerdes erinde of heuene : i-come ich am þe to : Ore louerd þe sente word bi me : þat þou art clanliche i-schriue And þine penaunce hast wel i-do : and þine sunnes beoth for-&yogh;iue; Swyþe wel þou him hast i-paid : þou and þi wijf al-so, And boþe &yogh;e schullen with alle Ioye : newene come him to." Þo he hadde þis word i-seid : he nuste &yogh;ware he bi-cam. Þis guode man seint Iulian : to godes seruise him nam And to his bi-hofþe him makede al-&yogh;are : he and is wijf al-so. Sone after-ward in his seruise : heo deiden boþe-to And wenden to þe blisse of heuene : þare heo schullen euere beo. guod it is to hereborewi Miseise men : bi heom þat men mowen i-seo, For þare-with þis holie man : his sunnes bette inou&yogh;, And a gret haluwe in heouene he is : þei he fader and moder a-slou&yogh;. bidde we &yogh;eorne sein Iulian : þat he ore erinde beode Þat ore louerd us &yogh;iue milce and ore : and alle þat habbez neode, Þat &yogh;wanne we oþur any cristine man : ouer lond schullen wende, For is fader soule and is moder : þat he guod hereborewe us sende, And atþe laste þoru&yogh; godes wille : þat we moten teo Into þe blisse of heuene : and þare with-outen ende beo.

29.1: SEinte Marie egyptiane : In egypte was i-bore; Al hire &yogh;ounge lijf heo liuede : in sunne and in hore. Vnneþe heo was tweolf &yogh;er old : are heo dude folie : hire bodi and al hire wille heo dude : to sunne of lecherie. Þaron heo hadde so gret delijt : þat in hire owene londe heo ne mi&yogh;te fulfulle hire owene wille al. al hire : þo bi-gan heo hire vnder|stonde, heo wende into Alisaundrie : and þare heo wonede longue. Alle þat bi hire ligge wolden : gladliche he dude a-fongue; heo ne sparede leinte ne oþur tyme : preost ne oþur non, riche ne pouere, ne oþur al. om. weddede men : þat heo ne let to hire gon. Men þat ne hadden none wille : swuch sunne forto do, with faire wordes and fol semblaunt : heo brou&yogh;te heom ofte þer-to; Þare nas man in no mester : so gleu ne so quoynte al. om. Þat heo nas to bringue men to sunne : wel prestore in eche poynte. For þulke dede heo ne tok : of no man mede ne wunne— for non ne scholde for defaute : bi-leue þe foule sunne; Oþur any al. om. mede bote hire foule wille : heo kepte of no man; with spinningue and with seuwingue : hire liflode heo wan. hit is sun n e and schame to ani man : to þenche oþur to wite Þe fuylþe of þe wrechche sunnes : þat we findeth of hire i-write. For to hire-sulue one heo seide : þat schame it was to huyre, &YOGH;waþur ani womman euere on eorþe were : so sunful a creature; hit was wonder þat þe eorþe i-opened nadde : ase heo hire-sulf gan telle, And i-swoluwe hire ase heo þar-on &yogh;eode : into þe putte of helle.— In Alisaundrie heo liuede þis foule lijf : &yogh;eres seuentene, Þat so muche vildede of womman : nas neuere i-sei&yogh;e, ich wene. On a day in heruest : as þis womman bi-heold a-boute, bi þe wei&yogh;e heo sai&yogh; muche folk : and manie grete route. heo þou&yogh;te, for heo was so i-knowe : in Alisaundrie in euer-eche ende, Þe lasse sockne heo hadde of hire folie : þannes heo wolde i-wende; heo þou&yogh;te, "a-mong þis straunge men : so fale ase ich i-seo, Mi wille ich mi&yogh;te muche of heom habbe : with heom i-chulle beo." A-mong heom heo cam and axede heom : &yogh;wodere huy alle þou&yogh;te. heo seiden, heo wolden to Ierusalem : for þe swete rode heo sou&yogh;ten Þat scholde op-on þe holie rode-day : eche manne i-schewed beo, And þat euer-ech guod man þudere wolde : for-to honouri þat swete treo. "Mot ich," seide þis womman : "with eov þudere wende? And of þat craft þat ich i-leorned habbe : to eov ichulle beon prest and hende." "&YOGH;e," seide on of heom, "hastþou &yogh;warof : to a-quiti þi schip-huyre, A-mendet worth muche ore compaygnie : for swuch a creature." "Non oþur Moneye," heo seide, "ich ne habbe : bote mi-self her : Ichulle beo corteis of þat ich habbe : a&yogh;ein þe mariner; to him, and to eov al-so : so prest i-chulle beon and hende, Þat hit ne schal for-þunche ov nou&yogh;t : þei ich with eov wende." Þis womman wende forth with þis men : In muche sunne, alas! to alle þat with hire sunegy wolde : euere redi heo was. Þo heo cam to þe se : atþe furste þingue heo &yogh;af þe Marinere hire bodi : ouer þe se forto bringue; to þe Mariner, and to alle his : þat in þe schipe were, I-redi heo was forto sunegun with : alas, heo nadde none fere. Iesu, muche is þi merci : and muche þou þoledest þere, Þat water oþur schip wolde heom bere : þat heo a-dreinte nere!— bi-fore þe holie rode-day : to Ierusalem heo cam. Alle þat folie wolden do : gladliche to hure heo nam. Þo þe holie rode-day was i-come : þat men scheoweden þat swete treo, Mani on to þe temple eoden : þe rode forto seo. Þo Marie was with þe oþere : to þe temple-dore i-come, Anne fot heo ne mi&yogh;te þare-Inne go : hire mi&yogh;te was hire al bi-nome; hire þou&yogh;te, &yogh;wane heo wolde In go : þat sum man hire a-&yogh;en-drou&yogh;. 1 For heo fram alle oþere stod with-oute : of-schamed heo was j-nou&yogh;. &YOGH;eot heo wolde in-ward go : and hire þou&yogh;te þat men a-&yogh;en hire pulte. heo weop for scame, and hire bi-þou&yogh;te : þat it was for grete gulte. In-to one huyrne heo wende al one : fram hire ferene alle. heo i-sai&yogh; þe fourme of ore leuedi : depeint þare on þe walle : heo weop and ful a-doun a-kneo : and seide : "leuedi, þin ore! Sunful womman ich habbe i-beo : so nelle ich neuere-eft more; Þe sunnes þat ich habbe i-do : heo me reweth sore : &YOGH;if me grace heom for-to bete : þoru&yogh; holie churche lore, And &yogh;if me grace in to go : þe swete rode forto seo : Þoru&yogh; grace of hire and of þe : þe betere womman i schal beo. here ich for-sake mi sunful lijf : and alle mine luþere dede, In clenesse orig. clanesse and in penaunce i-chulle : mi lijf here-afturward lede." Þo heo hadde to þulke ymage : longue i-crid and i-bede, Mildeliche, with careful heorte : heo eode fram þulke stude And eode hire to þe temple dore : ac &yogh;uyt heo was sore of-drad. With-oute lettingue In heo &yogh;eode— : welle, þat heo was þo bliþe and glad! heo &yogh;eode In bi-fore þe rode : and þo heo hire mi&yogh;te i-seo, Sore wepinde heo cride on hire : and feol a-doun a-kneo, And bad for-&yogh;yuenesse of hire sunnes : þe rode, þat was so swete; Þe worldes blisse þare heo for-sok : hire sunnes for-to bete; Ofte heo custe þe pauement : þare þe rode hadde on i-stonde. to ore lauedie ymage heo wende a&yogh;en : weopinde and wrong hire honde. Þare mi&yogh;te ech man deol i-seo : ho-so of pite couþe, Of deol and soruwe þat heo made : with heorte and with mouþe. heo bad ore leuedi þat heo hire tei&yogh;te : &yogh;if it were hire wille, &YOGH;ware heo mi&yogh;te hire sunnes bete : priueliche and stille. heo ne sai&yogh; no man, ake a uoiz heo heorde : þat þis word to hire sede : "Þe flum Iordan þou schalt passi : and in pays þi lijf lede." heo þou&yogh;te þe wordes weren to hire iseid : al for hire guode; heo a-ros and þonkede ore leuedi &yogh;eorne : and þe swete holie rode. bi-for þe none heo wende : toward þe flum Iordan, biddinde hire beden. þo gan heo i-mete : In þe wey a man, Þat &yogh;af hire þreo rounde panes : and heo nuste &yogh;ware he bi-cam. Þare-with heo bou&yogh;te hire þreo loues : and forth with hire heom nam. ¶ Heo cam to þe watere : a luytel are hit were eue. In seint Iohanes chapele þe baptist : al þe ni&yogh;t heo gan bi-leue. heo let hire schriue and hoseli also : swyþe wel þoru godes grace, And with þe watur of þe flum Iordan : heo wusch hire in þat place. A-morewe heo carf ane lof atwo : and et þat haluen-del, Of þe flum heo dronk þer-to : and made hire a murie mel. Heo wende into wildernesse : ouer þe flum Iordan : Þare heo liuede mani a &yogh;er : þat heo ne sai&yogh; best ne man.
