Þe tweie loues and þe halue lof : þat heo with hire nam, bi-come so harde so ani ston : þo heo ouer þe watere cam : Þare-bi he liuede in wildernesse : &yogh;eres seuentene. hire cloþes roteden and feollen hire fram : clout mele in þe grene. &YOGH;eot heo leouede twenti &yogh;er : after þe seuentene bi-fore Þat heo ne et no mannische mete : bote weodes and wilde more. Þe &yogh;wyle hire loues i-lasten : heo was ofte and sore I-fondet of hire hote flesch : þoru&yogh; þe feondes lore : hire longede after mete and drinke : and aftur oþur wede, And on lecherie heo þou&yogh;te muche : ase heo hire-sulf sede; Ake þo heo ne et nou&yogh;t bote weodes and mores : of alle þe twenti &yogh;er, Enes heo nas of hire flesch : i-fondet ase heo was er, Of mete ne of drinke ne of folie : of hete ne of colde; heo ne þou&yogh;te on no-þing bote on god : ase hire-sulfue tolde. Of alle þe seuene-and-þritti &yogh;er : þat heo leouede þere heo ne sai&yogh; noþur best ne man. : bote in þe sixe-and-þrittiþe &yogh;ere A Monuk cam to hire, are heo deide : as þe bok us doth lere— For ore louerd wolde þat hire lijf : a-mong Men i-kud were.—
29.2: AN MS. SN Abbeye þare was in paleis r. palestine? : of ordre swiþe strongue; heore &yogh;at was swiþe faste i-mad : þoru&yogh; al þe &yogh;ere longue, For no Monuk ne scholde gon out þar-of : þe worldes weole to seo : Þene furste sonenday of leinte : þat &yogh;at scholde i-opened beo, For ech Monek scholde þat ilke day : beon i-hoseled and i-schriue, ech Monek scholde oþeres blessingue afongue : and euerech to oþur it &yogh;iue, And wenden al one in-to wi[l]dernesse : and al. om. euer-ech in is ende, to bieten heore sunnes; ake huy scholden : alle at ester hom wende. On holi man was þare-inne : is name was frere Zosime, Þat wel and treoweliche is ordre heold : ase bi-feol to euerech time. Sone so þat &yogh;at was vndo : and þat þe leinte com, he wente forth þene wei : toward þe flum Iordan. Þo he þat watur i-passed hadde : feor he wende and longue, Þat he ne sai&yogh; noþer best ne man : confort of to fongue; Twenti dai&yogh;es þar-inne he &yogh;eode : ake euere hope he hadde Þat ore louerd wolde him some Miracle schewen : and no drede he nadde. Þene twentiþe dai a-boute noon : a-kneo he sat a-doun, he tornede him estward ase he was i-woned : and seide is oresoun : On is ri&yogh;t side him þou&yogh;te he sai&yogh; : in a wonder al. wilde stude and derne Ase þei it a mannes schadewe were : ligge al plat in one huyrne. he wende it were sum foul wi&yogh;t : and blessede him a-non. Þo bi-cam he hardiore in godes name : and þare-ner he gan gon. him þou&yogh;te þat hit a womman was : naked, and swiþe broun, Ase heo was with þe sonne i-brent : al plat heo lai a-doun; hire her was hor and swiþe &yogh;wij&yogh;t : as þei it were wolle, Þunne and schort, þat it mi&yogh;te : onneþe helie hire scholle. Þo was þis Monek swiþe glad— : for he nadde nanne Man I-sei&yogh;en, sethþe he i-passed hadde : þat watur of flum Iordan. toward þis womman he &yogh;eode : and þis womman up a-ros, estward heo gan eorne bliue— : þe Monek ful sore a-gros. Naþeles he orn euere aftur hire : ake þis womman was euere bi-fore; Þe Monek so weri nas of orne : neuere sethþe he was i-bore. "Abijd," he seide, "&yogh;wi fleu&yogh;stþou me : þat am with-oute mi&yogh;te, Old and feble? ne dred þe nou&yogh;t : þat ich with þe wulle fi&yogh;te!" &YOGH;eot nolde þis womman with him speke : Ake gan al. þo gan he to weope sore. 2 vv. om. here "haue reuþe of me and spek sum-&yogh;wat : with me of godes lore, &YOGH;if þou art a-godes half : womman of flesch and felle; Ich coiuri þe þat þov a-bide : and of þi stat me telle." ¶ Þis womman bi-gan þo for-to speke : "Frere Zosime, þin ore," he sede, "Ne wilne þou nou&yogh;t þat ich þe a-bide : for ich am with-oute wede; Ne wilne þou nou&yogh;t þat ich schewie þe : oþur wummen forto schende, Mi licame, for ich naked am : ake lat me a-wei fram þe wende." Þis Monek weop and cride &yogh;eorne : nolde he stunte nou&yogh;t; For heo is name nemde so : he was a-ferd in is þou&yogh;t. Þis womman seide, "&yogh;if þou wolt : i-wite &yogh;wat ich beo, Cast me sum þing to helie MS. holie; r. heolie? me with : and on oresun bide for me!" With guode heorte þis Monuk hire caste : A luytel wede þo, &YOGH;ware-with to helie hire derne limes. : and to him heo gan go, And seide, "Frere Zosime, &yogh;wi wilnestþou : a sunfol wrechche to seo? graunte me þat ich mote : in þine beden beo." Þis Monek ful a-doun a-kne : and heo a-&yogh;ein him al-so, And eyþer bad oþures blessingue : and noþur nolde it do. Ase heo leien longue to-gadere : bi-twene heom oþur word huy ne sede bote "blesse þu me," "ake blesse þou me"— : þe Monek swatte for drede. Þo seide þis womman, "i-blessed be god : þat bringueth þe soule bote." "&YOGH;e," seide þe Monek, "god us graunti : þat we þarof parti mote." Þis womman, þo heo weren a-rise : to þe Moneke sone heo sede : "Frere Zosyme, ho gan þe hidere : to a swuch wrechche lede? hou is þe stat of holi churche : i-loked, and cristine-dom, And hou is it of þe heþene prince : þat heore ri&yogh;tes heom bi-nam?"
29.3: "LEoue Moder," þis Monek sede : "þe betere is in eche stude holi churche and cristine-dom : i-loked for þine bede. bide for me for godes loue : nouþe ich bi-seche þe!" Þis womman seide, "for þou art preost : þou schalt bidde for me. Ake þat ich onbou&yogh;sum ne beo i-seie : þei ich sunful beo, I-chulle bidde for þe, mi leoue fader : þat þou schalt i-seo." Þis womman tornede hire estward : and a-knes heo sat a-doun, hire ei&yogh;ene and hire hondene opward heo heold : and seide hire oresoun. A-non so heo bi-gan hire oresun : wonder men mi&yogh;ten i-seo : Fram þe eorþe heo was op i-houe : þe hei&yogh;þe of fet þreo; Þare heo houede stilleliche : as þei heo were with-oute breþe, heo ne wawede leome non : bote hire lippene vnneþe &YOGH;ware-with heo seide hire oresun— : and no-þing hire op ne bar bote ore swete louerdes grace— : fair Miracle was þar! Þis Monek stod and bi-þou&yogh;te him : gret wonder he hadde and fere : he ne heold hire no womman : ake treouwede þat hit sum gost were, For heo houede so a-boue. : ake after hire oresun Þis holi þing wel stilleliche : to þe eorþe ali&yogh;te a-doun; "Leoue fader," heo seide, "&yogh;wat is þe? : &yogh;wy chaungest þou þi þou&yogh;t? Ich am a womman of sunful flesch : a gost nam ich nou&yogh;t." "Moder, þin ore!" þe Monek seide : and feol a-doun a-kne, "to schewi ore swete louerdes mi&yogh;te : þi lijf tel þou me!" Þis guode womman nam him up : "leoue fader," heo sede, MS. seide "Schame it is to heore telle : of mine sunful dede. Ake for þou me i-sei&yogh;e naked er : and þat mi bodi was al bar, Þat was for schendnesse of mine foule dedes : of sunne beo euere i-war. So foule beth mine sunfole dedes : þat, bote god þe &yogh;iue is grace, &YOGH;wane þou i-heorst me hem telle : fleo þou wolt out of þis place. Naþeles, leoue fader, bide for me : þat god heom me for-&yogh;iue; Ich hopie, it is godes wille : þat ich beo of þe i-schriue."
29.4: Heo bi-gan þo telle alle hire dedes : to þe Monek Zosime, Þat heo dude sethþe heo was i-bore : forto þat ilke tim[e]. "Leoue fader," he seide, "for godes loue : ich bi-seche þe Þat þou here-of ne schewe noman : are þat ich ded beo. go nouþe hom, and led clene lijf : as þou hast er ido : And eft in þis tyme a twelf-monþe : hidere cum to me. For þat ower ordre is swuch : þat ech Monek schal oute be Þe furste sonendai of leinte : ake þou ne schalt nou&yogh;t so : Þei þou habbe wille out forto go : &yogh;wile ne tit þe non : Ake a-schere[þore]s MS. scheres -day at eue : hidere þou schalt gon; Ore louerdes flesch and is blod : hidere bring with þe, Þat ich enes, are ich dei&yogh;e : mouwe i-hoseled beo, Þat time þat ore swete louerd : a-schere-þores-day at eue A-mong his desciples made is cene— : þat þou it nou&yogh;t bi-leue! For i nas neuereft I-hoseled : sethþe ich passede þe flum Iordan, Þat is nouþe seuene-and-þritti &yogh;er : þat I-ne say&yogh; neuereft man. do þat ich þe habbe i-bede : mi leoue fader Zosime, And blesse me, for ich mot heonne wende : for it is nouþe al time." ¶ Þo þe Monek hire i-blesset hadde : Astward heo gan gon. Þe Monek custe þe wey þare heo eode : þo he nuste non oþur won; &YOGH;eorne he bi-heold after-ward : þe &yogh;wile he ire mi&yogh;te i-seo, And þo he ne sai&yogh; hire nonmore : weopinde he gan hom teo; Þo he cam hom, in penaunce : clene lijf he gan lede; Of al þat he hadde orig. hath oute i-founde : no-þing he ne sede. Ake þe &yogh;er, are he were ido : him þou&yogh;te swiþe longue, Þat he mi&yogh;te of þat holi womman : sum confort eft afongue. Þo leinte cam, and euerech Monek : wende out in is side, A strong feuere nam frere Zosime : þat he moste athom a-bide. Þo þou&yogh;te he on þat word : þat Marie to him seide er : Þat, þei he wolde out i-wende : he scholde habbe no power. Þe feuere him heold, ase heo seide : a-non to þe schereþores-dai at eue. A-non so he was hol, he wende forth : no lengore he nolde bi-leue; he nam godes flesch and is blod : and to þe flum is wei he nam. Þat schereþores-dai a&yogh;en orig. at eue : to þe watere he cam. Ake he ne mi&yogh;te finde no schip : him ouer for-to lede. he sat and weop and bi-heold ouer-ward : and bad ore louerd him rede. "Alas," he seide, "þe defaute of schip! : hou schulle we to-gadere wende?" Euere he waytede, &yogh;if ore louerd : ani grace him wolde sende. Þo sai&yogh; he Marie : bi-&yogh;eonde þe watere stonde. he heold op is hondene and sat on is knes : and þonkede godes sonde. Þo Marie hadde i-blessed : þat watur with hire honde, With-oute wetingue þare-ouer he o &yogh;eode : ase it were on druy&yogh;e londe; heo orn and ne watte neuere a to. : wel bri&yogh;te þe Mone schon. Þis Monek wolde kneuli a-&yogh;einest hire : þo heo toward him cam gon. "Stond op," heo seide, "þou art a preost : kneuli ne schalt þou&yogh; nou&yogh;t, for reuerence of þat holi þing : þat þou hast with þe i-brou&yogh;t. Ake, leoue fader, blesse þou me : for i-ne may a-bide nou&yogh;t longue; bide for me þat ich beo wuyrþe : þat holi þin[g] a-fongue!" Þis womman sat a-doun a-kne : to ore louerd heo gan crie, heo seide hire crede and hire pater-noster : and overlined. þe holie aue Marie, heo custe þe Monekes hond in-stude of pays : and seide hire oresun, And nam godes flesch and is blod : with gret deuociun. "louerd," heo seide þo heo hadde i-do : "&yogh;if it is þi wille, Þat þou bi-leue þine schulchene : in pays swyþe stille, for mine ey&yogh;ene habbeth nouþe i-sei&yogh;e : þine swete mi&yogh;te And ore hele þat þou i-&yogh;arket hast : al mankun for-to li&yogh;te. "fader Zosime, god it þe &yogh;elde : þat þou hidere woldest gon! bide for me and for mine foule sunnes : and go þou hom a-non. An-oþer &yogh;er in þis time : loke þat þou hidere to me wende, And ore louerd þe wole bi þulke tyme : of me oþur tyþingues sende. haue nouþe guod day, mi leoue fader : a&yogh;en ich mot a-non." "Ore louerd it wolde," þis monek seide : "þat ich mi&yogh;te with þe gon! bide for me, &yogh;if it is þi wille : and al-so for holi churche, And for alle cristine men : þat heo moten cristes wille wurche." Marie blessede eft þat watur : al druye heo wende a-boue— Mani fair Miracle ore louerd schewez : for cristine mannes loue! Þane nynþe day of Aueril : þis Miracle was i-do, Þat Marie and frere Zosime : with wop departeden a-to. Þis Monek bi-heold after hire : and þo he ne sai&yogh; hire nonmore, A-&yogh;ein he wente to is Abbeie : wepinde swiþe sore. Sorest him rev þat he nuste : &yogh;wat hire name was, And þat he nadde i-axed hire— : ofte he seide alas. ¶ Longue him þou&yogh;te are þulke &yogh;er : were icome to ende. Anon so leinte was icome : a-&yogh;ein he gan i-wende. Þat watur he passede of flum Iordan : into wildernesse wel wide he &yogh;eode, þat he ful weri was : for he nadde &yogh;waron to ride. Ne mi&yogh;te he nou&yogh;were þis womman i-seo : a-watere ne a-londe; he nolde stunte are þat he cam : þare ase he furst hire founde. Ake þo þat he ne fond hire nou&yogh;t þare : he gan to weopen sore, For he nuste &yogh;woderward gon : hire for-to sechen more. Ase he lokede est-ward : him þou&yogh;te þat he i-sei&yogh; Ase þei it a bri&yogh;t sonne were MS. it were : In þe heir houi an hei&yogh;. Þuder-ward he &yogh;eode in grete Ioye : for him þou&yogh;te þar-of wonder. Þo fond he þis womman ligge ded : In one diche þare-onder, hire heued i-torned estward. : þe Monek bi-gan to weope sore, At hire fet he feol a-doun : for he ne mi&yogh;te stonde more.
29.5: SO sore he weop þat he wusch hire fet : with teres of is eie. And euere houede þis clere lij&yogh;t : ouer hire faire and hei&yogh;e. Þis Monek nuste &yogh;wat he mi&yogh;te do : with þat holi bodi þere, And mest him for-þou&yogh;te þat he nuste : &yogh;wat hire name were. bi-side hire he sai&yogh; ligge a writ : and he it nam up on is hond. Þeos wordes, þat ich ou wolle nouþe telle : þaron i-write he fond : "Frere Zosime, bure þat bodi : of þis wrechche wommane Marie, And prey to god þat he hire for-&yogh;iue : hire sunnes and hire folie, Þat deide anon-ri&yogh;t after hire hosel : þe nynþe dai after Aueril; And &yogh;eld to eorþe þat to hire bi-falle : and þanne heo hath hire wil." glad was þe Monek, þat he wuste : &yogh;wat he scholde do with þat bodi þat þare lay : and &yogh;wat heo het, al-so; Ant gret Ioie he hadde of þe faire Miracle : þo he þat writ dude rede, And of þe womman þat twelf Monþe hadde i-leie : ded, ase it sede, And þat heo, a-non so heo i-hoseled was : bi-&yogh;eonde þe flum Iordan, Deide þare in wildernesse : þat so feor was þare-fram, And þat heo eode bi-fore hire deþe : In a stounde of þe day MS. daye Twenti dawene Iorneies : þare ase heo ded orig. det lay. Ake hou hire put mi&yogh;te beon i-maket : gret care þar-of he hadde : for þe eorþe was hard, and he was old : and none spade he nadde. Ake naþeles he fond ane staf : þat was scharp atþe ende : Þare-with he dalf. ake luyte he mi&yogh;te : þare-with þe eorþe wende, for he was feble for fastingue : and for gret trauail al-so. Þo he i-sai&yogh; ane leon licke þat bodi : and þare-a-boute go. Sore was þe Monek a-drad : þo he sai&yogh; þat best so gon, And for Marie him hadde bi-fore i-seid : þat heo neuere ne i-sai&yogh; þare non, And for it was a stuyrne best— : he hadde þar-of gret orig. gred doute. Þis leon boþe with heued and bodi : to him he gan a-loute. Þo was þis Monek hardi a-non : and to þe leon he sede : "For þou art þoru&yogh; god hidere i-sent : cum help me to þis dede, Þat þis put were wel i-maket!" : and þo þe leon i-heorde þis, Mildeliche þane put he schrapede : wel euene and nou&yogh;t a-mis— for it was a-cordinde to þe bodi : in lengþe and in brede; he fourmede euene þane put : with-oute ani mis-dede. Þo þe put was imaket : þis Monek and þe leon Mildeliche nomen þis holi bodi : and leiden it þare-inne a-doun. huy nadden nou&yogh;t &yogh;[w]are-inne hire winde— : bote a pece þare was i-leued of þulke wede &yogh;ware-with heo hadde : hire derne limes bi-weued : Þare-with huy heoleden þat huy mi&yogh;ten : and casten eorþe hire a-boue, Þis holie man and þat best : and bureden hire with grete loue. Þo þis bodi was i-bured : þe leon &yogh;eode is wei, And þe Monek wel mildeliche in penaunce : a&yogh;en to his Abbei. Al clanliche he tolde is breþren fore : al þat he fond oute, And liet write þis holie wommanes lif : and despeopli hit al-a-boute. Þus seinte Marie egyptiane : out of hire fole dede Wende to heouene blisse : þoru&yogh; penaunce þat heo gan lede.

30.1: SEint Cristofre was a saracen : in þe londe of canaan. In none stude bi is daie : nas so gret a man : Foure-and-twenti fet he was long : and þicke and brod i-nou&yogh; : A scwuch bote he were strong : me þinchez it were wou&yogh;! Al a contreie þare he were : for him wolde fleo. Þare-fore him þou&yogh;te þat noman : a&yogh;en him scholde beo : He seide, he nolde with no man bi-leue : bote with on þat were hext louerd ouer alle men : and onder non oþur nere. Swuch a Man he wente to seche. : and so þat men him tolde Of þe hexte manne þat on eorþe was : and of mest power i-holde. Seint Cristofre sou&yogh;te feor : and atþe laste he cam him to. Þe king axede him a-non &yogh;wat he were : and &yogh;wat he sou&yogh;te also. Cristofre him seide &yogh;wat he was : and þat he serui wolde Þene hexte Man þat ou&yogh;were were : and þat non oþur abouwie ne scholde, &YOGH;if he mi&yogh;te ani scwych orig. scwuch finde. : þis king to him sede Þat he ne heold of no man : ne a-bouwie he nolde ne drede. Eiþur was of oþur glad. : Cristofre him seruede longue. Þe kyng louede muche Melodie : of fieþle r. fiþele and of songue : So þat is Iugelour a day : bi-fore him pleide faste, And nemde in is ryme and in is song : þene deuel atþe laste. Anon so þe kyng þat i-heorde : he blessede him a-non. Seint Cristofre nam wel guode &yogh;eme : and nolde ane fot feor gon Are he wuste &yogh;wi it were. : þe king was ful loth to telle. Cristofre seide, "bote þou me segge : no leng serui þe I-nelle." Þo þe kyng ne i-sai&yogh; non oþur : "leoue Cristofre," he sede, "Ich blessede me þo ich heorde him nemme : for ich habbe of him gret drede." "Þanne he is," quath Cristofre : "herre Maister þane þou?" "Þat ne may ich," quath þe kyng : "for-soþe for-sake nov." "Haue guod day," quat Cristofre þo : "Inelle neuereft with þe beo. Ichulle seche þane deuel MS. feond; deuel on the margin. and serui him : &yogh;if ich him owere iseo." Þe kyng was sori, and alle his : þat huy ne mi&yogh;ten him make a-bide. Forth he wende þene deuel to seche : ake natheles nou&yogh;t wel wide— For þe schrewe wole euere a-redi beo : to heom þat beoth to him i-nome. Þo Cristofre cam with-oute toun : gret folk he sai&yogh; come wel on horse, with grete nobleye : swyþe fierce and proute. Cristofre heom mette we[l] baldeliche— : he nadde of heom no doute. Þe maister, fiers with-alle : cam and mette with him a-non, "Beu sire," he seide, "&yogh;wat art þou? : and &yogh;wodere þenxt þou gon?" "Ich am a ma[n] opon mi seruiz : and noman serui i-nelle Bote mi louerd þat ich seche : þe hei&yogh;e deuel of helle." "Beu frere," quath þe oþur, "ich it am : wel-come ar þov to me! Þe beste seruiz þat þou wolt cheose : man schal deliueri þe." Cristofre sai&yogh; is grete folk : and þat he was of gret pouwer : Of swuch a louerd he was wel glad : and al-so of þat grete mester. Þe Maister hei&yogh;te al is folk a-wei : bote heom-seoluen tweie, To teche him is mester priueliche : ase huy wenden bi þe weie. Ase huy wenden tale&yogh;inde forth : of þis luþere seruise, In þe wei heo iseien one croiz stonde. : þe deuel gan þarof a-grise : his wei in breres and in þornes : wel feor bi-side he nam; Þo heo þe croiz i-passede hadden : a-&yogh;ein to þe weie he cam. Cristofre him Axede &yogh;wi it were. : and him was loth to telle. "Certes," he seide, "bote þou me segge : no leng serui þe i-nelle." "Cristofre, mi leoue freont," quath þe deuel : "ichulle þe telle fayn, with þat þou serui me after-ward : þe betere with al mi mayn : with a swuch croiz ase we þare i-seien : þe heie god þat was here Ouer- cam and in soruwe brou&yogh;te : me and alle mine fere." "Þanne is he herre," quath Cristofre : "and hath power more?" "Þat ne may ich nou&yogh;t for-sake," þe feond seide : "and þat me for|þinchez sore." "Daþeit þanne," Cristofre seide : "þat leng beo in þine seruise, &YOGH;if ich of þane heie manne may o&yogh;t i-wite : in anie kunnes wise!" Forth he wende and sou&yogh;te ore louerd. : wel wide he gan gon. Atþe laste he fond ane hermite : to him he wende a-non, he tolde him clanliche al-hou it was : and hou he a swych man sou&yogh;te. "&YOGH;e," seide þe heremite, "ihered he beo : þat þe in swyche wille brou&yogh;te! Leue broþer," seide þe heremite, "he is þi louerd : for to manne he þe wrou&yogh;te, And with is owene flechs and is blod : wel deore he þe a-bou&yogh;te. Þou most sum-&yogh;wat soffri for him : and festen eche friday." "Ine faste neuere," seide Cristofre : "ne, certes, &yogh;eot Ine may." "Þou most," seide þe heremite, "to churche gon : and þine beden bidde also." "I-not," seide Cristofre, "&yogh;wat it is : ne i-ne can hit nou&yogh;t do." ¶ "No," seide þe heremite, "þou art strong : and here is a water bi|side Þat no man may þare-ouer come : bote he þe herre ride: Þou most in lesnesse of þine sunnes : habbe þine wone&yogh;ingue þere And &yogh;wane ani man to þe neode hath : þare-ouer þou most him bere, In fur&yogh;iuenesse of þine misdedes." : he grauntede þat a-non. Þe heremite &yogh;af him cristine-dom : and het him þudere gon. ¶ CRistofre bi-side þulke watere : one hole he made him þere. In his hond a long perche he bar : is staf as þei it were; &YOGH;wane any man wolde ouer þat watur : opon is rug he him caste And tok is perche and bar him ouer : he stap hardeliche and faste, For he was boþe strong and long— : þare ne cam so heui non Þat Cristofre ouer þe deope watere : ne bar heom ouer ech-on. A ni&yogh;t in þe oþur half of þe watur : a uoiz þare cam and gradde "Hale, hale," to seint Cristofre : þat he him þare-ouer ladde. Cristofre a-ros him op a-non : is perche on honde he nam And wod ouer þe watur—and ne fond no man : þo he to londe cam. he nas bote i-come hom a-&yogh;en : þat on ne gradde eft-sone þer. Cristofre wod ouer, and ne mi&yogh;te finde : non more þane he dude er. &YOGH;uyt it gradde þe þridde tyme : þo he cam hom to londe. And with is rodde wod a-&yogh;en. : a luyte child he fond þare stonde; Þat child bad him par charite : ouer þe watere him lede. "Cum forth, &yogh;if þou wolt here ouer" : cristofre to him sede; Swyþe li&yogh;tliche þat child he nam : and in is Armes it caste. Euere ase he was ouer-ward : it gan to heuegy faste; And þat watur wax al-so : þat Cristofre sore agaste To a-drenche þat child þat was so heui— : vnneþe he stod atþe laste. Neuere so clene he nas ouer-come : at eche stape he grunte and blaste; And laste þat child hadde a-dreint : he ne dorste it a-doun caste. Þo he was to londe i-come : ase him þou&yogh;te ful longue er, Þat child he sette a-doun to grounde : and stod op, to reste him þer. "&YOGH;wat art þou, þat art so luyte : and so heui bi-come, So heui þat ich was ope þe poyinte : to habbe a-dreint i-lome? Þei al þe world hadde ope me i-leie : me þinchez so heui it nere." "No wonder, cristofre," seide þat child : "þei ic MS. it heuiore were Þane al þe world, for ich [am] more— : and no wonder it nis and—nis on an erasure. : For ich made al þe world of nou&yogh;t : and al oþur þin[g] þat is. And for þou schalt þe soþe i-seo : þine staf piche in þe grounde: And he schal bere lef and blowe : and fruyt bere in luyte stounde." With þis word þat child wende forth. : Cristofre is staf nam And pi&yogh;te hit in þe grounde a-morewe : and ri&yogh;t soth it þare bi-cam. Þo was he sikerore þane he was er : and ore louerd he louede more. Forth he wend[e], to siwi him : and forto prechi is lore. he heorde telle &yogh;ware Cristine men : In torment weren ibrou&yogh;t: To conforti heom he wende þudere : þat heo ne scholden flechchie nou&yogh;t. "Beoth hardie," he seide, "and studefaste : and doth as ich ou lere!" Þe Iustise sturte forth a-non : and smot him vnder þe Ere; "Artþou," he seide, "on of þulke : þou it schalt a-corie sore." "Site þou wel stille," Cristofre seide : "and ne smijt þou me non|more! For &yogh;if ich a cristine man nere : Ich me wolde a-wreke a-non. &YOGH;e bi-leuez on ouwer Maumates," he seide : "I-maket of treo and ston, Þat none Miracles ne mouwen do : non more þane a treo. Sum of þe power þat mi louerd hath : bi mi staf þou schalt i-seo:" his rodde he pi&yogh;te in þe grounde : and heo bi-gan a-non To leui and blowe and bere fruyt : bi-fore heom euerech-on. "On swuch a god &yogh;e schullen bi-leue : þat swuch Miracle mai do." Þe Iustise ne dorste, for he was muche : a bold word segge him to. For þe faire Miracle of is staf : and for is prechingue al-so, To god heo[m] MS. heo torneden in þe place : seuen þousende and mo. Toward a-maner wildernesse : seint Cristofre wende, In godes seruise to lede is lijf : ase ore louerd him grace sende. Þe Iustise tolde þe kyngue fore : of swych a man þat he i-sei&yogh; Turne þat folk and he ne dorste : for strencþe come him nei&yogh;. Þe king het sone to hundret kni&yogh;tes : seche forto heo him founde, And þat huy scholden him nimen and leden : bi-fore him, faste i-bounde. Forth wenden þis kny&yogh;tes : wel I-armede, a-non. Toward Cristofre huy comen a luyte : and bi-heolden him echon: huy alle ne dorsten come him nei&yogh; : ake hamward huy gonne fleo, And tolden, þo huy comen hom : þat huy ne mi&yogh;ten him no&yogh;were i-seo. "Ou&yogh;, &yogh;e cowardes," quath þe king : "nabbe &yogh;e him nou&yogh;t i-founde? Ichulle, &yogh;if he a-liue is : habbe him, faste i-bounde." he sende to hundret oþur kny&yogh;tes : þat hy him wide sou&yogh;te, And þat huy ne comen neuere a-&yogh;en : are huy him with heom brou&yogh;te. Wel I-armede heo wenden forth. : and a-non so huy Cristofre i-seie, huy stoden and ne dorsten gon him ner : oþur vnneþe bi-holden him with ei&yogh;e. ¶ Cristofre stod and him r. hem bi-heold : and axede hem &yogh;wat huy wolden. "For no-þing ne dorre we," þe kny&yogh;tes seiden : "bi þe don þat we scholden: Þe king us het bringue þe to him : and þine hondene faste binde. &YOGH;if þou wolt, we wollez him segge : þat we ne mouwen þe finde." "Nay, certes," seide Cristofre þo : "&yogh;e scholden beo i-blamede so; Ake with ou ichulle MS. ichulle ichulle gon : and loki &yogh;wat he wulle habbe i-do." he made heom al a-&yogh;ein heore wille : ase a þef, faste him binde, þat heo neren i-blamede, and leden him forth : his hondene him bi-hinde. Of godes lawe bi þe weie : Cristofre heom gan so lere, MS. lerere Þat echone, are huy comen hom : faire i-cristnede were. Natheles huy ladden him forth : bi-fore þe kyngue, faste i-bounde, And seiden, "here is godes kny&yogh;t : nouþe we him habbeth i-founde." þe king sat an hei&yogh; op-on is sege. : and a-non so he Cristofre i-sei&yogh;, For drede he feol doun to grounde : þat is necke to-barst nei&yogh;. his kny&yogh;tes nomen him up a-non. : and ase tyme ase is wit him cam, he bad Cristofre to him take : and leten beo is cristindam. "þou mi&yogh;t, guode man," seide cristofre : "al-so wel beo stille. Mi bodi þou hast here faste i-bounde : þou mi&yogh;t don al þi wille." ¶ "Certes, sire," þis kni&yogh;tes seiden : þat hadden him þudere i-brou&yogh;t, "Cristindom we habbez itake : and we nelleth it bi-leue nou&yogh;t." þe king let þo in grete wrathþe : Cristofre in prisone do, And binden alle þe kny&yogh;tes faste : and heore heuedes smiten of al-so. þo þeos kny&yogh;tes bi-hauedede weren : þe king sone bi-þou&yogh;te And tweyen faire wommen with-alle : to cristofre he brou&yogh;te— Þat on het Nice, þat oþur Aquiline— : for-to tornen is mod. Þo þis wommen iseien Cristofre : ase he in prisone stod, heom þou&yogh;te is face wel bri&yogh;tore schine : þane þe sonne oþur þe Mone. "Cr[i]stofre, merci," loude heo gradden : "make us cristine sone!" Cristofre heom tei&yogh;te þe ri&yogh;te bi-leue : and cristnede heom a-non þere. A-morewe þe kying let heom fette : to lokie hou it were; he hopede heo hadden þane guode man : in lecherie i-brou&yogh;t. þe wommen Answereden to his Axingue : as huy ne tolden of him no&yogh;t. "&YOGH;wat, hou goth þis," quat þe kyng : "habbe &yogh;e i-turnd ower þou&yogh;t? honourieth mine godes, ich rede : þe &yogh;wyle ou is wel i-þou&yogh;t." al. ido&yogh;t "Ouwer godes beoth wurþe," þis Maydenes seiden : "in fa[i]r stude honoured to beo: þare-fore lat swope þe stretes faire : þat al folk mouwe i-seo, And we heom wollez honouri, i-wis : ase ri&yogh;t is and lawe." þe king let don ase heo seiden : swiþe sone and fawe. þo þis Maumates weren i-brou&yogh;t : in þe strete at þe laste, þis maydenes nomen heore gurdles boþe : ant to heom teiden faste And to-drowen heom in-to al þe strete : and heowen heom to peces þere. "Goth," heo seiden, "ant fechchiez heom leches : þat heo i-helede were!" Þe kying was nei&yogh; for wrathþe wod : þat o maide he let hongue And to hire fet bynden heuie stones : þat hire deþes þrowes weren strongue. A-non so þis mayde was up i-drawe : hire leomes borsten with-inne, Necke and senewes and oþur limes— : wel au&yogh;te heo heuene i-winne. he let don þat oþur in strong fuyr— : ake þare ne mi&yogh;te non come hire nei&yogh;: Ake sethþe he let hire heued of smite : þo he þat oþer cas i-sei&yogh;. Þus þis twei holie maydenes : to þe blisse of heuene i-wende, Þoru þe grace þat ore swete louerd : for seint Cristofre heom sende. ¶ Þe king let þo cristofre fecche : and axede him a-non &YOGH;weþur he wolde his Maumates serui : oþur to þe deþe gon. Cristofre for-sok heore Maumates : and heore seruiz also. Þe king het a-non þat Men him scholden : op-on a strong gredile do And with strong fuyr and pich rosti him. : and þo he was i-leid þar-on, As wex þat gredile malt a-wei : and þat fuyr a-queynte a-non, And he a-ros up with-oute harme. : wroth was þe kyng þo. To a piler he let him binde faste : and kny&yogh;tes a-boute him go, For-[to] scheoten him to deþe : with Mani a kene flo. With bouwe and Areblast þare schoten to him : four hondret kny&yogh;tes and mo: Ake þare nas non Arewe þat nei&yogh; him cam : ake alle heo gliden bi-side And heo[n]gun MS. heogun in þe Eyr a-boute him : and þare huy gunne a-bide. A-non so þe king þis i-sai&yogh; : for wratþe þudere he wende. An Arewe þat ouer þis guode man heng : a-&yogh;ein him sone kende, Boþe is e&yogh;ene heo smot out : and deope into þe heued. Þe king stod for Anguysche and for drede : ase is wit him were bi-reued. "Þou onselie wrechche," seide cristofre : "&yogh;wat is nouþe wurth þi mi&yogh;te? A-&yogh;ein him þat þov hauest bi-gonne : feble þou art to fi&yogh;te! Of þi wrechhede ich habbe reuþe : And þat i schal cuyþe þe: For to-Moruwe mi louerd soffri wole : þat þou schalt laten a-quelle me, And þanne smeore þine ei&yogh;ene with mi blod : and fonde mi louerdes mi&yogh;te: And &yogh;if þou wolt a-ri&yogh;t bi-leue : þou schalt habbe þi si&yogh;te." Þe blinde kyng þar-to hopede : and swiþe wel it onder-stod: A-morewe he let is heued of-smyte : and smeorie him with is blod: he hadde is si&yogh;t guod and cler : þoru&yogh; godes grace wel sone. þoru&yogh; þe bone of seint cristofre : he tournede to cristine-dome. he let burien faire seint Cristofre : and bi-liefde on god a-non and let him cristni in godes lawe : and is men ech-on. Þus seint Cristofre þene hexte louerd : at þe laste of-sou&yogh;te. God us bringue to þulke Ioye : þat he is soule brou&yogh;te.

31.1: SEint Domenic, þe holie frere : in spayne was i-bore, In þe toune of Caylre— : wel guod was þe more: Sire felice is fader het : is moder dame Ione. glad was þe Moder of þe sone : þat for him gan ofte grone. Þeo &yogh;wile þat þis holie child : in is Moder wombe was, hire þou&yogh;te, ase heo lay a-slepe : ase ore louerd &yogh;af þat cas, þat heo bar in hire wombe a best : þat faireste in any lond, And þat best bar ri&yogh;t in is Mouth : ane berninde brond; þe brond in þusse bestes mouth : þo it was of hire i-bore, Schon so þat al cristine-dom : þe bri&yogh;tore was þare-fore, And so wide so was cristinedom : And þare was so deork so ny&yogh;t þe brond in þe bestes Mouþe : hire þou&yogh;te &yogh;af gret li&yogh;t. þo þat child was i-bore : and i-brou&yogh;t to cristin-dom, Al-so bi-feol þat a guod lauedi : þat him of watere nam, þou&yogh;te þat þare was a steorre : In his fore-heued so bri&yogh;t, þat þoru-out al cristine-dom : schon and &yogh;af gret lij&yogh;t. &YOGH;wat was þis schiningue of þis child : bote þat he scholde bringue to godes lawe Mani a man : þoru&yogh; is guode prechingue, And þat he scholde an ordre make : of frere prechours, þat &yogh;et is; þat þare-þoru&yogh; al cristine-dom : a-mendi scholde, i-wis? þis child, þeo &yogh;wyle it was &yogh;ong : to guode drou&yogh; a-non, to fastingue and to almes-dede : and wolle werie Vern. wolleward to gon; In is bedde he nolde beo : bote wel luyte stounde, Ake ligge in is oresones : op-on þe harde grounde. þo he was sethþe to scole i-set : a deore &yogh;er þare cam: his bokes he solde and al is guod : and alle þe panes he nam And delde heom alle to pouere men : ant ne lefde him-sulf ri&yogh;t no&yogh;t. þe tyþingue of is godhede : was sone wide i-brou&yogh;t: So þat þe bischop of þe lond : louede him wel i-nou&yogh; And enqueorede of is dedes : þat to alle guode he drou&yogh;: hei&yogh; man he made him sone : and chanun seculer— Wel luyte tolde þe holie Man : of is grete power. Þare weren false cristine Men : a-boute in þe londe, þat nolden nou&yogh;t clanliche : þe ri&yogh;te bi-leue onder-stonde, Ne huy ne bi-lefden nou&yogh;t þat ore louerd were i-bore : of þe maide Marie— Swuch manere fals bi-leue : Men cleopeden heresie. A-&yogh;ein heom þis holie man : despuytede alday faste, And manie of heom þoru&yogh; godes grace : into ri&yogh;te bi-leue heom caste. An Eorl þare was in þe londe þo : þat guod Man was i-nou&yogh;: Sire Symon de Mountfort : þat to alle guodnesse drou&yogh;, his fader þat was here a-slawe : a-mong us in Engelonde Atþe batayle of Euesham : þat longue worth onder-stonde. Þis guode kny&yogh;t sire Symon : strong kny&yogh;t was i-nou&yogh; And a-&yogh;ein þis vuele cristine Men : to batayle al day he drou&yogh;. Seint Domenic al-so a-boute &yogh;eode : and prechede a&yogh;ein heom wel faste: So þat þis tweye guode Men : to-gadere heore heorte caste, Þat huy weren boþe at one rede : þe on with his prechingue, Þe oþur with strencþe of bataille : þat folk to guode bringue. And þe guode Erol r. Eorl syre symon : þe &yogh;wile is lijf i-laste, Euere heold op with his power : seint Dompnic wel faste; And þoru&yogh; is pouer muche-del : þe ordre he bi-gan Of frere prechours, þat &yogh;eot is : for-to saui mani a man.— bi-twene þis men for heore heresie : þe striuingue ofte was And þe holie Manne seint Domenic. : ase ore louerd &yogh;af þat cas, Op-on þe hul of vittorie : A day þare was i-nome Of desputisun bi-tweone heom : and þo þe day was i-come, Seint Domenic cam forth þo : and In a writ he brou&yogh;te his resones for cristin-dom : and þis luþere Men it bi-tau&yogh;te, to counseilie heom þare-upon bet : and Answerien þare-to Oþur beon studefastore in heore bi-leue : bote huy heom couþen ondo. þis Men of heore heresie : lou&yogh;wen þo wel smere; A v. om. A gret fuyr huy maden a-non : and þat writ heo casten In þere, And seiden, &yogh;if it barnde þo : of none vertue it nere. Þat writ lay longue in þat fuyr : and neuere þe weorse it nas, Ne nou&yogh;t i-wemned of one lette[r] : and þat was a fair cas! Þo þe luþere Men i-seien þis : a-nuyde huy weren sore; huy nomen þat bok and seiden a-non : þat huy wolden &yogh;eot fondi more: huy casten eft-sone in-to þe fuyr : and þe þridde tyme al-so: And euere þat writ was al-so sound : as it was þare-inne i-do. þis Men of heore heresie : i-schende heom heolden þo— And nolden nou&yogh;t &yogh;eot al clanliche : out of heore folie go.
31.2: Seint domenic þis holie Man : ase ore louerd &yogh;af þat cas, In þe Cite of tolouse : ten &yogh;er to-gadere he was. he þou&yogh;te bi-guynne a-godes name : &yogh;if he mi&yogh;te it bringue to ende, An ordre of Men to prechi faste : and a-boute þe world to wende, þat mi&yogh;ten þoru&yogh;-out cristindom : Men wissi and rede; &YOGH;eorne he bad to Iesu crist : helpe him to þis dede. So þat þe pope Innocent : a gret counseil I-nou&yogh; Makede at rome þulke tyme : and muche folk þudere drou&yogh;. Seint Domenic wel mildeliche : þudere gan to wende, &YOGH;if he mi&yogh;te anie grace habbe : to bringue is ordre to ende. he cam and bad þe pope leue : swuch þing for-to do. þe pope makede him dauncherous : and nolde ensenti þer-to. ¶ A ni&yogh;t, as þe pope lai a-slepe : ase ore louerd &yogh;af þat cas, him þou&yogh;te þat þe churche of rome : al a-doneward was Of "seint Iohanes de lateran" : and as he lai þere he lokede euere and al þat folk : &yogh;wane huy ouer-falle were; And seint Domenic heold up a-&yogh;en : and faste schef with-oute, Wal ant tymber he pulte a-&yogh;ein : and faste orn a-boute. þe pope, þo he a-wok : In grete þou&yogh;te lay &YOGH;wat þis bi-tocningue mi&yogh;te beo : þat he slepinde i-sai&yogh;. he þou&yogh;te þat þe stat of holi churche : swuyþe i-febled were And þat cristine-dom in Manie studes : in ri&yogh;t guod stat it nere, And þat seint Domenic þoru&yogh; is ordre : hire scholde helpe a-rere þoru&yogh; his prechingue wide in londe : cristine men to lere. þe pope a-morewe sente aftur him : and grauntede him wel fawe to maken is ordre a-godes name : and folk to guode drawe; bote þat he he on the margin. heom scheowede is ruyle : to alle is cardinales þere, And þat huy weren i-prouede guode : are huy i-confermede were. So þat þe ordre of frere prechours : seint Domenic bi-gan þo, þat hath i-saued wel mani a man : and &yogh;eot it schal wel mo. clerkes huy onder-fenguen sone : þat þe Abite nome; So þat euere mo and mo : freres þere bi-come.
31.3: SEint Domenic matte þo In a ni&yogh;t : þat seint petur him bi-tok Ane staf, ase he cam to him : and seint powel ane bok. Þo porueide he in is ordre : &yogh;wane freres wenden ouer lond, to bere ane bok at heore rugges : and ane staf in heore hond. Sethþe him þou&yogh;te a-slepe al-so : þat he sai&yogh; þe freres go þoru&yogh; þe londe, two and two : and to-gadere non mo. In-to Tolouse he wende þo : and bi-lefte him-sulf þere, And sone V. summe he sente is freres a-boute : þat huy de-partet were; In-to spaynne he sente some : and to paris al-so, And þat þridde Couent to boloygne : heore ordre forth to do; he het heom wende to and two : and prechi in þat lond, At heore rugge bere ane bok : and ane staf in hore hond. ¶ A wonder sweuene seint Domenic : In his slep i-sei&yogh;: Ore louerd him wrathþede swiþe : op in þe eyr an hei&yogh;, þreo launcene he heold in is hond : þe poynt toward þe grounde, Ri&yogh;t ase he wolde al þene world : þoru&yogh; smyte In one stounde; So ferelich he was to bi-holde : þat it nas non ende. þo cam ore leuedi li&yogh;te a-doun : þat is so milde and hende; "A, mi sone," heo seide, "&yogh;wat þenest þou? : mcrci and þin ore!" "I-nelle," seide ore louerd : "þis sunne : þolie more." he seide, "al þis world is ful of sunne : and ful &yogh;are hath i-beo, And þare-fore i-chulle al þene world a-sle : with þeose launces þreo." Ore leuedi heold up hire hondene : and sat a-doun a-kneo, And seide, "leoue sone, nouþe þin ore! : þov most þe bet bi-seo, þou most þine wratþe mienge : with milce and with ore, And þenche þat þou most milsful beo : And þat þou bou&yogh;test man ful sore." "Moder," seide ore louerd þo : "hov mi&yogh;te ich don þi lore? Ne sixtþou hou men me mis-doth : þat I-ne mai hit þolie more?"
31.4: "Leoue sone," ore lauedi seide : "a-bijd &yogh;eot one stounde: Ich habbe ane guode Caumpiun : to þine bi-hofþe i-founde, þat schal muche del of þat folk : onder þine wille do; And anne felawe i-chulle him bi-take : þat schal helpe him þer-to." "Lat me iseo," ore louerd seide : "i-chulle loki &yogh;weþer huy beon ou&yogh;tes." Ore leuedi nam þo seint domenic : and bi-fore [ore] louerd him brou&yogh;te, And seint Fraunceis al-so guod : "mi sone," heo seide, "lo Mi chaumpiun and his felawe : þat schullen þis dede do." "&YOGH;e," seide ore louerd, "þeos beoth boþe : strongue and guode þer-to : I-chulle heom helpe in heore dedes : and &yogh;iue heom grace al-so." ¶ Seint Domenic a-morewe a-ros : ant to churche wende sone, And on is sweuene þou&yogh;te muche : &yogh;wat him was to done. he stod and bi-heold a-boute : his felawe he gan to V. of seo þat ore lauedi him brou&yogh;te a-ni&yogh;t : is felawe for-to beo. he ne hadde neuer er him i-sei&yogh;e : he descreuede him faste a-non, his face and is bodi al-so : and om. in V. him þou&yogh;te it was swych on. he tok and custe him a-non : ase it was wel ri&yogh;t, And tolde him al V. of al þat cas : hov him matte a-ni&yogh;t; And Eyþer bi-gan to schewi oþur : heore wille and heore þou&yogh;t; So þat huy weren, ase god wolde : in o consent i-brou&yogh;t, And eiþur dude bi oþeres rede : and þeos tweie ordres wrou&yogh;te, Of frere prechours and of frere Menores : ase ore leuedi heom on brou&yogh;te : ¶ Seint Domenic þe ordre of frere prechours : ase ich habbe i-seid, And seint Fraunceis of frere Menores : eiþer bi oþeres red. And sire Symon de Mount-fort : þat guod kni&yogh;t was and hende, Sosteinede þis holie Men : to bringue þis dede to ende.— Ich wene, ich may for soþe it segge : &yogh;if huy nadden i-beo bi-founde, þe world hadde for grete sune i-beo : are þis i-brou&yogh;t to grounde! &YOGH;eot, for al þat heo mouwen a-boute go : to prechi and to schriue, Sunne is &yogh;eot into al þis lond : and wrechhede, al-to riue! here mouwen þis luþere men i-seo : þat euere spekez to quede, In &yogh;wuche manere þis guode men : bi-gunne furst þis dede. Manie of þis deoueles limes : bi-twene heom seggez al day&yogh; : "Wel murie was þe world and guod : are man ani frere i-say&yogh;." Al-so huy spekez, heom bi-fallez : for ore louerd seide, i-wis : "bi þe fruyt man may i-seo : &yogh;wat-manere treo it is : For þare ne may of no luyþur treo : no guod fruyt springue;" vnneþe may a luyþur man ani guod word : out of him-sulue bringue. huy mouwen loki &yogh;wanne ore louerd : heom smyt, harde i-nou&yogh;, with one of his launces þreo : þat he to heom drou&yogh;, þat was for þis tweie holie men : þulke tyme on-do; Fondi heo mouwen heore wyþer-wine [&yogh;wan] om. huy comiez þar-to. Ake hit ne worth neuere fals : þat ore louerd him-self sede : þat his desciples scholden i-blessede beo : &yogh;wanne men hem spekez to quede And seggez heom scorn and bysemare : for ore louerdes name. bi þe freres þus it is : of Men þat seggez heom schame; Ake ore louerd him-sulf wole wreche nime : þei it were þo with-drawe For seint Domenic þe holie Man : and seint Fraunceis, is felawe.— þis holie Man seint dominic : In-to his ordre he nam Ane &yogh;oungue clerk at one tyme : þat frere prechour bi-cam And sethþe þoru&yogh; þe feondes lore : with-drou&yogh; him atþen-ende And seide þat he wolde a-&yogh;ein : to þe worlde wende; he dude of is Abite : and is schurte on him caste. Seint Dominic sat a-doun a-kneo : and for him bad wel faste. Ase he seide is oresones : þe clerk bi-gan to weopen sore And pitou[s]liche bi-gan to crie : "a! nouþe merci, louerd, þin ore! þis schurte MS. schrurte þat is a-boute me : for-brennez me to grounde; Drawez hire of for godes loue : oþur ich deie in luyte stounde." So þat þoru&yogh; ore louerdes grace : him þou&yogh;te he was for-brent, Are he nome a-&yogh;ein is Abite : and hadde is heorte i-wend.
31.5: BI a frere al-so at boloyne : bi-feol swych a cas þat of þe feond i-fondet was : and with-inne him al-so he was. Seint Domenic it of-þou&yogh;te sore : and het a-godes name þene feond to helle wende a-non : and seide, "&yogh;wi dostþou me schuch schame?" "þov ne þart me blamie nou&yogh;t : for with ri&yogh;te ich am here," Diaboius. þe feond Answerede seint Domenic : ase he was in þe frere, "For þes frere cam &yogh;ursterday to toune : and dronk with-oute leue. Ase a luyte mot þare-Inne ich lay : and bi-gan with-inne him weue; For he ne blessede nou&yogh;t is drinke : and with-oute leue it nam, Wit lawe ich mai in him beo : and with lawe in him ich am." "Certes," seide þis frere, "he seith soth : and ri&yogh;t so it is. Ichot, i dronk &yogh;urstai in toune : with-oute leue, i-wis, And Ine blessede nou&yogh;t mi drinke : and a swuch mot þare was Inne, And with þat drinke þat ich dronk : it schet me sone with-Inne. Euer-eft he hath I-greued me. : ore louerd fram me him bringue!" Ase huy tolden here-a-boute : to Matynes huy gonne ringue. ¶ "Out, out," quath þe deuel þo : "a-wei ich mot gon : þis þeues with þis wide hodes : a-rise wollez a-non, And I-ne dar nou&yogh;t a-bide heore song : adrad ich am wel sore." he fleu out of þis selie man : and ne cam nei&yogh; him non-more.— As þe holie man seint Domenic : and his felawes come with-oute Tolouse bi a watur : ase huy hadden er i-lome, heore bokes fullen into þe watur : and sonken a-non to grounde. huy wenden forth in heore wei : þo huy ne mi&yogh;ten beon i-founde. þare cam þane þridde day : a fischare with is ginne And caste is nettes in þat watur. : þo felde he heui with-Inne. þou&yogh;te he, "here is fisch i-nou&yogh;" : and bi-gan to drawe faste : þe holie manness bokes it weren. : þo huy comen forth atþe laste, Also sounde huy weren and druye : ase huy euerer were; For al þat huy leien in þat watur : no-þing þe worse huy nere.— ¶ At one tyme seint Domenic : at rome was i-sete, And fourti of is freres al-so : with him to þe mete. huy nadden bote a luyte bred— : wel luyte was þe lestes, And alle huy maden heom also Ioifole : ase huy weren at one feste. Ake natheles huy weren of-hungrede sore : þei huy so glade were. þo comen þare tweie children In : with wel milde chere; Abite of freres huy hadden up-on : fairore neuere nere : In heore lappene huy brou&yogh;ten mete : ant to seint Domenic hit bere. þo huy hadden him þis mete i-take : huy nusten &yogh;ware huy bi-come. þis freres maden heom glade I-nou&yogh; : and wordeliche forth it nome.— ¶ A dai, as þis holie Man : in þe Contreie we[n]de, þat lodlokeste weder þat mi&yogh;te beo : ore louerd ouer him sende. he bi-gan to maken is oresun : his felawe was in doute. þat weder bi-gan to reinie faste : in eche side a-boute; Ake sone it &yogh;af him roume V. Ac hit bigon to &yogh;iue him wei : and al-a-boute with-drawe, þat bi fif fet it ne cam nou&yogh;t him nei&yogh; : ne al-so nei&yogh; his felawe.
31.6: BI-side þe Cite of Toluse bi a watur huy come. A man ladde heom ouer In a schip : ase he dude oþere i-lome. Seint Domenic wolde wende is wei : þo he to londe cam. þe passour him het a-bide : and bi þe cope him nam, And seide, he scholde him paye is huyre : were him leof þe loth, he nolde him serui so for nou&yogh;t : and þarto he swor is oth. "Lat me," seide þis holie Man : "par charite forth quijt gon, And god wole &yogh;elden þi trauail : for i-ne habbe seoluer non." "Al for nou&yogh;t," seide þes oþur : "bi þe fei þat i schal to þe, Mi trauail þou schalt me paie : oþur þi cope bi-leue with me." "&YOGH;wane þou nelt," quath þe holie man : "for godes loue nou&yogh;t do, Ich bidde god, &yogh;if is wille beo : þat he helpe me þer-to." þo lay bi-side þe schipe þere : a peni, fair I-nov&yogh;. þe passour beu&yogh; a-doun a-non : and þane peni to him drou&yogh;. "NIm þare," seide þis holie man : "ase ore louerd sende þe. For i-nabbe mi-sulf nou&yogh;t : ore louerd a-quitez me." Ore suete louerd nolde nou&yogh;t : þat þe freres i-lette were; him-sulf he sende heom heore schip-huyre. : fair miracle was þere!— ¶ Al-so þis holie man a ni&yogh;t : In his oresones lay bi him-sulf in priueite : ase he dude ni&yogh;t and day, þe deuel cam and stod bi him : In Abite of frere. "Womme," seide þe holie man : "&yogh;wat dost þov nouþe here? &YOGH;wy nartþov In þine bedde a-slepe : In þe dortour with þine fere? þov wost wel it nis nou&yogh;t ordre : ne non ri&yogh;t guod manere." þe Deuel stod and made him signe : ase ho-so seith "i-nelle nou&yogh;t speke Ne so muche mis-don a-&yogh;eines god : is ordre for-to breke." V. has 2 vv. more. ¶ Seint Domenic hadde wonder þar-of : &yogh;wat frere it mi&yogh;te beo þat so wel is ordre heold. : he þou&yogh;te he wolde i-seo : he wende and li&yogh;te ane candle : and bi-heold þis frere. þo he wuste &yogh;wat he was : he þou&yogh;te &yogh;wat dost þou here; he blamede him MS. he&dotb; i o&dotb;m suyþe muche : &yogh;wat he dude þo þere, For it were betere is ri&yogh;te : þat he in helle were. diabolus. ¶ "þou mis-dest more," þe deuel seide : "þin ordre for-to breke : For þou wost wel þis tyme : it ne fallez þe nou&yogh;t to speke." Dominicus. ¶ "þou ne seist nou&yogh;t ri&yogh;t," quath seint Domenic : "for þe prior may, For-to wissi is &yogh;oungue freres : speken ni&yogh;t and day. Ich hote þat þou me telle : nouþe þou art allingues here, &YOGH;ware-with þou fondest mest : In churche ani frere." ¶ "bote ich makie," seide þe deuel þo : "late to churche gon, diabolus. And &yogh;wane he alles þare-inne is : out þannes to wiende a-non." Dominicus. Of þe dortore he axede him : &yogh;wat were þare is dede. diabolus. ¶ "bote ich makie freres to ligge longue : in heore bedde," he sede, "And þe [&yogh;wile] om. huy þarinne beoth : huy þenchez V. þenken on vuel þou&yogh;t. hit is on of Mine beste hous : Inelle bi-leue it nou&yogh;t." Dominicus. ¶ Seint Domenic axede of þe freitore : "&yogh;wat is þi dede þere?" diabolus. "bote ich fondi þe dedes þere : of glotonie for-to a-rere; Ich makie freres to muchel ete : and to drinke al-so, For-to maken heom feble : godes seruise to do." Dominicus. ¶ "&YOGH;wat In þe parlore?" seint Domenic seide : "beo nouþe soth a-knouwe!" diabolus. "A, beo stille," seide þe schrewe þo : "þat hous is al min owe : For ich heom makie telle þere : euerech oþur tyþingue, And make heom þenche and speke al-so : of folies and lesinge." Dominicus. ¶ "And &yogh;wat þe chapitle?" seint Domenic seide : "mi&yogh;t þou þare ou&yogh;t winne?" diabolus. "A, beo stille," þe schrewe seide : "neuere Ine cam þare-Inne. Longue, for þou it hast i-nemd : þe worse me schal beo. God ne suffri me neuere þare-inne come : ne enes it i-seo! Al þat ich habbe i-wonne a-day : and þe ni&yogh;t bi-fore, Sone so þine freres þudere comieth : al ich habbe i-lore; I-wyped it is al V. as clene a-wey : ase it neuere nere. A-corsed is al þulke stude : ne come ich neuere þere." þo wende þe schrewe is wei : and luyte hadde i-wonne, And þe holie man is beden seide : ase he hadde bi-gonne.—
31.7: LOngue leouede þis holie man : in guode liue i-nou&yogh;, And is ordre in guod poynt brou&yogh;te : are he to deþe drou&yogh;; At þe laste, ase god it wolde : þat he scholde heonnes wende, A V. Atte frere prechur[s] of boloygne : [he] drov toward is ende. he hadde a couent of [twelue] freres : þo he drou toward þe deþe. his V. þis twelf freres bi-fore him comen : him-seolf was þe þretteþe : The half-lines transp. in V. he prechede heom faire i-nou&yogh; : to siwi godes lore, For-to holden þe ordre wel : and to echen as more and more. Of þreo þing he made is testament V. quide : ri&yogh;t bi-fore his deþe : pouerte,. and loue,. and Meoknesse : his breþren he dude om. in V. bi-queþe; þat huy weren euere in guode loue : and in Meoknesse al-so, And þat huy ladden heore lijf in pouerte : and euere heolden þer-to. For he foundede hore ordre furst : ope þeos þingues þreo And bi-quath sethþen alle þo : þat wolden is breþren beo. he &yogh;af alle godes curs and his : þat his ordre fuylden ou&yogh;t with grete richesse and worldes feo : for þe ordre it nolde nou&yogh;t. þo he hadde imaked is testament : he deide ri&yogh;t in þe place And bi-tei&yogh;te þe ordre and is soule : al In ore louerdes grace. he deide twelf hundred &yogh;er : and four-score V. twenti &yogh;er and on orig. two Aftur þat ore louerd nam : of is moder flechs and bon. And endleue houndret &yogh;er : and four-score &yogh;er and tene Aftur þat ore louerd on eorþe cam : he bi-gan þe ordre, ich wene. Wel au&yogh;te we blessi þe tyme : þat euere he was bi-gunne : For mani a soule, ichot, he hath : to godes bi-hofþe i-wonne.— ¶ þo þis holie Man seint Dominic : bi-gan of þis liue gon, Into þe Ioye of heuene : his soule wende a-non. For ase þe prior of bixe V. Bride : þo in is bedde a-slepe lay, hym þou&yogh;te ri&yogh;t þulke tyme : þat he a gret laddre i-say, þe laddre schon swyþe bri&yogh;te : into heuene an hei&yogh;; Ore louerd on-ouewarde : and ore leuedi he i-sei&yogh;, Al bi-neoþe sat a frere : in is scapelori &yogh;wijt, his hod i-drawe ouer is ei&yogh;en : ri&yogh;t in his Abijt; Ase he sat on þis laddre lowe : on þe neþemeste roungue, Aungles þare eoden up and doun : And swiþe murie huy songue. Ore louerd heold þis laddre an hei&yogh; : and ore leuedi also, And drowen þane frere up þare-bi : þat þar-on was i-do, In his Abijte huy drowen him up : in-to heouene an hei&yogh;; And al þat clere lij&yogh;t of heouene : him þou&yogh;te þat he i-sei&yogh;, And heouene smot to-gadere a-non : þo he was with-Inne i-brou&yogh;t. Þo þis prior a-wok : he lay in grete þou&yogh;t; his breþren he let cleopie a-non : and seide, "ichot, i-wis, Þat þis holie man seint Domenic : out of þis liue he is; For i sai&yogh; him ri&yogh;t nouþe," he seide : "to þe Ioye of heuene go." Þe soþe huy of-Axeden sethþe : þat he deide ri&yogh;t þo.— bidde we &yogh;eorne seint Dominic : þat þe ordre hath i-wrou&yogh;t, Þat we beon forth with him : to þe Ioye of heuene i-brou&yogh;t. bidde we ore louerd and ore lauedi : for seint Dominikes loue Þat we moten aftur ore ende-day : to þe blisse of heuene come.

32.1: TEofle was a swyþe gret man : And guod clerk he was al-so, hext Maister bi-fore alle oþere : under þe bischope i-do. Þo þe bischop was ded : Teofle was forth ibrou&yogh;t to beon bischop aftur him. : ake natheles he nolde [nout], nout added later. And seide þat he nas nou&yogh;t wuyrþe þare-to : and guod he couþe to luyte. Þat folke made ane oþe r ne sone : with grete nobleye and with pruyte. Þo þe bischop in MS. is his power was : to teofle wrathþe he caste, For he was raþur to bischope i-chose : and with þe oþur bischope heold faste : he dude him out of his mester : and is guod him bi-nam. So þat Teofle þare-aftur-ward : in-to grete pouerte bi-cam; Al-so riche man ase he was er : ase pouere he was þo; So þat he nuste &yogh;ware-bi libbe. : welle, þat him was wo! Þo he was in Miseise i-brou&yogh;t : him schamede swiþe sore : Men þat him honoured er : þo nolden huy non-more; Ech man tolde luyte of him— : for of þe pouere Men wollez so. he ne mi&yogh;te for schame a-mong men come : he nuste &yogh;wat for-to do, Þene deth he wilnede þingue mest. : so þat he him bi-þou&yogh;te Þat, ho-so þene feond serui wolde : in grete richesse he him brou&yogh;te. to a giv he wende a ny&yogh;t : þat wonede þare-bi-side; he bad him helpe of þat cas : þat gan him þare bi-tide, And him to serui for richesse : þene deuel a-boute wel wide. "Wel, it schal beo," þe giv seide : "ake &yogh;eot þou most a-bide; Cum oþur ny&yogh;t þis tyme : In þis stude here to me And i-chulle þe swuch red do : þat wel schal liki þe." ¶ Teofle ne fur-&yogh;at nou&yogh;t þis. : to þe giv he eode In þat ilke stude þat oþur ni&yogh;t : to beten is grete neode. "Cum forth with me," quath þe giv : "ase ich þe wolle lede. Ake of &yogh;wat þu iseo oþur heore : ne haue þou none drede, Ne make no signe of þe creoyz : ne þeron ne þench ri&yogh;t nou&yogh;t, And in swuche richesse nere þou neuere : ase þov worst sone i-brou&yogh;t."
32.2: TEofle wende forth with him : and dude ase he him sede. Into a priue stude he cam sone : ase þe giv gan him lede : Þene heie feond he fond þere : Maister of alle quede, And al his maynie a-boute him : for-to a-counti heore mis-dede. "&YOGH;wat is he þat ilke," quath þe schrewe : "þat þov bringuest with þe?" "he schal beon of þine," quath þe giv : "and for neode he cam to þe. A man he was of gret pouwer : þat is nouþe him bi-nome, And for-to bringue him into richesse al. him in a-&yogh;ein : þi Man he schal bi|come." "Wel-come, beu frere," þe feond seide : "nouþe þou dost wel, i-wis! haddest þov i-don þus mani day : riche þou were are þis. bi-com mi Man, and do me homage : and þov schalt beo riche i-nov&yogh;; For I-nelle no man helpe bote mine owene : and elles I dude wov&yogh;." ¶ "Ich bi-come þi man," quath Teofle : "and clanliche to þe take." al. 4 vv. more. "Certes, beau frere," quath þe Deuel : "wel muche þov most for|sake : Þov most fur-sake god þat þe schop : and alle halewene also." "And ich heom for-sake," Teofle seide : "for þine wille ichulle do." "Saunz faille, beu frere," þe Deuel seide : "þou ne mi&yogh;test speke no bet. Þou art nouþe sone riche man I-nov&yogh;. : ake oþing &yogh;eot þe let; bote þou it do, it is for nou&yogh;t : al þat we habbez i-do : Þou most for-sake for-with al. forþ mid god : Marie, is moder, al-so; For bote þou it wolle do : i-nam siker of þe nou&yogh;t— For manie þat weren in Mine se[r]uise : heo hath fram me ibrou&yogh;t." "And ich fur-sake," Teofle seide : "hire sone, and hire al-so, And þe ich bi-take lijf and soule : al þine wille to do." "Ov, beu frere," þe deuel seide : "&yogh;eot ich am a-drad : For Marie so ofte hath : mine Men fram me i-lad; Word nis a-&yogh;ein hire bote wind : for þei a man hire for-sake, &YOGH;if he wole a-&yogh;ein to hire i-wende : gladliche heo wole him take. Þare-fore ichulle beon siker of þe : er ich mongy with þe : guode chartres of þis foreward : þou schalt makie me, And writen hire with þine owene honde : and a-selen hire al-so. &YOGH;wan þou hast i-don al þis : þine wille ichulle do." Teofle grauntede þis a-non : þe chartre he wrou&yogh;te sone And a-selede hire with is ryng : ase foreward was to done; he sat on kneo and tok is maister : and custe is fet al-so. "Nouþe, teofle," þe schrewe seide : "þov hast al wel i-dc. Þis chartre ichulle so faste bi bi superscrbd. -louke : In helle, &yogh;wanne ich hom come, Þat I ne drede me nou&yogh;t þat heo worþe : þoru&yogh; Marie me bi-nome. And wiend þou hom, and beo studefast : ase ichulle a&yogh;ein þe : So riche man nere þou neuere : ase þou worst sone þoru me." Þe feond wende hom to helle : and teofle hom al-so, And þonkede þe gywe alle guode : þat he him hadde ido.
32.3: A-Morewe, so sone ase hit was day : þe bischop after teofle sende, Þat he to him wel hasteliche : with-oute ani defaute wende. Merci he criede wel deolfulliche : þo he to him cam, And bi-tok him a&yogh;ein is power : þat he er him bi-nam. Teofle bi-cam a-non so riche : þat so riche man non nas; Ase louerd and sire ech man him heold : wel muche is power was; Eche man was glad to queme him. : Men wondreden of þat cas, And seiden, "it nis in þis world : bote si haut e si bas." Worldes richesse he hadde i-nou&yogh; : and worldes blisse al-so. Alas, þat ani cristine Man scholde : in þat manere come þare-to! ¶ Hit bi-feol þare-after-ward : In wel luyte stounde Þat þe giv þat him þere-to brou&yogh;te : with tricherie was i-founde; I-nome he was and to dome i-brou&yogh;t : and to strongue deþe i-do : Fur-barnd he was þoru Iuggement : and to late he was so! ¶ Þo teofle him onder-stod—: In is heorte he þou&yogh;te Þat þe Deuel, with &yogh;wam þe giv was : to þulke deþe him brou&yogh;te. Þou&yogh;te he, "nam ich al-so with him? : and þei ich beo riche ane stounde, Ne schal ich neuere i-wite þe tyme : are he me bringue to grounde : Þanne were ich fur-lore lijf and soule! : and ich am to him i-bounde So faste, þat Ine may me with-drawe. : alas þat ilke stounde! Alas, &yogh;wy ne hadde ich i-beo raþur ded : þane MS. þanne i-don þulke dede! Nabbe ich fur-sake heom echone : þat me scholden helpe and rede? hou mi&yogh;te ich hopie of grace : &yogh;wane ich heom habbe fur-sake? A sunful wreche ich am, alas : nas neuere i-seie mi make! god is so ri&yogh;tful þat to him : ne hopie ich nou&yogh;t þere-fore. bote ich habbe ore leuedie grace : certus, ich am fur-lore. For heo was euere ful of milce : and þei ich hire habbe for-sake, hou ich euere þare-of spede : to hire grace ichulle me take." To churche he wende to ore leuedi auter : and cride hire milce and ore, his kneon he beot a-&yogh;ein þe eorþe : weopinde swyþe sore On hire he cride and weop ful sore : boþe ny&yogh;t and day, Out of þe chapele nolde he nou&yogh;t : ake euere þare-inne he lay.
32.4: FOurty dayes and fourty ny&yogh;t : on hire he criede faste. hire milce, þat euere was so guod : heo scheowede him at þe laste : For ase he criede on hire so &yogh;eorne : þat swete mayde so hende cudde hire milde-hede, and fram heouene : to him a-doun gan wende. "hov mi&yogh;te ich," heo seide, "þou wrechche Man : eny grace þe take, And hou mi&yogh;te ich to mi sone for þe bidde : &yogh;wane þou hast him for-sake?" "A, leuedi, leuedi," teofle seide : "nouþe, leuedi, þin ore! Ich habbe i-sunegut manne mest : þat rewez me wel sore. haue merci of þis sunfule wrechche! : I-nelle do sunne non-more, Ake, &yogh;if þou wolt me þine grace &yogh;iue : Ichulle don al þi lore." "Þov sunfule man," ore leuedi seide : "ase muche ase on me is, to þe ichulle beo milde I-nov&yogh; : and to alle cristine men, i-wis : For ich louie muche cristine Men : And norichi heom al-so, and euere am redi to heom a-li&yogh;te : heore bone forto do; And swiþe muche ich þolie ofte : mine sone to maken liþe, Þat he ne nimez of heom grete wreche : ase he wolde ofte-siþe. Ake sch[r]yf þe to him of þine sunnes : þat was i-bore of me And þat þolede deth for sunfule men : and ichulle bidde for þe." "Leuedi, merci," Teofle seide : "vnwuyrþe ich am þer-to, with þat Mouth þat ich him for-sok : swuch schrift to him do." "&YOGH;us, hardiliche," ore leuedi seide : "for he is milde and softe; Wel þou wost þat sunfule men : gret loue he cuth wel ofte. For he was for sunfule Men i-bore : and to deþe for heom i-do, he mot nede to heom beo milde : for ri&yogh;t kuynde it wole so."
32.5: Teofle bi-gan þo weope and crie : "louerd, merci," he sede, "to þe ich me schriue with deolful heorte : for mi luþer mis|dede. haue merci of me, al-so wisliche : ase þou were for me i-bore And for us þoledest deth : þat we ne scholden beo fur-lore! Þench nouþe, louerd, on mine wrechhede! : swete Ihesu, þin ore! Do me þine milce, ich bidde þe, louerd : i-nelle do sunne neuere-eft more." ¶ "Teofle, teofle," ore leuedi seide : "for þi cristine-dom, An for pite þat ich habbe of cristine men : sethþe mi sone mi flesch nom, I-chulle bidde on mine bare kneon : mi sone for þe MS. me wel sone. beo studefast, ase þou hast bi-gonne MS. bi-goume : and he wole i-heore þi bone." with þis word Teofle nuste : &yogh;ware ore leuedi bi-com. he weop and cride euere &yogh;eorne : and al to hire grace him nom. Þreo dawes with-oute mete and drinke : þare he gan a-bide In wop and sor and deol j-nou&yogh; : on ore leuedi euere he criede.
32.6: Ore lauedi cam þo al li&yogh;inde : and with glade semblaunt also, "Teofle," heo seide, "þou hast nouþe sone : penaunce i-nou&yogh; i-do; beo glad and bliþe, for ich habbe i-bede : mine sone milce and ore, Þat he hath þine sunnes þe fur-&yogh;yue. : ne sunegue þov nonmore!" "I-hered beo þov," teofle seide : "and þi holie grace, And i-blessed beo þe tyme þat ich to þe : criede in þusse place! Leuedi, euere ich am a-drad : and siker nam ich nou&yogh;t, Are þe chartre þat ich him om. him made : leuedi, to me beo i-brou&yogh;t : Leuedi, þou art ful of milce : þat þou me schewest in þis place : &YOGH;wane þi milce, leuedi, is so muche : do me þerof þine grace!" "Nov sone, theofle," ore leuedi seide : "&yogh;eot ichulle þe milde beo," with þis word heo wende forth : þat he ne mi&yogh;te hire more i-seo. hire milce heo scheowede, for heo cam : to him þene þridde day And brou&yogh;te þe chartre and bi-tei&yogh;te as him : ase he a-slepe lay, And wende a-&yogh;ein wel stilleliche— : and þo Theofle a-wok, Þe chartre he heold in is hond : þat ore leuedi him bi-tok. glad and bliþe he was i-nou&yogh; : and me þunchez þat he wel ou&yogh;te! Ore lauedie he þonkede and hire grace : þat to swuche guodnesse him brou&yogh;te. al. 2 vv. more. ¶ Þis cas bi-feol in leinte : on a satures-day at ni&yogh;t. A-morewe, þene sonenday : þe day was cler and bri&yogh;t al. as þe day was li&yogh;t , Þe bischop and is clerkes : and muche folk al-so to churche comen, ase ri&yogh;t was : godes seruise to do. Ri&yogh;t þo godspel was i-rad : Theofle forth him wende, To þe bischopes fet he feol a-doun : and þene Deuel more he schende : he tolde þe bischope euerech del : and al þe folke al-so, Þat foreward MS. fereward and þe sikernesse : þat he hadde þe Deuele i-do, And hov of þe Deueles mi&yogh;te : ore swete leuedi him caste And brou&yogh;te him þe chartres þat he made : þat bi-loke was in helle faste. Þe chartre bi-fore al þat folk : he let þe bischope rede, Þat ech man i-sei&yogh;e is luþere sunne : and ore leuedie mildhede. Þa[t] folk wolde þe chartre witen : for miracle, þat al. as huy bede. "A, Merci, merci, for godes loue" : Theofle ofte seide, "For þe &yogh;wyle þe chartre is i-hol : &yogh;eot euere-more me dredeth; Are heo beo to douste i-brent : siker lijf ne mai ich lede." Þe chartre huy barnden bi-fore heom alle : þat ech man mi&yogh;te i-seo. "Certes, nouþe ich hopie," theofle seide : "þat siker ich mouwe beo." ¶ Þo þe bischop hadde is masse i-do : þat folk cam mani-folde A-boute Theofle in eche side : þat wonder to bi-holde. bri&yogh;tore þane þe sonne, heom þou&yogh;te : he schon in-to al is face, Þat non ne mi&yogh;te for bri&yogh;thede : bi-holde him in þat place. he liet dele and &yogh;iue pouere men : þat al. his guod wel clene þere, And seide þat he out of churche nolde : þe &yogh;wile he a-liue were. To þe stude he wende a-non : þat al. þer ore leuedi to him a-li&yogh;te And brou&yogh;te him þe chartres of is sunnes : þoru&yogh; hire swete mi&yogh;te. A-non-ri&yogh;t he bi-gan to sikni : and þare ri&yogh;t a-doun lay; his breþren he custe echone : and deide þene þridde day. þat folk dude bi him þat was to done : and bureden him ri&yogh;t þere. his soule wende to heuene MS. henene anon : þare I-cholde we alle were. For he is a seint in heuene an hei&yogh; : and his day fallez in þe &yogh;ere A luyte bi-fore Aueryl : ase þe bok us doth lere. Wel fair Miracle ore leuedi dude : þat brou&yogh;te him of þulke wo, Ase heo hath manye oþere i-don : and &yogh;eot heo wole wel mo.

33.1: SEint George þe holie man : ase we findez i-write, In þe londe of Cappadoce : he was i-bore and bi-&yogh;ite. þe false godes he for-sok : and tornede to cristine-dom, And louede Iesu crist swiþe wel : and holi man bi-com. Dacian, þe luþere prince : þat was in þulke stounde, Alle þe cristine men þat he fond : he let bringue to grounde. A day, ase he honourede is false godes : and oþere manie on, Seint George I-sai&yogh; al þis : ase he cam þare-forth gon. þe signe he made of þe croiz : and blessede him al-a-boute And Armede him þoru&yogh; þe holie gost : with-Inne and with-oute, he wende him forth wel baldeliche : and wel loude bi-gan to grede To Dacian and to Alle his : and þeose wordes sede : "Alle false godes so beoth : deuelschine, i-wis; For ore louerd made heuene : ase in þe sautere i-writen it is." þo Dacian i-heorde þis : he grennede and femde faste, And lourede with sori semblaunt : and þeos wordes out he caste : "Belamy, &yogh;wat art þou : þat so gret fol art and so bold, þat in ovre power and bi ovre godes : swuche wordes hast i-told? þov ne dost us nou&yogh;t one schame : ase we alle I-seoth, Ake ore godes and us, &yogh;wane þou seist : þat huy deuelene beoth. Tel me sone of &yogh;wannes þou art : and &yogh;wat is þi ri&yogh;te name, þat darst us segge and ore godes : þus baldeliche swch MS. schwch schame." "George, ich hote," þis oþur seide : "and cristine man ich am, And out of þe lond of cappadoce : hidere to eov ich cam." "bel amy," seide Dacian : "torne þi word a-non And honoure here ovre godes : oþur it schal an-oþur gon." "Beo stille, þov fol," seint George seide : "þou spext embe nou&yogh;t, For ich habbe on Iesu crist : I-fastned al mi þou&yogh;t." "A, traytour," seide Dacian : "wolt þov take on so? þov schalt in oþere ribaudies : sone dai&yogh;es beo i-do." he liet him hangi up an hei&yogh; : In one-manere rode And þare-to him binde faste al naked : with ropes strongue and guode. with kene Owles þer-under : þe tormentores stode And to-drowen is holie lymes : þat faste huy ronne on blode; Al huy to-teren is te[n]dre flesch : þe peces fullen to grounde; Brenninde eoyle huy nomen sethþe : and casten In þe wounde. þo huy hadden him so longue to-drawe : þat reouþe it was to seo, huy bi-þou&yogh;ten heom of more wo : and nomen him a-doun of þe treo : with smarte scourges huy leiden on him : and wounde op-on oþur made— to þe bare bon þe scourgene comen : ase þe Owles hadden i-wade; þe woundene huy selten sethþe : and salt ful þicke caste, And sethþe with a clout of here : roddeden þe woundes faste. louerd, muche was þe pine þat he hadde : ech ope oþur þere, þo men selten so is quike flesch : and roddeden so with here! Reuþe it was swuch pine to se : ho-so ou&yogh;t of reuþe were; And euere lay þe guode Man : ase þei him noþing nere. ¶ þo Dacian i-sai&yogh; þat he ne mi&yogh;te : ouer-comen him so, he let binde þene holie man : and in strongue prisone do. þare he lai al þe longue ni&yogh;t : to oþur wo þat he hadde. A-morewe þe tormentores eft-sone : bi-fore Daciane him ladden. In eche manere huy fondeden þo : &yogh;if huy mi&yogh;ten tuyrne is þou&yogh;t. Ake þo huy i-sei&yogh;en euerech-one : þat it was al for nou&yogh;t, Dacian let makie a weol of bras : so strong ase he mi&yogh;te, And scharpe sweordes wel þicke a-boute : þare-on faste he pi&yogh;te : he let nime þis holie man : and þare-aboue him do, þat þe swerdes scholden is bodi to-rende : and to-drawe al-so. So sone ase huy þis guode man : a-boue þusse &yogh;weole brou&yogh;te, þat &yogh;weol to-brac, ase god it wolde : and to-bruysde al-to nou&yogh;te; So þat þis holie man : harmles þarof he was. Dacian was swiþe wroth : þo he i-sai&yogh; þat cas. ¶ A forneis he let maken al. nyme of bras : and fullen it ful of led; he let maken a strong fuyr i-nov&yogh; : ase he nam sone is red. Þo þat led was al i-molte : and boylede swiþe faste, he let nimen þis holie man : and ri&yogh;t a-middes caste.
33.2: SEint George nam up is hond : and þe croiz bi-fore him made, And in þe wallinde led : baldeliche he gan wade. þare-Inne he sat wel softe a-doun : ase þei him noþing nere, And leonede to þe brerde stille : ase þei he a-slepe were; he lai ase þei he in reste were : for-to þat led atþe laste was al in-to þe colde i-turnd : þat boylede er so faste. Louerd, muche is þi mi&yogh;te : ase men mi&yogh;ten þare i-seo, þat ani man mi&yogh;te in þe wallinde led : so longue harmles beo! ¶ þo Dacian þis i-sei&yogh; : his wit him was nei&yogh; bi-nome; "Mahun," he seide, "hov geth þis? : &yogh;ware is novþe þi mi&yogh;te bi-come? &YOGH;wane I-ne may þis foule þeof : ouer-come in þusse wise, I schal bi-nime him sone is lijf : þare he ne schal neuere a-rise." his dom he gan to &yogh;iue a-non : þat huy seint George nome And drowen him þoru&yogh;-ovt out superscribed. al þe toun : for-to-huy with-oute come, [& þat] om. in the MS. huy smiten of his heued : with-oute þe toun atþe laste, And is bodi þare in sum foul place : to wilde bestes it caste. Þo þis dom was þus I&yogh;yue : hit nas nou&yogh;t i-lete : huy nomen and drowen þis holie man : villiche þoru&yogh; þe strete, Forto huy comen with-oute toun : þare huy wolden is heued of smite. heore wepne huy drowen forth and &yogh;wetten hem : kene forto bite. "Leoue breþren," seint George seide : "one stounde a-bidez &yogh;uyte, For-to ich habbe to Iesu crist : mine bone i-bede a luyte." ¶ his hondene he heold up on hei&yogh; : a-doun he sat on kneo, And seide, "swete louerd Iesu crist : þat alle þing mi&yogh;t i-seo, graunte me, &yogh;if þi wille is : þat, ho-so in guode manere halewez mine day in Aueril : for mi loue on eorþe here, þat þare ne falle in þat hous : no qualm in al þe &yogh;ere, Ne gret sijknesse ne hongur strong : þat þarof beo no fere; And ho-so in perile of þe se : to me bit is bone, Oþur in any oþur stude perilous : louerd, þov helpe heom sone!" ¶ þo i-heorden huy a voiz in heuene : þat to him seide, i-wis : "Mi blessede child, cum here forth to me : þi bone i-heord is." þo is heued was of i-smite : ase al þat folk i-sei&yogh;, Aungles nomen is swete soule : and to heuene beren on hei&yogh;. þare he is in grete Ioye : þat last with-outen ende. Nov god for seint Georges loue : late ore soule þudere wende.

34.1: SEint Eadmund þe holie kyng : i-bore was here bi este The half-lines al. transposed. In þe on ende of Engelonde : of &yogh;wam Men makiez feste; For of southfolke he was kyng : and of þe contreie wel wide. Þare weren in Enguelonde þo : kyngus in fale side. Swyþe fair kny&yogh;t and strong he was : and hardi and quoynte, Meoke and milde and ful of milce : and large in eche poynte. Twey princes of an oþur lond : þat weren in luþere þou&yogh;te, Nomen heore red to-gadere faste : to bringue enguelond to nou&yogh;te; hubba was þat on i-hote : and þat oþur hei&yogh;te hynguar. Into enguelond huy comen with gret fierd : are ani man were i-war : In North-humberlond huy bi-gunne : and þare huy slowen to grounde And robbeden and barnden al to nou&yogh;t : and destruyden al þat huy founde. þo huy hadden north-humberlond : clanliche a-doun i-brou&yogh;t, Al-so huy wolden al enguelond : and þou&yogh;ten huy nolden blinne nou&yogh;t : hynguar, þat þe o. maister was : his felawe he bi-lefde þere, hubba, [&] wende here bi este : to quelle þat þare were. Of þe guodnesse of seint Eadmund : he heorde muche telle : Into is lond he wende a-non : to fondi him to quelle. Into is hexte toune he cam : er any man were i-war, And robbede furst al þat he fond : and made þane toun wel bar; And al-so he slov þat folk to grounde : al þat he mi&yogh;te of-gon, &YOGH;ong and old, wyf and Mayde : he ne sparede neuere on. children fram heore moder breste : he drov and let heom quelle And al-to-hewe bi-fore þe moderes : þat reuþe it was to telle; ¶ þare-After he let þe Moderes a-sle : sorewe þare was I-nov&yogh;! þane toun he barnde al to douste : and al þat folk a-slov&yogh;. he axede at some of þe men : &yogh;ware heore kyng were; And huy tei&yogh;ten him &yogh;ware he was : huy ne dorsten non-oþur for fere : In þe toune of Eglesdone : a guod wei þannes, he was. þo þe luþere prince heorde þat : he ne made no softe pas, Ake wende him þudere ful hastifliche : with is luþere men ech-one. huy comen and metten þane holie kyng : with-oute þe &yogh;ate al one. A-non so hynguar wuste þat it was he : he let him nime þere, And bi-segi is Men alle : þat with-Inne were. ¶ þis holie kyn[g] was faste Inome. : and In a luyte stounde Bi-fore þe prince he was i-lad : naked and faste i-bounde, vv. 37-8 are to be transposed. For-to a-fongue þare is dom : and non so men him nome (!), al.: þo his dom was i&yogh;yue, faste me him nom Ri&yogh;t as men ladden ore louerd bi-fore pilatus : for-to a-fongue is dome. In a wode as he was i-lad : to a treo huy him bounde And with smarte scourges beoten him sore : and maden him many a wounde. þis holie man stod euere stille : he ne grochchede nou&yogh;t ene, Ake euere he cride "god, þin ore!" : and non oþur he nolde him mene. So þat þis luþere tormentores : þat beoten him so sore, þou&yogh;ten þat al. þei huy him schame duden : and al. om. hov huy mi&yogh;ten don him more. huy benden heore bouwene and stoden a-feor : and heore Arewene ri&yogh;ten : Ase to ane marke huy schoten to him : ase euene ase huy mi&yogh;ten. þe Arewene stikeden on him ful þicke : and al is bodi to-drowe; And euere stod þis holie man : ri&yogh;t stille, ase þei he lowe. Ase ful ase is an Irchepil : of piles al-a-boute, So ful he stikede of Arewene : with-Inne and with-oute, So ful, þat in none stude : on Arewe ne mi&yogh;te In wende bote he for-korue some oþure : more is bodi to rende. Ase þe holie man i-Martred was : seint sebastian, Also huy serueden is holie bodi : and schoten þane holie man, þat euerech pece fram oþur fleu : þat wonder was of is liue. And euere he stod ase him no rou&yogh;te : and cride on god wel bliue. þo hynguar i-sai&yogh; þat huy ne mi&yogh;ten : þare-with ouer-come him nou&yogh;t, A-non he let is heued of smyte : þat he were of liue i-brou&yogh;t.
34.2: Ase þis holie man is beden bad : a man smot of is heued; And al. ac is bodi was al. was er al-to-rend : and nou&yogh;t i-hol bi-leued. And for it was so al-to-drawe : huy leten it ligge þere. Ake, for men ne scholden nou&yogh;t finde is heued : forth with heom huy it bere Into þe wode of Eglesdone : ane MS. ane ane derne stude huy founde : A-mong þicke þornes huy it casten : and hudden it in þe grounde. þo heo hadden of þis holie kyng : al heore wille þere, glade and bliþe huy wenden forth : luþere Men ase it were. þat heued huy hudden derneliche : þat no cristine man ne come, &YOGH;if þat þare ani bi-lefte a-lyue : and with him þannes it nome. A wilde wolf þare cam sone : and to þe heuede he drov&yogh;, And þare oppe he lai and wuste it faste : a-&yogh;ein is kuynde i-nouv&yogh;— For is kuynde were more to for-swolewen it— : and lickede MS. lickeden it ofte and custe, And ri&yogh;t ase he wolde is owene &yogh;welp : with wilde bestes it wuste. ¶ Sethþe þare comen cristine Men : and in sum power weren i-brou&yogh;t : þat holie bodi huy founden sone : for it nas i-hud ri&yogh;t nou&yogh;t. Ake for huy ne founden nou&yogh;t þat heued : a-boute huy wenden wide And sou&yogh;tten it longue, In manie studes : euerech in his side. huy ne mi&yogh;ten it finde for no þyng. : so þat huy comen ane day bi-sides þulke þicke þornes : þare ase þat heued lai. huy nusten nou&yogh;t þat it was þere. : þo bi-gan þat heued to grede, Ase it a-mong þe þornes lay : and ri&yogh;t þeose wordes sede : ¶ "Here, here, here," with swete voyz : ase þei he were a-liue. þo þat folk i-heorde þat : þuder-ward huy wenden bliue : þat heued huy founden in þulke stude : ase hit him-sulf sede. Louerd, i-hered beo þi mi&yogh;te : þat þare was a fair dede! þat heued huy beren to þe bodi : and setten it euene þare-to, And beren it forth with gret honovr : ase ri&yogh;t was forto do. al. 4 vv. more.
34.3: TO seint Eadmundesburie huy ladden him : ase men cleopiez nouþe þene toun— þare is on Abbeie of blake Monkes : ase huy setten him a-doun. In swyþe noble schrine huy brou&yogh;ten him : ase ri&yogh;t was for-to do. þare he lijth &yogh;eot hol and sound : ase heo i-seoth þat comieth him to : For is bodi þat was so to-drawe : hol bi-cam a-non And sound, as þe &yogh;wyle he a-liue was : boþe of flesch and bon; ¶ þat heued al-so faste to þe bodi : ase it was euerer. In al is bodi nas o weom : þat man mi&yogh;te i-seo þer, bote ase is heued was of I-smyte : ase ore louerd it wolde, A smal red line is al-a-boute : schininde ase of golde. A swyþe fair pilegrimage it is : þudere forto fare, For-to honouri þat holie bodi : þat þare hath i-leie so &yogh;are. Novþe god for þe loue of seint Eadmund : þat was so noble king, graunte us þe Ioye þat he is Inne : aftur ovre ending. Amen.

35.0: 45 [Mi&yogh;hel]. This legend I have published before in 'Lemcke, Jahrbuch für rom. und engl. phil., 1874.'
35.1: SEynt MI&yogh;hel þe Archaungel : and is felawes also, huy beoth bi-tweone ore louerd and us : to schewi &yogh;wat we schulle do. Ane day huy habbez in þe &yogh;ere : þoru&yogh; al cristinedom. þoru&yogh; fair miracle of seint Mi&yogh;hel : þe day a man al. me furst nom. In þe one ende of Apuyle : a gret hul þare was and hei&yogh; þat þe hul gargan is i-cleoped : for a man þat þare was nei&yogh;, þat gargan i-cleoped was— : þe hul þare-fore hatte so. þis gargan was wel riche man : and in gret power i-do. hit bi-feol þreo hundret &yogh;er : and euene twenti ri&yogh;t Aftur þat ore louerd for us : In is Moder was a-lij&yogh;t, Þat garganes reoþeren : and oþure bestes I-nowe A Morewenes op-on þe hei&yogh;e hulle : to heore lesewe heom drowe. An eue þis ruþerene wenden hom : as heore wone was, ech-one. Bote o bole, þat he louede muche : was bi-hynden al one : Opon þe hexte toret of þe hul : þe bole wel euene drov&yogh;. And þo þe louerd hine miste an euen : a-nuyd he was i-nov&yogh;; With him he nam men i-nowe : and sou&yogh;te into al þat lond : Opon þe hexte hurste of al þe hulle : atþe laste he him fond. he nam one aruwe envenimed : in grete wrathe I-nov&yogh; And schet to þis selie bole : and with grete strencþe i-nov&yogh;. al. drou&yogh; Ake þis Arewe tornede euene a-&yogh;ein : to him þat hire schet, And smot him, ase it in wreche were : deope wounde and gret.
