Nov was þat a wonder Arewe : and wonder wei heo sou&yogh;te! I-ne kepte nou&yogh;t leorni so forto scheote : ne swuch arewe þat man me brou&yogh;te. A wonder schere-wynd heo was on : womme &yogh;wat heo þou&yogh;te! Ake euere me þinchez he þat hire schet : þe game sore a-bou&yogh;te.— þat folk þat þare-a-boute stod : in grete wonder was; to þe bischope huy wenden anon : and tolden him al þat cas. þe bischop was in grete fere : and in grete þou&yogh;te stod; A tokningue it was, he wuste wel : of vuele oþur of guod : he hiet al þe contreye a-boute : In oresones anon-ri&yogh;t to beo And þre dawes in fastingue al-so : þis tokningue forto seo.
35.2: Seint MI&yogh;hel after þene þridde day : to þe bischope he com, And seide, "hou þinchez þe of þis dede? : was it a wonder dom? Ne þinche ov no wonder þar-of : for mi wille it was, i-wis : For Ichulle witie wel þulke stude : þat in mine warde is; And In þusse manere ich it schewi eov : þat &yogh;e þe soþe i-seo, And þat &yogh;e honouri þulke stude : for is wardein ichulle beo." ¶ þe bischop with procession : swyþe fair and hende, For-to honouri þulke holie stude : mildeliche he gan i-wende. A noble churche huy founden þare : with walles faire and proute; huy ne dorsten nou&yogh;t þare-nei&yogh; come : heore preiere huy duden with-oute. v. 41-2 spurious? þare-aftur-ward al þat folk of þe lond : þat I-cristned were Aldai comen to þulke hulle : heore beden to bidde þere.— Sethþe [it ful] om. þare-after-ward : þat Saracines þare come And weorreden þe cristine men : and bataylle a-&yogh;ein heom nome : þo het þe bischop of al. al þat folk : þulke dayes þreo to seint MI&yogh;hel bidden faste : and in fastingue al-so beo. þe þridde ny&yogh;t seint Mi&yogh;hel : to þe bischope cam eft-sone, MS. eft ftsone And seide, "lat &yogh;arki al þi folk : þe bataille for-to done. þat &yogh;e to-day þare-Inne beon : ri&yogh;t atþe feorþe tyde, And with eov Ichulle þare beo : sum-&yogh;ware þare-bi-side." þe bischop was þo glad i-nou&yogh;. : þat folk was sone &yogh;are, þe tyme þat he hadde i-set : to þe batayle forto fare.
35.3: TO-gadere huy smiten opon þe hulle : ake it was ido a-non : for þare cam a gret deork cloude : and ouer-caste heom ech-on, And þe leitingue smot þere and þere : þe luþere men to grounde; Six hundret it a-slov of heom : in wel luytel stounde. heore felawes flowen faste a-non : and ascapeden onneþe; þare nas non þat ne was longue sijk : oþur deide in strongue deþe. þus seint Mi&yogh;hel sturede him þo : a-mong heom feor and ner. þo was it soth þat seint Dauid : seide in þe sauter : "þat ore [louerd] makez is Aungles : ase gostes fleojnde, And heom þat beoth is ministres : ase fuyr berninde." Godes ministres aungles beoth : seint Mi&yogh;hel and oþere mo; þat ase gostes flowen þo vn-seie : in fourme of fuyre þo. A wonder game huy pleiden þere— : þat mi&yogh;te segge heore fon; Betere heom hadde at hom i-beo : and i-piked heore ton! ¶ þis cristine Men a-morewe : &yogh;arkeden heom fule wel And wenden to þis holie hul : to þonki seint Mi&yogh;hel. þo founden huy ane churche þere : swyþe quoynte a rerd. þe bischop was þo glad I-nov&yogh; : and sumdel he was a-ferd : he nuste hou þe churche cam : ne ho hire hadde a-rerd þere, Ne &yogh;weþer seint Mi&yogh;hel wolde : þat heo i-halewed were— For him þou&yogh;te þat hit was ri&yogh;t : to halewi churchene newe. Seint Mi&yogh;hel wel &yogh;eorne he bad : þat was is freond wel trewe, þat he heom sende sum tokningue : &yogh;wat he scholde þarof do; þreo dawes he let þat folk fasten : and heore beden bide al-so. &YOGH;eot cam seint Mi&yogh;hel eft-sone : to þe bischope þere, And seide, "ne þench nou&yogh;t on mine churche : þat ich let mi-seolf a-rere! For ich habbe þe churche a-rerd : and I-halewed al-so. And þar-of þov schalt signe i-finde : &yogh;wane þov comest þere-to: For wiend In atþe est-porche : and ase ich habbe i-gon Mine fet þov schalt finde I-sene : ri&yogh;t in þe Marbre-ston. Sing þare þine hei&yogh;e-masse : and &yogh;if þat folk also Ore louerdes flesch and is blod : &yogh;wane þe masse is ido!" ¶ Þe bischop wel sone a-Morewe : to þe churche him drov&yogh;, And þis folk al-so with him : with offringue fair I-nov&yogh;. At þe est-porche huy wenden In : and in þe Marbre-ston þe stapes huy founden I-sene : ase seint Mi&yogh;hel hadde igon. Innore-more huy wenden &yogh;uyt : weouedes huy founden þreo, With rede palles huy weren i-heoled : þe faireste þat mi&yogh;ten beo: Ore swete lauedies was þat on : þat men scholden to bidde, þat oþur seint Iohanes þe baptist MS. bastist : And seint peteres þat þridde. ¶ þe bischop song is masse þere : and sethþe atþen ende þat folk he dude hoseli al : are he wolde þanne wende. þat folk to þulke holie stude : aldai faste drou&yogh;; And ore louerd dude þare ofte a-day : fair Miracle I-nov&yogh;. So þat þe pope, þat was þo : þoru&yogh; þe Cardinales rede For honour of þulke stude : and seint Mi&yogh;heles holie dede, And also for þe Miracle : [þat] þoru&yogh; seint Mi&yogh;hel com, Mi&yogh;heles-masse-day he hiet halewi : þoru&yogh; al cristin-dom.—
35.4: Seint MI&yogh;hel In nouembre : hath &yogh;eot an-oþur dai, bi-fore þe feste of seint Luc : as ich ou telle mai. þoru&yogh; seint Mi&yogh;heles wille : ri&yogh;t ase þe oþur was, And þoru&yogh; is heste he was bi-founde : i-hereth þoru&yogh; &yogh;wat cas. Hit bi-feol seue hundred &yogh;er : and in þe teoþe &yogh;ere ri&yogh;t After þat ore swete louerd : in is Moder was a-lij&yogh;t, Þat to þe bischope Albert : seint Mi&yogh;hel cam a-ni&yogh;t Bi-side þe Montaygne of Toumbe : ase it were in a sij&yogh;t: Opon þe hulle of Toumbe : ane churche he him liete r. het a-rere, Ri&yogh;t swuch one ase ope þulke of gargan : and þat it bi-tyme were. þe bischop axede in &yogh;wuche stude : he scholde þe churche make. "I-chulle þe," quath seint Mi&yogh;hel : "guode tokne þarof take: Ane bole þov schalt þare finde : þat þeoues habbet þare i-hud, Opon þe hei&yogh;e hulle of toumbe : þat nis nou&yogh;t &yogh;eot i-kud. þare ase þou finst þe bole I-hud : þov schalt mine churche a-rere." þe bischop þat wel onder-stod : and bi-gan is churche þere, And þare a-rerde hire faire I-nov : to þe helpe of mani a man, In þe honour of seint Mi&yogh;hel : ase hul r. þulke of gargan. Opon hei&yogh;e hulles þis churchene weren : boþe of seint Mi&yogh;hel— hei&yogh; man me þinchez he wolde beo : for he louede hulles wel. he dude wel, for he mi&yogh;te beo : at hom opon is owe And sittinde a-boute him wide i-seo : and þe contreie bet i-knowe, And hom a-&yogh;ein þe sonere fleo : &yogh;wane þat he li&yogh;te lowe; he ne þurte carie of non oþur weork : noþur to ripe ne mowe. For he let opon eiþer hulle : areren a chapel, Muche folk þat &yogh;eot on eorþe is : onder-stant þat wel, And &yogh;wane huy a-rereth anie churche : to massi Inne oþur rede godspel, Opon an hul bi custome : huy makiez of seint Mi&yogh;hel, Ase þe Mount of seint Mi&yogh;hel : and þe Mount a-gv al-so, And also oþere in fale studes : ho-so nimez &yogh;eme þar-to.
35.5: IN þe grete se of Occean : þe hul of Toumbe is, þat geth a-bouten al þe world : In þat on ende, i-wis. Al-a-boute þe hulle geth þe se. : and In þe feste-daie euere-mo þe se. with-drauth MS. hire w. hire hire twies aday : þat ech man may druy&yogh;e gon Forto honouri þulke holie stude— : and in non oþur tyme it nis þat þe .se. ne geth al-a-boute : bote on þe feste-daie, i-wis. ¶ So bi-feol In one time : þat þe se hire with-drou&yogh; In þe feste-dai&yogh;e of þulke stude : and folk þare wende In I-nov&yogh;: So þat a womman grete with childe : cam In atþen ende, And nas nou&yogh;t so swift ase oþere weren : a-&yogh;einward forto wende: þe .se. for-closede hire sone : and heo bi-lefte with-Inne; heo floterede þare in luyte reste : and in wel feble wunne. So þat heo bi-lefte þare : In wonder cas I-nov&yogh;, For-to it was on oþur &yogh;er : þat þe .se. hire with-drou&yogh;; And hadde child þare In þe .se. : and at þe &yogh;eres ende hol and sound with hire childe : þudere heo gan i-wiende— I-saued heo was in þe deope .se. : þoru&yogh; þe grace of seint Mi&yogh;hel. For-soþe, nis nouþe no man aliue : þat hire couþe habbe i-wust so wel, Ne so hire i-fed and hire child : þat ne costnede nou&yogh;t a strav&yogh;: For þei heo hadde fisch and drinke : &yogh;e wuten wel it was rav&yogh;. And so to floteri in þe grete .se! : wounder, þat heo nadde i-beo ded. Seint Mi&yogh;hel was a guod wardein : &yogh;wane we habbeth al i-sed; Icholde ech man me hadde ane peny i-&yogh;yue : þat no couþe nou&yogh;t witen hire so! Atþe feste-day at þe hul of Toumbe : þis dede was i-do.— þe hul of Toumbe he is i-cleoped : for he is sumdel MS. sundel nare And long, ase Man may i-seo : ane Mannes burieles fare þat mannes bodi is Inne I-leid : &yogh;wane huy beoth here dede; Also þilke hul is long : and nou&yogh;t wel large In brede. And þat is, ase þe .se. hath i-bete : faste on eiþur side And hath þat sond a-rerd up on hei&yogh; : þat men mouwen i-seo wel wide, And þar-of Imaket ane hul : narv and long i-wis; More þane four hondret fet : þe hul so hei&yogh; is.—
35.6: MEn synguez a-Mi&yogh;heles-masse-day : In holie churche also Of one bataile þat seint Mi&yogh;hel : with a dragun scholde do: þat was þe luþere lucifer : þo he was al. þat was is felawe And sumdel is souerein : for-to he gan mis-drawe, Ake þo he þat Aungel was : þoru&yogh; is wicke pruyte Bi-cam to a luþer feond— : he bi-&yogh;at þare-with luyte! he feol out of is hei&yogh;e sege : þat he ches a-mis, To þe deope putte of helle : þare is wonijngue is. fram þe hexte stude þat is : with one swenge he cam To þe loweste stude, i-wis— : ane wonder wei he nam! Nov sori beo he! &yogh;wat was him? : &yogh;wi ferde þe schrewe so? he pleyde with þe fallingue tourn : so wel he couþe hine do, Iaumbe leue he cam swenge : Into helle grounde. A muregore In he hadde bi-fore : þat worse þare he founde! A wonder sweng, me þinchez, he made! : his bi-&yogh;ete was ful luyte; he may corsi euere-more : his mis-farinde pruyte. for al-so sone as ore louerd I-maud : heouene and eorþe and helle, he makede him furst and is felawes : ase ich ov mai here telle. And he ase-sone ase he was imaud : he bi-gan to smite in pruyte: Al-so hei&yogh; ase ore louerd he wolde beo : he bi-&yogh;at þare-with wel luyte. Manie heolden faste with him : and nou&yogh;t alle of one lore: And al. om. manie likeden wel is dedene : some lasse and some more, Some ferden ase huy ne rou&yogh;ten : noþer of on .ne of oþur. þare ne bi-lefte in heouene non of heom : ne heore maister noþer. Seint Mi&yogh;hel was maister to driuen heom : out of heuene a-doun: þat was þe batayle þat he made : with þe luþere dragoun. þe maister-dragoun lucifer : and is ri&yogh;te felawes ech-on þat faste heolden with is pruyte : he drof heom to helle anon. Ake huy þat heolden sumdel with him : and nou&yogh;t fulliche so faste, Out of heouene he drof heom : and In-to þe lofte heom caste, Al here bi-neþe toward þe eorþe : þare mest tempeste is: And þare heo schullen in tempest and in t. and al. om. in pine beo : to þe daye of dome, i-wis; And ase hore gult þe more was : heore pine was al. is al-so, þe worse stude heom [was] i-take : heore penaunce for-to do. Ake to helle huy ne schullen nou&yogh;t : are domes-day i-wende; Ak þare huy schullen after-ward : bi-leue with-outen ende. Oþure þare weren þat for heom r. him : sumdel in mis-þou&yogh;te weren, Ake natheles huy heolden betere with god : and al. ac vnneþe fur-bere: þulke wenden out of heouene al-so : and a-boue þe oþure beoth, An hei&yogh; onder þe firmament : and godes wille i-seoth, And so schullen sumdel in pine beo : a-non to þe worldes ende, Ake huy schullen at domes-day : a-&yogh;ein to heouene wende. In eorthþeliche parays : some beoth &yogh;eot al-so, And in oþur studes on eorþe : heore penaunce for-to do.— For heore defaute in heouene : þoru&yogh; ore louerdes grace Man was formest on eorþe i-wrou&yogh;t : to fulfulle þulke place. ¶ For ten ordres of Aungles : þare weren i-makede þo, And þe teoþe ordre ful a-doun : In-to pine and wo: And &yogh;eot þare beot ordres Nyne : and þare-fore man is i-wrou&yogh;t, To fulfulle þe teoþe ordre : þat was out of heouene i-brou&yogh;t.
35.7: SOne so man was i-wrou&yogh;t : sunne he bi-gan to do And fur-gulte þe murie Ioie : þat he was i-maket to: In helle he was with lucifer : and with oþure luþere fode, For-to ore louerd it bou&yogh;te : In flesch and in blode. þe luþere gostes beoth a-boute : with heore luþere pouwer To bi-traye wrechche men : and bringue into heore paunter; And þe guode beoth al-so a-boute : with power þat heore is For-to witien men fram sunne : þat huy ne wurchen a-mis. Boþe þe luþere and þe guode : a-li&yogh;teth ofte a-doun And to men in hore slepe comieth : ase In a visioun, And scheowieth in metingue : mani a wounder dede, Þe guode of guode þingues : and þe luþere euere of quede, And deriez men in heore slep : and bodieth seoruwe and care, And ofte huy ouer-liggez [men] : and al. þat men cleopiet þe ni&yogh;t-mare— For þat is al heore delii&yogh;t : &yogh;wane huy mowen don men wo. Ase þeoues huy cheoseth þe ni&yogh;t : a-boute to fleo and go. Mest huy greuieth selie men : &yogh;wane huy liggez upri&yogh;t; heuie huy liggez on heom i-nov : nere heom erore so lij&yogh;t: huy liggez ase an heui stok : þat wolde ane Man a-stoffe, þat he ne may him wawie fot ne hond : ne vnneþes ani-þing poffe. ¶ Daþeheit a swuch luþer Caumberleyn : þat a-wakez men so sore, And god him &yogh;iue sorewe I-nou&yogh; : and euere so leng þe more, And alle þat louiez is compaygnie! : for he nas neuere hende. &YOGH;if ani man him louez wel : ore louerd hyne him sende.— þe schrewene wollez also ofte : mankun to bi-trai&yogh;e, A-li&yogh;te a-doun in mannes forme : bi ni&yogh;te and bi daye, And liggez ofte bi wommen : ase huy weren of flesch and of blode— Ake þulke bi-&yogh;ete þat huy bi-&yogh;itez : neuere ne cometh to guode. And ofte in fourme of womman : a-day and eke a-ny&yogh;t huy latez men ligge heom bi : and bi-trayez heom ou&yogh;t-ri&yogh;t— for huy wutez wel &yogh;wuche beoz þe men : þat to folie habbeth wille: Al-one in some deerne stude : huy stondez þanne wel stille, And Mani fol heom lijth so bi : In wodes and in mede. Ake þare nis non þat deth so : þat huy ne acoriez þe dede: heore membres to-swellez sone : and some a-scapieth onneþe, And some for-dwynez al awei : for-to huy beon i-brou&yogh;t to deþe; More wonder it is, for-soþe : hov ani a-scapiez a-liue— for a swiþe attri þing it is : to lefman oþur to wyue. And ofte in fourme of wommane : In many derne weye grete compaygnie men i-seoth of heom : boþe hoppie and plei&yogh;e, þat Eluene beoth i-cleopede : and ofte heo comiez to toune, And bi daye muche in wodes heo beoth : and bi ni&yogh;te ope hei&yogh;e dounes. þat beoth þe wrechche gostes : þat out of heuene weren i-nome, And manie of heom a-domesday : &yogh;eot schullen to reste come. Ake þeo schrewene þat beoth in toune in t. al. om. : bi ni&yogh;te and bi day&yogh;e fondieth with &yogh;wuche feolonie : huy mouwen mest men bi-traie.— For þulke tyme þat þe feond : ore furste fader i-wan þoru&yogh; þat appel þat he him &yogh;af : mayster he was of man; he hadde faste al to him men i-bounde : for-to ore louerd us bou&yogh;te: And for men weren so alle his : þe lasse of heom he rou&yogh;te, Ne noþing he nas ginful : ase þe schrewene nouþe beoth— for plente nis no deinte : ase we al day i-seot. he fierde ase doth a port-doggue : I-norischet in port-toun: for he geth ofte in prece of Men : a-mong heom op and doun, Ne &yogh;eme ne nimeth he to men : to beorken on heom nou&yogh;t ene, Ake a-mong men he goth stille I-nov&yogh; : bote ani man him hene: Al-so fierde þe deuel þo : for mankun was al his, And hadde of him al. hem so gret plente : he ne tolde nou&yogh;t þar-of, iwis. he nas no-þing clib to heom : for-to a-sailli heom with wou&yogh;, Non more þane þe port-hound : þat nei&yogh; men geth I-nou&yogh;; Ne he nis al. nas noþing grim to bi-gyli men : ase he was bi-fore, al. nouþe is Er þane al. Siþþe ore swete louerd : of Marie was i-bore. Hadde he i-beo swuch bi-fore : ase he was er al. haþ siþþe i-wis, Onneþe was þare ani Man : þat ne hadde i-beon al his. Ake ore louerd after is deþe : In harde logge him brou&yogh;te And teide þane schrewe faste Inov&yogh; : and daþeheit þat hit of-þou&yogh;te! A teie doggue is clib I-nov : &yogh;wane man comez In is si&yogh;te, And grennez and beorkez faste I-nov : and drau&yogh;th with al is mi&yogh;te; Ake &yogh;if ani man cometh so nei&yogh; : þat he sette on him is toth, for-soþe he bitez sore I-nov&yogh; : ase all[e] swuche doth; he is clibbest op-on heom : þat arriet him with ston: Ake nei&yogh; no man ne may he come : bote þat to nei&yogh; him wollez gon.
35.8: Nouþe late, sethþe he was iteid : þe deuel farez al-so: he beorkez and grennez toward Men : ake he ne may heom nou&yogh;t do; In is owene wrathþe he brennez : him-sulf he doth mest wo, Ake he ne mai no man a-reche : bote ho-so wole allingues to him go. vv. 289-290 al. om. And &yogh;wane ani Man cometh him so nei&yogh; : þat he mouwe him a-reche, Bite he wole harde I-nov&yogh; : and is lessun him teche, Þat, bote he tuyrne to amendement : and take to godes leche And of preoste beo wel i-schriue : him worth i-don gret wreche. ¶ Hardest þe deuel bitez þe men : &yogh;wane ani comez him to Of heom þat arreden him er : and guodnesse habbez i-do— for þare-with Men him arrieth mest— : and &yogh;wuch so him wole with|drawe And comez so nei&yogh; þat he him mouwe a-reche : he cachchez him wel fawe And opon is pouwer harde bit— : his bitingues beoth wel ille. he ne may no man, ase &yogh;e i-seoth : taken a-&yogh;ein is wille, Nonmore þane a tei&yogh; doggue : þat is in strongue tei&yogh;e. And &yogh;wane he ne may a-reche Men : ful wide he cast is ei&yogh;e &YOGH;if he may ani man i-seo : þat toward him wole drawe; he bi-guynnez a-non for-to tolli him : ase man doth his felawe— for &yogh;wane a man ne mai : his felawe bringue him nere, with is hond he tollez him : ase man þat seith "Ich am here." ¶ þe Deuel tollez with is hond : ase wel as doth a man, And fif fingres þare-on he hath : þat he wel bi-sette can. Ech of is fingres hath is name : ase we cleopiez ovre al-so. þe leste hatte "luttle man" : for he is lest þere-to. þe nexte finguer hatte "leche" : for &yogh;wane þe leche makez ou&yogh;t, with þat finguer he wole hit tasti : &yogh;if it is a-ri&yogh;t i-wrou&yogh;t. ¶ "Longueman" hatte þe midleste : for he lenguest is. þe feorþe finguer hatte "techere" : for þere-with men techez i-wis, Ase a man þat seith "lo he þere : of &yogh;wam we speken er longue." for mannes þoumbe strenguest is : þare-fore he hatte "þe strongue." þanne hatte þe leste luttle man : and þe nexte hatte leche, And sethþe þat oþur longueman : þe techare for he doth [teche], Strongue is þe þoumbe I-cleoped : þou wost wel &yogh;wy it is: þeos fif fingres þe deuel hath : and heore names, i-wis. þare-with he tollez men to him : &yogh;wanne men stondez feor a-to And with fol þou&yogh;t toward him lokiez : and nutez &yogh;wat he wollez do, And heore Inwit heom seith : þat swyþe gret sunne it were, And grete wille huy habbez þer-to : &yogh;if huy dorsten for fere. ¶ þe deuel stant and wolde fain : henten heom bi þe polle: with "luttle man," is leste finguer : he bi-guynneth heom furst to tolle And seith, "&yogh;ware-of art þou of-drad? : a luyte sunne it is"— he makez þe sunne luyte Inov&yogh; : for þe finguer is luyte, i-wis. &YOGH;if he ne may with is luytel finguer : ane man to sunne teche, with is felawe he tolleth next : þat men cleopieth "leche," And seit, "&yogh;e, god is leche guod : and ful of milce and ore, he wole wel hele and fur-&yogh;iue : þei þe sunne were wel more; he nis nou&yogh;t so wrechful ase men weneth : he hath þe deore a-bou&yogh;t; wel more sunne he wole fur-&yogh;yuen : þare-fore ne dred þe nou&yogh;t." And bote he mouwe þare-with i-winne : he pult forth is felawe, þe "longue finguer," þat sit him next— : þat alle weren huy to|drawe!— And seith, "man, þov art &yogh;ung I-nov : þou mi&yogh;t libben &yogh;eot wel longue And þine sunnes bieten wel : þei huy weren ten so strongue. Scholdestov nouþe þine wille lete : &yogh;wat scholde þi &yogh;ungue blod? þou mi&yogh;t libbe longue I-nov&yogh; : and a-mendi al þi mod." Bote he MS. &yogh;e mouwe &yogh;eot makie man : þare-with don a-mis, he tollez him with þe "techare" : þat is nexte felawe is. And seith, "lo þere þilke preost : and þilke kny&yogh;t al-so And þilke person, and manie oþure : þat more sunne habbez i-do, And natheles huy beoth guode men : and guod lijf ledez i-nou&yogh;. þilke man nas neuere I-bore : þat oþur-&yogh;wile ne dude sum wou&yogh;. Seint powel with is owene hond : Manie men he slov&yogh;, And þe Marie Maudeleine : þat al. om. to lecherie drov&yogh;, Seint peter þries in one nij&yogh;t : for-sok ore louerd al-so; And al-so loke þis oþur helewe : &yogh;wat sunne huy habbez i-do: Ake þei huy beoth In heouene nouþe : ne worst þou neuere so hei&yogh;e. More sunne þane þou wolt do : þov mi&yogh;t biete, are þou dei&yogh;e: þou woldest beo holiore þane ani man. : bi-holt þe al-a-boute: A misdede wole beo sone ibet. : &yogh;ware-of hast þou doute?" &YOGH;if he ne may with is techare : maken is wei roume, with is "strongue" he tollez þanne : with is schrewe þoume, And seith, "þov art strong i-nov : more sunne to biete; woldest þou bi-leue so murie þing? : þench þat it is swete, al. 2 vv more. And biet þine sunnes aftur-ward : for þe ne faillez strenþe non; And wel fieblore þane þou art : ofte wolleth mis-don And sethþe doth heore penaunce : ake natheles nou&yogh;t wel strongue, For ore louerd is euere &yogh;are : sunful Man to fongue." In þis manere þe luþere schrewe : &yogh;wane he vnder-&yogh;it ou&yogh;t þat men lokiez touward him : and sumdel chaungiez heore þou&yogh;t, he tollez heom euere ner and ner : with is fingres a-rewe. Nouþe luþer þrift on al is hond : for euere he was a schrewe! Daþeit þat sori wolde beo : þei he were al-to-hewe! For he bringuez to sunne mani on : and to amendement wel fewe. Þare-fore þenchez, &yogh;wane he wole : eou to sunne puyte And with is fingres tollez eov : and seiz þe sunne is luyte And þat ore louerd is guod leche and milsful : and þat þou schalt libbe longue And þat oþure sunegiez more : þat ne beoth nou&yogh;t so strongue: A-non so &yogh;e þenchez swuch a þou&yogh;t : bi-þenchez ov þer-to hou þe schrewe tollez eov : and with wuch finguer al-so: Seggez him þat he ly&yogh;th loude : ho-so it dorste him telle, Saue þat he is maister : in þe deope putte of helle; Þat god holde him is dignete : and is grete maistrie For-to sum riche man &yogh;iue al is guod : to bi-nimen him is baylie. For-soþe, he deoth vuele I-nouv&yogh; : þat comez in his tollingue: He wole him bringue euere ner ant ner : In deoppore suneguyngue, Atenende In-to þe putte of helle : þare euere he worth fur-lore, þat onneþe him worth þe grace : to with-drawen him bi-fore.— þei we ne mouwen nou&yogh;t þe feondes i-seo : a-mong us huy beoth wel þicke; And þei huy ovte of helle beon : heore pinene beoth strongue and wicke. For huy farez ase doth þe man : þat in ane hache al. acces of þe feueres is: Beo he in house oþur in fielde : is brenningue i-last, i-wis; Feor and neor he may go : ake euere i-last is pine. Hit is bi þe Deouele here : al-so and bi is hyne: For þei huy ovte of helle beon : huy ne schullen nou&yogh;t so at-route þat huy þe brenningue of helle : with heom ne bereth a-boute.—

36.1: ÞE ri&yogh;te put of helle is : a-midde þe eorþe with-Inne, þat ore louerd it made i-wis : þat quoynte was of ginne. heouene and eorþe he made furst : and seothe alle þing þat is. þe Eorþe nis bote a luytel hurst : a-&yogh;ein þe ri&yogh;te heouene, i-wis. Heouene geth al-a-boute þe eorþe : euene it mot wey&yogh;e; A-midde ri&yogh;t heouene þe eorþe is : ase þe streon a-midde þe Ey&yogh;e. Muche is þat on þanne more þane þat oþur : for þe leste steorre is In heouene, ase þe bok us tellez : [more] þane al þe eorþe, i-wis. For ho-so were an hei&yogh; bi ane steorre : &yogh;if it so mi&yogh;te beo, So luyte wolde þe eorþe þinche : þat vnneþe he scholde it ou&yogh;t i-seo. þe heouene geth ene a-boute : þoru&yogh; dai&yogh;e and þoru&yogh; ny&yogh;t; þe Mone and þe steorrene with him heo berth : and þe sonne þat is so bri&yogh;t: For þat is euene a-boue þin heued : ri&yogh;t atþe nones stounde, Ounder þine fet euene it is : at midni&yogh;t onder þe grounde, And cometh up &yogh;wane þe sonne a-rist : and [o]uer þe is at none; heo makez euene þus hire cours : and comez a-boute wel sone. Ase an Appel þe eorþe is round : so þat euere-mo half þe eorþe þe sonne bi-schineth : hov-so it euere go, And Noon it is bi-nethen us : &yogh;wane it is here mid-ni&yogh;t; Ase man may þe soþe i-seo : ho-so hauez guod In-si&yogh;t: Ase &yogh;if þov heolde ane clere candele : bi-side an Appel ri&yogh;t, Euene half þe Appel : heo wolde &yogh;iuen hire lij&yogh;t.
36.2: firmamenta. EI&yogh;te firmamenz þare beoth : swuche ase we i-seoth. þe Ouemeste is þe ri&yogh;tte heouene : in &yogh;wan þe steorrene beoth— for godes riche is þare a-boue : þat last with-outen ende; þarto we beoth i-maked— : god leue us þudere i-wende. ¶ þare-bi-neoþe beoth seoue firmamenz : þat euerech of heom, i-wis, planete. One steorre hath with-oute mo : þat planete i-cleoped is. Ichulle nemmen heore seoue names : and formest bi-guynne hext: Saturnus is al a-boue : and Iupiter sethþe next, þanne Mars bi-neoþen him : and sethþe þe sonne is, Venus sethþe, þe clere steorre : Mercurius þanne, i-wis, þat wel selden is of us i-sei&yogh;e : þe Mone is next þe grounde. þoru&yogh; gret wit of clergie : heore names weren furst bi-founde: for euerech of þeos seouene mouwen : gret wonder on eorþe do, boþe of wederes and of fruyt : ase heore power &yogh;if þare-to. And al-so man, r. men þat beoth &yogh;wane he is i-bore : onder heore power, i-wis, Schullen habbe diuers lijf : euere ase heore vertue is : Some lechours, some glotones : and some of oþur manere. And natheles a man of guod Inwit : of alle he may him skere : for þe planetes ne doth non oþur : bote &yogh;iuez in mannes wille, To beon luþur oþur guod : ase heore uertue wole to tille, And &yogh;iuen r. &yogh;iuez him al-so qualite : to don so and so; Ake nou&yogh;t-for-þan after is inwit : ech wys man may do : for swuch qualite no man ne hath : to beon lechor oþur schrewe, þat he þare-with ne may him wite— : ake natheles so doth fewe.
36.3: Of þe seoue planetes al-so guod : heore power &yogh;e i-seoth, for þe seoue Dawes in þe wyke : þare-aftur I-nemde beoth : Of Saturnus so is satur-day : and sonen-day of þe sonne, And of þe Mone Monen-day : &yogh;if &yogh;e wel rikeni konne; Of one planete euerech day : In þe wike i-cleoped is, On englisch oþur latyn : bote &yogh;e telle a-mis. And for mars and saturnus : In heore power luþere beoth And luyte guod on eorþe doth : ase þis clerkes i-seoth, þare-fore Men schoniez muche : þene satur-day bi-guynne, And þene tywesday, euerech [werc] om. : to guode ende it forto wynne. Among alle þe planetes : þe sonne a-midde heom is Ase is þe kyng a-Midde is men : to conseili heom i-wis : Al-so þe sonne, þat heo mouwe : schyne a-boute eche-on : for alle habbez lij&yogh;t of hire : and with-oute hire nou&yogh;t on. Ase man may bi þe Mone i-seo : þe &yogh;wyle heo is neowe ri&yogh;t : A luyte rondel ase a sikel : Men seoth þar-on li&yogh;t, And al þat oþur del with-Inne : swiþe blak as a rauon as a r. on the margin. it is. Ri&yogh;t so blac is al þe mone : of hire-sulf, i-wis, Bote þare ase þe sonne schynez : þat hire li&yogh;t &yogh;if hire al And Makez hire schyne a-boute : bri&yogh;tore þane ani cristal. for &yogh;wanne þe sonne schynez on cristal : oþur in watere cler, A gret leome it &yogh;if out a-&yogh;ein : and schynez feor and ner : Al-so fareth þe Mone, i-wis : þe sonne schynez doun ri&yogh;t Euene on hire and heo a&yogh;ein : and a-mong us sent hire li&yogh;t. And for þe sonne is feor a-boue : ri&yogh;t at-fore þe prime, bi-neoþen hire þe Mone is euene : and þe sonne schyne[z] bi-tyme Al In þe ouere side of þe Mone : and hider-ward nowi&yogh;t : þanne ne seo we nou&yogh;t of hire : ne heo ne &yogh;ifth no li&yogh;t. So þat þe sonne bi-fore geth : luyte and luyte, i-wis, And schyneth on þe hiderore half : on þulke þat ner him is: Heo makez þe Mone wexe so : luyte and luyte bi stounde, So þat þe Mone is hei&yogh;ful : &yogh;wane þe sonne geth to grounde. þe Mone bi-gynnez bi este a-rise : euene a-&yogh;en hire ri&yogh;t ri&yogh;t on the margin. , þat in þulke half to-ward us : þe sonne sent hire lij&yogh;t : þanne is þe ouere half deork : and þe hiderore half al bri&yogh;t And sent hire leome hidere to us : and schinez al þe ni&yogh;t. So þat heo drauth hire on the margin. feor þe sonne : and luyte and luyte is blak, al. a-bac And euere is cler toward þe sonne : and þat oþur del is blak; And ate laste toward us is al blac : atþe monþes ende And cler a-boue ase is þe sonne : þat to hire li&yogh;t deth sende. So þat þe sonne in þe haluendele : schinez euere-mo, &YOGH;wat a-boue and &yogh;wat bi-neoþe : hov-so hit euere go— Ase man may i-seo bi ane candele : þat is bi-side ane balle, þat &yogh;ifth li&yogh;t on þat haluendel : hov-so it euere falle. And &yogh;wane þe sonne is onder þe eorþe : and þe Mone a-boue a-ny&yogh;t, bi-side þe eorþe in þat on half : &yogh;eot þe sonne sent hire li&yogh;t.— ¶ An hundret siþe and fiue and sixti : ase it is i-write, þe sonne is more þane þe eorþe : ho-so it wole i-wite; And þe eorþe is more þane þe Mone : nye siþe, i-wis. þe Mone þinchez wel þe more : for heo so nei&yogh; us is. þe sonne is herre þane þe Mone : More þane schwche þreo þane it beo heonnes to þe Mone— : þe lasse heo is to seo.
36.4: Muche is bi-twene heouene and eorþe : for þe man þat mi&yogh;te go euereche daye fourty mile : and &yogh;eot sumdel mo, He ne scholde nou&yogh;t to þe hexte heouene : þat &yogh;e alday i-seoth, comen in ei&yogh;te þousende &yogh;er : þere ase þe steorrene beoth; And þei adam, ore furste fader : hadde bi-gonne a-non þo þat he was furst i-mad : and toward þe heouene i-gon And hadde eche daie fourti mile : euene opri&yogh;t i-go, he ne hadde nou&yogh;t &yogh;eot to heuene i-come : bi a þousende mile and mo. Sikere &yogh;e beon isegge &yogh;eov soth : I-leue ho-so i-leue— hov schulle we þat comiez so late : after Adam and eue? Ake &yogh;wane a man is on eorþe ded : and is soule beo guod, heo nath with hire non heuinesse : of flesche MS. of flechs of flesche ne of blod : &YOGH;if heo is þanne with-oute sunne : heo hath Aungles cuynde And mai beo nouþe here and þer : ase quik ase mannes muynde. for ase &yogh;e I-seoth þe li&yogh;tingue : out of þe cloudene i-wende þat comieth of þat on half of þe world : and al-so sone in þe oþur ende, wel smart-loker scheot ane mannes soule : &yogh;e more þane swuche seuene, &YOGH;if heo is oute of sunne : þene ri&yogh;te wei into heouene. Ake wel sonere he may to helle come— : þare-fore it is i-sene þat wel mo to helle wendez : &yogh;e ich drede swuche tene.
36.5: Elementa. BI-neoþe þe loweste heuene : þat þe mone is on i-brou&yogh;t, so beoth þe foure Elemenz : of &yogh;wan we beoth i-wrou&yogh;t. Next þe Mone þat fuyr is hext— : ech-one huy beoth rounde— þe eir is þanne next bi-neothe : and tillez ri&yogh;t to þe grounde, Sethþe is watur, and sethþe þe eorþe— : þeos beoth foure, i-wis; of &yogh;wan man and eche quic þing : for-soþe I-maked is. Ore louerd in ech-on of þis foure : al dai scheweth is mi&yogh;te, Ase &yogh;e mowe in þe stude of fuyre : I-seo a wonder si&yogh;te, Scheote as þei it a steorre were : bi þe lofte an hei&yogh;, Ake þe steorrene beoth feorre a-boue : for þat is sumdel nei&yogh;. þe sonne may here a-mong us : gret strencþe and mi&yogh;te do : heo drauth up þe kuynde of þe watere : and of þe eorþe al-so, he drau&yogh;th up of MS. op þe eorþe in druye wedere : ase it were a druye breth, So þat þoru&yogh; hete of þe sonne : a-boue MS. aboute þe eir it geth, And &yogh;wane it comez a-mong þe fuyre : sone it bi-gynnez forto tiende And al berninde it scheot forth : þat hit beo i-bar[n]d to ende. þare-fore men ne i-seoth no swuch þing : bote it beo in hete. Fuigur. ¶ Li&yogh;tingue comez al-so þare-of : &yogh;wane it comez to wete : for al þat ilke druye breth : þat is so i-drawe an hei&yogh; þoru&yogh; hete þat was bi-fore : and a cloude þat al. om. þare was al. is nei&yogh;, A-non so it is a-fuyre : it scheot þoru&yogh; þe cloude, And þe &yogh;wile it is in þe watere : it goþeleth swyþe loude.
36.6: Ase &yogh;if a man nome ane sclabbe of Ire : þat glowynde were a-fuyre And pulte in watere, it wolde goþeli loude : þat men mi&yogh;ten it feor i-huyre. Tonitruum. Al-so þat fuyr up an hei&yogh; : þat bi þe cloude is i-tend; hit goþelez in þe watere loude : as it þoru&yogh;-out I-went— And þat is þe þondre, i-wis : and siker non oþur þing; And &yogh;wane þat fuyr scheot þoru&yogh;-out : þat is þe li&yogh;ting, And þat scheot a-brod þoru al þe world— : þat comez aftur þe dunte; And natheles it þinchez bi-fore : for it ne may nou&yogh;were at-stunte. &YOGH;if here were an hei&yogh; stepel : and a man a-boue sete And men i-sei&yogh;en him smiten al an hei&yogh; : guode duntes and grete, þou mi&yogh;test him seo wel longue smite : þe duntes with þine ei&yogh;e Are þov scholdest þene dunt i-heore : &yogh;if he were ou&yogh;t hei&yogh;e— for man mai i-seo wel feor a þing : a-non so it is ido, &YOGH;if þare nis no-þing bi-tweone : ake man ne may nou&yogh;t i-heore so. &YOGH;wane þat fuyr comez into þe &yogh;water : gret noyse a-non þare is, Ake men ne heorez it nou&yogh;t a-non : for it is so feor, i-wis; ¶ þe li&yogh;tingue we i-seoth a-non : &yogh;wane it is þoru&yogh; i-brou&yogh;t— þare-fore men þinchez it comez bi-fore : bote natheles it ne doth nou&yogh;t : for &yogh;wane þe li&yogh;tingue is i-come : A-non we habbez þe si&yogh;te, Ake þet sovn ne may nou&yogh;t : so sone a-doun to us a-li&yogh;te.— Novþe nis þe druy&yogh;e breth of eorþe : neuere with-oute hete Idrawe up, þat comez bi-fore : ne a-queint with-oute wete : þare-fore bote after hete : man ne schal no þondre i-seo, And þat þe weder smite in wete : for non-oþur ne mai it beo. So þat man schal in puyr somer : selde þondre i-huyre : For þer is þanne selde wete : to maken quenchingue of fuyre; Ne in puyr winter no-þe-mo : for þanne nis non hete To drawe up þe drou&yogh;þe of þe eorþe : for þe muchele wete. þare-fore Men seggez þat wynter-þondre : selde man schal guod i-seo, For he ne may neuere come : bote þat weder onkuynde beo. Ake bi-tweone somer and wynter : ase in Aueril and may, And eft-sone fram heruest : forto seint Clementes day, þanne is þe þondre kuynde Inov : and li&yogh;tingue al-so : For þanne is þat weder wet : and ofte hot þar-to.— &YOGH;e mouwen axi, &yogh;wane it al. om. þundre is : I-meingt of fuyr in wete, hov is þat hit a-quellez men : ofte bi weye and strete, And smit a-doun wel grete treon : and deth wel mani a wonder? þare-fore ich mot eov more telle : of kuynde of þe þonder.
36.7: ÞO ore louerd þolede on eorþe deth : and bond þene deuel for man A[n]d debruysde helle-&yogh;ates : with þondre þudere he cam. þare-fore euereft Aftur-ward : &yogh;ware-so þe deouelene beo, Of þondre huy beoth so sore a-ferd : þat huy nutez &yogh;wodere to fleo; And huy þat woniez in þe lufte : and oþure ase wel so heo, In strongue fere comieth a-doun : and nutez &yogh;wodere teo, And huy slez men bi þe weie : ase man may ofte I-seo— þat muche fere god heom &yogh;yue : and no-þe worse us ne beo! In oþur manere þare comez &yogh;eot harm : of þe þondre a-mong : For þare ase þat weder is : þe tempeste is ful strong, Of wynd, . of watur,. and of fuyr : þat þei þare were MS. weren þere A Mulleston, he scholde al-to-driue : þei he of molten bras were. &YOGH;wane þe tempeste is þare so strong : me þinchez, it nis no wonder þei þare come leome ofte a-doun : with þe dunte of þe þonder; &YOGH;wane þe wynd and þat fuyr smiteth : þoru&yogh; þe watur-cloude, with swyþe grete strencþe it li&yogh;t a-doun : ase man mai i-huyre loude, And smit ase it were a dunt : oþur blast of grete mi&yogh;te— No wonder þei it smite harde : &yogh;wane it so deth a-li&yogh;te— And brekez treon and quellez men : and deth gret oþur wonder. In þis manere comez þe harm : þat men i-seoth of þe þonder. Men I-seoth ofte li&yogh;tingue : brenne hous and schrenche, þat vnneþe mai ani watur : þat fuyr þarof a-queenche;— For of þe watur-cloude a-boue : þat fuyr is out i-brou&yogh;t And for it out of þe watere comez : þat fuyr nele quenche nou&yogh;t.— Nouþe mouwe &yogh;e Axi in &yogh;wuche manere : &yogh;water comez so hei&yogh;e, And &yogh;warof comez rein and snov&yogh; : þat &yogh;e i-seoth with ei&yogh;e. ¶ þe sonne, þat is al maister here : sent a-doun hire hete And makez þe wateres breþi up-ri&yogh;t : as þei huy scholden swete, Boþe þe .sees. an ferchse wateres : and drau&yogh;th op so þane breth, So þat a-boue in þe lufte : þilke mist euene geth. Novþe is þare uppe in þe lufte : a swyþe cold stude, i-wis, For bi-tweone heoue and eorþe : so cold non þare nis, þare ase þe blake cloudene beoth : and oþur wederes al-so— hit nis up-ri&yogh;t fram þe eorþe : bote Ane mile oþur two. Plunia. &YOGH;wane þe sonne hath þudere i-drawe : þene mist for hete, It ne may no feor for þe colde : ake bi-cometh al to wete, And gaderez þare to one watur-cloude : and houeth þare ane stounde, For-to þe tyme come þat it Ryne : and droppinde falle to grounde. &YOGH;if it is cold up an hei&yogh; : þe dropen bi-cometh to snowe, Nix. And þanne al. As Grando. huy freosez adoneward : are huy comen here ou&yogh;t lowe; And &yogh;if it is þoru&yogh;-out cold : þat huy alle al. al i-frozen beo, Þanne it is haul puyr : ase &yogh;e mouwen al day i-seo. ¶ þe breth of þe watere þat þe sonne : drau&yogh;th op a-&yogh;ein eue, &yogh;wane þe sonne is to grounde i-go : it ne may nou&yogh;t bi-leue, And &yogh;wane no-þing ne halt it up : and þe hete is al i-do, Ros. þanne it fallez softe adoun : and to dewe bi-comez ri&yogh;t so, And hangueth on leues and on gras : for-to þe hete a-morewe come And þe sonne luyte and luyte : it habbe eft-sone up i-nome. ¶ þe hore-forst cometh &yogh;wane it is so cold : þat it freoseth a-ny&yogh;t, And þe Dev freose a-doneward : &yogh;wane he is a-doun a-li&yogh;t. ¶ &YOGH;if þe Dev&yogh; is al-so up i-drawe : and a-doneward i-falle al-so And þare come a þicke myst : and a cold forst þer-to, þanne freost þe þicke Myst : and cleouez an hei&yogh; on þe treo: pruyna. And þarof comez þe Rym-forst : ase þilke Mist deth fleo; he cleouez on hegges al a-bovte : and In þe wodes al-so, On treo, on stones, on bestes al-so : þare it may cleouien to— I-chot wel, on mi fore-top : it hauez wel ofte i-do—. In þis manere MS. manere manere &yogh;e mowen i-seo : þe kuynde of reyne and snowe, Of hawel., of snov&yogh; r. dev ., of Rym-forst : of hore-forst þat freost lowe, Of cloudene and of Mist al-so— : for al o þing it is: For alle huy comiez of water-breth : þat þe sonne drau&yogh;th up, i-wis.—
36.8: NOvþe is watur here on eorþe : wel more þane þe londe: For sum o see, with-oute mo : is more, ich onder-stonde. For þe gret . se . of occean : In þe on ende, i-wis, Is more þane al þe eorþe beo : and gret wonder it is. r. nis For a-boute al þe eorþe heo geth : and brod heo is þare-to, Ase þe &yogh;wyte of þe Eye goth a-boute þe &yogh;eolke : and more is al-so. Ech oþur . se . a-mong us here : ne beo heo so gret non, Nis bote a lime of þulke se : and þudere In huy goth ech-on. ¶ Wellene comiez of grete wateres : and muche del of þe se þoru&yogh; veynes al vnder eorþe : and to þe se wendez a&yogh;e. For þare beoz ase it veynene weren : onder eorþe mani on, þat sikeniez out of þe se : and þarof springueth þis wellene ech-on; And þare-þoru&yogh; eornth þat watur faste : a-boute fram þe se, And þare-ate wellen springuth out : and eft eorneth In a&yogh;e. So þat for alle þe grete wateres : þat to þe se goth echon Vnne[þe] is þe se eni-þing þe more : ake euere heo is bi on. For ase swiþe it geth under eorþe : ase it comez in-to þe se, And euere to wellene it geth a-brod : and eft-sone ernth in a&yogh;e; And al-so sone ase ech watur comez : to þe se in is ende, To þe grete se of occean : ase swiþe it deth i-wende. Þare-fore [for] alle þe wateres : þat to þe se doth gon, þe se mot nedlingus beo : euere-more bi on. þat heo flowez and ebbez : and wexet In a þrowe, þat is þoru&yogh; kuynde of þe mone : and ri&yogh;t nou&yogh;t þoru&yogh; hire owe.
36.9: Terra. ÞE eorþe a-midde þe grete se : ase a luy[te] bal is round, And puyr helle a-midde þe eorþe : ho-so sou&yogh;te þene ground. And &yogh;eot ase gret ase þe eorþe þinchez : and ase luyte ase heo is, þare nis bote þat seouenþe del : þat Men woniez on, i-wis. For In þe north side here : ho-so lie nele, For it is feor fram þe sonne : no Man ne wonez for chele, Ne In þe south half noþe-mo : for þe grete hete Of þe sonne þat is a-boue— : þe leomene beoth so grete al. kete ; And manie oþur studes al-so : þei men mi&yogh;ten wonien þare-Inne, huy ne berez noþur corn ne fruyt : Manne is mete to wynne. And þei þe eorþe were al to-delt : ho-so mi&yogh;te bi Art, &YOGH;eot nis þare, to wonien Inne : onneþe þe seuenþe part.— Of þis foure elemenz : ech quic þing I-make is: Of eorþe., of watur., and of þe eyr : and of fuyre, i-wis.
36.10: MAn hath of eorþe al is bodi : and of watere he hauez wete, Of þe Eyr he hath breth and wind : of fuyr he hath hete. Ech quic þing [hath] of alle þeos foure : of some more and lasse. Ho-so hath of þe eorþe mest : he is slou&yogh; ase þe Asse, Of fade colur, of hard huyde : boistous fourme and ded strong, Of muche þou&yogh;t, of luyte speche : stille groyninde and wrath long, Of slou&yogh; wreche and Aru&yogh; mouth al. fereblet : fast. and loth to gyue guod, Sone old and nou&yogh;t willesfol : stable and studefast of mod. Ho-so hath of þe watere mest : he schal beo &yogh;wit and fat al-so, Of nesche her and no-þing crips : gret slepare and slov&yogh; þar-to, Snvuelinde nose and wet mouth : of fewe wordes : and luyte drinke, Of schorte wrathþe and de-bonere : Arv&yogh;. al. fereblet and luyte luste swinke. ¶ ho-so haueth of þe eir mest : he is of guod colour, Fat and of nesche her : wel large and gret lechour, Li&yogh;Inde and of glad semblaunt : and somdel of pruyte; Habbe he mete and drinke I-nov&yogh; : he carez elles luyte; Wrathþe he berth luytel &yogh;wyle : he wole beo ballede sone; glad and bliþe, and onstable : of þat he hath to done. ¶ ho-so hath of fuyre mest : he is smal and red, Oþur he is blac with cripse here : lene and sumdel qued, Hinderful al. hinder and of bost I-nov&yogh; : hardi and ofte lie, Sweriare and of manie word : and fol of lecherie, Proud and wemod, and drinkare : and in wrathþe al-mest wod, Hardi and li&yogh;t and stalewarde : and wakiare wel guod. Ake euerech of þeos foure elemenz : en-tempriez oþur, i-wis, So þat vnneþe In ani Man : any ri&yogh;[t] puyr maister is. Ake al. ase &yogh;if þov nimst ri&yogh;t puyr hot watur : and dost cold þar-to, þov mi&yogh;t it makien euene wlach : and entempri it so.— ¶ þo ore louerd formest made man : he made him, i-wis, Of alle foure Elemens : ase man &yogh;eot i-mad is. þo made he þe kuynde in eche manne : ase &yogh;e mouwe i-wite, bi-twene Man and womman : of &yogh;wan we beoth bi-&yogh;ite. A swyþe foul þing is þat sed : of &yogh;wan Man is i-spreind; boþe Man and womman : to-gadere huy beoth i-meind. Of &yogh;wij&yogh;t colour it bi-leuez : ase it is i-write, for-to a-boute þe twelfte day : þat it was bi-&yogh;ite.
36.11: FOrmest þare keniez þar-of : smale bollene þreo, Ake euerech hangez faste on oþur : ho-so it mi&yogh;te i-seo. Of þe hexte bolle comez þat brayn : þe heorte of þane a-midde, þe liuere, þat is neþemest : heo comez of þe þridde. þis beoth þe þreo hexte limes MS. limest : þat formest i-kenede beoz, And In heom is al ane Mannes lijf : ase [&yogh;e] nouþe i-seoth; þare nis non of þulke þreo : þat hadde any wounde, þat euereft mi&yogh;te I-held beo : to libbe anie stounde. Aftur þe twelf formeste dawes : þat þet sed hath &yogh;wij&yogh;t i-beo, hit bi-comez to a þicke blod : and chaungez al is bleo. Hit þickez to al. so Nye dawes : for-to þe on and twentyþe day : þanne it tornez formest to flesch : ase þe kuynde may. Aftur ei&yogh;te and twenti dawes : fourme it bi-gynnez to nyme, So þat In-with fourti dawes : it haueth euerech lime, And in lasse &yogh;if it is a knaue : for he is of more hete. &YOGH;wane þe limes beoth formest i-mad : huy ne beoz nou&yogh;t ful grete. A smal weob it bi-cluppez al-a-boute : to holden it to-gadere faste, Fram þat hit is formest i-kened : forto hit beo i-bore atþe laste. ¶ Al round it lith in þe wombe : and i-bouwed ase an hare &YOGH;wane þat heo in fourme lith : for is .In. is sumdel nare. Al I-buyd þe leggues beoz : it nolde nou&yogh;t elles fei&yogh;e, al. veie þe helene to þe bottokes : þe kneuwene in eiþur ei&yogh;e; þat heued is i-buid a-doneward : þe Armes al with-Inne, þe elbouwes ri&yogh;t in þe schere : þe fustus to þe chinne; Al i-buyd is þe rug : so þat nei&yogh; round it is. Man, &yogh;war-of cometh þi pruyte? : for þare nis non, i-wis! So hei&yogh; þov makest þe here : and to no man þou nelt a-buye : Loke hov crekede r. croked þov were þare : and nouþe to no man þov nelt a-buye (!). þou ne mi&yogh;test nou&yogh;t þo holde up þin heued : ne enes on-do þin ei&yogh;e; Fra orig. fram &yogh;wam cam it sethþe þe : to beren þin heued so hei&yogh;e? &YOGH;if man him wolde bi-þenche : and ri&yogh;t him onder-stonde, he scholde beo meoke, and milde of heorte : and to no man habben onde. vv. 734-5 al. om.
36.12: IN eche manne þreo soulene beoth : ake nou&yogh;t alle I-liche guode, Anime. Ase ich seide eov er of þreo bollene : &yogh;if &yogh;e it onder-stode. In þe Neþemeste bolle : þat þe liuere deoth of springue, þare comez o-manere soule : at þe bi-guynningue Ase it were a-manere lijf : þat sent norischingue To þe limes al-a-boute : and bi-ginnez al. bringeth in is wexingue; So þat ane mannes norischingue : and is wexingue al-so Of þulke furste soule comez : and of þe liuere þer-to. þulke manere soule is : in ech wexinde þingue, In treon and in gras al-so : huy ne mi&yogh;ten nou&yogh;t elles springue. þoru&yogh; vertue of þulke soule : &yogh;wane it is þer-to i-brou&yogh;t þat mannes lymes i-fourmede beoth : þat þare ne faillez nou&yogh;t, þanne comez þare In þe heorte : þat þe oþur bolle was, A soule þat bringuz þat lijf : þare it neuer er nas. þat child is þanne quick a-non : ake strencþe nath it nou&yogh;t Enes for-to wawie him : are hit beo feorrore i-brou&yogh;t. Of þulke soule hath ech man : þat he mai wawi an gon In is bi-guynningue, al. Is velynge and al is lijf : and is fif wittes ech-on. þulke soule hath ech þing : þat vuel al. vele may ouer al. oþer -go, Best, . and foul, and fisch al-so : worm and oþure mo. þeos soule þat bringuez þat lijf : is ate heorte grounde : þare-fore ho-so is þare i-smyte : he dei&yogh;ez in luyte stounde. þeos soule comez of mannes cuynde : and þe oþere bi-fore al-so : þare-fore, &yogh;wane a man dei&yogh;ez : huy dei&yogh;ez boþe-to. &YOGH;eot þare is þe þridde soule : þat al heore maister is : For &yogh;wane a child hath alle is limes : [&] om. quike huy beoth, i-wis, In þe ende of þe feorþe monþe : þat it was bi-&yogh;ite, Oþur sone þar-aftur-ward : ase we findez i-write :
36.13: ÞE cuynde þat ore louerd made : and porueide al-so þo he hadde Man formest I-mad : and in parays i-do, To myenge þe kuynde of heuene : to mannes kuynde her, And al. Ane soule of witte and of liue : þat is Aungelene i-pier, heo comez fram þe kuynde of Aungles : and in þis fourme a-li&yogh;t And miengez with þis wrechche flesch : ase ore louerd it hath i-di&yogh;t, And makez þe kuynde þat nas er : bote ase a best onneþe þe kuynde of aungles with him bere : for-to he come to deþe. þulke soule nimth hire In : and bi-leuez, i-wis, In þe childes brayn an hei&yogh; : þat is hexte lime is. þulke soule i-last euere : and ne dei&yogh;e[z] neuere mo, And went, &yogh;wane a man schal dei&yogh;e : to weole oþur to wo. Al þat man hath bi-fore a best : oþur more resun can, Al he it hath of þulke soule : &yogh;ware-þoru&yogh; he is man. And &yogh;wane man went out of þis liue : þulke soule, i-wis, Bi-guynnez departi fram þe bodie MS. soule : þe &yogh;wile he a-liue is, And wend, ase heo hauez of-serued : to Ioye oþur to pine; þe soulene þat hire ferene weren : beoth sone i-brou&yogh;t to fyne. þulke þat halt ane Mannes lijf : and stikez in þe heorte, &YOGH;wane heo schal with þe bodie [dei&yogh;e] : þat in strong Anguysche deth smeorte, &YOGH;if he onder-&yogh;it his felawe : to Ioye fram him i-wende, þare-fore heo maketh signe of Ioye : and deth as þe hiende; And [&yogh;wan] heo deiez with þe bodie : fair chere heo makez and softe, And bi-lef þat bodi in swych point : ase man may i-seon wel ofte : þe ei&yogh;ene I-closede faire i-nov&yogh; : þe mouth of faire chere, Ech lyme al-so faire i-strei&yogh;t : In guod poynt ase he were. þe þridde soule al-so &yogh;eot : þat deiez atþen ende, þat norischingue to al þat bodi : ant to þe limes deth sende, he deth ane al. ek signe in þe bodie : &yogh;if is felawe geth to guode, And bi-lefth þat bodi in fair hev : &yogh;wij&yogh;t oþur red of blode. þeos soulene al. soule dei&yogh;ez in a man : &yogh;wane þe hete is al i-do, þe raþur þat al. þe erore whan he leost is breth : and wawe&yogh;Ingue al-so. &YOGH;wane huy i-seoz heore felawe : to torment i-brou&yogh;t, Luþur semblaunt huy makiez boþe : as it ne likede heom nou&yogh;t, And bi-leueth þat bodi in foule heowe : þe ei&yogh;ene stareInde, And þe mouth of foul semblaunt : and ofte is al. om. grenninde. Swuche signes þat fereliche beoth : þat man may ofte i-seo, Beoth signes þat þe wrechche soule : in luþere weie beo. Nov Iesu crist, þat us soule &yogh;af : graunte us þat we hire moten so here rede þat seint Mi&yogh;hel hire mote a-fongue : and bi-fore to Ioye lede. Amen.

37.1: SEint Clement was I-bore at Rome : I-furn bi olde dawe. Of þe hexte men he was i-come : þa[t] weren in þulke lawe. his Moder hiet Macidiane : his fader Faustinian. Twei breþren he hadde, eldore þane he : heore namen ich telle kan : Þat on hiet Faust, þat oþur Faustyn : twynnes boþe huy were; Fader and moder weren glade of heom : þat heom bi-&yogh;ete and bere. Swiþe fair womman heore Moder added later. was : þe faireste þat Men wuste; hire louerd heo louede treweliche— : non-oþur of heom men nuste. For hire fair-hede hire louerdes broþer : fondede with al overlined. is mi&yogh;te To bringue hire in fole loue : bi dai&yogh;e and eke bi ny&yogh;te. Þis guode womman was MS. wast studefast : he nolde nou&yogh;t don is wille; Ake euere Ansuerede him fayre i-nov : and bar hire faire and stille. he of-sou&yogh;te hire so swiþe : þat no pais heo nadde. heo nust[e] &yogh;wat was hire beste red : ake sore of him heo dradde, And þou&yogh;te &yogh;if heo tolde hire louerd fore : þat he wolde beo wroth And þe more hatie is broþer— : þat were hire swiþe loth. heo þou&yogh;te hou heo mi&yogh;te on take : þat heo ane &yogh;wyle nere Ovt of is si&yogh;te in oþur stude : þat heo fur-&yogh;ite were. heo hire bi-þou&yogh;te of one quoyntise : þat to hire louerd heo seide. MS. leide? A ni&yogh;t In hire bed heo bi-gan to sike : ase þei heo of slepe a-breyde : "A, sire," heo seide, "merci, þin ore! : ich am in grete drede : An hard metingue me hath i-mat : I-not &yogh;wat me is to rede : Me þou&yogh;te þat on of ovre godes : cam here bi-fore þe And hiet me greiþi hastifueliche : mine twei sones and me And wiende with hem and wonie : feor In an oþur londe, For-to ich oþur MS. oþur oþur heste hadde : of him oþur is sonde; And bote &yogh;if ich sone dude so : he swor with grete oþe, To luþere deþe he wolde do : us and ore children boþe. Þare-fore, sire, bi-þench þe wel : &yogh;wat þar-of þov wolt rede : For bote it beo sone ido : for-soþe we beoth dede." Þis guode Man overlined. lai in grete care : And þene deth sore he dradde, bi-þou&yogh;te him strete In swuche neode : þene beste red he radde : "Dame," he seide, "&yogh;wane it is so : to schilden us fram care Þov schalt nime þine twei sones : a[n] to MS. ato Atenes fare. Þov schalt habbe with þe men I-nowe : And tresor al-so. Þov schalt, &yogh;wane þou þudere comest : þine sones to lore do, Þat huy leornien of clergie. : and &yogh;wan ore god þe sent tokningue For-to comen hom a-&yogh;ein : þov schalt heom with þe bringue."
37.2: Glad was þo þis guode wijf : of þat leoue rede. heo greiþede hire and wende forth : ase hire louerd sede : heo gan hire twei sones : toward atenes lede. Ake seint clement athom with is fader : bi-lefde, for &yogh;ong-hede, For he was onneþes fif &yogh;er old : and for þat he scholde beo his fader solas, and al. om. for he nadde : bote childrene þreo.— Þo þis guode wijf was forth i-went : and hire louerdes broþer it wuste Þat hire louede in fole loue : no red þar-of he nuste; ¶ For wrathþe to is broþur he seide : "sire, hov geth þis? Is þi wijf fram þe I-went? : heo is strong hore, i-wis. heo haueth me wel longue i-loued : ne r. no leng hele ich ne may, And to bringue me in fole dede : heo fonde[de] MS. fonde ni&yogh;t and day; Onneþe ich me mi&yogh;te with hire wite : for, siker, i-nolde it do, For sunne, ne for þe loue of þe : ne for mi treovnesse al-so. Anon so heo it onder-&yogh;at : þat i-nolde don hire wille, On of þine hynene heo louede : In folie wel stille, Þat hath bi hire wel ofte i-leie. : ake, þat þov it ne onder-&yogh;ete, heo þou&yogh;te hov heo mi&yogh;te with him beo— : for heo nolde him nou&yogh;t lete : Þare-fore heo þou&yogh;te ane feolle wrench : of wommanes kuynde lore, And is i-go with hire copiner : þov ne sixt hire nonmore. For ofte men seggez, and soth it is : þat þis wommen beoth Feolle and false, and þat al. om. me for-þinchez : þat we þe soþe i-seoth." Sori was þis guode Man : þo he heorde þis, Þat his wijf, þat he louede muche : scholde so don a-mis, Ant þat heo was so fram him i-went : and þat heo ne bi-lefde bi-hinde his sones, þat him so leoue weren : ne he nuste &yogh;ware heom finde. After he wolde habbe i-went : ake he ne dorste for care Of cleme[n]te, is &yogh;ongue sone : laste he scholde for-fare. al. 2 vv. more. — Forth wende þis wijf with hire sones : ase god hire wolde sende. In scipe heo dude hire in þe se : in-to an oþur londe to wende. A-midde þe se a-&yogh;ein ane roche : þat schip bi-gan to glide, Þat it alto-drof, and huy fullen out : euer-ech in is side. A wawe þare cam of þe se : þoru ore louerdes sonde, And caste þis guode wijf al quik : a-non-ri&yogh;t to þe londe. A-non so heo was up i-cast : and to hire ri&yogh;te witte cam, And miste hire twei leoue sones : gret deol to hire heo nam; Into þe se heo wolde habbe i-lope : hire-seolf for-to a-drenche, &YOGH;if it nadde i-beo for grete hope : of þing þat heo gan þenche : Þat þe se wolde some tyme : hire sones to londe caste— For men seggez heo wole ech ded þing : weorpen up atþe laste; hadde heo enes heore bodies i-sei&yogh;e : hire þou&yogh;te þat heo ne rou&yogh;te. Wide and longue heo &yogh;eode a-boute : and heore bodies sou&yogh;te. Þo heo ne mi&yogh;te heom finde : heo &yogh;al and weop ful sore, heo drov&yogh; of hire tressene and caste a-wei : for heo ne hopede to heom nonmore, hire hondene heo wrong and to-gnov&yogh; : þat flesch, ri&yogh;t to þe bone, And al-to-gnov&yogh; þe senewes : and made ful sori mone. heo orn ase heo witles were : a-boute in-to al þe londe. Wimmen MS. wumnen hadden of hire gret revþe : þat heo to al. om. -gnov so hire honde, And fondeden &yogh;eorne to conforti hire : ake huy alle ne mi&yogh;ten make Þat heo wolde into hire heorte : ani gladnesse take. Into a wommanes hous heo cam : þat longue was bedrede, Þat gret revþe hadde þo heo i-heorde : hire so weope and grede : heo confortede hire, &yogh;wat so heo mi&yogh;te : and made hire bi-leue with hire aldai, with glad semblaunt : for-to it was nei&yogh; eue. So heo confortede þis guode wijf : þat heo bi-lefte þare at at superscr. Inne, Mid MS. And, al. And mid weorke of hire hondene : hire liflode for al. gan -to winne, With spinningue and with sevwyngue : þat heo wel couþe do; Þare-with heo fedde hire swiþe wel : and hire ostesse al-so. Sone þare-after þe senewes : of hire hondene bi-gonne to schrinke, For heo heom hadde er so for-gnawe— : þat heo ne mi&yogh;te non-more swinke; So þat heo ne mi&yogh;te i-welde : noþur Arm ne honde to pulte enes mete to hire mouth : ase hit was godes sonde. Þat deol þat heo made [þo] : no tongue it telle may. "Alas," heo seide, "þus longue i-leoued : and þat ich euere a-bod þis day! For more sorewe þane me is on : neuere womman ne hadde. Þe Ioye of mi louerd furst i for-les : for sunne þat ich dradde, And bi-lefde clement mi &yogh;ongue : þat me was so leof, i-wis; And sethþe les mine tweie sones in þe se : þat weren al mi blis; And al one fram mine freond : þus feor in one-couþe londe Mit deol and soruwe ich habbe i-leoued : þoru&yogh; swunch of mine honde : Novþe mine hondene me beoth bi-nome : þat I-ne may heom enes wawe. Alas, þus longue in care i-leoued : þat i-nere i-brou&yogh;t of lijf-dawe!" Þat deol þat heo made : revþe it was to telle; Ofte heo was ope þe pointe : hire-sulf for-to a-quelle. Fram dore to dore hire mete heo bad : and with þat he mi&yogh;te I-winne, heo fedde hire-sulf and hire hostesse : &yogh;wane heo cam to hire Inne.—
37.3: HIre louerd athom aftur hire : of-longet was wel sore, And sente men to sechen hire : ake huy ne comen a-&yogh;ein nonmore. Oþere he sente into al þat lond : and þo huy hadden longue i-sou&yogh;t, huy comen a-&yogh;ein and tolden him : þat huy ne mi&yogh;ten hire finde nou&yogh;t. Þo gan he Clement, is &yogh;ongue sone : In-to guode warde take, And wend him-sulf into al þat lond : forto sechen is make. he ne cam neuer-eft hom a-&yogh;ein— : wel wide he hire sou&yogh;te, And &yogh;eode a-boute and bad is mete : þat of is lijf he ne rou&yogh;te. ¶ Twenti &yogh;er he bad is mete : and is wijf &yogh;eot wel mo. he ful into feblesse of elde : þat vnneþe he mi&yogh;te go. al. 2 vv. more. Seint clement, þis &yogh;ongue child : to clergie was i-do; he i-werth sone a gret clerk : quoynte and guod al-so. Þoru&yogh; his clergie him þou&yogh;te : þat heore lawe nas nau&yogh;t: he wilnede muche to wyten of god : &yogh;if ani man him hadde i-tau&yogh;t.
37.4: HIt bi-feol þat seint Barnabe : Into Rome cam, And clement hyne heorde a day : prechi of cristinedom: So þat of þis holie Apostle : he lette him cristni a-non, And bi-cam þe beste prechur : þat mi&yogh;te on eorþe gon. he heorde telle of seint peter : þat In þe londe of Iudee was: Are he to him were I-come : glad ne bliþe he nas: he bi-cam is o desciple : and a-boute with him wende For-to prechie cristine-dom : þoru&yogh; wit þat god him sende.
37.5: Symon Magus, þe luþere Man : &yogh;eode in Ane oþur londe, To prechi a&yogh;ein Cristinedom : þoru&yogh; þe deoueles sonde. Tweie desciples he hadde with him : þat, þo huy onder-&yogh;ete Þe falshede þat with him was : huy gonne him sone for-lete; To seint peter huy wenden a-non : and his desciples bi-come. glad was seint peter of heom : and þonkede god i-lome.
37.6: SEint Clement tolde a day : to seint peter wel stille hov hit of is freond bi-feol : as it was godes wille, And al-hov is Moder &yogh;eode a-wei : with is breþren tweie, Þat he wende þat huy a-dronke weren : oþur i-storue bi þe weie, And hov is fader wende to sechen heom : þo he ne sai&yogh; oþur red; And [he] om. wende þat he were a-dreint : oþur for deole ded; And hov frendles he was op i-brou&yogh;t : Into al. & to swyche lore. Þo seint peter i-heorde þis : he gan to weope sore.— Ase seint petur &yogh;eode a dai : prechinde ouer lond, Ane womman, þat him þou&yogh;te gent and freo : In grete miseise he fond, &YOGH;ware heo &yogh;eode and bad hire mete. : he Axede hire a-non &YOGH;wy heo ne mi&yogh;te hire mete I-winne : and &yogh;wy heo wolde so gon.
37.7: ÞIs womman seide, "swuch day was : Ich couþe minne mete I|winne, Ake nouþe mine hondene me beoth bi-nome : þat Ine may sevwy ne spinne. More sor e we þane me is on : neuere nas i-founde; Alas þat ich nadde me a-dreint : a-wei, þat ilke stounde!" ¶ "Womman," seide seint peter þo : "folliche þov dest telle: For þe Man þat him-seolfue a-slowe : his soule scholde into helle." "Sire," heo seide, "wuste ich þe soþe : þat soulene libbe scholde After þusse liue, I-nolde bi-leue : þat me-seolf a-quelle i-nolde, Þat Ich mi&yogh;te one stounde : mine sones i-seo; I-ne rou&yogh;te sethþe, þei ich scholde : euer-eft in helle beo. For mi louerd and mi overlined. &yogh;ongore sone : ich MS. þat ich bi-lefte at rome And wende forth with mine tweie sones : ake þo we in þe se come, Þat schip brak, and mine leoue sones : ne mi&yogh;ten neuereft beo i|founde; Ake me heo caste to londe al quik : allas þulke stounde! Ine mai for feblesse wende a-&yogh;ein : ne Ine habbe no man þat me lede, And not &yogh;weþer mi louerd and mi &yogh;ongue sone : beon quike oþur dede."
37.8: "Clement," seide seint peter : "þat min o desciple nouþe is, Seith þat is fader and is moder : þis cas bi-feollen, al. bifel i-wis." Þis womman feol a-don i-swowe : þo heo i-heorde þis. Þo heo a-ros, heo cride &yogh;eorne : and weop for Ioie and blis, And seide, "sire, þat is mi sone. : tech me &yogh;ware he beo! Ine wilne mi lijf no leng to habbe : bote þat ich him enes i-seo." Seint peter seide, "cum forth with me : to him ichulle þe lede. Ake ne beo þov nou&yogh;t a-knowe to him : erore þane ich þe rede." he nam þis wommane bi þe hond : and to hire sone hire brou&yogh;te. Þo seint Clement i-sai&yogh; him lede ane womman : vuel bi him he þou&yogh;te, And seide, "nouþe In þine olde liue : woltþou with wommane beo?" So wroth he was þat vnneþe he wolde : toward him bi-seo. ¶ Þis guode wijf stod bi hire sone : heo ne mi&yogh;te for-bere non-more, heo bi-cluppte him faste and custe a-non : for Ioye heo weop ful sore. hire hondene þat hire weren bi-nome : anon-ri&yogh;t hole huy were, For Ioye, and for grete vertue : of þe holie men þere.
37.9: SEint Clement was wroth with hire : for heo bi-clupte him and custe, MS. clupte And in grete wrathþe hire pulte a-wei : and to þe grounde upri&yogh;t þruste. "Clement," seide seint peter þo : "darstþov þine moder pulte? Þov cri hire Merci and lat þe schriue : for þine foule gulte!" "Louerd," seide seint cleme[n]t [þo] : "&yogh;weþur þis mi moder beo? Louerd, i-hered beo þi mi&yogh;te : þat ich moste þis day i-seo!" To is moder he ful a-doun : and bi-clupte hire and custe. Welle, þe Ioye þat þare was : þo eiþur of oþur wuste! Þis wyf seide, "leoue sone, þin ore : &yogh;weþur þi fader a-liue beo?" "Certes, moder," he seide, "i-not : Ine wene neuer-eft him i-seo. Twenti &yogh;er it is ago : þat he After þe i-wende, Þat neuer-eft Ine heorde word of him : ne he ne cam ne sende." Þis guode wyf bi-gan to weope sore : ake natheles for blisse Of hire sone þat heo hadde I-founde : hire seoruwe heo gan to lisse.
37.10: Euere stoden bi seint peter : his oþere desciples tweie Þat fram symon Magus weren i-come to him : and &yogh;eorne bi|heolden beie; huy i-heorden hou þis guode wyf tolde : to clemente, hire sone, þere, hov hire tweie leoue sones : in þe se a-dreinte were. Þo huy hadden þis tale i-heord : huy weren swiþe glad, For Ioye huy stoden ase þei huy weren : witlese oþur orig.and a-mad. "louerd," huy seiden, "&yogh;weþer þis beo soth : þat we i-heorez nouþe telle, oþur us þinchez ase in metingue : oþur in manere of spelle?" "hit is soth," seint peter seide : "oþur me þinchez &yogh;e beoth wode." huy nusten &yogh;weþur to beon stille oþur speke : bote ase gydie men huy stode. ¶ "Louerd," huy seiden, "here is ore Moder : þat a-dreint was ase we wende, I-hered he beo þat hire hath to liue i-brou&yogh;t : And þat hire to us sende! And þis is Clement, ore &yogh;ongue broþur : þat longue hath i-beo ore fere; Nuste we neuere er &yogh;wat he was : are þoru&yogh; godes grace nouþe here." Louerd, þe Ioye þat þe[re] was : And þat manie Mi&yogh;ten i-seo, bi-twene þe guode wyf and hire sones : þe swete breþren þreo!
37.11: ÞIs guode wyf axede hire tweye sones : hov huy to liue come. "Dame," huy seiden, "ase god it wolde : a bord of þe schype we nome And þar-on we hienguen, and hit bar us forth : into þe se wel wide. Marineres us token into heore schipe : ase we floten heom bi-side. Are huy us hadden to londe i-brou&yogh;t : huy nolden neuere a-fine. To Ane holie wydewe huy solden us : þat hiet dame Iustine; Þat us lokede nesche I-nov&yogh; : as þei we hire sones were, And, god &yogh;ielde it hire! of clergie : heo liet us sone lere. So þat we beoth nouþe godes desciples : and with his Apostle here. Ore broþur clement we knoweth nouþe furst : þat &yogh;are hath i-beon ore fere. And nouþe we beoth here to-gadere come : we mowen i-seo godes mi&yogh;te, Þat euere wole mannes &yogh;wyle &yogh;elde : þat seruez him with ri&yogh;te." Ech man wot wel þat þis I-heorth : þey we ne seggen it i-lome, gret Ioye bi-twene heom alle was : þo huy to-gadere come. ¶ þis guode wyf heom tolde of hire hostesse : þat Innede hire bi ny&yogh;te, Þat heo was a guod womman and was bedrade : &yogh;if huy hire hele mi&yogh;ten.
37.12: SEint petre hire let fette : and þoru&yogh; ore louerdes grace Made hire hol, bi-fore al þat folk : anon in þulke place.— Ase seint petre prechede a day : he seide in his prechingue Þat, ho-so seruede ore louerd wel : scholde habbe guod endingue. ¶ Þo stod þare op a swiþe old man : his lockes weren ful hore; pouere and stoupinde and miseise. : he bi-gan to siken sore. "gret revþe," he seide, "ich habbe of eov : þat &yogh;e bi-trayez men so; Ech man bi-fallez ase his &yogh;wate is : &yogh;wat-so he euere do. ¶ For þei a man swyncke and crie on god : and bidde &yogh;eorne is bede, him schal bi-falle, guod oþur vuel : ase it is him i-queþe. Þei mani man beo wis and euere swynke : he ne may neuere bate; And þei manie don vuele and euere folie : &yogh;eot he hath guod &yogh;wate." ¶ Seint petre hiet þe þreo breþren : þat is desciples were, Despuyti a&yogh;ein þis olde man : of þat he tolde þere. huy stoden and heore [r]esones orig. oresones seiden : þat ech man scholde a-fongue After þat he wurche wolde : And elles it were with wrongue; "For, ho-so nath no guod, ne swinke nele : ne of porueance beo, &YOGH;wat-so-euere man beo Iqueþe : he ne may it neuere fleo; r. i-þeo And [ho]-so is wys to winne guod : and wel it witie can, &YOGH;wat-so-euere is &yogh;wate beo : he worth riche man. For ore louerd wole here and elles-&yogh;ware : &yogh;elden ane mannes seruise After þat he him-seolf wurche wole : ake aftur &yogh;wate in none wise."
37.13: GRet clerk was þis olde Man : he desputede wel faste A-&yogh;ein þe þreo breþren with gret reson. : þat playt wel longue laste. Seint Clement was grettest clerk : þare-fore atþenende Maister he was, þoru&yogh; grace : þat ore louerd him wolde sende. Atþe laste þis olde Man : bi-gan to sike and grone, And seid[e], "wel, icholde i-leue : ower resones ech-one, &YOGH;if I-ne hadde to muche i-fondet : of þinge þat geth bi &yogh;wate. Alas þulke soruful tyme : for mi confort cometh to late! Riche man ich was elles-&yogh;ware : þei ich beo nouþe a wrechche here; Ich hadde þreo &yogh;oungue children : and a guod wif þat was mi fere. Mine tweie sones heo ladde awei : þo we heom hadden al bi-swonke : Ine heorde neuereft word of heom : Ich wot huy beoth a-dronke. Alle myne freond and al mi guod : Ich bi-lefte me bi-hynde And habbe here i-walke in onkovþe londe : &yogh;if ich heom mi&yogh;te i-fynde. Mi &yogh;ongeste child ich bi-lefte athom : Ich wene þat he beo ded. Worse &yogh;wate nadde neuere man : Inot &yogh;wat is mi red. And ich am, overlined. þare no man me ne knoweth : mid miseise ouer-come; honguer and chele hath myne leomes : and elde, me bi-nome. Seggez ov-sulf &yogh;if &yogh;e euere I-heorden : Ani so deolful cas! ho is þat ne may i-leue : þat luþur &yogh;wate it nas?" ¶ Þo þis þreo breþren hore fader i-knewen : þoru&yogh; þat he hadde i-sed, Sturten huy wolden and cussen him. : ake seint petre heom for-bed, And seide, "&yogh;if ich bringue bi-fore þe i-hole : þine children and þi wijf, Woltþov for-hote þine mis-bi-leue : and a-mendi þi lijf And i-leue þat þing MS. þing þat comez ase god wole : and no-þing after &yogh;wate?" "&YOGH;e, sire," seide þis olde man : "Ake þat worth so wel late. Also ase it neuere ne worth : þat ich i-seo heom alle, And al. om. so ne worth hit neuere þat muche þing : nele bi &yogh;wate falle." ¶ "Lo," seide seint petre þo : "þis beoth þine sones þreo, Þat, for-to bringue þe in godes lawe : plaidiez a&yogh;ein þe." Þo þis olde Man i-heorde þis : his limes him bere nolde, huy nescheden ase doth wex a-&yogh;ein þe fuyre : And ful a-don on þe molde; he lai al cold with-oute breþe : ase þei he no lyf nadde. his [sones] him clupten a[n]d custen him : sore huy weopen and gradde; huy beren him a-boute and bleowen on him : &yogh;if huy him mi&yogh;ten in stat bringue. Longue it was are heo mi&yogh;ten : i-seo of liue : Ani ri&yogh;t tokningue. Þo is stat him was i-come : he axede a-non-ri&yogh;t þere hov huy weren a-liue forth i-brou&yogh;t : so freondlese ase huy were. Euerech tolde in his wise : ore swete louerdes mi&yogh;te, Þat he on heom i-schewed hadde : ho-so onder-stode þe ri&yogh;te. Ase huy tolden of heore lijf : euerech in his side, Þis guode wif orn ase heo were wilde : and swiþe loude heo cride: "&YOGH;ware is mi louerd? &yogh;ware is mi spouse? : schewez him me a-non!" huy bi-clupten heom and fullen a-doun : a fote ne mi&yogh;ten huy gon. More Ioye ne mi&yogh;te beo i-sei&yogh;e : bi none mannes liue, Þane was, þo huy to-gadere comen : a-mong heom alle fiue. here we mouwen alle i-seo : ore swete louerdes mi&yogh;te, Þat euere atþenende he wole &yogh;elde : þe manne þat him seruez with ri&yogh;te.—
37.14: HIt bi-ful þat þe Aumperour : ouer-al sende is sonde, Symon Magus, þe luþere man : to sechen him into al þe londe, For-to sleen him, ho-so him mi&yogh;te I-finde : al for his luþer-hede. And þo symon Magus i-heorde þar-of : he was in grete drede. On feolonie he þou&yogh;te for wrathþe : of þe breþren tweie, Faust and Faustin, þat weren with him : and departed fram him bei&yogh;e. bi hore fader he cam a day : ase þe deuel him gan lere, And caste on him is owene fourme : ase þei it him-sulf were, Þoru&yogh; is foul enchauntement— : ho-so þe ne olde manne i-sei&yogh;e, wenden þat symon magus it were. : þare was þe deuel to slei&yogh;e, For þe Ioye þat his sones hadden : of him þare in one stounde; And for he schold e beon for him a-slawe : &yogh;if he mi&yogh;te beon i-founde. For euere þe deuel, and alle his : of feolonie doth þenche; Ake atþe laste huy worþeth bi-traid : with heore feolle wrenche. ¶ Symon Magus wende a-wei orig. a&yogh;en : þo al þis i-don was. Þis guode [man] &yogh;eode forth to is children : he nuste nou&yogh;t of þat cas : he cam and wolde gret Ioye make : with heom and with is wiue. huy spatten on him, euerechone : and heten him a-wei wel bliue, For he was þe deueles lyme : huy nolden nou&yogh;t with him dele, Ake bote he þe sonere fram heom &yogh;eode : him to wroþer hele.
37.15: " Alas," seide þis olde Man : "Mine leoue overlined. children þreo, &YOGH;wi wolle &yogh;e ouwer fader þus pulte and bete? : nelle &yogh;e me nonmore i-seo?" "Nay," seiden þis breþren þreo : "þov nart ore fader nou&yogh;t, Þov art symon Magus, godes trichor. : to deþe þov worst i-brou&yogh;t; &YOGH;if þe Aumperores [men] þe mouwen finde : þat wide þe habbez i-sou&yogh;t, Þov worst to-drawe ase þe deueles lime : for falshede þat þou hast i|wrou&yogh;t." ¶ "Louerd, merci," seide þis olde man : "&yogh;wodere may ich nouþe iwende, Nouþe mi wijf ne mine sones me nellez i-knowe : o dai to þenende? Mest wrechche ich am of alle men : nouþe Ine habbe freond non bote heom, and huy me wollez a-sle. : &yogh;wodere may ich nouþe gon?" ¶ Symon Magus þare-at-fore : in Auntioche ase al. om. he wende, And seint petre bi-fore al þat folk : with lesingues foule he schende; he seide þat he man-quellare was : and wichche, and eke for-swore : Þat folk a-waytede him for-to sle : In Auntyoche þare-fore. ¶ Seint petre þis onder-&yogh;at : he wolde beon a-wreke, he þou&yogh;te. he cam to þis seli oldeman : þat him wel longue sou&yogh;te; "beo stille," he seide, "and do Aftur me : and soffre a luytel þrowe, And Ichulle makien þat þi wijf : and þine sones : þe schullen sone i-knowe. Þov schalt gon In-to Auntioche : þare symon Magus was, Ase he me desclaundret hath : and segge of þis ilke cas In his name, ase ech man weneth : þat þov he him-sulue beo, And segge þat hit lesingue is : þat þov seidest op-on me, And line al-so þine owene Mouth : as þei it beo in his name, And þat hit was al les þat þov seidest : to bringue me in luþer fame, And þat þov art þarof repentaunt : sori, and swiþe wel I-schriue, Of þe lesingue þat þov bi me seidest : and bide heom it þe for-&yogh;yue."
37.16: ÞIs olde Man &yogh;eode him forth : In-to Auntioche a-non, And &yogh;ede a-boute to Mani a stude : þare symon hadde I-gon; "Guode Men," he seide, "&yogh;if ich habbe i-told : bi seint petre eni|þing bote guod and gret trewenesse : for-soþe, it is lesing; here bi-foren eov euerech-one : ich lixni minne owene Mouth. For he is treowe and studefast : and is guodnesse is wide couth. For-to saui al þat lond : ore louerd him hath i-sent : bi-lieueth and wurcheth aftur him : oþur &yogh;e beoth alle I-schent! For &yogh;e eov-seolf and Al eower guod : þoru&yogh; ore louerdes wreche hit schal for-fare, bote &yogh;e don : ase he eov wole lere ant teche. &YOGH;if ich euere-eft more am so : in þe deoueles weorke I-brou&yogh;t Þat Ich ani-þing oþur bi him segge : ne leuez me þar-of nou&yogh;t, Ake doth me overlined. schame and betez me : ant bringuez me of dawe, Ase men schullen a strong liare : and man of false lawe." ¶ Þare-Aftur-ward he cam to seint petre : and he is leomen ri&yogh;te And brou&yogh;te him a-&yogh;ein to is owene fourme : al þoru&yogh; godes mi&yogh;te. Þo was þere gret Ioye bi-tweone [is sones] om. : and him and eke is wiue, þo huy weren in ri&yogh;te fourme : to-gadere alle fiue.
37.17: Euere is strengore ore swete louerd : þane þe deuel atþende! And symon Magus-is tricherie : op-on him-sulf it gan i-wiende. Al al. for Auntioche wel gret loue : opon seint petre caste, And sore heom longuede after him : and leten him seche faste. ¶ Seint Petre cam to Auntioche : ase he hadde er I-lome : Men and wommen of þe lond : wel glade a-boute him come, And Anoureden him suyþe muche : ase ane prince of godes lawe And Ase heore maister and heore louerd— : huy weren of him wel fawe; In riche chayre huy setten him : and knevlede him bi-fore, And beden wel &yogh;eorne him wardi heom : and techen, þat heore soulene neren for-lore. ¶ Þis was a-seint petres day : þat comez in feuerer, Þat for þe honour of þulke dede : men helewiez feor and ner. Þo þis dede was al I-don : and seint petre þannes i-wend, Symon Magus hyede þudere : and heold him foule I-schend. bi-fore al þis folk he cam : "Muche wonder me þinchez," he sede, "Þat ich ouwer soule-bote here-bi-fore : and to eouwer guod gan eov rede, Þat &yogh;e ne flouwen petre, þane trichour : þat he a-mong eov ne come; And nou&yogh;t one ne al. &yogh;e Anoreden him : ake wit grete nobleie him nome And an hei&yogh; in chaire MS. in chaire In chaire setten him : ase he eouwer crist were. Fleoth fram him, &yogh;if &yogh;e wollez i-sauede beon : and doth ase ich eov lere!" ¶ Þo al þat folk i-heorde þis : for wrathþe heo weren nei&yogh; wode; "False trichour," huy seiden, "þis oþur day : bi-fore us here þov stode And seidest þat he was treowe and guod : and þat we after him do scholde, And seist nouþe þat he is luþer and fals! : þi &yogh;wile worth sone i-&yogh;olde," huy sturten forth and beoten þis foule þeof : þat he was nei&yogh; a-slawe; Nadde he þe revlocur i-cried on heom : hey r. huy wolden him habbe to-drawe. Ase he mi&yogh;te, he crep a-wei : with many a luþur strok. Þare he him-seolf, ase euerech swyke doth : him-seolf he bi-swok!
37.18: Seint petre &yogh;eode to rome : with his desciple þreo. he wuste þat is tyme was nei&yogh; : þat he Imartred scholde beo : Seint Clement al bi is daye : he made him pope at rome, Þat he guode &yogh;eme after him : to holie churche nome. ¶ Þo seint petre I-martred was : seint clement him bi-sou&yogh;te : al. biþou&yogh;te vv. 401-4 are corrupted. &YOGH;if he bi-lefte pope forth : ase þat folk him bi-sou&yogh;te, Þat no al. om. pope ne al. om. mi&yogh;te aftur him : Ane oþurne pope make, &YOGH;wam so huy wolden, þoru&yogh; heore wille : oþur for on the margin. eni mede take; Þat he him bad for godes loue : þat no pope bi is daye Non oþur pope ne scholde maken so : holie churche to bi-traye; vv. 403-4 added. For a wardein of holie churche : þoru&yogh; is godnesse man schal take, Þat al. om.; r. and? nou&yogh;t, ase it were bi heritage : þat o freond þat oþur make. he tok up is dignete : for al þat man him bad, And seint lyn, þat was a guod man : was pope in his stude Imad. After seint lynes daye : alle þe men wolde Seint clemente habbe pope Imad : ake for no-þing &yogh;eot he nolde; Se[int] MS. Se Clete huy maden pope þo. : ake after is dai&yogh;e a-non Þat folk heold seint clement faste : huy nolden him nou&yogh;t for-gon; h Alflingue with strencþe huy maden him pope. : and þo hit cam þar-to, he fondede to paye euer-ech Man : riche and pouere al-so. he honourede more þe pouere Men : þane he dude þe riche, to helpe more is al. þe soule þane is al. þe bodi— : for huy ne beot nou&yogh;t Iliche. Sisyme, þe Iustise of þe lond : hadde a swiþe guod wijf, Þat þoru&yogh; se[int] cleme[n]t I-cristned was : for-to amendi hire lijf. &YOGH;wane heo mi&yogh;te, fram hire louerd [heo stole] : al with-oute fiere. A day, ase on the margin. heo wolde to churche gon : he siwede hire wel swiþe. 2 vv. om. Sone so heo to churche cam : and hire hovse-bonde onder-&yogh;at, MS. it onder-&yogh;at A-drad heo was, and hudde hire : in one [derne] stude heo sat. Þo seint clement seide is oresun : and is clerkes amen seide, Þe Iustise i-werth boþe def and blind. : wel loude he gan to grede : "&YOGH;ware beo &yogh;e nouþe, mine men? : ovt &yogh;e moten me lede, For Ine mai mi-seolf I-seo ne heore. : &yogh;wat mai ich to-rede? cometh forth to me euerechone : and out heonnes &yogh;e me leden!" vv. 426-7 al. om. his Men sturten forth And nomen him op : huy swatten alle for drede. huy beren him al-a-boute þe churche : huy ne mi&yogh;ten þe dore finde : &YOGH;wane huy wenden atþe dore to beo : þanne weren huy feor bi-hinde. Sore was þis guode wijf a-drad : þo heo i-sai&yogh; heom so fare : heo Axede &yogh;wat hire louerd were— : for no leng ne mi&yogh;te heo spare. huy seiden, "for he wolde orig. huy wolden I-seon and I-heore : oþur þane to him bi-come, bi-come he is blijnd and def : here in þe churche of Rome." Þis guode wijf bad ore louerd &yogh;eorne : þat huy mosten þannes ovt wende : Þo founden þis men þe dore a-non : and wenden out atþenende. Þis guode wijf bad Clement &yogh;eorne : to hire louerd come And amendi him þoru&yogh; godes grace : of is limes, þat him weren bi-nome. ¶ Seint clement and þis guode wijf to þis luþere man gonne teo : huy founden him loki swiþe brode : and no-þing ne mi&yogh;te i-seo. vv. 439-40 al. om. Seint clement bad ore louerd for him : and þo he i-don hadde, his heoringue and is si&yogh;t him cam a-&yogh;ein. : ake neuere þonk he ne hadde. For a-non so he i-sai&yogh; seint clement stonde : bi is wiue, he wende And seide þat he hadde bi hire i-leie : and þare-fore he him a-blende. Þis guode wijf &yogh;eode into hire preuetez : and Iesu crist [bad] wel faste Þat hire louerd þoru&yogh; is grace : in-to betere bi-leue him caste.
