37.19: SEint petre fram heouene : to hire a-li&yogh;te a-doun And s[e]ide, hire louerd scholde i-saued beo : þoru&yogh; hire oresun; "For seint powel seide MS. seide seide; al. For me saiþ þat a luþer man : scholde i-saued beo Þoru&yogh; guodnesse of a godwomman : And so it worth bi him and þe." Þis guode wyf eode to hire louerd : and prechede him of cristine-dom : So þat he þoru&yogh; godes grace : in-to guode bi-leue he com. he liet him cristni sone a-non : and al is may[n]e þere, Þre hondret men and tweolue : with him i-cristnede were. ¶ TraIan, þe luþere Amperour : herof he heorde speke : he swor he wolde for his Iustise : of seint clement beo a-wreke. he comaundede Mamertyn : þat was an oþur Iustise, Þat he scholde maken clement þe pope : to don heom al. om. sacrefise Oþur maken him out of londe fleme— : þat he ne lete it nou&yogh;t, Laste heore lawe and heore godes weren : þoru&yogh; him to grounde i-brou&yogh;t. ¶ Þis Iustise wende þo wiþ MS. þou&yogh; gret power : And seint clement he nom; orig. nam And for he nolde don heore godes h. g. al. om. sacrefise : he &yogh;af him an oþur dom : Þat he scholde beon out of londe i-driue : into wildernesse. Ase a þeof he was i-harlet forth : in wel fyl destresse. Þo he into wildernesse cam : to þousende he fond þere Of cristine Men, þat hadden þer : longue i-woned for fere, Laste þe Aumperoures men : In torment heom hadden i-brou&yogh;t; And huy for drede of strongue deþe : weren in feble þou&yogh;t.— For manie men bi þulke daie : for drede of þulke þingue Ase bestes huy leoueden in wildernesse : þo cristinedom bi-gan furst springue.— Wel glade weren þis guode men : þo huy seint clement i-sei&yogh;e : heo &yogh;eoden a-&yogh;ein him and þonkeden god : weopinde with heore eie. huy maden seint clement heore Maister þere : pope ase he was. Þare nas non þat in studefast lijf : for him a-mendet ne was. Water huy nadden nei&yogh; heom non : bi six Mile wei wel longue, Al heore drinke huy fetten þare : in wei&yogh;e swiþe stronge. Seint clement [bad] ore louerd crist : &yogh;if hit is wille were, Þat he holpe is trewe couent : and sende heom watur þere. he i-sai&yogh; a lomb stonde and marki : with is ri&yogh;t fot ane stude : he i-sai&yogh; þat hit ore louerd was : to don þat he hadde i-bede. ¶ Seint clement &yogh;eode and smot in þulke stude : as þat lomb markede er : Þare sprong a welle fair and guod— : wel gret Ioye was þer. Þis Miracle was widen i-cud : fif hondret men þare-fore bi-comen cristine and blesseden þe time : þat seint clement was i-bore. Þo &yogh;ede he forþere a-mong þe men : and so fair Miracle wrou&yogh;te, Swiþe muche folk to guode bi-leue : and to Iesu crist he brou&yogh;te. Fyf hondred of Maumates : to grounde he brou&yogh;te þere; And sixti churche and fiftene : in heore studes he liet a-rere.
37.20: So þat traIan þe Aumperour : her-of heorde telle : Ane duyk of gret power he sende þudere : þane guode man for|to quelle. Þis duyk him nam and liet to overlined. him binde : grete orig. and gr. stones wel faste, And ladden him feor in-to þe deope se : and ri&yogh;t a-midde him caste. Welle, muche was þe deol : þat is desciples for him made! In-to þe se huy ornen to sechen him : ase feor ase huy dorsten wade. Þo huy ne mi&yogh;ten nei&yogh; him come : ore louerd wel &yogh;eorne huy beade r. bade to &yogh;iuen heom a si&yogh;t of seint clement : þe more to beon glade. Ase huy seten opon þe .se : and crieden on him wel faste and &yogh;eorne, Þe .se. wel swiftliche hire with-drav&yogh; al. wiþdrou&yogh; : and with gret eyr In gan eorne : So þat with-inne þe deope .se : þreo grete Milene and more A swiþe fair wei and druye þare was : i-here[d] beo godes ore! Þis guode men bi þis faire wei : In-to þe .se. gonne to wende : Ane churche hui founden, of Marbre i-maud : ri&yogh;t atþe weies ende. With-Inne þe churche huy founden ane cofre : of seluer and of golde And þarinne seint clementes bodi : ase ore louer[d] it wolde. Welle, louerd, muche was þe Ioye : þat þis guode Men inne were, For þe faire Miracle of seint clement : þat huy founden þere! huy beden heore beden &yogh;wat-so huy wolden : and wenden a&yogh;en at|þenende : euere orn þe se after heom wel faste : at heore helene bi-hinde, For-to heo cam to hire ri&yogh;te stude : and þare heo gan atstonde. Þis guode men serueden god þe bet : and þonke[den] &yogh;eorne is sonde.
37.21: Longue þer-aftur it bi-feol : þoru&yogh; ore louerdes heste, fram &yogh;er to &yogh;ere seue dawes : at seint clementes festes þat þe se ire wolde so with-drawe : and makie ane wei wel druye To þe holie chapele of seint clement : þat no watur ne scholde man a-nuye; Þat ech Man alle þe seuen dawes : al druye wende and clene, For-to honouri þat holie bodi : ase it bi-feol eche &yogh;ere ene; And Anon-ri&yogh;t þe se wende a-&yogh;ein : with watur and with slyme After þe ei&yogh;te dawes, and heold him so : for-to an oþur &yogh;er þat tyme.
37.22: Awommon cam MS. cam cam þudere at one tyme : and a child þat was hire sone, For-to A-novri þat swete bodi : as it was mannes wone. hit feol at MS. þat þe endingue : of þe seueþe dai&yogh;e þat þe se cam eorne & rotte &yogh;eorne : ase þat child a-slepe laye. Þat folk, þat þare was bi-leued : bi-gonne ateorne faste; Þis womman louede hire lyf al-so : þat heo nas nou&yogh;t þe laste. Þo heo was to londe i-come : and hire sone overlined. mid hire nadde, Muche was þe deol þat heo made : loude heo weop and gradde. gredinde heo orn and longue sou&yogh;te : a-boute bi þe se-side, &YOGH;if þe .se. him hadde up i-cast— : heo sou&yogh;te a-boute wel wide. Þo heo ne mi&yogh;te him nou&yogh;were i-finde : weopinde hom heo wende, And bad seint clement, of hire childe : þat he sum gladnesse hire sende. heo bi-lefte al þe &yogh;er : in gret sor and in care. Anoþur &yogh;er at seint clementes tid : þuder-ward heo wolde fare. al. was &yogh;are To þe chapele &yogh;eorne heo orn : þo þe se was In i-weved : orig. i-wend h Ire MS. Ire; h added. sone heo fond in þulke stude : þare heo hine hadde bi-leued. Sone þis womman nam him up : and wende þat he MS. heo ded were. Þat child, ase þei it woke of slepe : Axede &yogh;wat heo wolde þere. Þis womman for Ioie gradde loude : þat folk a-boute hire wende, And þonkeden god with grete Ioye : þat swuche miracle him sende. huy axeden hov he hadde so longue i-leued : And &yogh;if he were ou&yogh;t i-drei&yogh;t. "hit nis nov&yogh;t longue," þat child seide : "ake to sone &yogh;e me MS. me me habbez a-wei&yogh;t; Softe and swote i habbe MS. &yogh;e habbez i-slepe : onneþe me þinchez o ny&yogh;t. Moste ich lengore habbe i-lei&yogh;e : me hadde i-beo wel i-di&yogh;t." With gret Ioye huy ladden þis child hom. : þis miracle was couth wel wide. Mani fair Miracle sein t clement dude : bi þe sees sides. ¶ þe se with-drov&yogh; hire wel mani a &yogh;er : to maken men druye i-wende; And þulke miracle for mannes [sunne] : bi-lefde sethþe atþen ende. Þo Men founden þis holie &yogh;wuchche : In a fair place stonde with þis holie bodi a-boue þe se : al on druye londe; Muche folk with fair procession : þis holie bodi nome And ladden it forth with gret honour : to þe churche of rome. Þare is nouþe seint clementes churche : I-mad with quoynte gynne. god &yogh;iue us part of þulke Ioy&yogh;e : þat seint clement is inne.

38.1: SEynt laurence guod man was : and in strong Marty r dom he endede here on eorþe is lijf : and to þe Ioye of heuene he com. Decius þe Aumperour : þat luþur was i-nov&yogh;, And is Iustise Valerian : þat to alle schrewe-hede drov&yogh;, huy wenden and sou&yogh;ten cristine Men : and &yogh;wane huy enie founde, huy pineden heom with gret torment : and brou&yogh;ten heom sone to grounde. huy comen MS. comenen and founden þene bischop sixte : and a-slowen him with gret wou&yogh;. Seint laurence was is Ercedeckne : þat guod man was i-nov&yogh;. ¶ þo þe bischop scholde beon i-nome : and he þat cas i-sei&yogh;, Seint laurence, is Ercedekne : he cleopede, þat was him nei&yogh; : Al þat tresor of holie churche : þat he to-gadere drov&yogh; Seint laurence he it bi-tok : to witien it wel i-nov&yogh;. þe tormentores, þat þis i-sei&yogh;en : heom boþe huy nome faste, Seint sixte and seint laurence : and strongue biendes on heom caste. huy ladden seint sixte to heore false godes : and is tweie felawes al-so, And scheweden heom heore false hymages : and beden heom a-loute þar-to; Þo þis guode men nolden don so : ake on ore louerd huy crieden faste, huy smiten of heore heuedes sone : and heore bodies þare caste. Þe Aumperoure huy senden word : al &yogh;wat huy hadden i-do, And hov seint laurence in prisone was : in strongue bendes, al-so, And hou he al þat tresor hadde : of churchene to him i-drawe. A v. om. Þe Aumperov[r] i-heorde þis : he was glad þarof and fawe : For he þou&yogh;te þat tresor al habbe : þei it were a-&yogh;en lawe. ¶ Þane holie Man he liet fette : and bi-fore him lede, And bi-heold him wel stuyrneliche : and wrotþeliche MS. wortþeliche to him sede : "&YOGH;ware is þat tresor of þe churchene : þat þe was i-brou&yogh;t?" Seint laurence stod wel stille : and ne ansuerede MS. ansueredede him ri&yogh;t nou&yogh;t. Þe Aumperour was swiþe wroth : þo he ne &yogh;af him non Answere; A-non he wolde habbe defouled him : vnneþe he it al. om. ni&yogh;te for-bere. he liet cleopie valerian : þat was is hei&yogh;e Iustise, "Nim," he seide, "þeosne Man : wel faste in alle wise And win of him þat tresor : and make him don sacrefise, Oþur bring him in swuch torment : þat oþure of him a-grise." Þe Iustise nam þene holie Man : and liet him binde faste, And bi-tok him Ypolite, þe kny&yogh;t : In strong prisone to caste. he brou&yogh;te [him] in strong prisoun : and bi-lek him faste al-so, with þeoues and with luþere Men : þat hadden þe Aumperoure mis-do.— On heþene man þare was Inne : lucille was is name, Þat hadde þare-inne so muche i-wope : for seoruwe and for schame, Þat he weop out boþe is ei&yogh;ene : and al blynd was bi-come. Seint laurence hadde reuþe : þat is si&yogh;t him was bi-nome : "bi-lief," he seide, "on Iesu crist : þat for us schedde is blod, And afong cristinedom : ant þov schalt habbe þi si&yogh;t wel guod." "Ich bi-lieue," þis oþur seide : "on him with al mi þou&yogh;t, And for-sake alle þeos false godes : þat ne mowen me helpe nou&yogh;t." ¶ Seint laurence baptizede him : and a-non-ri&yogh;t with þe dede his si&yogh;t him cam wel cler and guod. : þo bi-gan he a-non to grede : "I-hered beo swete Iesu crist : þat here hath i·cud is mi&yogh;te And þoru&yogh; is seriaunt, seint laurence : me hath i-sent mi si&yogh;te! For ase &yogh;e wuten euerechone : mi si&yogh;t me was bi-nome, And þoru&yogh; Iesu crist and seint laurence : it is me a&yogh;ein i-come." Þis tyþingue sprong sone wide : so þat oþore i-nowe Þat wide a-boute blinde weren : þuder-ward faste huy drowe. ¶ Þo Ypolite þis i-sai&yogh; : þat ore louerd hadde swuch mi&yogh;te Þat alle þe blinde þat þudere comen : anon hadden heore si&yogh;te, "Merci!" he criede, "seint laurence" : and to Iesu MS. Iusu. crist him nam, And he, and al is maynie : nomen cristine-dom.
38.2: Valerian þare-after-ward sone : ase it cam in is þou&yogh;te, Sende to ypolite þe kny&yogh;t : þat he seint laurence him brou&yogh;te. "Nov, laurence," quath ypolite : "forth ich mot þe lede." "&YOGH;e, go we forth," seide laurence : "ne schal us no-þing drede : Þe Ioye of heouene is al-&yogh;are : to us boþe in alle wise." Þo ladde ypolit laurence forth : bi-fore þe luþere Iustise. Valerian þe Iustise : bi-heold laurence faste, And seide, "bel ami, hov longue : schal ower folie i-laste? Tuyrn þi þou&yogh;t, ich rede, sone : and schewe us þat tresour Of churchene þat þe was bi-take : and de-liuere it þe Aumperour!" ¶ "Sire Iustise," seint laurence seide : "&yogh;if þov onder-stanst resoun, Þov wost wel þat ich habbe i-leye : longue in þat prisoun, So þat i-ne habbe nou&yogh;t þat tresor : of churche here nov &yogh;are; Ake &yogh;if me þreo dawes furst : þat ich mouwe a-boute fare, And ich it wolle to-gadere bringue : and here bi-fore þe lede." Þo was þe Iustise swyþe glad : of wordes þat he sede; For hope of orig. op þat grete tresor : and for none oþur MS. oþur þur þingue, he &yogh;af him respit of þreo dawes : þat tresor forth to bringue, And bi-tok him ypolite in warde : þat he him a&yogh;ein brou&yogh;te. Forth huy wenden wide a-boute : and guod tresor huy sou&yogh;te : Alle þe men þat huy mi&yogh;ten finde : þat pouere and feble were, In sicnesse oþur in miseise : to-gadere huy brou&yogh;ten þere, And in ypolitus house hudden heom : And wenden to þe Aumperour. Þe Aumperour heom Axede sone : &yogh;ware were þat tresour. ¶ "Sire," seide seint laurence : "redi it is a-non." he wende out after þe selie Men : and bad heom with him gon. In-to þe paleis orig. palais he ladde heom forth : bi-fore þe Aumperour, "Lo, sire," he seide, "ich habbe i-brou&yogh;t : holi churche tresour. Þis tresour is swiþe holi and guod : and euere it wole i-laste, hit ne schal neuere wanie : ake euere wexe faste; In eche londe it is redi : &yogh;wodere-so ani man wiende; Þare-with Man may þe blisse of heouene : bugge with-outen ende." al. 2 vv. more. "Ei, traitre," seide þe Aumperour : "is it i-come here-to? hastþov us þus to scorn i-driue? : þov ne schalt non-more so." he liet him streope nakede a-non : and with smarte scourgene him bete, Þat blod orn bi is limes a-doun : boþe in lengþe and in grete (!). Þo seide þis holie man : "louerd, ich þonkie þe Þat a-mong þine holie compaynie : þi wille is to bringue me. And þov, wrechche luþere þing : þov art in gret torment i-wis, In wrathþe and soruwe of heorte : and neuere þe worse me nis." "A, traytour," seide þis luþere Man : "neltþov non-oþur singue?" Alle manere of tormenz : bi-fore him he liet bringue, Hokes of .Ire., and &yogh;weoles also : with rasores al-a-boute, And a bed of Ire with kene pikes : al brenninde with-oute, Scourgene of led and raketei&yogh;es : and oþere wel mani on, Þat we ne conne nou&yogh;t alle tellen : on eorþe nouþe nis swuch non. "Lo," seide þe Aumperour : "bi-hold nouþe al-a-boute, And honovre ore godes, ich rede, a-non : oþur herto þov schalt loute; al. route For alle þe tormenz þat þov i-sixt : and &yogh;eot wel mo þer-to, bote þov tuyrne þi þou&yogh;t a-non : on þi bodi schullen beo i-do." ¶ "Þov wrechche," seide þis holie man : "mi wille hath euere i-beo For-to come to þis murie solas : þat ich here nouþe i-seo. Wel mo tormenz þane here beoth : to þe beoth i-mad al-&yogh;are In þe pine of helle : &yogh;wane ich schal to þe Ioye of heuene fare."
38.3: Decius þe Aumperour þo : fierde ase he were wod. Þe compaynie of tormentores : wel prest bi-fore him stod : he het heom with grete staues : leggen on him to grounde. Þe tormentores leiden on him : and maden him mani a wounde. Ase huy beoten þis holie bodi : seint laurence him sede : "Þou wrechche, nouþe þov mi&yogh;t i-seo : þat I-nabbe of þe no drede." "Nimez a-non," quath þe Aumperour : "and makiez is torment more!" Wel redie weren þe schrewes alle : to don aftur is lore : Irene plates al brenninde : In is woundes huy duden so sore. "Swete louerd," þis holi man seide : "ich bidde þe milce and ore : For þo ich was harde a-coupet : I-ne for-sok þe nou&yogh;t, Ake þo me Axeden me, ich was a-knowe of þe : with worde and with þou&yogh;t." Þo decius i-heorde þis : for wrathþe he gan grede, And liet nime scourgene : with grete bottene al. battes of lede And liet beten þis holi man : þat is bones breken some; Þat he was op-on þe pointe of deth : and is strencþe nei&yogh; bi-nome. ¶ "Louerd," he seide, "Iesu crist : þat þoledest deth [for added later ] me, Onder-fong, &yogh;wane ich heonnes wiende : mine soule, ich bidde þe!" Þo cam þare a swete voiz : a-doun fram heuene anon, Þat þeos wordes to him seide : þat huy heorden ech-on : "&YOGH;eot þe beoth for godes loue : tormentes MS. tormentores to come wel mo." ¶ Þo Decius i-heorde þis : for wrathþe he gradde and wo : "Lo," he seide, "mine barones : þat mi conseileres &yogh;e beoth, Conseil nimez here-of al. To con|seile me in mine court : of þingue þat &yogh;e i-seoth : &YOGH;e i-heorez wel hov þe deuele[n] : with him spekez nov here— For of þing þat &yogh;e i-heorez alle : he ne may him nou&yogh;t skere. huy comieth here and confortiez him : ase &yogh;e i-heorez ech-on. Strong wichche [he] is, þat ne doutez : of ore godes ech-on; Wel hardi he is, for he ne tellez : of alle ore tormenz non. bi þe fei þat ich owe to mahun : an-oþur it schal gon!" Scourgene he liet nime of Ire : þat harde weren i-nov&yogh;, And is flesch, þat was er bi-leued : þare-with he al. me to-gnov&yogh;. Þo is flesch þus defouled was : þat reovþe it was to seo, "Þeof," he seide, "&yogh;eot þov schalt : In wel more torment beo." his chekene and is mouth a-boute : he liet MS. liete bete with stones, And daschte þe tiez out of is heued : and to-breken is bones. "Þov wrechche," he seide, "bi-þiench þi-seolf : and torne sone þi þou&yogh;t!" ¶ "Sire Aumperour," laurence seide : "þov spext al embe nou&yogh;t : I-nelle honovri none oþur godes : þane Iesus, in none wise; For him ich louie, and euere wolle : don him sacrefise." Þo Decius him hadde i-do : al þat he couþe bi-þenche, "Certes," he seide, "þov schalt beo ded : ne schaltþov nou&yogh;t so at|blenche." Strong fuyr he lieth maken and gret : and a gredire þar-on sette, Þene holie Man, seint laurence : þar-to he liet fette And al-a-long opon þe gredire : ouer þe fure him caste. Þe tormentores stoden al-a-boute : and bleowen þat fuyr wel faste; with Irene pikes huy pulten him : and schouen In al. him faste a-boue. Louerd, muche was þe pyne : þat he soffrede for þi loue! Þat fuyr bi-neoþe rostede him : al quic mid flesch and blode, And þe Irene pikes in is flesch : ful bitterliche huy wode. Seint laurence bi-gan to speke [þo] : and to þe Aumperore he sede : "Þov luþere wrechche, it ne deriez me nou&yogh;t : al þine luþere dede. Nim &yogh;eme þat þine fuyrie coles : wel muche a-kelez me, And into þe strongue fuyre of helle : huy schullen bringue þe.
38.4: "LOuerd Iesu crist, þov it wost : I-ne habbe þe nou&yogh;t for-sake, Ake clanliche mi bodi and al mi þou&yogh;t : þe ich habbe bi-take." Þo bi-heold he þene Aumperour : with fair semblaunt and louv&yogh; : "Þov wrechche," he seide, "þou hast i-rosted : þulke one side i-nou&yogh; : Torne hire opward and .et. hire nouþe : for &yogh;are heo is þare-to; And wiend and roste þat oþur side : þat heo beo i-nov&yogh; al-so." al. 2 vv. more. ¶ Þo bi-heold he up on hei&yogh; : and toward heouene is Eyene caste, And seide : "swete Iesu crist : Ich þonki þe wel faste Þat ich it habbe of-serued : at þine &yogh;ates In to wiende." With þulke worde he deide þo : and broute is lijf to ende. al. 2 vv. more. Ypolit, þe guode kny&yogh;t : þat he brou&yogh;te to cristine-dom, And þat him wuste in prisone .er : swyþe sori bi-com : bi ni&yogh;te he wende stillede-liche : and þis holie bodi he nom And burede hit wel stillede-liche : after is harde dom. Louerd, muche was þe pine : þat he þolede here : hit MS. his is wel ri&yogh;t þat he beo : Apostles i-fere. Novþe, Iesu, for þe grete pine : þat seint laurence here hadde, Vs bringue to þulke Ioye : þat þine Aungels his soule ladde. Amen.

39.1: SEint Kenelm, þe &yogh;ongue kyng : þat holi martyr is, he was kyng in Engelonde : of þe Marche of Walis. Kyng kenulf his fader hiet : he was kyng þare also; Þe Abbeie of wynchecoumbe he liet arere : And þare-inne monekes do; And Aftur is deþe he was þare i-bured : and &yogh;eot he lijth þere In þe Abbei&yogh;e, þat &yogh;eot stant : þat he him-seolf liet a-rere. Þo was wynchecombe gret cite : and mest of i-nov&yogh; Of al þulke half of Engelonde : so feor so his lond drou&yogh;. Fyf kingues þare weren þulke tyme : In engelonde i-do, For Enguelond was guod and long : and sum-del brod al-so. A-bouten ei&yogh;te hondret mile : Engelond long is Fram MS. fran þe South into þe North : and to houndret brod i-wis Fram þe Est into þe West. : al-so þare-inne beoth Manie wateres guode i-nowe : þat men al dai i-seoth. bote þreo wateres principales : of alle ne beoth, i-wis : Þat .on. is homber, þat oþur seuerne : and temes þe þridde is. To þe North-se hombur geth : þat is on of þe beste, And Temese into þe est-se : and seuerne into þe weste. ¶ Þeos fijf kyngus of Engelonde : þat weren bi olde dawe, hadden heore part ech bi him-seolf i-deld : ase it was ri&yogh;t and lawe. Þe kyng þat was of þe March : he hadde al þat beste : Muche del he hadde of Engelond : þat on half al-bi weste, Wyrecestre-schire, and ware-wike-schire : and þe schire of gloucestre— Þat is nei&yogh;wat al o bischopriche : þe bischopes of wyrecestre. he hadde þar-to chastre-schire : and derbi-schire al-so, And stafford-schire—þat beoth alle : to al. in one bischope-riche i-do, In þe bischop-riche of Chastre : and &yogh;eot heo beoth þar-to, Schrobbe-schire sum : and warewyke-schire haluen-del al-so. Þis king hadde al-so hereforde-schire : þat o bischopriche is, Ake Schrob-schire fallez haluendel : to þulke schire, al. bischopriche i-wis, And sum of warewike-schire : and of gloucestre-schire al-so. Sethþe hadde þe king of þe March : wel more lond þer-to : Nore-hampte-sc h ire, and boking-ham-schire : and þe schire of Oxen|ford, Leycestre-schire, . lincolne-schire : and þe schire of hert-ford— Þat is al o bischopriche : þat of lincolne nouþe is, Þat &yogh;wuylene was of deorkcestre : bi-side Oxenforde, i-wis. Sethþe hadde þe king of þe March : Notingham-schire þer-to— In þe bischopriche of Euerwike : bote þo nas it nou&yogh;t so. Þo was al þis lond i-cleoped : þe Marche of Walis : Of al þis seint kenelmes fader : he was king, i-wis. Non of alle þe oþere kyne-riches : a-&yogh;ein þis kinedom nas; And wynche-coumbe of al þis lond : chef Cite þo was. Þis fijf kyngues þat weren þo : þat on was of kent, i-wis, And þe oþer, ase ich ou seide er : of þe Marche of walis, Of Esex, r. Westsex and of North-homberlond : and of est-lond al-so— Þis fijf kynedomes in engelond : in þat time weren i-do. Þe king of west-sex hadde þo : al wilte-schire, i-wis, And Deorkecestre, al. Dorsete and barroke-schire : þat al o bischopriche is, To al. om. þe bischopriche of salesburi— : ake þo nas it so nou&yogh;t, orig. nou&yogh;t so For þe chief stude of þe bischopriche : at schirbourne was i-wrou&yogh;t. Sethþe hadde þe kyng of west-sex : south-sex al-so, Þe welde and al þe bischopriche : of Cicestre þer-to; And southampte-schire and soþereye : þat of þe r. o bischopriche is, Þe bischopriche of wynchestre : þat &yogh;uyt is þere, i-wis; And somer-sete [þat] to welles : þulke tyme drou&yogh;— Nov it is þe bischopriche of baþe : &yogh;e schullen i-wyten. al. &yogh;e witeþ wel inou&yogh; vv. 63-4 are transp. in the MS. ¶ Þe kyng of west-sex hadde sethþe : al deuene-schire, i-wis, And Cornwaile, þat in þe bischopriche : of Eccestre nouþe is.— Þe king of kent was þo kyng : of al þe londe of kent, Þat weren inne tweie bischopriches : and &yogh;eot nis it nou&yogh;t i-went : Þe bischopriche of Caunterburi : þat in Engelonde &yogh;eot is hext, And þe bischopriche of Roucestre : þat inþe west-side is next.— Þe king þat was of ast-londe : king was of North-folk, Þe bischopriche of Northwich : and al-so of south-folk And al þe bischopriche of hely : þat þe Yle of hely &yogh;eot is, And grauntebrugge-schire : þare-to fallez, i-wis; Seint Eadmund was of þat lond : kyng bi olde dawe— For he was in is owene lond : for is guodnesse a-slawe.— Þe kyng of North-humber-lond : was kyng, ich onder-stonde, Of al þe londe bi-&yogh;eonde houmber : A-non into scotlonde, Þe bischopriche of Eouerwik : and of Duyrham, i-wis; Seint Oswold bi olde dawe : was kyng of al þis. Þus manie kyngues weren : &yogh;wylene in Engelonde, And heore londes de-partede weren : þus, ich under-stonde.— Þe kyng þat was of þe march : ase ich telle bi-gan, Kenulf kyng he was i-cleoped : swiþe holi and guod man : Seint kenelm was is sone : and is eir al-so; Borewenild and quendrith : weren is dou&yogh;trene two. In þe foure-and-twentiþe &yogh;ere : of is kynedom Þe kyng on the margin. kenulf deide : and to þe IoIe of heuene he com— hit was afftur þat ore louerd : in his moder a-li&yogh;te Ei&yogh;te hundret &yogh;er and Nyntene : bi a-countes ri&yogh;te. ¶ Seint kenelm, is &yogh;onge sone : In is seuenþe &yogh;ere kyng was I-mad aftur him : al-þei he &yogh;ong child were. his [o] soster Borewenild : louede him i-nou&yogh; And in eche manere : to alle guod-nesse heo drou&yogh;. Quendrith, þe oþur soster : of hire maneres nas nou&yogh;t, For heo tornede to feolonie : and orig. ant to quede hire þou&yogh;t. ¶ heo i-sai&yogh; þat hire &yogh;ungue broþer : þat nas nou&yogh;t of seue &yogh;er, kyng was i-mad of al þat lond : þat heore fader hadde er : to him heo hadde gret onde : þat he scholde so riche beo And eir of hire fader lond : and of more power þane heo; heo þou&yogh;te, &yogh;if heo mi&yogh;te bringue : þis child of lijf-dawe, Þat heo wolde of is heritage : beo quene with lawe. Al hire þou&yogh;t was ni&yogh;t and day : to bi-þenche sum outrage, Þat þis child were i-brou&yogh;t of dawe : for-to habbe is heritage. heo porueide hire ri&yogh;t feolonliche : A poysun, strong i-nou&yogh;, For-to &yogh;iue þis &yogh;ongue child : to slen him with wou&yogh;. Þo þat poysun him was i-&yogh;iue : þat so strong and luþer was, Ore louerdes mi&yogh;te was so muche : þat no-þe worse him nas. Þo þe luþere quene þat i-sai : þat hit was al for nou&yogh;t, Þat no poysun ne mi&yogh;te him sle : heo þou&yogh;te an oþur þou&yogh;t. Þis &yogh;ongue child ane maister hadde : þat his wardein was— Askebert he was i-cleoped : a strong trichour, alas! For noman ne may to oþur : sonere tricherie do Þane þilke þat is him euere nei&yogh; : and þat he trist mest to. ¶ Þis luþere quene bi-þou&yogh;te hire : of one false wrenche— Men seith þat feolonie nas neuere non : þat womman ne can bi-þenche. with þis Askebert heo spac : þis child to slen and spille; heo bi-het him mede and guod i-nov&yogh; : and of eche þing don is wille. So þat þis to luþere þingues : weren at one rede, And bi-speken hou huy mi&yogh;ten best : don þe luþere dede. Þe &yogh;wyle huy bi-speken boþe : þis &yogh;ongue child to quelle, Þis swete sweuene þis child matte : þat ich ov wolle nouþe telle : him þou&yogh;te þat þare stod a treo : ri&yogh;t bi-fore is bedde, Þat a-non to þe steorrene it tilde : and swyþe wide it spradde; Þis treo was fair and noble i-nov&yogh; : And schon wel bri&yogh;te and wide, Ful of blostmene and of fruyt : and mani a riche bou&yogh; bi-side, berninde wex and laumpes al-so : þicke brenninde and li&yogh;te— So noble treo nas neuere i-sei&yogh;e : ne non þat schon so bri&yogh;te. him þou&yogh;te he c[l]am MS. cam op-on þat treo : to þexte bowe an hei&yogh; And bi-heold a-boute in-to al þe world : and a-perteliche al. prute inou&yogh; i-sei&yogh;. Þe &yogh;wyle he stod opon þis treo : and bi-heold a-boute so, him þou&yogh;te þat on of is nexte frend : and þat he truste mest to, On þe grounde stod bi-neþe : and smot a-to þis treo, Þat it feol a-doun to grounde : þat deol it was to seo. to aluyte foul he MS. ich bi-cam : non fairore ne mi&yogh;te non om. non beo, And bi-gan with Ioye i-nov&yogh; : ri&yogh;t into heouene fleo. Þo þis child þou&yogh;te so : at wynchecombe he lay : he a-wok and [in] grete þou&yogh;te was : boþe ni&yogh;t and day. he nuste &yogh;wat tockninge it was : wel þe more was his MS. hire þou&yogh;t; Are he þarof sum-þing wuste : bliþe nas he nou&yogh;t. his norice, þat him hadde i-fed : and with hire milk forth i-brou&yogh;t, Þat child heo louede euere muche : with dedes and with þou&yogh;t; To hire þat child triste mest : —woluene hire name was : Þis child tolde hire priueliche : of is metingue al is cas. Þo þis Norice hadde i-heord : þe sweuene, þat was so guod, heo bi-gan to siche sore : and in grete þou&yogh;te stod; "Alas," heo seide, "þat ich scholde : euere þis day a-bide, Þat mi child, mi swete heorte : swych cas schal bi-tide! Alas, mi child, mi swete fode : þat ich habbe forth i-brou&yogh;t, Þi soster, þat al. om. bi-spekez þi deth : to quelle þe heo hath i-þou&yogh;t. Ake þe foul, þat þou bi-come to : and to heuene gan i-wende, Þat was þi soule, þat þudere schal : aftur þi liues ende."— Þis metyngue bi-cam soth i-nou&yogh; : þat he fond atþe laste. For is soster and Askebert : bi-speken is deth wel faste. Askebert seide a day : þat þis child scholde wende An hontingue, to plei&yogh;en him : bi þe wodes ende, And he with him, ase hit was ri&yogh;t : to witien him bi þe wei&yogh;e. he = heo, huy wende to þe wode of clent : ase it were heom for-to pleie. Ase huy wenden a-boute þe wode : ase ore louerd &yogh;af þe grace, grete wille þat child hadde : þare to slepen in one place; A-doun he lai wel soffteliche : and gan to slepe a-non. Askebert ne þou&yogh;te nou&yogh;t : þat he scholde þannes gon. bi-side in one derne stude : he gan to deluen faste Ane put, &yogh;wane þat child were ded : þare-inne him to caste. Þat child bi-gan a-wakien sone : ase þei it were bi cas, After is maister he bi-heold : and ne sai&yogh; nou&yogh;t &yogh;ware he was. Ake ore louerd him &yogh;af þe grace : þei he nuste nou&yogh;t of is dede, Þat he spac to his maister : and þeos wordes sede : "Þou trauailest," he seide, "a-boute nou&yogh;t : and þine &yogh;wyle þou dost spille, For in ane oþure stude i schal deie : &yogh;ware hit is godes wille; And þoru&yogh; tokningue of þis &yogh;eorde : þou schal wel i-seo Þare al. whane al þi wille þou mi&yogh;t do : þat ich i-martred beo." Forth wende þis luþere man : and þis child also. huy comen to on oþur stude : þare þe dede was i-do. Þis maister nam þe &yogh;eorde : and sette hire on þe grounde : And heo bi-gan to leui þare : in wel luyte stounde, And a swyþe gret Asch bi-cam sethþe : and &yogh;eot stant in þulke place, to schewi þe mi&yogh;te of seint kenelm : and ore louerdes grace. Þes luþere man nam þis child : in þe wode of klent And ladde him, ase men doth a þeof : to a-fongue is Iuggement, he ladde him into a priue stude : al out of þe wei&yogh;e, bi-twene [twei] om. hulles hei&yogh;e : into a deop ualeie. ¶ Þis child þoru&yogh; þe holi gost : þei þe oþur it nolde him telle, Wuste wel is luþere þou&yogh;t : þat he him wolde a-quelle; And þo he targede a luyte : þis luþere dede to done, Þat child seide wel mildeliche : "&yogh;wy ne dost þou sone?" he bi-gan Ane saume þat men singuth : in holie churche a-day, Þat was "te deum laudamus" : are þat he a-doun lay. Ri&yogh;t ase he scide an holi vers : þat þare-inne was and is, A-latyn i-write, as alle þe oþure : and þe englisch so is þis "Þe faire compaygnie of Martyrs : louerd, herieth þe :" Ri&yogh;t ase he hadde þat fers i-seid : as þe boc tellez me, Þe luþere man smot of is heued : onder an haw&yogh;þorn-treo, Þare ase godes wille was : þat he i-martred scholde beo. A coluere, &yogh;wi&yogh;t so eni milk : out of him gan teo And ri&yogh;t euene heo was i-sei&yogh;e : into heouene fleo. Onneþe he was seue &yogh;er old : are he i-martred were— Alto soth is sweuene was : ase [men] mi&yogh;ten i-seo þere! ¶ Þis luþere man þat him a-slov&yogh; : bi-gan to delue faste And made ane put, deop i-nou&yogh; : and þare-inne þis child caste; he burede hit þare faste i-nou : þat he i-founde nere, And wende hom a-&yogh;ein in is wei : and liet him ligge þere. To Quendrith, his luþere soster : a-non-ri&yogh;t he gan i-wende And tolde al þis luþere dede : hou he was i-brou&yogh;t to ende. Þeos womman was þo glad i-nou&yogh;! : A-boute heo sende a-non For-to saisi alle his londes to hire : and þe maneres euerech-on, And liet hire makien quiene of þe Marche : ase hire broþur was king. A schrewe lauedi heo was i-nov&yogh; : and wicke þoru&yogh; alle þing! heo wende a-boute ope al hire lond : and nam hire manrede, orig. manrade And bi-cam stuyrne and bi-ladde hire men : harde with muche wrech-hede. al. 2 vv. more. heo liet hote into al þat lond : þat no man so wod nere to nemmen hire broþer name : for loue ne for fere; And &yogh;if man mi&yogh;te ani i-wite : þat nadde it nou&yogh;t bi-leued, Þat he were sone i-nome : and i-smiten of is heued. Þus fierde þis luþere womman : and sturede hire wel faste; Þat no man ne dorste hire broþur bi-mene : huy weren so sore a-gaste. And euere lai þis holie bodi : i-bured swiþe stille, Þat no man ne dorste of him speke : a-&yogh;ein þe quiene wille. So longue, þat he was al for-&yogh;ite : þo men ne moste of him speke. Ake hit nas nou&yogh;t þat atþe laste : ore louerd him nolde a-wreke. Þane no man nolde, þat witti was : of him þenchen ene, Ore louerd nolde nou&yogh;t þat he were : allingues for-&yogh;ite so clene; &YOGH;wane no man, þat witti was : of him ne hadde muynde, A doumb best, þat is with-oute witte : hadde, a-&yogh;ein kuynde. For a wydewe hadde ane &yogh;wite kov : þat wonede þare-bi-side, Þat &yogh;eode a-dai to fetten hire mete : in þe wode wel wide Þo seint kenelm was i-bured : in þe valeie þare doune. Þis kou wolde eche daye : &yogh;wane heo come fram toune to gaderi hire mete, with oþure kuyn : heo wolde gon al one Fer a-doun into þis valeie : and hire felawes bi-leue ech-one, And sitte bi þis holie bodi : al þe longue dai, Ase it were for-to honouri him : for hit so one lay; And so heo sat with-oute mete : al þe day to þen ende, And &yogh;wane hit atþe eue was : hamward heo wolde wende. &YOGH;wane heo cam hom at eue : fair and round heo was, And swyþe Mielch al-so : —þat was a wonder cas! For þare ne was no oþur kov : þat half so muche milk &yogh;eoue; heo ne &yogh;af a-morewe noþe lasse : þei heo were i-milked an eue. al. 2 vv. more. Folk þat þis wonder i-sai&yogh; : guode &yogh;eme alle huy nome And a-waiteden wel a dai : &yogh;ware þe kou bi-come. Heo seien hire sitte al þe day : in þe valeie þare doune, Stille in one stude, meteles : for-to heo eode an eue to toune. Ake &yogh;wi heo sete þare so : heo ne mi&yogh;ten i-wite noþing; bote in heore heorte huy onder-stoden : þat it was sum tokning. For þis kov wonede so þere : and adai drou&yogh; hire þare-to, Þe ualeye men cleopeden "koubache" : and &yogh;eot men doth al-so.— In kovbache þat holie bodi : lai wel mani a &yogh;er, Þat men nusten of him no-þing : ase ich ov seide er : For is soster, þat was so forth al. fers : and : in grete pruyte i-brou&yogh;t, So gret þretningue for him heo made : þat men ne dorsten him nemme nou&yogh;t.— Þo þis bodi ne moste beo : i-founde in Engelonde, Ore louerd, þat wot alle þing : to him he sende is sonde. al. þerto sette is honde Ase þe pope stod at rome : in his masse a day At seint peteres weouede : ase muche folk þat i-sai, A coluere, &yogh;wi&yogh;t so ani snov : cam fram heouene fleo And leide on þe weuede a luyte writ : and sethþe a&yogh;en gan steo, he flev&yogh; op into heouene an hei&yogh; : ase ore louerd it wolde. Þat writ was &yogh;wijt and schon wel bri&yogh;te : þe lettres weren of golde. Þe pope þonkede ihesu crist : and þat folk dude al-so. he nam þe lettre on his hond : and þo heo was ondo, he nuste &yogh;wat it was to segge : ne non in-si&yogh;t he ne couþe i-wite— For he ne couþe englisch non : and on englis it was i-write. he liet cleopie eche-manere men : of eche diuerse londe, &yogh;if any covþe of þis holie writ : Ani-þing onder-stonde. Þo weren þare men of Engelonde : þat wusten &yogh;wat it sede, And onder-stoden wel þat writ : þo heo i-heorden it rede. ¶ Þat writ was puyr on Englisch i-write : ase men it radden þere; And for-to tellen with-oute ryme : þeos wordes it were : "In klent covbache kenelm, kyngues sone, al. bern lijth onder ane þorne, is al. om. heued him al. om. bi-reued." Þis writ was wel nobleliche : i-wust and up i-do, And i-holde for gret relike : and &yogh;eot it is al-so; Þe nobleste relike it is on þar-of : þat is in þe churche of rome— So it ou&yogh;te wel ho-so it under-stode : fram &yogh;wanne þat it come: For &yogh;wane it out of heouene cam : fram ore louerdes honde, &YOGH;wat noblere relike mi&yogh;te beo? : I-ne can non onder-stonde. Þare-fore seint kenelmes day : ase þe pope makede is heste, At rome huy holdez hei&yogh;liche : and makiez wel hei&yogh; feste.— ¶ Þe pope, þo he þe soþe wuste : þat it was swuch tockningue, his messagers in-to Engelonde : he sende wit þis tiþingue; To þe Erchebischope of kaunterburi : wolfred þat was þo, his lettre he sende, þat he scholde : of swuche þingue onder-go And seche after þe wode of klent : &yogh;if ani man mi&yogh;te i-wite, And seche ane þorn in kovbache : ase it was in þe write, And for-to seche þat holie bodi : þat derneliche lay þere, And nimen it up with gret honour : þat hit i-schrined were. Þo þe lettre fram þe pope : to þe Erchebischope cam, Of bischopes and of clerkus : conseil þar-of he nam: So þat in þe wode of klent : þat in wyricestre-schire is, he liet seche þat holie bodi : and fond it out, i-wis, Onder þe þorne at covbache : ase þat writ seide of rome. For þe contreie-men bi-side : manie þudere huy come, al. & for þe miracle of þe cou : þe what|loker þerto hi come. Þo al. For men of þare-bi-side : onder-&yogh;eten al. þat o. þat cas, Ortreweden wel &yogh;ware it lay : for þe miracle so fair was. A-non so þat bodi was op i-nome : þe &yogh;wile þat folk þare stod, Þere sprong a welle, þare he lay : þat &yogh;eot is fair and guod. A welle þare is cler i-nou&yogh; : and eucreft hath i-beo, In þe stude þare he lai on : ase man mai þare i-seo, Men al. þat me cleopieth "seint kenelmes welle"— : þat mani man hath i-sou&yogh;t, And manie þoru&yogh; þe watere : of grete Anguisse beoth i-brou&yogh;t. Of þe cite of wynchecumbe : and of þe contreie þare-bi-side Þe men weren þat sou&yogh;ten so : þat holie bodi so wide: And al. for þe bischopes hadden er i-loked : þat it scholde to winchecumbe beo i-bore And i-schrined, þare is fader lai : þat a-rerde þat hous bi-fore. Þis men nomen up þat holie bodi : þat of gloucestre-schire were, And nobleliche toward wynchecumbe : with procession it bere. Þat folk of wyricestre-schire : þat woneden þare-bi-side, Nomen heom to rede manie : to maken þat bodi a-bide, And sworen þat huy it wolden habbe : and noman ne scholde it heom bi-reue, For in þe schire þare it i-founde was : huy seiden, it scholde bi-leue. bi þe watere of pireford : þis two schirene hem mette, And conteckeden for þis holie bodi : and faste to-gadere sette. So þat huy nomen ane fourme of pays : to don bi al. vp godes grace, &YOGH;if god heom wolde is wille sch[e]wen : are huy wenden fram þat place. Feor huy weren i-trauailed and sore : so þat heom luste slepe ech-on: huy maden ane fourme þat huy scholden alle : ligge slepe a-non, And &yogh;weþur of þis twei schires : mi&yogh;ten sonore a-wake huy scholden sauf i-nov&yogh; wenden forth : and þat bodi with hem MS. him take. ¶ Stille huy lei&yogh;en slepe faste : þis schirene boþe-to, And resten heom of hore werienesse— : for ore louerd it wolde so. [So] þat huy of gloucestre-schire : a-woken sone ech-on At one tyme alle, ase god it wolde : and of wyricestre-schire nou&yogh;t on. In pais huy wenden forth heore wey : and þis bodi with heom toke. Wel fif mile wei huy weren i-wende : are þe oþere a-woke. Þis oþere i-sei&yogh;en heom bi-gylede : anon so huy bi-gounne a-wake: And siweden þis oþere swiþe faste : ake huy ne mi&yogh;ten heom nou&yogh;t of-take.— Þis men toward wy[n]checombe : þat holie bodi huy bere. Are heo mi&yogh;ten it þudere bringue : swyþe werie huy were. So þat huy comen into one wode : a luyte bi este þe toune, And resten heom, þo huy weren so nei&yogh; : op-on ane hei&yogh;e doune. A-þurst huy weren for werienesse : so þat it nas non ende. huy beden ore louerd for seint kenelmes loue : þat he scholde heom drinke sende. A fair welle þare sprong op : an hei&yogh; op-on þe doune— Þat &yogh;uyt is þare, cler and cold : half a mile fram toune; heo is nouþe wel faire i-heoled : with freo ston, ase ri&yogh;t is, I-redi ech man to drinken of : þat cometh þare-forth, i-wis. ¶ Þe Monekes of Wynchecombe : arerd habbez þare-bi-side A fair chapele of seint kenelm : þat men sechez ful wide.— Quendrith, þe luþere womman : at wynchecumbe þo was; bote heo nuste nou&yogh;t hire broþer so nei&yogh; : ne no-wi&yogh;t of þat cas. In seint peteres churche heo sat : bi-side þe Abbeie-&yogh;ate, In a soler inþe est-side : and lokede out þare-ate. heo i-sai&yogh; al þis grete folk come : a-doneward of þe doune hei&yogh;e Toward wynchecumbe : a-luyte fram suyd-lei&yogh;e. heo Axede &yogh;wat men it weren : and &yogh;wat huy þou&yogh;ten þere. Men seiden þat huy to churche wolden : and þat huy hire broþer bere. Þo was þis Quiene sori i-nov&yogh;! : in grete deole and fere hire sauter heo nam on honde : ase þei heo witles were. Of þe sauter þe laste saume : bi-fore þe Euesongus, i-wis, of corsingue and al. om. of luþere men : and of mansingue i-maked heo is: "Deus laudem" [heo] is i-cleoped. : þis saume þe Quiene radde, For-to a-corsi hire broþur bodi : and alle þat him þudere ladde. Þo heo cam to þe Ninteoþe vers : ase þe mansingue endez, i-wis, Þat "hoc opus eorum" : a-latin i-cleoped it is, Þat seit þat al. what men it beo scholden : þat duden al. afongeþ þat ilke dede: Opon hire owene heued it cam : ase heo þat vers gan rede: For ri&yogh;t ase heo þat vers radde : out-borsten boþe hire ei&yogh;e And fullen a-doun op-on hire sauter : ase manie men i-sei&yogh;e. al. 2 vv. more. Þe sauter is &yogh;uyt at wynchecombe : and ho-so come wole þare-to, Aperteliche man may þare i-se : &yogh;ware þe dede was i-do.— al. 2 vv. more. Þis holie bodi was forth i-bore : with gret honour ate fine, And in þe Abbeie, þare he lijth &yogh;uyt : i-don in wel noble schrine. Þis luþere Quiene deide sethþe : in schrewedenesse i-nou&yogh;; Þat bodi, ase a corsede wrechche : into ane diche man it drov&yogh;, Into þe fouleste þat was þare a-boute : and þare-inne man it slong— bote hire endingue sunful al. scenfol were : me þinchez elles it hadde i-beo wrong! Nov god for þe loue of seint kenelm : is swete grace vs MS. it sende, Þat we moten to þulke Ioie : þare he is inne,i-wiende. AmeN.

40.1: SEint Gregori þe confessour : in Ciscile was i-bore. In holienesse he ladde is lijf : þat is soule nere for-lore. gret clerk he was and guod prechour. : in Cycile he liet a-rere Sixe Abbeies of Monekes : with-inne a fewe &yogh;eres, Se seouenþe he dude a-rere : in þe Cite of rome; Þare he and manie oþur with him : þe Abite of monekes nome. In so gret fastingue he was : and so luyte he wolde ete, Þat al is wille he for-les : of drinke and of mete; For defaute he scholde raþur deie : þane beo of-houngred ene— So he was to fastingue i-woned : his lijf he ladde so clene. Wel sielden for al is feblesse : Idel he beo scholde, r. wolde. Þat of ore louerdes seruise : rede oþur singue he [no]lde MS. wlde, w over an erasure. Oþur writen oþur telle : oþur rimes þar-of make, Oþur he wolde bidde is beden : þe &yogh;wyle he mi&yogh;te wake. Þe pope is guodnesse under-&yogh;at : þei he þare-of were stille : At rome he made him cardinal : al a-&yogh;ein is wille. So wijs and holi he was in þou&yogh;te : and so ri&yogh;tful of is dede, Þat þe conseil of holie churche : muche was bi is rede.— Out of is paleys in a day : þis holie man gan i-wiende : he founde Marchauns at rome : with Mercerie wel hiende. to sullen huy ladden on heore hond : swete children þreo, Fairore þingus þane huy weren : ne mi&yogh;te no man i-seo. Seint Gregori &yogh;eorne heom bi-heold : a stounde he gan at-stonde, And axede &yogh;wat þe childre weren : and of &yogh;wuche londe. Þe Marchaunz seiden, "Englische huy beoth : of Engelonde i-nome, And swuch is þe kuynde of alle þe men : þat of þat lond doz come." "Wel au&yogh;te," seide þis holie man : "þat lond beo guod and riche, For al. om. huy beoth Englische swyþe wel i-cleoped : engles huy buth i-liche. &YOGH;if þat [lond] om. is swuch ase [þe] om. men beoth : name it hauez with ri&yogh;te, Englene lond it au&yogh;te wel beo : and engles þare-inne a-li&yogh;te; And swuch folk au&yogh;te in heouene : beon englene i-fere." Þo Axede he &yogh;wat bi-leue : in engelonde were. Þe marchaunz seiden, "al engelond : is puyr heþenesse." "Alas," seide seint Gregori : "a-las, þe sorienesse Þat þe prince of þe deorke helle : schal habbe in powere A lond fol of so fair folk : þat au&yogh;ten beo Engles i-fere!" he wende a-&yogh;ein in-to is paleis : with wel dreorie chere, And carede muche þat in Engelond : cristinedom i-brou&yogh;t nere. At þe commuyn conseil a day : seint Gregori a-ros sone, And bad þe pope and is cardinales : graunti him ane bone, Þat huy him senden in-to engelond : to prechie cristinedom. Þo al. om. þe pope mid is cardinales : gret conseil þar-of nam; Nolden huy him graunti nou&yogh;t. : ake euere he bad so faste, Þat huy dorsten werne none lengore : and graunteden atþe laste. Seint Gregori was þo glad i-nou&yogh;! : he nolde a-bide non lengore more, Þo wende he toward engelonde : to prechie godes lore. A-non so he was fram rome i-wend : defaute of him men hadde; Þat folk cam to þe pope al day om. al day : and echone on him huy gradde, Ase he to seint peteres munstre i-wende : þo in ane dai&yogh;e, "Þou þencst," huy seiden, "with þi conseil : al rome to bi-trai&yogh;e; he þat halt op þe conseile of Rome : heonnes þou hast i-send; bote þou him of-sende sone : al rome worth i-schend." Þe pope hadde gret loue ei&yogh;e : of þat þe folk him seide. A v. om. he nas nou&yogh;wer nei&yogh; atþe se : are he him of-sende. With wel dreorie chere þo : þis holie man a&yogh;en wende.— Ase god it wolde, þare-aftur-ward : sone it dude bi-falle Þat þe pope wende out of þe world : so we schullen alle. Þe cardinales and þe bischopes : and al þat conseil of rome, Ane pope to cheose afturward : alle to-gadere huy come. huy hieten þat ech man þat of þe conseile was : eche dai&yogh;e faste scholde And in heore bedes beon ni&yogh;t and day : &yogh;if ore louerd heom sende wolde Ani tokningue a-mong heom : &yogh;if ani of heom wuyrþe were In rome pope for-to beo : cristine men wel to lere. Þo huy hadden in heore oresones i-beon : þreo daies and þreo ni&yogh;t, In þe huyrne of one chapele : huy sei&yogh;en swyþe gret li&yogh;t, Þat stod ase þei hit a piler were : into heouene up-ri&yogh;t— huy ne i-sei&yogh;en neuer er no þing : so cler ne so bri&yogh;t. Þo huy comen to þe place : onder þe li&yogh;te huy founde Þane holie man, seint Gregori : plat i-falle to grounde; For werinesse of is oresones : he lai al al. as in suoddringue. Þat folk bi-gan to herien god : and loude huy guonne si[n]gue; huy nomen þesne holie man : and maden him pope a-non. Fair and swete was þat li&yogh;t : þat op-on him schon!— Swiþe wel he wuste cristine-dom : and holie lijf he ladde. Of þe mis-bi-leue of Engelonde : gret deol and care he hadde. Seint Austin was a Monek þo : him and oþere he nam And sende heom in-to engelonde : to prechi cristindom. ¶ Seint Austin and is Monekus : þo huy weren in Engelonde, wide huy precheden cristindom— : i-hered beo godes sonde. Seint Austin wende to þe kingues court : and so he prechede þere, v. 80-3 al. om. Þat þe king and alle is men : sone i-baptizede were. Þo huy hadde i-brou&yogh;t in-to godes lawe : þene kyng and is pouwer, Þ t folk tornede þoru&yogh; godes grace : to him feor and ner. So longue þat þis holie men : heore wille hadden at þen ende, Þat al folk of eche toune : to cristindom gan i-wende. Þo wende seint Austin a-&yogh;en. : þe pope he tolde at rome v. 86-95 al. om. hou alle þe men of engelonde : cristin-dom nome. Þo was þe pope seint Gregori : i-brou&yogh;t in grete blisse, And liet seint Austyn wende a-&yogh;en : þat lond more to wisse And make Bischopes and Ercedeknes : and oþure prelatus al-so, Cristin-dom to witie in engelonde : þat men ne scholde neuere ondo. Seint Austin wende a-non a-&yogh;en : and þo he to engelonde cam, Twelf bischopes þare-inne he made : to witien cristin-dom, And oþere prelates of holi churche : þat we a-mong us i-seoth. In þis manere to cristindom : alle i-brou&yogh;t we beoth Þoru&yogh; þe bone of seint gregori : þat hidere sende is sonde; Þare-fore we cleopiez him in holie bok : Apostul of Engelonde, For he us sende ore ri&yogh;te bi-leue : þat we overlined. holdez &yogh;uyte, The text is corrupted here. And in his dai&yogh;e sette children to lore : þe &yogh;wyle huy beoth luyte— God for þe loue of seint gregori : þulke lore us leue so wite, Þat he us sende bi seint Austin : and neuereft hire for-&yogh;ite. Wel au&yogh;ten cristine men to louien him : þat in ri&yogh;te bi-leue heom brou&yogh;te; For he was þe furste man : þat cristin-dom to hem bi-sou&yogh;te. This v. is corrupted. — Muche folk þare was in Rome : þat in guode bi-leue nere Ne bi-lieueden nou&yogh;t þat þe sacringe : ore louerdes licame were. Þare-fore þe pope seint Gregori : prechede heom a day, And þare-of schewede heom fair miracle : þat ech of heom it sai&yogh; : Of ore louerdes licame a luyte he brac : bi-fore heom ase huy stode: Sone it bi-cam to a luyte childes fingur : al wringuynde al. vrninge a-blode. huy bi-liefden wel þo aftur-ward : on ihesu crist ech-on, And onder-stoden þet sacrement : þoru&yogh; lore of þat holie mon. 110-1 al. om. Þus þe holie man seint Gregori : pope was in rome, And sende us in-to engelonde : þe lawes of cristindome. holi churche and cristindom : þoru&yogh; him was so i-loked here, Þat he is nouþe in heouene : with Aungles i-fere. v. 114-5 al. om. Bidde we þanne þene holie man : apostle of Engelonde, Þat he bi-fore ihesu crist : ore neode ounder-stonde.

41.1: SEint Cudbert was i-bore : here in Engelonde. god dude for him gret miracle : ase &yogh;e schulle under-stonde. Þe &yogh;wyle þat he was a &yogh;ong child : and in is ei&yogh;teteoþe &yogh;ere, With &yogh;ounge children he pleide atþe bal : þat is felawes were. Þare cam gon a luyte child : hit ne þou&yogh;te þreo &yogh;er old, A swete creature and fair : milde it was and bold; to þe &yogh;onge Cudbert he &yogh;eode : "leue broþer," he sede, "Ne þench nou&yogh;t on swuche idele games : þanne dost þou a guod dede." Seint Cudbert ne tok none &yogh;eme : to þe childes rede, And pleide forth with his felawes : ase huy alle him bede. Þo þis &yogh;ongue child i-sai&yogh; : þat he is red for-sok, A-doun he feol to grounde : and gret deol to him tok, And bi-gan to weopen sore : and his hondene forto wringue. Þe children hadden alle deol of him : and bi-lefden heore pleiingue, huy gladeden him ase huy couþen : sore huy gonne to siche; And euere made þis &yogh;oungue child : reulich deol i-liche. "A weilawei," þis Cudbert seide : "&yogh;wi weopest þou so sore? &YOGH;if we þe habbez ou&yogh;t mis-don : we ne schullen none more." Þanne spac þis &yogh;ounge child— : for sore huy weopen bei&yogh;e, "Cuthbert," he seide, "it ne falleth þe nou&yogh;t : with &yogh;ongue children to plei&yogh;e; None swuche idele games : ne bi-cometh þe for-to wurche, &YOGH;wane god hath i-porueid þe : on heued of holie churche." With þusse worde men nusten : &yogh;wodere þat &yogh;ongue child i-wende— An Aungel of heouene it was : þat ore louerd þudere sende. Þo bi-gan MS. bigan gan seint Cudbert : to weope and siche sore, And lette a-wei is idele games : þo nolde he plei&yogh;e more: he made his fader and is freond : setten him to lore, And in his &yogh;onghede ny&yogh;t and day : of-seruede cristes ore. Þo he in grettore eolde was : ase þe bok us hauez i-seid, hit bi-feol þat þe bischop seint Aydan : sone þare-Aftur was ded. Cudbert a-felde was with schep : Aungles of heouene he i-sei&yogh; Þe bischopes soule seint Aydan : to heouene bere an hei&yogh;. "I-nelle schep wite," seint Cudbert seide : "fol ich am to longue, Schep i-nelle wite none lengore nouþe— : a-fongue ho-so heom al. om. a|fongue." he wende to þe Abbeye of Gireuaus : grei&yogh; monek he bi-cam— gret Ioye mauden þe Monekes alle : þo he þe Abite nam. Swiþe wel he is ordre heold : he was of grete penaunce, Þe holieste monek he was i-holde : in engelonde oþur in Fraunce.— hit bi-feol þare-aftur-ward : þat þare cam a goute In is kneo, of Anguische gret : &yogh;ware-of he hadde doute; So longue, þat is kneo to-swal : gret Anguysche he i-fielde, Þe senewes in is hamme schronken : he ne mi&yogh;te þanne leg i-wielde, Ne strechche forth is leg bi-neoþe : þat Ioynede to is þi&yogh;; Ase a crupel lame he was—: he i-werth swiþe sori. No man ne couþe him þare-of rede : þat is leg i-sei&yogh;; Ake nathþeles euere was is hope : to iesu crist a-hei&yogh;. In A day, solas for-to habbe : he liet him bere a-boute, And in þe fielde he i-mette a wel fair kny&yogh;t : with loreins swiþe proute. Þe knyt bad heom one stounde a-bide : þat seint Cudbert bere; he bi-heold and handlede þane sore leg : ase þei he leche were. "Nim," he seide, "þe milk of one kov : þat is of o colour, Iuys of smal-Ache do þar-to : and clene &yogh;wetene flour; Seoth it to-gadere swiþe wel : and leie it al hot þar-to, A-brod ase þei hit a plastre were : and guod it schal þe do." Þo he hadde þis i-seid : þe kny&yogh;t is wei forth wende— An Aungel of heouene it was : þat ore louerd þudere sende. Are seint Cudbert þe plastre hadde : longue, him þou&yogh;te, om. him þou&yogh;te to is legge i-bounde, his leg and is senewes : bi-comen hole and sounde.— hit nas nou&yogh;t longue þare-aftur-ward : ase þe bok us doth telle, Þat þe Abbot sende him out : to one of heore celles; hostiler he was þare i-mad : gistes to onder-fongue. god dude fair miracle for him : are he hadde i-beo þare ou&yogh;t longue. Aungles þare comen to him ofte : and with him huy ete Ase þei it oþure gistes weren— : þe gistningue was ful swete! gistes wel gladliche þene mete he &yogh;af : he nolde no man werne, heom þat beden par charite : for he nas noþing stuyrne. him-seolf he wolde &yogh;iue heom watur : to waschen with hire r. here hond, And serui heom of alle þe mes : and bi-fore heom stonde.— hit bi-feol þat an hiendi gist : and a wel fair þare cam And bad þe mete par charite : and Cudbert In him nam; watur to is hondene he him &yogh;af al. largeliche : and om. on þe hei&yogh;e deis him sette, Mete and drinke he him &yogh;af : and with guod heorte it fette, to þe bachouse he &yogh;eode him-seolf : ase þe bakares hadden i-bake, hi[s] giste to fetten bred al hot : þe gladdore him for-to make. Þo he cam a-&yogh;ein with þe hote bred : his gist ne fond he nou&yogh;t; Þare-of hadde þis holie man : gret wonder in is þou&yogh;t. Þicke snov&yogh; was þare-oute : he ne mi&yogh;te nou&yogh;t finde is fore, &yogh;ware-forth he wende a-wei : in snowe ne in þe flore. Ase he sou&yogh;te þeosne holie man : a[n] wende a-boute wel wide, he smulde a suyþe swote smul : in a chaumbre þare-bi-side. Þo he into þe caumbre cam : he fond a bord i-sprad, And þreo loues þare-op-on al hote. : þo was he wel glad, An d seide, "þis was godes Aungel : þat hath þis hidere i-brou&yogh;t; he cam hidere us for-to fede : and him-seolf ne beo i-fed nou&yogh;t."— eche ni&yogh;te &yogh;wane þeos monekes : to bedde weren i-gone, Cudbert wel stilleliche : wende him forth al one, In-to þe colde se he &yogh;eode : a-non op to þe chinne; For-to hit was midni&yogh;t nei&yogh; : so he stod þare-inne. Þanne he wende up þare-of : and þo al. whan he cam to londe, For feblesse he lai a-doun : he ne mi&yogh;te nou&yogh;t wel stonde. Þanne comen þare op of þe se : tweie oteres wel grete; Ouer-al huy lickeden þis holie man : are huy him wolden lete. &YOGH;wane huy him hadden i-lickede so : huy wenden in-to þe se, And seint Cudbert hol and sound : in-to is celle a-&yogh;e; with oþure he &yogh;eode to matynes : &yogh;eorne he song and radde, Þe Monekes wenden euer-echone : þat he come fram is bedde. A monek þat þare-inne was : onder-&yogh;at it ech del, Ake ase seint Cudbert him bad : he MS. þat he it for-hele[de] MS. for hele swiþe wel.— Ase ore louerdes wille was : þare-aftur it dude bi-falle Þat þe bischop of Duyrham deide : al-so we schullen alle: Men nomen þo seint Cudbert : and maden him bischop þere. Swyþe wel he wuste is bischopriche : þat folk he dude wel lere. þo was þat soþe to ende i-brou&yogh;t : þat þe Aungel him seide, Þat he scholde an heued of holi churche beo : þo he atþe bal pleide. þo he hadde god i-serued longue : aftur him he sende: In þe Monþe of luyde : of þis worlde he wende to þe Ioye of heouene. : and god us graunti al-so, Þoru&yogh; þe bone of seint cudbert : þat we moten comen þar-to.

42.1: SEint Marc, þe holie godspellare : wide wende in londe For-to prechi cristine-dom : þoru&yogh; ore louerdes sonde. In egypte he prechede longue : and sethþe at þen ende Into þe lond of Alisaundre : þannes he gan i-wiende. Þo he into Alisaundre cam : his on newe scho with-oute hurtingue of ani-þing : gan to berste a-two. Þo was þis guode man of-drad : longue he stod in þou&yogh;t, And seide, "mi porpos and mi wei : is nouþe to ende i-brou&yogh;t! &YOGH;if it mi louerdes wille were : þat he me wolde þane deth sende, Ich am redi his wille a-fongue : &yogh;wodere al. & wh. he wole þat ich al. to wiende." he wende forth to a soutere : &yogh;if he is scho makie mi&yogh;te. Þe soutare atþe furste stiche : ful vuele is hond he p[r]i&yogh;te. MS. pi&yogh;te Sori and wroth þis soutare was : for him smert so sore. Seint Marc bi-gan to prechi þo : and tolde him of godes lore, And bad him bi-lieue on Iesu crist : and cristine-dom vnder-fongue, And he is hond hele wolde : þat i-hurt was so strongue. Seint Marc with is spottle : watte a luyte vrþe on þe grounde And þare-with he smeorede his sore hond : and heo werth hol in a stounde. Þe soutere, and alle his, bi-gonne þo : and euerech þat in þe strete cam, to bi-lieue on crist, godes sone : and a-fenguen cristine-dam.— Seint Marc &yogh;eode wide in londe : to prechi godes lawe. Þe prince of þe londe it onder-&yogh;at : and þou&yogh;te to don him of dawe. he liet him seche into al þat lond : and þo he him hadde i-founde, "Ich hote eov," he seide to is men : "þat he beo faste i-bounde v. 24 corrupted. For-to he to þe prisone come : and þare-inne &yogh;e him caste a-non." Ouer-al is flechs was to-drawe : ri&yogh;t to þe bare bon, with Irene crokes,as men him drowe : þe mosseles lei&yogh;en wel grete; And al blodie weren of is blod : þe stones in þe strete. A-ni&yogh;t, ase he in prisone lai : ore louerd to him cam, In fourme þat he on eorþe was : þo he manhede nam; "Marc," he seide, "beo wel glad : and &yogh;arkne þe wel bliue, For þi name is i-write : in eche boke of liue : al. in þe b. of eche l. Þov schalt to-morewe for mi loue : soffri deth wel stronge MS. stronde And sethþe mine blisse of heouene : with-outen ende a-fongue." Seint Marc þonkede ore louerd ful &yogh;eorne : ase he al. and in his bedes lay. A-morewe þe prince him liet up fette : sone so it was dai. A strong rop he liet nime : and a-boute is swere binde, And teiden r. teien him sethþe to a wilde hors : at þe taile bi-hinde; he liet him drawe þoru&yogh; al þe toun : þat ech lime fram oþer wende. Þus seint Marc þe holie man : his soule to ore louerd sende. In þe Monþe of Aueril þis was. : men scholden faste is eue; Ake for þe hei&yogh;e feste of eastur-dai : men it doth bi-leue. his dai men fastez þoru&yogh; al þat lond : for him-seolf nis it nou&yogh;t, Ake for reuerence of þe baneres : [þat] in þat dai beoth fort i-brou&yogh;t. For men berez heom eche &yogh;ere a-boute : ase red is þare-of i-nome, vv. 45-50 om. in most MSS. (except MS. Vernon). to bidden for þe eorþe blede : þat it mote wel forth come. Men fastez, &yogh;wane huy formest berez heom out : a-seint Marcus dai þare-fore, And þreo dawes a-&yogh;ein halewe-þoresday : &yogh;wane huy bez forþer i-bore. bidde we nouþe seint Marc : &yogh;was lijf we habbez i-heord to þe ende, Þat ore soule mote þoru&yogh; his Arndingue : into heouene i-wiende.

43.1: SEint phelipe and seint Iacob : Apostles weren twei&yogh;e: Þe formeste dai þat comez in may : deth huy þoleden bei&yogh;e. Aftur ore louerdes passione : in þe twentiþe &yogh;ere Seint phelipe prechede in Sythie : to men þat luþere weren. Þis men nomen seint phelipe : and to heore Maumates al. maumet him ladde. And sone so he bi-foren hem cam : þis maumates loude gradde; Fuyr huy bleuwen out of heore Mouþes : þat þare-with huy brou&yogh;ten of dawe Þe princes sone of þe lond : and tweie constables of þe lawe; And manie men þat þare-nei&yogh; weren : wel grete siknesse to heom nome, Some fullen in-to þe dropesie : and some meoseles bi-come. Muche reuþe was into al þat lond : of þis misauenture. "Wulle &yogh;e," seide seint phelip þo : "mi conseil alle i-huyre, And ichulle þoru&yogh; godes grace : helen eov euer[e]ch-on." Glad was þis folk of þat word : and graunteden him a-non. "berez awei," he seide, "þis foule wi&yogh;t : þat &yogh;e habbez to i-bede, And nimez þe fourme of þe holie croiz : and settez in his stude!" Þat folk was fayn of his bi-heste : i-redie þare weren i-nowe, Ane rode huy setten up on hei&yogh; : þe maumates huy al-to-drowe. Seint pheolip þoru&yogh; godes grace : drof out bi-fore heore ei&yogh;e A foul deouel of þat on : þat huy alle i-sei&yogh;e. Þo þis rode was up i-set : and þe Maumet i-brou&yogh;t to grounde, Alle þe sike men þat þare-nei&yogh; weren : bi-comen hole and sounde, And þe þreo men þat weren a-slawe : a-&yogh;ein to liue come— Muche was þe Ioye into al þat lond : þat men þare-of nome. Cristinedom huy guonne a-fongue : and Anouri þe swete rode, And bi-lieueden on him þat bou&yogh;te us alle : þare-on with is blode. Þoru&yogh; þe vertuwe of þis faire miracle : muche folk of þe londe bi-gan cristine for-to beo : and þe ri&yogh;te bi-leue onder-stonde; After þe wissingue of seint phelip : alle heore lijf huy guonne lede— For prophesie and ri&yogh;t-w[i]snesse : huy heolden al þat he seide. Þo phelipe was sixti &yogh;er : and seouene and twenti old, In pays he deide in his bed : ase þe bok us hath i-told. Gret deol þat folk made þo : and wel faire huy him nome And bureden him with gret honour : ase a swuch man to bi-come.

44.1: SEint Iacob was ore louerdes kun : and ore lauedie soster sone. telle i-chulle sum-&yogh;wat of ore louerdes kunne : nouþe it is mi þou&yogh;t i-come. al. nou it me comeþ in mone Seinte Anne, ore leuedie Moder, : housebondes hadde þreo: Ioachim, and cleophas : and þe þridde hiet salomee; heo hadde euer-ech aftur oþur : for heo was i-wedded þrie; bi euerech of heom ane dou&yogh;ter heo hadde : and euerech hie&yogh;te marie. Ioachimes dou&yogh;ter : was eldest of þe þreo, And Iosep hadde i-wedded. : þe Marie cleophe, Þat was cleophases dou&yogh;ter : and þe Midleste i-bore, I-wedded heo was to Zebede : þat was hire louerd i-core. Ake þe &yogh;ongeste of alle þreo : þe Marie salomee, to a guod man i-wedded heo was : his name was Alfe. bi him heo hadde seint Iacob : and al-so tweie oþure: Seint symon and seint Iude : þat alle þreo weren i-broþre. Þe midleste soster : þe Marie cleofe, hadde tweie holie sones : bi hire louerd Zebede: Seint Ieame þe holie man : and seint Iohan þe ewangelist, Þat was, ich wene, berne best : with ore louerd crist. Þe eldeste soster of alle þreo : ore lauedi swete and milde. heo bar ore louerd Iesu crist : best of alle childe. So þat heo þat eldest was : ne hadde child bote on, And þe midleste hadde tweie sones : seint Ieame and seint Iohan, And þe &yogh;oungueste of þe þreo : sones hadde þreo— huy weren ore louerdes cosines : ase &yogh;e mouwen i-seo. Ech of heom fiue Apostle was : and swiþe holi man. telle ichulle of seint Iacob : of &yogh;wam ich formest bi-gan.— A-mong men of pharise : þat luþere weren, he cam. heom þou&yogh;te þat he scholde beo : A man of gret wisdom: Þare-fore þe prince of heom : in Ane Ester-day bad him prechi al þat folk : a-&yogh;ein godes lay. Op-on A laddre he sette him hei&yogh;e : þat men him scholden wide i-seo And i-heoren him prechi swyþe wel him—wel al. om. : þat is word þe bet i-scholde i-leued beo. Þo he was op on hei&yogh; i-set : and al þat folk him cam al. om. a-boute, Godes wordes he bi-gan to prechie : he nadde none doute; he prechede hov he hadde dez i-þoled : and hou he in þulke daie Fram deþe to liue a-ros : þat þe feond us ne scholde bi-traie, And hou he us þe Deuele bi-nam : þat in his power us hadde longue, And hou ech man in þulke dai&yogh;e : godes flesch scholde a-fongue. "hou geth þis?" þe prince seide : "beo stille, i þe bi-seche. Ich bad þe wanie Vern. weyue þi r. þis fole þou&yogh;t : and þou bi-guynnest it more to eche!" "Nay," seide seint Iacob to þe prince : "I-ne eche no folie, Ake ower fole þou&yogh;t ich wolde ou bi-nime : to seggen soth and nou&yogh;t li&yogh;e." Þe prince for wrathþe of his prechingue : þe laddre a-doun gan felle— And seint Iacob þare-opon was : þare-fore he him wolde a-quelle. Fram swiþe hei&yogh;e he ful a-doun. : Ake þo he was i-falle, Þat ech man wende þat he were ded : he a-ros up a-mong heom alle, And prechede eft-sone with glade heorte : ase he er i-don hadde. Þat folk him nomen swiþe faste : and to þe prisone him ladde. Þare he was in biendes strongue : fram þat was eastur-dai For-to cam þare-afturward : þe furste dai of Mai. Þo he out of þe prisone cam : he bi-gan to prechi bliue, he ne liet for ei&yogh;e ne for dez : þe &yogh;wyle he was a-liue. Mid one follares preche r. perche : þat men tesieth opon cloth, Opon þe scolle he was i-smite : þat is brain out drof. his soule, þo he was ded : to heouene he gan i-wiende. Þus seint Iacob þe holie man : brou&yogh;te is lijf to ende. Apostel he was, and martyr al-so : faste men scholden is eue, bote for þe hei&yogh;e Easter feste : men moten it nede bi-leue. al. 2 vv. more.

45.1: SEint Bartelmev þe holie man : cam of kingues blode; Swyþe fair man and noble he was : and glad & of swete mode. he siwede ore louerd on eorþe here : are he deide on þe rode, And i-sai&yogh; is priuetez : with þe oþere Apostles guode. Þo ore louerd was to heouene i-went : he prechede of him wel faste And wende wide in mani a lond : þe &yogh;wyle is lijf i-laste. So þat to þe londe of .Inde : he cam þoru&yogh; godes wille; At þe onende of þe lond : he bi-lefde wel stille. Ase an vncouth pilegrim : he &yogh;eode up and doun, he ne seide neiþer on ne oþur : bote bi-heold þane toun. In þe temple was a fals god : a maumet luþur i-nov&yogh;, Þare-inne was þe feond of helle : and muche folk to him drov&yogh;— ¶ huy cleopeden þat Maumet Astaroth. : þat þoru&yogh; þe deoueles mi&yogh;te Ofte he wolde Answerie men : and manie MS. nanie he bi-nam heom heore si&yogh;te, heore speche and heore limes al-so : and dude MS. duden men wo i-nov&yogh;; & &yogh;wane he a-&yogh;en ani sick man cam om. cam : of his vuele he r. him with-drou&yogh;, Þanne was þe sike man hol anon : ase he moste nede a-mende &YOGH;wane he ne hadde non oþur vuel : bote ase þe schrewe him sende; And he with-drov&yogh; him of is vuel : he moste nede hol beo. Þe schrewe tolde þe men þanne : þat þis wonder mi&yogh;ten i-seo, Þat he hadde þoru&yogh; is mi&yogh;te : þe men i-maud hol i-nov&yogh;— And þei r. Al-þei? þe schrewe ne dude non oþur guod : bote of is vuele him with-drou&yogh;. Þare-fore sike men al dai : ful þicke a-boute him sou&yogh;te And criden on him wel deolfulliche : þat he to hele heom brou&yogh;te. ¶ Of þingue þat was al-so for-to come : men axeden him feor and neor And he heom tolde of alle þing : þoru&yogh; þe deoueles pouwer; Folk cam þicke a-bouten him : bi dai&yogh;e and bi ni&yogh;te, And he ansuerede heom of al þat huy wolden— : muche is þe deoueles mi&yogh;te! Ake after þat seint Bartelmev : to þulke cite com, Þe power of þat false god : clanliche he bi-nom: For he ne mi&yogh;te aftur þulke tyme : with al. for no man speke ri&yogh;t nou&yogh;t Ne &yogh;iuen Ansuere of no-þing : so he was bi-neoþe i-brou&yogh;t; Þat folk cam þicke a-boute him : to witen at him heore wille Of þingues, ase huy weren bi-fore i-woned : and euere he was puyr stille. Þare-fore was wonder inov&yogh; : deol and sor al-so, huy weren a-ferd to beon for-lore : and þat huy hadden ou&yogh;t misdo: to atoun huy wenden þare-bi-side : þoru&yogh; heore alre wit, to an oþur Maumet þat was his felawe : þat huy cleopeden berit; huy crieden on him wel deolfulliche : þat he heom tolde fore &YOGH;wi Astaroth, heore owene god : his speche hadde for-lore. "&YOGH;e, &yogh;e," seide þis luþere best : "&yogh;e ne witen nou&yogh;t hou it is? with strongue chaines al fuyrie : he is i-bounde, i-wis, For Bartelmev, godes seriaunt : þat is þudere i-come And in þe cite geth wel stilledeliche : and al. om. is power him hath bi-nome And i-bounde him so faste þat he ne may : enes drawe is breth, Ake þoru&yogh; Anguische is clene ouer-come : ase þei he hadde i-þoled deth." ¶ "&YOGH;wat is [he] þilke Bartelmeu&yogh;" : þeos oþere him axeden a-non, "Þat mai makien ore almi&yogh;tie god : ded so any ston?" "he is," seide þis Maumat : "of gret pouwer, ase &yogh;e i-seoth, he mai do with us al þat he wole : for bi-neothþe him we beoth. Eche daie an hundret siþe : and oþur swuch bi ni&yogh;te he knevleth to is god in guode entente : þat &yogh;ifth him al is mi&yogh;te; Aungles with him i-nowe he hath : &yogh;ware-þoru&yogh; þat he may do Al þat he wole with us alle : and alle þing he wot al-so— For he wot nouþe þare ase he is : al ore speche and ore þou&yogh;t. Þare-fore ich rede eov alle wel : þat &yogh;e ne wrathþi him nou&yogh;t. ech-manere speche þat is : he knoweth and speket al-so, bote at one worde, alle þing : he wot &yogh;wat is i-do. &YOGH;if &yogh;e him sechez, þei &yogh;e come : ri&yogh;t bi him ase he is, &YOGH;e ne schulle him nou&yogh;t i-seo : bote him-seolf wolle, i-wis. Ake þus &yogh;e him mouwe i-knowe : &yogh;if &yogh;e him i-seo : he is swiþe long of bodi : of ri&yogh;t fair fourme and freo, Opri&yogh;t he geoth and euene i-nov&yogh; : and swiþe &yogh;wij&yogh;t is his bleo, his her is broun and swiþe crips : non ne mai cripsore beo, Muchele ey&yogh;ene and euene nose : i-strei&yogh;t a-doun a-long, his berd is long and sid i-nou&yogh; : and sum-del hor a-mong; In a &yogh;wij&yogh;t Golioun he geth : he nath cloþes non mo— Alle þis sixe-and-twenti &yogh;er : þar-inne he hath i-go Þat fram him it neuer-eft ne cam : ne hit ne a-peirez nou&yogh;t of hewe Ne for-oldeth nou&yogh;t with-alle : ake is euere i-liche newe. Wel he wot al þat &yogh;e spekez : and &yogh;wat &yogh;e doth alle here; Þare-fore, &yogh;if he eou axeth ou&yogh;t : &yogh;e ne mowen eou nou&yogh;t skere. Ake &yogh;if he him sewi al. schewe so : þat &yogh;e him mowe i-seo, biddez him for his louerdes loue : þa t he beo milde to me, Þat he ne come nou&yogh;t here nei&yogh; me : þat ich beo to grounde i-brou&yogh;t And i-tormented ase mi felawe is— : for i-nelle mis-don him nou&yogh;t." ¶ Þo þis fole men þis i-heorden : huy weren in gret þou&yogh;t, And longue heom þou&yogh;te are huy hadden : seint Bartelmev&yogh; i-sou&yogh;t. huy wende a&yogh;en to heore owene temple : ake huy weren alle blinde : twei dai&yogh;es huy sou&yogh;ten him faste : and ne mi&yogh;ten him nou&yogh;were i-finde.
45.2: A dai ase al þat folk : to þe temple was i-brou&yogh;t, for-to honouri heore false god : þat ne mi&yogh;te heom helpe nou&yogh;t, A guydi man þare cam al-so : þat þe deuel hadde i-beo longue In him and bi-nomen him is wit : and i-tormented him ful strongue. A-non so þis gidie man : in-to þis temple cam, Þe deuel þat in him was : gret deol to him nam, wel loude he gradde, "seint Bartelmeu&yogh; : ich bi-seche þe, Þine oresones brennez me al : þou haue merci of me!" ¶ Þis holie man stod þare-bi-side : and answerede him a-non : "beo doumb!" he seide, "ich þe rede : þat þou out of him gon." Þe deuel fleu&yogh; a-non with þat word : out of him in þulke place, And þe sike man al. om. bi-cam hol and sound : a-non þoru&yogh; godes grace. Þat folk stod al in gret wonder : þo huy i-sei&yogh;en þis cas, And bi-heolden þene holie man : þat of swuch power was, And tolden wide þis holie dede : þat ne mi&yogh;te nou&yogh;t beo i-hud. In þusse manere seint Barthelmev&yogh; : was formest in Inde i-kud.
45.3: Pollimius hiet þe kyng : þat of þulke contreie was : Sone þe tiþingues to him comen : of þat faire cas. he hadde ane dou&yogh;ter þat was lunatyke : þat þe deuel hadde muche with to done And made hire witles al. biwit euerech monthþe : ase hit feol in þe stat of þe mone. he sente to þis holie man : seint Barthelmev&yogh; wel sone, Þat he of is dou&yogh;ter hadde reouþe : and hele hire þoru&yogh; is bone. Þudere wende þis holie man : and þis mayde founde Bitinde alle þat nei&yogh; hire come : and grenninde, faste i-bounde. Þis holie man stod and bi-heold : þene deuel he made out wiende; hire ri&yogh;te wit heo hadde a-non : euer-eft to hire liues ende. Welle, glad was hire fader þo : and elles it were with wou&yogh;. he liet fette forth riche cloþus : and gold and seluer inou&yogh;, And liet chargi Camailes þare-with : and with riche &yogh;imstones al-so, to presenti with þis holie man : þat swuch dede hadde i-do. Ake þare nas non þat mi&yogh;te him finde : þo huy comen with al þis pruyte— Þare-bi he mi&yogh;ten onder-stonde : þat he þar-of tolde luyte. And þo no man ne mi&yogh;te him finde : hit of-þou&yogh;te sore þe kyngue. Ake nathþeles þis holie man : ne for-&yogh;at him of none þingue. A ni&yogh;t ase he lai in his bed : and on him faste þou&yogh;te, Þis holie man stod him bi-fore : he nuste ho him þudere brou&yogh;te; "Sire king," he seide, "&yogh;wat was þe : to siende me swuch pruyte? Þov ne paidest me ri&yogh;t nou&yogh;t þare-with : for ich tolde þar-of luyte; Ake þat tresor þat ich of telle : þat is heouene riche, Þat ne roustez ne a-peirez nou&yogh;t : ake euere worthþ i-liche. And forto techen eov of godes lawe : hidere ich am i-come, And makie eov leten eouwer false godes : and lieuen on godes sone; v. 121-2 al. om. For-to techen eov þulke lawe : hidere ich am i-brou&yogh;t, And maken eov leten ouwer false godes : þat ne mouwen eov helpe nou&yogh;t. And &yogh;if þou nelt nou&yogh;t of þusse þingue : i-lieue þat hit soth beo, Cum with me to ouwer false god : and þov schalt þe soþe i-seo." Þe king wende þo forth with him : to hore false god a-non. heore luþere preostes huy founden þere : bi-fore him mani on And duden to him heore sacrefise : ase huy weren i-woned to done. Þe deuel þat wit-inne him was : wel loude he gradde sone, And seide, "&yogh;e wrechches, leteth a-non : and ne Anourieth me ri&yogh;t nou&yogh;t, laste &yogh;e beon in swuch torment : ase ich am inne, i-brou&yogh;t! For Iesu cristes Aungeles : þat þe giwes to deþe brou&yogh;te, here beoth faste a-boute me : and bringueth me al-to nou&yogh;te; with brenninde raketei&yogh;es : huy habbeth me faste i-bounde, Þoru&yogh; power of heore hei&yogh;e louerd : þat þe giwes &yogh;euen deþes wounde And he þare-aftur þane þridde day : so weilawei þe stounde, Fram deþe to liue he a-ros : and brou&yogh;te us alle to grounde, And in eche side his apostles sende : to prechie godes name, And on of h eom is nouþe here : þoru&yogh; &yogh;wam ich habbe þis schame." ¶ Þat folk stod and bi-heold a-boute : and nusten &yogh;wuch he was. Seint Barthelmev&yogh; stod and si&yogh;te sore : and ofte seide alas, And seide, "nouþe &yogh;e mouwen i-seo : &yogh;wuch lijf &yogh;e ledeth her, And in &yogh;wuch a god &yogh;e bi-lieueth : and &yogh;wuch is his pouwer! &YOGH;if &yogh;e wollez þat ich bidde for eov : mine louerd þat us bou&yogh;te, Draweth a-doun ouwer Maumat : ant to-brekez him al-to nou&yogh;te!" Þo þe king i-heorde þis : his men he hiet ech-on A-bouten him casten strongue ropes : and drawen him a-doun a-non. Þat folk was þo redi a-non : and ropes casten on him i-nowe. Ake huy ne mi&yogh;ten him nou&yogh;t enes wawie : for al þat huy alle drowe. "Doth a-wei," quath seint Barthelmev : "and ouwer ropes nimez a-doun!" And þo þe schrewe on-bounde was : seint Barthelmev&yogh; seide is oresoun : "Þou deuel," he seide, "þat hast bi-traid : þus muche folk ech-on, &YOGH;if þou wolt þat I-ne make þe nou&yogh;t : to þe putte of helle gon, wiend out a-non mid al. of þulke fourme : and brec hit al-to nou&yogh;te!" Þe deuel a-non with þulke worde : wel narewe is wei he sou&yogh;te, And to-bruysde al þat wrechche maumat : and wiende MS. wiend þe out þarof a-non; And alle þe maumates of þe temple : heo to-daschten euerech-on. Al þat folk stod and þis i-sei&yogh; : and wel loude bi-gonne to crie, And seiden, "þare nis bote on al-mi&yogh;ti god : i-boren of þe mayde marie!" Seint Barthelmeu criede on Iesu crist : and bad is oresoun. An Aungel cam so bri&yogh;t so sonne : fram heouene li&yogh;te a-doun, to þe four huyrnes he fleu&yogh; a-boute : and in euereche he drou&yogh; with his finger a wel fair croiz : apert and cler inou&yogh;. "Mi louerd," he seide, "me sende hidere : and ase he him-seolf me sede, Þis temple i-chulle bi-fore eou alle : clansi of eche fuylþe-hede. Ake ichulle nouþe formest þene deuel : to eov alle schewen, i-wis, Þat &yogh;e mouwen þe soþe i-sco : &yogh;wuch ouwer bi-leue is. Ake þei he beo grislich for-to bi-holde : ne habbez of him no doute, Ake swuch signe ase ich habbe i-maud : in þeos four huyrnes a-boute, Makiez þulke sulue signe : in ouwer fore-heued ech-on, And ech luþur þing euereft schal : fram eou fleon oþur gon." Þo maden huy alle in heore fore-heued : þe fourme of þe rode; And þe Aungel heom scheuwede al a-brod : þene deuel ase huy stode, Þe fourme of a grislich man : þat al for-broide were And swarttore þane euere ani blou&yogh;man : with foule farinde chere; A scharp face he hadde and al for-kroked : his berd atelich and long, Ei&yogh;ene brode al brenninde : red and swart a-mong; A-non to is fiet tilde is her : and after þe schrewe sum it drou&yogh;; his hondene bi-hinden him at his rug— : huy weren þare wel i-nou&yogh;! Fuyrie speldene al stinkende : out of is mouth he blaste, And fuyr of brumston at his nose : þat stonk al-so foule and faste; Croked was boþe nose and mouth : wrechchede was his bone— And bote it al. þis were and r. ane hendi bacheler : a-bid for-to eft-sone! Daiþet habbe swuch a louerding : and alle þat him wel loue! &YOGH;eot, þei þe schrewe gret pouwer habbe : god is euere a-boue. ¶ "Þou luþere þing," quath þis Aungel : "þat here art nouþe onder me, For þou dudest Barthelmeus heste : ichulle habbe reuþe of þe : Ichulle þe onbinde, and late þe fleo : on eorþe in eche ende, For-to þe dai of dame r. dome come : þat þou to helle i-wiende." Þo þis luþere best onbounde was : with wel grisliche bere he fleu&yogh; a-wei a-mong heom alle : and neuereft ne cam þere. Þo þe Aungel hadde al þis ido : to heouene MS. heouene heuene he wende an hei&yogh;. &YOGH;eorne criede ech of heom : þat al þis wonder i-sei&yogh;, And hereden god, and þene Aungel al-so : þat þare a-mong heo[m] cam; huy crieden euere on seint Barthelmev : þat he &yogh;eue heom cristindom. So þat al þat ilke lond : to cristine-dom was i-brou&yogh;t þo, Þoru&yogh; þe Aungele and seint barthelmev— : i-blessede beon huy bo! v. 197-8 al. om.
45.4: Pollimius with is Quene : alle is childrene he nam And liet heom on the margin. baptizen of seint barthelmev&yogh; : and sethþe al is kinedom; So þat al þat ilke lond : to cristinedom was i-brou&yogh;t. Þe king for-sok al is lond : and ne tolde þarof ri&yogh;t nou&yogh;t, And wende and siwede seint Barthelmeu&yogh; : and prechede with him wel faste, And bi-cam swiþe holi man : and was bischop at þe laste. ¶ Ane broþer, herre kyng þane he was : he hadde, of grete pruyte, Astriages was is name : þare-bi-side a luyte.
