Þe tyþingue of seint Barthelmeu&yogh; : wel sone to him cam, Al-hou he hadde þene king is broþer : i-turned to cristinedam : A þousend men wel j-Armede : After him he sende For-to enqueri in-to al þat lond : &yogh;woder-ward he wende. huy wenden and sou&yogh;ten him ful stuyrneliche : and þo he was i-founde, bi-fore heore kingue Astriages : huy brou&yogh;ten him, faste i-bounde, And swiþe ofte he was with heom i-pult : þat he feol a-doun to grounde. v. 213 al. om. ¶ "Bel ami," seide Astriages þe king : "hou hauest þou on i-take? hast þou mine broþur with tricherie : i-maked mi godes for-sake, bi þe fei þat i schal to mahun : ichulle serui þe al-so And make þe bi-leue þine false god : oþur to strongue deþe þe do. And &yogh;eot, þeof, more schame opon oþur : ase ich i-heore ich iheore al. om. bi mannes sawe, Þov hast ore godes elles-&yogh;ware : defoulet and al-to-drawe." ¶ "Sire king," quath seint Barthelmeu&yogh; : "þou ne seist nou&yogh;t as þe hiende, Þat i scholde with tricherie : þine broþeres heorte wiende; with no tricherie ne wende ich him : ake with sothþenesse and with ri&yogh;te, Ich brou&yogh;te him out of mis-bi-leue : to him þat [hath] om. alle mi&yogh;te, Fram þe godes þat beoth al-so mi&yogh;te-lese : ase is þat dede treo Þat ich liet al-to-drawe. : and &yogh;if þou wolt þe soþe i-seo, bring me to þine oþur god : and &yogh;if ich mai don swuch dede, I-lief wel þat he is mi&yogh;teles : and for-sak þou him, ich rede. And with þulke god þat ich on bi-lieue : &yogh;if þou mi&yogh;t so on take, Ich rede þat þou a-cordi þe : and þine owene god for-sake; al. Ich þe bihote truliche : þat ich him wole forsake. And &yogh;if þat ich mai þoru strencþe of mi louerd : þinne god ouer-come, For-sak þe wrechches ase huy beoth wuyrþe : for heore mi&yogh;te heom is bi-nome." Nadde he bote þis word i-seid : þat þare ne cam to þe kingue A messager wel hasteliche : þat brou&yogh;te him ful sori tiþingue : Þat berit is owene god : þat he wel ofte sou&yogh;te, was i-falle of þe temple a-doun : and al to-dascht to nou&yogh;te. ¶ Þo þe king i-heorde þis : sori he was i-nou&yogh;, he fierde ase a man þat witles were : and is cloþes al to-drou&yogh;. he liet nime seint barthelmeu : and tormenti him wel faste And with grete staues legge on him : þe &yogh;wyle huy wolden i-laste. Þo he was defoulet so : þat reouþe it was to wite, Ase we findez in some stude : of his liue i-write, ¶ He liet him don on a rode : is heued toward þe grounde, Fiet and hondene to þe treo : i-nailled and faste al. oþer i-bounde; And seth, to don him more pine : ase we findez i-w[r]ite al-so, Þo he hadde þeron i-honged longue : he liet him a-doun do And liet huylden is fel al fram is flechs : al quik with kene knyue; Ri&yogh;t ase men huyldeth a ded oxe : men hulden him a-liue. Alas, hou mi&yogh;ten huy habben þe heorte? : alas, þe deolfulle pine! louerd, muche is þi mi&yogh;te : ase þov scheoudest þare bi þine hine!
45.5: Atþe laste þo he was i-huld : ase we findez i-writen al-so, huy smiten of is holie heued : are huy mi&yogh;ten him to deþe do— Vnneþe huy mi&yogh;ten mid al þ is wo : bringue is lijf to fine. Muche wonder was þat ani lijf mi&yogh;te : on eorþe þolie swuch pine! v. 252-3 al. om. his bodi was þoru&yogh; cristine men : i-bured faire i-nou&yogh;. Wel þicke, ase huy dorsten : þat folk þudere-ward drou&yogh; : For ore louerd anon-ri&yogh;t for is loue : fair miracle þare sende; &YOGH;ware-fore guode men þare-a-boute : wel þicke þudere wende. ¶ Þe luþere king Astriages : þat him liet so a-quelle, he dradde him sumdel of þe miracles : þo he heorde þar-of telle : Þane þreotteoþe dai þare-afterward : þat he liet him martri þere, Alle þe grete maistres he nam with him : þat of þe temple were, And to is toumbe huy wenden alle : þare ase þat holie bodi lai. Anon so huy þudere comen : ase al þat folk i-say, Þe deuel, þat heore maister was : tormentede heom a-non : For wreche of þat holie man : huy bi-comen guydie ech-on, MS. æchon And ase for-lorene wrechches huy deiden þo : he ne liet heom no leng gon; Into helle þe soulene with him he nam : þare ne liet he nou&yogh;t on. ¶ Þe tyþingue was sone wide i-brou&yogh;t. : huy dradden heom wel sore Þat of mis-bi-leue weren : huy ne dorsten þo non-more, Ake huy for-soken hore false lawe : and beden ore louerdes ore, And lieten heom cristni euerech-one : þoru&yogh; seint Barthelmeus lore.
45.6: POllonius, þat kyng was er : and þat to ore louerdes lawe him nam, bischop huy maden him ouer heom alle : to holden op cristin|dom. he was bischop twenti &yogh;er : are he dude heonne i-wiende; to þe Ioye of heouene is soule wende : atþe twenti &yogh;eres ende. v. 276-311 om. in Ashm. & Vern. — Þare was of seint Barthelmeu&yogh; : Miracles euere i-nowe, And wel þicke al-a-boute to is toumbe : muche folk euere drowe. &YOGH;eot þare weren luþere men bi-leued : and hadden þa[r]to envie, Þat he bi-liefden nou&yogh;t þat ore louerd was i-bore : of þe maidene Marie : A veteles huy maden al of led : and þare-inne huy caste Þis holi bodi wel fijlliche : and dutten it swyþe faste, And amidde þe se casten hit : and wolden deliueren heom so. Ake &yogh;eot ore louerd cudde is mi&yogh;te : ase he hath ofte i-do : For þat ilke led a-&yogh;ein is kuynde : þei it vuele were is ri&yogh;te, Aboue þe watere it gan to fleote— : þare was godes mi&yogh;te!— For þat watur nadde power non : to holden it to þe grounde. to þe cite of lupar it flet : and þare it was furst i-founde, And of cristine men op I-nome : and faire on eorþe i-brou&yogh;t. &YOGH;eot ore louerd, þei he were þare : he ne for-&yogh;at him ri&yogh;t nou&yogh;t : For he sende miracles riuedeliche : a-boute þe bodie þere. Atþe laste some luþere men : þat in þe londe were hadden þar-to &yogh;eot gret onde : and in a tyme bi-stelen þare-to And nomen þe bones up fram þe stude : þat huy weren inne i-do, And in þe contreie a-boute heom bere : and casten euerech in his side, Some in one stude and some in oþur : and to-spradden heom so wel wide, For huy ne scholden neuereft to-gadere come : ne more miracle do. So al. om. longue, ase godes wille was : defoulede huy weren so.
45.7: SEint Barthelmeu&yogh; cam sethþe : to a monek þare-bi-side : "Mine bones," he seide, "beoth i-cast : and al-to-spradde wel wide : I-nelle non-more þat huy beon so : þare-fore þou most gon Þis ny&yogh;t a-boute þare huy beoth : and to-gadere heom bringue ech-on." "A, sire, merci," þis Monek seide : "hou scholde ich i-knowe heom nov?" "Swiþe wel," seide þis holie man : "and ichulle þe tellen hou : Euerech of heom þare huy liggez : þei it deork ni&yogh;t beo, Schyne schullen ase bri&yogh;te ase sonne : þat wel feor þou schalt heom i-seo." ¶ Þis Monek wende forth bi ni&yogh;te : he ne fond of heom nou&yogh;t on Þat huy ne schinen ase clere ase ani sonne. : and so he gaderede heom ech-on. In a schip he brou&yogh;te heom in þe se : with gret honour at-þenende, Þat &yogh;wodere-so ore louerd wolde : þoru&yogh; is wille [he] heom sende. A wynd þare cam and drof þat schip : softe and euene i-nou&yogh;; So þat to þe londe of a-puyle : þat schip wel euene drou&yogh;. Þare weren þe bones faire onder-fongue : and faire in schrine i-do. Mani fair Miracle þare comen sone : And &yogh;eot þare doth al-so. Bidde we nouþe seint Barthelmev&yogh; : þat hei&yogh; Apostle is, Þat we moten þoru&yogh; his bone : come to heouene blis. AmeN!

46.1: SEint Thomas þe guode Apostle : I-martred was in .Inde; Of is lif we moten rede : ase we in boke dothþ finde. Þe &yogh;wyle ore louerd on eorþe was : with him he wende a-boute. Men cleopeden him sethþe ane to-nome : "Thomas longue in doute :" For þo ore louerd fram deþe to liue a-ros : In doute þar-of he was; Þe Apostles it leueden ech-one wel : bote þis ilke seint Thomas, Bote he seide þat he it nolde i-leue : bote he sei&yogh;e is wounde And handlede as and þerinne pulte : is finguer oþur is þombe al. to þe grounde — For þis Mis-bileue men him cleopeden : "Thomas longue in doute," Ase men redeth &yogh;eot in holie churche : &yogh;wan is dai cometh a-boute. ¶ Sethþe cam ore louerd crist : mid is woundes al a-blode To him and to is desciples : þare huy to-gadere stode; Ore louerd seide, "Thomas, hider þi finguer : ant pult here into mi side, And ne beo nou&yogh;t in mis-bi-leue : for mine woundene þou sixt wide." Þo bi-liefde he wel þat it was soth : and al-so euereft more; "Mi louerd," he seide, "and mi god : ich bidde þe milce and ore!" Þo þat he þe soþe i-sai&yogh; : ore louerd he louede faste, And prechede is manhede and cristinedom : þe &yogh;wile is lif i-laste.— ¶ It bi-feol, longue after þe tyme : þat ore louerd to heouene wende, Þat Gondofre, þe king of Inde : wel wide a-boute sende &YOGH;if man mi&yogh;hte ani Carpenter : finde, quoynte and slei&yogh;h, In anie londe, þat him couþe a-rere : a paleys noble and hei&yogh;h. In þe londe of cesaree : seint Thomas was þo : o vre louerd a-li&yogh;hte a-doun fram heouene : and a&yogh;ein him cam go, "Thomas," he seide, "þe king of Inde : haueth i-sent here-nei&yogh;h To furie al. seche after a Carpenter : þat were quointe and slei&yogh;h : Cum here with me, and ichulle : þudere to him þe sende." "A., louerd, þin ore," quath seint Thomas : "I-ne rechche &yogh;wodere ich wiende, Bote þat I-ne come nou&yogh;t in Inde : for þar-of me deth a-grise; Siend me elles &yogh;wodere þou wolt : ac þudere in none wise!" ¶ "Þou schalt wiende þudere," ore louerd seide : "and ichulle beon with þe. And &yogh;wane þou hast þoru&yogh;h þi prechingue : þat lond-folc i-brou&yogh;ht to me, Þou schalt þare i-martred beon : and to me þanne i-wiende. Go we to þis Messager : and þudere ichulle þe siende." huy come and metten þis Messager : þat brou&yogh;te þis tyþingue, Ase he cam furst op of þe se : a-middes þe Chepingue— Aben he was i-hote. : ore louerd hine þare mette, And axede &yogh;wat he þere sou&yogh;hte : and wel faire he him grette. ¶ "Mi louerd Gondofre," quath Aben : "þat is kyng of Inde, Sende me hidere &yogh;if þat ich mi&yogh;hte : ani quoynte Carpenter finde And þat [ich], hou-so ich euere on toke : in alle manere him brou&yogh;te : Þat [ich] with Catele, &yogh;if he were þral : of is louerd him bou&yogh;te And þat ich him, om. him &yogh;if he freo man were : huyrde him deore i-nou&yogh;h; And for-to do sum-&yogh;ware mi neode : hider-ward ich drou&yogh;h." ¶ "Ich habbe ane man," ore louerd seide : "þat ri&yogh;ht min owene is, Þat &yogh;wanne ich him ofte a-boute sende : wel he wrou&yogh;hte, i-wis, And dude is mester swiþe wel : &yogh;wodere he euere i-wende, And euere al þat he mi&yogh;hte bi-&yogh;ite MS. &yogh;e&dotb; i te : he brou&yogh;te me oþur sende. For quoyntore bold he can make : þane euere in Inde were; Ne swuch man nis þare in Inde non : þat swuch bold couþe a-rere." al. 2 vv. more. Ore louerd tok seint Thomas : Aben bi þe honde; Þat ope þe forewarde þat he made : ladde him to is londe. al. 2 vv. more. ¶ Aben ope þis forewarde : glad and bliþe was; Into schipe he wende a-non : with þe guode man seint Thomas. Sone he axede seint Thomas : ase huy in þe se i-wende, &YOGH;weþer he puyrliche is man were : þat him þudere sende. "&YOGH;if ich nadde," quath seint Thomas : "puyrliche is man i-beo, Mi manhe[de] al. his manrede ich wolde habbe for-sake : þo he bi-tok me þe." "Sei&yogh;e þou me," quath Aben, "&yogh;eot : &yogh;wat is þi seruise? &YOGH;ware-of seruest þou þat hei&yogh;e Man : þat &yogh;e beon boþe so wise?" ¶ "A carpenter," quath seint Thomas : "ich am, quoynte and slei&yogh;h, paleys and bold ich can arere : swiþe noble and hei&yogh;h, strong and li&yogh;t and swiþe fair : with-outen and with-inne, Þat no man ne may it felle a-doun : with strencþe ne with ginne, Ne so strong wynd ne tempeste : þat greuie mouwe it ou&yogh;t; So quoynte bold nas neuere on eorþe : to no prince i-wrou&yogh;t." "Deu merci," quath þis Aben : "þat þi louerd gret Man is, Þat so quoynte Men hat onder him : i-not non swuch, i-wis!" ¶ "Hei&yogh;h Man he is," quath seint Thomas : "and an hei&yogh; kyngues sone. Ope ane hei&yogh;e Montayngne his wonijngue is : þare he wole euere wone; Þare he halt is heritage : and is fader kynedom an hei&yogh;h; Þare nis non of is fon so strong : þat mouwe come þere-nei&yogh;h. Sik man ne pouere nis þare non : so riche þat lond is; So murie lond nas neuere i-sei&yogh;e : ne of swuch solas ne blis." Tellinde, huy rouweden forth in þe se : so þat þoru&yogh; guod winde Þene seueþe day huy comen a-lond : wel a þeos half Inde. ¶ At ane hei&yogh;e toune huy a-riueden : þare a kyng inne lay Þat liet weddi to an hei&yogh;h Man : his dou&yogh;hter þat ilke day. At þis bruydale was plei i-nou&yogh;h : song and gret hoppingue, Tabours and fiþele and symphanye : stiues and harpingue. Seint Thomas and þis Aben : wenden to þis feste, So Manie Men wel ofte doth : with li&yogh;t biddingue oþur heste. ¶ A Taborere song atþe mete : ase it is al. om.; r. ire? ri&yogh;hte was. Ase he eode singuynde op an doun : he bi-heold on seint Thomas : hire MS. him þou&yogh;hte þat he was cristine man : to pai&yogh;en him he gan singue "Cristine men habbez ane god : louerd of alle þingue." Þo seint Thomas þis i-heorde : he bad hire singue eft-sone. Þis taborere song up an doun : and dude seint Thomas bone. Þe Botiler chidde with seint Thomas : for he made hire singue more, And smot him a boffat onder þe Ere : þat him smert ful sore. ¶ "I-nelle nou&yogh;t a-rise," quath seint Thomas : "heonne fram mi fere Are ich i-seo an hound bringue þulke hond : a-mong al þis folke here." Þo þat folk hadde al-mest i-&yogh;ete : þe Botiler wende sone Out to ane welle to fechche in watur : ase he hadde þare-with to done. Þo he out to þe welle cam : a leon þere cam gon Ant hente þene botiler bi þe þrote : and a-stranglede him a-non, And to-drou&yogh;h ech lime fram oþur. : an hound þere cam bi cas And kipte up þe hond in is mouth : þat he smot with seint Thomas, And bar as in bi-fore al þat folk : and so bi-fore þe kingue. Þare nas non þat þis i-sai&yogh;h : þat ne wondreden of þat þingue, And seiden, "þis is an holi Man : þat god deth fore swuch dede : For bi þe botilere it is icome : ri&yogh;ht ase he er seide." ¶ Þe kyng liet cleopie bi-fore him : seint Thomas a-non, And seide, "þou art an holi man : þat þus a-wrecxt þe of þine fon : Þou schalt with me to mi dou&yogh;ter : into hire chaumbre wende And blessi hire, and hire spouse : þat huy habben þe bettere ende." Seint Thomas with þe king : in-to chaumbre gan gon; Þat &yogh;ongue wif and hire spouse : a-&yogh;ein him come a-non. Seint Thomas is holie hond : ope bei&yogh;e heore heuedes leide And blessede heom a-godes name : and is oresun seide. ¶ he nam is leue and wende a-&yogh;ein : and þe &yogh;ongue spouse ladde him forth & þonkede him : þat he cam in þe house. This verse on the margin. A &yogh;eord of palm cam in is hond : he nuste hou it cam, Ase he ladde seint Thomas— : wel gladliche he it nam : Þe &yogh;eord was ful of Dates : wexinde ase þei huy were. Gret wonder and ioye huy [hadden] : of þis miracle þere. Þis &yogh;ounge Man bar is &yogh;onge wif : þis fruyt so guod and suete; Of þat fruyt huy nomen boþe : and gladliche þar-of ete. ¶ Sone þo huy hadden þarof i-ete : huy ne mi&yogh;hten no feor gon, Ake ayþer lai a-doun bi oþur : and softe slepen a-non. Men beddeden heom ase softe ase huy mi&yogh;hten : and palles on heom caste, And wenden alle out bote heom-suluen two : and þe doren maden faste. Ase huy lei&yogh;e boþe and slepen : a fair king to heom cam, And bi-twene heom stod, in fair Abite : and bi-tweone is Armes heom nam; "Mine leoue children," he seide : "min apostle þat was her Blessede eov for þat &yogh;e scholden : of heouene beo parteners : Dothþ aftur him, and &yogh;e schullen beo : þare with-outen ende." Stille he liet heom ligge and slepe : and wel softe a&yogh;ein gan wende. ¶ Þo huy a-woken, huy lei&yogh;en and tolden : hou þat it beo mi&yogh;hte; gret wonder huy hadden for huy nusten : nou&yogh;ht of þis noble si&yogh;hte. Ase huy lei&yogh;en and herof tolden : seint Thomas to hom MS. him wende; "Þe kyng," he seide, "þat with eov spak : hidere to eov me sende— Þei &yogh;ates and doren beo faste imade : he hath [me] in i-brou&yogh;t. &YOGH;if &yogh;e wollez þe Ioye a-fongue : þat he haueth to eov i-wrou&yogh;ht, And his blessingue þat ich eov &yogh;af : þoru&yogh; me witez al-so, In Ioye and blisse with-outen ende : of heouene he wole eov do. For &yogh;e habbez &yogh;eot ouwer Maiden-hod : þat of eche guodnesse is quene, Þat neuere ne a-dwynet bi-fore god : ac euere is bri&yogh;t and schene." Þis &yogh;ongues al. &yogh;onge þinges feollen a-doun : to seint Thomas a-kneo, And crieden on him þat he heom tei&yogh;te : in guode liue to beo. ¶ Seint Thomas heom prechede anon : hou it of ore louerd is, And brou&yogh;te heom boþe to cristindom : and þe kingue and alle his. On of his desciples sethþe he nam : þat het dyonis, And made him maister of þat folk : þat huy ne wrou&yogh;ten amis; Þesne dyonis he made preost : and ane churche he liet arere. Þat folk cam eche daye : and heor[d]e MS. heore seruise þere. Þo þat lond was al i-brou&yogh;t : in guod stat i-nov, Seint Thomas is leue nam : and toward Inde him drov.— ¶ Anon so Aben, þat cam aftur him : to Inde mi&yogh;hte him bringue, with gret Ioye he ladde him forth : and brou&yogh;te him bi-fore þe kingue. To a fair place þe kyng him ladde : and axede him on alle wise &YOGH;if he couþe þere swuch bold a-rere : ase he him couþe deuise. Seint Thomas bi-heold þis noble place : "sire," he seide, "&yogh;e, So fair bold nis in al þis lond : ase ich can here arere þe." Ane perche he nam, and mat a-boute : hou al. as ech hous scholde beo. ¶ "Sire," he seide, "mi deuis : þou schalt here i-seo : Þe halle ichulle furst arere : in þis place in alle wise, Est-ward þe dore and þe proche : ri&yogh;ht ase þe sonne arisez, Þat þe sonne &yogh;wane heo a-rist : atþe dore in schine; here &yogh;ond ichulle þe chaumbres habbe : A v. om. : : ymete by myne lyne, Here &yogh;ond ichulle þe kuchen habbe : And a conduyt þare-bi-side." he deuisede [al] euene inov : and longue i-nou&yogh; and wide, So noble bold ne mi&yogh;hte non beo : ase he gan þare deuise. ¶ Þe kyng of is sotilte : bi-gan sum-del a-grise, And seide, "certus, ich &yogh;iue þe pris : of þe beste Carpenter And þe quoynteste þat ich euere i-knev : and best deuised al. deuisest her." he toc him catel al. gareisoun i-nov&yogh; : swuch bold with to rere; And wende him-sulf out of þe lond : þat to &yogh;er ne cam he þere. Seint Thomas þis tresor nam : and wide wende in londe And prechede Men of cristindom : and of god to vnder-stonde; Þat tresor he delde pouere men : euere &yogh;ware he heom founde. ¶ Muche folk he brou&yogh;te to cristindom : a-boute into al þat londe; ¶ Churchene he arerde mani on : and preostes he sette þere— Swich quoynte bold and noble it was : þat he wolde þe kyngue a-rere. Þe þridde &yogh;er þe king cam hom : and wende al-&yogh;are to finde his bold ase he hadde bi-speke. : and þo was it al bi-hinde. After seint Thomas he sende a-non : þat bi-traide him so, he seide. Sone Men tolden him hou it was : and al of is dede. Þe king liet him nimen a-non : and in strongue prisone him do, A v. om.: & Aban þat him þuder bro&yogh;te : bi him he dude also, And swor othþ þat he scholde : al quik i-huld beo And sethþe i-barnd al-to douste : and with þe wind a-wei fleo. ¶ Þe kingus broþer, þat hei&yogh;te Gad : al atþe deþe lay : Þe kyng al for-&yogh;at seint Thomas : for deol þat he i-sai&yogh;h; he hiet is Men witen him wel : and is felawe also, For-to is broþur were in betere point : þat he mi&yogh;hte heore dom heom do. ¶ So þat is broþur deide sone. : þe kyng made deol I-nov&yogh;h; he liet him a-greiþi swiþe fayre : and elles it were wou&yogh;h; Four dawes he heold him inne : þat he faire a-greyþed were In pourpre and cheisel and guode &yogh;immes : þat no defaute þare nere. Þo he [was] om. imaud al. agreiþed with grete nobleye : þene feorþe day huy him nome And with gret compaygnie of hei&yogh;e men : to is burijngue come. ¶ Ase huy wolden þis dede man : in is putte do, With grete noblei&yogh;e and pruyte i-nov : and with wop and sor also, he a-ros up fram deþe to liue : a-mong heom euerech-one. Þo mauden huy Ioye and blisse i-nov&yogh; : þat lusten er betere grone. "Broþer," he seide, þo he a-ros : "þou dudest ane vuele dede, Þat seint Thomas þe holie man : into prisone liete lede, For mid god of heouene he is wel— : and þoru&yogh;h him ich am nov To liue ibrou&yogh;t ase &yogh;e iseothþ : and i-chulle &yogh;ou tellen hov. ¶ For Aungles comen, þo ich was ded : and mine soule bere, And scheuwede me þe Ioye of heouene : þei ich vnwuyrþe were. Þis noble bold he schewede me al. me ek : þat seint Thomas liet arere with þat tresor þat þou him toke— : god &yogh;eue þat ich were þere! I-maud it is ase he deuisede þe : and noblelokur, &yogh;if it may, Of &yogh;immes and stones preciouse— : so noble neuere i-ne sai&yogh;. 'Lo,' seide þe Aungel þo : 'sixt þou þis noble bold? Þis hath seint Thomas a-rerd : of þat seluer and of þat gold Þat þi broþur him bi-tok : elles-&yogh;ware to bi-guynne; Ake þi broþur vnwuyrþe is : forto come þare-inne.' 'Ore louerd it &yogh;eue,' ich seide þo : 'þat it ouwere wille it were þat ich moste here porter beo— : for non betere wuyrþe ich nere.' ¶ 'we schullen,' seide an Aungel þo : 'to ore louerd for þe bi-seche Þat þi soule wende to eorþe a-&yogh;ein : þi lijf for-to eche, For-to libben on eorþe more : to don al þine wille. Ake buye out Thomas of prisone : ich rede, þat he ne a-spille.' " Þo he hadde þis tale i-told : he orn to seint Thomas, And feol to is fiet and þonkede him : ase he in prisone was, And tolde al of him hou it was : and bad him &yogh;eorne al-so To for-&yogh;iue is broþur, þe king : þat he him hadde mis-do. ¶ Þe kyng cam al-so eorne a-non : and criede him milce and ore, To for-&yogh;iuen him þat he hadde mis-do : and seide he nolde non-more. Out of prisone huy brou&yogh;ten him sone : with Ioye and blisse i-nou&yogh;. Þat folk honourede him ase a god : and wel þicke a-boute him drou&yogh;. "Muche hath ore louerd," quath seint Thomas : "for eov alle i-do, Þat schewede eov þus is priuete : &yogh;wane &yogh;e ne beoth nou&yogh;t wuyrþe þer-to. Þat paleis is noble and riche i-nov : þat ich þare habbe i-wrou&yogh;t: with þet tresor þat þe king me tok : to ende it is i-brou&yogh;t; Ech man þat wole don aftur me : þudere he schal wende And louerd and prince þare beo : euere with-outen ende. &YOGH;e mouwe wienden in-to al þat lond : and i-seon al-a-boute Ech contreie ful of churchene : þar-of &yogh;e mowen beo proute: Sire king, alle huy beoth a-rerd : of tresur þat þou me toke. &YOGH;if þou nelt nou&yogh;t i-leue me : wiend a-boute and loke!" Þe kyng, and al þat oþur folk : þat þicke a-boute him com, Bi-lieueden on god for þis miracle : and turnden to cristindom ¶ Fourtene þousend of men : to ore louerd tur[n]den þere, with-oute children and wummen : þat Manie al-so were. Seint Thomas heom tei&yogh;hte þe ri&yogh;hte bi-leue : and made heom þar-of wise; At eche churche he sette ane preost : to don heom heore seruise. Þo huy weren alle in guod point : his leue wel faire he nam, And wende ferrore into þe lond : to prechi cristindom.— ¶ In-to an oþur contreie he cam : þare he a-stunte ane stounde; he pulte him forth wel baldeliche : and prechede to grounde; Deue and blinde and oþere al-so : þat in sicknesse weren i-bounde, he helde a-non þoru&yogh; godes grace : &yogh;wane he anie founde. Swuche Miracle ase he dude : þoru&yogh; ore louerdes sonde, Nas neuere a-mong heom i-sei&yogh;e : in none stude of þe londe. ¶ Þat word sprong of him wide : fale Iorneis þanne Þat god was into Inde i-come : in a fourme of manne; he was gladdore þane ani Man : þat þudere mi&yogh;hte wende To habbe enes a si&yogh;th of him : a-boute in eche ende; Gret prece cam a-bouten him : of þe contreie feor and nei&yogh;h, And heolden him god in Mannes fourme : euerech þat him i-sei&yogh;h. ¶ Þe riche men þat weren nei&yogh;h : ane noble croune wrou&yogh;ten Of gold and of Riche &yogh;ymmes : and to þis holie Man huy al. om. brou&yogh;ten, And ech-manere cloþingue also : þat a kyng werie scholde, For-to cloþi him ase an hei&yogh;h kyng : and crouni him with golde. A v. om.: Grete tresour hi bro&yogh;te him ek : &yogh;if he it fonge wolde. ¶ Seint Thomas stod and bi-heold : no-þing þar-of he nolde; "Mine leoue freond," he seide, "&yogh;e weneth : þat ich beo þat i-nam nou&yogh;t: I-nam no kyng swuch þing to habbe : ase &yogh;e me habbuth i-wrou&yogh;t, I-nam nou&yogh;ht god, ase some weneth : ake ich am is hine, And he me hath hidere i-sent : to bringue eou fram helle pine And techen eov fur-sake eower false godes : þat ne mouwen eov helpe nou&yogh;t, And to bi-leue on ore ri&yogh;hte louerd : þat us alle hath i-wrou&yogh;t. ¶ Bi-leueth on him, ich eov rede : and to Ioye &yogh;e schullen wende. Þat tresour þat &yogh;e bringueth me : pouere men &yogh;e it sende, For ri&yogh;ht nou&yogh;ht i-nelle þare-of : ake deleth it heom a-boute; And bi-lieuez on Ihesu crist : and no-þing ne schulle &yogh;e doute." v. 266-7 al. om. Sike men þare comen þicke : a-boute in euerech side, Blinde and Doumbe and oþere al-so : heore hele fort-abide, Museles and crokede ek : and þat weren in palasye; v. 270-1 al. om. Ful þicke huy stoden in þe place : on þis holie man to crie. ¶ Seint Thomas alle þeos sike Men : brou&yogh;hte in one place, And a-mong heom sat a-doun a-kneo : and bad ore louerdes grace Þat he cudde is mi&yogh;hte and is grace : and heore hele heom sende þere, So þat al þat folk þe soþe i-sei&yogh;e : þat al-mi&yogh;hti god he were. Þo he hadde ore louerd þus i-bede : a-mong heom þare cam So gret li&yogh;ht and cler schinyngue : þat heore si&yogh;ht heom almest bi|nam; ¶ hit ouer-spradde furst seint Thomas : ase he lai in is beden, And þe sike Men alle, þat huy fullen a-doun : euerech in his stede, And lei&yogh;en þare al plat to grounde : þe mountaunce of half a tide, Þe &yogh;wile þis grete li&yogh;ht i-laste : ech bi oþeres side. A-non so þat li&yogh;ht i-passed was : þat ech mi&yogh;hte oþur i-seo, Ech-one huy a-risen up hole and sounde : holore ne mi&yogh;hte none men beo. ¶ Þare was Ioye and blisse i-nou&yogh; : þere ne mi&yogh;hte beo non more; huy honoureden seint Thomas : and criden him milce and ore. Þare turnden þo nei&yogh;h a þousend men : and i-baptizede were, with-oute children and wummen : þoru&yogh; is miracle þere. Þat cri was þo þarof so muche : þat al þat lond wel wide Þar-of spac, and þudere ornen : ful þicke in euerech side.— ¶ Carik hiet þe kingues mei : þat of þulke londe was, Migdonia hei&yogh;te is wif : þat ore louerd &yogh;af swiþe fair cas. For Migdonia, þis guode wif : to a wumman cam Þat heo knev&yogh; erore and was þo : i-turnd to cristindom, Þat hadde six &yogh;er blynd i-beo : and guod si&yogh;ht heo hadde þo; "Leoue soster," quath þis Migdonie : "hou is þis i-go Þat þov hast so longue blind i-beo : and nou art i-held so? &YOGH;wat is þilke wise Man : þat s wu ch mi&yogh;hte may do?" ¶ "Certes, Dame," þis oþur seide : "þe nobleste Man it is Þat euere on vrþe a-mon[g] men cam : with-oute god sulf, i-wis; For he heleth þe sike þat wollez beon hole : and þar-of ne faillez he neuere. haddestþov enes him i-sei&yogh;e : þe gladdore þou woldest beo euere." "Dev merci," quath þis guode wijf : "hou may ich best al. om. on take Þat ich hadde al. nadde i-sei&yogh;e þis holie man : þat swuch wonder may make?" ¶ "Wel, þou schalt do," þis oþur seide : "for to-morewe, ase he me tolde, he wole come and prechi al þat folk : hov huy schullen heore bi-leue holde; Þou schalt with me þudere go : wel priueliche, ich rede, And huyd þi face, with al. þi face ihud & in oþur cloþus : þat no man ne wite þi dede!" Þat guode wijf ne fur-&yogh;at nou&yogh;t þis : ake dude ase he ire radde, Chaungede hire cloþus and hudde ire face : and wende ase heo ire ladde. ¶ To þis holie prechingue heo cam : þat no man ne knev hire þere, And i-heorde þane holie man : hov he gan þat folk lere; Þe grete miracles heo i-sai&yogh;h also : þat ore louerd for him wrou&yogh;hte. heo nuste &yogh;wat heo mi&yogh;hte for Ioye do : ake stod in grete þou&yogh;hte; heo wilnede more þanne ani-þing : to speke with him a þrowe, Ake heo ne dorste for no-þing : laste heo were i-knowe. ¶ heo wende hom al i-hud : ake euere heo hadde in þou&yogh;hte Anoþer time with him to speke : &yogh;wane ore louerd þe time brou&yogh;te. Bi-fore hire bedde heo lay any&yogh;ht : and on ore louerd criede longue Þat heo moste þoru&yogh; seint Thomas : cristindom a-fongue. ¶ Atþe mid ni&yogh;ht seint Thomas cam : and bi hire stod atþe laste— Nuste heo neuere &yogh;ware he cam In : þe doren weren alle faste. "Beo glad," he seide, "Migdonie : god hath i-heord þine bone: Þou hast muche i-wilned after me : ich come to þe here ful sone. God wole þat þou beo on of his : and þat þou come þoru&yogh; me To þe lif þat euere schal i-laste : and þat ich beo a-slawe for þe. For þe ich schal i-martred beo : and boþe we schullen wiende To þe Ioye of heuene, and þare beo : to-gadere with-outen ende." ¶ Seint Thomas &yogh;af hire cristindom : are he þannes wende, And tei&yogh;te h ire al godes lawe : hire lif for-to a-mende. Þis wif bi-cam a guod womman : and nolde neuer-eft mo After þat tyme for no-þing : to hire louerdes bedde go. hire louerd was þar-of sore a-nuyd : and þo he ne mi&yogh;hte for no þingue Maken hire enes nei&yogh;h him come : he playnede him to þe kingue. ¶ Þe kyng hiet þe Quiene a-non : þat he = heo scholde to hire wiende And reden hire to honouri hire louerd bet : and don ase þe hende— For wummen conne of oþeres rede : þare-fore þe Qu i ene he sende. Þe Quiene adai wel mildeliche : to þis guode wumman wende And radde hire to hire louerd go : to schilden hire fram vilenie, And no-þing ne lieue þane false man : þat radde hire to schuche folie. ¶ "A, dame, merci," quath þis oþur : "þou nost nou&yogh;t hou it is; &YOGH;if þou wustest al þat ich wot : þou noldest nou&yogh;t so segge, i-wis. For so noble a man ase he is : nas neuere on eorþe ido; haddestþou him enes i-sei&yogh;e : þou woldest segge al-so. And &yogh;if þou isei&yogh;e nouþe þat ich seo : þe wolde wondri, i-wis. For symphor þe hei&yogh;e kny&yogh;t : þat Maister of kny&yogh;htes is, ¶ To-dai was his sone ded : and symphor wel &yogh;eorne him sou&yogh;te, Þane holie Man seint Thomas : and to is sone nouþe him brou&yogh;te: And þare he hath him ri&yogh;ht nouþe : [arerd] fram deþe to liue; And þare he sit nouþe in is hous : and prechez þat folk bliue; A-boute him al-so sike men : wel þicke comez nov gon, Crokede and blinde and oþur e al-so : and [he] heom heleth ech-on." ¶ "Leoue soster," quath þis Qu i ene : "&yogh;weþur þis mouwe soth beo?" "&YOGH;e, Dame, certes," quath þis oþur : "and &yogh;if þou it wolt i-seo, Go we þudere and þou schalt : þe soþe finde a-non." Þe Quiene þou&yogh;te þo ful longue : are heo were þudere i-gon. huy come and founden seint Thomas : ri&yogh;ht ase þis womman seide. Þe Quiene stod and him bi-heold : and alle is holie dede: ¶ To is fiet heo ful a-doun : heo ne mi&yogh;hte no leng a-bide, And bad him &yogh;iuen hire cristindom : and merci faste him cride. Sone þo heo i-cristned was : hamward þane wei heo nam To þe kyngue, and longue hire þou&yogh;te : are heo to him cam. "Sire," heo seide, "ich habbe i-founde : þis guode wijf Migdonie r. þare-fore; al. so þat In grete wisdome, and ich wende er : to finde hire in folie; And, gode þonk, of hire wisdom : heo partede with me: And þare r. þare-fore; al. so þat i-nelle in þine folie : non-more siwe þe." Þo was þe kyng sori inov&yogh; : he nuste &yogh;wat þar-of to do. For-to quelle is wif þare-fore : none heorte he nadde þar-to. ¶ He cleopede Carik, is cosyn : "we beoth bi-traide," he seide, "Mine Quiene ich sende, ase þou wel wost : þi wif for-to rede, To bringue hire out of fole þou&yogh;t : ase þou me for loue bede, And nouþe ich habbe hire for-lore : forth with hire, ich drede, For loue of þe one i-lore boþe : alas, þe wrechhede! we moten us a-wreken of þat þeof : þat bringueth heom in swuch dede." ¶ He liet sienden aftur seint Thomas : &yogh;if Men him mi&yogh;hten finde; And þo þis holie Man i-founde was : faste men him guonne binde, And harli him forth bi-fore þe kyng : his hondene him bi-hinde: So þat he was to deþe i-brou&yogh;t : in þe londe of Inde. For þo he was bi-fore þe kyngue i-brou&yogh;t : þe kyng him hiet a-non For-to honouri heore false godes : þat weren of treo and ston, a v. om. Oþur he wolde laten him tormenti : and to-drawe is flechs fram þe bon. ¶ Þis holie Man for-sok þo : is heste forto do. Irene plates he liet nime : brode and longue also, And liet heom caste a-midde þe fuyre : þat al glowinde huy weren a-non, And sethþe he hiet þane holie Man : þar-uppe bare-fot gon. A-non so þis holie Man : sette is fet þare-on, A welle with watur þare sprong out of þe vrþe : so cold so ani ston, al. out : of þe harde ston And a-queinte þat fuyr a-non : þat so hot and strong was; Þe guode man eode forth þar-on : þat neuere þe worse him nas. ¶ Þo was þe king nei&yogh;h out of witte : an Ouene he liet hete, Þat heo was al glowinde fuyr : are huy wolden lete : Þene holie Man huy nomen anon : and a-midde þe Ouene him caste. And þo he was þare-inne i-do : þat fuyr no leng ne laste, Ake it bi-gan to quienche a-non : þat so gret hete er of drov&yogh;; Þe holie Man þare-inne was : in Ioye and Muruþe i-nov&yogh;. ¶ Þo þe kyng þis i-sai&yogh;h : he nuste hou on take; "Carik," he seide, "hou geth þis? : ore godus us habbuth for-sake; we ne mowen nou&yogh;t þis luþere þeof : with none þingue quelle." "Certus, sire," quath Car[i]k : "anoþur ichulle þe telle: we schullen nime þis [luþere] om. Man : and [to] ore godes him lede And maken him forto honouri heom : mid ei&yogh;e and for drede, Þoru&yogh;h &yogh;wan he schal is louerdes wrathþe : habben out and out, And is merueile him beo bi-nome : þoru&yogh; &yogh;wan h e is so prout." ¶ To þis Maumates þis holie man : i-brou&yogh;t was wel sone Mid strencþe forto honouri heom : ase huy weren i-woned to done. Seint Thomas bi-heold þis maumates : ase he bi-fore heom stod; "Ich coniouri eov," he seide, "in his name : þat for us schedde is blod, Ov deuelene þat þare-inne beoth : and with foles wolleth speke, Þat &yogh;e sone þarof out fleon : and þe Maumates to-breke." ¶ A-non so he hadde þis word i-seid : þe maumates ne mi&yogh;hte no leng duyre, Ake bi-gunnen al to melte awei : ase wex deth a&yogh;ein þe fuyre, Þat huy weren so alle to nau&yogh;ht i-brou&yogh;ht : ri&yogh;ht ase huy neuere nere. In gret wonder stod al þat folk : þat in þat paleis al. place were; Ech-one huy gonne with one mouþe : wel loude grede and crie: "O. god is al-mi&yogh;hti one : i-boren of Mayde Marie, Of &yogh;wam seint [Thomas] hath i-speke— : to him we wollez alle us take And þeos wrechches false godes : clanliche alle for-sake." ¶ Þo þe kyng and Carik : and þe false preostes al-so Þat wusten þe Maumates, i-heorden þis : huy nusten &yogh;wat to do. Þe kyng and Carick for fyn wo : out of þe place wenden, Þo huy i-sei&yogh;en hou þis holie Man : heore godus so foule schende; huy ne dorsten for cristine Men : setten on him non hond, Ne al-so for þe grete Miracle : þat Man alday with him fond. ¶ Ake þe preostes of þe false lawe : in grete wrathþe huy stode; Þat on hente in is hond a strong swerd : with ful wroþe mode: "Of þis þeof ichulle," he seide : "mine godes anon a-wreke, Þat heom hath swuch schame i-do : ho-so it euere bi-speke," he leide on þis holi Man : with is swerd to grounde Into al is bodi and made him sone : manie eouele woundes, And a-martrede so þane holie Man : and a-slou&yogh;h him in a stounde. Þe cristine Men weren wroþe i-nou&yogh;h : þo huy hine ded founden; Þane preost huy wolden habbe i-barnd— : ake he fleu&yogh;h a-non; And þe king and carik habbe a-slawe— : ake huy weren a-wei igon. ¶ Þis holie bodi huy nomen a-non : and to churche it bere, And bureden it with gret honour : and with grete nobleye þere. So þat strencþe of holie churche : wexinde euere was. Þus cam into Inde cristindom : formest þoru&yogh;h seint Thomas. Nov seint Thomas þat Cristindam : formest into Inde brou&yogh;te, B[r]ingue us to þe Ioye of heouene : to &yogh;wan ore louerd us bou&yogh;te.

47.1: SEint Mathie Apostle is : ase &yogh;e schullen alle i-wite; Þoru&yogh;h lot he was apostel i-maud : ase it is i-write. Ivdas þat Apostel was : þo he hadde ore louerd i-sold, Þare [nas] om. non longue in is stude : þat Apostel were i-told. Aftur þe tyme þat ore louerd : in-to heouene was i-sti&yogh;e, Þe Apostles weren alle to-gadere : and ore lauedi seinte marie: ¶ So þat seinte peter heom radde : ase ore louerd hadde i-bede, For Ivdas þat Apostle was : to nimen on in is stude. So þat huy nomen and casten lot. : and ope seint Mathie it gan falle; So þat he, and seint powel : þe laste weren of heom alle.— Seint Mathie cam of hei&yogh;e Men : þat nouþe apostel is; In þe londe of Bedlehem : i-bore he was, i-wis. Seothþe, þo he Apostel was : and huy wenden alle wide And precheden Men overlined. to cristindom : euerech in his side, Into þe londe of Iudee : seint Mathie þene wei nam; Þare he prechede to manie Men : and brou&yogh;hte to cristindom. he helde also þat sike weren— : ne may no man rikeni alle; Þoru&yogh;h him þat folk into cristindom : swiþe wide it gan falle. ¶ Þare was a maister in þat lond : þat a swuch drunch made þere Þat alle þat þar-of dronken : anon-ri&yogh;ht a-blende were. Of þat drunch men brou&yogh;ten to seint Mathie : and he it dronk anon: And him nas þare-fore neuere þe worsse : ake al hol he gan forth gon. Þat folk hadde þer-of wonder gret : þat he ne les anon is si&yogh;hte. "Alas, mine leoue freond," quath seint Mathie : "&yogh;e ne seoth nou&yogh;t godes mi&yogh;hte. Þat &yogh;e i-seon sothþliche godes mi&yogh;hte : þat he on us sende, Latez bringue here bi-fore me alle þulke : þat þare-with weren a-blende!" Men leten heom sechen wel widen out : and bringue þere into place. Þis holie Man heo[m] helde a-non : þoru&yogh; ore louerdes grace; ¶ Þreo hundred men and mo al. to (=two) : þoru&yogh;h ore louerdes mi&yogh;hte Þat þoru&yogh; þat drunch weren a-blende : he &yogh;af heom þare heore si&yogh;te. Þat folk criede &yogh;eorne on him : and þicke a-bouten him cam, And bilieueden on god þoru&yogh; is techingue : and turnden to cristin|dom. ¶ Þe luþer Iustise of þat lond : her-of heorde telle: he liet nimen þis holie man : and in strongue deþe a-quelle. Ake it nis nou&yogh;hwere in boke i-founde : &yogh;wat deth he hadde þere; Ake i-martred he was in strong torment : ase alle þe apostles were. ¶ Guode Men comen aftur-ward : and þat holi bodi nome And fram þe londe of Iudee : ladden it sethþe to Rome, And bureden it þere with gret honour : þare ase men schewez &yogh;uyte In seinte Marie churche ofte : his heued with grete pruyte. Nov god for þe loue of seint Mathi : us leue ore lif so wisse Þat we, &yogh;wanne we heonnes wiendeth : comen to heouene blisse. MS. blissa AmeN.

48.1: SEint Siluestre pope was : þe furste þat þare cam þat euere hadde Rome in pes : to holde up cristindom; For alle þat comen bi-fore him : luþere Men to-drowe And harleden heom out of þe londe : and with tormens manie huy slowe. Ake ore louerdes mi&yogh;hte euere wax : and þe strencþe of cristindom, So þat it was in betere pays : þo seint siluestre cam. ¶ It bi-fel þat he prechede þe Aumperoure : Costantin þat was þo; þat he grauntede him þe churche of Rome : in pays with-outen wo. Ake erore he hadde wo i-nou&yogh;h : are it mi&yogh;hte þar-to astonde: For in prisone he was ofte ido : and ofte i-driue out of londe. ¶ A luþur Iustise cam in a time : in-to þe contreye a-boute For-to tormenti cristine men : and to overlined. harli with gret route; he liet martri ane holie Man : þat hiet thymothe, And liet him sethþe in a foul stude : casten with gret vilte. Seint siluestre wente a-ni&yogh;ht : and þat bodi þannes drou&yogh;h And burede it with gret honour : in a fair place i-nou&yogh;h. ¶ þe Iustise sethþe it vnder-&yogh;at : siluestre faste he nam, And seide, "þeof, þou schalt habbe : þat ilke sulue dom &YOGH;wy laddest þou a-wei þanne þeof trichour? : &yogh;wodere hastþou him -brou&yogh;t?" "Certes, sire," quath siluestre : "þeof ne trichour nas he nou&yogh;ht; Ake þou art swuch on, ich wot it wel : and godes martyr he is. And þat þou þare-of þe soþe i-seo : to-ni&yogh;ht þou schalt, i-wis, In strongue deþe a-strangled [be] : and wiende to þe pine of helle." "A, þeof traitour," quath þe Iustise : "raþer ichulle þe a-quelle." ¶ He liet nime þis holie man : and in strong prisone caste, For-to he bi-sei&yogh;e him in &yogh;wat deþe : he were i-brou&yogh;t ate laste. his soper he liet greiþi faire : ase he was i-woned to do, And with grete pruyte and noblei&yogh;e : he eode and sat þar-to. A fisches bon schet in is þrote : ase he sat and .et., þat neuereft ne cam out a-&yogh;ein : are he is lijf fur-liet; For he was a-choked a-non : and toward þe deþe he drou&yogh;h, Vnneþe he liuede for-to mid-ni&yogh;ht : with pine and seoruwe i-nov. ¶ His Men þat weren is conseilers : comen eorninde faste Into þe prisone to siluestre : and sore huy weren a-gaste, And seiden, "leoue louerd, fur-&yogh;if us : þat we þe habbez mis-do! Gret wreche to ore Maister cam for þe : ne lat nou&yogh;ht to us so! Louerd, graunte us þi guode wille : we nelleth mis-don þe non-more; Go forth &yogh;ware þi wille is : we biddeth þe milce and ore." ¶ þis guode man wende out of prison : with honour i-nov&yogh;, Ri&yogh;ht ase Men þane luþere Iustise : to-ward þe eorþe drov&yogh;. þat folk bi-leueden heore owene prince : þat huy heolden er so hei&yogh;e, And alle siweden þis holi man : for miracle þat huy seien. Sorie weren þe luþere Men þo : for heore lawe eode al-to nau&yogh;hte; And þe cristine Men weren glade i-nou&yogh; : for al þe pris huy cau&yogh;hte. Mani heþene Man þare-fore : tornede to cristindom, And wel þe betere pais þoru&yogh; al þe lond : a-mong cristine men bi-cam. ¶ Seint siluestre bi-lefde pope : in guod pais þo i-nov&yogh; And muche folk wide a-boute : to godes lawe þare drou&yogh;. Preostes he made and deknene al-so : and he him-sulf furst bi-founde þe ordres to maken a-&yogh;ein midewynter : þat men halt &yogh;uy[t] in al þe londe. Al-so he bi-fond þat Men scholden : maken þe seruise with linnene cloth clene i-wasche : ope þe weuede in alle wise, And helie with clene linnene cloth : ore louerdes flechs and is blod, And noþer in pal ne in seolke : nere it no so guod— ¶ And þat was, for, þo ore louerd : bou&yogh;te us with is blode, Iosep of Aramathie : nam him a-doun of þe rode And wond him in &yogh;wi&yogh;ht linnene cloth : ase þe godspel hath i-seid, Ake noþur in seolke ne in sendel : þo þat swete flesch was ded. In swuch cloth ase is swete flechs : was i-wounde þo, his swete flechs schal ope þe weued : beon i-wounden euere-mo. þis guode Man þreo-and-twenti &yogh;er : pope was at rome And þreo monþes and endleoue dawes : are is ende-day him come. And þo he deide in godes seruise : ase he hadde longue þare-in i-beo, I-bured he was bi-side rome : for-soþe, Milene þreo. Nou god for is swete loue : us graunti þulke blisse þat seint siluestre is inne : þat we þar-of ne misse.

49.1: lawe SEint Eustas þe noble kny&yogh;t : of heþene lawe MS. londe was; Ake are he i-cristned were : men cleopeden him placidas. he was with Traian þe Aumperour : hext of alle is kni&yogh;hte, Maister he was of al is ost : at eche bata i le to fi&yogh;hte. he wilnede to wite godes lawe : and of cristindom; Ake no man þar-of him ne tei&yogh;hte : ne &yogh;eme þare-to ne nam: ¶ his heorte him &yogh;af þat is lawe nas nou&yogh;t : and þare-fore almes-dede Ofte he dude for godes loue : þat he him scholde þe bet rede. A wif he hadde and twei sones : þat swiþe &yogh;oungue were; heo wilnede &yogh;eorne þat sum man : of god hire wolde lere.— þis hei&yogh;e kni&yogh;htes wenden a day : on honteth mani on with heore cheuenteyn placidas : to cachche hert and bocke and don. ¶ A-mong oþur game huy founden ane heort : swiþe fair best with-alle: placidas him siwede a-non : &yogh;if he mi&yogh;hte maken him falle. Fram is felawes he wende al one : þis best orn with gret pas, And he siwede him fer in vncouþe stude : þat al weri he was. þo huy comen opon a fair hul : þis best with-stod atþe laste. þis kni&yogh;ht ne dorste ner him wiende : ake bi-heold him stikele and faste. Bi-twene is hornes he i-sai&yogh;h : ane creiz schine bri&yogh;hte with gret leome ase it were of sonne : þat vnneþe bi-holde he it mi&yogh;hte. ¶ "Placidas," seide þe heort : "&yogh;wy woltþou weorri with me? I-cham god þat þou ne knowest nou&yogh;t : ichulle schewi me to þe. þine almesse-dedes þat þou hast i-do : a-mountede me bi-fore; þat þou ne canst nou&yogh;t, i-chulle þe teche : þat þi soule ne beo for-lore. þov were a-boute to cachche me : ichulle þe cahche al-so." "Louerd," seide placidas : "sei&yogh;e me &yogh;wat i schal do." ¶ "Bote go," seide ore louerd þo : "hom to þine wiue, And nim hire and evwere twei sones : and lat eou cristni bliue. þus time to-moruwe cum a&yogh;ein : and ich þe wolle wisse hou þou schalt leden here þi lijf : to of-serui heouene blisse." þo nuste he &yogh;ware þe heort bi-cam. : þis kni&yogh;ht in grete þou&yogh;te wende hom and þonkede god : þat swuch tiþingue him brou&yogh;hte. his wiue he tolde it priueliche. : "sire, merci," heo seide, "To-ni&yogh;ht ore louerd cam al-so to me : and ri&yogh;ht so he gan me rede." ¶ Huy nomen heore twey sones with heom : and to a bischop huy wende And lieten heom cristni alle foure : heore lif for-to amende; þis kny&YOGH;th liet is name tuyrne : and liet him cleopie Eustas. With oþure kni&yogh;htes he wende eft an hontez : þudere ase he er was. þis holie best he sai&yogh;h þo eft-sone : aftur he wende al-so, For-to he cam in-to a priue stude : ase he hadde er i-do. þo criede he and fel a-doun a-kneo : "louerd," he seide, "þin ore, Tel me hou i schal mi lif lede : to saui me þoru&yogh;h þi lore." Ore [louerd] spac þo in þe heortes mouþe : "loke þat þou do after me! For þov hast þene deuel ouer-come : he armeth him a&yogh;en þe: þolie þou schalt wo and sor : ase Men schulle in bataylle; &YOGH;if þou wolt þolie and a-&yogh;ein him fi&yogh;hte : of is wille he schal faille. he schal þe, ase he dude Iob : mid alle wo þe fonde; Seie me &yogh;if þou it þolie wolt : and faste a-&yogh;ein him stonde!" ¶ "Louerd," seide þis guode kni&yogh;ht : "&yogh;if me studefast-hede, þat ich mouwe is fondingue þole : ase þou me wolt wisse and rede." "Ope þi-sulue it is &yogh;if þou wolt beo : studefast," ore louerd seide; "Ake &yogh;if þou wolt so, ichulle in þi care : boþe witie þe and lede." Mid þusse worde ore louerd wende : he nuste &yogh;ware he bi-cam. þis kni&yogh;ht in grete þou&yogh;hte of heorte : þene wey hamward nam; his wiue he tolde al hou it was : and bad hire studefast be. To is louerdes court, þe aumperoures : nolde he nonmore teo. ¶ þo comen þeoues and robbeden him : of al þat euere he hadde; his Orf deide al-so to grounde : nou&yogh;ht o best a-liue he nadde; his hinene deiden euerechone— : þare bi-lefde non a-liue Bote he and [is] tweie &yogh;ongue sones : and is leoue wiue. þo ne bi-lefde heom non more guod : þane heom hieng a-boute— huy þonkeden god of alle is sondene : &yogh;uyt nadden huy none doute. For schame þat huy beggares weren : heore hous huy liete stonde And bi ni&yogh;hte stelen a-wei : to-ward an oþur londe, ¶ Eustas al-one and is wijf : and is sones twei&yogh;e; So &yogh;ungue weren þis children two : þat he bar heom ofte bi wei&yogh;e. Gret deol made þe Aumperour : þo he miste sire Eustas, And liet him seche al-a-boute : ake men nusten &yogh;ware he was. Toward Egypte huy passeden þe se : for huy mosten so don nede. Þo huy þe se ipassede hadden : þe schipman axede is mede. huy seiden þat huy noþing nadden : ake þat huy beggares were. Þe schipman bi-heold þat guode wif : and þou&yogh;te him of faire chere; ¶ he seide, "ichulle for mi mede : þis wumman with me at-holde." Þe kni&yogh;ht weop and criede &yogh;eorne : ake hit ne mih&yogh;te no-þing holde, Þis schipman nam MS. nan him and is sones : and out of þe schipe heom þraste, And liet heom wienden &yogh;wodere huy wolden : and heold MS. beold þis womman faste. Þe kny&yogh;ht bi-heold after-ward : ake þo it non-oþur nas, Sore he weop and wrong MS. wrond is honden : longue i-swowe he was. "Leue sones," he seide, "&yogh;wat schulle &yogh;e nou? : &yogh;oungue &yogh;e beoth, help-les, In vncouþe londe; ho schal ou wite : nouþe &yogh;e beoth moder-les? ¶ Mi-sulf ich couþe mine mete bi-swynke : ake inot &yogh;wat &yogh;e schulle do; A feble norice ich am, alas! : i nas neuere i-tei&yogh;ht þer-to." Wel softe he ladde is sones forth : and wel ofte he heom bar. To a deop watur he cam : and no schip ne fond he þar: he bar is o sone ouer þat watur : and þare a-doun him sette. D ix. continues;] [þe while he wente ouer a&yogh;en : his oþer sone to fette, a-midde þe water as he was : a wolf þer com vrne & nom þat child & ber hit ford : touard þe wode &yogh;erne. A leon com in þe oþer half : & þis oþer child [he] nom & bere hit ford touard þe wode : ar þe faþer to him com. ¶ þis kni&yogh;t stod a-midde þe water : no wonder þe him wo were, whan he sei þat þis wilde bestes : his sones awei bere; he wep & his hondes wrong : & tar him be þe here; him-sulf he wolde habbe a-dreint : &yogh;if þat oþing nere: he þo&yogh;te on þat our lord sede : þat he scholde þolie sore. he þolede, him þo&yogh;te, sorue y-nou : noman ne mi&yogh;te more. "lord," he sede, "whiþer schal ich nou?" : & wente bi an vncouþe weie; "kni&yogh;tes ich was y-woneþ to haue : wit me of gret nobleie: ¶ Ich les hom suþþe, & al my good : þat ich scholde bi leþe mi lif; Mene bileueþe oþer solas non : bote my sones & my wif. þo mi wif me was by-nome : nas me wo y-nou? &yogh;if ich dorste sigge, ich was : ibro&yogh;t in more wo wit wou. Me nas bileueþ bote mi sones : þat al myn herten were: þo sei ich whare wilde bestes : awei to wode hom bere, & icham a wrecche & frendles : bileueþ nou alone, al nakeþ & bar of alle gode : as ich sprong out of þe stone! ¶ wel ichot þat iob hadde : y-nou of care & sore; a lone wrecche as icham : me þincþ ichaue more: for he hadde frend & wif also : him forto bimene, me nis bileueþ wif ne frend : to solaci me ene. a dunghupel warup he him reste : him was also bileueþ: of al my god so moche y naue : þat ich mow rest op my hed. of al men þat euer were : me þinch icham mest wrecche— ac whan god wol so þat ich schal : of noþing I-ne recche." þo he hadde al y-mad his mone : þat reuþe hit was y-nou, In sorue & care spitosliche Ashm pitosliche : touard toune he drou. ¶ þer he &yogh;ede & beþ his mete : þat al folc reuþe hadde þat so fair man & stalworde : in meseise his lif ladde. hai-ward hi made him of þe toun : hor corn forto wite, þat he mi&yogh;te in treunesse : his liflode be-&yogh;ite. his lordinges he paide wel : & al oþere also— for ho-so haþ wit him godes grace : he ne schal neuer mis-do. for he ne couþe no&yogh;t his mester : gret sorue he hadde ynou; his wo he nom in pacience : to eche godnesse he drou. heyward he was fiftene &yogh;er : in gret sorue & care; ne com noman nei him þat him kneu : his frend him Ashm. frendes, him om. were wel bare.— ¶ ac om. in Ashm. hit bifel þat þe emperour : þat his lord er was, y-worreþ was of a noþer king : þorou a luþer cas. sone him misseþe þis gode kni&yogh;t : & ofte he sede alas. to many lond he sente aboute : to seche seint eustas. tuei kni&yogh;tes þat his felaues were : þat so&yogh;te him suiþe wide, In his baille hi mette him : as hi come þer-ford ride. seint eustas i-kneu hom wel : & hi him no&yogh;t wit-alle— for ho-so is in meseise & in sor : his heu wole sone falle. ¶ "knowest," hi sede, "eni man : þat hatte placidas?" he sede nai, & sede soþ : for he het eustas. þo gonne þis kni&yogh;tes sike sore— : & hit was nei eue: þis haiward hom baþ suiþe faire : al ni&yogh;t wit him bileue. þo hi come hom to his In : he made hom faire chere & cortesliche serueþe hom : quinte man as he were. ac euer whan he from hom turneþe : þ e teres ourne of his eie; ac fair semblant he made y-nou : euer whan hi him seie. ¶ þis kni&yogh;tes þo&yogh;te wonþer gret : þat a such heiward of so quinte seruise was : as he were eny stuard. þe lengor þat hi him bihulde : þe bet hom þo&yogh;te [hi] him kneue— for whan man is fol of mete & drinke : hit MS. his soteleþ Ashm. so teleþ in his hwe. "þis man," sede þe on to þe oþer : "ilich is placidas, loke we where he haue þe wounde : þat on his hed was, þat he hente in þe bataile? : for &yogh;if he haþ þilke wounde In þilke stude, siker we beþ : þat we him haueþ i-founde." þo hi founde þis soþe tokne : in gret ioie hi were ibro&yogh;t, hi sede, "þu art placidas : þat we longe haueþ iso&yogh;t. ¶ þe emperour sente after þe : to him þ u schalt come, for his fon haueþ moche of his lond : for þe faute r. defaute of þe y-nome." sein eustas made gret daunger : & naþeles ate nende to þe emperour of rome, his lord : wit hom he gan wende. glad tiþing com to þe emperour : þo he him isay! he let him greidi in fair atir : as noble kni&yogh;t & hei, he let &yogh;arki his ost also : mony kni&yogh;t & sueyn, & made eustas, as he was er : of hom alle cheuenteyn. ¶ hi wente & worreþe op hor fon : to grounde fer & ner; hi þat er al maistres were : nadde do no poer. more prouesse ne mi&yogh;te be : þan was of þis kni&yogh;te, for he was of bodi strong : & moche couþe of fi&yogh;te, & he hadde wit him godes grace : be dai & by ny&yogh;te; þer-fore non heden man : a&yogh;en him stonde ne mi&yogh;te. þo þe king hor fo vnþer-&yogh;et : þat his poer noding nas, & þat he ne mi&yogh;te worre holde : a&yogh;en sein eustas, ¶ he flei hom in-to his owe lond : vnneþe wit þe liue. seint eustas wit his gode route : after sueþe bliue; of his men he let ek mony nyme : & slou ek of hom riue, he let sle al oþer nyme : oþer out of londe hom driue. &yogh;ut he suor he wolde awreke be : of þe gret schonde þat hi hadde his lord y-worreþ : in his owe londe. ¶ gret maister he wex anon— : what, whare was þo his horn? he ne &yogh;ede no&yogh;t in þe feld afote : to wite man r. mannes corn! a maister heiward he was on : wit such men to fi&yogh;te, to porswy in-to his owe lond : a king of so gret mi&yogh;te! he let ordeine wel his ost : & parti hit a-þre,] Cheuenteynes he liet [chese] om. tweie : vnder him to beo. ¶ Þare weren &yogh;oungue tweie : faire men MS. manc with-alle, with red heued, &yogh;eolu and crips Ashm. Rede men wiþ &yogh;elou her — : fair cas þare gan bi-falle: For þere nere none into al þe Ost : þat so staleworþ e men were Ne of so gret prouwesse in þe bataile : ne þat so wel armes bere, Þare-fore Evstas vnder him : cheuenteynes heom made þere, Eyþer is owene compay[ni]e : swiþe wel to lede and lere. huy siweden heore fo in-to is lond : no-þing a-dradde huy nere; And þo huy þe se i-passed hadden : heor baneres huy lieten MS. leieten a-rere, ¶ Into al þat lond huy wenten a-boute : and nomen alle þat huy founden, heore fon huy slowen þat heore pouwer : was sone i-brou&yogh;t to grounde; For huy nomen some and ladden forth : with heom, faste i-bounde, Some huy raymeden for heore lif : of manie harde poundes. Are huy heom hadden so ouer-come : huy &yogh;euen manie woundes; Gult-lese men þat weren of pais : huy lieten beo hole and sounde. huy come and nomen a gret cite : and þare-inne huy a-li&yogh;hte; Ase louerdes huy resten þere— : so fareth þat habbeth mi&yogh;hte. ¶ Þis two cheuenteynes þat weren : onder sire Eustas, huy casten of heore helmes heom for-to auente : heore bodi ful weri was; Vnder a chaumbre huy resten heom : in a wel fair herber, huy tolden of heore grete prouwesse : þat huy duden feor and ner. "Wonderliche," þat on seide : "ich am forth i-gon. Mi fader was kny&yogh;ht of gret pouwer : nis nou&yogh;h were nouþe schuch on; ¶ he and mi moder stilleliche : lieten heom cristni beye, And me and mi &yogh;oungue broþur MS. broþus : þat weren his sones tweye. orig. bey &yogh;e A ni&yogh;ht he nam is wif and us : þat his sones were, And ladde us into anoþur lond : þare we neuerer nere. Þo we þe se i-passede hadden : þe Mariner for is huyre Drof us out of is schip . and ore moder ladde awey : þat us was leof and duyre. ¶ Ore fader nam us and ladde us forth : swiþe gret deol he made. To awater we comen þat was so deop : þat we ne mi&yogh;hten nou&yogh;ht wade : Mi fader bar ouer mine &yogh;ounguere broþer : and in þat oþur half him sette, And cam a wolf and bar him forth : þe &yogh;wyle he [me] wolde fette; And are he mi&yogh;hte to me come : a leon þare cam eorne And kipte me and bar me forth : to-ward þe wode wel &yogh;eorne. ¶ Schepherdes ornen him a-&yogh;ein : with hornes and with hounde, And crieden and schoten to-ward him : þat he me liet falle to grounde; huy nomen and ladden me to heore hous : and lieten me forth bringue. Of fader ne of moder ne can ich : telle eov no tyþingue." ¶ "Louerd crist," seide þat oþur : "i-hered beo þi mi&yogh;hte, Þat ich moste of mine leoue broþur : habbe one si&yogh;hte! Certes," he seide, "ich am þi broþur : þat þe wolf a-wei bar; Ake Aker-men weren in þe feld : þat weren of him i-war, with staues and with stones al-so : a&yogh;en him huy ornen bliue And maden him legge me a-doun : so þat ich cam to liue." louerd, muche was þe Ioye : þat bi-twene heom was þere! Mest huy bi-menden fader and moder : þat huy nusten &yogh;ware huy were. ¶ Heore Moder sat and heorde þis : In ane chaumbre þare-bi-side: welle, louerd, þat he = heo was glad : þat heo mi&yogh;hte þane day a-bide! Sori heo was þat heo ne mi&yogh;hte out : with hire sones to speke— Ake heo was bi-loke ase a prison : ne heo ne mi&yogh;hte þat hous breke; For heo and manie oþer : in ostage weren itake. Bi-fore þe prince heo was sethþe i-brou&yogh;t : hire fin for-to make. Þo isai&yogh; heo &yogh;ware hire louerd was— : a-doun heo feol to grounde, "I-hered beo þou, ihesu crist!" heo seide : "mine louerd ich habbe i-founde!" ¶ Þis guode kni&yogh;ht [gan] om. for ioýe to wepe : he clupte hire and custe; More Ioye þane [was heom] om. bi-twene : no man neuerer nuste. "Sire, merci," heo seide : "ne haue þou no mis-þou&yogh;t, For god it wot, ich am clene : and i-wemmed nou&yogh;t. For also-sone as þe luþere man : me hadde fram þe i-brou&yogh;t, he vuelde, and deide sone : bi god þat ich habbe i-sou&yogh;t!" Þo was þis guode kni&yogh;ht gladore : bi muche þane he er was! "Dame," he seide, "of ore leoue sones : quite we beoth, alas! For a leon bar þat on a-wei : and a wolf þat oþur also; Wel ich wot þat huy to-drawe beoth : inot &yogh;wat we schullen do." ¶ "Sire," seide þis guode wif : "make gret Ioye with-alle, Among alle þe men þat euere weren : fairest us is bi-falle: For ase ich in a chaumbre sat : kni&yogh;htes ich heorde twei&yogh;e Tellen of us so þat ichwot : þat it weren ovre sones bei&yogh;e. Lat of-sechen &yogh;wuche huy beoth : for soþe, huy beoth of þine. Beo glad and in alle Ioye : for we habbez ouer-come ore pine." ¶ Þis kni&yogh;ht for Ioye liet sende a-boute : þe messagers neren nou&yogh;t bi-hynde; he liet seche and crien ouer-al : &yogh;if men mi&yogh;hten anie swuche i-finde. he fond þat is sones weren : onder him cheuentey[n]s, Þat he him-sulf made for heore prouwesse : of þe ostes souereins. Glade huy hadde er i-beo : ake so glade neuere huy nere, Þo fader and moder and þe sones : to-gadere i-come were; Þat þe fader and þe sones : þe maistrie a-wei bere v. 256-7 seem spurious. And maistres weren of al þat folk : to ordeinen heom and to lere. ¶ Louerd, muche is þi mi&yogh;hte : and þat þou cuddest þere— For þat þou i-saued habbe wolt : no-þing ne schal fur-pere.— ¶ Þo þis guode kni&yogh;ht and is sones : and heore ost atþen ende Þe Maistrie hadden of alle heore fon : hamward huy guonne wiende with gret Ioye and nobleye— : of no man heom ne dradde; Alle þe hexte men of þe londe : ase prisones with heom huy ladde. Muche pris þare was of heom : ase huy wenden toward rome. Ake deolfole tiþingues huy founden þere : þo huy þudere come: For huy founden hore louerd ded : þene Aumperour traIan, And an oþer huy founden imad after him : þat hiet Adrian, Þat muche schame dude cristine men : &yogh;ware anie weren i-nome. Gret Ioye he made with þis kni&yogh;htes : þo huy weren þudere i-come, For heore prouwesse, and for heore prisones : þat huy mid heom brou&yogh;hte. hext prince of þat lond vnder him : sire Eustas makie he þou&yogh;hte; Bote it were bi is red : no-þing don he nolde, And &yogh;wane he wende into anie stude : euere mid him he scholde. ¶ A dai huy comen bi heore temple : þat heore maumates inne were: Þe Aumperour li&yogh;hte a-doun : to don þare is preiere. Sire Eustas nolde nou&yogh;t þare-inne come : ake bi-lefde þere-with-oute. Þe Aumperour in wrathþe axede a-non : &yogh;ware-of he hadde doute And &yogh;wi he ne a-li&yogh;hte, ase ri&yogh;ht were : and to is godes a-loute. "Sire," seide sire Eustas, "it is for nou&yogh;t : þat þou art þare-a-boute; I-ne rechche a-liue ho it wite : cristine ich am, i-wis. Of swuch a prince ase þou art, gret deol is : þat so schal bi-leue a-mis." ¶ "Ov!" seide þe Aumperour : "hast þou þus i-seid? habbe ich þus i-loued þe : and þou me hast bi-treid? &YOGH;if þou louest þin owene stat : torne þi þou&yogh;t, ich rede, Oþur þou schalt segge þat þou ne dudest : neuere so luþer dede." "Certes, sire, for nou&yogh;t it is" : þis guode kni&yogh;ht a-&yogh;ein seide, "holde ichulle þat ich habbe i-take : I-ne bi-leue it for no drede." wod-wroth was þe Aumperour : he liet him binde faste And leden hom to is paleis : and among leones him caste, Þat huy scholden for-swolewen euerech lime : of þis guode kni&yogh;hte. huy a-lutten to him and lickeden him— : þare was godes mi&yogh;hte! ¶ þo is sones and is wif : herof heorden telle Þat þe Aumperour heore louerd nome : him for-to a-quelle, huy comen eorne with gret eyr : and axeden &yogh;ware he were, And seiden huy wolden for godes MS. guodes loue : mid him dei&yogh;e þere. v. 300 is to follow here. he schok is heued and criede loude : and ter him bi is here; he liet makie ane tonne of bras : for-to berne heom þare-inne. Wel wusten þis guode kni&yogh;htes : &yogh;wat huy scholden þare-with iwinne. ¶ Þo was þe luþere Aumperour : wroþere þane he was bi-fore. r. ere Sire Eustas sat a-doun a-kneo : and seide, "nouþe, louerd, þin ore! Graunte us to þe Ioye of heouene : comen aftur þis sore, And þat ore þou&yogh;t studefast beo : and treowe euere-more. v. 303 added. Graunte us þat alle guode men : þat us habbuth in muynde And of us bi-sechez help to þe : þat huy it moten finde, Þat huy of peril beon i-brou&yogh;t : and of alle oþure vuele al-so, Þat þou, &yogh;if it is þi wille : into þe Ioye of heouene heom do. we foure þat muche of ore lif : i-liued habbeth in wo, Graunte us one stude to ore martyrdom : and to ore burijngue al-so, Þat we in one stude forto domes-day : to-gadere resten mote, Þat þe sike of bodie and of soule : at us habben bote." ¶ Þo cam þare a uoyz, and seide : "Eustas, glad þou beo, Al þat þou i-bede hast : god hat h i-graunted þe." Þis tormentores nomen þis guode kni&yogh;ht : and is sones and is wif, And duden heom in ane tonne of bras : to leten þare heore lijf; Gret fuyr huy þare-aboute maden : bi-neoþe and a-boue: And þare huy þoleden martyrdom : for ore louerdes loue. ¶ Þo þis fuyr hadde longue i-barnd : a-boute þe brasene tonne, And þat bras was muche i-molte : and to-gadere i-ronne, huy eoden ner, and þis holie men : wel faire liggen huy founde, So &yogh;wijht schininde so eni milk : þe bodies hole and sounde And þe soulene ore louerd bi-tai&yogh;t— : for þare nas of cloþe ne of here, Ne of no stude of alle heore bodies : þat of þe fuyre i-weommede were. ¶ Cristine men a-wayteden heore point : and stelen þare-to bi ni&yogh;hte And þeos holie bodies ladden a-wey : and longue þare-to huy ti&yogh;hte And bureden heom faire in one stude : to &yogh;wuche huy weren i-brou&yogh;t— For ore louerd wolde þat it were : ase huy hadden him erore bi-sou&yogh;t. An hondred &yogh;er i-passede weren : and twenti also Aftur ore louerdes buyrtyme : þat huy weren to deþe ido. Þus seint Eustas mid is wif : and mid is sones cam To þe hei&yogh;e Ioye of heouene : þoru&yogh; strong martyrdom.

50.1: SEint Iohan þe ewangelist : þat Apostel is, was ore louerdes Aunte sone : and seint Iemes broþur, i-wis: his Moder was ore lauedie suster : Marie cleophe, I-wedded heo was to is fader : þat hiet zebede; Þis Zebede hadde twei&yogh;e sones : bi Marie is wif: Þes seint Iohan and eke seint Ieme : þat ladden wel holi lijf. ¶ Seint Iohan was &yogh;onguore þane ore louerd: twelf monþe oþur þere-a-boute; For is kun he was þe betere Man : þar-of nis no doute: And natheles he was, ich wene : þritti &yogh;er old nei&yogh;h Are hee ou&yogh;t muche of ore louerd wuste : oþer are he him muche isei&yogh;h. For ore louerd nas bote luyte i-knowe : ne he ne cudde him nou&yogh;t Are he i-baptized were : and to cristine-dom i-brou&yogh;t; And &yogh;eot ne cudde he him nou&yogh;t a-brod : are seint Iohan þe baptist were I-martred for þe lawe of holie churche : þat he gan heroudes lere. ¶ Ake þo seint Iohan i-martred was : ore louerd ne sparede nou&yogh;ht Forto gon and prechi a-boute : til he was to deþe i-brou&yogh;t. To beon is desciples furst he ches : twei&yogh;e breþren þo : Seint petre and seint Andreu : ase he cam bi þe se go; And þare he sai&yogh;h tweie breþren þo : seint Ieme and þes seint Iohan, with þe olde man Zebede : heore fader, a-fischeth gon : ¶ heom he cleopede al-so to him : and huy bi-lefden a-non heore fader, and siweden him : and token þe betere won. Seint Iohan was best with him : of is desciples echon : Þat was i-sene þo he leonede : an d slep op on is breoste-bon; For þe &yogh;wile he made is cene : ase on schere-þores-day, Seint Iohan among is desciples : to is swete breste lay. A-morewe, ase on þe guode friday : ase he deide on þe rode, his swete moder and seint Iohan : faste bi him stode : Þere in seint Iohanes warde : is swete moder he tok, To wardi ase hire owene sone : ase we findez i-write in bok. ¶ hire wardein he was aftur also : þat he to heouene i-wende, Al þe &yogh;wyle þat heo on eorþe was : for-to he aftur hire sende. Ri&yogh;ht it was to wardi hire : &yogh;wane heo is Aunte was, And for þare nas non oþur al. noþer of heom : þat clene mayde was; al. nas Clene mayde to wardi oþur : ri&yogh;ht it was i-do al. to do — Þare-fore in is swete warde : ore louerd bi-tok hire so.— Aftur þat ore louerd was : to þe Ioye of heouene i-went, And his desciples a-witsonenday : þene holi gost hadde i-sent, ¶ huy wenden forth wel baldeliche : euerech in is side, A-boute in diuerse londes : and precheden wel wide. In-to þe londe of Asye : seint Iohan þe ewangelist wende, to wissi þulke side : and prechede of Iesu crist. To þe Cite of Efese : atþe laste he com, Þare he hadde him-sulue hous and hom : and prechede cristindom.— ¶ Þe Aumperour domician : þat luþur was i-nov&yogh;h, Alle þe cristine Men þat he fond : he tormentede oþur a-slou&yogh;h. So þat seint Iohan was i-nome : þat longue hadde beo i-sou&yogh;ht; Bi-fore þe Aumperores Iustise : ful sone al. to rome he was i-brou&yogh;t. Þe Iustise þou&yogh;hte anon : fram god to tuyrne is þou&yogh;ht. "Certes," quath þis holie Man : "þare-to ne bringest þou it nou&yogh;t; For ichulle more don after god : þane aftur þe, i-wis." Welle, wrothþ was þe Iustise : þo he i-heorde þis! Ane tonne ful of Eoyle he nam : and liet it boylie faste, And al wallinde þesne holie Man : a-midde þe eolie he caste. ¶ Seint Iohan þare-inne sat : so longue so it was, he ne chaungede neuer ene his hiev : ne neuere þe worse him nas, Ake al hol with-outen eni harm : out of þis eolye he a-ros— Þe Iustise þat him þer-inne brou&yogh;te : þar-of wel sore a-gros. Þis was in rome bi-fore a &yogh;at : þat þis dede was i-do, Þat men cleopeden "þe porte latin" : and &yogh;uyt men doth also. A-seint Iohanes day it was : in þe bi-ginningue of may. For þulke miracle men holdez &yogh;uyt : þoru al þe lond is day; And for þat &yogh;at hiet "porte latyn" : þare þe dede was i-do, &YOGH;uy[t] men holdeth al. writ þilke day : of seint Iohan al. of porte latyn al-so.— ¶ Domician þe Aumperour : þo he i-sai&yogh;h þis cas Þat seint Iohan nas no-þe worse : þat he in þe eolie was, wod-wroth he was and sori i-nou&yogh;h : ake natheles he ne dorste nou&yogh;t For cristine Men, þat he were : þoru&yogh; him to deþe i-brou&yogh;ht; he hiet him fleo out of þe londe : þat non more he ne come þere. I-harled he was out of rome : ase þei he strong þeof were, And i-outlawed ase a þeof : þat he in þe contreye ne come. Into þe yle of patmos : he wende out of rome, And wonede þare in penaunce : twelf monþes nei&yogh;h. Of ore louerdes priuetez : wel muche he þare i-sei&yogh;h, For ofte þe priuetez of heouene : ore louerd him schewede þere. &YOGH;ware-of he made þare ane bok : al-holi churche to lere, þat men cleopeth "Apocalips" : þat men redez in churche al day; Muche is of godes priuetez : þat he þare i-sai&yogh;. orig. i sai&yogh;h — ¶ Þe furste &yogh;er þat seint Iohan: þus i-outlawed was, Of þe Aumperour þat him drof awey : þare bi-feol a sori cas : For þe senatour him a-slov&yogh; : þat was þo of rome, In contek þat heom was bi-twene— : for huy conteckeden i-lome. Seint Iones pays was sone i-cried : and alle oþeres also Þat weren þoru&yogh; þe Aumperour : in outlawingue ido. Seint Iohan him wende a-&yogh;einward þo : mildeliche i-nov&yogh;; Toward þe cite of Efese : to is owene hous he drou&yogh;— For he hadde þare hous and hom : and kun and freond i-nowe. Men and wimmen of þe toun : wel þicke a-&yogh;ein him drowe, To wel-comien him with grete Ioye : and in-to toune him brou&yogh;te, with swiþe gret procession : ase huy ful wel ou&yogh;ten. ¶ Ase huy wenden þoru&yogh; þe toun : with grete Ioye þere, Men and wimmen a-&yogh;ein heom comen : with ful dreorie chere : For drusiane, a ded womman : toward vrþe huy bere; Þare was for hire deol i-nov&yogh; : and wel sorie alle huy were. Gret loue þare hadde er i-beo : bi-tweone hire and seint Iohan. Ase sone ase þat folk him i-sai&yogh; : þe gladdore alle huy were a-non; huy gonne on him to crie faste : "sire," huy seiden, "þin ore! Þis is drusiane, þi guode freond : þat was vnder þi lore. Þou wost wel heo hath þe muche i-loued : nov ne may heo nonmore, here heo is in þis bere ded : heo makez us carie sore. ¶ Heo ne wilnede non oþur þing : þe &yogh;wile heo sik lay, Bote þat he = heo moste þe i-seon : are hire ende-day : And nouþe it is so ase þou sixt : þat, þei þou beo here, heo ne may! Þench on þe loue þat heo þe louede : sethþe heo þe furst i-say; And &yogh;if þou woldest us swuch grace do : and a-&yogh;ein to liue hire bringue, Euere we scholden herie þe : and þe kingue of alle kyngue." ¶ seint Iohan bi-gan to sichen sore : ase he in þou&yogh;hte were; he bad heom ane stounde a-bide : and setten a-doun þe bere. he sat a-doun wel softe a-kneo : and criede to ore louerd þere, Þis woman þat him so muche louede : &yogh;if it were is wille, a-rere. Þo he hadde i-seid is oresun : anon-ri&yogh;ht in þe place Þis womman a-ros up hol and sound : þoru&yogh; ore louerdes grace, And herede faste ihesu crist : and þene holie man sein Iohan— Þare was prece of alle þe men : þat þudere mi&yogh;hten gon. Seint Iohan bad hire go hom a-non : and greyþi som-þing to mete Athom in hire owene hous : þat he mi&yogh;hte with hire ete. ¶ Þeos drusiane wente forth : and &yogh;a[r]kede mete i-nov&yogh;, And made seint Iohan fair semblaunt : and elles it were wou&yogh;.— [fol. not numbered] In þe cite of Efese : seint Iohan bi-lefde longue, And prechede þat folk to gode tuyrne : and cristindom a-fongue, And ordeinede preostes : and churchene liet a-rere, Bischopes he made beste Men : þat folk for-to lere. Þis guode Men þat vnder him weren : bischopes and oþere also, Fondeden boþe ni&yogh;ht and day : aftur is wissingue do. huy crieden on him with al hore mi&yogh;hte : alle of one al. þe cite : For he wuste so muche and vnder-&yogh;at : of ore louerdes priuete Þe &yogh;wile he with him on eorþe was : and next him euere also, Þat he scholde of is holie lijf : in sum guode bok do, And of is kuynde &yogh;wat he was : and þat folk don to lore, al. aboute lere Þat huy mi&yogh;hten þe betere iwite : &yogh;wat ore swete louerd wore. ¶ Seint Iohan bi-sou&yogh;te þat folk &yogh;eorne : for him þat huy bede In fastingue and in orisones : to don a swuch holi dede; And wende into a derne stude : and bad ore louerd faste Þat he scholde þene holie gost : into is heorte caste, Þe holie Godspel of him to make : al-holie churche to lere, &YOGH;ware-þoru&yogh; euerech cristine man : þe betere bi-lieued were. he bad al-so þat þare ne scholde : þoru&yogh; ore louerdes grace wind. ne reyn. ne oþur weder : come nei&yogh;him in þat place To letten him of is holie dede : þe &yogh;wyle he þare-a-boute were. Ore louerd heorde is bone wel : þat no weder ne lette him þere, Ne cam no wynd &yogh;eot to þis day : ase þe holie Man it bad, Ne oþur tempeste in þulke stude : as þe bok was i-mad, al. a v. more: Holi is þe bok when so holi is þe stede Ne al. þat þer ne mi&yogh;hte neuereft come tempeste : ase þe holie man it bad. hadde ibede A-non so seint Ion bi-gan : to don þis holie dede, I-tend he was of þe holie gost : þat ech del þat he seide he sek of ore louerdes breoste : ase he þar-to lay Þe &yogh;wile he made is swete cene : a-schere-þoresday; Þare he sek out þat holie wit : of þe holie godspelle Þat he made sethþe in Efese : a-mong cristine Men to telle. he was þe feorþe Ewangelist : and herre nas þare non; And is godspel he made last : of heom euerechon. Seint Matheu and seint Mark : and eke seint luc, i-wis, heore god-spelles huy hadden longue i-maud : are he bi-guonne his. Ake seint Iohan bi-gan his hext : for þare-on he bi-gan Of ore louerd al &yogh;wat he was : are þat he were Man; he bi-gan so hei&yogh;e is godspel MS. godspell : of ore louerdes kuynde, i-wis, Þat vnneþe ani Man eorþelich : entendeth &yogh;wat it is. For he sou&yogh;hte so deope is kuynde : and of him bi-gan so hei&yogh;e, In þe fourme of Ane Ern he is de-peint : ase we ofte i-seoth with ei&yogh;e. For þe Ern is swiftest r. sucth (= seoth) best of alle foules : and hext he may fleo: For &yogh;wane he is in þe lofte an hei&yogh;h : þat herre ne may non beo, &YOGH;uyt he may here in þe grounde : ane luttle worm i-seo; al. a v. more : & ate se-gronde a smal fisch : to chese wider to teo. Also he may so hei&yogh;e fleo : and þe firmament so nei&yogh;h, Þat almest is wyngene brenneth : &yogh;wane he is so hei&yogh;h. ¶ Se al. Seint (S e ) Iohan þat is al. is in þe fourme of Ern : is godspelles wel hei&yogh;e bi-gan, Þare-inne he tolde al is al. our louerdes lif : þe &yogh;wile he was on eorþ man. his godspel is swiþe hei&yogh; i-holde : ase wel ri&yogh;ht it is, For muche del of holi churche : þer-þoru&yogh;h i-loked is. Seint Iohan cudde þis godspel sone : and prechede it faste al-so; &YOGH;eot þare weren luþere men : þat onde hadden þare-to.— ¶ On atyme manie luþere Men : to-gadere heom hadden i-nome And to seint Iohan þe ewangelist : in grete wrathþe come And heten him wende forth with heom : to heore maumates a non And a-nouri as forth with heom : oþur it scholde an-oþur gon. "Beu freres," quath þis holie Man : "ichulle segge eou a sothþ— Ich habbe reuþe of eov in mine heorte : þat &yogh;e nutez &yogh;wat &yogh;e dothþ. Ichulle don eou chois of tweiy þingues : and þarof cheose &yogh;e: To gon al. þat ich go with eou to eower temple : oþur &yogh;e to churche with me; ¶ &YOGH;wane &YOGH;e to godes churche comieth : &yogh;if &yogh;e þoru&yogh; eower godes lawe Mouwen make þe churche to falle : bi-lieue ichulle on heom fawe; And &yogh;if ich may bi al. so eower temple : bi-fore eower owene si&yogh;hte, Bi-leueth on Ihesu crist, ich rede : &yogh;wane &yogh;e i-seothþ is mi&yogh;hte." "We grauntiez wel," þis oþure seiden : "þou schalt furst bi-guynne To cuyþe þine louerdes mi&yogh;hte : þe maistrie forto wynne." To þe false temple huy wenden furst : and þo huy weren þare-nei&yogh;h alle, Seint Iohan bad heom stonde fer : þat huy ne weren of-falle. ¶ Þo huy weren alle with-drawen a-feor : seint Iohan a-feor stod; "I-seo &yogh;e," he seide, "þis temple alle : þat &yogh;e holdeth so guod? Ich hote hire in mine louerdes name : þat heo falle a-non, Þat &yogh;e mowen þe soþe i-seon : bi-fore eou here ech-on." Ne hadde he bote þat word i-seid : þat heo ne ful up þe doun, Fram ende to oþur, al þis temple : with swiþe grislich soun. ¶ Þo al þat folk þat þare stod : þis miracle i-sei&yogh;h, huy gonne to crien on Ihesu crist : and on seint Iohan an hei&yogh;h; Twelf þousend Men þare torneden : echone to cristindom, with-oute children and wimmen : þat turneden also mani on.— ¶ ARistodimus, þe Bischop : and Maister of þe lawe, &YOGH;uyt ne mi&yogh;hte nou&yogh;ht seint Iohan : to ore louerd is herte drawe: For þo he isai&yogh;h þis faire miracle : þat þe temple ful so þere, &YOGH;eot nolde he it nou&yogh;ht i-leue : þat ani miracle it were; he nolde i-lieue in none manere : þat ore louerd were of mi&yogh;hte. Seint Iohan stod and þou&yogh;hte longue : hou he him mi&yogh;hte bringue best to ri&yogh;hte, ¶ And seide, "sei&yogh;e þou me &yogh;wat i schal do : þat þou bi-fore þe i-seo; And bote &yogh;if ich it do, ne lief þou nou&yogh;ht : þat mi louerd al-mi&yogh;hti beo." "Par fey," quath þis luþere Man : "nov ichulle herkni þe; Do nouþe þat ichulle þe segge : and þou schalt winne me. Venim ich habbe, strong i-nov&yogh;h : þat ho-so þarof nimeth ou&yogh;t, Ne come þere with-inne him neuere so luyte : to deþe he worthþ i-brou&yogh;t; This verse is doubled in the MS. Drink þare-of bi-fore MS. b : atfore mine eyene Ey&yogh;en : and &yogh;if it ne greueth greuez þe nou&yogh;ht, To Ihesu crist, þat is þi god : ichulle take al mi þou&yogh;ht." "Þou seist wel i-nou&yogh;," quath seint Iohan : "bring nouþe hidere to me Þat strongue venym, and ichulle : hit drinke bi-fore þe." ¶ Þe false Bischop him bi-þou&yogh;the : for-to a-gasten him þe sarrore þere, And also to seon þe soþe : þat his god of pouwer were: Twey men þare weren, to deþe i-dempt : for heore luþere dede, Þe false bischop dude hem boþe : bi-fore seint Iohan lede And made heom drinke of þat venym : ri&yogh;th bi-fore is ey&yogh;e. A-non so it ou&yogh;t with-inne hem cam : boþe huy gonne dey&yogh;e. ¶ Seint Iohan sethþe þe coppe tok : þo he isai&yogh;h al þis cas, And dronk þare-of ane grete drau&yogh;t : and neuere þe worse him nas, Ake euere þe lengore þare-aftur-ward : þe more Ioye he made and blis Þat folk stod al in gret wonder : þo huy i-sei&yogh;en al þis. ¶ huy stoden and bi-heolden sein Iohan longue : þre tidene and more, And euere þe leng þe gladdore : huy sei&yogh;en him for al his sore: To Ie[s]u crist huy gonne tuyrne : and criden merci a-non; So þat huy to cristine-dom : þare turnde, wel many on. ¶ Ake Aristod[i]mus þe Bischop : was euere in luþere þou&yogh;te, And ne bi-liefde nou&yogh;ht in Iesu crist : for al þat he þare wrou&yogh;te. "&YOGH;wat fayllez þe &yogh;uyt?" quath seint Iohan : "me þunchez it is with wou&yogh;h Þat þou ne leuest ore louerdes mi&yogh;hte— : ne sixt þou nou&yogh;t &yogh;uyt i-nov&yogh;?" This v. on the margin. "Bote þou most &yogh;uyt," quath þe Bischop : "þe dede to liue a-rere Þat to deþe with þis venym : a-poysoned nou ri&yogh;ht were." "Þou seist nouþe ful wel," quath seint Iohan : "ake þat þou þe soþe i-seo, I-nelle nou&yogh;t mi-sulf ney hem MS. him come : ake ope þe it schal al beo. Nim mine cuyrtel here to þe : and lei&yogh;e ope hem a-non, MS. anom And in þe name of Iesu crist : hot heom a-rise a[nd] MS. a gon." ¶ Þe bischop nam seint Iohanes Cuyrtel : bi-fore ri&yogh;ht þe Iustise, And leide ope þe dede and het heom þo : in ore louerdes name a-rise.
