A-non so he hadde þis word i-seid : þis men a-risen a-non And &yogh;eoden forth hole and sounde : and þonkeden seint Iohan. ¶ Þe bischop, þo he þis i-sei&yogh;h : and þe Iustise al-so, Criden merci Iesu crist : of þat huy hadden misdo, And torneden þare to cristinedom : and oþur folk also i-nou&yogh;h, For þe faire miracle þat huy seyen : and elles it were wou&yogh;h.— ¶ Þe Miracle þat seint Iohan dude : no toungue telle ne may&yogh;; Þare-fore folk him siwede faste : þat is miracle i-say&yogh;. Tweye Ioliue louerdingues and wilde : þat &yogh;oungue and Ioliue al. stronge were, Siweden him and duden al-so : ase he gan heom lere: ¶ Furst huy solden al heore god : þat heom ne bi-lefde nou&yogh;th, And turnden hem al to Iesu crist : heore heorte and al heore þou&yogh;ht, And siweden MS. siwenden sein Iohan swiþe faste : þat þare-to heom hadde i-brou&yogh;ht; And he heom prechede of Iesu crist : þat deore heom hadde i-bou&yogh;ht. ¶ Þis twei&yogh;e &yogh;ongue men ase huy &yogh;eoden : swyþe riche men and hei&yogh;e with grete nobleye and pruyde i-nou&yogh; : bi þe weye huy sei&yogh;e; Þou&yogh;ten huy, "swuch nobleye : we weren i-woned to lede In Iolifte and in pruyte i-nou&yogh; : and nouþe we beoth in wrech-hede, In Miseyse and in pouerte : and riche weren bi-fore! vs þinkez, sorie mouwe we beon MS. bieon : þat we euere weren ibore." Seint Iohan wuste al heore heorte : þei he ne heorde þare-of nou&yogh;ht: "&YOGH;e foles," he seide, "&yogh;wat is eou nouþe? : &yogh;wi chaunge &yogh;e eouwer þou&yogh;ht? Bowes and &yogh;eordene fechchiez me : and stones al-so!" Þis &yogh;ongue Men weren þare-a-boute a-non : þat þe dede were i-do. ¶ Seint Iohan tornede þis &yogh;eordene sone : in-to puyr gold and cler, And þe stones to &yogh;immes preciouse : þoru&yogh;h ore louerdes pouwer, And þis twei wilde Bachilers : he &yogh;af it euer-ech del; "Here-with," he seide, "&yogh;e mouwen : habbe wel manie guode Mel, And also muche lond eou bugge a-&yogh;ein : and more þane &yogh;e solden bi-fore; For &yogh;e habbuth, bote &yogh;e betere do : þe Ioye of heouene fur-lore." ¶ Þis &yogh;ongue Men nomen þis tresour : and wel glade þar-of were, And to manie goldsmiþes : wel wide-a-bouten it bere. Þis goldsmiþes sworen euer-ech-on : þat þis gold i-sei&yogh;en, Þat so clene gold ne so puyr : huy ne sei&yogh;en neuere with ei&yogh;en. ¶ Hou mi&yogh;te fairore miracle beo : oþur fairore poer, Þat al. þen bowes and &yogh;eordene tornede al. torne þare : in so puyr gold and cler?— ¶ Al-so al. As seint Iohan þe Ewangelist : ferrore wende þere, And þe twey men forth with him : þat so riche of golde were, This v. on the margin. A ded man toward burijngue : Men brou&yogh;hten ope one bere. Þe Moder criede opon sein Iohan : þat he him scholde arere, "Louerd," heo seide, "ich bidde þe : þat þou habbe reuþe of me And of mi sone þat is ded : ibrou&yogh;t here a-&yogh;ein þe; haue reuþe of him, ich bidde þe : for Iesues woundes fiue, Ase þou haddest of Drusiane : þo þou a-rerdest hire to liue!" ¶ Þo gan seint Iohan to weope sore : and bad a-stunte þe bere, And bad ore louerd for is grace : þat dede bodi a-rere. Þis &yogh;ongue man a-non with þis word : to liue a-ros þere. Þo was Ioye and blisse i-nou&yogh;h : a-mong alle þat þare were! ¶ "Ich hote þe nouþe," quath seint Iohan : "þat ded hast i-beo &yogh;are, Þat þou telle þis men sum-þing : of þat þou sei&yogh;e elles-&yogh;ware, And nameliche here to þis twei men : þat nouþe beoth for-lore, Þat beoth itornede to þe deuele a-&yogh;ein : to &yogh;wam huy serueden bi-fore." ¶ Þis &yogh;ongue Man þat was to liue a-rerd : bi-heold þeos oþure twei&yogh;e; "Allas," he seide, "þe wrechhede : þat ich i-seo al. isei bi eou bei&yogh;e! Þulke time þat &yogh;e for-soken : þis holie Mannes lore, Aungles þat eou wusten er : weopen for eou ful sore, And &yogh;uyt huy doth ase ich nou ri&yogh;ht i-sei&yogh;h : and þe deuelene in heore ende ¶ Mauden for eou Ioye i-nou&yogh;h : to &yogh;wam &yogh;e gonne wiende. Allas, wrechches, þe muchele pine : þat to eou is al-&yogh;are, Þat in helle ich sai&yogh;h to eouwer bi-hoffþe : to &yogh;wan &yogh;e schullen fare!" Þo þis twei Men i-heorden þis : huy bi-gonne to crie a-non, Deol and seoruwe huy mauden i-nou&yogh;h : and gradden opon seint Iohan. "Allas, &yogh;e foles &yogh;e f. overlined. ," quath seint Iohan : "&yogh;e nuteth &yogh;ware &yogh;e wollez beo. &YOGH;if god wolle habbe merci of eou : &yogh;e mouwen sone i-seo. To ech sunful man he is redi : þat to him wole i-wiende; Þare-fore criez &yogh;eorne on him : for-to he eou milce siende: And þe soþe &yogh;e mouwen sone under-&yogh;ite : &yogh;wane he hath eou milce i-sent, &YOGH;wane þis gold and þeos &yogh;immes : to heore kuynde beoth a-&yogh;en i|went." ¶ Huy crieden &yogh;eorne on ore louerd þo : and in penaunce huy were, In fastingue and in oresones : þritti dawes þere. Þo tur[n]de þat gold bi-fore heore ei&yogh;ene : into bowes of treo, And þe &yogh;ymmes into harde stones : ase huy hadden er i-beo. ¶ Þo þis &yogh;ongue men þis i-sei&yogh;en : glade huy weren i-nou&yogh;h! Þudere a-&yogh;ein ase huy fetten heom er : huy beren euer-ech bou&yogh;h, And for-soken al þe worldes pruyte : and duden ase þe wise, And endeden heore lif atþe laste : in ore louerdes seruise.— Perdrix. ¶ In a time ase þis holie man : wende in þe contreye, A &yogh;ong partrich he bar on his hond : and þare-with he gan pleye. A wylde louerdyng þare cam gon : a-&yogh;ein him bi þe weye, I-wepned swiþe baldeliche : he nadde of no man Ey&yogh;e. A-bysemare he bi-heold seint Iohan : þo he him sai&yogh;h bere on honde Þis &yogh;ongue foul and þare-with pleye— : þare-to he hadde onde. "Loke," he seide, "þis olde conIoun : in his olde liue, Þat men holdez swuch prophete : alle oþur men to schriue! wel bi-trufleth he þat folk. : here men mi&yogh;hten i-seo hou he plei&yogh;ez with þis &yogh;ongue brid : he ne mi&yogh;hte nou&yogh;t wys beo." ¶ "Leoue broþur," quath seint Iohan : "ich bidde tel þou me &YOGH;wat is þat þou berest on honde : and &yogh;ware-offe it seruez þe." "Ane bouwe ich bere," quath þis oþur : "and Arewen also þer-to, To scheoten wilde bestes with : and wilde foules also." ¶ "Biend þine bouwe," quath seint Ioan : "to loke &yogh;wat he can do!" Þis &yogh;ongue Man nam and bende is bouwe : and bar it longue so. Þare-aftur sone he nam is bouwe : and unbende it ase he couþe. "&YOGH;wy dost þou so?" quath sein Iohan : "&yogh;wat schal he vnbend nouþe?" "For he wole," quath þis oþur : "þe smartore dryue eft-sone And þe betere dunt &yogh;yue to euerech þing : þat ich habbe with to done; ¶ For, &yogh;if ich hire bere longue i-bend : þe feblore heo wolle al. wolde beo And euerech drau&yogh;ht þe worse driue— : þat may ech man MS. man may i-wite and seo." "Leoue broþur," quath seint Iohan : "al-so it farez, i-wis, Bi mannes heorte here on eorþe : þat feble and leoþi is. &YOGH;if he is toward Iesu MS. Iusu crist : i-bend faste euere-mo, Febli he schal and beo a-sad al. al sad : and is strencþe also al. al a-go; And &yogh;if he is oþur-&yogh;wile onbend : and itorned to solaz, he wole bieon eft-sone, &yogh;wane he is i-bend : stifore þane he er was, And in godes seruise þe bet driue & duyre : and þare-to beon stif and strong. Þare-fore mot ech holi man : solaci him a-mong And tuyrne is herte to some truyfle : &yogh;wane he may ani i-se, Þat he mouwe to godes seruise : þe stifore and þe strengore be. This v. on the margin. Þe Ern is foul of alle foules : þat hey&yogh;est may fleo, And &yogh;uyt he mot nede, to resten him : a-&yogh;ein to grounde teo; hou mi&yogh;hte he euere fleon on hei&yogh;h : bote he reste him atþe grounde? Nammore ne may mannes bodi : bote he reste him sum stounde. Þare-fore, bel amy, þou mi&yogh;ht : herebi þat soþe MS. þe soþe herebi þat soþe. ise, Þat for solaz man may þe betere : in godes seruise be."— ¶ Seint Iohan wende a-boute wide : and churche he liet a-rere, And maude preostes and bischopes : þat folk for-to lere. Ake Aristod[i]mus þe bischop : þat he tornede er to cristindom, In þe Cite of Ephese : swiþe holi man bi-cam, And ane churche of seint Iohan : in Ephese he arerde bliue— And seint Iohan sethþe in þulke churche : wende out of þis liue.— ¶ A day ase þis holie man : his seruise hadde i-do, A &yogh;oung man he say þare-bi-side : staleworþe and fair al-so; Ake a li&yogh;ht red he was, and of þunne wit. : seint Iohan bi-heold him faste, And opon a bischop þare-bi-side : his ei&yogh;ene a-non he caste: "Ich bi-take þe," he seide, "in warde to wite : þis man here lo, Þat þou him loke and norichi wel : þat he nou&yogh;t ne mis-do; So þat þou me ansuerie of is warde : &yogh;wane þou me comest eft to; witnesse ich take on ihesu crist : and on holie churche al-so." ¶ "Sire, wel fawe," þe bischop seide : þis &yogh;ongueman he tok wel softe. Seint Iohan him chargede of is warde : and muneguede him wel ofte Þat he him wuste swiþe wel : ase he answerie wolde; And bi-tei&yogh;hte heom boþe Ihesu crist : and wende &yogh;wodere he scholde. Þis bischop nam þis Ioliue man : and ladde hom to is inne, And norichcede him softe and wel : seint Iones loue to winne, And prechede him &yogh;eorne of Ihesu crist : to bi-nimen him his folie; So þat þis &yogh;oungue man to guode turnde : and merci gan to crie, And faire bar him and louede wel : god and seinte marie, And dude al þat þe bischop wolde : and guod al. hard lif gan dri&yogh;e. ¶ Atþe laste þis bischop : sumdel is heorte gan wiende— Ase ofte verlich bi-guynninge : flechchez atþen ende; he soffrede þis &yogh;onge man to pleye : ant to muche habbe is wille, And luyte and luyte don folie : and liet him al a-spille. Formest he gan haunti wakes : and for compaygnie he wax a syutor of tauernes : and siwede to glotonie; Þo ne mi&yogh;hte he nou&yogh;ht beon with-oute : and turnde to lecherie And bi-cam an holer strong : and tornede al-to folie. ¶ So longue, to holden up his folie : smale þingues he nam, Aftur þe smale he tok þe grete : and strong þef he bi-cam; So þat he hadde gret de-deyn : smale þefþes to do, For bote it were þe grettore þing : he ne tornede nou&yogh;ht þer-to. Atþe laste to þe al. a compaygnie of Outlawes : sone he gan gon; Vnder non oþur he nolde beon : ake hext maister a-non; Oþure þat erore maistres weren : bi-comen is men ech-on. he robbede ouer-al to grounde : and slow&yogh;h orig. slowen al-so mani on, More soruwe ne mi&yogh;hte beo : þane he dude in eche ende. For of[te] MS. of vuel chastingue : to folie wolie al. wole wiende. ¶ So þat seint Iohan in a time : to þat Bischop cam, Aftur &yogh;wam he bi-tok him er in warde : guode &yogh;eme a-boute he nam. "Sire bischop," he seide, "&yogh;eld me up : þat guode tresor, ich rede, Þat in warde ich þe bi-tok : and a-countes of is dede!" ¶ Þo was þe bischop sore a-drad : "sire, merci," he seide, "I-ne may him þe &yogh;elde nou&yogh;ht : for he is ded, ich dred[e]." "Alas," quath sein Iohan, "&yogh;weþur he beo? : in &yogh;wat manere is þis?" "Certes, sire," þe bischop seide, "a-&yogh;ein god ded he is, his soule is ded, þei is bodi : &yogh;uyt a-liue beo; For he is outlawe strong bicome : ase al þe contreye may seo. Opon an hei&yogh;h hul he wonez : with outlawes mani on, And lat a-quelle and robi also : alle þat he may of-gon." ¶ Þo bi-gan þis holi man : to sike and weope sore, For deol is cloþus he to-drou&yogh; : "louerd," he seide, "þin ore, Ane feble tresorer ich me ches : and þoru&yogh;h is feble lore Mi deorewuyrþe tresur ich habbe [i-lore]! : ine truste to him non|more. Alas, sire bischop, þi feble warde! : ine þonki þe nou&yogh;ht þarc-fore. &YOGH;wane it non oþur nis, ich mot seche : þat þou me hast i-lore. ¶ Lat greyþi me an hors a-non : and ane man in ane stounde, Þat he al. om. me mouwe þane wey teche : forto ich him habbe i-founde." Þis holie man, þat feble was : and ouer-come nei&yogh;h with elde, Opon a strong hors he Arnde forth : ouer mor and ouer felde. So þat, þare þe outlawes weren : he cam atþe laste; And some of þe schrewes weren al-&yogh;are : and nomen him wel faste, To robbi him and to sle : and heten him holde him stille. "Ov, beau freres," quath seint Ioan : "ich mot nede don ouwer wille; ¶ Ake ich bidde eou for eouwer cortesie : eouwer mayster latez [me] seo, And latez him-sulf with me do : &yogh;wat is wille beo." Wel i-Armed þe maister cam : prikie and ride faste; And a-no[n] so he on þis holie man : his ei&yogh;ene a-feor caste, And wuste wel þat he it was : him gan to schamie, so sore Þat he bi-gan to fleo a-non : and ne kepte i-seo him non-more. ¶ A-non so sein Ioan þis i-sei&yogh;h : he Arnde aftur a-non And siwede him al-so stifliche al. [h]asteliche, r. hastifliche : ase his hors mi&yogh;hte gon; he Arnde ase þei he a &yogh;ung man were. : "mi sone," he seide, "þi ore, &YOGH;wy fleustþou me? nam ich þi fader? : ne dred þe nou&yogh;t so sore! Spek here with þi feble fader : vn-Armed and in elde! Abid me nouþe, and ichulle for þe : ore louerd resun &yogh;elde. Ich am &yogh;are þene deth a-fongue : for þine strongue pine. A v. om.: As our louerd dude for us : & mi soule &yogh;iue for þine. Spek with me, bote þou more wolle : ich hote a-godes name!" Þe oþur a-stunte and vnneþe al. om. a-bod : he ne mi&yogh;hte no[n] oþur al. vnneþe he mi&yogh;te for schame; ¶ He a-li&yogh;hte and vn-armede him : and weopinde ful sore he ful to seint Iones fet : and cride him milce and ore, And bi-h i et him stifliche a-godes name : þat he nold [misdo] namore, Ake louien god and holi churche : and libbe al bi is lore. So þat he was euereft more : guod man and stable i-nou&yogh;, And bi seint Iones rede ladde is lif : and to alle guodnesse he drou&yogh;.— ¶ Seint [Iohan] leouede here so longue : and so mani his dawes were, Þat he ne mi&yogh;hte nou&yogh;ht ouer þe eorþe go : bote ase is desciples him bere; huy beren him, for feblesse and for elde : to churche with al. mid alle teone, And euere-more he prechede hem : þat loue heom were bi-tweone. Þo he was of an hondred &yogh;er : bote o &yogh;er wane vnneþe, And seuene and sixti &yogh;er it was : aftur ore louerdes deþe, ¶ Ore louerd with is desciples cam to him : fram heouene up an hei&yogh;h, "Cum forth," he seide, "mi frend, to me : þi time is comen nei&yogh;h; hit is nei&yogh;h time þat þou come : to mine riche feste with þine breþren in mine riche : for it al. þat (for om.) schal euere i-leste. For þou schalt nouþe a-sonenday : þat þene fifte day heonne is, Þe day of mine oprisingue : to me comen, i-wis." ¶ Þis holie man hiet his desciples : þat huy him to churche bere— Þat of him and in his name : Aristod[i]mus MS. Aristodinus liet a-rere. Þat folk cam sone þicke þudere : with deol and sor i-nou&yogh;h, For hit was couth swiþe sone : þat he toward is ende drou&yogh;h. ¶ Þene sonen-ny&yogh;ht wel tyme : his seruise he gan to do, And sethþe he gan þat folk to wisse : and to prechi al-so; Atþe furste cocke þat creu&yogh; : he gan to prechie faste, And for-to hei&yogh;h vnderne of þe daye : his prechingue i-laste. Þo hiet he is desciples þat huy ane put : four-huyrned him made, Faste bi-side þe hei&yogh;e weuede : with schouelene and with spade, And þat huy casten out at þe churche-dore : þe eorþe, &yogh;eorne he bad. With weop and with soruwe i-nou&yogh;h : þe put was þare i-mad. ¶ Þo þe put was al-&yogh;are i-maud : In alle heore ey&yogh;ene si&yogh;hte Þis holie man wel softeliche : þudere in gan a-li&yogh;hte; his hondene he huld up on hei&yogh;h : "swete louerd," he seide, "Ich am cominde to þine feste : ase þou me erore bede. ¶ Louerd, muche ich þonki þe : þat it þi wille is To þine gistningue cleopie [me] : for muche ich it wilni, i-wis. Þine sones ich bi-take [þe] to loke : &yogh;wane i-ne may no lengore heom wite, Þat holie churche, þine clene spouse : þoru&yogh; me þe hath bi-&yogh;ite. Vnder-fong me with mine breþren : þat þou brou&yogh;htest with þe Þo þou me bede to þine holie feste : and come aftur me." ¶ Þo cam þare a-boute þis holie man : so muche li&yogh;ht a-li&yogh;the, Þat no man ne mi&yogh;hte for cler leome : habbe of him no si&yogh;hte. Þis holie man him blessede : and wel softe a-doun he lay; "Mine breþren," he seide, "i-blessede &yogh;e beon : and habbez nouþe guod day!" ¶ Þis guode man wende out of þis world : al-clene with-oute ech pine, Ase he was clene in mayden-hod— : he cam to a swete fine. Þat clere li&yogh;ht þat a-boute him was : laste almest ane tyde; Þat folk ne sei&yogh;en nou&yogh;t of him— : faste huy weopen and cride. Þo þis li&yogh;th a-passed was : huy [lokede] in þe put to grounde: Þare-inne of þis holie Man : no-þing huy ne sei&yogh;en ne founde; Þare nas inne nou&yogh;ht bote smale greynes : þat heo mi&yogh;hten vnder-&yogh;ite— Þat is holi þing and is i-cleoped : Manna in holi write, Þat ore louerd wole al. wule, while in fourme of reyn : fram heouene to vrþe sende Þe children of Israhel to heore mete : þo huy of MS. to Egypte wenden. ¶ Þis Manna, þat holie greyn : &yogh;uyt to þis day dez springue Op of þat put, þat manie men : bringuez to botningue. Non oþur þing of seint Iohan : men ne mi&yogh;hten on eorþe finde; Al-clene, ich wene, in heouene he is : þare nis no leome bi-hinde. Of euerech haluwe men founden for-soþe : þat bodi bi-leue here, Bote of ore lauedy and of him : þat maydenes weren so clere. Fayr a þing is Maiden-hod : ase it is on heom i-sene! In þis Manere seint Iohan wende : of þis eorthþelich lif, ich wene.— ¶ Seint Edward þat was nouþe late : In enguelonde ore king, Þis holie seint Iohan þe Ewangelist : he louede þoru&yogh;h alle þing; Men ne scholde him no-þing bidde : for þe loue of seint Iohan Þat he mi&yogh;hte do with-oute blame : þat he ne grauntede a-non. A day þare cam a pouere man : with ful dreori mod And bad him for seint Iohanes loue : þat he &yogh;eue him sum guod. ¶ Seint Edward him bi-þou&yogh;hte : þo, he ne hadde þare no-þing For-to &yogh;yue þis pouere Man : bote ane guyldene ring. Þane ryng he louede wel i-nou&yogh; : and for þe loue of seint Iohan &YOGH;uy[t] he hine &yogh;af þe pouere manne. : and he wende him forth a-non. ¶ Þare-aftur sethþe seint Iohan cam : to a kny&yogh;ht of Enguelonde, Ase he was bi-&yogh;eonde se : Auntres for-to fonde; "Wiend," he seide, "&yogh;wane þou hom comest : to Edward, eower king, And sei&yogh;e þat he for &yogh;was loue : he &yogh;af þeosne ryng Sende him here his ryng a-&yogh;eyn : and þonki him also." Þo þis kny&yogh;ht cam to enguelonde : his erinde he gan do. ¶ Seint Edward i-kneu&yogh;h wel þane ring : and þare-bi onder-stod anon Þat þe pouere man þat he him &yogh;af : was þe guode seint Iohan. Harl. adds: Nouþe seint Iohan þe Ewangelist : &yogh;yf it þi wille is, Beode ore Erinde, þat we moten : come to heouene blis. AMEN. Þulke ring is &yogh;ut at westmynstre : for relik ido, As me scheweþ pelegrims : þat ofte comeþ þerto.

51.1: Alle halewene-day we holdez : one time in þe &yogh;ere; For manie enchesones holie churche : þare-to us gan lere. On is, for þe grete noumbre : þat of alle halewe is, Þat euerech ne mai nou&yogh;t at is feste : ane day habbe, i-wis. An oþur is, þat we beoth feble : þat we ne mouwen nou&yogh;ht alle Þe festene bi heom-sulf holde : ase huy in þe &yogh;ere doth falle. Þe þridde ancheson al. om. is, for þe &yogh;er is schort : ase ech ne may nou&yogh;th allone Þe al. Ane feste habbe in þe &yogh;ere : þare huy habbez i-mone. Þe feorþe enchesun is, i-wis : for guod ri&yogh;ht it is with-alle Þat we of heom maken feste : &yogh;wane þe time doth falle, For gret feste huy makiez in heouene : and in grete Ioye beoth &YOGH;wan huy any a-mendement : of us on vrþe i-seoth; For þe guod-spel seith of swich gret Ioye : þat a-mong heom in heouene is &YOGH;wane ani of us a-mendi wole : of þat we doth a-mis. vv. 13-14 al. om. ¶ þe fifte enchesun is, for þare was : a forbuysne þar-of bi-gonne Longue are þe strencþe of cristinedom : on vrþe were i-wonne: For þe hey&yogh;e maystres of saresins : þat on vrþe weren þo her MS. here Maden ech maumat bi heom-sulf : at rome on Auter; Ac natheles of eche ne mi&yogh;hte he nou&yogh;t : for here godes so fale were, And huy nolden nou&yogh;th þat ani god were : with-oute honour þere: Þare-fore huy maden on Auter : commuyn to ech-one, For-to honouri alle heore godes þare : ase it were al i-mone. And sethþe þo cristinedom cam : and swyþe wide spradde, At rome and eke elles-&yogh;ware : clanliche þe maystrie hadde, ¶ Bonefas, þe guode pope : to þe false Auteres cam And of þe Autere of alle godes : grete &yogh;eme he nam: In forebuysne þar-of : ane churche he liet a-rere Of ore lauedi and of alle haluwene : in þulke place þere— Ake six hundret &yogh;er and fiue : ore louerd [þer-]bi-fore of marie, is suete moder : on vrþe was i-bore. ¶ Þe churche þat of ore lauedi was : and of alle halewene þo bi-founde, Stant &yogh;eot at rome, and is i-cleped : "Marie la rounde." Þe pope al-so Bonefaz : ane day in þe &yogh;ere In þe honour of alle halewene : he liet halewi þere, And hiet al-so þoru&yogh;h al cristinedom : halewi þilke day; Ake þulke tyme he was i-holde : þe endlefte dai of may. Ake þe pope Gregori : þat þare-aftur longue cam, I-say&yogh; þat þe day to halewi was : ope al cristindom And þat ri&yogh;ht was þat ech man : þe hexte and leste, In þe honour of alle haluwene : made þane day feste; And in al. om. a skars tyme of þe &yogh;ere : ase we wyten, it was in May So gret feste forto holde : ase ful to þad r. þat day: Þare-fore he liet þane day tuyrne : ase we him holdez &yogh;uyte, In þe furste dai of nouembre : &yogh;wane ech guod nis nouh&yogh;t so luyte; ¶ "Me þinchez, &yogh;uyt," quath þe guode man : "þe feste feble were bote Men hadden &yogh;ware-with : þe wombe Ioye a-rere."— ¶ Þe furste &yogh;er þare-aftur-ward : þat men þane day þus nome, Of a fair cas ich may telle : þat bi-feol in þe churche of rome. Þe wardein of seint peteres church : þat &yogh;uyt in rome is, Þe feste honourede swyþe muche : of alle halewene, i-wis: on alle halewene-day in churche : to ech auter he gan gon And honourede ech aftur oþur : he ne liet nou&yogh;ht on. To þe hei&yogh;e auter of seint petre : ate laste he wende, And þare he lay a-doun an slep : ase god him grace sende. him þou&yogh;te, þare cam an Aungel : and ladde him to heouene on hei&yogh;h. In a chayere with gret Ioye : ore louerd, him þou&yogh;hte, he sei&yogh;h with grete hei&yogh;hnesse sitte : and Aungles him al-a-boute. ¶ Þo cam þare a fair leuedi : with Maydenes a gret route— Þat was ore lauedi with virgines— : and ore louerd faire heo grette; Ore louerd a-&yogh;ein hire a-ros : and bi him fayre hire sette. Þo cam þare a Man in o sclaueyn : ase hit of a Camayle were, And olde hore Men aftur him : and honoureden god þere— Þat was seint Iohan þe baptist : and þe profetes olde And also þe patriarkes : þat of ore louerd &yogh;wylene tolde. ¶ Þo comen þare twelue in one route : ase bischopes it weren ech-one, Þe furste ase he pope were MS. huy popes weren : bi-fore he &yogh;eode al one— Þat was seint petre : and his felawes endleuene; Alle huy honourede ore louerd : þare he sat in heouene. ¶ Þo comen þare ase hit kny&yogh;htes weren : redie for-to fi&yogh;hte, Al-blodie, for-to defendi ore louerd : and holie churche ri&yogh;hte— Þat weren Marty[r]s þat for god : and holie churche al-so &YOGH;euen heore lif ase godes kny&yogh;htes : and to deþe weren ido. ¶ Þo cam þare a gret compaygnie : preostes ase þei it were— Þat weren þe confessours : þat hadden holie churche to lere, Ase bischopes and Abbodes : and oþur guode men al-so. Ore louerd huy honoureden alle : ase heore ri&yogh;hte was to do; Of feste þat Men on vrþe maden : huy þonkeden him and bade For alle þat a-ri&yogh;ht heore day heolden : and feste of heom made. ¶ Þo gonne MS. goune huy singue heore Matines : swyþ[e] murie with-alle, For alle þat honouriez heore day here : ase he o in þe &yogh;ere doth falle.— wel ou&yogh;hte we þane day honouren : &yogh;wane huy þat ilke day Swuch Ioye for us in heouene maden : ase þe guode Man i-say. Nou bidde alle halewene : þat we heore feste holden so Þat huy us bringuen to þe hey&yogh;e Ioye : þare huy buth inne i-do.

52.1: Alle soulene-day on vrþe : ri&yogh;ht is to holde hei&yogh;e: For alle we schullen habben neode þar-to : for alle we schullen dei&yogh;e. A fair si&yogh;ht þare-of al-so : þe Aungel þo gan bringue Þene Manne of Rome ase he ladde him : ase he lay in metingue. him þou&yogh;te, he sai&yogh;h manie men : liggen in beddes of golde, And manie sitte at hey&yogh;e borde : and habbe al þat huy wolde; And manie gon nakede : and bidde þat sum man heom scholde bi|weue, And manie of-hongrede, and beden also : þat men sum guod heom eue. ¶ Þe Aungel him seide &yogh;wat it was : al þat he sai&yogh;h þere, And þat it was purgatorie : and þe Men soulene were; Þulke þat weren at so noble bord : and in þe riche beddes also, Þat weren men for &yogh;wam þare was : muche guod on vrþe ido, Þat bi-lefden freond bi-hynde heom : þat Massene leten singue And duden guod for godes loue : heore soulene out of pine to bringue. Þulke þat weren a-cale and of-hongred : þat no guod ne mi&yogh;hten finde, Þat weren þulke þat nadden on vrþe : none freond hem bi-hinde Ne for hem late al. To lete for hem masses singue : ne almes-dede for hem do; Þare-fore ase helplese men : in Misayse huy &yogh;eoden so. "Loke," quath þe Aungel, "þat þu telle : þe pope her-of sone, Þat men holden alle soulene-day : for it is wel to done; And also wide ase holie churche : þat he make is heste, Þene a-morewe aftur alle halewene-day : to holde þulke feste, Þat ech Man with guode wille : ase fer forth ase he may For alle þe soulene in purgatorie : bidde þat ilke day; So þat þe pouere þat nath no freond : þat for him bi name ou&yogh;ht do, Þo[ru&yogh;] MS. þo biddingue of ech cristine Man : i-holpe huy mowen beo so." ¶ Þe guode Man a-ros up a-non : þo he i-sai&yogh; al þis, And þonkede god of þe si&yogh;hte— : and so he wel au&yogh;hte, i-wis. Þe pope he tolde þat þo was : al þat he sai&yogh;h þere; So þat men holdeth þulke feste al. festen : herre þane heo er were.— Ore louerd bi-fond furst purgatorie : Men þuder in to wende Þat hor MS. for penaunce here on vrþe : ne brou&yogh;hten nou&yogh;t MS. non to ende, And þat Men for simple sunnes : of &yogh;wan i-schriue hy nere MS. were In þulke torment huy bi-lefden : for-to hy i-bette were; And Men al-so þat weren i-schriue : and heore schrift a-fengue also Of a fol preost, and nou&yogh;ht i-nou&yogh; : to þe sunne þat was i-do, Þulke schullen so to purgatorie : for-to huy habben to ende i-brou&yogh;ht penaunce a-cordinde to heore sunne : and aftur þe preostes nou&yogh;ht. al. 4 vv. more. &YOGH;if heo is more þane þe sunne : and a man it do, i-wis, Al it schal in heouene tuyrne : to echingue of his blis; &YOGH;if heo is euene to his sunne : þe sunne heo wole a-quenche, Ake nou&yogh;ht &yogh;if heo to luytel is. : þare-fore ech man him bi-þenche And to a fol preost ne triste nou&yogh;ht : þat to luyte penaunce him set; For soþe, here oþur elles-&yogh;ware : ech sunne worth i-bet. &YOGH;wat, hou is hit þanne of Ianekin : and of robinet þe wilde, Of annot and of Malekin : þat wollez habbe þene preost so milde, And huy seggez, "þilke preost is to hard : god schilde us fram is lothþ; go we to sire Gilbert þe preost : he nis neuere wrothþ, ¶ he wollez schriue us nessche i-nou&yogh; : and ore sunnes al for-&yogh;yue." bi god, &yogh;wane huy habbez al ido : hom huy gothþ vn-schriue; For heore penaunce schal beo so luyte : þat sire Gilbert and huy also Schullen gon a-deuelewey : bote god nime &yogh;eme heom to.— In purgatorie nis no confort : bote of one þingue : of þe hope of Ioye aftur-ward : þat ore louerd heom wole bringue.— &YOGH;wane Men in heore deth-beddes beoth : and heore penaunce heom is i-set, And huy ne mouwen nou&yogh;ht on eorþe beo : for-to heo beo ful bet, So repentaunt huy mouwen beo : þat ore louerd it wole for-&yogh;yue With-outen any purgatorie : &yogh;wan huy beoth wel i-schriue. Ake &yogh;if his penaunce him is i-&yogh;yue : &yogh;wane he mot heonne wende, Of þat he is i-schriue : and he ne may it bringue to ende, On of his nexte freond mi&yogh;hte : for him it swiþe wel do. Ake four þingus he moste habbe : þat scholde take on so : Furst þare moste gret loue beo : bi-twene &yogh;wam so it were— For with-oute loue and deol of heorte : swuch þing nou&yogh;ht al. no&yogh;t worþ nere; Ake &yogh;if huy weren al-so of one blode : þe betere it were, i-wis— Ake studefast heorte of guod loue : þe maistrie þar-of is. ¶ Þat oþur þing is þat he schal : þoru&yogh;h deþe heonne wiende And þat he ne may habbe no space here : his penaunce bringue to ende. Þe þridde þing is þat hit beo : þoru&yogh;h þe preostes rede, For no man ne may þare-with-oute : wel endi swuch dede. Þe feorþe þing is þat men him take : penaunce more þare-to Þane him þat þe sunne dude : &yogh;if he mi&yogh;hte penaunce do; For ho-so wole for oþeres sunne : swuch penaunce here lede, More penaunce man mot heom sette : þane him þat dude þe dede. ¶ Þare-fore &yogh;wane anie of ouwer freond : hath i-brou&yogh;ht is lif to fine, I-seoth here hou &yogh;e mouwen bringue him : out of his pine; to biete is sunne in þis manere : sikerliche &yogh;e mouwen eou beode. For godus loue þenchez þaron : &yogh;wane ouwer freond habbez neode!— In &yogh;wuch stude is nouþe purgatorie : manie wolden fayn i-wite. hit [nis] om. nou&yogh;ht a al. in o stude to alle men : ake in fif studes, it is i-write : ¶ On is in þe firmament : þare gret brenningue is Of fuyr þat hath þare is stude : and of þe sonne, i-wis. Þat oþur is in þe Ey r a-bouen us here : þare luþere gostes fleoth Þat tormentiez heom ny&yogh;ht and day : and neuere in reste ne beoth. Þe þridde is an vrþe a-mong us here. : þe feorþe in watere is. Þe fifte is onder vrþe deope : bi-side helle, i-wis — ¶ Seint patrik on vrþe &yogh;wilene : ane stude þar-of founde, Ase god wolde, bi-side þe hul : of seint brendan in his londe. al. Irlond For four þingus purgatorie : in þeos fif studen is : For sum Man scholde lasse torment : þane oþur habbe, i-wis; And þat men mi&yogh;hten þorou&yogh;h god dede : þe sonore to Ioye heom bringue; And þat men weren þoru&yogh;h hem i-war : bi a vision oþur metingue; And for men r. man þat delitiez muche in sunne : in one place, Þare he schal þe sunne biete : for-to ore louerd him &yogh;iue grace.— ¶ One tale and one faire en-saunple : þare-of we findez i-write, Þat al. for ore louerd schewez us swuch þing : for we scholden þe soþe i-wite. A preost was &yogh;wilene in one stude : þat dude him baþie i-lome In one stude priueliche : þare none men ne come. So þat þare cam ofte a man : ase hit were bi cas, And seruede him and wuchs him wel— : ake he nuste &yogh;wat he was. A day he made halibred : and þe manne hit bi-tok Ase for is mede for is swunch. : ake he it anon for-sok; ¶ "Sire," he seide, "ine may hit nou&yogh;ht : for it i-halewed is, And for i-nam nou&yogh;ht holi &yogh;uyt : i-ne may it nau&yogh;t, i-wis." "A-godes name," quath þe preost : "ich hote and halsnie þe Þat þou me segge &yogh;wat þou art : þat þus ofte comest to me." "Ich was &yogh;wylene of þis stude : louerd," þis oþur seide, "In þis place ich delitede muche : to don a mis-dede, And al mi delift al. delit of þulke sunne : so was in þis place; I-ne bette nou&yogh;ht þe sunne a-liue : for ich nadde nou&yogh;ht þe grace, And aftur mi deth þere-fore : mi purgatorie here is, to biete mi sunne in þulke place : þare ase ich dude amis. And &yogh;if þou woldest al. Ac woldestou for me massene singue : ich mi&yogh;hte habbe milce and ore; And þou mi&yogh;ht i-wyte þat ich am sauf : &yogh;wane þou ne finst me nonmore." Þe preost song for him Massene fiue : and oþur guodnesse dude also. Sone he miste þat selie gost : &yogh;uyt are þe seueny&yogh;ht weren i-do : For he wende to þe Ioye of heouene : þat he deore a-bou&yogh;hte. Þus Mani Man hath his purgatorie : þare he is sunne wrou&yogh;hte. So may parauentur dame Aldith : þat nath non oþur blis bote athom in hire halle clene : þere ase hire Moker is, Þat, þei heo bidde hire beden at churche : hire þou&yogh;ht is athom more; parauenture heo schal it bete þare : and a-bugge hire loue ful sore!— Men habbuz here heore purgatorie : manie for swuche þingue, And manie to warni some men : to helpe heom þarof to bringue. Mani man his purgatorie : in wature hath al-so : Þarof ichulle one ensaumple segge : of þat &yogh;wilene was ido.— ¶ Seint Tebaud þe bischop hadde : in his fot ane hote goute, Þat poudagre icleopeod is— : he hadde þere-offe gret doute. Ase his fischares wenden a-fischez : in heruest al-a-boute, In heor net huy nomen ane clompe of .Is MS. ys? . : huy weren þare-with wel proute : For þat ys þat was so cold : i-leid to heore louerdes fote hit MS. þat wolde aswagi þe hote goute : and bringue him sum bote. Þis bischop tebaut was wel glad. : þat ys huy leiden oft to is fot, and eche time : it made him liþe and softe. Þat ys was euere hol and sound : it ne malt for none hete. Seint tebaut þou&yogh;hte þare-of wonder : for no-þing he nolde it lete. A luyte cri him þou&yogh;hte a day : in þat ys he heorde þere. he coniourede hit a-godes name : to segge him &yogh;wat it were. "Ich am," quath þis oþur, "a seli gost : and in þis ys ich am her In mi purgatorie, forte ich beo : of mine sunnes scker. Ake &yogh;if þou woldest for godesloue : þritti masses singue For me, ich wot þat þu mi&yogh;htest : of þis pine me bringue." Þe bischop grauntede him wel sone : and bi-gan a-non a-morewe Þe Massene for þis selie gost : to bringuen it out of soruwe, And ech day song so aftur oþur. : þe deuel hadde þerto gret onde Þe &yogh;uyt þat gost scholde of pine come— : his wrench he gan fonde. For ase þe bischop þene tenþe day : bi-gan is masse to singue, Al þe toun þe feondes hadde : i-brou&yogh;t on a fi&yogh;htyngue. Þe guode man bi-lefde is masse a-non : and orn a-mong heom faste, And harmles þoru&yogh;h godes grace : a-passede al. paisede heom atþe laste. Ase he bi-gan a-morewe is masse : a gret cri þare cam al-a-boute Þat þe toun bi-seged was : with gret ferd al with-oute, And Men ornen into al þe toun : ase witlese for doute. Þe bischop lefde is masse a-non : and orn to-ward þe route; He made pays a-&yogh;ein þat fierd : þat huy no-þing ne reueden. Ake natheles so þeo tuey dawes : his masse he bi-leuede. ¶ Ase he bi-gan is masse þene þridde day : men heten out al-a-boute, For is court and muche of þe toun : a-fuyre was with-oute. "Þei it al fur-berne," quath þe bischop : "and ich mi-sulf also, I-nelle to-day fram þis weued : are þis masse beo i-do." So þat he song is masse forth : and muche folk was bisi with-oute to lauien watur and quienche þat fuyr : þat orn so wide a-boute. Þo þe Masse was i-do : þat fuyr a-queynte anon; Þare nas a-peired nou&yogh;ht an hous : ake hole stoden echon. MS. achon ¶ Þulke þreo dawes þe deouel hadde : al þulke wo i-do his masse forto lette : and pini þe soule so. Þe bischop fond þat .ys. athom : i-molten al to nou&yogh;hte : Þo wuste he þat þoru is Masse : to Ioye þe soule he brou&yogh;hte.— Manie þingus one soule helpez : þat in purgatorie is; Ake þreo þingues heom helpez mest : bi-fore alle oþere, i-wis : beden of Men, and almes-dede : singuingue of Masses al-so— Þeos þreo þingues beoth best, i-wis : and mest guod huy wollez do.— ¶ Þat biddingue of beden beoth guode : þe soþe &yogh;e mouwen i-wite bi a tale of a clerk : þat we findez i-write. A clerk hadd[e] &yogh;wilene ane wone : bi churche-hey&yogh;e &yogh;wane he come, to segge for alle cristine soulene : þe "deprofundis" i-lome. In a churche-&yogh;erd ones he cam late : þeoues him comen a-boute And a-saileden him to robbi : he nuste &yogh;wat do for doute. Þe bodies þat weren i-burede þare : his beden &yogh;olden a-non : huy comen with wepnen him forto helpe : and sturten forth echon, euer-ech with swuch-manere wepne : ase huy uyseden here a-liue, plou&yogh;-Man with his Aker-staf : Archer mid bouwe and knyue; A-boute þis þeoues huy comen ech-one : and guonne heom sone to-driue, And to heore puttes wenden sethþe a-&yogh;ein : þis clerk hamward wel bliue. Þus weren is beden i-&yogh;olde : þat he bad erore and ofte. Ich am siker, þe þeoues þe þ. on the margin. ne &yogh;eoden nou&yogh;ht : aweywardes ful softe : For ich wot wel þat non of us : ne hadde heom so sore a-gast! A wonder bataille it was on : hadde it longue i-last; Ich wene, þei ani chaumpiun : þare hadde i-beo, Sone he wolde habbe i-nome is red : hamward for-to fleo!— Almes-dede deth þe soule also : swiþe gret guod with-alle : Þat &yogh;e mouwen bi a cas i-seo : þat ane kny&yogh;hte dude bi-falle. ¶ A guod man &yogh;wyle, þat hei&yogh;te steuene : to is endingue drou&yogh;. A kny&yogh;ht, his freond, for is deth : made gret deol i-nou&yogh; And dude for him grete almes-dede : boþe ni&yogh;ht and day. Þarof he i-sai&yogh; a fair bi-tokningue : ase he a-slepe lay : him þou&yogh;hte he sai&yogh; a sluper brugge : swyþe fayr and hei&yogh;, A deop watur and swart bi-neoþe : a fair mede þare was nei&yogh; with swote smul and faire floures. : and ope þe brugge he sei&yogh; MS. gan gon with grete Misayse mani Men : þat fullen into þat watur a-non, And manie he sai&yogh; þare-oppe gon : al-sauf with-oute drede, And manie with Ioye and blisse i-nou&yogh; : pleyinde in þe Mede. Ope þe brugge him þou&yogh;hte he sai&yogh; : gon in wrechhede Steuene, for &yogh;wam þat he dude : þe grete almes-dede; Blake men þare weren bi-neoþe : þat a-doneward him drowe, And oþere þare weren in &yogh;wite cloþes : þat opward him heolden i-nowe; bi-twene heom laste þe noyse longue : a&yogh;ein oþur ech drou&yogh; faste, Ake euere hadden þe &yogh;wite Men : þe maistrie at þe laste. Þat weren þe almesdedes : þat for him weren i-do, Þat þe kny&yogh;ht for is soule dude : þat drowen him opward so. ¶ Þe blake þat him a-doneward drowen : þat weren is luþere dedes, Þat wolden him to pine drawe : &yogh;if huy mi&yogh;hten for almes-dede.— Massene also doth gret guod : boþe þe quike and dede : Þat &yogh;e mouwen i-heore bi þis tale : and bi oþure þat ich er sede. ¶ Men weren &yogh;wilene in a contreye : þare a gret ston-roche stod, And Men wenden þat þare-onder were : gret tresor MS. trosor and guod : So þat huy doluen þare-aftur : ake to wroþerhele ate laste : For opon hem ful þe roche adoun : and heom alle ouer-caste, And a-slou&yogh; heom alle, bote anne Man : þat, ase it were bi cas, In a-manere dich fel and lay : and þe roche a-boue him was; So þat he ne mi&yogh;hte of þe stude : ase i-putted he lay þere. his wyf nuste nou&yogh;ht of is lyf : ake wende þat he ded were : to churche heo wende euerech day : ane masse to leten singue, A lof and wyn and a candel of wex : to þe weued heo wolde bringue, And al for hire louerdes soule— : heo ne bi-lefde nou&yogh;ht a day. Þe deuel hadde þarto gret onde : þo he þat i-sai&yogh; : ¶ Ase þis wyf &yogh;eode a day toward churche : þe deuel cam hire to And seide þat heo &yogh;eode for nau&yogh;ht : for þe Masse was i-do. Þat guode wyf &yogh;eode hom a-&yogh;ein : and wende þat he soth sede. A-morewe he made hire al-so gon hom : mid þulke sulue dede; And þane þridde day al-so guod. : ake þat wyf þane feorþe day Sone a-ros and to churche &yogh;eode : þo heo þane day i-sai&yogh;h. &YOGH;uyt cam þe schrewe and seide : þat þe Masse was i-do. Þis wyf i-liefde him er fule wel : ake þo nolde heo nou&yogh;ht so, Ake wende to churche, and fond þe soþe : of þat þe schrewe hire mette, Þat it was to bi-trayen hire : and guodnesse to lette. ¶ Sone hit bi-feol þare-afturward : þat Men of þe toune wenden to bete op þulke roche : þat so lay þare a-doune, And wenden to finde sum tresor. : huy doluen and beoten faste. Þe selie Man bi-neoþe was of-drad : þat huy more opon him caste; "Deluez," he seide, "warliche : þat &yogh;e ne slen me nou&yogh;ht!" Þo weren þis Men sore a-dradde : and stoden in gret þou&yogh;ht; Ake naþeles huy doluen bi-side : so þat huy to him come. huy founden him ligge hol and sound : and with Ioye hine up nome. huy axeden him hou he hadde i-leoued : þat hongur him ne a-slou&yogh;. "Certes," he seide, "ich habbe i-haued : mete and drinke i-nou&yogh; : For a lof and a picher wyn : Mi wyf me sende ech day, And a brennind candle : þat me li&yogh;hte þe &yogh;wile ich here lay. bote þreo dawes þis oþur wike : no-þing heo me ne sende; Ich was nei&yogh;h for hongur ded.: ake heo gan sone a-mende And sende me ase heo dude er : and fedde me wel with-alle. Of alle wyues worþe hire best : and best hire mote bi-falle!" bi þis Miracle man may i-seo : and bi manie oþure al-so, Þat Massene and almes-dede : gret guod þe soule wollez do.— Þis guodnesses nellez nou&yogh;ht helpe : alle i-liche, i-wis; For of Men þat heonne wiendez : mani-manere þare is : Oþur ri&yogh;ht guode, oþur ri&yogh;ht vuele : oþur ri&yogh;ht om. ri&yogh;ht bi-tweone two. goddede helpez some ful luyte : þat man wole for heom do, &YOGH;if þat huy ri&yogh;ht guode beoz— : huy ne habbuth none neode mid-alle to none erþeliche guodnesse : þat heom mi&yogh;hte þare bi-falle; For in þe Ioye of heouene huy buth : ase huy weren bi-fore. Ake naþeles þat men for heom doth : ne worth nou&yogh;ht for-lore : For it schal him-sulf helpe muche : þat þulke guodnesse deth, And alle cristine soulene also : þat in purgatorie beoth. ¶ Þreo-manere men þare buth ri&yogh;ht guode : þat to heouene wiendez a-non &YOGH;wane huy out of þis worlde farez. : &yogh;ung child is þat on Þat deide aftur is cristinedom : are hit dude to quede; And Martyrs þat for godes loue : in strong torment weren dede; Þe þridde manere so but clene men : þat are þat huy heonnes wende, Alle heore sunnes betten here : ase ore louerd heom grace sende. Þis þreo-manere men ne mouwen nou&yogh;ht : in purgatorie bi-leue, Ake smitez þoru-out quiclokur : þane þe leyte doth an eue; huy ne mouwen nou&yogh;ht bi-leue þare : for er heo wenden heonne, Clene huy weren of alle sunne : and ne habbut noþing MS. noþint to brenne. For ase wode and col fedez : þat fuyr þat here is, Al-so sunne fet þat fuyr : in purgatorie, i-wis; And &yogh;wan þe sunne is i-brend a-wey : þe soule to heuene geth, Ake wel sone þoru&yogh; he flieth : þat in clannesse þolede deth. Also doth [þe] om.; H þulke þreo-manere Men : of &yogh;wan ich eou er seide : For heouene openez a&yogh;enes heom : so sone ase heo beoth dede.— And þat it beo soth of alle þreo : ensaumple &yogh;e mouwen i-seo. Þat a&yogh;ein children i-baptizede : heouene i-opened beo : For ore louerd was nyne-and-twenti &yogh;er : and twelf daywes old Are he i-baptized were : ase þe bok us hath i-told : Of al þat tyme non eorþelich Man : ne mi&yogh;hte enes i-wite Þat heouene openede ou&yogh;were aboue : þat we findez i-write; bote þo he was i-baptized : of þe holie Man seint Iohan, A-boue his heued with gret li&yogh;ht : heouene openede a-non. &YOGH;wat bi-tocknede þulke openingue : þat þo was and er nou&yogh;ht, bote þat þoru overlined. cristindom : Man was to heouene i-brou&yogh;t, And þat heouene-dore was faste i-mad : for-to cristindom were, And þat a-&yogh;ein þe furste cristindom : heouene openede þere; And þat heouene-dore i-opened is : to cristine Men al-so, And to &yogh;ongue children forto huy habben : þoru&yogh; sunne it fur-do? For huy schullen, &yogh;wane huy heonnes wiendez : heouene-dore opene finde, For huy ne berez with heom no sunne : þat drawe heom bi-hinde; Also quicliche ase li&yogh;httingue : þoru purgatorie huy doz gon, And heouene-dore findez opene : and wiendez in anon. gret folie it is to weope : ase Men beoz i-wonet to done, For &yogh;ongue children þat dei&yogh;ez so : þat in heouene buth so sone! "Awei, mi child," seith þe damme : and suou&yogh;nez a-&yogh;ein þe wowe; bi crist, heo au&yogh;te þonki god : þat nam hit ase his owe!— ¶ A-&yogh;ein þe Martyrs þat guode buth : heouene i-opened is : Þat Man may bi þe Martyrdom iseo : of seint steuene, i-wis. For þo men him to deþe þreowen : he bi-heold to heouene an hei&yogh;h : An heouene openede a-non : ase he þare i-sei&yogh;h— "Lo," he seide, "nouþe ich i-seo : þoru&yogh; ihesu cristes sonde heouene opene, and godes sone : in is fader ri&yogh;th hond stonde." And þe furste martyr he was : þat euere on vrþe cam Aftur godes passion : to holde up cristindom : heouene openede a&yogh;en him : ase he þene deth nam, to bi-tokni þat he wolde al-so : a&yogh;en ech þat þolede guod Martyrdom. And þei he were sum-del in sunne : heore deth þat huy nome And heore blod heom wolde wasche : are huy to purgatorie come.— Þulke also of clene liue : þat in clennesse here lif endiez, heouene openez a-&yogh;ein heom : &yogh;wane huy heonne wiendez : Þat Man may i-seo bi ensaumple : of seint Iohan þe wangelist. Clannore þane he was, no man nas : with-oute Iesu crist. he seith in þe Apocalips— : þat a wel guod bok is, Þat he i-sei&yogh;h heouene-dore : a-&yogh;en him opene, i-wis. &YOGH;wat bi-toknede þat bote þis : huy scholden i-seo also A-&yogh;ein heom, alle þat clene weren : heouene-dore vndo?— Erþelich guodnesse helpez luyte : swyche Men, i-wisse, For huy nabbuth þare-to non neode : &yogh;wane huy beoth in heuene|blisse. Ake þanne it helpez him-sulf muche : þat deth þulke goddede, And alle þat beoth in purgatorie : ase ich erore sede. ho-so is al-so in helle pine : it hellpez him luytel al-so Any guod-nesse þat Man may : on vrþe for him do; ¶ For seint Austyn seith, &yogh;if he wuste : þat is fader in helle were, Non more he nolde for him bidde : þane for ane deuel þere. Ake euere it helpez him þat it dothþ : and cristine soulene al-so; For no guodnesse ne worth fur-lore : þat Man may on vrþe do. — Ake beden oþer oþure al. om. almes-dedes luyte helpuz : of fremde oþur of kunne, bote he with-oute wrathþe beo : and with-oute dedlich sunne. Ake a masse nis noþe-worse : for r. of &yogh;wam þat heo is i-do, Þei it beo of a sunful preost— : of non oþur þing it nis so. For þat dede is so hei&yogh;h : þat heo ne may a-peyri nou&yogh;ht Of al. For no wrechche preost þat it dez : þei he beo in sunne i-brou&yogh;ht. Ake þei þe Masse ne beo þe worse : þe preost, bi mi swere, Þat hire singuth in dedlich sunne : a-corie it schal ful deore! For &yogh;wane sire Gileberd i-massed hath : his lif he wole so di&yogh;hte Atþe tauerne to beon a-day : and bi is quene bi ny&yogh;hte; he seith, &yogh;wane Men cleopiez him preost : "sittez stille, mine guode i-fere, Þe preost hanguez at churche : and ich am nouþe here"— ¶ his cope oþur is surplis : þe preost he seith it isse; Ake his cope schal bi-leue at hom : &yogh;wane he schal to helle, i-wisse!— ho-so wole &yogh;wane he is ded al. þat a ded man, : to of his guodnesse a-fongue, do it bi-time for þe dede : þare-aftur þinkez longue. And þat it beo soth, man may i-s[e]o MS. so : bi a wonder cas Þat &yogh;wylene bi a kny&yogh;ht bi-feol : þat with þe hei&yogh;e kyng charles was. ¶ Þe kyng Charles his Ost aday : to strongue batayle gan lede. his .O. kny&yogh;ht þat with him wende : of þe deþe gan him drede. A cosyn he hadde in þe route : to him he þou&yogh;hte he mi&yogh;hte best truste r. truste to of alle Men : and so he au&yogh;hte with ri&yogh;hte; "Cosyn," he seide, "&yogh;if ich am : here to deþe i-brou&yogh;ht, Sul Mi stede and do r. do guod? for mi soule : ne bi-lef þou it nou&yogh;ht!" Þis kni&yogh;ht truste wel to is word : þat grauntede don is bone; And in-to þe batayle wende forth : ase ri&yogh;ht was for-to done, And fau&yogh;ht þe &yogh;wyle he mi&yogh;hte : and a-slawe was at þen ende. his cosin nam his stede sone : and hamward he gan wiende, And to is owene bi-hofþe faste ire heold : and þou&yogh;hte forto done Also muche guod for þe kny&yogh;htes soule : &yogh;wane he mi&yogh;hte eft-sone. ¶ Þe kny&yogh;ht cam to him eft-sone : gostliche in priuete, "Cosyn," he seide, "late þou dudest : þat þou bi-hei&yogh;htest me! Þou madest me beon in purgatorie : seue ny&yogh;ht, mid-i-wisse. And nouþe ich am in heouene : and þarof þou schalt misse, For þou schalt in þis ilke day : to þe pine of helle wende, For þe treson þat þou me dudest : and beon þare with-outen ende." Þis gost wende forth a-non : and þe false Man wel sone deide, and wende a-deuele wey : ase he of-seruede to done. here mouwen þis false esecutores : beon MS. bieon i-warre bi þis tale, Þat muche habbez of dedes godes : and deleth þare-of ful smale, Ake þenchez, &yogh;wane huy riche beoth : to &yogh;elden it wel, i-wis; Þe soule longueth þare-aftur-ward al. þerafter sore : þat in purgatorie is, heo a-bidez longue heore richesse : þe guode is euere bi-hinde— huy schullen gon a-deouele wey : and þare heore miede finde. Nou Ihesus, þat us deore bou&yogh;hte : þei we don ofte a-mis, On alle cristine soulene haue merci : and bring us to heuene blis, And led us to oure ri&yogh;hte heritage : for þou bou&yogh;htest us þar-to; Ne leos nou&yogh;ht þat þou deore bou&yogh;htest : þei we sumdel mis-do!

53.1: SEint Eadmund þe confessour : þat lythþ at pounteneye, Of guode men and trewe he cam : þei huy neren nou&yogh;ht ful hei&yogh;e; In Engelonde he was i-bore : in þe toun of Abindone. Glad mi&yogh;htte þe moder beo : þat bar swuch a sone! Mabile þe riche is moder [het] : þat guod womman was i-nou&yogh;, For boþe wif and MS. and and wydewe : to holie lif heo drou&yogh;. Lustniez nouþe and i may telle : hou and in &yogh;wat manere Seint Eadmund was i-bore : &yogh;if &yogh;e it wollez i-here. vv. 7-8 al. om. A-seint Eadmundus dai þe king : þis guode child was i-bore; So clene he cam fram is moder : with-oute ech-manere hore, And so clene, al. drie þat no cloth : þat nei&yogh;h þe moder was Ne nei&yogh;h þis &yogh;oungue child, þo it was þo—was al. om. i-bore : no-þing þe foulere al. isoilled it nas. ¶ A-seint Eadmundes dai he was i-bore : ri&yogh;ht ase it was day; Fram erne morewe þat al. forte it was eue : ase a ded þing he lay&yogh;, Ri&yogh;ht ase he were ded-bore : for no þing on him lif ne sai&yogh;; Þe mide-wyues him wolden habbe i-bured : ac þe moder seide euere nay. A-&yogh;ein eue he cudde furst is lif. : to churche he was i-bore, And for seint Eadmundes day : he [was] Eadmund i-cleoped þare-fore. ¶ Þis child wax and wel i-þev— : elles wonder it were. Þo it was of ani elde : þe moder it sette to lere, And Robert al-so, hire oþur sone— : for sones heo hadde to, And tweye maydenes clene i-nou&yogh; : hire dou&yogh;htren were al-so, Dame Margerie and dame Alis : þat at catesbi weren i-do And þare in religion Nonnes huy weren : and &yogh;uyt liggez þare boþe-to. ¶ Dame Mabile, heore guode moder : þeos children heo louede i-nou&yogh;h, And wissede heom to clene liue : and to alle guodnesse heom drou&yogh;h. Þe &yogh;wyle þe children &yogh;ongue weren : heo &yogh;af heom ofte mede For-to faste þane friday : to watur and to brede. Þoru&yogh; mede and þoru&yogh; ire faire bi-heste : huy weren so þar-on i-brou&yogh;t, Þat, þo huy weren of grettore elde : it ne grefde heom ri&yogh;ht nou&yogh;ht. ¶ Þe moder werede þe strongue here : for ore louerdes loue, Fram þe scholdre to þe hele : and on haubark þare-a-boue— In swuche manere he ladde hire lif : þe widewe þat was so wis. wel &yogh;ongue heo sende boþe hire sones : to scole to paris, And bi-tok heom spense luyte i-nou&yogh; : ase heo it mi&yogh;hte bi-seo. huy senden hire word al. seide a&yogh;e þat huy ne mi&yogh;hten : with so luyte beo. "leoue sones," quath þe mode[r] : "ichulle beon a-&yogh;ein eov hende; &YOGH;if &yogh;e wollez aftur me do : ich can eou more sende, And it schal eov like swiþe wel : bi þat &yogh;e wyteth þe ende; Ne spariez nou&yogh;ht, mi leoue sones al. &yogh;if &yogh;e dorre mid so lute : out of londe to wende." ¶ "Leoue Moder," queþen þe sones : "we schullen do aftur þi lore; Ake wel þou wost þat we ne mouwen nou&yogh;t libbe : bote þou us sende more." ¶ Þe moder tok wel stilleliche : eyþur of heom ane here And bad heom boþe for hire loue : þat huy with heom as bere And werie as twie oþur þrie : eche woke þere, And heo wolde heom sende spense i-nov : þe &yogh;wuyle huy at scole were. ¶ Þis children &yogh;eoden to scole þo : and duden heore moder heste And wereden þe here twie a wike : oþur þrie at þe leste. So longe huy woneden heom þar-to : þat huy nomen as ofture þo, So þat noþur ny&yogh;ht ne day : huy nolden heom for-go; ¶ huy woneden heom so wel þar-to : þat huy as wereden day and ny&yogh;ht. Þis was, for-soþe, a guod Moder : for al. þat (heo om.) heo tei&yogh;hte hire children a-ri&yogh;ht! And euere &yogh;wane heo sende heom cloþes : ase heo as mi&yogh;hte i-winne, Þare-with heo wolde herene sende : faste i-seuwede with-inne.— ¶ Seint Eadmund þe &yogh;ongue clerk : to eche guod-nesse drou&yogh;, Þat euerech clerk þat him i-knev&yogh; : hadde of him Ioye inov&yogh;; For ore louerdes swete grace : with him was wel riue : And þat ore louerd cudde him wel : al bi is &yogh;ongue liue. ¶ For ase þis child &yogh;eode a day : in a Mede to pleie, his felawes he bi-lefde ech-on : and &yogh;eode bi-side þe wei&yogh;e, And al one &yogh;eode up and doun : and is bedes seide. Þo cam þere gon a fair &yogh;wit child : to him in þis mede, "Felawe," he seide, "heil þou beo : þat þus one gest i-lome!" Seint Eadmund stod in gret þou&yogh;ht : fro &yogh;wannes þis child come. ¶ "Ne knoustþou me nou&yogh;ht?" quath þis child. : seint Eadmund seide "no." "Ich am þi felawe," quath þat child : "&yogh;wodere þou euere go. At scole ich sitte euere bi þe : euere on þi ri&yogh;ht side, And with þe ich go in euerech stude : ne go þou no so wide, ¶ And þi plei-fere, for-soþe, ich am— : and &yogh;if þou nost nou&yogh;t &yogh;wat ich beo, ¶ In mi fore-heued i-write : mi name þou mi&yogh;ht i-seo. Ashm. has 4 vv. more. And al-so ase mi name is : in mi fore-heued i-do, Creoyce þare-with þi fore-heued : and þi breoste al-so Euereche ni&yogh;hte are þou slepe : in þe muynde of me, This v. on the margin. ¶ And þe deuel ne schal habbe no pouwer : for-to greui þe." ¶ Seint eadmund nuste mit þusse worde : &yogh;ware þis child bi-cam. he onder-stod þat it was ore louerd : and gret Ioye to him he nam; And nolde fur-&yogh;ite neuere ane ni&yogh;ht : his lore forto do, to creoici þri&yogh;es is fore-heued : and is breoste al-so ¶ And segge "ihesus of Nazareth" : ase he it sai&yogh; i-write— with no-þing ne scholde a man betere : fram al. wiþ þe deuel him wite.— In penaunce, and in is lore : þis child dude al is þou&yogh;t; For godes loue he þolede muche : þat deore him hadde a-bou&yogh;ht, ¶ In penaunce he was so wel i-woned : and &yogh;ong þar-on i-brou&yogh;ht, Þat, þo he was of grettore elde : it ne grefde him ri&yogh;ht nou&yogh;ht. At parys he was at scole longue : and at Oxenford al-so. he ne dude neuere lecherie : ne ensentede þar-to; Ase is schrift-fader wolde telle : ofte in priueite, he ne mi&yogh;hte neuere finde man : of so gret chastete. ¶ Priueliche at oxenford : on a day he cam To one ymage of ore lauedi : and bi þe hond hire nam And bi-hiet al. forhet bi-fore hire treweliche : fram al. om. eche wummanes imone And with treuþe holden al is lif : clanliche to hire one. ¶ Þulke ymage he weddede with a ring : ase a man dotþ is wif, Clanliche to holden in spoushod : to hire al is lijf; "Aue Maria, gracia plena" : þeos four wordes weren i-do And i-graued in þis ring : for huy a-cordeden wel þar-to. ¶ Wel he huld is treuþe setþe : and his weddingue al-so, And trewe spouse was i-nov&yogh; : nolde he nou&yogh;t misdo. Ich wot wel, &yogh;uyt men mi&yogh;hten finde : ho-so sou&yogh;te bliue, Summan, þei it sielde beo : untreowore to is wiue, And al ful beo of þe Mariage : &yogh;e and fayn it wolde un-binde! &YOGH;weþur ani of eou couþe ou&yogh;were : ani swuch hosebonde finde?— ¶ His hostasse hadde one dou&yogh;ter : þere he was at inne, Þat louede muche þis holie child : &yogh;if heo mi&yogh;hte is loue i-winne; heo ne couþe nei&yogh;h non oþur wit : ake al. om. heo fondede for-to do Folie bi him ny&yogh;ht and dai : &yogh;if heo mi&yogh;hte bringue him þar-to. ¶ Heo bad him þat heo moste a-ni&yogh;ht : to is bedde wiende. Þis holie clerk ne wernde hire nou&yogh;ht : and dude ase þe hende. Þat Maide was þo glad i-nov&yogh; : for erore heo bad wel of[te]. A-ni&yogh;ht, þo heo hire tyme i-sai&yogh;h : to is bed heo cam wel softe, ¶ hire cloþes heo dude of a non : ase it is ri&yogh;ht of bedde, And made hire naked, to creopen in. : ake febleliche hire spedde : For seint Eadmund hadde ane smarte &yogh;eorde : and þe cloþus a-doun spradde al. þis womman anon he redde And beot hire on þe nakede rug : þat wel-nei&yogh;h heo a-wedde; he ne sparede rug ne side noþur : are heo to grounde bledde— A-quenche he mi&yogh;hte hire fole wille : mid blode þat heo schedde! ¶ And euere seide þis holie Man : ase he leide on faste, "Maide, þou schalt leorni þus : a-wei forto caste Þi fole wille of þi flesch : with swuche discipline." heo þou&yogh;hte wel luyte on folie : are þis guode clerk wolde fine! ¶ Þis Maide wende softe a&yogh;en : hire rug smert ful sore. he heo. bi-&yogh;at so luyte þo : þat hire ne longuede þudere nam-more; Clene wumman heo bi-cam : with-oute flechsliche dede, And clene Maide deide setþe : ase hire schriftfader seide. ¶ Þis Maidenes þat beotþ willeffole : folie forto do, I-cholde huy founden swuche lefmanes : þat wolden heom chastie so!— Þo Mabile, is swete moder : scholde of þis liue go, Seint Eadmund, hire guode sone : nei&yogh;h hire was þo; his Moder him &yogh;af hire blessingue : þo heo scholde of liue fare. "Blesse al. Blesse ek mine broþur," quath seint Eadmund : "þei he beo elles|&yogh;ware." ¶ "Leoue sone," quath þis wydewe : "boþe &yogh;e comen of me, And he is, &yogh;wane &yogh;e beoth o blod : i-blessed i-nou&yogh; with þe. þe added later. Ake ich bidde þe for godes loue : and for seinte Marie Þat þou sum-&yogh;ware þine sostrene do : in-to ane nonnerie, So þat huy mouwen clene lif lede : in ore louerdes seruise; And ne soffre þou nou&yogh;ht þat huy beon : i-weddet in none wise. Þe catel þat ich heom bi-queþe : þis dede for-to do, Al ich bi-take in þine warde : and heom þare-with also." ¶ Þis guode womman deide þus : þat of wydewene was flour; And in a chapel al. seint Nicholas churche at Abindone heo was i-bured : with swyþe gret honour, In a ston bi-fore þe croiz : in þe soutþ-side, i-wis; A luyte with-inne þe churche-hei &yogh;ate al. wiþoute þe abbay-&yogh;ate : þat chapel a-rerd is. A-boue hire is i-write : "here lijthþ in þis ston Mabile, flour of wudewene"— : and lesingue nis it non, For heo was womman of guode liue : ase Men mi&yogh;hten bi hire i-seo; And mani Miracle at Abindone : for hire hath sethþe i-beo. ¶ Ne for-&yogh;at nou&yogh;ht seint Eadmund : þat is moder him hadde i-bede : Þo is power was i-woxe : he purueide him ane stude, Þat is sostren weren i-do : in one Nonnerie; Ake wel vnneþe he it fond : with-oute symonie.— ¶ Simonie so is i-cleoped : foreward for-to make to bugge liflode of holie churche : and a certein catel take. A-mansede beotþ alle swuche : þat so wollez don; Ake naþeles to religion : manie comiez so!— ¶ Þis guode sone sou&yogh;hte wide a-boute : mani a Nonnerie, Are he mi&yogh;hte his sostren do : with-oute symonie; Atþe laste he cam to Catesbi : in Norehamptone-schire, I-graunted him was þare a-non : al þat he wolde desire : ¶ boþe his sustren a-godes half : Nounnes he made þere; Þat leueden þare al heore lijf : and holie wommen were, Þe eldore was sethþe prioresse : of þe lauedies ech-on— For heom hauez setþe ore louerd i-do : miracles mani on; And bi-fore þe hei&yogh;e weuede : i-burede huy beoth þere In a chapele þat huy leten : of seint Eadmund a-rere.— ¶ Seint Eadmund, þis holie man : werede strongue here; In strengore manere heo was i-maud : þane oþur mannes were : heo nas i-sponne ne i-weoue : ake i-broide strengus longue, And sethþe ase man knut a net : i-knut swiþe harde and stronge, Of harde horses here i-maud— : þe knottes deope wode, Þat muche del of is bodie orn : of quiture and of blode. ¶ Þare-of he hadde schuirte and briech : fram necke to þe hiele; vn-ayseliche he mi&yogh;hte ligge : oþur ani al. & lutel ayse i-fele. A strong rop þere was þanne : a-boue fram þe scholdre i-do to is bottokes, of horse-here : to holden it faste to; And setþe he was bi-neoþe is briech : i-gurd faste i-nov&yogh; with a strong corde a-boue : þat þe here faste al. þe here: þat faste to d. drou&yogh;. ¶ So faste was in euerech side : þe here to him i-bounde, Þat vnneþ[e] he mi&yogh;hte bie&yogh;e is rug : oþur stoupi touward þe grounde; And &yogh;wan he stoupede ani-þing : is flechs was so for-gnawe Þat wonder was hou he it þolede : þat he ne hadde to deþe i-drawe. al. to beo so to-drawe ¶ Fiet and hondene þat neren nou&yogh;t : i-tormentede with þat here Necke and face and al is heued : þat with-oute were, he roddede a-ni&yogh;ht with þe here : &yogh;wane no man ne mi&yogh;hte i r. it seo; For he nolde þat no lime : un-pined scholde beo. ¶ A dai he tok al priueliche : is Manne his olde here, Þat he as fur-brende stilleliche : for huy for-olde were. he caste as in gret fuyr i-nov&yogh;— : ac it ne cam nou&yogh;ht þare-nei&yogh;h, Ake euere huy weren i-liche sounde : ase þis man i-sei&yogh;h. Þo he i-sai&yogh; þat huy ne brende nou&yogh;ht : he bond þer-to wel faste heuie stones to drawe a-doun : and in-to a deop watur heom caste. Þat fuyr nadde power non : to touchi þe holie here! Ake naþeles he tolde is louerd fore : þat huy i-brende were.— ¶ Seint Eadmund and is felawe : ase it was ofte heore wone, In a day fram leukenore : wenden to Abindone. Ase huy comen in a gret ualei&yogh;e : blake foule huy sei&yogh;e Ase it crowene and rokes al. chowen weren : fleon bi þe Eyr wel hei&yogh;e; A luyte blac sak ase þei it were : þis foules a-mong heom bere, huy casten it up fram on to oþur : ase huy it al-to-drowe and to-tere. his felawe stod and bi-h e old : and was nei&yogh;h wod for fere. ¶ Seint Eadmund him &yogh;af confort : ant tolde him &yogh;wat it were : "Deuelene," he seide, "of helle it beoth : and þat huy berez so, i-wis, Ane Mannes soule here-bi-fore : of Chalgraue it is, Þat nouþe ri&yogh;ht deide late— : heo ne cometh neuere in blis, he mai singue weylawei : þat he euere dude amis." ¶ Forth huy wenden to chalgraue : þe soþe huy founden þere : Þe Man was al. om. ded a luyte bi-fore : and al hot ligge on bere. Neuere þe gladdore ne mi&yogh;hte he beo : þat deuelene him so to-tere; he mi&yogh;hte segge weilawey : þat euere is lifdawes were!— ¶ Seint Eadmund, þe holie Man : louede wel is lore, And for is lore he louede &yogh;uyt : godes seruise þe on the margin. more. Mest he louede on oresoun : þat was of ihesu crist And of ore leuedi, is swete Moder : and of sein Ioan þe Ewangelist, Þat ".O. intemerata" : bi-gvynnez on latyn; Þe bi-guynningue is wel guod : and al-so is þe fin. Euereche dai bi custome : he seide þis oresun, he nolde bi-leue for no scole : ne for no lessoun. ¶ In a dai he it fur-&yogh;at : he hadde so muche to done. Seint Ioan þe Ewangelist to him cam : þe ni&yogh;ht aftur-ward ful sone And a paumerie bar on is hond : gret and strong i-nou&yogh;h; Seint Eadmund he nam bi þe hond : and is paumerie op drou&yogh;h, So hei&yogh;e and with so gret Eyr : ase he him wolde al-to-driue. Seint Eadmund lay and quakede : and drad was of is liue, For, &yogh;if he him smite ase he dunt drou&yogh; : he were ded a-non; [Here a fol. is wanting in the Laud MS.; MS. Harl. continues:] [he quakede & cride dulfulliche : "louerd, merci, seint Iohn!" ¶"Ich wole for-&yogh;eue þe," quaþ seint Ioh a n : "þu criest so sore; & þench bet on oure oreisoun : & nefor&yogh;et hit nomore!" he nefor-&yogh;at after þulke tyme : nomore þis oreisoun, For no studie nefor no neode : nefor þo&yogh;t of lessoun.— ¶ So wel lurnede þis holi man : & suche grace hadde, Þat he bigan at Oxenford : & of art þer radde. Of art he radde six &yogh;er : contynuelliche ynou&yogh;, & siþþe for-[to] beo more profound : to arsmetrike he drou&yogh;, & arsmetrike radde in cours : in Oxenford wel faste & his figurs drou&yogh; aldai : & his numbre caste.— ¶ Arsmetrike is alore : þat of figurs al is & of drau&yogh;tes as me draweþ in poudre : & of MS. in numbre, i-wis.— ¶ A ni&yogh;t in avisioun : his moder to him wende, "Sone," heo seide, "to what figurs : woltou nou entende?" "Leoue moder," quaþ þis oþer : "suche as we iseoþ." "Leoue sone," quaþ þe moder : "betere figurs þer beoþ, wherto þu most þin hurte do : & þenche her-on nomore!" heo nom forþ his ri&yogh;t hond : & wrot þer-on his lore : Þreo rounde cerclen heo wrot : in þe paume amidde, In þe tueye heo wrot fader & sone : & holigost in þe þridde; "Sone," heo seide, "her-afterward : entende to þis lore!" To heuene a&yogh;e þe moder wende : henese&yogh; hire nomore. Theologia. ¶ Þo ise&yogh; seint Edmund : þat hit was al of þe Trinite, & þat god wolde þat he schulde : ihure diuinite. To diuinite, as god wolde : þis gode man him drou&yogh;; Þer nespedde non in Oxenford : so wel of ynou&yogh;. hit nas no&yogh;t longe þer-afterward : þat þe Chanceler ne sede, & þe hexte maystres of þe toun : þat he schulde bigynne & rede. he wiþsede & longe al. longe & seide : þat he nas no&yogh;t worþi þerto; So þat moche a&yogh;en his wille : nede hi makede him hit do. So þat he bigan at Oxenford : of diuinite. So noble alosed þer nas non : in al þe vniuersite. Of redinge he hadde so gode grace : þat meni on to him drou&yogh;; his scolers þat ihurde of him : gode men were ynou&yogh;. So pitousliche he wolde rede : & so gode grace hadde þer-to, Þat his scolers þat ihurde of him : nuste ofte what to do, Ac sete as in anoþer wordle : & ofte hudde here e&yogh;e & wepe þat þe teres vrne adoun : þat men hit al-aboute ise&yogh;e. vneþe eni ihurde of him : þat þe betere ne bicom, & meni bileuede al þe wordle : & to religioun nom.— ¶ A dai as þis holi man : in diuinite Desputede, as hit was his wone : of þe trinite, In his chaire he sat longe : er his scolers come; Alutel he bigan to swoudri : as a slep him nome. Þo þo&yogh;te him in his swoudringe : þat a whit coluere com Fram heuene mid oure louerdes flesch : & þe wei to him nom, & þat swete flesch pulte in his mouþ : & siþþe fle&yogh; vp anhe&yogh;; heuene openede hire a&yogh;en : as þis gode man ise&yogh;. Þe sauour of oure louerdes flesch : him þo&yogh;te, was in his mouþe, And al þe clergie, him þo&yogh;te, of god : þo he awok, he couþe, Of þe pure stat of crist : & of his mageste As [an] angel him þo&yogh;te he couþe : & of his priueite. ¶ he bigan so deope desputi : of þe trinite, Þat gret wonder me hadde : þurf al þe vniuersite; Þat þe gretteste clerkes þat were : in Oxenforde þo Ne þo&yogh;te þat eni vrþlich man : so furforþ mi&yogh;te go Ne wite so moche of godes stat : bote hit [an] angel were; Þer nere none maystres in Oxenford : þat in gret wonder þerof nere. Ac he mi&yogh;te of ihesu crist iwite : more þan was in boc, whan he vsede oure louerdes flesch : & in his mouþe toc!— ¶ Ne þo&yogh;te no&yogh;t þis holi man : so moche in his lessoun Þat euere among his þo&yogh;t nas mest : in godes passioun. O tyme he was in grete studie : of his lessoun any&yogh;t, Þat longe he sat þer-aboute : forte hit was ne&yogh; daili&yogh;t. Þo hit was toward þe dai : a-napped he was sore, he lynede adoun vpon his boc : þo he nemi&yogh;te studie nomore; So þat he ful aslepe : & vnywar also, & om. &? neþo&yogh;te no&yogh;t on þe passioun : as he was iwoned to do. Þe deuel com to him wel sone : noþing to siche he nas. Seint Edmund of him was iwar : in swoudring as he was he wolde him blesci wiþ þe deuel : his ri&yogh;t hond he gan forþ drawe : Þe deuel him nom þerbi anon : he nemi&yogh;te him no&yogh;t wawe. Þo nom he forþ his lift hond : to blesci him wiþ also : Þe deuel him nom þerbi faste : þat he nemi&yogh;te noþing do. vpe him he lai as a sak : þat he was al ouercome, he nemi&yogh;te him wawe fot ne hond : his poer him was binome. Ac delyure he hadde al his þo&yogh;t : so þat he þo&yogh;te sone Of oure louerdes passioun : as he was woned to done. ¶ Þe deuel nemi&yogh;te þo bileue : vpe him none þrowe, For drede he ful sone adoun : bituene him & þe wowe. ¶ Seint Edmund aros vp anon : & þe deuel ouercom, Strangliche & harde ynou : bi þe þrote he him nom. "þurf oure louerdes passioun : tel nou," he seide, "me, Ich axi þe hou cristene man : mai best him witie fram þe." "Me neschal wiþ noþing," quaþ þe deuel : "schulde fram mi poer So wel as þurf his passioun : þat þu nemnedest er." ¶ þer lurnede þis holi man : as we mowe ek echon, In whiche manere we mowe best : þe deueles poer forgon, For he hatieþ godes passioun : as man doþ his fon,]
53.2: And &yogh;wane men it habbuth in muynde : he mot fleo a-non.— Euerech tyme of daye and ny&yogh;ht : seint Eadmund him gan bi-seo Þat he di&yogh;hte wel to godes wille : þat he nolde idel beo; Oþur he was in is oresones : oþur at is bok, Oþur he .Et. oþur slep : oþur to oþur þingus he him tok. Þreo tymes him þou&yogh;te þat he for-les : &yogh;wene he cam þar-to : &YOGH;wane he rod, and &yogh;wane he slep : and &yogh;wane he .Et. al-so; For he nas þanne in studie : ne in is beden no-þe-mo; Ech oþur tyme, ase him þou&yogh;te : to sum prou him scholde go.— ¶ So longue þat al. om. þis guode man : to eche holienesse drou&yogh;, Þat is guodnesse was wide couth : and men speken þar-of i-nov&yogh;. Þe beste prechur he was i-holde : þat man ou&yogh;ware under-stod— For ho-so hath with him godes grace : is dede mot nede beo guod. So þat of þe Creoycerie : þe pope sente fram rome To þe bischopus of Enguelond : þat huy ane wise man nome For-to prechi of þe creoycerie : ase ri&yogh;ht was for-to do. Seint Eadmund, þe holie man : i-chose was þare-to, To prechi of þe creoicerie : a-boute in þe londe, Þat men wenden to Ierusalem : oþur senden heore sonde. ¶ procracies huy &yogh;euen him also : ase he wende a-boute, Of persones to nime largeliche : þat non nere with-oute. bote þat nolde he do for noþing : of no man spence take; And &yogh;wane persones it boden him : he it wolde for-sake. For &yogh;wane he seruede ore louerd crist : to is owene spense he tok; Of persones and of oþur men : &yogh;iftus he fur-sok. ¶ he ne ferde nou&yogh;t ase þis Ercedeknes : ne as oþure na-þe-mo, Þat persones and þeos pouere preostes : ouer-al doth ful wo!— Ase he prechede a day : of þe creoiz wel longue, A &yogh;ung man wende a-mong þe oþure : þe creoiz for-to a-fongue. A womman þat him louede : so heo i-sai&yogh;h þis, heo hente him bi-hinde faste : and drov&yogh; him a-&yogh;ein, i-wis. ¶ Also stif ase ani hard bord : hire hond bi-cam a-non, Þat heo ne mi&yogh;hte as a-welde : noþur senuwes ne bon; And þe hond was al-so fur-crokud. : heo made revlich bere. Seint Eadmund bi-heold a-boute : and axede &yogh;wat it were. "Sire, merci," quath þis womman : "wrechchede ich am i-nov&yogh;! Ase þis &yogh;ongue man wolde take þe croiz : a luyte ich him with-drou&yogh; : And min hond is al for-croket : &yogh;ware-with ich him nam. In alle wrechhede ich am i-brou&yogh;ht : alas, þat ich here cam!" ¶ "Womman," quath þis holie man : "woltþu þe croiz take? "&YOGH;e, louerd," he = heo seide, "&yogh;if ich mi&yogh;hte : i-nelle hire nou&yogh;t for-sake." Þis wumman sat a-doun a-kneo : and of him þe creoiz he = heo nam : And hire crokede hond strei&yogh;hte forthþ : and a-non-ri&yogh;ht hol bi-cam; heo cride and hered Ihesu crist. : þis was couth a-non; For þis miracle þare token þe creoiz : þe mo wel mani on.— ¶ In a time atþe gang-dawes al. roueisouns : þis holie man al-so prechede a day at Oxenford : ase he ofte hadde i-do, In alle halewene church-&yogh;erd : In þe norþure side, with þe Baneres at onderne : a-se men doth a-londe wel wide. Ase þis holie man with al þis folk : in is prechingue was best, Þat lodlokeste weder þat mi&yogh;hte beo : cam al fram bi west, Swart and dreok r. deork and grislich : and ouer-caste al þene toun; Þe wynd blev&yogh; al-so swiþe grisliche : ase þe world scholde al a-doun; So deork it was bi-come al-so : þat men mi&yogh;hte vnneþe i-se— Lodlokur wedur þane it was : ne mi&yogh;hte neuere be. ¶ Þat folk for drede of heore cloþus : faste bi-gonne to fleo. "A-bidez," quath þis holie man : "ore louerd is guod and freo. Þe deuel it is þat bringuth þis wedur : for-to destourbi godes lore; Ore louerd is strengore þane he : ne drede &yogh;e eov nou&yogh;t to sore!" he bi-heold upward toward god : and cride him milce and ore, Þat he schilde hem fram þe deueles mi&yogh;hte : þat he ne grefde hem nammore. Þo he hadde i-seid þis oresun : þat wedur bi-gan to glide In þe oþur half of þe churche : al in þe souþere side; Þare it bigan to falle a-non : and nolde no leng a-bide, Þat vnneþe þoru&yogh;h þe hey&yogh;e stret : mi&yogh;hte ani man go oþur ride— Ake in þe northhalf of þe churche : þare þis holie man stod, Ne fel neuere a reynes drope : for-to destourbi a mannes Mod; In þe southhalf þoru&yogh; al þe hei&yogh;e strete : it leide on for wod, Þat al þe stret a-watere orn : ase it were a gret flod. ¶ Þat folk þat fram þe prechingue : for drede of þe wedere drov&yogh; And þat wenden bi þe hei&yogh;e strete : hadden þar-of i-nov&yogh;; Ake huy þat bi-lefden þare : druy&yogh;e and clene were— louerd, muche is þi mi&yogh;hte! : and fair miracle was þere!— In þe toun of wyricestre : bi-tidde þat selue cas, Ase þis holie man seint Eadmund : in is prechingue was; Swuch wedur þare cam ouer him : he drof it a-wey al-so. Me þinchez, ase bi is liue : fair miracle it was i-do!— ¶ So wide sprong is guode los : a-boute, feor and ner, Þat men ne hulden nou&yogh;t in engelonde : of guodnesse is per. At salesburi he was i-maket : Canoun seculer; prouendes of churches al. prouendre of þe hous he hadde : and was tresurer. Þo he was auauncet so : he tolde þar-of ful luyte, he spendede a-boute on pouere Men : þat oþure duden in pruyte; he spendede so muche for godes loue : in is almes-dede Þat vnneþe he mi&yogh;hte mid is rentes : half &yogh;er is hous lede. ¶ To þe Abbeye of stanle : he wende swiþe al. þanne i-lome And suiournede þare for defaute : for-to is crop him come— For Maister steuene of lexintone : þat was þo Abbot þere, his desciple hadde i-be : þe &yogh;wyle huy at scole were. his fulle .net. he neuere mo : þat ani Man mi&yogh;hte i-seo, bote ase muche ase he nede moste : þet wolde in ani poynt be; Of him wondrede euer-ech Man : þat isai&yogh; him ete, hov he mi&yogh;hte holde is lijf : with so luyte mete. Of guode metes ne kepte he nou&yogh;t : þei men it wolde him bringue; &YOGH;wat lutles it was, þat he et : was al of grete þingue. ¶ Þat dai þat he masse song : flechs nolde he non, Ne þat dai next bi-fore : for man þat mi&yogh;hte gon; Fram þat Men loke alleluya : for-to cam estur-day, he ne .Et. nou&yogh;ht, þat þolede deth : ase muche folk isai&yogh;h, Ne in þe aduent na-þe-mo. : ake þat was luyte i-nov&yogh; A-&yogh;ein is oþur penaunce : þat he al day forth drov&yogh;.— ¶ Hit bi-fel þat þe Erchebischop : of caunterburi was ded : Seint Eadmund þar-to was chose : ase Commuyn nam heore red. Þo þe Eleccioun was i-maud : in þe chapitle at Caunterburi, A-non huy senden heore messagers : to him to salesburi. huy wenden toward salesbury : ake þare nas he nou&yogh;t; huy founden him at Calne : þo huy longue hadden i-sou&yogh;t. ¶ In is chaumbre he sat priueliche : at is boke ful stille : No man ne dorste come him nei&yogh;h : to letten him of al. forto wite is wille. Ake naþeles on þat was him next : ase it were is chaumberlein, Guode tiþingue he þou&yogh;hte him bringue : and þarof was wel fain : he tolde him þat he was ichose : Erchebischop to beo. Þis holie man gan him chide faste : and hiet him fram him fleo, "Be stille, þou fol! ich hote þe" : he seide, "and go out heonne a-non, Make faste þe dore aftur þe : and ne lat þou no man in gon For-to lette me of mi studie : ake lat me in pays beo!" Of þat tiþingue he tolde luyte : ase þare men mi&yogh;ten i-seo. al. 2 vv. more. ¶ Þis Messagers bi-lefden þare oute : and carefole weren of þou&yogh;ht, For þe day passede swiþe : and heore erinde ne duden [huy] nou&yogh;ht. huy wenden for heore guode tiþingue : nobleliche beon onder-fongue, For þe muruþe of is semblaunt : &yogh;uyt þare hem þou&yogh;hte longue! heore &yogh;iftus huy mi&yogh;hten eþe a-bere : þat þis holie man heom caste! huy bi-menden, and it of-þou&yogh;hte heom sore : heore hi&yogh;ingue þuder so faste. ¶ he ne a-ros nou&yogh;ht a fote fram is bok : are god þe tyme sende, Ase he was an oþur day i-woned— : ake forthþ þo ful softe he wende. Þo he cam out of is chaumbre : þe messagers come And seiden heore erinde hou it was. : þar-of he tok luyte gome. Þo þe lettres weren i-radde : "beu freres," he sede, "I-chulle loke &yogh;wat mine felawes : of þis þing wollez rede In þe chapitle of salesburi : ase ri&yogh;ht is þat ich do." huy nadden of him non oþur word : þo it alles cam þar-to. ¶ Þe chapitle at salesburi : i-holde was plener; Alle þe chanouns of þe ordre : þudere come fer and ner, To conseili heom of þis þing. : þe red was sone i-take: Gladliche at one worde : alle huy stoden þare-ate. "buth stille!" quath þe guode man : "&yogh;wat schal þat i-sed? wuyrþe nam ich nou&yogh;t þar-to : nimez an oþur red!" ¶ "Certes," quath þe bischop þo : and þe Canones al-so, "Þov ne mi&yogh;ht nou&yogh;ht beo þare-a-&yogh;ein : þou most it nede do." Seint Eadmund seide euere nay : and bi-gan to wepe sore. Þe Chanones wepen with him al-so : and criden cristes ore; To is fiet huy fullen a-kneo : and heolden up heore honde And beden him for þe loue of god : betere him under-stonde And habbe reuþe of holie churche : and of him-sulf al-so, And þenche, &yogh;wane holie churche it wolde : he moste it nede do. ¶ Þe bischop also weop on him : and on him cride faste, And in vertue of obedience : hiet him at þe laste Þat he ne scholde it nou&yogh;ht bi-leue : godes wille to wurche And beo bou&yogh;sum to al þe lond : and nameliche to holie churche. Þo bi-gan þis holie man : to wepe and sike sore; "Nov god," he seide, "us &yogh;iue is grace : is milce and eke is ore! ¶ And ich take god to witnesse : and ore leuedi al-so Þat, &yogh;if ich ne wende suneguy dedliche : i-ne scholde it neuere do." Þo huy heorden þis word of him : Ioyfole i-nou&yogh; huy were, And nomen him up with ioye i-nov : and to þe hei&yogh;e autere him bere, And 'Te deum laudamus' songuen : swyþe murie and hei&yogh;e; Euere wep þe holie Man : ase þe chanones i-sei&yogh;e. ¶ So þat he cam to caunturburi : and dude ase ri&yogh;t was þere, And Erchebischop was i-maud : is vnþonkes þei it were. Ne þarf no man þar-of esche : &yogh;weþur he toke on wel i-nou&yogh; And wel wissede holie churche : and to eche guodnesse drou&yogh;! &YOGH;if is lyf was holi er : wel betere it was þo; In strong penaunce he was i-nov&yogh; : of fastingue and oþur wo. he hadde euere of selie bonde-men : pite and deol i-nov&yogh;, For him þou&yogh;te þat þe hei&yogh;e men : duden hem al day wou&yogh;.— ¶ In a time on of is pouere Men : wende of lif-dawe, And is beste best to heriet : men brou&yogh;te him, ase it was lawe. Þo cam þis selie mannes wif : þat careful widewe was, And mette with þis holie man : ase ore louerd &yogh;af þat cas : heo cride on him deolfulliche : merci and is ore, And seide him, bote þat o best : luyte guod heo hadde more; heo al. Ne heo nuste in &yogh;wat manere : ne hou al. for meseise heo mi&yogh;hte liue, heo bad him for þe loue of god : þat best a-&yogh;ein hire &yogh;iue. ¶ "Guode womman," seide þe holie man : "þou wost wel hou it is, Þat þat chief louerd habbe þe beste ay&yogh;te : &yogh;wane is man is ded, i-wis." To is clerkes he seide a-latyn : þat þe widewe it ne under-stod : "Me þinchez it a luþur lawe : and noþur ri&yogh;htful ne guod. Þis guode wif hath i-lore hire louerd : þat al hire guod forhtþ drou&yogh;, And to leose þare-aftur ire orig. is beste best : me þinchez it is wou&yogh;; In þat on were lure orig. luþur i-nou&yogh; : þei heo ne lore þat oþur al-so. Þe deueles lawe it is of helle : and þoru&yogh;h god neuere i-do. ¶ "Guode wif," he seide, "&yogh;if ich [þe] take : a-&yogh;ein þi best to lone, Woltþou it witie to mine bi-hofþe : for-to ich it axi eft-sone?"
