56.1: Slei&yogh;e Men and egleche : and of redes wise and bolde, Lustniez nouþe to mi speche : wise and vnwise, &yogh;ongue and olde : No-þing ich eov nelle rede ne teche : of none wichche ne of none scolde, Bote of a lif þat may beo lech e : to sunfule men of herte colde. ¶ Ich nelle eov noþer rede ne rime : of kyng ne of Eorl, al. Telle nelle i c of no man: of kny&yogh;ht ne of swein, Ake of a womman ichchulle ov telle al. also i c can : þat was sunful and for-lein : A swyþe fol wumman heo bi-cam : and þoru&yogh; godes grace heo was i-brou&yogh;ht a&yogh;eyn, And nouþe heo is to crist i-come : þe fayre Marie Maudeleyn. Of hire al. h. name ichulle &yogh;eou telle nouþe al. om. : al-hou and &yogh;ware heo was i-bore, &YOGH;if &yogh;e to me wullez i-heore al. lusten & dwelle : and habben of god þonk þare-fore. ¶ Þis word Marie so is bri&yogh;h[t]nesse : and bi-tokneþe MS. bitokne þe steorre of þe se, And soruwe also and biturnesse : ase þe bok tellez me; For &yogh;wane a man fielez in is heorte : þat he hauez muche mis-do, And him þare-fore biguynnez to smeorte : þat is to him al. þan is him bitur and wo, he mournez and he sikez ofte— : þis ilke Marie fierde al-so, Þat þing þat was hire leof and softe : was sethþe hire fulle fo. ¶ In þe Castel of Magdale : þis faire wumman was i-bore : heo was icleoped in propre name : "þe Maudeleyne" ri&yogh;ht þare-fore. To speken of hire ich am wel fous : and it likez me ful murie. Ire fader was hoten sire Titus : and hire moder Dame Euchirie; hire broþur was cleoped lazarus : and Martha was hire soster— heo was debonere and pitiuous : and heo was a seli foster. heore fader and heore moder boþe r. bo : comen of riche kunne, Of bolde kyngus and of Quienes sup. also : Men of muchele wunne : ¶ Of castles and of tounes r. toures : of londes and of þeodes, Of halles and of boures : of palefrei&yogh;es and of stedes; large huy weren of heore metes : to heom þat hadden neode, To men goinde and eke sittinde al. ysete : þat heore bonene wolden heom beode. Wyse men and sley&yogh;e : oueral huy weren i-tolde. Þo þat huy scholden dei&yogh;e : and so huy weren i-holde : ¶ Heore londes and heore leodes : huy delden alle a-þreo, Tounes and heore þeodes : heore guod r. gold and heore feo, To feoffen heore children al. Here ch. to dy&yogh;te : þare-wiz echon, For huy ne scholden nou&yogh;t striue fy&yogh;te : &yogh;wane huy heom weren at-gon. wel sone þere-aftur : þo huy nede scholde, Deiden fader and Moder : ase iesu crist it wolde; ¶ Bi heom Men duden sone : ase huy ou&yogh;ten to done, And to heore longue home : brou&yogh;ten heom ful sone— Iesu crist of heouene : of heom habbe merci And for is names seouene : fram helle heom waraunti! huy di&yogh;hten heore londes : a-mong heom, alle þreo, And with heore hondene delden : heore gold and heore feo : To Marie bi-lefde al. gan falle : þe castel Magdale, ¶ Þare-fore Maudeleyne sup. of alle : formest i-cleoped was heo; vv. 43-44 are wr. in one line. Lazarus hadde þat haluen-del al. chaumpart : of al Ierusalem, Of wodes and fieldes and of sart : al-mest to bedle h em; Martha was i-feoffed : with þe al. om. Betanie And al-so with genezarez : bote þe bok us lie. ¶ Marie, heo ne tolde nou&yogh;t : bote al of hire pruyde, Ake þar-on was al hire þou&yogh;ht : and faire hire to schruyde, And sethþe for-to walke a-boute al. om. : to don hire flechses wille, To gon and eorne feor and neor al. & to stalke : boþe loude and stille; For-soþe, heo was riche i-nou&yogh;h al. sekirly : and so heo moste nede : Manie riche Men hire lei&yogh;en bi : and &yogh;euen hire gret mede. ¶ Lazarus spendede al is þou&yogh;ht : op-on his chiualerie, Of oþur þingus ne tok he no &yogh;eme : ne to al. Ac at o word he tolde no&yogh;t: of housebondrie. Þe selie Martha, þat oþur suster : heo was of redes guode, Ase þei heo and hire soster : neren nou&yogh;t of one blode : ¶ Martha nam hire broþur lond : and hire sustres al-so, And dude heom teolien wel i-nou&yogh; : ase wys man scholde do; Þare-with heo fedde alle heore men : and cloþede heom al-so, [&] pouere men and wummen : þat weren neodfole and in wo. ¶ So fair womman nas þare non : in none kunnes londe, Ase marie was of bodie al. lycam : and of fote and honde; So more fairore þat heo bi-cam al. was hir fax : þe more of hire was prys, MS. pryis Þe more fol womman heo wax : and sunful and unwys : ¶ Hire ri&yogh;hte name marie : ouer-al heo les þare-fore, Sunfole wumman men cleopeden hire al. gan hire clepy : bi-hinde hire and bi-fore. Þo þis wumman hadde i-heord : þat hire name was ilore, Þat heo was so bi-gyled and bicherd : wo was hire þare-fore; Þo Men hire cleopeden sunfule : and li e ten hire ri&yogh;hte name, heo wax kareful and dreori of þou&yogh;ht al. drery & carful : and gan sore to schame : Þo nolde heo no-more : bi-fore þe riche men come; In-to hire castel for sorewe al. sore : heo hauez hire i-nome, For-to ore louerd cam and prechede : ouer al in þat londe. Martha hire suster ofte bi-fore op-braid r. apechede? : hire schame and hire schonde, And chidde hire ful ofte : for hire lecherie, boþe fastinde and eke ful : þat vnneþe he mi&yogh;hte it drie. ¶ A man of þat contreye : þat hei&yogh;hte symond leperous, Al-so þe bok us tellez : bad ore louerd to is hous, And is deciples tweolue : with him, to þe mete, For he ne mi&yogh;hte nou&yogh;ht him-sulf : fram heom alle ete. ¶ Marie þis i-heorde : and þarof was ful glad; A smeorieles to greiþi : þar-to he was ful rad; heo wende to symundes hous : þat no man hire ne bad, To ore louerd Iesu crist. al. crist Iesus : and ful sore heo was of-drad, ¶ For þat he was so sunful : bi-fore ore louerd to come, Careful heo was, and sore a-ferd : forto beon i-nome; heo ne dorste ore louerd repie nou&yogh;ht al. om. : bi-hinde ne bi-fore, Ne no Man hire nolde cleopie : and þat hire grefde sore. ¶ Þo ore louerd was i-sete : in symundes house þere, And his Apostles to þe mete : þat with him þo were, Ore louerd sat and þou&yogh;hte muche : ake bote luyte he ne eet. orig. eat Marie þat was so sunful al. þat of hirself ne ro&yogh;t : heo crep doun to is fiet, ¶ heo custe is fiet and wusch al-so : with hire wete teres, And wipede heom aftur-ward : with hire &yogh;eoluwe heres, Out of hire boxe heo nam : Oynement ful guod And smeorede ore louerdes heued : with ful blisful mod. ¶ Iudas was þare bi-side and smulde hit : and þare-fore he was nei&yogh;h wod,— Þat swote smul him culde nei&yogh;h : and gremede is sorie blod,— And al. he bad don up þat riche þing : þat heo ore louerd gan with smeore; To spene it so in wasting : he seide, it was gret lure; And seide, "it mai beon i-sold ful deore : to bugge with muchel mete, pouere Men þare-with to freueri : of drunch and of mete." on the margin, to drinke and to ete ¶ Þo saide ore louerd to Iudas : "lat þou þis wumman beo! Ful guod weork it was and is : þat heo wurchez in me; For ai schulle &yogh;e pouere with eov habbe : and so ne worth eov me— Þi toungue moste bien i-schaue : to speche heo is to freo." ¶ Symund leprous i-heorde þis : he þou&yogh;hte wel mani-fold Þat, &yogh;if þes profete were al-so wys : ase he is fore i-told, he nolde soffri þis fole wumman : his bodi enes to reppe, For no weork þat heo can do al. do can : to-ward him enes steppe. ¶ Ore louerd wuste is luþere þou&yogh;ht : ake þarof stod him non ey&yogh;e: "Symund, þou þenchest muche for nou&yogh;ht. : sum-þing ichulle þe sei&yogh;e." "Maister, seye," seide symound : "ich it bidde þe! For þou noldest for no þing al. C pound : segge on-ri&yogh;ht to me." ¶ "An vsurer was &yogh;wilene : þat hadde dettores tweyne, Þat swyþe longue &yogh;wyle : dette him scholden bey n e: Þat on him scholde fifti panes : and twenti þar-to, al. fyf siþe twenti Þat oþur him scholde of dette : fifti panewes al-so. al. panes : fulle fifty ¶ And noþur of heom nadde : &yogh;ware-of þe dette for-to &yogh;elde: huy &yogh;olden, þo he it creuede al. He for&yogh;af hit hem : (the MSS. are corrupt) : ase þe bok us telde. &YOGH;weþur of heom tweine : cudde him more loue þo?" "Maister, he þat al. þat he more &yogh;af for&yogh;af : me þinche, so mote i go." ¶ "For soþe, symund leperous : þou hauest i-demed a-ri&yogh;ht. For sethþe ich cam into þin hous : þou ne custest me no-wi&yogh;ht, Ne þou ne wusche nou&yogh;t mine fiet : with watur ne with teres Ne þou ne wypedest heom nou&yogh;ht &yogh;uyt : with cloþe no with heres, orig, here, s added later. ¶ Min heued on none halue : with no-manere Oynement Ne smeordest MS. smeredest smeordest , with none salue : ne with no piement; Sethþe ich cam in-to þin hous : þis wumman MS. wumnan nolde blinne Mine fiet to wasche and cusse : with-outen and with-inne, ¶ And to wipen heom sethþe aftur-ward : with hire faire here, Min heued also to smeorien : with riche Oynement and dere. Op aris, þou wumman, þine sunnes þe beoth for-&yogh;yue! Al-so ich nouþe can and may r. may and can : of me þou art i-schriue." ¶ Marie þe Maudeleyne al. M. þat was in fere : ore swete louerd hire schrof, Swete Iesu crist out of hire : seue deuelene he MS. heo drof. Ore louerd makede hire is procuratour : his leof and is hostesse; heo louede him with gret honour : in pays and in destresse. ¶ Martha, hire suster, was ful sik : and so heo hadde i-beo ful &yogh;ore, At hire bi-hinde heo hadde i-bled : seuen &yogh;er and more; heo ne mi&yogh;hte for no-þing : no leche-craft craft on the margin. a-fongue, Are ore louerd, heouene king : a-mong heom þare gan &yogh;ongue, And &yogh;af hire is swete blessingue : and helde hire of hire sore And bad hire beon hol and sound. : and so heo was euer-eft more. ¶ Heore beire broþur lazarus : was swyþe sikel a overlined. man. Iesus hereborewede at heore hous : &yogh;wane he bi heom cam, And his Apostles alle : &yogh;wane huy þare-forth come, heore In huy gonne cleopie : an al. þat wolde to hem by falle: ase heore owene it nome; ¶ Al swuch ase þare-inne was : huy eten and huy drounke— Men habbez ofte note of þing : þat luytel it habbut swounke. Þo Iesus hadde þare i-beo : ase longue ase he wolde, he wente to an oþur contreye : for men i-seon him scholde; ¶ Marie he &yogh;af is blessingue : and Martha and lazarus, Muchele a n d luttle, elde and &yogh;ongue : þat woneden in heore hous. Aftur þat he was i-wend : Marie was al. wax egleche: Crist hire hauede a-boute i-sent : to sarmoni and to preche: ¶ To sunfole men he was ful rad : to wissi and to teche, MS. toche And to sike men heo wa[s] ful glad : to beon heore soule leche; Mani on to cristinedom : heo brou&yogh;hte, and out of sunne, Fram lecherie and hore-dom : þoru al. to schrift, to Ioye and alle wunne.— ¶ Aftur ore louerdes passione : in þe þritten þe &yogh;ere Giwes weren proute and grimme : olme and of luþere chere, Seint steuene to deþe huy stenden : þat was ore louerd ful deore, And manie Men huy flemden : þat cristes limes were; ¶ Non Apostle ne moste liue : in Giwene londe, Alle huy weren of londe i-driue : with wrathþe and nyþe and onde. Seint Maximus was þo : with godes apostles al. þo was w. g. a. : s. M. bi-come; Sixti .ant. Ten deciples : to-gadere heom hadden i-nome; ¶ Marie þe Maudeleyne : and hire broþur lazarus, And heore suster Martha : and þe bischop Maximus, Mani mo of cristine Men : wel mo þane i can nemne, weren i-hote fleme : and some to quelle and brenne. ¶ Huy weren in .A. schip i-pult : with-outen ster and ore, Þat huy scholden beon fur-faren al. i-spilt : and ne libben no-more; Þare nas noþur ido with heom : noþur watur ne bred, For huy scholden of-hongrede beon : and sone þare-aftur-ward ded. ¶ Huy schypeden in þe salte se : ase Iesu crist it wolde, For-to þat tyme scholde beo : þat huy a-riui scholde. To Marcile þe wynd heom drof : a gret name-couth cite; Euer-ech of heom oþur schrof : are huy comen out of þe se. ¶ Huy ne founden þare no freond al. frend non : þat wolde heom hereboruwe, Cristine man ne no giv Noþer gywe ne cr. man : an eue noþur a-moruwe, Ne &yogh;yuen heom mete ne drinke noþur al. om. : ne lissen heore soruwe, Ne no man, for loue ne for swunch : þat huy mi&yogh;hten of bugge ne borewe: ¶ In one olde porche : huy stunten al þat ny&yogh;ht, with-oute li&yogh;ht of torche : with-oute fuyr and candle bri&yogh;ht. Þe porche was an old MS. hold hous : of olde weorke i-wrou&yogh;t; Þudere in huy weren alle wel vouse : þat of þe se weren i-brou&yogh;ht, ¶ For huy nusten elle-&yogh;ware : þat huy stunte mi&yogh;hte; Bote huy hadde gre[t] schame and teone : and giwes with heom to fi&yogh;hte. Þare huy duelden al þat ny&yogh;ht : forto it was day a-moruwe. Þe sarasins heom boden fi&yogh;ht : to echen heore soruwe. ¶ Alle þe Men þat fram þe se : þuder weren i-come, huy nusten &yogh;wodere huy mi&yogh;hte fleo : for-þi huy weren i-nome. huy weren i-hote ope lyf and lime al. on here lyf : Iesu crist fur-sake, And, with þretningue and with strif : to heore false godus take. ¶ Þe Marie Maudeleine : heo sai&yogh;h þat folk a-rise, Riche and pouere, kny&yogh;ht and sweyn : to don þat sacrefise: heo was a-nuyd and of-drad : þat hire bi-gan to grise; To speken of god heo was ful rad : and so dude on hire wise. ¶ Op heo stod with wordes bolde : with bri&yogh;ht neb and glade chere, And seide, "herkniez to me, &yogh;unge and elde : þat wullez beon cristes: rhyme om.; al. þat in þis place ben here Ne bi-lieuez nou&yogh;ht opon Mahun : ne on teruagaunt, is fere, For huy beoth boþe deue and doumbe : and huy ne mouwen i-seo n i-here, ¶ Ne huy ne mouwen eov helpe nou&yogh;ht : of none kunnes þingue Þei men of heom &yogh;elpen ou&yogh;t : ne no guod to eu bringue: For huy bez doumbe and deue : crokede and eke blinde, heore mi&yogh;hte is fallen to grounde : bi-foren and bi-hinde. ¶ Ake &yogh;e schulle lieuen on iesu crist : oure hei&yogh;e heouene kyng, Þat al þis worldes maister is : with-oute ani ending: For he may don is wille al. He ou wole dy&yogh;t (of om.) : of euereche cunnes þing Þat &yogh;e wilniez with ri&yogh;hte : and with-outen suneguyng; ¶ He is with-oute þe bi-guynningue : and he is with-outen ende, with-oute fuylþe and sunegyng : so corteys and so hende Þat al þing þat man with skile him biddez : he wole him &yogh;yue and sende, To Man þat goth and eke rit : þat wole to him wende; ¶ He is wuryte r. wuyrte of alle þing : he makede heouene and helle, Ne may no kayser ne no kyng : his vertues alle telle; Þe man þat him seruez wel : ne may him no feond cwelle, orig. dwelle Ake huy þat wullez a-&yogh;ein him fi&yogh;hte : to grounde he wole heom felle; ¶ He makede day and eke ny&yogh;ht : steorrene and sonne and Mone; Þe man þat trewe is and louez him ari&yogh;t : he wole graunti him is bone And þat he biddez him with treouþe : he it grauntez him ful sone, he helpez boþe king and kny&yogh;ht : þe pouere alle mididone." ¶ A riche prince of sarazins : þudere was i-come, with him is wyf and his mayne : þat with him he hadde i-nome: To Maries prechingue : he lustnede ful sone; For þat heo was so fair a þing : to hire huy token guod gome. ¶ Þe sarazins onvele : weren fulle of nyþe and hete, þo it was time of mele : huy wenden to heore mete; þo huy comen hom vnsele : and þar-to weren i-sete, Cristes Men to delen guod : ful clene huy hadden for-&yogh;ete. ¶ Þare weren of cristine men : mo þane sixti and tene; No man nadde reuþe of heom : and þat was þare i-sene: huy weren wit-oute mete and drunch : in gret hongur and in teone, Ne huy ne duden no weork ne swunch : ne no-þing men nolde heom lene. ¶ Hit was in one ny&yogh;hte : aftur þe þridde day, þat þis riche princes wif : in hire bedde lay: Þare cam Marie Maudeleyne : and bi-foren hire heo stod: "Dame, me þinchez þou art vnhende al. vilayne : for þou hast muche guod, ¶ Of þe ich habbe gret feorlich : and muche me þinchez wunder Þat þou last Iesu cristes folk : þus steorue for hungur! Bote &yogh;if þou oþur þi louerd : lissi heore kare, Wite &yogh;e mid-i-wisse : sorewe eou schal beon ful &yogh;are: ¶ Swuch a fierd schal op-on eov come : þat schal eov so al. om. fur-fare And a-quellen eou and eouwer folk : huy nellez eov no-þing spare." Þis riche princes wif þis word : nolde hire louerd nou&yogh;ht telle— For-soþe, heo was puyrliche vnwys : in sawe and in spelle. Þe oþur ny&yogh;ht þe Maudeleyne : eft-sone &yogh;eode hire to, And spak to hire wel stuyrneliche : and þe þridde nyht al-so; And &yogh;uyt he o nolde hire erinde : to hire louerd do. a v. om.; al. Alle suche messageres : crist hem worche wo. ¶ Marie cam þe feorþe ny&yogh;ht : and bi-fore þe prince heo stod: "Slepestou, tyraunt, þou deueles kny&yogh;ht : of sathanasses blod? þi wif, þe Naddre, heo is a-mad : ich holde hire puyr wod: heo nolde þe telle þat ich bad : for vuele ne for guod. ¶ Þou hauest mete and drunch i-nov&yogh; : and luytel oþur care, And soffrest cristes men with wou&yogh;h : for hungur þus fur-fare! Bote þou a-mendi heore stat sone : þe is sorewe al-&yogh;are, þare schal so strong MS. stronk folk come þe a-&yogh;ein : þat wollez þe luytel spare, ¶ with sweord and spere huy schullen þe sle : and al þi folk fur-fare." þe Maudeleyne &yogh;eode fram him : and liet him ligge þare. þe Quiene al. prince a-wok and si&yogh;hte sore : and tolde hire louerd þe quene so; þo þou&yogh;hte him þat he i-warned was al. þo&yogh;te heo, so dyde me: : þreo ny&yogh;htes and mo. ¶ Heo tolde him þat hire was i-seid orig. i-said : and al-so i-hote to do: Feden Iesu cristes men : and lissi heom of heore wo, Oþur heom scholde sorewe i-nov&yogh; : and kare comen heom to. þo seide þe prince : "Dame, &yogh;wat schulle we do Of þisse opene warningue : þat is i-come us to? vv. 269-70 are written in one line. v. 270 al. om. Betere is þat we Cristes men : swyþe wel heom fiede and schruyde, þene we tellen luyte of heom : In vilte oþur in pruyde." ¶ huy token Iesu cristes Men : and ladden hom al. hem to heore inne; Al þat heom was neod, huy founden heom : with loue and alle wunne. Þe Maudeleyne heom radde wel : to witien heom fram sunne, So þat heom ne þorte neuere drede : of sathanases kunne. ¶ Opon a day heo bi-gan al. Heo bigan vpon a day : godes word forto preche And of godes lawe, with gret wit Wiþ grete witte of godes lay : ase heo þar mi&yogh;hte a-reche; To leden heore lyf in guod fey : alle he o gan heom teche, And for-to louie god and don a-wey : wrathþe and onde and wreche. ¶ Þe prince saide þo to hire : with egleche wordes and bolde: "Mi&yogh;ht þou proui with treuþe : þat þou prechest may beo wel i-holde?" Þe Maudeleyne saide, corr. to seide "&yogh;e : ich am redi eov to teche, Bi ore maistres conseile : and mid is holie speche— Þat is seinte MS. seinte? petre of rome— : hov &yogh;e schullen on take Þe blisse of heouene for-to afongue : and þe feondes lore for-sake." ¶ Þo seide þe prince a-non : and is wyf al-so: "We beoz boþe redie a-non : þine wille forto do, So ase þi louerd is : of so muchel mi&yogh;hte Þat he may, &yogh;wane he wole : at is wille alle þingus di&yogh;hte. ¶ Bide þine louerd, heoue king : þat is us alle a-boue, So ase he may don alle þing : and al-so for is moder loue, And for þine bi-sechingue al. bisokne : þat he &yogh;yue a child, þat beo a sone: And at þane forewarde tokne : we wollez with eov wone, Ore kinedom also forth with us : his owene we wollez bi-come, And we wollez &yogh;elden a-&yogh;ein to is Men : þat we heom habbez bi-nome. ¶ Þo seide Marie þe Maudeleine : "þat nelle ich nou&yogh;ht bi-leue, A preiere to mi louerd to make : nele me no-þing MS. þinging greue. "Ich bidde þe, swete Iesu crist : þat makedest sonne and mone, Þat þou þis prince siende a child : and þat it beo a sone." heo bad with guode heorte and milde. : heo was i-heord ful sone: ¶ Þat ilke ny&yogh;ht huy geten a child : ase god heom &yogh;af grace to done. ¶ Þo þe prince wuste : þat is Quiene was with childe, A-non-ri&yogh;ht toward Iesu crist : he wax meoke and milde; huy leten heore vuele dedes : þat weren so wikke and wilde, And aftur godes dedes : huy wrou&yogh;hten a[nd] gonne buylde. ¶ Þo swor þe prince and seide, "bi heued min : wiende ichulle to rome And bi-come a pilegrim : and don aftur þe holie dome, And with seint petur ichulle speke : and don aftur is redes, &yogh;if it is so ase Marie seiz : of Iesu cristes dedes; And &yogh;if þat ich him finde : at þe court of rome, Of him ichulle vnder-fongue : fulloutht and cristindome." ¶ Þo seide þe lauedi : "ichulle wiende with þe, And, þare þou art i-cristned : ichulle al-so beo; And &yogh;wane þou comest hidere a-&yogh;ein : ich may come with þe." Þo seide þe prince lei&yogh;inde : to is wif a-game: "And beo nouþe ase þou seist : mi leoue swete dame, ¶ Bote in schipe wexez ofte soruwe al. om. : peril and teone and grame; And þou art nouþe with childe : couth is þat guode fame, In þe .se. þou mi&yogh;htest al. þou m. in þe se wilde : ful sone hente schame— &YOGH;uyt hadde ich leouere ich were i-huld : and euere to ligge lame. Ake bi-lef þou athom and reste þe wel al. om. : and &yogh;em alle ore þingues; At mine a&yogh;ein-come god siende me : of þe guode tiþingues!" ¶ Þo spak þe lauedi, þe Quiene : and feol a-doun to is fote: "Leue louerd, þou let beo þat : and graunte me þat ich mote! Þis ilke sorewe wole me a-slen : bote þou do me bote." ¶ &YOGH;eot seide þe leuedi : and weop wel swiþe sore, Deolful and dreori heo ful a-doun : and seide ofte, "sire, þin ore! hov mi&yogh;hte ich libbe and beon glad : bote we to-gadere wore orig. were ? we loueden us so &yogh;oungue : and nouþe we beoth sumdel hore." ¶ So longue and &yogh;eorne þis lauedi bad : hire louerd þat was so hende, Þat he hire orig. him grauntede, and was ful glad : with him for-to wiende. For neodfole bi-sokne : of heom and heore men, Þe holie blessingue with hire hond : Marie makede on heom, For no wickede gost : bi þe weye ne scholde hem derie, Þe holie rode tokningue : fram seoruwe heom scholde werie. ¶ Þe Marie heo mauden wardein : of heom and of heore schipe, r. lordschipe? Þe swete holie Maudeleyne : in cristes wurthschipe, For heo was þe kingue of heouene : leof and deore and queme, And bi-token hire ech-del : to witien and to &yogh;eme. ¶ huy nomen with heom into heore schip : bred i-nov&yogh; and wyn, Venesun of heort and hynd : and of wilde swyn, huy nomen with heom in heore schip : al þat hem was leof, Gies and hennes, crannes and swannes : and porc, motoun and beof; For huy scholden passi : þe grickische se, And for þat huy nusten hou longue : huy scholden þare-inne be. ¶ huy drowen op seil and ore : and schipeden a-non-ri&yogh;ht, Alle, þe lasse and þe more : Eorl, baroun and kny&yogh;ht. huy nadden bote seue ny&yogh;ht : i-seiled in þat flod, Þat huy neren sore of-dradde : þe se wax stuyrne and wod; Þe se bi-gan to flowen : and þe wawes forto a-rise: Some bi-gonne to swounen : and heore heortene sore a-grise; ¶ Þe se bi-gan to ebbi al. route : and þe wynd ful stuyrne to blowe. Ase þe Quiene on hire bedde lay al. And þe q. for doute: : hire token ful strongue þrowes, heo swounede ful i-lomeliche al. ylome : and harde pinede þare-fore, So for-to þat hire &yogh;oungue sone : were of hure i-bore. Þo þat child i-bore was : þe Moder bi-gan to deye, Þat folk gradde "allas allas" : and weopen with heore eye. ¶ Þo þe leuedi was ded : aftur þat þet child was i-bore, huy ne mi&yogh;hten it bi-leue : to al. þer was wiþ hem non oþer red : but make deol þare-fore. Þat child wolde souke : and it nuste &yogh;wam, Þare nas no milk a-boute : ne no mielch wumman. ¶ "Allas," quath þe prince : "þat ich euere was i-bore! Wo is me for þis &yogh;unge child : and for mi Quien þat ich habbe i-lore, And nouþe it mot nede deye : for souke ne hath i[t] non, Ne i-not in none halue al. Wote i c neuer sikerly : &yogh;wat me is best to don." ¶ Þe schipmen hiete n with stuyrne mod : þat men ne schulden nou&yogh;ht spare Þe dede Quien to casten in þat flod : oþur elles huy mosten fur-fare: "Þe &yogh;wyle þat bodi is here with us : þe stormes beoth so kete, To quellen us huy þenchez : and þat huy nellez lete." ¶ huy nomen up þad r. þat dede bodi : in-to þe se for-to caste. "Abidez &yogh;uyte and herkniez me!" : þe prince gradde faste; "&YOGH;if &yogh;e nellez for mi loue it lete om. it lete : ne for loue of mi wif, spariez for mi luytel sone : so þat he mouwe habbe is lyf! For &yogh;if is moder mouwe &yogh;uyt : of hire suoweningue awake, Þanne may mi luytel sone : to hire tete take." ¶ huy lokeden heom bi-side : and sei&yogh;en an hei&yogh;h hurst Swiþe feor in þe se al. In þe se wyde : and þe prince it i-sai&yogh; furst; him þou&yogh;te þat wel more wisdom : to þe bodie it were to burien it opon þet hei&yogh;e hurst : þane fisches it eten þere. ¶ Þo huy comen þudere al. were þ. ycome : huy ne mi&yogh;hten make no put: Þe hurst was al of harde stone : ech faste in oþur i-knut; huy nomen þe Quiene and hire child : and wounden in a mantel, And leide opon þe hei&yogh;e hurste : in a grene cantel; huy leiden þat childes mouth : to þe moder tete— Þo þe prince þat i-sai&yogh;h : with wepingue is neb he gan wete. with gret deol þe Quiene and hire Child : þare huy gonne lete Opon þe t hurst þat was so hei&yogh;h : and hard and wilde and kete. ¶ Þe prince wep and wende forth : with his schip in þe se; "Marie Maudeleyne," quath þe prince, "alas : þat euere kneu ich þe! To don þis pelrimage : &yogh;wy raddest þou me? Þov bede þi god a bone : þat mi wif with childe scholde be: And nouþe is ded þus sone : boþe hire child and heo! ¶ Al mi lond and al mi þing : ich habbe i-take þe To witen and to wardi : &yogh;wi schal it þanne þus be? Mi wif and mi &yogh;ungue child : marie, ich bi-take To Ihesu crist, þi owene louerd : þat alle þing of nou&yogh;ht gan make, Þat, &yogh;if he is so corteys and mi&yogh;htful : ase þou seidest to me, he saue mi wif and mi child : fur-fare þat ich ne be." ¶ To his schyp he wende : and so forz in þe se. God hem to Rome sende : for þudere wolden he. Seinte petur wuste wel : þat þe prince cam: With milde mod and fair compaygnie : a-&yogh;eines him he nam. Petur Axede him fram &yogh;wanne he cam : and &yogh;wodere he wiende wolde. "To Rome," he seide, "þen wey ich take al. nam : and speke with þe i s cholde;" he tolde of marie Maudeleyne : hou he to hire cam, And hou he cristus sixti men : and tene to him nam, he tolde him of is child : he tolde him of is wif, hov he with milde heorte : for heom þolede strif. ¶ Seinte petur creoysede him : opon is ri&yogh;ht scholder, Of þat Marie hauede i-seid : he hauede game and wonder, And seide, "prince, wel-come þou be : and þine kni&yogh;htes alle! pays and grace with þe beo : and Ioye þe mote on falle In bour and in halle : in field and in toun al-so, In castel noþur in boure : ne worþe þe neuere wo, In watur and in londe : and in alle stude God þe fram harme schilde— : and þat ich habbe i-bede. ¶ Þey [þi] wif slepe nouþe al. nou slepe : and þi sone him reste, Loke þat þou ne weope nou&yogh;t for hem n. f. h. om. : ne make deol ne cheste : Mi louerd is swiþe mi&yogh;thful : he wole don is wille, And he is also quoynte and sley : boþe loude and stille, he can &yogh;yuen and bi-nimen : borewi and eke &yogh;ielde For soruwe blisse, &yogh;wane his wille is : in toune, in watere, in fielde; &YOGH;wane he is wroth, he doth wreche : ake þat fallez ful sielde; Ake of[te] gret fuyr and eke stuyrne : wext of a luytel spielde." ¶ Petur ladde þene riche man : a&yogh;ein al. om. to Ierusalem, And fro þannes þene wey he nam : with him to bedlehem, Fram þannes to þe flym Iordan : an long bi þe strem— I segge it ase ich ov telle can : In boke and nou&yogh;ht in drem. he schewede him caluarie : þare god was don on rode, his fiet and is hondene : al-hou huy ronnen on blode, he tolde him of þe þornes : þat on his heued stode, And of þe nailes þat in is fiet : and in his hondene wode, And &yogh;et he tolde him of þe spere : þat to þe heorte him stong, And hou he an hei&yogh;h opon þe rode : deide with muche wrong, hou he into helle cam : with Sathanas to fi&yogh;hte, And is folk þat þare-inne was : hou he it gan out di&yogh;hte, hou he a-ros, and to heoue steu&yogh; : to is fader sete And sat him þare-inne, for he was gleu&yogh; : and was him swyþe i-mete. ¶ Þo þe prince hadde i-heord : seint peteres lore, he carede laste he were bi-cherd : for he hadde i-beo þare al. was fol so &yogh;ore; he hadde i-leorned swiþe wel : al clanliche his bi-leue, his oures and is sauter ech-del : þo seide he, "god it &yogh;eue Þat ich were sone : in mine owene contreye And al mi folk, with flechs and blod : ri&yogh;ht ase ich wolde, sei&yogh;e!" Seint petur he bad par charite : cristni him a-non And al is oþur mayne : and laten heom wende hom And þanne habben guod day : "and &yogh;if us þine blessingue! we wollez so bliue so we mouwen : don us to schipijngue." ¶ "Þou schalt with-outen cristindom : wienden into þine londe; Ne drede þe nou&yogh;th, for þou mi&yogh;ht it don : with-oute schame and schonde. Þe Maudeleyne schal beon with þe : and to þe heo schal fongue, Lazarus and Martha, al þre : bi þe huy schullen stonde; Þare þou schalt i-cristned beo : þoru Iesu cristes sonde, And muche folk al-so of þine contreye : ne þinche þe nou&yogh;t to longue! ¶ An holi man schal cristni eov : þe bischop Maximus, Þat can is mester don swiþe wel : in Ihesu cristus hous, he wole beo &yogh;ep and eke rad : sley and eke vous, To cristni manie he wole beo glad : to is louerd Iesous— he were a fol and un-wis : þat ne were of glad and bliþe." Þe prince tok leue of seint petur : and þonkede him fale siþe. Þe prince saide, "holie fader : haue nov wel guod day! Ichulle wienden hamward : so bliue so ich may." he dude him into þe salte flod. : his schip bi-gan to go So bliue, for þe wind was guod : a[s] swaluwe swift al. om. oþur flo; with-inne þe seuenni&yogh;htte : þudere he was i-come Þare he, overlined. a&yogh;ein is wille, bi lefde : is wif and is sone. ¶ huy i-sei&yogh;en bi þe stronde : a luytel child gon pleye with publes on is honde : bi-fore hem in þe weye. Þe prince stap out of þe schipe : of hem alle he was þe furste, Opon þe stronde he &yogh;af a lupe : he hi&yogh;ede him to þe hurste. Þat child was swiþe sore of-drad : þo þe prince cam, To his moder he was wel rad : and a-boute þe necke hire nam. ¶ Þe leuedi lai wel stille and slep : opon a grene cantel, Þat child for fere orn to hire and crep : under hire mantel. Þo saide þat child, "hiderward : a þing, me þou&yogh;hte, i sai&yogh; come, Of him ich am ful sore a-drad : laste we beon i-nome." "Beo stille, mi sone, mi leoue child : he is mi worldes fiere; For gladnesse wepe he wole : þat [he] us findez here." ¶ Þe prince cam and fond hire þer : ligginde on þe hurste, Þare ase he bi-lefde hire er : and þat chil sek hire breste. For Ioye he weep and sat on is knen : and heold up his honde : "Þat ich euere moste þis i-seo : ich þonki ore louerdes sonde. A, swete Marie Maudeleine : þat me wolde nou ri&yogh;ht þinche murie Mi&yogh;hte þis wumman quikie a-&yogh;ein : and liuen and hire sturie!" ¶ Þo he hadde þat word i-seid : his wif bi-gan to wake, al. quake Of a swume heo schok and braid : and sone bi-gan a-wake; And [seide], "þe hende Marie Maudeleyne : heo hath i-&yogh;iue me space, orig. grace Fram deþe to liue heo hauez me i-brou&yogh;t : þoru hire louerdes grace; heo hauez i-fed me and mi sone : and i-don us alle guode— To seggen it þe &yogh;wi scholde ich schone? : þat &yogh;elde hire þe rode! heo hauez i-beon min hou[s]wif : mi mayde and mi norice, And bote ich þe [seide] hou heo heold mi lif : for-soþe ich were nice. ¶ Al þat seint petur hath al. peter : haþ : sethþe i-schewed þe, Þe swete marie Maudeleyne al. M. M. swete : it hauez i-schewed me : heo me hauez on hire hond i-lad : ouer þe salte strem, And setþe forþere-more : to Ierusalem, And setþe heo me ladde : bedlehem for-to seo, Þudere ase seint petur : bi-fore ladde þe, And sethþe to þe flum Iordan : heo ladde me ful raþe, with-oute harme and si&yogh;ht of man : and with-oute schame and scaþe, And ouer-al heo me ladde : mi louerd, þare þou were; And, for þou scholdest Ioyful beo : nouþe ri&yogh;ht heo brou&yogh;hte me here." ¶ Quath þe prince, "ich þonki god al-mi&yogh;hti : þat ich eov habbe a|liue. A-risez boþe, &yogh;if &yogh;e mouwen : and go we to schipe ful bliue!" huy duden heom to þe watere : and schipeden alle a-non, Þe wynd was blowinde swiþe wel : and heore schip bi-gan to gon; huy gonne to seili swiþe al. Hij hyed hem to seyle : in þat salte fom, And hi&yogh;eden heom ful bliue : þat al. Hem þo&yogh;t longe & eyle : or huy weren at hom. With-inne a quartron of þe &yogh;ere : huy comen to Marcilie. Mani Men of feor and ner : of heom gonne speke and spilie, Manie hem hadden to-gadere i-nome : Eorl, baron, kny&yogh;ht, and swein, Are huy weren to londe i-comen : for-to wenden heom a-&yogh;ein, Sarazins, and þe Giwes some : and þe Marie Maudeleyn; ¶ Martha cam and lazarus : of heom huy weren ful glad, And þe holie Bischop Maximus : to heom he was ful rad, And manie of cristine Men— : huy neren noþing of-drad To comen and gon a-&yogh;einest him : and don þat he heom bad. Þo þe prince and is wyf : weren i-come to londe, Þe Maudeleyne with-oute strif : i-reuested þare huy founde; And þo huy comen fram schipes bord : marie huy founden stonde For-to prechen godes word : to heom þat were on londe. ¶ Þe prince tok MS. tok tok is wif and is sone : with heorte guod and swete, To þe Maudeleyne huy comen : and fellen doun to hire fete, And tolden hire al heore lijf : þat heom bi-feol in þat weye; Pays and loue, harm and strif : al huy gonne hire sei&yogh;e. huy lieten þane Bischop Maximus : cristni heom a-non, Marie and Martha and lazarus : huy brou&yogh;hten heom þaron. Þe children and þe wummen alle : þat weren in þe londe, Alle huy nomen cristindom : and þat was þoru godes sonde. ¶ Ich wot, huy nomen heore false godes : and casten heom þare doune And brenden al-to poudre : feor fram euerech toune; huy duden a-rere churches : ouer al þe contreies, And priories wurche : and manie guode Abbeies, And preostes huy gonne makien al. Hij dude hede prestes : ouer-al in þe londe, Sudecknes and oþur clerkus : to serui heom to honde. huy mauden lazarus bischop : þe Maudeleynes broþer; Þe holie bischop Maximus : maude al-so mani anoþur.— ¶ Þo al þat lond cristine was : and al þat folc þare-inne, Marie bi-þou&yogh;hte a wonder cas : and stal a-wey fram hire kunne, In-to wildernesse he wende : al for-to wonien þere. Swuch grace god hire sende : heo was þare þritti &yogh;eres. Þare nas no watur a-boute : ne þare ne wax no treo Þat ani best mi&yogh;hte onder at-route : þe betere an ayse to beo. For-soþe ichulle &yogh;eov telle : of a ferliche wonder : Aungles comen euer-eche day : ri&yogh;ht a-bouten onde r n, And nomen swiþe softeliche al. softe : þe Marie Maudelein And beren hire op in-to þe lofte : and brou&yogh;hten hire eft a-&yogh;ein. ¶ Men nusten hou heo leouede : for noman ne sai&yogh;h hire ete; Ake some huy onder-stoden : þat heo liuede bi Aungelene mete. A preost þare was in marcilie : þat wilned swiþe muche For-to leden elinge lif : þe betere fram sunne him wite; he maude him a wonijngue : in þat wildernesse Þare Marie, þe swete Maudeleine al. þing : wonede in clennesse; he ne bulde nou&yogh;ht fram Marie al. hire stede : bote a wel luyte mile— For-to quemen god he it dude : and he &yogh;eld wel is &yogh;wile. he hadde wunder for þat he sai&yogh;h : þat þe Aungles comen ofte A-boute onderne eche daye : ase he stod in is crofte, And hou huy beren þe Maudeleyne : an hei op on lofte, And al-so hou huy brou&yogh;hten hire a-&yogh;ein : and setten hire a-doun wel softe. ¶ Þe preost a-ros op-on a day : and wende neor þe stude, he wolde i-wite &yogh;wat he i-sai&yogh;h : and þare-fore he it dude; To þulke stude he cam so nei&yogh;h : al bote a stones caste : Þo bi-gonne hise þeon to schrinke : and to croki swiþe faste; A-drad he was, and turnde a-&yogh;ein : and so he moste nede— Ne knev he nou&yogh;t þe Maudeleyne : ne hire guode dedes. Eft-sone he &yogh;eode him þude-ward : is fiet bi-gonne folde, his heorte and his Inneward : him gonnen al to colde. he þou&yogh;hte it was sum derne þing : oþur som holi priuete, I-comen fram þe heuene king : þat he ne scholde it nou&yogh;ht i-seo : ¶ he sat a-doun opon is kneon : and bad ore louerd þere Þat he moste i-wite and seon : &yogh;wat þat feorlich were; he gradde on eornest and on game : "þou best in þine celle, Ich halsni þe a-godes name : of þi stat þat þou me telle!" heo bi-gan to tellen : wordes him a-&yogh;ein : "I segge it þe for-soþe : ich am Marie Maudeleyn, Þat to þe kingue of heoue : of mine sunnes ich me schrof, And foule deuelene seouene : out of me he drof. Ich habbe i-woned nouþe here : fulle þritti &yogh;er, Ake i-ne sai&yogh;h neuere no man þus nei&yogh;h : bote þe nouþe her. ¶ Of no-þing þat ani man : of þe eorþe euere bi-swonk, I-ne .et., sethþe ich hidere cam : no mete, ne no drunch ne overlined. dronk; Godes Aungles euer-ech day : habbe me here i-nome An ibore me alne wey : &yogh;wane ischolde come, An hei&yogh;h to heouene lofte : euere &yogh;wane i MS. it ete scholde, And hidere a&yogh;ein wel softe : &yogh;wane ich mi-sulf wolde. Ich halsni þe a-godes name : þat þou wende to Marcilie, And with mine freond with-oute blame : loke wel þat þou spilie : Þou gret wel Martha, mi soster, ofte : and mi broþer lazarus, And al-so gret ofte swiþe wel : þene bischop Maximus, And seie hem wel ichulle comen : a-sonenday at eue, with heom for-to wonie : and euere with heom bi-leue— For ischal to paradis : newene fram heom fare, Ake mi bodi, for-soþe i-wis : bi-leue schal with heom þare; Sei&yogh;e heom þat huy kepen me : aftur þe mid-ni&yogh;hte, For þare ich hopie for-to beo : þoru godes swete mi&yogh;hte." ¶ Þis holie preost him wende forth : and dude hire herinde anon To þe bischop maximus : ase heo bad him don. Þe holie bischop Maximus : was glad of þat sonde, And for þat tiþingue he þonkede god al. t. ioyus : he helde : and to him heold up is honde; hire soster and hire broþer : weren þar-of wel fayn : "Nou comez oure Maister sone : þe marie Maudeleyn!" Of þis ilke tyþingues : huy weren swiþe glad Þat huy hadden i-heord— : ake some weren of-drad Þat huy bi-trayde weren. : ake þe bischop Maximus wuste wel þat hit was sothz— : to seon hire he was Ioyous, And to witen hire stat euer-echdel : he was wel coraIous. ¶ For-to seon þane Messager : þene sonen-ny&yogh;ht he wakede, And al ny&yogh;ht was in heore queor : and his oresones he makede, bi-fore þe hei&yogh;e Auter ore louerd he bad : þat he moste i-seo Þe Maudeleynes face : þat he þe gladdore mi&yogh;hte beo. Sone aftur þe Midni&yogh;ht : are ani koc him crev, Þare cam a wonder muche li&yogh;ht : ake no wynd þare ne blev, Þe Aungles comen fram heouene : and brou&yogh;hten þe Marie, huy seiden þe salmus seouene : and þe letanie; Fram þe eorþe huy gonne hire holden al. helden here : swiþe longue stounde, Þe &yogh;wyle heo makede hire preyere : and sethþe lieten hire to grounde. Þo cam wit hire swuch a smul : among heom euerech-on, In churche, in halle and in bour : þat swuch ne smulden huy neuerer non. ¶ Þe bischop, for þe muchele lij&yogh;ht : and for þat swote smullingue, al. smak Sumdel þare-fore he was a-ferd : and a luyte him drov&yogh; bi-hinde. abak Marie turnede, of wordes freo : and of vilenie quijt and sker, And seide, "fader, &yogh;wy woltþou þi dou&yogh;ter fleo? : a-bid and cum me ner!" he sai&yogh;h hire neb, and turnde a-&yogh;ein : so bri&yogh;ht so sonne-bem, Of þat swete Maudeleine : so lij&yogh;ht so ani leom. ¶ heo saide, "fader Maximus : par seinte charite, Schrift and hosel ich &yogh;uyrne al. To ben ihoseled i c am vous : sone þou graunte it me!" huy cleopeden alle þe preostes : and þe clerkus euerech-on And alle þe oþur ministres : and duden hire wille a-non. heo it a-ueng wepinde : with guod deuotion, And wel sore sichinde : heo lay hire-sulf a-doun, ¶ And seide, "Ihesu, þat deidest opon þe trco : al mi stat þou wost; Into þine hondene ich bi-take þe : mi lijf and mi gost." Anon-ri&yogh;ht heo &yogh;af up hire lijf : and hire gost, i-wis. heo was i-lad with-outen strif : anon-ri&yogh;ht to paradys. Þe bischope þou&yogh;hte murie : and þe clerkes echon, And a-non-ri&yogh;ht gonne hire burien : in a Marbre-ston. ¶ Seue ni&yogh;ht þare-aftur-ward : þat day þat heo i-bured was, Ni&yogh;ht and day þat smul was þare— : it was a wonder cas. Þe bischop þou&yogh;hte murie : and bad, &yogh;wane he ded were, Þat Men him scholden burien : bi-siden hire ri&yogh;ht þere. Of þe Maudeleine : þis is þe ri&yogh;hte endingue. God us schilde fram peyne · and to heouene us bringue! AmeN

57.1: SEint ypolyt þe Martyr : knyht was of gret honour, Þat wuste seint laurence in prisone : þoru&yogh; heste of þe Aumperour, And þoru&yogh;h him turnde to cristindom : and his maine al-so, And burede him ful stilleliche : þo he was to deþe i-do. ¶ Þo he hadde seint laurence i-bured : and hit was vnder-&yogh;ite, Me n ortreuweden þat he cristine were : ase huy mi&yogh;hten wel þo i-wite. Þene þridde day aftur : þat seint laurence i-bured was, Ypolyt wende to is owene hous : ase it were bi cas; Al his mayne he grette fayre : and &yogh;af heom part al-so Of þe milsfole dede þat he hadde : on seint laurence i-do. ¶ his meyne, þat al cristine was : fair semblaunt him made i-nou&yogh;h, And sone þo it time was : toward þe mete him drov&yogh;. Þo þat bord was i-leid : and he was þarto i-sete, And his mete bi-fore him i-brou&yogh;ht : er he hadde ou&yogh;t i-&yogh;ete, Þe kny&yogh;htes comen in ate &yogh;ate : luþere men i-nowe, bi-fore decius þe Aumperour : wel filliche him drowe. ¶ Þo decius i-sai&yogh;h him furst : a-busemare he lou&yogh;, And seide : "ypolyt, hou gez þis? : turnste to þe wou&yogh;h? honoure ore godes, ich [þe] rede : and do ore heste sone, And do, ase þou art hiende kni&yogh;ht : ase þou au&yogh;test for-to done!" ¶ "Sire, ich habbe," quath ypolyt : "in folie longue i-beo And in vnconnesse mi lijf i-leoued : ase man þat ne couþe ise; Ake nouþe ich am to god i-turnd— : to late i dude so! Þou do bi me al þat þou canst : for non oþur i-nelle do." ¶ "No? neltþou?" quat þis Aumperur : "þou schalt i-leue me, Ase we serueden laurence er : we schullen nou serui þe!" "&YOGH;e, god it al. om. &yogh;eue," quath þis holie man : "þat it were bi me nouþe Ase it mid him is þat þou nemmest : ri&yogh;ht nouþe with luþere mouþe!" ¶ "Go z forth," quath þis Aumperour : "mine tormentores, a-non, And streputh naked þis luþere þef : ri&yogh;ht to flechs and bon!" Þis tormentores wel &yogh;are were : to don þat sorie dede. Þe holie man, þo he was naked : to þe Aumperour he seide; Þis holie man seide, þis—seide al. om. "wenstou, wrechche, to make me naked? : nay þou, i-wis, Ake þou bi-guinnest raþur to cloþie me : with Ioye of heouene blis." ¶ "Nimez a-non," quath þe Aumperour : "and tormentiez him wel faste!" Þe tormentores al redie weren : and heor cloþes of huy caste, Wiþ scourges and with staues al-so : huy beoten him ase huy weren wode, And al defouleden is holie bodi : þat is limes ronnen a-blode; So longue, þat huy [werie] weren : and þare-fore stille huy stode. Þe Aumperour bi-heold heom faste : with ful sorie mode. ¶ Þis holie man, þo him smert sore : lude to grede he gan : "Ich þonki þe, louerd iesu crist : for ich am cristine man." "Nimez him," quath þe Aumperour : "and ledez him up on hei&yogh;h!" huy brou&yogh;hten him up-on an he Ash. hei de-grece : þat muche al þat folk him i-sei&yogh;h, And duden on him is noble on the margin. robe : þat he werede er Þe &yogh;wyle he was so noble kny&yogh;ht : and of so gret power. ¶ Þo he stod al-so quoynteliche : ase men him greþi mi&yogh;hte, "Ypolyt," quath þe Aumperour : "nouþe þou hast þine ri&yogh;hte. bi-þench þe wuch a man þou art : and &yogh;wuch a kny&yogh;ht a k. om. in Ash. þou hast i-beo, Noble and hende, ase þou &yogh;uyt schalt : &yogh;if þou wolt þe bi-seo; bi-þench þe of þat þou hast i-haued : of þi noble dignete, And bi-lef here in ore compaynie : ase þou were er with me!" ¶ "Sire Aumperour," quath [þis] holie Man : "for nou&yogh;ht þou spext so : For a newe kny&yogh;ht ich am bi-come : n i ewe batayle to do; Godes kny&yogh;ht of heouene ich am : and al mi wille so is Þat ich in his batayle be Ash. were : sone i-martred, i-wis." Þo was þe Aumperour wroth i-nov&yogh;h : he cleopede Valerian, his Iustise, þat was schrewe i-nov&yogh; : and a swiþe luþer man; "Nim," he seide, "þis foule þef : and with a strong torment bring him of liue, ase þou mi&yogh;ht : with hard Iuggement; And wiend furst hom to is þingue : and nim al his guod, For euerech del ich &yogh;iue it þe : and his flechs and his blod." ¶ To þis holie mannes hous : þe Iustise wende a-non, Al his maynie he fond þare : cristine euerechon; Ech aftur oþur he liet heom nime : and tormenti sore i-nov&yogh;; And bi-fore þis holie man : ech aftur oþur drou&yogh; And ech aftur oþur bi-fore his ei&yogh;ene : with gret torment he Ash. me slov&yogh; : he liet alle heore hauedene smiten of : with schendnesse and wou&yogh;. ¶ Þo huy weren bi-fore þis holie man : alle to deþe i-brou&yogh;ht, And þe Iustise i-sai&yogh;h þat he ne mi&yogh;hte : þare-with tuyrne is þou&yogh;ht, wilde coltes and strongue : he liet fette atþe laste And bi þe fet þisne holie man : to heore tayle he bond faste, And liet þe coltes eorne forth. : wel luyte huy wolden a-bide, Ake ornen and drowen þene holie Man : al-a-boute wel wide, Þoru&yogh; scharpe breres and þornes : and ope manie an harde stone; Þe peces fullen þicke a-boute : of his fle s che fram þe bone. So longue, þat he liet þat lif— : his deth was strong i-nov&yogh;, &YOGH;wane ech of þis wilde coltes : at heore tayle him drov&yogh;! ¶ Ore louerd hat ofte for his loue : fair miracle i-do On hors þat weren to him i-mete : and on coltes al-so. Manie Men habbuth i-said þare-fore : &yogh;wane huy &yogh;eme to hors toke : "Ore louerd and seint ypolyt : þis hors saue and loke!" bidde we nouþe seint ypolyt : þat he ore erinde beode, Þat merci he al. god habbe of us alle : and off alle þat habbuth neode. 0.1: Seynt blase wel clene lyf ladde, wiþoute any hore; In þe lond of capadoce þis godeman was I-bore. ffor his godnesse cristenemen bisschop him wolde make; Nolde he nat of swich power, ac gan it anon for-sake. ffor he it nolde in none manere, he fley out of þe londe In wildernesse to a dep valeye, .&yogh;. &yogh; = &. þer he gan to astonde. Pryueliche he wonede þer, .&yogh;. hudde him swiþe longe, And seruede god wel; in penance he duelde swiþe stronge. Wilde bestes þat þer were, a-boute him comen þikke, [&yogh;] solaseden him, for he was one; his lymes þei wolden likke. Whan any of hem sike were, to him he = heo, hi wolden a-non, And arst ar he hem blessede, nane fot fro him nolden gon. Ech sik beste sone hol was whan þei hadde his blessinge; Þoru godes grace fro fer to him he comen for þis þingge. v. 13-14 al. om. — Þe luþer iustise of þe lond, þat het agrycolas, his men to hunten owt he sente, þer þis gode man was. As þei wenden, hem þoute wounder þ t he so fewe deer founde. he be-hulde into þe depe : þo seye þei on þe grounde Swiþe fele der a-boute aman, þat he al. om. sat hem a-mydde A-kne, &yogh; be-held to heuene-ward, his beden forto bydde; Þese bestes a-louten alle to him-ward. In gret þout þes honten were; he wenten &yogh; tolde þe Iustise al þat þei seye þere. he het hem a-&yogh;en wende &yogh;. him al. om. seche, &yogh;if r. &yogh; &yogh;if þei him al. om. fonde þer gon, Any cristene man, þat hi scholde to-fore him bringge a-non. Þo &yogh;e = he, heo comen .&yogh;. seint blase founde, he seyden : "þou schalt aryse &yogh;. come wiþ ous, &yogh; speke anon wiþ þe heye Iustise." "Mine leue sones," seint blase seyde, "&yogh;e ben to me welcome; ffor now ich wot þat Ihesu crist to me haueþ &yogh;eme I-nome. Go we nou forþ in his name, Ich wot he wile vs lede; Ne leueþ nat to don be me al þat he &yogh;ou al. &yogh;oure maister sede." As þei ladde þis holy man toward þe Iustise, Prechinde he turnede many on to oure louerdes seruise; Blynde .&yogh;. deue .&yogh; dombe also .&yogh;. þ t oþer siknesse hadde, Many on to hele he brou&yogh;the, als me him forþ ladde; Wilde bestes þat sike were, ourne to him also As men him ladde, .&yogh;. fette here hele als þei hadde arst i-do.— A &yogh;ong child, als he et MS. het his mete, a bon schet in his þrote; Al astrangled &yogh; ded it lay, þo it was in i-schote. his moder nadde no child bote þat; greth doel &yogh;e made wiþ-alle, To-fore seint blase &yogh;e bar þis child .&yogh;. as wod gan doun falle, &yogh; bad he scholde hire sone hele. þis god man his hond vp nom &yogh;. blesse[de] it : &yogh; þat bon out schet, &yogh; þat child hol be-com. "Louerd," seyde þis gode man, "grante me a bone : Þat man in what yuel biddeþ to me, I-here him wel sone &YOGH;if he seye þese wordes to þe : 'louerd cryst, þin ore! ffor loue of seint blase, þi sergeant, help [me] of þis MS. his sore!' " In worschipe of godes holy name, who-so him bid þis bone ffor loue of seint blase in good entente, he worþ i-herd wel sone.— A pouere wif-man þer was also, þat bote on sowe hadde; a wolf awey to wode it ber. on seint blase loude &yogh;e gradde Þat he scholde of hire swyne helpe. seint blase low a-non. "Ne dred te noþing of þe wolf, þei he be an yuel swon! "A-byd, mayster, &yogh; com a&yogh;eyn &yogh; bring þis swyn a-now orig. a-non, corr. to a-now al. nou To þis pore wifman, þat haþ þerto betere ry&yogh;t þan þou!" Þe wilde beste com a&yogh;en &yogh; þat swyn doun a r. adoun leyde Al harmles ate wydewe fot, as þe holy man him seyde. ffor þer nas no wilde beste þat he nadde to his heste, ffor he hym r. hem held, as &yogh;e habbeþ i-herd, &yogh; made wiþ hem gret feste.— Þo he at-fore þe iustise cam, "wel-come, blase," he seyde, "Þou louest oure godes &yogh; art here frend; he willen þe wisse &yogh; rede." "heil be þou, iustise," seint blase seyde, "&yogh; alle þat þe i-seþ! Ne clepe nat þes godes so fair a name, for pure deflen he beþ. ffor who þ t euere al. hi & hoso on hem beleueþ, schullen into al. in helle pyne Ene &yogh;. euere tormentud be, þe lord &yogh; ek his hyne." Þis iustise for wraþþe anon let hym strepe al nakud, [&yogh;] wiþ harde skourges on hym legge; many wounde on him was makud. Euere he seyde, as men hym beet : "&yogh;e ne turneþ nat my þout; My louerd ihesu is al myn help, .I ne drede &yogh;ou ry&yogh;t nowth." Þo he hym hadde longe i-bete þat he wery were, he him deden in strong prison, to tormenten him þere. Þat wifman þat seint blase hadde þe swyn þe wolf be-nome, Þo þat he in prison was, &yogh; þe tidinge to hire icome, &YOGH;e slou þat swyn, &yogh; bar to al. om. seint blase boþe heued &yogh; feet To þe prison, wel MS. wel wel y-sode; &yogh; þe godeman þar-of eth. "Wifman," he seyde, "for þe kyndenesse þou hast me her I-do, wexe &yogh; eche þine bestes schulle, &yogh; þin oþer þing also. &YOGH; euerich [man] her-afteward þat me haueþ in mynde &yogh; honoureþ me wiþ any of his orf, al þulke beste kynde prouen it schal þe bet wiþ him, &yogh; al þat him comeþ to;" Akne he bad to oure louerd crist þat it moste ben so.— Atfore þe iustise an oþer day seint blase was i-brout. Þo he i-say þat he ne my&yogh;tte a&yogh;en god torne his þout, Mid ropes him hengen al. hi h. him on a tre. be-neþe þer stode I-nowe Tormentours wiþ oules kene, &yogh; al his fless to-drowe; as men wiþ combes wolle to-drauþ, his fless þer-wiþ he tere. Euere prechede þis holy man, as þei him noþing nere. Þo he hym ne my&yogh;tten so ouer-come, to prison a&yogh;en him bere— ffor his lymes him nolde bere, so he to-drawe were. as me bar þe godeman, he stremede al o-blode. seue wifmen þat cristene were, be-helde [þis] om. as þei stode : Þei &yogh;eden &yogh; gadereden of þe blod, for it was holden relik, Þer-wiþ hem smere &yogh; sum to wyte, to smere þerwiþ þe sike. Þo þe luþere men þis i-seye, . faste he hem toke, &yogh; bad hem honure here godes; .&yogh; al þat he for-soke. Þei seyde : "&yogh;our godes vn-clene beþ, þerfore &yogh;e vs hem lene, &yogh; bring hem to þe faire water, we schullen hem wassche clene, &yogh; we hem willeþ honure, als &yogh;e vs willeþ rede." Þis [iustise] was ry&yogh;th glad; his godes to þe water he let lede. Þes wifmen nomen þese maumettes, wan þider &yogh;e corr. to he? were bi-swonke, &yogh; casten hem into þe depe water; a-non þe schrewen sonken. "Nou we biddeþ &yogh;ou selue helpuþ, al. Biddeþ hi seide hom sulue helpe oþer &yogh;oure al. hore my&yogh;tte is schronke. Why nelle he nat comen vp to helpe &yogh;ou? Ich wene he beþ a-dronke." Þes wreches wiþ poles &yogh; wiþ hokes here godes a-non soute; wiþ drery chere &yogh; vnneþe he hem to londe broutthe. Þis Iustise was for wraþþe wod, loude he gradde &yogh; chidde; A wel strong fur he let þer make .&yogh; caste þes wifmen amydde. welled led &yogh;e þrewen on hem, vnneþe it þoute hem warm; Þat fur be-gan to quenche a-non; non of hem nadde harm. wel wroþ was þis Iustise þo, &yogh; wel loude gradde; he hem let honge opon a tre, as he arst seint blase hadde. wiþ oules he to-drowen here fless, as he be-neþe stode; Non oþer þan whyt mylk out of hem com, in stede of here blode. Euere þe more men hem to-drowe, þe gladdere he were; "Sire Iustise, it is for nout, þus r. þu ne quellest vs nat to-&yogh;ere. &YOGH;if þou vs wilt don oþer þing, bringge it sone to ende, Þat we mowe to Ihesu crist; we wilneþ þider wende." Þis Iustise het þat me scholde here heuedes of smyte anon. Þese wyfman to-ward here martirdom glade gonne gon. Þat on wifman hadde tweye sones, þat cristene were also; he wepe for here moder deþ, he nuste neuere elles what do; Þei hengen on hire, &yogh; nolden hire fro nat o fote gon, &YOGH;e sworen &yogh;e wolden þan deþ a-fonge wiþ hire þer a-non. Gret doel hadde þe moder of hem, for &yogh;e of elde nere; &YOGH;e ne MS. ne ne my&yogh;tte it for noþing se þat þei martired were, al. 2 vv. more. he criede opon þe tormentoures þ t he hem ne sscholde sle: &yogh; he hem let here wey so &yogh;onge alyue gon a&yogh;e, And nome &yogh; smyten þe heuedes of þese wifmen alle seuene. Aungles þere soules alle ladde to þe blisse of heuene. Þe children gret dol for here moder maden in alle wyse; Þo me nolde hem asle, he ronne to þe iustise, &YOGH; seyde þat &yogh;e cristene were, &yogh; þat his lawe nas nawth, &YOGH; þat he scholde myd his godes to pyne of helle ben brouth. Þe iustise let þes children nyme, þei &yogh;e &yogh;onge were; In depe prison &yogh;e weren i-cast, to tormenten hem þere. Wel glad were þes &yogh;unge, þo &yogh;e were y-nome, ffor he hopeden y-martired be, &yogh; to heuene-blisse come. Þo let þe Iustise anon after seint blase sende, &YOGH; het him MS. hem honure here godes, &yogh; his þout sone wende. "It is for naut," seint blase seyde, "þou ne schalt it nat make Þat ich wreche stones honure, &yogh; Ihesu crist for-sake. Do wiþ my body what þou wilt, of whom þou hast power; Of my soule ne hast þou [non], it nis nat in þi power." Þer was a water swyþe depe : þe iustise atte laste, ffor-to adranche þis holy man, amyddes he let him caste. Signe of þe crois seint blase made : vp MS. vp fro þe water he &yogh;ede dreye, Vp &yogh; doun als vpe druye lond, ne my&yogh;te þe water him nuye. "Wreche," he seyde, "her þou my&yogh;t se wich is godes my&yogh;th! Loke &yogh;if &yogh;oure godes so hardi be þat þei al. Beþ &yogh;e so hardi vp &yogh;oure godes : þat &yogh;e doren here a-ly&yogh;th!" ffifue &yogh; sixti of proute hynen lupen into þe water a-non, &YOGH; treste to meche to here godes, &yogh; adreynten euerichon. Þo weren þo þat stode a-rowe, al. þe oþere þe arwere ech be oþer as þei stode, Þer ne dorste non of hem to þem go for depe of þe flode. Seint blase &yogh;ede vp &yogh; doun, &yogh; an aungel to him com &YOGH; seyde : "þou take þe blisse of heuene þoru þi martirdom!" Þis godeman þonkede ihesu crist, þ t his aungel to him sende; &YOGH; þo his [fon] om. al. þe oþer ne dorste comen hym ney, a&yogh;en to londe he wende. he seyde : "nou &yogh;e ben agast forto comen to me, I come to &yogh;ou in godes name, for I &yogh;ou nelle fle." Þo schon his face as þe sonne, wiþ leme swiþe bry&yogh;the; Þer nas [non] þat for bry&yogh;thnesse his face sen MS. þ t sen my&yogh;the. Þer were ey&yogh;tte &yogh; twenti men .&yogh; sixti men also Þat leueden in god for þe miracle þat þere was I-do. I-nome he were wiþ þis gode man, to-fore þe iustise ben brouth. Þe iustise bad seint blase &yogh; hem change here þout. Þo he sey þei nolde it do, he het MS. let his men a-non to smyten of wiþoute þe toun here hefdes euerichon. Þes twey children in prison were; loude he gonne grede Þat me hem scholde to martyrdom wiþ seint blase lede, &YOGH; seyden : "wharto wilie = wil &yogh;e vs wyte, wreches, in þis hurne? ffor nawth it is þat &yogh;e weneþ oure þout fro gode turne." Me nomen þe children &yogh; ladden hem forþ wiþ oþere to martirdom. Seint blase him sat doun akne, þo he þider com: "Louerd ihesu, &yogh;if it is þi wille, ane bone bidde I. þe: &YOGH;if þat any man in his annuy habbe mynde of me, In cas of peryl oþer of yuel, oþer &yogh;if þer is I-schote Bon oþer stre, oþer oþur þing I-comen al. into eny in mannes þrote, &YOGH; he bidde myn help to þe, be daye oþer be ny&yogh;tte, Graunte me þis bone, swete ihesu, for þin holy mi&yogh;tte. &YOGH;if any man assigneþ aut of his in þe honour of me, Of corn, of orf, of oþer þing, Louerd, ich bidde þe Þat al his þing mote al. om. þe betere preue, for þi swete my&yogh;the." Þer cam fram heuene a bry&yogh;th myst &yogh; an-oward him a-ly&yogh;the; Þer-inne oure louerd ly&yogh;tte adoun, to þis holy man he seyde: "Blase, my leue frend, be glad, of deþ haue þou no drede! Al þi bone i þe graunte þat þou hast beden here. heye þe nou, &yogh; comeþ wiþ me, þou &yogh; þine twey al. triwe fere!" he was so glad þat god wiþ him spak &yogh; grauntede him his bone, "Doþ," seyde he to þe tormentores, "al þat &yogh;e habbeþ to done." Þe tormentores smyten of his heued, .&yogh; alle his feren also, &YOGH; þe twey childre, þat glad were he my&yogh;tten come þer-to. Sebast hy&yogh;tte þat cite þer seint blase was i-bore, &YOGH; þer his heued was of y-smyte—him schamede nat þerfore. Þe bone þat he hadde i-bede, cristenemen it vnderstode: In þe honurance of seint blase he parteden of here gode: Þe betere preuede al here on the margin added oþer god, .&yogh;. &yogh;eth it doþ al-so, In þe stede wher his ymage is, . þei findeþ it wel y-do. &YOGH; who is in stable beleue, &yogh; wille to sein blase crye, &YOGH; &yogh;ifue of his good in honur of hym, god nelle nat for him lye. God leue þat we parti mote of þe heye blisse Þere þat seint blase is Inne i-brout, þat we þer-offe ne mysse. amen

1.0: 74 Vita & passio sancte Cecilie virginis & martiris.
1.1: Seinte Cecilie, of noble kynde I-bore &yogh;e was at rome; Oure louerd crist &yogh;e louede wel ar &yogh;e fram cradel come. Stilleliche &yogh;e hire let bapti&yogh;e, as we fynden I-wryte; To oure louerd crist &yogh;e bad &yogh;erne hire maydenhod to wyte. So þat þoru strengþe of hire frendes I-spoused &yogh;e was to a man Of gret nobleye &yogh; of richesse, his name was Vallerian. Þis mayde werede robe of pal &yogh; cloþes swiþe riche, Garlaundes &yogh; tressoures of gold—þe here next hire liche. Whane &yogh;e herde menstrales song, . &yogh;e song in hire menstralcie, Ash. Wen þe m. songe hor song: of hor m. Þis mayde stiliche song of god &yogh; of his moder marye. A vers of þe psalter hire song was, wer-on was mast hire þout: "Lat, louerd, myn herte wiþoute wem be, þ t it confundet be naut!" A-ny&yogh;t as &yogh;e was in riche bed wiþ hire lord i-brouth, Sone he hadde of folye þis clene mayde be-sout. "Swete herte," þis mayde seyde, "for loue þou hast to me, Graunte me y mowe þe telle a litel pryuete, Þat ich me mowe þerof schryue, &yogh;. þ t þou it wille hele." "Certes, lemman," þis &yogh;ungman seyde, "noþing telle I nele." "Suete lemman," þis mayde seyde, "in warde icham I-do: An aungel of heuene is my wardeyn, &yogh; my lemman þer-to. Wel faste he stant her bi me. &yogh;if he vnder&yogh;ete Þat þou be-nome my maydenhod, noþing nolde he lete Þat he ne wolde harde smyte, &yogh; be-nyme þe þi my&yogh;tte Of þi &yogh;ungnesse &yogh; of noble stat, for þou ne my&yogh;th wiþ him fy&yogh;tthe. Ac &yogh;if he wiste þou louedest me in gode loue &yogh; clene, Wytte MS. wytie? he wolde þe als he deþ me, &yogh; al yuel fro þe &yogh;ene." "&YOGH;if þou wilt," seyde Vallerian, "þat ich I-leue þis, Þen angel þou most me schewe, þat I se hym I-wis; &YOGH; wanne I þat soþe i-se, þat þou hast soþ i-seyd, In clenesse for-soþe þi wille I do, al after þi red. &YOGH;if I se þat in folye þou louest anoþer þan me, No-þing ne schal &yogh;ou helpe, þat I ne sle him &yogh; þe." "Swete herte," seyde þat mayde, "&yogh; þou wile þe aungel se, Þou most bileuen on Ihesu crist &yogh; I-cristned be, &YOGH; sen him þou schalt &yogh;if þou wilt so; he þe wile wytte MS. wytie? fro helle, So gret ioye of oure loue schal be þat no tunge ne may telle. Ac henne ouer þre myle þou most gon þe wey to al. of apye; Þere [pore] men þou schalt fynde on Ihesu crist faste crye, Sey þ t ich to hem þe sende, &yogh; þ t he þe teche anon Whar is seint vrban þe holi old man, for þou most to him gon, ffor priue counseil þou wilt wiþ him speke. &yogh; he þe schal bapti&yogh;e. &YOGH; þanne þou schalt þan angel se, &yogh; do as he þe wile wise." Vallerian a-ros a-non, as oure louerd him &yogh;af wille, To þe stede þe mayde bad he wende forþ wel stille. Þes pore men him taute a-non to þe olde seint vrban; he fond him in an old for-late stede, þat r. þer wonede neuere man, Among puttes &yogh; burieles als men cristene men þreu After þat he martired were, men anye kneu(!) To his feet he ful a-doun a-kne, als-sone as overlined. [he] to him come, &YOGH; seyde þat cesilie send him þider to asken cristendome. "Louerd, I-herd be þi my&yogh;tte," seyde seint vrban, "Weþer þis be þat Luþere werreor men clepuþ vallerian? Were cecilie haue him now y-mad, him þ t was so wilde &YOGH; more tyrant þan any wolf, als a lomb he is om. he is now mylde?" Þo com þer go a swiþe old man a ly&yogh;tthe fro heuene þer, hor, wiþ whyte vestemens, a swiþe fair wryt he ber. Þo vallerian it al. him I-sey, a-doun he fel for drede; Seint vrban nom him vp a&yogh;en . &yogh; gan him forþ lede. Þis halewe of heuene tok him þat wryt, &yogh; bad him forto rede. Vallerian tok it anon, & þus þe wordes sede: "On MS. Oure louerd is, .&yogh;. on bi-leue, .&yogh; on bapti&yogh;ingge, On god .&yogh; fader of alle þat beþ, þ t oueral is .&yogh; in eche þingge." "I-leuestou þis," quaþ seint vrban, "þat þou dost her I-se?" "Þer nis noþing," quaþ þis oþer, "þat bet to leue be." After þis whyte man he be-held; he nuste wher he be-cam. Seint vrban him nom a-non, &yogh; &yogh;af him cristendom. To sein Cecilie he wente a&yogh;en, þo he was þare is fulle: he fond hire chambre ly&yogh;th wiþ-inne, .&yogh; swiþe swote smulle. he fond cecilie, his gode spouse, &yogh; an aungel wiþ hire stonde, Bry&yogh;ttere þan any leme MS. lome ; twey garlondes he hadde on honde, Of rose &yogh; of lilie swote; þat on, cecilie he tok, &YOGH; þat oþer, vallerian, as we fynden in bok. "Wyteþ þis wiþ trewe loue, wiþ chaste body &yogh; clene, Ich hem habbe fro heuene i-brou&yogh;th, oure lord hem doþ &yogh;ou lene; ffor-falewe ne olde wille þei nat, ac euere he willeþ laste. Two manere floures þer beþ on, nelle neuere here heu caste; Þe lilie be-tokneþ &yogh;oure maydenhod, þ t is so whyt &yogh; swote, Þe rose be-tokneþ &yogh;oure martirdom; for þer-on deye &yogh;e mote. And for þou dest, vallerian, cecilie red so sone, What þou be-sekest of my lord, he wille þe graunte sone." "I ne wille al. wilny noþing so miche," seyde vallerian, "Bote al. As þat Tiburs, MS. Tiburft my broþer, wiþ me were cristeneman." "Mi lord," quaþ þis aungel, "wile &yogh;iuen þat ilke grace, &YOGH; boþe &yogh;e schulle I-martired be at o tyme, in o place." Þe aungel [wende] wiþ þis word, he nuste wher he be-com. Þis two clene þingges ioye I-now ech of oþer nom. Tiburs com to chambre &yogh; spac al. to speke wiþ his broþer þere: he stod &yogh; be-held al-a-boute als he nuste wher he were; "Broþer," he seyde, "hou goþ þis? þis tyme of þe &yogh;ere So swote smul ne smelde I neuere, me þinkþ, as I do here! Þei þis hous were ful of newe roses &yogh; of lylie also, I ne my&yogh;tte hem versschere smelle, me þinkþ, þan I now do. So ful ich am al of þe smul, &yogh; so muche it is in my þout, Þat Ich am for-soþe in an-oþer wytte I-brouth." "Leue broþer," quaþ vallerian, "garlandes we habbeþ here Of floures þat þou ne my&yogh;t i-se bote þou were oure fere. als þou hast þane swote smel þar-of for oure bone, &YOGH;if þou wilt be-leue as we, þou my&yogh;t sen hem sone." "Leue broþer," seyde þis oþer, "wheþur it be soþ þis, Oþer I stonde in matyngge .&yogh; mete þat so it is?" "In metyngge," quaþ vallerian, "we habbeþ euere I-be; Nou we ben ferst of slepe a-waked, nou we mowe ferst i-se." "Sestow nou bet," quaþ þis oþer, "þan þou hast er I-do?" "&YOGH;e," seyde vallerian, "wel sone al. om. me be-houeþ so, ffor my lordes aungel of heuene haþ I-&yogh;oue me sy&yogh;th; &YOGH; for oure loue he þe schal also, &yogh;if þou wile leue a-ry&yogh;th." Þo seyde þis holy mayde: "tibors, leue broþer, What ben maumettes bote wrechedhede? þou sest on hem non oþer. Ne sestou þat þese maumets ben mad of old tre? Þing þ t ne may him-sulf helpe, hou my&yogh;te it hel[p]e þe?" "No-þing nis soþere," quaþ tiburs, MS. tiburus "þanne þat þou hast i-seyd; Gydiere he were þan any beste þat nolde don þi red." Seinte cecilie him custe a-non: "leue tiburs," he seyde, "To-day þou schalt my broþer be, for þou wilt don be rede. Þoru clene loue &yogh; good be-leue þi broþer my spouse is, Þar-þoru þou schalt be-come also my broþer when þou art his. Mid Vallerian þou most go to þe bisschop Vrban &YOGH; be cristned, &yogh; do also as he þe rede can." "Is þat vrban," quaþ tiburs, "þat so &yogh;erne haþ be sou&yogh;th, Þat &yogh;are haþ be fleme &yogh; hud? &yogh; &yogh;if he were forþ brou&yogh;th, ffor-berne he scholde, &yogh; we also, &yogh;if we wiþ him were; &YOGH; so þe while we heuene sou&yogh;then, for-barnd we scholde ben here." "&YOGH;if þer nere," quaþ þis mayde, "onliche bote þis lyf, ffol he were þat it wolde [lese] for any-maner strif; &YOGH; seþe þer is so mury lif þer þat we schulle after a-fonge, ffol is þat nelle a whyle ben wo, to be in ioye so longe." "Leue broþer," quaþ tiburs, "þou haue merci of me &YOGH; led me to þat gode man, ich be-seche þe." Þat o broþer þat oþer ladde to þe bisschop Vrban; Þar he for-sok his foule lawe, &yogh; be-cam cristene man. Tiburs, þo he com a&yogh;en, þan aungel sey a-non Þat cecilie him hadde be-hote, in þe chambre wiþ hire gon.— Cecilie, for &yogh;e wyfman was, at hom &yogh;e moste a-byde; Ak þese breþeren, þat men were, a-boute wenten wyde, And whane me martyreden cristenemen, þider he wolden gon &YOGH; stele to whan MS. whom he my&yogh;tte best, &yogh; burien hem MS. him a-non. Als þei burieden twey godemen þat y-martired were, Come þe emperoures men .&yogh; nomen hem ry&yogh;t þere. To-fore þe Iustise he weren i-brouth. þei al. me askede hem MS. him a-non: "Who made &yogh;ou so hardi to burie þe emperoures foon, Þe mys-bi-leuede trichours þ t were a&yogh;en oure lawe, Þat wiþ ry&yogh;th Iugement of þe lond were i-brout of dawe?" "Sire, we wolde," þis oþere seyde, "þat we worþi were here knaues forto habbe I-be, þat þou let quelle þare! he leften þing þat nas nawt, þei it semblance hadde, &YOGH; toke good þing þat was &yogh; worþ .&yogh;. no semblance nadde. Þe worldes ioye, þat haþ semblance, for so[þe] nawt it nys; And þei þe blisse of heuen þinke lite, . mechul &yogh; swete it is." "Beaus amys, me þynkþ þat &yogh;e ben wode: worþe he is to habbe wo, who-so ne keput nat of gode." "In wynter," quaþ Vallerian, "Idel men sitten &yogh; drynkun, To bismere he leyen here al. erþe tilien þat a-boute sowynge swynkeþ; In heruest, whan þe swynkeres moweþ fair schef &yogh; good &yogh; rype, al. erþe In meseyse &yogh;e mowen gon vp &yogh; doun, he nabbeþ neuere agripe: Als we schulle for oure trauayl In blisse rype atte ende, whanne &yogh;e schulle for &yogh;oure ioye to helle wepynde wende." "Ek he al. we ," seyde þe Iustise, "þat Lordes scholde be, Beþ lasse worþ þan swiche wreches, þat nolde neuere þe?" "Certes," quaþ vallerian, "þou art lasse i-told Þan is a saly beggere a&yogh;en god, ne be þou neuere so bold." "Bel amy," quaþ þe Iustise, "yne kepe nat of þi Ianglyngge. Doþ &yogh;oure sacrefise a-non, oþer me schal &yogh;ou to deþe bringge." "Certes," quaþ þis godeman, "þou ne bringgest me neuere þerto." Þe Iustise hem let a-non in strong prisone do. Maxime þe gayler [het] þat hem in warde nom; So þat he &yogh; alle his þorw hem cristene bi-com. Seinte cecilie com be þe prison; loude &yogh;e gan grede : "What do &yogh;e, godes knytes? kuþeþ &yogh;our staleworthede! Fy&yogh;teþ nou staleworþliche, to leue þis derkhede, Þat &yogh;e were in þe weye i-brouth þ t to cler ly&yogh;t schal &yogh;ou lede." Opon þe morue, to þe maumets þis gode men were brouth. Þe Iustise het hem don sacrifise; ac þei ne wolde nat. here heued he let of smyte, &yogh; maxime it al. om. I-sey Whare aungles here soules nome &yogh; to heuene baren an hey. To þe Iustise he &yogh;ede anon : "cristene ich am," he sede, "Ich i-sey þe godemannes al. menne soule aungles to heuene lede." Þe Iustise him let nymen a non, naked he let him bete Wiþ stronge skourgen, faste i-bounde, forto he gan þat lif lete. Þe body þei casten wiþoute þe toun. þo gan cecilie forþ gon : Þese þre holy martires &yogh;e burede to-gydere a-non. [&YOGH;e was sone i-nome &yogh; ilad before þe Iustise þo.] This v. om. "What," sede he, "hou goþ þis? beþ þer &yogh;et schrewen mo? artou Vallerianus wif? be þe fey Ich owe mahoun, Bote þou oþer do, þi wyth al. wite heu worþ sone I-brouth a-doun. Of what kynne artou of y-come, þ t þus foleliche wilt al. þe doþ lere?" "Of betere kunne," quaþ cecilie, "þan þou euere were." "In wich-maner lif," quaþ þis oþer, "þenkest tou to lyue?" "ffor-soþe þou axest as a fol, &yogh; swich ansuere me schul þe &yogh;iue. for al þi poer, þou schalt i-se, be þat þou wost þen ende, Þat þou ne schalt fro ihesu cryst ones myn herte wende." "hou comeþ it þe," seyde þe iustise, "to be so hardy her, To clepe me fol þat am þi maister? ne sixte nower my per. al. poer " "Þi per, al. poer wreche," quaþ þis mayde, "worþ sone i-brou&yogh;th be-hynde, for it nis bote a bladre I-blowe fol of a wreche wynde; be it wiþ a litel prikke I-priked, a-wey it schrinkeþ al : Als þi caroigne wiþ siknesse, wreche, a-dwyne schal. Þi poer þat þou &yogh;elpest of, boþe is þenne &yogh; lite." "hou goþ þis, dame?" seyde þe Iustise, "whenne comeþ al þis prute? I may þe &yogh;iue deþ &yogh; lif, as þou sixt myd þin eye." "Certes," quaþ þe mayde þo, "þou lixt þer-of wel heye : a wreche caroyne þou my&yogh;th &yogh;iue, &yogh; al. om. deþ þat wel schort is, Ak of lyf ne my&yogh;tte no-þing &yogh;iue þi-selue nat, i-wis. Seþe þou my&yogh;th &yogh;iue deþ &yogh; no lif, me þinkþ be pur ry&yogh;tte Þat þou art deþes seriant, for of lif hasto no my&yogh;tte. ffor al. & whan þou deþes sergeant art, deþ þi louerd is, &YOGH; in deþ wiþ-outen ende þou wilt be, I-wis." "Dame," quaþ þe iustise, "of þi gydihede ne kepe ich ry&yogh;th nowth. Do sacrifise to oure godes, oþer þou worst to deþe i-brouth!" "Þou seist þat ich gydi am," seinte cecilie sede, "Ac þou art gydi, &yogh; ek blind, i-sene is on þi rede. Scholde I honure þine [godes] ymad of ston &yogh; tre? I nelle it do, for-soþe, for þou ne my&yogh;t nat I-se. Bote þou my&yogh;th i-se þat art blynd al. Bote þ u Þ u blynd, Þ u mi&yogh;t ise , . þat þis þing soþ is; &YOGH;if þou sixt .&yogh;. ne leuest it naut, gydi þou art, I-wys, for gydi he is þat nelle I-leue þat he seþ myd his eye; Gydi &yogh; blind þou schalt deye, in helle pyne deye." Þo ferde þe schrewe as he were wod, he het þis mayde take &YOGH; leden in-to an out-hous, &yogh; a greth fur make, &YOGH; þer-ouer a led-ful of water, &yogh; al amydde hire caste, To seþe hire þer while any Lime hol on hire I-laste. Þo þis Iuggement was I-&yogh;iue, &yogh; men hire forþ ladde, Wifmen &yogh; men þat [it] i-seye, loude &yogh;e wopen &yogh; gradde, "Allas," þei seyde, "þat þis &yogh;ongge þing, MS. þis þus fair a creature, Schal nou lese hire &yogh;ongge lif, &yogh; deye þoru þe fure!" "Beþ stille," quaþ þis holi mayde, "for me ne wepeþ nout! Mi &yogh;ongge lif ne lese I nowth, ac to lyue Icham i-brouth. Ane schorte deþ I schal a-vonge, &yogh; lif wiþ-outen ende; ffol he were þat nolde also. god he al. om. me sone hyne sende." Men casten hire in þe seþing water. þar-Inne al ny&yogh;t &yogh;e seeþ; Þe lengere &yogh;e þer-inne sat, þe ferþere &yogh;e was hire deeþ; Wiþ þe welmes &yogh;e sat &yogh; pleyde, &yogh; prechede of godes grace. Mo þan four hondred be-come cristene in þat place. Þe Iustise sey þat he my&yogh;tte in swich deþ hire quelle naut : he het of smyte hire heued, þat &yogh;e were to deþe i-brout. Þe quellere hire smot wiþ al his mayn þre siþe in þe swere, he ne smot it nat fulliche of, hire deþ was bouth to dere! No quellere ne moste be þulke daye smyte oftere þan þrie; half-slawe he leuede hire so; a-weyward he gan hye. Nou an yuel stede gon he mote, for he was a schrewe! Wo dede he þat holy mayde, gulteles hire so to hewe, &YOGH; bi-lefte al. beleue hire so half a-lyue; welle, wo him be! ffor who-so nuste of no doel, þer men my&yogh;tte it se : Þis holi mayde &yogh;ede a-boute, hire heued half of-smyte, &YOGH; was half quik &yogh; half ded, þat rewþe it was to wyte; &YOGH; pouere men mechel of hire good &yogh;e delde wiþ hire honde— It was a wel fair grace of god þat &yogh;e aut my&yogh;tte stonde. &YOGH;e prechede, &yogh; to Ihesu cryst many a god man wende, &YOGH; alle to seint vrban þe bisschop to bapti&yogh;e &yogh;e hem sende, &YOGH; bad þat he scholde hire hous þat &yogh;e hadde woned Inne halewen in oure louerdes name &yogh; a churche þer bigynne, And burien þere hire swete body, &yogh; þat oure louerdes seruise Vpe his poer þer-inne were i-do on alle-kynne wyse. Þe þridde day after hire martirdom þe mayde a-doun lay, And prechede to þe cristenemen, &yogh; bad hem habbe god day, &YOGH; seyde : "now ich habbe i-do al þat my wille is to, Wende I wile to Ihesu crist, &yogh; &yogh;e schulle also." Þis was two hundred &yogh;er &yogh; þre &yogh; twenti ry&yogh;th After þat oure louer[d] was in his moder a-ly&yogh;th. Nou bidde we oure swete louerd, for hire martirdom, To bringge vs to þat ioye þat hire soule to com. After this there follows: 75. S. Alexius, in six-lined stanzas, ed. by me in Herrig's Archiv , 1873, and by Furnivall for the Early English Text Society, Original Series, no. 69. —Amen.
